Reviews.Title: “Flawless Experience”
Reviews.Author: GregSteer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 7 nights, through to April 1. The first impressions with the service staff were great, and the lobby area was fantastic (my wife had to take photos of beautiful flowers arranged throughout the lobby area). We stayed in a "junior suite" overlooking W44th St, the room was impressive 60sqm, clean, quiet & comfortable. Bathroom was large and immaculate and the Hermes toiletries an extra treat. The location is great, we walked everywhere from Times Square, through to the Guggenheim, The Met and walked most of Central Park. Grand Central is only a couple of blocks away. We had a few drinks downstairs in the bar, the staff again very helpful and friendly. When we sadly had to depart, again the staff, especially Elvis from the Bell staff were great. My wife and I travel extensively and stay at great resorts and hotels around the world, Sofitel NYC is up there as one of our all time favourites.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place to stay in Midtown”
Reviews.Author: eyemom2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel for a weekend, our first visit there. The service was outstanding. The rooms were good sized for NY and the location was great. It was pricey but a value for NY. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Cheesy24
Reviews.Content: The bed was the most comfortable of any on our trip. Slept well every night. Loved how close the hotel was to everything we wanted to see. Didn't eat at the hotel at all because there were so many great, cheaper places near by. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Sano1980
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night at the Sofitel for a quick stopover in the city coming from the caribbean. We could have easily stayed much longer, since we felt very welcome there. The French touches every now and then ("bonjour" "au revoir" etc) add a nice european flair to the chic atmosphere of this place. The lobby is somewhat dark, but this makes it look elegant and feels quiet and relaxing. Our room on the 12th floor was a standard room, and for that it was quite spacious with a large bathroom with separate shower and bathtub. The toiletries provided were of very good quality - famous L'Occitane products. Since we were facing the inner court, it was absolutely quiet - I thought this was a big advantage given the perfect central location. The king bed was very comfortable and for the evening turn-down service we were provided two small bottles of Evian water. The only thing I missed in our room was any kind of coffee making facility. All in all a great hotel, stunning hardware and very polite and professional staff. We would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: James186356
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located but on a quieter street. When you step inside from the busy New York streets you immediately feel relaxed. Staff are all very friendly and polite and anticipate you needs before you even ask. Rooms are quiet and very comfortable. The deal I booked did not include breakfast so went to the Red Flame Diner down the street which was very good. Did eat in the Gaby Bar some nights which has excellent food and service. Would definately stay in this hotel again if I visit New York.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Manhattan location”
Reviews.Author: Parabolic Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A really good New York Hotel. Position is excellent particularly for central Manhattan and easy access up to the Lincoln centre etc. The rooms are an excellent size and well lit by New York standards. The beds and linen are fantastic. First class bar and staff. If there had been tea/ coffee facilities in the room it would have merited 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 7 nights at the New York Sofitel and we were not disappoited. We had also stayed at the Los Angeles and Chicago Sofitels during our holiday and can safely say that if you want a top hotel with friendly staff then look no further than this hotel chain. The Sofitel NY is located on 44th street between 5th and 6th so the location is ideal. The hotel itself is very clean, large rooms for NY with comfortable bed and a very nice bathroom. The staff are super friendly and will always greet you in French when you enter the hotel. Although a bit pricey, would definately recommend this hotel to anyone looking for accommodation in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, my second visit, would go again”
Reviews.Author: Lamonts
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, great location, first stayed here in 2005 and happily returned and it’s still as good. Nice clean room with good views did my booking on the web – arrived and all was as booked. Charming welcome and bags brought to our room. They all made my daughter feel very special as the trip was a treat for her before going to Uni. Room was serviced twice daily with fresh water each and day and even fresh orchids in the bath room. Breakfasts were especially good and included in our e booking offer. Good coffee shop and deli just across the road should you want any snacks to take out with you for the day. Unfortunately not quite so impressed with the bar service as the waiter could not seem to quite see us, food eventually was good. Amazing week in NY, we had great weather and did all the sites and shopping. It’s worth booking this hotel for the location alone. Bags were kept by the concierge so we could enjoy our last day, we returned to the hotel where they have a guest area to freshen up, retrieve our bags and they hailed us a bag for JFK. Well done Sofitel NY would certainly come back to you again.

Reviews.Title: “Ellegant”
Reviews.Author: beanbag33
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the stay, beautifully appointed room and the service is exceptional .

Reviews.Title: “Consistent Quality”
Reviews.Author: MaxwellBrierleyHill
Reviews.Content: I travel between 40% and 50% of my life on business and I find that Sofitel/Pullman hotels are always a welcome retreat from the necessary demands of meetings, conferences ext. The bedrooms are always exceptional. They have the facilities WFI drinks making. although the NewYork sofitel did not have the in room drinks making facilities but it did not disappoint . The service was excellent and the rooms a welcome retreat. I have stayed in NewYork four times and would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel. ( although i would like to have had one of their excellent drink making facilities has they normally do in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location but poor service”
Reviews.Author: waxyLondon
Reviews.Content: We booked and paid for a superior room with king bed at the Sofitel New York 6 months prior to our visit and when we arrived they only had a room with 2 single beds. We had to move rooms the next day, we were told they would move our luggage for us but when we arrived back at the hotel at 5pm this had not been done. They gave us the room and we then had to wait until 6.15pm to bring us our luggage. They kept telling us how busy they were! I also asked the concierge to book a restaurant for us which was full but were told to call back at 2pm. I asked them to do this while I was out and when I got back at 5pm they had not done so. The room we moved to was better than the first room but nothing special. The position of the hotel was fantastic so I would consider staying again. The doormen were great and gave us good suggestions of where to eat for breakfast each day. The Sofitel in Rome, Amsterdam and Marrakech are much more helpful and had better rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Seamless, quality service”
Reviews.Author: holiday_maker_1000
Reviews.Content: The excellent service we received here reallly helped us get the most out of our fleeting visit to NYC. The welcome at check in was warm, helpful and efficient, the restaurant recommendation from the concierge was spot on and our breakfast server managed to be welcoming, attentive and unobtrusive all at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Home from home :-)”
Reviews.Author: mixip
Reviews.Content: I've reviewed the Sofitel a few times over the last decade; always v.positive and last year I decided to do something different (Staybridge Inn Times Square) and whilst that was a great hotel too, returning to the Sofitel this year reminded me why this hotel is so much better than the others. Firstly the location can't be beat; there are few hotels of this standard that manage to combine the right mix of closeness to all the major landmarks whilst retaining a feeling of solitude. Admittedly the sofitel is never going to win awards for the views out of the window but New York is for walking in, not watching from the inside :-) Service is great; everyone smiles, says hello (or bonjour/soir) and nothing is too much trouble. Last time I was here I griped a little that no renovation was going on but on inspection I can see that they're constantly renovating rooms, just in the same style and layout and why not if it isn't broken? Entertainment system is great and free wi-fi whilst it says is a "low-fi" option vs the paid for version I can testify that my ipad couldn't tell the difference so save your money. L'Occitane in the bathrooms is nice and the usual biscuits and water with turn-down service is a nice touch. For 29 floors it's also amazing how quick the lifts are; you rarely wait more than 30 secs for one. Late check out was handy and made the perfect end to a weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Iceland_Unlimited_TS
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel with very cool staff. Stayed for three nights and wish I had stayed longer. Will return. Thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: carnet_de_voyage933
Reviews.Content: Rooms are big and clean, the beds are so comfy! Service is first class except at the bar , where you always have to wait for a long time before any one comes to see you. The room service is really efficient and fast, but like most of room services, it is overpriced. WiFi works absolutely fine and it's free, a rare commodity these days in hotels. Location is one of the best of NY: close to times square, 2 min walk from 5th Av and a walkable distance to Central Park. This was my second time at the Sofitel and I would definitively come back again. Ah, I also got a free late check out (4pm) without even asking for it!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely haven amongst the madness........”
Reviews.Author: LTS1Bournemouth
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fairly small by New York standards which appealed to us. The location is about a 5 minute walk from Times Square and about a 10 -15 minute walk to Central Park. The hotel itself is very smart and the room was luxurious. The bathroom had a lovely large shower and bath, it was modern and stylish. There is free Wi-fi in the room which I thought was excellent, about time Starwood caught up with this! Check in was very efficient, not overly friendly, but efficient. They have a well equipped gym. The Concierge made us laugh as we were trying to ask him tourist type questions he really couldn't be bothered with us! Fortunately, we saw the funny side! I noticed a lot of corporate guests so I would say this is probably a very popular business hotel. We felt safe here and enjoyed the peace the hotel gave us from all the fantastic New York chaos outside. Taxi from JFK cost $55.00 plus tip. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay in Every Way!”
Reviews.Author: Laura S
Reviews.Content: What can I say about this great hotel that has not been said already? As an experienced international traveler, and a corporate sales manager for a travel agency, I pride myself on knowing exactly what a hotel should have to accommodate guests. This one has it all. My mother and I stayed here to celebrate my birthday, and it was a wonderful experience. The staff is warm and friendly, the location is perfect for shopping on 5th ave, Times Square, and the Theaters. The subway is a short walk, whether you are headed east or west, which is important to mention. The beds are very comfortable, and the spacious bath with seperate tub is great for soaking after a long day. When the staff saw it was my birthday, they had a delicious dessert waiting for me when I returned in the evening. It is those little extras that can make a hotel go from great to exceptional in my book. I will be staying there when I return to NYC if I have a need or desire to stay in the mid-town area.

Reviews.Title: “Location could not be better”
Reviews.Author: RachelB087
Reviews.Content: The Location of the hotel was fantastic. It was within walking distance of the Rockefeller Centre, the Empire State Building and 2 minutes from Times Square. The beds were comfy and the hotel as a whole was nicely decorated. The free WiFi was also a big bonus for me. We didn't eat in the hotel as it seemed quite expensive and there were plenty of restaurants in the surrounding areas. I recommend walking through times square and towards 8th street and walking up that way for restaurants as there are more that way with a great variety of different cuisines. The only down side to the hotel for me was, as many people have mentioned, we had no water on the final morning of our stay. I'm not sure what the hotel does but we couldn't hold off having a shower because we needed to leave to get our flight home. All the staff we encountered were very friendly and I wouldn't hesitate recommending the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and great bed”
Reviews.Author: starrynight88
Reviews.Content: When my taxi stopped infront of this hotel - I thought "hmmmmmmm" but as I got through the revolving door - it became " I really like this". The foyer has an olde world charm which provides a sense of home and yet home is not quite like that. The signature arometherapy fragrance provides a sense of comfort. However, it is the locality the wins my top points. It is located a block from Times Square and 3 mins to 5th Avenue. It is also within easy walking distances to subways. I would recommend this to any new visitor to New York city. Good place to take baby steps in getting to know the city. As usual, the bed is simply sublime

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ErinBRI
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel for business. This hotel was PERFECT. Check in was quick and easy, the personnel were friendly. The room was spacious, very clean and had many nice touches. Their was a nice radio playing, there were robes, slippers, high end toiletries, a mini bar, etc. The bed was fantastic, I have never enjoyed a bed more than my own at home until staying here. It was soft and the bedding was very nice and very soft. I'll definitely book this hotel for future travel, it was one of my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chelsea J
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed here for 3 nights and it was wonderful! The room was clean, the bed was comfortable, the staff extremely helpful, and the location can't be beat! I recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location....5 minutes from everything!”
Reviews.Author: ruthiebear22
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to NY and it was a lovely hotel, very safe and staff were just lovely. We stayed for 8 nights in a suite, which was great as we were a family of 3, which gave us more than enough space for suitcases, shopping, etc... The room was really quite and the beds were so comfortable, great after a day out walking....The bathroom and the amenities (Hermes) was also nice, they gave us complimentary water each night as well...we couldn't fault the hotel or it's staff..the location is just 5 minutes from everything...Grand Central Station, 5th Ave, Times Square and Broadway....We just went to the Red Flame most mornings for breakfast, huge meals and great service...good coffee, pop over to Gregory's, he gets this right!.... Dry cleaning...there is a dry cleaner directly opposite the Red Flame in the "Hippodrome" building on the ground floor, its cheap..and try and get to "Carmines" italian restaurant at Times Square...you won't be sorry, meals are really generous, 1 serve fed the 3 of us and do try the traditional Italian cheesecake...to die for!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: avelascov
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, impecable service and great location! A couple of blocks away from Times Square and half a block from Fifth Avenue, great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: catmouse
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights for business. Room was decent size and was spotless, Curiously no coffee maker. Hot water took about 5 minutes to arrive in shower and when I reported this at checkout, it was met with indifference. Bed was very comfortable. On the whole staff were friendly and helpful. Most staff were bilingual, English/French. The real plus point is the location. It's easy to get to. I took the Newark Express bus which stops in Bryant park, just a few steps away and Times Square is 2 minutes walk away. I also used the Red Flame Diner for breakfast (I found paying over 30$ for breakfast too steep) and it gives a proper New York experience for much less. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel New York 44th Street”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: An excellent position in Mid Manhattan. We had room 2415, it had a balcony, and from there you could see both the Empire State Building & the Chrysler Building. A top quality hotel, not cheap ($1400 for 3 nights) for a room with a suite. Easy to get to Times Square, about 2 minutes walk, an excellent diner (The Red Flame, $30 for breakfast for 2) 1 minute walk. This was our first visit to New York so we paid for a good hotel, in a good location. There is a Novotel just off Times Square if you want the location but not the price or views.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: lotuslight73
Reviews.Content: Lobby and facilities are outdated for the brand standard, but the staff are very helpful. The bathrooms are exceptionally large for NYC / Midtown (with separate bathtub), which is a great treat after a long day at work. While the lobby decor is underwhelming the fresh flowers and arrangements are a nice surprise if you are taking some time to rest or having a meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Location...”
Reviews.Author: zipidydoodah
Reviews.Content: I stayed Sunday Feb 19- Wed Feb 22, Great location as it's close to Grand Central and Times Square. Nice touches, free water! Wifi! Heating system that was quiet. Could not hear any of the other guests in rooms or hallways. Pricey - yes, but you get good value. Nice workout room.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: JenandTomandMonty
Reviews.Content: I stay here in the off season when the prices are lower. The service is great and it is a great location. The bar staff is nice and the bar is a good place to get a quick drink. It can get a bit pricey during the holiday season so I cannot always stay here. I have stayed at several Sofitels, never any problems.

Reviews.Title: “A slice of luxury in midtown”
Reviews.Author: Keats575
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our four-night stay at the Sofitel. The location is ideal for taking in the sights and excitement of midtown and the theatre district, and the hotel is a lovely and quiet place to come "home" to. Our room was tastefully decorated, clean, and stocked with a nice variety of L'Occitane products. The bed was luxurious and very comfortable. The courteous and friendly housekeeping staff were exceptional; they did a great job of keeping our room spotless and stocked with fresh linens without disruption to us. We enjoyed the turn-down service and the complimentary water every evening. Our daily room service breakfast was delicious, nicely presented, and it always arrived quickly. On the morning we checked out, we first had no hot water, then no water at all for showering. We notified the staff and they informed us that there had been a problem affecting a number of floors. I understand that these things happen, but it did leave a bad impression after a lovely stay at the hotel. Because we had a flight, we couldn't delay our morning routine to wait for the water issue to be fixed. I found it disappointing that no apologies or attempt to compensate us for the inconvenience were forthcoming at check-out until we raised our concern with a manager. At that point he apologized and offered a form of compensation for a future visit. I know that hotels charge a lot for phone calls, but the prices here seem especially steep. After traveling through France with very reasonable overseas phone rates, this was a shock. Excessive roaming charges are probably preferable to hotel phone rates. All in all, this is a lovely, clean, well-appointed hotel with wonderful staff, and I wouldn't hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Home Again!”
Reviews.Author: Southerner057
Reviews.Content: This was my second long stay at the Sofitel New York, and it was like going back to my northern home, got upgraded to a suite on the 26 floor which was great since I was staying for a full week. The beds are simply magnifique! All the staff was very nice and professional but there are some stars worth mentioning: Noelle in guest relations, Alexandra in the front desk and Paula in the consierge services. The only service aspect where I can see room for improvement is the door. doormen and bellboys should be a bit more like... well like the rest of their colleagues. Hope to come back sooner than later!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: EveC19
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here 3 times now and each time have been delighted with the whole experience. Its a wonderful hotel in a great location for visiting all the major sites in NY plus its very close to a wide selection of good restaurants should you choose not to eat at the hotel itself, where the food incidentally is very good and the breakfasts in particular never fail to impress. Also close to the theatre district and the main shopping thoroughfares, And the staff have always been welcoming, friendly and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: jayne o
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel for four nights in February and I would recommend it to anyone. I have stayed in many 5* hotels and this hotel was excellent. Our room (a luxury one) was very spacious and clean and the bed was so comfortable. One small niggle was the lack of wardrobe space....but maybe I didn't pack to much for a four night stay! The staff were very polite and helpful, the bar had a great atmospher and the lobby area was lovely - with beautiful flower arrangements. The location is perfect - midway between times square and 5th avenue. I can't wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: RVMENG
Reviews.Content: I went for business purpuses to NYC, with my wife and have decided to stay at Sofitel. It was very nice. The room was clean, the staff is nice and the room good. The only problem we had was that sometimes the room maid knocked our door, no matter the 'Do not Disturb' sign was there. The breakfast was good too. The location is good, close to times square and subway but far enought to have peace. They give wi-fi connection for free. They say it is low band, but for my needs, it worked very well.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location, super comfy beds.”
Reviews.Author: Ju_321
Reviews.Content: Lovely place to stay whilst in New York if you want to stay in a luxury hotel. We stayed for a week and couldn't fault the place except for the service. Just make sure you check your bill...

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel 5 mins from times square!”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel077
Reviews.Content: First time to NYC for a few nights, so a Well located hotel was important. We were very happy with our choice as mid town was perfect. The Sofitel is tucked away from the crazy-ness of times square and close to grand central station, diamond district, subway, Bryant park (FAB for morning bagel, orange juice and coffee in the park!), nearby diner, macdonalds and other mid town interests. Hotel staff were always helpful Rooms were extremely clean and attended to in a timely fashion. One issue we had was with the in-room refrigerator. It did not cool properly, so maintenance staff were able to install a smaller one for our 3 night stay at this hotel for our water etc. They attended to this very quickly when reported. One thing - the beds are AMAZING ! After a through flight from Sydney, we were so glad we chose the Sofitel as our first sleep was phenomenal! free use of computer in lobby for the internet and complimentary bottled water was also a bonus Did not have the in house breakfast as we ventured out quite a bit and having so many options nearby assisted! Definitely recommend a coffee and bagel in Bryant park :) Overall, well located hotel for both business and leisure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Sleep... At a price!”
Reviews.Author: MannaMac
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights in February. The main reason to choose this Hotel is due to its location, 2 blocks away from times square and Broadway. It seems that they want you to have a French feeling experience, the staff will greet you with Bonjour all day long, including evenings. I booked a luxury king room that was not ready exactly until 3pm which is the check-in time. The first room given had a very strange smell and there was no cell phone reception. After my first call bringing up the matter I was immediately given another room in a higher floor. The new one was great. The air was a bit to dry, but the quality of sleeping is great. The hotel was full and for a few times we had to wait a lot for the elevators and then go down or up stopping in every floor. We also tried the room service once, the timing was perfect, the food not so much and of course overpriced. The concierge was not in the best of his mood when we booked a very expensive transportation to the Airport. USD 188.00 for an SUV to JFK. It’s a good place to stay if price is not an issue, I believe we could get a better deal in the same region.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: yankeetravels27
Reviews.Content: We started our stay in the restaurant where the food was horribly disappointing. Then we moved into the bar where we were going to have apres dinner drinks. It took 15 minutes to get a drink in an empty bar. The room was fine, nothing special, but clean, small. The subpar aspect was the service from the restaurant to the bar to the front desk staff. We stayed here because it was close to the event we were attending, but we will never make that mistake again.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious hospitality”
Reviews.Author: dabbler45
Reviews.Content: Good sized room for NY hotel. On 14th floor, view of rooftops, sky, and some buildings accross 44th Street. Nice amenities, clean, comfortable bed. Most notably, all the hotel persons, from front desk, to greeter at the door, were accomodating, welcoming, and warm. Left there with very positive feelings, even though it was only for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bedsy56
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of jan for 4nights in a junior suite I have stayed in this hotel for 4 times in a period over 10 years This hotel has good rooms ( may be time to update ) apart from that the room was cleaned and turndown everyday nice touch the water All the staff I met were very polite and efficient wish i wish could say the same about the door staff never open door got you taxi if they were not talking to each other, and one was stood talking to someone else on nearby hotel front Had breakfast in my rate was very good and nice place to start your day in NYC Also had room service which the food was very good value brought to you by polite staff Have stayed at many 5 star hotels in New York but I still keep coming back to this hotel why good location value for money and good staff who go that extra mile ( not front door) I live in the uk if you want a hotel in the big apple choose this one you won't be dissatisfied

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MishaFromVancouver
Reviews.Content: Very well located. Friendly service, very nice clean quiet rooms. Beds are very comfortable. Very nice bar area without loud music where you can sit and relax. Breakfast was overpriced for the food served, but I guess this is expected for a hotel. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: suebhon
Reviews.Content: Just returned home after a three night stay at the Sofitel. I got a great rate on Hotwire and, especially for this price, the hotel was wonderful. I was on a low floor in queen bed room-- but I never mind a low floor in the rear of a building in New York because there was zero street noise. The room was completely silent except for the loud closing of other doors nearby (the one design flaw). The room was nicely furnished and all amenities were top notch-- frette linens, towels and robe. L'occitane shampoo, etc. Bed was supremely comfortable. And the bathroom was quite nice-- rain shower and separate bath. No coffee maker in the room, but I got one when I requested it. Small, but well-equipped gym. The location was perfect for this business trip and I would definitely return. I've stayed at multiple hotels in midtown and this is one of my favorites (along with the Omni Berkshire).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location!”
Reviews.Author: fantasykick
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel well situated near Times Square. The hotel staff is friendly. Bathroom is very spacious and bed is so comfy. You won't be disappointed. I was offered a complimentary drink upon check in and the concierge staff is always ready to help with questions. Recommended if you want to stay near Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!”
Reviews.Author: pophacker
Reviews.Content: We (my husband, 17 year old son, 22 year old daughter, and me) just got back from 3 days in New York. We went to see Book of Mormon and that by itself was a joy. But the Sofitel added so much to our experience, I had to share. We booked two rooms, but upon check-in found out that the room for my son and daughter had only a queen bed. We called down for a cot which would have been an extra $50 per night. However, the front desk called us back and offered a suite on the 21st floor with double beds for them and a queen for us across the hall. The hotel also extended our check-out, then held our luggage for as until it was time to leave for the airport. The location was perfect, the rooms were very nice, the bathrooms were luxurious, but I have to say the people--from the doorman to the concierge--were helpful, kind and gracious. Oh, and the service in the restaurant was good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: dr_j_now
Reviews.Content: Room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. Location is great with many good restaurants and many landmarks within easy walking distance. Free internet was a nice touch for NY and if you find it to be too slow you can upgrade to a high speed for a fee, but I found the "slow" version to be quite adequate. Overall a great place to stay and quite a good value for the location and what you get.

Reviews.Title: “French elegance in the heart of Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent and caring staff in this hotel sets it apart. The physical plant is up to date with an elegant lobby, clean modern rooms with modern art reproductions on the wall. We stay here whenever we can get the right price, which is fairly often. The ambiance is very romantic. A great place to stay with your partner. Location gives you good access to both uptown and downtown neighborhoods via a pleasant walk. Highly recommneded.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kuma5
Reviews.Content: I went with my son to new york city for the first time and we loved the location and service at the Sofitel. The staff was outstanding and the conceirge was so helpful. We walked every where and had the best time. Clean, beautiful, comfortable, wish I could live there.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Top Notch in NYC - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: lovetravel58
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful surprise we found in midtown Manhattan. The Sofitel was just a beautiful , elegant top of the line hotel. From when we were first greeted at the door, to the reception desk to the housekeeping service, everyone there goes out of their way to ensure you are having an enjoyable experience. There are no New York attitudes here! Although the room was small, which is not that surprising in NYC, it was clean and very comfortable. The bedding was very high quality and towels were luxuriously thick! Special notice to Gabrielle, the bartender in their bar/restaurant who was sweet and makes fabulous chocolate martinis! Looking forward to visiting NY in the near future and will definitely make this our new place to stay! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Definately would...”
Reviews.Author: LaGracie
Reviews.Content: I booked a suite for 7 nights to celebrate my husband's 30th birthday. The room was lovely and from my experience of New York hotel room size spacious (plenty of room for all our (my) shopping bags and no tripping over any of them!!). The hotel is in a great central location making most of the New York's major attractions a walkable distance. Also there was a good spot for breakfast just a few doors down. In relation to service I have no complaints - the rooms were spotless, staff helpful and on my husband's birthday a birthday cake was left in the room - a very sweet touch. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel- Definately will be returning”
Reviews.Author: Snoopy1029
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled with our pick of the Sofitel. From the moment we entered until we checked out there wasn't even one disappointment. The Hotel is a short walk to Times Square and the theatre district. The Hotel room was clean. There was no reports of bed bugs on the registry. The amenities were great. There is a nice fitness room (although we didn't use it). There is a stocked mini fridge and water in the room. Wehn you walk in, they have music playing for you. The bed linens were one of the most comfortable I had ever experienced. The concierge was helpful and infact arranged our return car to the airport cheaper that we got from the car service. The staff were very friendly. Very close to everything. We can;t wait to go back and we will stay at the Sofitel again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Clee551622
Reviews.Content: A great location for accessing everything NY has to offer. Staff are very accommodating and willing to help with reservations, taxis and odd requests. We stayed in a junior suite which was spacious and well furnished. We have a 14mth old and they were able to accommodate cot, highchair and a refrigerator for storing milk etc in the room - on request. Having a baby restricted what we could do in the evenings and it was disappointing that the room service food was so, so average. We tried 3 times in the hope that it was a one-off but really it is well below standard of a luxury hotel and extremely expensive for the quality. It is delivered promptly and with a smile however! Finally, don't assume the lobby is ok to have business calls, at times it was extremely noisy. I would stay again but will eat out!

Reviews.Title: “Fell Short of Expectations”
Reviews.Author: belugalove
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a one night stay at the Sofitel New York. Overall I came away with mixed feelings. The location in mid-town is very convenient to everything within the city. The SoBed! Probably the best feature of the hotel is the bed, or as my wife called it, the Cloud. The staff however was quite a disappointment. Despite the fact that we were greeted upon arrival and escorted thru the lobby to front desk, service failed to impress beyond that. Check-in was fairly robotic and we were soon on our way up to our room; Luxury King was booked. The room itself was quite spacious by New York standards but we felt that the use of space poor. The room and facility as a whole felt like it was beginning to show some wear and tear....for some reason they taped duct-taped down the mats at the entry hall as well as at the front desk - this gave off a very janky vibe, not respecting of a 4 or 5 star property. Interaction with staff, from room service to the bell staff seemed very cold and uninviting; response time for requests however, was very quick. All in all, I'd be hesitant to recommend the Sofitel New York. Having stayed at the Sofitel DC a couple of years ago, I had much greater expectations that were brought down by uninspiring staff and mediocre condition of the property. Safe Travels!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Lovely and Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: CatherineofCanada
Reviews.Content: First time we have stayed at the Sofitel. We had a queen bed room and for New York, it was spacious with a lovely large bathroom. The beds and linens are excellent. And the hotel is very quiet while being accessible to everything. The staff is professional and courteous and helpful. They charge for internet in the rooms which is an irritation to me, but there is free internet in lobby. The lobby is a comfortable place to be, so I did my computer work there. Walking distance to Times Square and good restaurants. Being Canadian, I like the inclusion of French language on all hotel literature. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rosiesmartypants
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to New York, and we could not have been staying in a more convenient location - close to Broadway, Times Square, 5th Avenue...all within 5 minutes walking distance. I had requested a room in a high floor (just to get away from the noise of the traffic), and the hotel gave us a room on the top floor, which was amazing with the most spectacular sunrise views. The room was of a decent size, clean with an exceptionally comfortable bed - all we needed considering we spent most of our time sightseeing. We had very little interaction with the hotel staff, but when we did they were friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: hutchnshs
Reviews.Content: With all the fantastic reviews I was very excited to stay here. The location is fantastic! Near Times Square but not right in it, which can get old. We didn't have much interaction with the staff, but when we did they were very gracious. The room was clean and the closet was very nice (odd to include that but it really was). The bathrooms are very nice and the room was small, but it's NYC and that is the norm. I have no complaints at all and would stay here again. I will say that we got an AWESOME deal by booking early. If I was paying the highest rates for the room I would have expected more. But certainly check it out, just shop the rates first.

Reviews.Title: “For a Luxurious stay, in New York, stay at the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: Andy05255
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel Hotel for two nights and enjoyed every minute of our visit to New York! The Sofitel is on West 44th street just a few blocks from Times Square and centrally located in the Theater district. We arrived on a Friday afternoon and used the valet service to park our car which was so convenient. The doorman, the bellmen, the front desk, and room service people, all make you feel like a VIP! The Lobby is cozy and inviting. We had a junior suite with a foyer, sitting area with couch, ( that is a pull out if you bring a child) , easy chair , coffee table and flat screen TV. Our bedroom was entered via sliding pocket doors and the bathroom was luxurious! The King size bed was so comfy and relaxing and the room so quiet ! Our morning room service breakfast was perfect and delicious. We dinned at Gaby's on Saturday night and our meals were again perfect and delicious thanks to Nick our waiter, who was very personable. For a luxurious stay in the middle of Manhattan stay at the Sofitel Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “I Love This Place”
Reviews.Author: StephenM465
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I've stayed at this hotel. It's steps away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square, but is a totally refined, elegant hotel, with excellent service and staff. The beds are great, and while the rooms are small, they're tastefully modern. Great hotel. Love staying here.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay......”
Reviews.Author: Mandyfinds
Reviews.Content: I had spent three weeks in NYC and wanted to end my trip staying at the Sofitel after spending the first week up at the Warwick on 54th and then later at the Soho Grand. I thought I'd try something closer to times square and the Sofitel definitely fitted the bill. Great location. Unfortunately we didn't get off to a great start, it seemed my reservation (booked and paid for 3 weeks prior) was not in the system. After a bit of messing around it seems a technical glitch had sent my reservation into the ether, however it was now found. Hooray. Unfortunately it was 12 pm and there was not a room ready, only one of level 3. I wasn't too keen on a 3rd level room (mainly concerned about noise rather than view) so reception suggested I leave my bags and come back after 3pm. No worries, as check in is 3pm so not a drama. Happily left my luggage and went off to lunch. Around 4pm I returned and finalized my check in for alas, that's right, a level 3 room. After explaining to receptionist #2 that I had already gone through this with the other lady, she apologized abruptly with " Well it is the only room". Not overly impressed, I took it as the booking was already paid for, but at this stage I was regretting moving from my previous hotel. Anyway, arrived in the room to find the safe was not working.. Hung about for 35 mins whilst the maintenance team fixed this up. (great work and service from them - they were very nice) From there my stay improved. The room was very nice and the 3rd level was fine and free from street noise, which was great. The housekeeping staff and the door staff were all very helpful and great at their jobs. The bathroom was quite spacious and the shower was fabulous. The location of this hotel was also a bonus and very close to everything. So all in all, was a good stay. I think that the service at checkin definitely wasn't the greatest quite abrupt and mildly disinterested, probably wasn't up to their usual standard, perhaps I caught them on a bad day?

Reviews.Title: “everything about this hotel is perfect... except...Gaby restaurant service, blah...!”
Reviews.Author: jocelyn_b1229
Reviews.Content: we are actually STILL staying in the hotel...! I love it here, from our first experience with the doorman to the room itself... the location... we just love it here... until last night... we walked into the Gaby restaurant, servers just walking past us so we went to the front desk to ask if we seat ourselves, wait...? who knows no one acknowledged us... then we seat ourselves so we tell one of the hostess we have the I love chocolate package, well I guess they just assumed we didn't want anything else... we couldn't even get a waiter to come over and take an order or give us water? so my husband had to go to the bar and order...! after he orders, then they ask if we need something... but they were quick to clear our table before we were done... overall, will stay at the hotel, not eat at the restaurant...! hopefully by the time next we stay here, they will work on their customer service at the restaurant...!

Reviews.Title: “OK, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: BrusselsRolie
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a suite for a very reasonable price for NY standards (special package directly on the website for a week-long stay, same price as a double, but package not well advertised at all). Very high floor, corner, good view but without the landmark (Chrysler Building) that we were told we would have. Atmosphere got a bit stuffed as one couldn't open the windows. Understandable for obvious reasons, but still a little bit of fresh air would have been a good thing... Also, doors to the bathroom do not close entirely (there's a space on the floor) so if you want to really be on your own, hum, it can be a problem... Awesome beds (eh, eh, that's Sofitel for you). Rate did not include breakfast, and boy, oh, boy, was that a good idea: almost next door on the right, the Red Flame Diner was there, and their reputation for breakfast is spot on. It's great: they also deliver to the hotel if you want. For a week, though, you can get tired of the scenery, and if so, there's a good coffee shop where you can have breakfast. Very well located between Times Square and Grand Central, and within walking distance of Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel is the best”
Reviews.Author: ennailuj v
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November 2011...as always our experience was fantastic. I had an event to get to at 8am and the front desk was able to check me in EARLY instead of just holding my bags all day. We enjoyed champagne and room service breakfast which was expensive but worth it...the beds are so comfortable we didn't want to move. Having a separate tub and shower was a luxury but a bargain for the Sofitel price point. Every single staff member that we encountered was beyond courteous& competent. The lobby smells like really strong cologne...I would say this is the only downside of the experience. Thank you Sofitel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Paddylau
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time we're in New York over the past 5 years, the first 2 trips we stayed at Mandarin Oriental NY and Westin NY and thought we'll give Sofitel a try. We booked a Suite in November through third-party website as it was better values compare to booking with hotel directly. On the day of our arrival, we arrived at the hotel at 3:30pm and were told the room originally planned for our stay wasn't ready and was given another room. With the room card in hand, just standing outside our Suite, we discovered housekeeping were just getting the Suite ready for our stay, we can see the bedding from the previous occupant still needed to be change and floor still need hovering. I quickly rushed back to Front Desk as I thought it was unacceptable, in all fairness, prior giving us the key, the Front Office did phone and checked if the suite was ready. As there was no other Suite available, we accepted the one while it was now being prepared by 3 maids. This turned out to be the only mishap throughout our stay. Plus point: Excellent location, friendly staffs, all with a smile, it was also nice to see the General Manager greeting clients and leading from the front. Mishap was quickly rectified and followed up. Room was clean and cannot see anything that is aged or dated as others have posted on here before. Will definitely be back next time we are in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Azhkman
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 21st floor (I think in 2101). We had stayed here before. For some reason, found this at a really good rate starting New Year's Day. The location is really good. It's on 44th Street between 5th & 6th Avenues. By reference, there is a 24 hour deli (Smiler's) around the corner (northward) on 5th Avenue. And there is a 24 hour drugstore (Duane Reade) around the corner (northward) on 6th Avenue. The better shopping is up 5th Avenue to 57th Street, and above 57th, on Madison Avenue. Given that, there are pockets of shopping around the city. Site-wise, you are extremely close to Times Square and Rockafeller Center, but a long way from most of everything else, except Central Park which is about 25-30min walking northward on either 5th or 6th Avenue. It is close to Grand Central Terminal, but far from Penn Station. The closest subway is on 6th Avenue. It's location makes it a nice base for exploring around the city. The room itself was clean, nice big TV, good view of the Chrysler Building, and a clean and large bathroom with a separate tub! The safe was plenty big to hold everything, and the bed was the best one we had stayed in for a long time. The shower was strong enough, and using a D-Link, we created wifi in the room off the wired internet. The service of the hotel was very good, we received lots of help with our bags without even asking, both arriving and leaving the hotel. I would highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Sofitel Quality,”
Reviews.Author: TranspaciFlyer
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel that services business travelers, higher end tourists, and those that appreciate quality. The hotel should be judged by NYC standards. This means that the reception staff are more friendly and helpful than the typical MY hotel. Yes, there are hotels that offer better "value", but that can be a relative quality. If one defines value as delivering on the hospitality promise, reliability and being a solid hotel, then this is a high value hotel. If one judges only on price, then ouch, because it can be expensive. However, its NYC and good hotels are expensive. That's not the hotel's fault, but the city and state who charge high taxes.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: foinikas
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 31aug-5sep. Nice room, clean and friendly-helpful stuff. Location: perfect!!! We will com again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable haven in the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: tnor
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay at the Sofitel in New York. After travelling for a few weeks it was great to land somewhere that is pretty central in NY but is also quite and comfortable. Staff were helpful and the rooms well appointed (one thing that was not working was fixed within a few hours of being reported). The downstairs restaurant was a nice "opt out of the cold and bustle" option

Reviews.Title: “Great value and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: str82th
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights and three days at the Sofitel near Times Square. The hotel is very well kept. The staff is consistently friendly and helpful. We stayed in a suite which was very large for a New York suite--especially at that price point. The bed was very comfortable with nice pillows and comforter. The storage for hanging clothing was a bit sparse and the hallway with the closets was extremely narrow. The bathroom was medium-sized and only had one sink which was a bit of a problem getting ready to go out for two people. The suite couches were large and comfortable. Although we didn't have guests in the room with us we could have easily entertained another couple in that space. The lobbies were well kept and neat. Newspapers were always available (for free). There was plenty of seating in the lobby and several PCs to check e-mail and print out boarding passes, etc... Breakfast in the hotel restaurant was great tasting. Coffee from the coffee press was warm and delicious. Prices were fair. Location is good for New York but not quite central. We took in a show on Broadway and walked to it in 10 minutes. Cabs are always available in front of the hotel. Overall, great hotel and I suspect very consistent in how it is cared for. Accor is a very consistent hotel chain--not much left to chance ever in any of their hotels. I stay at both Mercure and Ibis in Europe often and have had consistently great stays.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the center of it all-in the capital of the world- Times Square.”
Reviews.Author: Lirio C
Reviews.Content: I had a great time in the 3 days that I spend in Sofitel New York. From the moment I was welcomed at the door to the professional and friendly check in. I would certainly return. My room was very well kept by the room attendant that also was friendly and respectful. What a wonderful experience. I will certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “#1 Luxury, Comfort and Convienience”
Reviews.Author: CJ-and-TJG
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel New York epitomizes elegance and luxury all within a convenient location of Manhattan. The staff were professional and extremely helpful. The room was extremely comfortable from the super comfy bed to the elegant spa-like bathroom. The hotel was in a fantastic location within easy walking distance to all of the major attractions. Check in & out was very efficient and the concierge service was excellent. We will definitely stay here again and would strongly recommend anyone seeking luxury and convenience stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back !”
Reviews.Author: MandySue_86
Reviews.Content: Everyone we talked to at the hotel were extremely friendly & very helpful! Our room was great & the location of the hotel was PERFECT ! We were able to walk every where we needed & the subway station was only blocks away. The room was great & serviced beautifully every day & plenty of room for the two of us & all my shopping! Only bad thing was dry cleaning was really expensive but that isn't unusual for this type of place.

Reviews.Title: “The NYC's luxury you need to experience. Go and see.”
Reviews.Author: RT4
Reviews.Content: Staying at the hotel was a wonderful experience. I could not find a better hotel with similar reviews for the price. Staff was accommodating, rooms were big enough for a small family and location was awesome. You can have it all in the walking distance enjoying the view and snapping pictures. Restaurants, Time Square, the Avenues with their stores, shops, bars, the Broadway, everything is right there. Taking the cab once at the hotel is better than own car, if you drive. The rooms were clean and big for NYC, bed was comfy, a bunch of storage space for clothes, big closets with tall mirrors to check out your new items. The street noises we could hardly notice, even when we tried. This was first time we stayed at the Sofitel and we will be staying again. Highly recommend you the hotel for so many things you can experience staying there. One of the kind! Go and see.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and extremely quiet”
Reviews.Author: Ann C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just spent four nights at the Sofitel NYC - our second visit to this hotel. I am totally convinced this is our ideal NYC hotel. It is close to Times Square, the theater district, and Rockefeller Center, but so quiet! The only drawback is the lack of view, but we don't mind. We stayed in a suite this time and it was huge! We never heard any noise from traffic or fellow guests.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Spot”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five days after Christmas. It is the first time we have stayed here. It is a great location, nice rooms, and quiet street.The only bad thing is that breakfast is not included, but there is a good diner two doors down. We will stay there again. It is between 6th and 5th avenue away from the craziness of Time Square, but with a perfect walking distance to everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel many times, and it is always a pleasure. the location is outstanding, particularly if you like the theater. We will be back! The rooms are very nice, with free wifi and beds are very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Caroline T
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5nights at the Sofitel Manhattan and it can only say that we had a great stay. The hotel situation is perfect only 2 blocks from Time Square, the staff is helpfull and efficient. Even when we called the reception to ask for bandage, someone was at our door within 2mins. The rooms are great, the bed is just perfect, all very clean and all in working order.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Trip”
Reviews.Author: JAMES B
Reviews.Content: Our Christmas trip to New York was made even better by the Sofitel. The property is beautifully maintained, the staff goes above and beyond. We never wanted for anything the entire trip. We were greeted by the doorman each time we entered the hotel. We stayed in a suite, which is very large for New York standards. Again, everything in the room was extra clean and luxurious. Room Service was excellent! The only downside here was the the Christmas meal on the 25th in the restaurant. The food was so so, and the service was horrible. However, it was the holiday and I am sure this is not how they normally do things. Everything else about the stay was A+

Reviews.Title: “Not a luxury hotel but it's got comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: Manico
Reviews.Content: Maybe it's me. For some reason, I seem to think of the Sofitel brand as a luxury hotel. Maybe it's because they're usually priced so high that I'm fooled into believing that. In any case, the Sofitel NY, while a nice hotel is definitely not a luxury hotel like the Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton chains. It's more comparable to a Renaissance or nice Hyatt Regency. The location of this property is right near Times Square but far enough away so that you're not drowning in crowds while getting to the hotel. Staff is pleasant and welcoming and they definitely do a good job. Rooms are slightly bigger than the "NYC standard" but even elite members of the Accor brand don't seem to get upgrades to bigger rooms (how many millions of dollars do you have to spend a year to get that???). The best things are the beds (very comfortable and hard to leave) and bathrooms (nice showers, tubs and amenities). You do get a decent turndown service and they have nice robes and slippers (if that's important to you). There is a small fitness room in the basement with about 3 treadmills and 3 other cardio machines plus some weight machines (2?). It can get crowded in here but at least they have a gym..... I was disappointed to see (maybe I'm missing something) only 1 restaurant/bar here off the check-in desk. It was small and had more of a cafe feel to it than a restaurant (see the Chicago Sofitel for an example of a nice restaurant). It was also grossly overpriced----usually I like to go to the Sofitel's for breakfast as you can usually get a continental basket (fresh baked goods) for around $17-20. Here it was over $25 and didn't include coffee. Hmmmmm........given the number and quality of French restaurants in town, you can do much better outside the Sofitel. I would stay here again-----but only if the price were below $200 a night which it never is. Otherwise, there are plenty of other great upscale and luxury hotels in town to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Could have done better”
Reviews.Author: Geniesser39
Reviews.Content: It's not up to the Sofitel standards. Some of the staff feel more comfortable in French than English. We had bad luck with one concierge and one receptionist. We went there for leisure reasons and they were definitely not very good at this. The advice and help was confusing and not good and never with a smile- rather reluctant. For this location simply not acceptable. It ended with messing up the limo service - the driver wasn't coming nor did the concierge find our reservation, which we got confirmed in writing by the hotel prior to the trip. The late arrangement resulted in a speed race back to the airport. For a hotel of this level you expect those details to work, why else would you book a Sofitel?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Loulinglee
Reviews.Content: Well all I can say thanks !!! .My wife and myself are staying in what we class as a top end hotel this is our first time in a sofitel and the first time to New York ,like many of us we save our money for the holiday of a lifetime, so we work hard and spend our money and expect the best value we can get ,the best service ,the best of everything ,because that's we have worked hard for !,,, Well we found it here at the Sofitel New York!!! As you have probably read the hotel is in the middle of it all go out the front turn right Times Square and Broadway ,out front turn left to the end of the road to junction of 5th avenue( this goes from central park all the way down to soho past empire state .Madison Gardens it's all right on your doorstep .The food in the hotel was fantastic the steak was superb ,our room was very clean and maid service as well as turn down service with comp water , room was well decorated with temp controlled heating that was fab as the weather here this week has been hot then cold ,I've read some of the comments from other reviewers about views frcm the room u are in a city so get real ,,, who wants to sit in a room when ure in New York ?.As far as the staff goes if your courteous to the staff they are more than courteous back !,,, .Ive sat in the main hall and have been astounded how rude and ignorant some people can be ,,,,,Enjoy it as we have ,make the most all around you and embrace life as it is given.Thank you to all at the sofitel :) stayed 5 nights 23rd to 28th

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, and good value”
Reviews.Author: dmorris12
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here two over the past 2 years, and enjoyed it. Both times, the value for the $$ was good- upscale hotel, and the rooms are even a fair size given the location close to Times Square. Location- excellent, close to Times Square, but not on top of it. Pretty much everything is nearby. Restaurant- very good, but wildly overpriced, even for NYC. Ambiance- nice, but overly 'French' which is ok except when its seems forced. Service was good. Bathroom- shower was nice, though the baths seemed dated. Bed- generally comfortable Gym- functional and nice. Overall, it exceeded expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality Abounds”
Reviews.Author: Travelmore
Reviews.Content: Hospitality abounds. Old World charm. Small rooms--slightly worn. Awesome tub--perfect size for a petite person. Comfortable bed and pillows. Concierge was very helpful with suggestions for dinner and directions. Nice location.

Reviews.Title: “VERY SPECIAL HOTEL IN MANHATTAN”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel offers high level of service in all its sectors, with extreme care of their employees. I've been, stayed at Sofitel a lot of times and always I loved it. I've already stayed at other hotels, as New York Palacem Park Lane e etc..., good either, but after Sofitel, always Sofitel. Antonio Carlos do Nascimento e mail: antonioc.nascimento@terra.com.br

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth it.”
Reviews.Author: maqart
Reviews.Content: Have been staying at the NYC Sofitel for years, and have never had a bad experience. Trips have ranged from family gatherings, to introducing young nieces to New York, to romantic weekends with my husband and everything has been perfect, every time. Good food, great views of the Chrysler building, helpful staff and nothing EVER too much trouble. But it is VERY expensive.... I look for deals online and save up. We're worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, service and location!”
Reviews.Author: 360physicaltherapy
Reviews.Content: Customer service was excellent. The location was walking distance to Broadway shows, Rockefeller Center and the center of Times Square. We had a queen room and the kids had a room with two singles. The beds were to die for...very comfy...and the rooms were very spacious considering it was NY. We stayed on the 19th floor so there was no noise to interrupt our sleep...not sure about the lower levels. The fitness center had both cardio and strength training equipment enough to get in a good workout. The rooms were very clean and the bathrooms were spotless with great lighting and plenty of hot water and good water pressure. The only problem was waiting for our bags after check in...we wished we would have just brought them up ourselves. Also room services was in my opinion was outrageously priced even for NY standards in my opinion though I do have to say the burger was tasty when we were tired of venturing out in the cold and just wanted to hang in the room. We did lock ourselves out and had to call for assistance from the kids room...they were up there with a key in mere minutes! Very impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pascarella
Reviews.Content: Very nice staff, well located, clean and sofisticated.

Reviews.Title: “Time Square”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Well positioned luxury hotel. The nearby Red Flame Diner was a great place for breakfast and reasonably priced. Many restaurants in the area catering to all levels and tastes. Reasonable value for money

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Adam M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just a night, but enjoyed the hotel. Location is fantastic on 44th just 2 blocks from Times Square. You can be in the midst of all the action within minutes but get to retreat to a quiet middle-of-the-block location. Staff is exceptional friendly and efficient. With a line of people checking out they had extra staff asking whether people were leaving bags and getting that process done independently. Room was great. Very comfortable bed. A nice large desk area to spread out and work. Huge bathroom. No complaints. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “well located could not fault it”
Reviews.Author: mcgringo
Reviews.Content: Great stay despite some selfish person smoking in their room and ruining 2 nights sleep. The management were quick to sort it and accommodate us in a different room until this guest moved out. The hotel is centrally located one side is times square the other side grand central Overall I was very happy with it, the complimentary breakfast was very good, well cooked, service was a little slow on busy weekend days. I would recommend it and would stay here again. It is quite expensive but so is most of NY hotels, overall happy

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: Emmi08
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have asked for anywhere better. The hotel was located right in the centre of everything we wanted to do. The room was lovely (very comfy bed) and the staff all very helpful - recommended us some great places to eat that weren't expensive and also helped us out with finding different tourist attractions. Very clean, helpful staff, ideal location, what more could you want!

Reviews.Title: “The place where I feel good!”
Reviews.Author: Yves P
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, nice room, nice service. Vladimir the concierge give good advice and directions. Albert at the front desk he's so nice and he's always kind.. He makes me feel welcome! It's my second stay there and I will come back fo sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to visit the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: Marsoan
Reviews.Content: We went twice to Sofitel and each time, we were very pleased with our choice. Staff is professional, rooms are just big enough, the bed is very comfy but most importantly, it's very well located to visit the city. You can walk to Central Park, you're a corner away from Times Square yet you don't feel or hear its craziness, a block away from beautiful Bryant Park and close to several metro stations. We booked through another travel site to get hotel and flight so the room was very affordable. Just dine out and you can enjoy without breaking the bank.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate elegance”
Reviews.Author: Tarja L
Reviews.Content: Truly elegant midtown manhattan hotel with a boutique feel. Perfect, central location. Although rooms are located on 29 floors the hotel feels much smaller, more intimate. The reception area can be a bit crowded at times but service is polite and appropriate without overdoing it. I was on a 4-day business trip so I really appreciated the beautifully appointed (art deco style) fresh and airy rooms. (Luxury room 18th floor). The best feature about the room was the amount of light, bright but by no means harsh. Wardrobe is large with full length mirror doors, again with good lighting, so perfect for testing your outfits. The bed is among the best at any hotel that I can recall off the top of my head, possibly with the exception of the beds at Sofitel Metropole in Hanoi. Good choice of pillows. Large flat screen tv, radio, etc. Marble bathroom is just about perfect in design, colours, lighting and above all functionality. A large shower cubicle with no flooding beyond the cubicle as well as a bathtub. A long stretch of marble top for laying cosmetics. Quality amenities as well as a make-up (shaving) mirror with lights! Only complaint are the heavy, swinging double doors leading from the entrance hall to the bathroom - kept hitting by ankles on them! Ordered continental breakfast from room service due to lack of time and that worked efficiently. Exquisite little croissant, danish pastry, muffin, pain au chocolat and mini baguette with coffee and juice. Gaby restaurant was ok for a quick lunch but for Sunday night dinner it felt cold and empty. It would be wonderful if the hotel could have a separate breakfast restaurant on the upper floors with a view and lots of light and freshness. Gaby has more of a bistro/bar feel, which is not very enticing at breakfast. Excellent hotel, particularly for New York where the quality of even luxury hotels varies widely. The only issue with the hotel is that it tends to be rather expensive most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Broadway/Midtown”
Reviews.Author: Dana_SF
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel is an excellent hotel. It has an understated/european charm, feels upscale yet laid-back, and is perfectly situated for being a tourist in the City. It generally has a quiet, unhurried feel to it. The lobby is fairly small, and never feels like its crowded with people. The bar/restaurant that's attached is first-rate. The hotel is part of a French chain, and the artwork around the hotel is either Manhattan- or Paris-themed (a nice touch). It's only 2 blocks from many Broadway theaters, and is in easy walking distance to many other popular destinations (ie Radio City, Rockefeller Center, 5th Ave shopping) and restaurants (ie Four Seasons, Gilt, Le Bernardin). We stay here every year for an end of year trip. Its a little pricey, but it feels like its worth it.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it very much!”
Reviews.Author: cucuruchito
Reviews.Content: Excellent concierge staff. Professional and Friendly. Carlomar and Rajae thank you! The front desk is correct. Elevators are fast. Rooms clean and pretty. I don t like the huge mirrors covering the drawers completely.. but.. the the rest of the room was perfect. The bed is very comfortable and the free wi fi works perfectly. With the special rate for three nights the value was really worthy and we stayed two more nights at a very good rate too. Loved the breakfast restaurant, waiters are really professional and fast. An asset of this hotel is the coffee. The coffee is great! A drawback: Room service was too slow...and front desk does not seem to be in real communication with the concierges.. maybe because they are too far apart... crossed information about shipments... but well, I liked the hotel very much and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Organised, in touch and an overall all round experience of note. Attention to detail is great and staff are fantastic. To mention a few Louis on the front desk and Metti and Nick in Gaby'S Change the doorman they are useless and will watch you battle with luggage whilst they answer their cell phones.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: ANSQ8
Reviews.Content: I stayed at a decent size suite, and my experience was just OK!! Pluses: 1. Excellent location: very close proximity to great shopping on 5th and Madison avenues, Broadway, and times square. 2. Beddings were comfy and luxurious and toiletries were high end 3. The gadgets at the room were not up to date, but the maintenance and tech guy was accommodating. Minuses: 1. The hotel didn't have a good view, confined between buildings. 2. The staff seemed unfriendly and not well knowledge. 3. The colors and style of the furniture were kind of dated.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevielittle
Reviews.Content: I stayed her with my girlfriend for a long weekend and it was superb. The location of the hotel is great, 2 minute walk to Time Square and 5th Avenue. The rooms are great, and I had a massive bathroom, and the hotel staff were very good with pointing out places to go and even got me tickets to the Basket Ball. Will definitely be returning and would recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ENCDublin
Reviews.Content: Cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. We had no problems whatsoever. This was our second stay in this particular hotel and once again it did not dissapoint. Fantastic location, the hotel is situated between 5th Avenue and Times Square about two minutes from 5th, yet the street is completely quiet. I would describe the rooms as 5 star business class, they are immaculate and very very comfortable. There are no words to describe how great the beds are! They put a duvet under the sheet as well as over. Room service was lovely but I wouldn't recommend the restaurant, purely because its a bit quiet and there are so many great restaurants within minutes of the hotel (highly recommend http://www.osteria-doge.com/ if you want super romantic mid price italian) . Hotel also has handy business centre with internet and printer just off the lobby which was useful. The lobby is quite small, not the kind you'd hang out in or have a drink in but you dont really go to New York to hang out in the hotel, do you? Really recommend the end of November as a good time to visit as prices are cheap after the Thanksgiving rush and you get to see all the Christmas lights being turned on (and great sales!)

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: miloumario
Reviews.Content: sort of generic midtown business hotel with some nice touches and also some tired elements. the staff were friendly and efficient. the location is convenient to meetings in midtown. the room service food was ok and the lobby restaurant serves a good breakfast. nothing extraordinary about this place. the room smelled a bit smoky and musty, perhaps from hosting heavy smoking french guests. the price was good and my firm had a corporate rate.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel - Great Manhattan Location”
Reviews.Author: LondonSam786 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent New York hotel. Good location, in the vicinity of Times Square and Central Park etc. Friendly staff, high room quality and attentive service. Only minor bit of constructive criticism would be that certain communal parts of the hotel (e.g. the lifts and carpeting in the lobby) were a touch dirty, which detracted from the overall look and feel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Brillant hotel,easy to check in and out.Room was clean and spacious.Only downside was the air conditioning unit was a bit loud and pets were allowed in the hotel.Would definitely recommend the hotel and consider staying again

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay as Usual”
Reviews.Author: RBS
Reviews.Content: I spent 8 nights at the Sofitel in October and enjoyed the professional service at the door, the desk and from housekeeping. We tended to go out late and housekeeping always gave our room an excellent full service in the evening. Our room service was a bit short of excellent. Often, the order was just slightly incorrect or lacking in a few things. We didn't want to wait for these things to be sent back so we just lived with it. Some additional training or attention to the evening room service staff would be helpful. I do think that the hotel needs to update the room in terms of a facelift. The draperies were old looking and there were stains on the furniture and carpet. Other than that, I am, after twenty years, happy to continue booking rooms at the Sofitel anywhere in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: andyg7
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights in the Sofitel NY, the staff were polite and check in was easy. The room was pretty small, clean but a little worn, a lot of the furniture was marked and looked like it needed replacing. The bathroom was clean and a decent size except for the tiny bath, which only a midget could use. For the money I spent I don't feel it was worth it, and having stayed at other hotels in the city I would not return. The Bryant Park is a much better option.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location for midtown and a great classic hotel”
Reviews.Author: paristosydney
Reviews.Content: Pros 1. Amazing location - smackbang in between Grand Central and Times Square so you can choose which is the most convenient for where you want to go. Very close to the NY Public Library and Bryant Park which was gorgeous. Also only 10-15 mins walk from Saks & Rockefeller. SO handy for shopping :-) 2. Classic foyer - really classy and luxurious. 3. Helpful staff and bellboys 4. Rooms are large by NY standards - even bathrooms also big. I loved this because most NY hotels are holes rather than rooms! 5. L'Occitane bath products a nice touch. 6. L'evian for turndown service included as is inroom wifi. 7. Beds are sooo comfy. I slept perfectly here. No cons! Would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Rough Start but Great End”
Reviews.Author: LuxFirstTravel
Reviews.Content: When we first checked into the hotel, we were not thrilled with the junior suite we booked. It had an odd floorplan and uninspiring view. I called the front desk and was told that was a preferred view. I don't call a construction site with the GE building behind it a preferrable view. I asked for a room change once something else became available. In the meantime, we both agreed that we were unlikely to return in the future. My efforts were awarded the next day when we were rebooked into another suite. It was so much better! Better floorplan and fantastic view of the mid-town skyline. The bed was extremely comfortable, probably the most comfortable we've ever slept in. The bathroom was huge by New York standards with a regular sized sink and separate tub and shower. Wonderful frette towels. Fresh flowers and candles in the bathroom were also a very nice touch. The closet, however, was much too small and oddly organized. Also, the furnishings and window coverings were a bit tired, but okay overall. Definitely have a meal or drink at the bar -- no disappointments there. The hotel is in a good location and within easy walking distance to Times Square, Rock Center, Fifth Avenue and Central Park. We plan on returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: NHTraveler37
Reviews.Content: Beautifully maintained both public areas and room. Fine interior design and decor. Two short blocks from Times Square, but completely quiet. Reasonable accessibility to non-tourist coffee shops and deli-type food, but a but a few blocks from decent restaurants. Very comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Just loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: hongo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the first time...and it's the best place I've stayed in NYC .
