I love the location on w. 44 since its easy to walk up or downtown and is close to times sq subway lines. The hotel is luxurious without being overly formal...just right! Staff is very friendly and always greets you in French ,which is fun because for me Paris is my favorite city in the world. We had a drink at the bar which was very nice and the breakfast at the hotel is wonderful - again it feels like a bit of France in the middle of ny. Fresh croissants and pain au chocolate accompany every breakfast choice. We felt pampered and attended to. We had a queen superior room and it was surprisingly spacious. The marble bathroom and occitane toiletries are beautiful. They have small touches like a candle and matches in the bath to use while you soak in the tub...I like that! Newspapers, free wifi, everything just feels classy and elegant, but not overly formal so you just feel comfortable and pampered.we were on 9 th floor and heard no noise at all..couldn't believe we were in manhattan,room was very quiet.I will definitely stay here again, and would stay in a Sofitel anywhere I go.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rosscaroline
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying this is the first trip advisor review we have done and we are doing so because this hotel was above and beyond what we expected. We had a junior suite (2022 great view) which was extremely clean, spacious and well designed. The bath was deep, the shower had power and the bath goodies were by Hermes. From check in to check out we found ALL of the staff to be freindly and attentive. It was one of our birthdays and when arriving back to the suite on the evening before, a small cake and chocolates were placed on the table in the sitting room with a happy birthday message. The hotel is in a fantastic location close to all the sites, but far enough away for peace and quite. While in the suite we could not believe how quite it was. We heard no traffic noise, other guests, lifts or staff. This was our 4th trip to New York and it will take a lot to sway us from now staying anywhere else. We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel. One word on the cost............you only get what you pay for. Try a cocktail in the bar......fantastic!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Taste of France in the Centre of New York”
Reviews.Author: TimW1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel on W44th Street for 4 nights. It's like walking in to a piece of France right in the heart of Manhattan. The hotel is within a few metres of 5th Avenue and a few minute walk to Broadway. Many of the staff spoke French before reverting to English, and as a European, I found the whole experience an escape from the hustle and bustle of Manhattan. The hotel is very well appointed and has a great bar/restaurant 'Gaby'. The room I had was very large compared to many New York hotels and was very quiet despite overlooking a busy street. The staff were very helpful, courteous and friendly. This will be my hotel of choice when I stay in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: jandlo
Reviews.Content: We had a terrific hotel experience as usual. It's our favorite NYC hotel. We had a roomy king bed room. It was clean, well appointed, and very quiet. We had no complaints about anything from check in to check out, it was seamless. We love the location, 44th St. is quiet and most everything is within walking distance. We indulged in breakfast a few mornings at the hotel restaurant, not frugal but well worth it. We hope to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “DISAPPOINTING STAY - Overall, Mixed Reviews”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel485
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel New York last weekend during a vacation with a good friend. I was very excited about my stay at this hotel since it had good reviews and having stayed at The Royalton (which I loved) across the street during my last NYC trip - I knew it would be the same level of quality and a great location. Prior to arriving, I had been in touch with the front desk to confirm various requests: two double beds, a mini fridge and early check-in. I was told that none of those requests should be a problem but that I should call the hotel the day of to confirm an early check-in. Regarding the early check-in, I even called the night before to find out about the possibility of checking in early and was told that the hotel was not at capacity and it shouldn't be a problem. The morning of my trip, I called from the airport around 8 am and was told that I would definitely be able to check in early - my request was for an 11:30 am - Noon check-in. My flight ended up being delayed because of severe fog and when my friend and I finally arrived around 1:30 pm, exhausted from an overnight flight and travel delays, we were told in a very matter-of-fact and cold manner that our room wouldn't be available until 3 pm, the normal check-in time. I explained that I had called earlier that morning and was guaranteed an early check-in and was told once again in a cold manner that our room would not be available until 3 pm. No apologies for being told otherwise, no sympathy, nothing. Just such a disappointment when you're told one thing only to find out that it won't be honored after a long day of travel. I should mention that I booked this room through Priceline and worried that I was being treated differently because of that. If that was the case, then the Sofitel should not offer their rooms on Priceline if they plan on treating those customers poorly. Even though I got a discount, I still paid quite a bit of money for the stay. Now, the WORST part of the stay happened the next morning. After sleeping in the bed, under the comforter - there's no flat sheet underneath the comforter which I think is kind of gross - I FLIPPPED BACK THE COMFORTER AND THERE WAS A MASSIVE BLOOD STAIN UNDERNEATH THE COMFORTER. I totally screamed and was so grossed out by this. I mean, I had this comforter with a blood stain on top of me while I slept. This wasn't a tiny blood stain, it was bigger than the size of a baseball and I can't believe it wasn't noticed by housekeeping. I called the front desk immediately and they simply said, we'll call housekeeping. No apologies were offered, there was no follow up after, just nothing. I was expecting them to be a bit more mortified. And I would certainly expect them to try to make the situation better by saying, what can I do to make this up to you? Can I offer you a complimentary drink at the bar or let me discount the night you slept under comforter or something along those lines. At the very least, a manager should've been alerted and called me to find out what happened. I really felt like the customer service aspect of the hotel should have kicked in after a disgusting error like that was made. I will say that housekeeping showed up right away and apologized but I was expecting more from the front desk / management because sleeping underneath a GIANT BLOOD STAIN is beyond unacceptable at a hotel like this, or any hotel for that matter. It just really ruined my stay. The other disappointment happened on my last night when I wanted to quickly shave my legs in the bathtub before going out to dinner. The tub plug was jammed / broken and I couldn't get the button / lever to work so the tub would drain water. I ultimately had to dig my nails under the plug and pull it up and the whole thing came out along with a giant hair ball. Gross. On top of that, the spray hose wouldn't work either. At that point, I was in a hurry and didn't bother to call the front desk and just used the shower. How was this broken tub not noticed when it was last cleaned? In terms of the positive aspects of my stay, whenever I spoke to the front desk on the phone, whoever I spoke to each time was very nice. Other than the person who turned me away when I tried to do an early check-in and the the person who offered no apologies when I called about the blood stain on my comforter, all of the other front desk people were pleasant to deal with. The man who actually checked me did call as soon as I got up to my room to make sure I got my mini-fridge which I really appreciated. I wish the level of service had been that attentive and concerned throughout my stay. The room itself was a good size - not huge but big enough and the bathroom was quite nice and spacious. Also, you can't beat the location in NYC in terms of convenience. Had it not been for the fact that I spent the first night sleeping underneath a blood stain and had been coldly denied the early check-in I had been promised, I would have been really happy with my stay. But these two issues, especially the blood-stained comforter just made it difficult for to enjoy my time at the Sofitel. For a hotel that charges the rates that they do, I would expect a luxury experience that would never allow those two issues to happen. I don't think I would ever pay the full rate to stay here after my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Wanderkinder
Reviews.Content: Surprisingly quiet, considering it is located b/w 5th & 6th on 44th, heart of midtown. Although the room was small (and we are accustomed to small European sized rooms), everything was very clean and comfortable. Rain shower could use more pressure and stall itself was about 4'x4'. The only thing to be aware of is that your reservation requests may need follow up. Our room was supposed to be b/w the 15th & 29th floors, w/ no connecting doors and away from the elevators, but upon check-in, they tried to put us in a 12th floor room, which was located near elevators. When we made a comment about the size of the room, the staff was quick to offer us similar rooms with different layouts that might feel larger.

Reviews.Title: “Not Our Usual Sofitel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We love the Sofitel brand; it has been our hotel chain of choice for several years, particularly because their hotels are a great value. That is, you pay a bit more, but you get a great place to stay. Unfortunately, beyond the great service and beautiful lobby of the Sofitel on West 44th in Manhattan, this particular Sofitel is about as special as a descent motel off the interstate in your town. It simply isn't worth the price. The place is worn; the common areas beyond the lobby (e.g. the elevators, hallways) needed cleaning and vacuuming; spent room service trays littered our hallway for hours; the bed's mattress was well beyond its prime time; and while the room itself was clean, it was nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of Everything!”
Reviews.Author: Mulla
Reviews.Content: Been there for three nights in a deluxe room, the room was small but adequate and nicely furnished. We had a room facing the GE Building, nice view. The room was very quite and well sound proofed. It was clean as well the bathroom which had a shower cubical and a small bath tub, it had L'Occitane bath products. The location was perfect, a mere three mins walk to Times Square, another 2 mins to Fifth Avenue. There were many restaurants nearby. There were three complimentary Internet stations in the lobby with a printer which we used, an added benefit. The turn down service was fine and timely with Evian water at beside.

Reviews.Title: “Fine place, great location”
Reviews.Author: Campanu
Reviews.Content: New York has so many options that it is always hard to decide where to stay within a range of prices. The Sofitel is just steps from my office, which means also steps from the 5th Avenue, Times Square, Central Park, the Chrysler building, the Empire State building... honestly, location is fantastic. The hotel feels quite small, actually. I have no idea how many rooms they have, but feels tiny, with a small entrance, a small restaurant, a tiny lobby and more tiny corridors in the floors. My room was OK, with a very comfortable bed, not impressive furniture, a good shower with excelent pressure and all nicely appointed. Unfortunately, soundproofing is not the top quality of the rooms, and in the morning I could hear a very disgusting noise from my neighbor, who seemed to be sick just when waking up. I stayed there four nights. Rooms was cleaned to perfect standards. Breakfast was not buffet and the tables were small, so not easy to set up a breakfast for 4 or 5 people. Still, products of top quality, delicious croissants, all very French. Hoewever, the service was not relaxing at all, making the start of a business day already a business day. People on holiday may feel that too. Had lunch one time, very nice, Sofitel style. Also had some drinks, bar looks nice and trendy. Concierge was helpful, as so were the bellboys. Reception was helpful, although it took a while to do a check-out of the three rooms I was paying for. All in all, not a remarkable stay as that was not what I was looking for, but all perfect and functional at usual NYC prices.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option in NY”
Reviews.Author: GuilhermeFurlan Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Before I have gone to NY I had read a lot of hotel's reviews and I was a little worried because a lot of hotels are expensive, well localized, but since they are old the comments were not so good. Sofitel NY is a very good option to Stay in Manhattan. I totally recomend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mrsm59
Reviews.Content: We chose the Sofitel for our 25th anniversary celebration and could not have been more pleased. From booking to checkout (and beyond), everything was perfect. When I called to book, I explained that it was our anniversary, and they made note of our requests. Because we were staying for several nights, they automatically upgraded us to a suite. Upon arrival, though, they gave us an even better suite with a beautiful private terrace overlooking the city. Check-in was quick (they actually had a room available for us at 11:00 a.m.!) and pleasant. The hotel lobby itself was lovely, with stunning floral designs. Our suite was wonderful and had all the amenities we could ask for. Rooms aren't huge, but that is the norm for NY. Staying for four nights, it was a pleasure to have the second room to relax in. Nightly turndown (which we did not use) also included two bottles of water (which we gladly accepted.) On our first night there, we returned from dinner to find a lovely dessert with Happy Anniversary spelled out in chocolate - such a nice treat! The location was outstanding, and we found that we were able to walk to many of the places we wanted to see. When we couldn't, the hotel doormen quickly found us taxis and cars. There were plenty of restaurants nearby; 5th Avenue shopping, Times Square, the Empire State Building, St. Patrick's Cathedral, Central Park and Rockefeller Plaza were all within reasonable walking distance. When it was time to leave, the doorman found us a very pleasant SUV driver for only a few dollars more than a cab to return to the airport. We had a great ride there, but discovered to our horror as we were checking in at the airport that my husband had forgotten his briefcase with our two computers in the car. In a panic, I called the hotel concierge and he quickly connected me with the doorman. The doorman clarified which driver we had used, took my number, and called me back very shortly. He had reached the driver and the driver said he would turn around and come back to the airport for us. Within 15 minutes, he was back, saving our trip from disaster, and refusing to take a tip for his trouble! This was a wonderful choice for a hotel for us. It wasn't cheap, but good hotels in Manhattan aren't. The hotel, location, and staff were all simply terrific!

Reviews.Title: “Does not live up to its reputation”
Reviews.Author: Tyger41
Reviews.Content: This is a luxurious hotel, with an imposing lobby and pleasant guest rooms. The front desk staff is helpful and efficient. However, some of the "suites" for which one pays extra are really imaginative arrangements of odd-shaped space. Telephone service is slow and inefficient, so that during our stay callers who tried to reach us were misdirected and in one case disconnected. The in-house restaurant will serve you a bagel with smoked salmon for breakfast for about $25, but 20 yards along 44th street the same breakfast costs $10.50. There are only a few French-speaking staff members, so the ambiance is not that of a French hotel. I greeted staff politely in French, as one would in a French hotel, and got blank looks. So this is a nice property, but one can do better at these prices. Try one of the Kimpton hotels, for example.

Reviews.Title: “very nice and in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jeans-r-us
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel nice rooms very large reception/lobby its tough to fault this hotel would i go back it would be a big YES

Reviews.Title: “As Good As It Gets”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times (over fifty) on business, and have never had a bad experience. If you have a special request and plan ahead, they always do the best they possibly can. In my opinion, the Sofitel New York is as good as it gets...

Reviews.Title: “My favorite in NYC”
Reviews.Author: cdelucia
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel... what an elite hotel should be. Luxury rooms, fantastic restaurant, and top-notch service. Great value for a top-flight NYC hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTraveler022
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Sofitel on our trip to NYC. Our first criteria was to find a hotel with no bedbug report and a reputation for cleanliness. We enjoyed our stay at Sofitel. Absolutely no trace of bedbugs whatsoever and the room was generally spotless. There was a small tear in the wallpaper in the bathroom but nothing that bothered us. The rooms are somewhat pricey but for a hotel of that caliber right next to Times Square, it seemed reasonable. The rooms were quiet and the beds were extremely comfortable, however, some feathers from my comforter were poking through the fabric and sort of stinging me. My friend didn't have that problem­. Unlike other guests who commented here, we found the service excellent. Polite and helpful. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, comfortable rooms (though no tea or coffee facility, and no scissors or knife). Table service at the Gaby bar / restaurant however is very disappointing (very slow and inattentive).

Reviews.Title: “First Time in NYC Loved it”
Reviews.Author: CraigW5456
Reviews.Content: Had booked Sofitel for 2 stays during our first visit to New York and on both occasions found the hotel excellent. Check-in seamless and bags promptly delivered. Room larger than most and the views over the city were sensational. Concierge services, headed by Renee, were most helpful and we were guided to some wonderful places to eat and given clear and concise instructions on using the subway and getting around on foot. The hotel is in a great spot..far enough from the madding crowds, but close enough to all the attractions we wanted to see. The Sofitel is excellent value, and indeed sets a standard to which some other hotels we have stayed in, could only aspire.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally Located But Can Use Improvement”
Reviews.Author: jazzgirlfromla
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Sofitel because it's centrally located to Times Square, the theatre district and there are great restaurants within walking distance or by transportation. The staff is wonderful, very friendly and they greet you in French. My past experiences with the Sofitel has been very good especially this past summer. However, I visited NYC recently I was not impressed by my room. Frankly, the rooms could be much cleaner. Our rooms were a bit dusty and the edges of the wall can use some deep cleaning. The carpet had a stain on it and the sheets felt very "prickly" to me which made it difficult to sleep. For the high price we pay, a good overall paint job throughout the hotel and a deep cleaning throughout the rooms, suites and hallways would change my rating to "very good", but for now I will leave it as average. I commend the staff for being wonderful to their guest. Additionally, I enjoyed the breakfast at their restaurant within the hotel. However, I am a perfectionist and details are important to me when I stay at a hotel. I judge the hotel experience first and foremost by the appearance - clean and attention to detail. For my stay in October, I give the Sofitel an "average" rating.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: TheWestCountryNomad
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of weeks ago for two nights on business. Excellent staff, very comfortable room and a good gymn. Restaurant was fine with a nice menu. The location is briilliant on 44th and close to 5th Avenue. Pricey though - both rooms and restaurant. If you want to treat yourself stay here.

Reviews.Title: “First time visitor to a Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: A V
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many hotels over the years in NYC. Although this property is overpriced it offered many quality things. The food is wonderful for a hotel and is in a wonderful location. The staff was very friendly but also very professional. The bed and linens were very nice. Great French touches throughout. I expected more done with the decor which was just average. If you could get this for a better price if would be a nice change of pace for the usual NYC properties.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tylia W
Reviews.Content: If it's space you want you won't be disappointed. NY hotels are definitely not known for the space, this hotel however is full of space. My husband and I enjoyed our stay at the Sofitel. We would definitely stay here again. If you stay here first you won't want to stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jskiba55
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in July 2011 with my partner. The hotel is located less than 5 minute walk from Times Square. It was also a very short walk to Fifth Avenue and Grand Central. Location was perfect, especially for first timers to New York. At the time of our stay New York was experiencing a record heat wave and returning to the hotel was perfect after a long day out. We stayed in a Luxury room. It was bigger than what I expected from a New York hotel room. We had ample space. The room was spotlessly clean, had all the little luxuries that make the stay easier and the bed were very comfortable (all Sofitels have great beds). Turn down service occured every night and the macaroons left were delicious and a great treat after a long day exploring the city. We arrive after a flight from LA and check in was very smooth and we were taken care of, especially after the man at reception (wish I could remember his name) found out I was an A-Club member which was a nice touch. I mentioned that I needed internet access because I had to pick university subjects and a late time in the night due to the time difference with Sydney. He directed me to where the computers are in the lobby but also gave me a complimentary voucher for in room broadband for 24 hours which was great service. The concierge gave us recommendations for good restaurants and also helped with booking one as we were seeing a show. Very helpful. One was French (can't remember name) and the other was Kellari Taverna next door. Both were great but Kellari was fantastic. Overall the hotel was fantastic. I couldn't find any faults. The hotel is a good choice for the location alone if you are a first timer to NYC or even if you just want the be close to all the tourist spots. Amazing hotel in the most amazing city I have ver visted. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: rollingtrolley
Reviews.Content: Went to NYC with family for a week, kids 11 and 14, their first trip, my fifth. Sofitel was really a great hotel in many ways, but first and foremost it is the great location that made us happy. It is close to Times Square, but not too close, KWIM, and just around the corner to 5th Avenue and Madison. Lots of attractions are a short walk away and also the Grand Terminal. We were very happy with the 18th floor corner combo of a junior suite and a superior room - the room combo had it's own entrance and hallway which made it even roomier. Rooms were very nice with no wear and tidy/clean. Great beds too, roomy bathrooms with shower + bath and Hermès/L'Occitane bath products. Friendly staff, helpful when needed. Will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: SaffronWaldenThomas
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, quiet, room, excellent thoughtful service and always with a smile. The use of French, even ot a largely Anglophone audience, was a clever touch.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights-------perfect location, public spaces were beautiful. I wish the price had been a little lower, but it is high season in NYC right now. We went to the bar for a cocktail. Service was a little slow.

Reviews.Title: “Need a lesson on people with disabilities”
Reviews.Author: mtbkrdon
Reviews.Content: Reserved room through Priceline name your price and got room for 275.00/night which by their web site price I thought I did well. Awesome location and great room, after some complaining. They first gave me a ADA approved room with handicapped shower. They did change me after a complaint but said I would have to wait to get another Room was worth the wait. Everything in the room made u realize why it is a four star.

Reviews.Title: “New York New York!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Just spent a fabulous few days in New York with my son. I have stayed in Sofitel in New York before and yet again had a very enjoyable stay. The staff are very welcoming and helpful. Location great for shopping, theatre and all main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “For me the most cost effective hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: Redrated
Reviews.Content: Most of us have some budget we work around for holidays. If your budget is unlimited read no further and stay at either the plaza, mandarin oriental or four seasons. I wanted to pay no more than $450 per night and be in the best midtown 4* or 5* hotel preferably between 50th and 59th street (i.e the most upmarket bit) I therefore read reviews on all 4* hotels in this location (over 50) and all the 5* hotels in NY and then drew up a shortlist and searched for best prices with both hotel search engines and visiting the hotel websites. Firstly 5*s were all above budget in this location. Except a couple which had terrible reviews including some with bed bugs! The Andaz down on wall street was within budget and looked nice but as a tourist do you really want to be on wall street? In an ideal world wouldn't we all stay at the Plaza/ the Mandarin Oriental or the four seasons?? The prices for these were way over budget though. Having therefore ruled out the 5*s this left the 4*s of which there are lots. Reviewing all the 4*s between 50th and 59th street although most were within budget the hotels by and large looked really quite shabby with small rooms and again sometimes bed bugs. I couldnt bring myself to want to stay in any of them. I therefore widened my search to include 40th to 59th street. At last some hotels which looked lovely, had good reviews and were affordable. The Sofitel for me was top of the pile. I loved the decor of this hotel and certainly would not describe the rooms as bland. Lots of beautiful woods in the rooms, marble bathrooms with back lit mirrors, separate shower and bath, wonderful soft beds with lovely cotton sheets, complimentary L'Occitane toiletaries, Great views, large flat screen tv with loads of channels (not that you will have time to use it in NY), Bose sound system with mp3 connector, mirrored wall next to the bed :) . The hotel was very clean and the staff pleasant and helpful. The hotel has a great location on 44th street between 5th and 6th avenues. I.e close to everything but in a quiet side street. 10-15 mins walk to central park. 5 mins walk to time square/ Broadway. 1 min walk to 5th avenue and all the best shops. The public areas of the hotel are lovely too. Cant really fault it. The price was around $410/night as the hotel website was doing 4 nights for the price of 3 in Oct 2011. I cant comment on the food as we ate out every night. With so many great restaurants in NY why would you eat at the hotel? DB bistro is just a few doors up if you want to try NYs most expensive burger! Overall a great hotel at this price point and for me the best value in New York. Would I stay here again definitely, unless their prices increase or my budget becomes unlimited!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: AdventureLive
Reviews.Content: This is very clean and comfortable five star hotel. Its short walk to central park, shopping, time square. There are plenty of places close by to grab a quick meal. Great for business or holiday travel. Will stay here next time in NY, just so convient to everything. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in the best NYC district”
Reviews.Author: JFR1Montreal
Reviews.Content: It was our second time at this hotel. This hotel is fully booked all the time...so we tried other places in the theatre disctrict but wanted to head back to this nice hotel. The rooms are bigger than the typical NYC hotel room. If you want a trendy boutique hotel with flashy people...this is not the place. If you want confortable rooms, quiet lobby, european service and great attentions: this is the place. The bathrooms are superb with lots of place and l'Occitane de Provence products. The best thing of this hotel is the location...and the Sofitel standards.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfy sightseeing base”
Reviews.Author: 665kate
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for seven nights whilst visiting NY in a deluxe room. The room was bigger than expected with a large desk, small breakfast table, gorgeous marble bathroom w separate bath and shower, large wardrobes and in room safe. The room was spotless and the beds comfortable. We couldn't hear any noise from the street (staying on level 3) or from our neighbours - one of the best sleeps of our trip. Housekeeping folded our clothes and whenever we left they appeared and tidied our room :) Loccitaine amentities, complimentary wine and chocolates, fresh flowers and evening turndown service are good. Doormen where helpful. We also used the gym a few times. Only down side was concierge was quite rude and didn't think we were staying in the hotel as we are quite young. We also ate elsewhere for breakfast as the prices were outrageous - almost equivalent to dinner at the sofitel. Easy walking distance to times square, central park, rockfeller, 5th ave shopping etc as others have mentioned. The restaurant was helpful and organised a picnic and car for us to see Battery Park and the Brooklyn Bridge (after it was all too hard for concierge or reception). Would definitely stay here again as rooms were large, clean and we had an excellent nights sleep and enough room to unpack all our clothes etc (and any additional shopping we acquired).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Broadway shows”
Reviews.Author: CharlesA
Reviews.Content: An outstanding visit to New York. Room was larger than most in Manhattan, and service was great - from doorman to concierge to front desk and maids. Will return here - we like this hotel the BEST from the 10 or so we have tried in Manhattan, and had just a wonderful experience. Good job, Sofitel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Above average accommodations.”
Reviews.Author: shafter1207
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a nice place to stay that is convenient, Sofitel is it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lobby great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The lobby and bar areas are beautifully designed and welcoming. Helpful and welcoming staff. Top notch in all areas, A little touch of the continent in the middle of New York. I have already recommended this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, efficient and friendly”
Reviews.Author: GeoffTravels
Reviews.Content: Great property, well run, staff very amiable (may be some improvements can be done at the Concierge desk though) and efficient. on the room side, they are comfortable, no surprise but all you need is there and they are in good condition, may be the bathroom could be refreshed a bit but really it's being picky. The Lobby has a great look and feel, nice ambiance, nice design and well maintained. The only downturn would be food quality at the room-service. Great service again but food was really so so ...

Reviews.Title: “The best place in town - Don't even know how to describe it!”
Reviews.Author: Catalina E
Reviews.Content: Every day I went out to know the city and when I felt tired I just wanted to go back to the hotel. I knew everything was going to be perfect: nice smile at the entrance, clean room, nice bathroom, flowers, the best room service and a perfect bed! When you visit a city for the first time you need a place to stay that makes you feel like home, that's exactly what I felt. I spent my entire last day at the hotel, I didn't want to leave - Just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: Suman514
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night on Labour Day weekend. Our one night was wonderful and would definitely recommend it. Excellent location - walking distance to Times Square and Central Park. Check-in was very efficient, and the rooms were bigger than expected and plush. Toiletries were by l'Occitaine. Big bathroom with a shower and a tub. My favorite part of the hotel was the lobby. Wonderfully done, and a nice oasis from the busy streets of New York. Other than the absent doorman/busboy service when we arrived (arond 11pm), our stay was wonderful. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location...”
Reviews.Author: CatherineMulkern
Reviews.Content: Great hotel couldn't fault it rooms beautiful beds so comfy! breakfast a little expensive, but worth it! Nothing was a problem, 2 mins walk from Times sq without being in the middle of the madness!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but bland... and slow”
Reviews.Author: HYNsDad
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine. Not much more to add. Other than the lobby décor and the greeting in French by the staff, the hotel is just bland, with special note to the rooms which were exceptionally devoid of any style or flavor. One point to note was the speed of service. The staff was very friendly, opening with a joyous greeting in French, but then things took far longer then they should – 2 hours past the promised time for a room to be ready, half an hour for a piece of luggage to arrive in the room and 3 phone calls to have a suit picked up for dry cleaning. Other than the service sluggishness there was nothing to complain, but also no reason to consider it for the next NY visit. I expected more of this stay, in part based on a recent stay at the Sofitel St James in London – but there is no comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and very well run”
Reviews.Author: andymardon
Reviews.Content: You might pay a few dollars more than some other hotels of similar class to stay here, but will save it in taxi costs as the location is perfect. Imagine a circle of popular attractions with Central park to the north, fifth avenue and Grand Central to the east, Empire State Building to the South and Times Square to the West. This hotel is right in the middle of that circle, each within a few blocks walking distance. We stayed in a standard room and it was sufficiently spacious by New York City standards with a very comfortable bed. Also, it was remarkably quiet in the room and you cannot hear the distinctive sirens and horns from outside. We were on a leisure trip but I could imagine this being perfect for business when you need a good nights sleep! Hotel staff were all very freindly and efficient. We needed a screwdriver to fix my girlfriends hair straighteners and someone was at the door within a few minutes of calling down to assist. Free internet and printing facilities in the lobby was a nice touch that makes you feel like the hotel is not trying to fleece you for every last cent. Overall, you get the feeling that the hotel is very well run and if you are doing the touristy things you be pleased you booked this for its location, especially when you realise how big manhattan is and how expensive short taxi journeys can be! Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jencolem
Reviews.Content: Boy was I in for a surprise at this hotel! Everything was perfect! The staff was great and went out of their way to make our stay wonderful. The room was great. Pretty spacious by NY standards. The bathroom was nice. Didn't eat in the restaurant so can't comment on that. The hotel is in the perfect location and a short walk to Time Square. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: OMG_11
Reviews.Content: Guided to this hotel by the high percentage of positive reports on TripAdvisor. I was not disappointed. Quality, comfort and attention to detail, No need to look further it is the Sofitel from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer389
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at Sofitel. We were very pleased! The room was very spacious for New York and the bathroom was fabulous. As other reviewers had mentioned, the room was very quiet, so we slept very well. The staff was very helpful and polite. The location was perfect and only a short walk to all the major attractions. We would certainly stay at Sofitel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: baloney56
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel for 5 nights while exploring NYC. The accommodations were lovely and service was wonderful. The room was soundproof so we never heard any of the other guests and we were on the 18th floor so there was no noise from outside. It's a quick walk to Grand Central Terminal, Times Square, Central Park and Empire State Building. The free bottled water every day was a nice touch since you really need to hydrate while doing all that walking. I'd go back without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “I have many happy memories of this place”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_30s
Reviews.Content: I have been staying in the Sofitel in Midtown now for many years. It is a great hotel with an excellent staff, a very good restaurant, good room service, proximity to touristy things, and to businessy things, and to many of the nicer neighbourhoods of New York (if you're up for a little walking). Yes, it's close to Times Square and people sometimes get a little huffy about the tourists, but get over it! This hotel is also close to many very good restaurants and is within walking distance to Central Park, the Rockefeller Center, the Apple Store, Broadway, you name it! Some of my favourite features of the Sofitel: 1) The staff: The people who work here are great and they take their jobs very seriously. I actually only go to this hotel every couple of months or less, but the staff remember me - and it's not just because my name shows up on their computer. I once had one of the staff chase me out of the hotel after I left my wallet at the check-in desk and we've been joking about it ever since. They will also usually try to upgrade you if they can. It helps if you're a member of the Sofitel 'A Club' for which it is easy to sign up. No matter what I ask for, they always do everything they can to help. The doorman even remembers guests. I have, many times, exited a cab from JFK to have the Sofitel doorman tell me "Welcome back, sir", even when I haven't been back in awhile. 2) The food, both in the hotel restaurant as well as the room service, not to mention the great restaurants in the proximity. If you want decent, cheap food, there is a good deli across 45th Street, and there's a Chipolte nearby as well. 3) All of the interesting things to see and learn about in the immediate area, eg, Grand Central Station, the various university clubs and other clubs (they're not *that* exclusive and most will give you a free tour if you ask), and a myriad of other historical things to see and do in the area. It's worth buying a guidebook. 4) The ability to get literally anything you want at any time of the day or night in this part of New York (not unique to the Sofitel but nevertheless. . .). 5) The rooms and the views: If you're into architecture, the views obviously vary but you can get excellent views of the Chrysler Building, the Rockefeller Center, Grand Central / MetLife Building, and some of the classic 'guilded age' and art-deco buildings of New York. Also, if you want to pay for a more expensive room or get upgraded, the suites are quite sizable and some have very good urban views. One recommendation with this hotel: Due to the nature of the location, a one-way cross street, if you need to get somewhere, book a car; try to avoid taking a taxi. It can be difficult to get a taxi from the hotel, even with the help of the doorman. They will do everything they can to help you but it can take up to 15 minutes sometimes and that can make a big difference if you're trying to get to the airport. Otherwise, I've no complaints. This is excellent value for money. I have stayed here and at the Iroquois next door which is cheaper for a reason. Spend the extra $100 and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Expensive”
Reviews.Author: cat0407
Reviews.Content: Loved the room, loved the location...Very expensive but New York is...The restaurant is ridiculousy priced and I was extremely upset to see that frois gras was on the menu...This is pure torture of geese...About time restaurants started to think about what they serve and what is humane... No coffee or tea facilities in room is a minus....you could go to the restaurant to make a coffee but not all day as these facilities were taken away after breakfast, dinner etc...And you have to ask for a tea bag and water.. Overall, I did love our stay but it is very pricey like I have said..The staff are great but I do believe there are better options if you are prepared to do the ground work....

Reviews.Title: “Great Option Near Broadway”
Reviews.Author: TravelLover23456
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel NYC is a great option for anyone looking to stay in midtown. To me, this Sofitel straddles the 4-star and 5-star categories, but is almost always priced more like its 4-star competition in the general vicinity of Times Square, and it's the nicest of the 4-stars I've tried in that area. Aside from an issue or two with the concierge, the staff is typically warm, helpful and welcoming. In making the online reservation, I threw in -- for whatever it was worth -- that we were in NYC this time for my partner's birthday. The front desk extended birthday wishes when we arrived, and then on our first night, we returned to the room to find a complimentary dessert with Happy Birthday written in chocolate. Small touches that I've never seen in any of the other 4-stars near Broadway. The rooms are clean and spacious (for NYC), and if you want midtown, the location is ideal. Finally, two things I pretty much never notice or mention in a review: The beds and pillows are phenomenal and the bathroom toiletries are Hermes. There is no spa on the property, but there is a clean and reasonably well-equipped work out room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: tmoreira20
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 days and 5 nights at the Sofitel New York beginning of September, at the most convenient central location in Manhattan (near Bryant Park and Times Square) for either visiting, shopping and going out in the evening (for dinner and to Broadway shows). The hotel decoration is very refined, with the most beautiful flower arrangements at the lobbies. The room was excellent with the best bed (mattress and pillows) in the entire world - My Bed – it is like sleeping over a soft, comfortable cloud. The bar/restaurant had a good choice of snacks, a lively ambiance and good service. The Concierge was very helpful and offered very good suggestions of tours and restaurants. I had a great stay at a luxury hotel which is really worth the price you pay and lives to its reputation, that I definitely recommend

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: linzif
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Royalton 3 weeks before this trip and when there had spotted this hotel straight accross the road. So, gave it a try. I preferred this greatly over The Royalton. The Sofitel is elegant, clean, bright and oozes quality. The room was an excellent size (no view we were at the back, but it was quiet) plently of room and superbly appointed. The bathroom was gorgeous and also a superb size. Concierge was knowledgable and helpful, as you would expect from this role, but don't always get. I love the location of 44th street, it works for me and there's a great local bakery/coffee shop straight over the street. I am returning here in November that's how much I like it!

Reviews.Title: “Always stay there”
Reviews.Author: Belle69Tumwater_WA
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Sofitel New York 6 times. I have always been completely satisfied with the accommodations and the service every time. It is a perfect location next to Time Square but quiet. You can walk to shows and restaurants easily. The beds are very comfortable, and it has a large bathroom with tub and free standing glass shower. I always feel pampered.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel NY hotel during UN & Presidential chaos”
Reviews.Author: Papa070
Reviews.Content: Well-located, lovely hotel, beautiful lobby and public areas. The rooms are on the small size with queen beds, but very nice bathroom. W. 44th St is interesting, with many hotels, clubs and restaurants, and right in between 5th Avenue shopping and sightseeing, and 6th Avenue with more commercial and near the theatre district. The bar, lounge and restaurant (Gaby) is a french brasserie type and nice, food not great but good, with excellent wine selections. Hotel is also convenient to Grand Central Station, NY Public Library, and Rockefeller Center.

Reviews.Title: “We wouldn't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Melanie A
Reviews.Content: This was 'hands down' our favourite hotel during our honeymoon in the USA. It is in a great spot and very close to Times Square. The room was larger than we had expected and the bathroom was decadent with a gorgeously large shower and bath... much needed after pounding the pavement day after day! Brilliant service and the house keeping staff came to make up our room a few times a day and brought us small bottles of water in the evening (a lovely touch). There were three computers with free internet available for guests in the lobby which was handy for keeping in touch with family and friends back home. We wouldn't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “SOFITEL NEW YORK TAKES ON IRENE”
Reviews.Author: TMCNEWS
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Sofitel numerous times in the past and have written reviews about the wonderful rooms and phenomenal Staff. I recently visited NYC with some friends to see a show and to have a dinner at Benjamin Steakhouse on E 41st Street. All three of us were also celebrating birthdays in September so that was our excuse to go. Little did we know heading into the City from Ohio that we would be there to witness history with Hurricane Irene visiting at the same time. The entire Staff and Management were completely up to date with all of the latest news on the location of the Hurricane and all of the precautions guests needed to take. A letter from the General Manager was placed in all of the rooms detailing what would happen if Irene took a direct hit on the City and where guests could go (2nd floor ballroom area). Coming and going from the hotel the management team, including the head of security, always had a presence in public areas to help answer guest’s questions. With the lower part of Manhattan and the mass transit closing in the afternoon on Saturday Staff members were assisting guests with how to get around town. They were also helping guests chose alternate destinations for dinners and entertainment. I have always found Sofitel a comfortable place to stay and have always appreciated the fact that the property is small enough for the staff to get to know you. This last trip also helps prove how concerned they are with the safety of their guests. Sofitel truly stepped up during what could have been a bad situation and was ready, another sign that this is THE hotel to book when going to NYC. The dinner at Benjamin Steakhouse was also perfect – as always.

Reviews.Title: “very smart”
Reviews.Author: SbrLondon_England
Reviews.Content: had a 4 night stay here. Room very comfy, staff helpful and polite, restaurant excellent. My one grumble though, for a high end hotel that has everything you could possibly need, it lacks the one thing that most people want, and thats coffee/tea making facilities..

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Balmoral99
Reviews.Content: One of the most amazing hotels in New York! Location is perfect, staff - very friendly, room, beds very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Between 5th Ave and Times Square”
Reviews.Author: spectatrice
Reviews.Content: Who wouldn't want to be there, this has been made famous now for the indiscreet incident with Dominique but the hotel is the flagship in the states of french taste and style and attention to it's guests. My choice when I stay in Paris too where they have about 12 each sublimely decorated by designers. Understood each hotel has a celebrated chef in their restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “A good night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: Hop3535
Reviews.Content: A good hotel close to everything but the best aspect was it is quiet, great after a long flight from Melbourne. The room had everything one needs.

Reviews.Title: “Loved staying at Sofitel New York”
Reviews.Author: redcarnations208
Reviews.Content: Great location on a quiet street. Staff and hotel made our stay welcomed and extremely pleasant. Will want to stay here in the future. We had room service several times and all delicious. Beds are soft and comfortable; bathroom luxurious replete with amenities and soft bathrobes. Needless to say for $250/night in February, well worth our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Chau-Fan
Reviews.Content: During our visit we lost our passports, credit cards, etc. The hotel concierge staff was extraordinary helpful. Also was the people at the front desk. A great hotel with excellent service. Among the best in NYC. I strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Port in a Storm”
Reviews.Author: primorski Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We arrived in New York only to learn that Hurricane Irene was due to hit NY the next day. The Sofitel proved to be a safe, hospitable and decidedly comfortable place in which to hunker down. In this time of potential crisis the staff remained professional and calm and services were maintained. Bar and restaurant were good, but pricey (especially the charge for the continental breakfast on the morning of Irene arriving - felt like we were being exploited through the circumstances we found ourselves in). Rooms very good with high quality fittings although smaller in size than expected. Well-located hotel close to the heart of NY. All in all, high quality accommodation provided with class and poise with a distinctively Gallic flavor and flair.

Reviews.Title: “We love Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: Perch_24
Reviews.Content: Family trip to New York from Canada - my wife and I, and two young teenage daughters. Hotel is in the perfect place for a family trip, or business (one of my staff always stays there when in NYC and now I will too). In the Theater District, 1/2 block from shopping on 5th Avenue, short walk to Times Square, very close to subway. On a relatively quiet street. We were on a family trip in Europe in the spring and Sofitels became our preferred hotel. They offer consistent service, great locations (usually next to an Embassy or neighborhood of that caliber - in NYC next to Harvard Club. Anyway, concierge was excellent with referrals (and stay away from advice) for restaurants for my daughter's birthday dinner. Rooms were very very nice - but not in a way that is "too much" that would make you feel like you're paying for what you don't need. We love Sofitel - classy but feels like home.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Steve S
Reviews.Content: What can i say Sofitel at its best, close to Times square and public transport, for a good coffee head over to Gregory's its just across the road, or for a quick snack head towards Broadway and look out for a pizza place called Patezia Perfect Pizza (W 46th Street) small place

Reviews.Title: “Great location, overpriced hotel”
Reviews.Author: My-voice-oz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for over a week. The location is great, central to all the highlights of NYC for those visiting first time. The hotel is well maintained, however, a little expensive for what it's worth. There are many other hotels who provide similar level of hospitality and facility for less. We were very happy with the hotel and the beds were very comfortable. the food at the restaurant was delicious, however, very pricey for NYC. A few buildings away, there's a fantastic restaurant called Kellari. Must visit there, don't eat at the hotel. Breakfast was ok but very very expensive for a continental breakfast we paid $20 plus taxes (each). We got percolator coffee, juice, butter, jam and a few dry pastries and a tiny sample of fruits. Very ordinary breakfast. Across the road from the hotel, there's Gregory cafe that serves good coffee and delicious pastries, sandwiches and fresh yoghurt options. Even though we were happy with the hotel's location and facilities, we will not stay here again. For the price we paid, we should have had a more luxurious facilities. Also, the hotel is full of French visitors, which is fine, however, drop the French accent, it's a little irritating when you're in NYC. It's not Paris here!!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in busy New York”
Reviews.Author: Travel5alot
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the lobby we were warmly greeted by one of the staff who led us to the front desk where the extremely professional staff checked us in ever so efficiently. We splurged a little and stayed in a suite which was beautiful! The bathroom was luxurious, the linen and towels were also first class. During our stay all of our interactions and observations of the staff show just how good this hotel is. A porter ran quite a way down the road to hail a taxi for us. I also noticed them carrying bags for people in the rain down to 5th avenue when the street was closed due to a parade. The peacefulness and serenity of the hotel also helped us to relax after a hectic day in New York City. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Plush and comfortable if a little soulless”
Reviews.Author: Clarinda_Vine
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in February 2011. As this was our first trip to New York we wanted to stay somewhere central and this definitely fits that bill - the location is excellent and is within walking distance to all mid-town shopping and attractions, and only 15/20 min walk from the Lincoln Centre. Broadway subway is also only 5 mins walk. We stayed on a room only basis and I am pleased we did as the breakfasts were very expensive, There is a coffee shop opposite the hotel that is a much cheaper option, plus a diner next door. The room was reasonably spacious and very quiet for its location. The bed was comfortable and clean, and the bathroom good with a powerful shower. The room was well cleaned and the whole hotel was well presented with lots of fresh flowers. There is a small room off the lobby where you can use the computers and internet. We used room service once and while prompt I did not think the food was great in terms of quality, although it was not worse than that found in comparable hotels. There is a lovely Greek restaurant almost next door to the hotel which we would highly recommend. The staff that we had contact with were all very helpful and polite with most speaking French and English. However, although quite plush in its design I personally felt that the hotel was a little soulless and not as aesthetically pleasing as other Sofitels, such as those in Brussels. However, in terms of location, especially for a first time trip, I think this hotel represents reasonable value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved New York and the Sofitel! Damn you Irene!”
Reviews.Author: TroySandi
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in New York! This was our first time to "The Big Apple", what an incredible city! So much to do, so little time. We were supposed to have a week in New York but unfortunately we were hit with some incredibly poor luck... we arrived on August 22, August 23rd we were standing in line for our Letterman tickets and found out the East Coast just experienced an earthquake which was apparently felt in New York City (we never felt a thing). Upon returning to the Sofitel (after the Letterman Show) we found out that Hurricane Irene was bearing down on the East Coast and a significant threat to the North East Coast and New York City! I re-booked our flights to leave a day before the storm was to arrive. So we had to leave 2.5 days earlier than intended. I prepaid for this entire trip via Expedia, I hope between the Sofitel and Expedia they will reimburse me for the 2 nights we were unable to stay. Our entire stay at the Sofitel was nothing but positive! Our reservation was for a queen room on an upper floor (18th floor +), when we checked in we were pleasantly surprised to hear that we had been upgraded from a queen to a king room but since we had checked in late there wasn't a king available on an upper floor. We were checked into a room on the 12th floor and advised we would be moved to a higher floor the following day. When we arrived to our room there was classical music playing, we also had received the daily turn down service. There was also a couple tasty French pastries and high end bottled water. The room was very clean and quiet. The beds and pillows were comfortable. The TV was HD and the clock/radio was Bose. The soap, shampoo and conditioner were of high quality. Complimentary robe and slippers. My only complaint is I would have liked more light in the bathroom. The following day we packed our bags and the bellman moved them to our new king room on a higher floor (23rd floor) while we were out enjoying New York. The entire staff at the Sofitel were very friendly, greeting us with smiles and "Bonjour", "Bonsoir" each time we went through the lobby. The location was perfect, close enough to Times Square but far away enough to be out of the chaos. Truly enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend the Sofitel if it is in your price range. If you are in New York for vacation, check out the New York Pass... depending on what you are interested in, you could potentially save you a significant amount of money. I would also suggest the hop-on/hop off bus tours, however, I would not use City Sights NY but rather the Gray Line. With the New York Pass you get a free 3 hour cruise around Manhattan, you get the best views of the Statue of Liberty. Times Square, obviously a definite must-see... the pulse of Manhattan. Empire State Building... get there early, we got there when it first opened and did not have to wait in any long lines and it was not very busy at up at the observatory. Brooklyn Bridge... walk across it, only takes 25 minutes and you get some fantastic views and photo opportunities. Central Park... grab a sandwich at one of the nearby delis, go into the park to enjoy this magnificent park. There is so much else to see but that should get you started. ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: klingsizen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel for 3 nights and we were extremely pleased with our experience. The rooms were very nicely appointed and the bathroom was spacious with separate shower and tub. The location was perfect right off of 5th Ave. and right down the street from the Theatre district. The concierge was very helpful with restaurants and shows. We were thrilled with all of his recommendations. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rubychick
Reviews.Content: My husband and I take an annual trip to Manhattan in the summer. We have stayed at The Paramount (rooms are way too small for similar price range if not more), Club Quarters (another great hotel), and so far none gave compared to Sofitel. The bathrooms are gorgeous and big as well as the room. The only thing I did not like is the bed only has a duvet with no top sheet and I kept finding myself (both times we stayed there) getting hot then cold then hot. We were also there the night the fire alarm kept going off the last weekend in July. A voice recording kept going off it was difficult to understand as the recording could have been pronounced more clearly and it would have been nice to get a phone call. My parents were on the room next door and my father had to call the front desk to find out what was going on that they were testing it. But why at 3:30 in the morning?! We will stay there again. It is conveniently located for all of the sights we wanted to see. The biggest pain for us was figuring out how to drive there because our gps kept sending us through time square. With the one way streets and festivals every weekend on the avenue of the Americas you are bound to have some traffic issues. be sure to get in early if you are driving ( or avoid that by arriving on a Friday . Great deals on the web for this hotel you will like the rooms and feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel in New York!”
Reviews.Author: tseibel75 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife over a long weekend for 4 days in August 2011. Hotel is well located on 44th Street between 5th and 6th Avanue. Hotel staff at reception and also the concierge are great and can ber of help at any time. Part of our package was a picnic, where we received a picnic basket with food and drinks (incl bottle of wine) from the hotel. We took the basket with us into Central Park and had a wonderful afternoon / evening. All in all great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved It”
Reviews.Author: a_fittis602
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel nearly 3yrs ago i didn't know about Trip Advisor then so i am writing a review now.I absolutley loved this hotel the staff were nice the room was lovely and the bed so comfy we really enjoyed our stay and would love to go back.What I would say is if you are coming from the airport make sure you get yellow cab we didn't and were ripped off big style......October 2008......

Reviews.Title: “Very good ! Great stay !”
Reviews.Author: mysteryguest132_11
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel ! It is situated so near Times Square - nice to have a walk in the evening. People at the reception and from guest relations are really friendly and very helpfull ! I would certainly recommend this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Still good as ever”
Reviews.Author: Roman1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is my preferred choice when in New York and have stayed there since it opened. On this trip it was on my own dime while we spent four days in NYC. The location is great both for mid-town business travellers and tourists alike. Staying at a Sofitel always tends to be pleasant with nicely decorated and fitted out rooms while service has a French twist. For me the "so-comfy" beds far out-shines other hotel offerings and coupled with a decent sized marbled bathroom this hotel has a winning formula. All the rooms and suites I have stayed have been of a decent size as have the bathrooms. We like Gaby's for a relaxed drink and the olives are always delicious. On this trip we did not eat in the hotel preferring to have a casual breakfast nearby and dinner at one of New Yorks many great restaurants. I do mark the hotel down for a rather shoddy response to a booking query which necessitated three telephone calls from me to solicit a response. They did come good but it would not have occurred without my persistence. I would add we stayed as part of their summer "chic picnic" deal. We had a blast sitting in Central Park having our lunch - on all my visits I'd never done this. The food was simple but tasty, only recommendation would be to pack a rug.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Ihearttofly
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth visit to NYC and for the first time, it was a solo trip. I decided to spoil myself and picked out a 4.5-star hotel. Based on the reviews I read here and at Expedia, I chose Sofitel for the price, room offered and location. After staying, I personally would give it 5 stars! I arrived at 8:30am after a red-eye flight and was looking to just drop off my luggage before wandering the town. I asked if it was too early to check in but they said if my room was available, it wouldn't be a problem. Not only did I get to check in, but I got a top floor, corner suite with a floor-to-ceiling view! I was able to put everything down, freshen up and not worry about coming back for the 3pm check-in time. My schedule was rather tight, so I was able to leave at 9am and enjoy the first half of my day around Central Park, the Met and AMNH. My room was a smaller sized corner suite but enough for 2 guests. The queen bed had a comfy mattress and pillows with crisp sheets and a down duvet. The view was lovely and the bathroom was spacious, simple but luxurious. The fresh orchids added a nice touch =) Room service was always available, and the staff in the halls always asked how my stay was and if I needed anything. Every time I arrived/left, I was greeted by staff...doors were always opened and the revolving door was spun for me! I've stayed at fairly nice hotels before, but this was sure a treat! There are restaurants and a gym all within 5 mins, and I particularly enjoyed the Red Flame Diner - great for a quick breakfast/brunch! Times Sq was literally a block away...many places to eat/shop there! Overall the Sofitel provided me with the best stay ever in all my visits to NYC. it was a shame I only stayed 3 days. I shall be returning to NY again in the winter and will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury but pricey”
Reviews.Author: goonervic
Reviews.Content: In hindsight this was a very expensive way to do New York. The hotel is lovely - very luxurious, but for the amount of time we actually spent in the room/hotel it probably wasn't worth it. It cost approx £2,300 for room only for 6 nights at the beginning of October. We were however upgraded to a suite on a 'staying over 4 nights' deal. Location is fantastic..... Flights were with Delta - not great, and JFK airport is FILTHY......... I have reviewed all the restaurants and attractions seperately

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: SNOWDROP252
Reviews.Content: Very central to stores and times square. Some great (cheap) restaraunts and breakfast locations all within five minutes walk of the hotel. Very comfortable room and great service from the staff. Only minus was the keyboards (3) at the public pc area. All the keyboards were badly worn.

Reviews.Title: “That is luxury”
Reviews.Author: Turista_ABC
Reviews.Content: This is what a luxury hotel means. Manhattan is an expensive place, so no claim about the prices. The location is perfect. We had bitter-sweet experience with the staff. Really friendly and other not at all. Anyway, is New York and you are not supposed to be at the hotel but few hours to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - poor management and communication”
Reviews.Author: jannyc0214
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel the weekend of 7/29 for my husbands 50th birthday trip. We found the hotel to be in a good location and the suite we had was nice, clean and quiet on a high floor with a good view. We considered ourselves very fortunate. Everything was great until the fire alarm in the hotel went off at 3:45 am - not something you want to hear when you are in a deep sleep on the 25th floor! But we realize things happen; however we expected much better customer service, communication and management response to this emergency situation. No one on staff appeared to know what was going on, no one was taking charge of the situation and they didn't seem to care that customers were concerned - especially once the fire department showed up! One staff member reluctantly told us and another couple that it was "probably a false alarm" and gave us the impression we were bothering him with the question. Fortunately, the situation was a false alarm which was great news. However, I have no confidence at all that had the situation been "real" that the personnel on duty would have acted any differently. This is a guest safety issue.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - Only a couple of negative points”
Reviews.Author: LuxuryRoomsBristol
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January. The hotel was pretty much as expected for a 4 star in NYC and we had a very comfortable stay. Our room was spacious with an excellent bed. The in-room facilities were also very good. The Bose sound system was a nice addition. We had a bit of a nightmare when we came to check out. The concierge did not give us a ticket for our luggage. When we enquired with them, they said that our luggage was not in their holding room. Mass panic ensued until we were eventually shown into a second store room. Low and behold, our luggage was there! Phew. We received an apologie from the manager and they kindly arranged a limo to take us to Newark. Overall, a great experience and I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location - Worst customer service ever”
Reviews.Author: Linn0099
Reviews.Content: After booking the room through sofitel reservations we were told to have great view rooms and smoking. Turns out the hotel switched to non-smoking a month previous and no rooms left with a view. The front desk manager, Mr. David, was most likely the worst man for his job ever. He smugly stated that we would have to pay 300 dollars for smoking, didn't matter what we booked and maybe we should find another hotel, after of course we pay 275 dollars for cancelling in the sofitel. They cheated us big time. Fraud!

Reviews.Title: “2422”
Reviews.Author: Getting0ut0fDC
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel in New York is everything that you expect from a luxury hotel ... and more. The service was excellent ... treating everyone like a V.I.P. Plus, if you have a chance to book one of the premium suites with a terrace overlooking the New York skyline, then I say "do it." The restaurant at this hotel is amazing. If you are there for breakfast, then don't bother looking at the menu ... just order the blueberry pancakes! The location is perfect ... right around the corner from Central Park, Times Square, and Fifth Avenue ... and only a 15 minute walk (with luggage in hand) from Penn Station. So ... why title this 2422? Well, that's one of the rooms with a private terrace ...

Reviews.Title: “Below par stay”
Reviews.Author: vantage76 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stay at the NYC Sofitel a few times a year when I’m in NY for business, but unfortunately this will be the last, as the overall experience was well below par, when you’re paying over $500 plus per night and being a Sofitel Platinum member (---------). When checked in the room it was not what u expect from a Sofitel brand it was more like Days Inn, there were glasses missing from the set, the hot water was not working, and we were woken up at 7am buy workman banging away changing carpets outside the room, which was ridiculous as there were no notice of this, If I had known I would have checked in elsewhere as I needed some down time after a serious of long flights, after complaining to the reception they made it feel like it was fault for being in that room at 7am. To be honest this was an utterly unprofessional way to behave and the stay experience was just short of being pathetic

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Jas_Bourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel in NYC during Easter and really enjoyed our stay. The rooms were a good size, clean, really comfortable bed and good bathroom. We felt welcomed here and all staff were friendly, helping with any requests. The Sofitel is perfectly located and close to Times square and accessible to the transport. Overall we would recommend this hotel and will return next time we are in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: coloredsky
Reviews.Content: What can I say that others haven't already wrote on here? Sofitel New York is the perfect choice for any traveler to the Big Apple. My mother and I chose to stay at the Sofitel for three nights of our NY vacation after reading the stellar reviews here (we would have selected to stay here our entire trip, but unfortunately weekday rates are about $100 more than the weekend ones). We loved every moment we spent in this hotel. The moment we stepped out of our taxicab after our exhausting red-eye flight from LA, we were greeted by a kind bellman who ushered us into the hotel and helped us with our suitcases. Check-in was quick and the staff were pleasant, accommodating, and friendly. We took the elevators up to our room on the 14th floor and were impressed by the spacious room we were provided with. Our room was tastefully decorated and very clean. The bathroom was our favorite part of the room - it was large unlike most hotel bathrooms and had a separate tub and shower. We left our suitcases in the room and did some shopping. When we returned, we found the maid had come in and cleaned our room again. There was classical music playing softly from the Bose speakers - what a nice touch! The remainder of our stay went smoothly. My mother and I loved the Sofitel and would always look forward coming back after a tiring day in the city. With the exception of a fire alarm that went off during one of the nights, our stay here was pleasant and perhaps one of the most enjoyable and luxurious experiences I've had in a hotel. Highly recommend! Pros: -Attentive, friendly staff -Spacious rooms and bathrooms -L'Occitane bath products in the bathrooms -Conair hair dryer, not those super slow ones -Comfy beds and pillows -Nice decor -The bowl of fresh apples in the lobby! -VERY clean -The classical music they play on the speakers Cons: -Nothing!

Reviews.Title: “We loved. It was fantastic and unforgettable experience”
Reviews.Author: mariaheitor
Reviews.Content: The location could not be better. is near of the best in NY and accessible transport. In the heart of the city and times square.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect...”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I love staying at this hotel! The rooms are nice, the location is great, and I enjoy the French ambiance. The first night of our stay, the fire alarm went off around 3:45 a.m., followed by instructions in French (help!). We called down to the front desk, and were informed it was a false alarm, to go back to sleep. For the next few minutes, there were lots of French instructions. My only other complaint is that I would love to have a sheet in addition to the duvet cover on the bed. It was way too hot for a duvet, but I needed a light cover. Come on, Sofitel, give us a sheet! Otherwise, the stay was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel New York is First Class 5 star all the way”
Reviews.Author: Mark_Deb_Buderim
Reviews.Content: This the 2nd time we have stayed here and will continue to keep returning each year. This Hotel is 5 star quality all the way, The Staff and quality of service starting from the doorman through to Management is the best in North America we have experienced in recent years. We have stayed here for a total of 5 weeks , The hotel has the best beds in the world .Bar & resuarant are on par with the best dining in New York.( we drank & ate our way through dozens!) , The concierge will get the tickets for any sporting event or theatre show even if they they "are sold out". The location is perfect, right near Times square and theatre districts, quality restaurants & cafes/bars nearby .The street the hotel is located on gives you a "friendly feel"

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: pickycritic05
Reviews.Content: Though pricey, hotel was fantastic! The rooms were a good size, clean and heavenly made bed and pillows. Everything worked flawlessly. Service at the front desk, porter, concierge was perfect - they were all helpful. To give you an idea of the service level, we forgot to bring our Ipad2 charger. The concierge (lady whom i forgot her name) offered to charge for us on her personal iPad2 charger! What great service! Only complaint is that internet was not included in the room rate and you have to pay US$5-$10 per day. Given the room rate we paid (> US$400 per night), internet should have been included. But this was just a minor irritation since everything else about the hotel was fantastic! I definitely will stay at Sofitel NYC again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Plain hotel. Does the job with friendly smiles”
Reviews.Author: Asta72
Reviews.Content: Rating: A strong 3. While there is absolutely nothing wrong with the very friendly and attentive service the hotel provides and the location of the very same, i do have a problem with slow internet and uncomfortable beds. The bed is rather hard and the pillows just disintegrate once you lay your head upon them. The A/C is also disturbing at night time as it blows directly on you in bed + makes a clicking sound every few seconds. There were also some glitches in the service that affected the rating in a negative fashion. Location: A 5 minute walk (in leisurely tempo) from Times square AND 5th Avenue. So not far away from great shopping or the theatres + an easy distance from Central Park so extremely well situated IMO. Room: We had 2 connecting rooms, 1 suite (1822) and one king bedroom(1823). I really liked their system of closing a door in the main corridor, creating a large hallway, so that one can go back and forth in between the 2 rooms without having to use the keys. Also, if this is the solution you would like to go for, please do note that the highest floor you can have is the 18th. But the views are more than ok anyways! The décor is nothign special. Feels new enough, but is very discreet. Also these rooms are at the end of the hotel so i do imagine that they are maybe a bit quieter than other rooms. Pro´s: * It is not noisy at all from the street or from other rooms * The rooms are large by NYC city hotel room standards!! * Big bathtub (1822) and large freestanding shower (1822).
