Regular sized tub and freestanding shower in 1823 * Great water pressure and heat * Hèrmes amenities which are divine * Good views * Really good storage space for both clothes and toiletries * The room becomes very dark * It is very clean! Con´s: * The bed and pillows are not comfortable and the bedlinen merely just more than ok. * The A/C is placed in a silly place so it blows directly at you when you lay in bed and makes clicking sounds every few seconds . * Rather odd labyrinthesque layout * Internet is beyond slow at times, very un-even speeds Staff/Service: Very pleasant and providing good service in every department in general. Their concierges (Vladimir in particular!) is utmost helpful and great with helping out with everything from renting a specific car, suggesting ticket reservations to finding rare garments. Food: Breakfast was good, but on the expensive side. Service a tad slow and in-accurate ie brought things not ordered. Only had dinner at Gaby once, it was good. Service was nicely executed. Internet: It is only charged per room, not by device which is good....It is easy to connect to, but annoyingly slow at times...! Laundry/Drycleaning: Only gave garments once. They were returned late + they also tried to deliver garments that were not ours at first! Plus my pants were probably never even laundered...! I gave them due to 2 icecream stains and they came back with the very same stains. Just pressed into the fabric so i both saw and felt them!!! They probably didn´t see them as the pants were dark, but that´s un-acceptable! The hotel did however remove the crage. Amenities/minibar: The minibar is sufficently stocked. But the amenities are to die for! Hèrmes all the way through making bathtime most pleasureble. Although is hould mentin that the amenities are way less chich in the regular room... "Just L´Occitane". Kind of odd to make such a distinction in between the rooms. But they do provide macaroons with their turndown service which makes almost anything forgiven, hooray! Things to do/To think about: * Bring your comfortable walkingshoes * Plan your activities by local areas * Shop! * If you can, spend more time than planned in the city as it really has something to ofeer everyone at any given time.

Reviews.Title: “Great midtown location”
Reviews.Author: BobV_52
Reviews.Content: An upscale hotel in a great location, walking distance to Times Square, ESB, 30 Rock, Bryant Park, Central Park. Plenty of dining options in all price ranges close by. Overall the hotel and room were very clean. The staff was always helpful and friendly. As with most hotels it seems the more upscale they are the fewer freebies they offer; no complimentary coffee in the room or lobby, you have call for ice. The minibar would have been much more useful as a fridge. The King room was good size and had a full bath and separate shower. A big plus was the fact that we did not hear any noise from the rooms on either side of us. As far as value, If you can get a good price on a room it is worth staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: PingSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel in NYC is very well located, close to Times Square, 5th Avenue, etc, in a relatively quiet street. The service is excellent and the price is affordable considering it is NYC.

Reviews.Title: “really solid and QUIET hotel”
Reviews.Author: moritz23
Reviews.Content: Many hotels in NYC are good, but few are a haven of tranquility once in your room. The Sofitel is good and have not put their soundproofing dollars in ultra hip bar decorations or the like. This is a business hotel, performs very well and everything works. Great breakfasts though not cheap, but this is Gotham City after all...

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfy and does the job”
Reviews.Author: fairreview27
Reviews.Content: We were well welcomed into the hotel. The rooms are of a decent size for new York. Everywhere was very clean. Free Internet access in the lobbey. Staff and concierge were very friendly and helpful. Couldn't fault it one bit , however the cleaner did walk in on me while I was in the shower......what is it with this hotel and the cleaners :-)

Reviews.Title: “Maybe time for a change?”
Reviews.Author: elegantraveller
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Sofitel for years, feeling comfortable in the familiarity of this Midtown area and enjoying the peace and quiet elegance after running around the city. Finding the location convenient for everything we love to do, we've never considered staying anywhere else. However, I think that, at last, it might be time for a change because after this stay, I feel the world has moved on and left the Sofitel behind. For sure, the same easy elegance is still here. The location couldn't be better for us and we love having The Red Flame a few doors away (!) but the Sofitel isn't cheap and, for the price paid, I think we might expect better. To start, I think the Sofitel NYC is the only hotel we use in the US which has no coffee making facility in the rooms. When we wake early and jetlagged, the coffee shop across the road or the Starbucks around the corner are of little use when a hot drink there and then, before starting the day is just what we need. In addition, there are extra charges for internet connection. Five or six years ago, perhaps this was no surprise, but these days even the low-cost inns offer free wifi and this extra charge merely adds to the overall cost of the stay. Why not build it into the price? These niggles don't take away the fact that the beds are super-comfortable, cool bedlinen ensures a great night's sleep and the bedroom and bathroom are immaculately clean and well maintained. But the rooms are a little dull and the furnishings rather beige. Not a thing has changed in these rooms since our first visit and what worked well in a few years ago is now rather bland. But sorry Sofitel, I think it's time to move on. There's plenty of choice out there; bright, breezy, modern places right here on the doorstep, offering all those little extras that I've missed on this visit and which would have made my stay so much more comfortable. It's time for a change.

Reviews.Title: “Really comfortable”
Reviews.Author: nygirl123
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable and clean and everything in this hotel smells great.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: canadiantraveller70
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel is ideally located. The staff and service was exceptional. Our room was gorgeous and very clean. Conceirge staff were very helpful everyday with their dining recommendations. We felt so welcome. Every staff member was friendly. I can't say one bad thing about this place. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Another fine Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust_at_work
Reviews.Content: (1) Based on my stay, and on the extensive due diligence that I did earlier this month before booking a room, I would like to point out, first and foremost, that I saw NO signs, and found NO reports, of, um, bedbug activity at this hotel. This is a huge deal. Even if you do not choose to stay at the Sofitel, promise me that you'll do your own due diligence before choosing a hotel in the City. (2) Hotel staff is, overall, extraordinarily friendly and helpful. (One of the doormen was rude, but he was clearly an outlier.) I felt important from the second that I set foot in the door, and the high quality of service extended to room service and housekeeping as well. (3) Location, location, location. Okay, so many people try to steer clear of Times Square, but, if you're going to NYC on business in particular, you're going to want to stay right in the middle of it all. (The restaurant selection on 44th Street is pretty incredible, too.) (4) I definitely recommend this hotel, but I should explain my 4/5 review. The -1 is due, yes, to little things: the dreaded "green stuff" on metal fixtures/features in the bathroom; small stains--that, I could see, had not come out in the wash--on the comforter; unusual (not bad, just unusual) smell to the room. (And did I mention the rude doorman?) Alas, the little things can keep a very good experience from be[com]ing an excellent experience. Recap: no bedbugs. Amazing service. Great location, if you can stand Times Square. Very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: geode
Reviews.Content: Comfortable lobby. Great place to sit down and rest. Arranged for refrigerator in room. Hotel tried to meet all requests. Very pleasant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, common areas could stand an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: lovevacas
Reviews.Content: I'll start by stating that I would stay here again, especially at the rate we got. The service was great, from the door men to the employees working the reception to the housekeepers. Everyone had a smile on their face and made you feel welcome. The location is outstanding..just a couple a blocks away from several metro stops, including Grand Central Station. Times Square is close by and Rockefeller Center is just a 15 minute walk or so. The room was very clean (I'm really picky about cleanliness, bordering on OCD) and even had a view of the Empire State Building. Now for the cons...the common areas of the hotel are a bit drab and dated. The carpets and hallways need to be updated. The furniture in the room and the trim work is a little tired as well. I've stayed at the Softel in Philly and it was much nicer and had a much better vibe than this Sofitel. It wouldn't prevent me from staying here again, but will only get worse if it doesn't get some TLC soon. If you get a good rate, I wouldn't hesitate.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: ellysian
Reviews.Content: It was ok. Not great nor bad. Rooms were ok, a bit on small side. Location is pretty central. We didn't eat in the hotel prefering to get cheap breakfasts in the local restaurants of which there are many. I thought the bar was a bit expensive especially when there is much local competition. Basically the hotel is clean, reasonable value and caters for a mix of short stay business and tourist travellers to NYC. A few frills would be nice andthe hotel was frankly unmemorable in it's averageness.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Close to all major sites, easy walking distance to Times Sq, Theaters, Rockerfeller Plaza, Central Park. We didn't eat at this hotel. Only minor complaint would be, I don't understnad hotels that don't fix ceilings when there has been a leak, coat of paint in the bathroom ceiling wouldn't hurt. However the room was clean, turn down service every day, and the bed was very comportable. Rooms where very quiet. Red Flame Diner a 1/2 block a way was great for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “First class - perfect”
Reviews.Author: Travellingozz
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 days with my daughter. Everything was perfect. The beds and bedinen were Devine and so comfortable. Hotel was in a perfect location for everything shops theatre, transport, restaurants etc. Concierge were amazing. Thank you sofitel after a long day out it was always wonderful to know we were going back to out comfortable immaculate room. Also gym was perfect .

Reviews.Title: “Great As Always”
Reviews.Author: FLLtourist
Reviews.Content: We stay here often and have never been disappointed. The staff is always courteous and the rooms are always immaculate. I still don't understand how come the closet space is so limited (even in the junior suite we had this time), but other than that I have no complaints. As others have mentioned, the Red Flame Diner down the street is a great inexpensive option for food. But I also recommend exploring the W. 45th St. side (exit through Gaby Restaurant) for some other alternative cuisines and fast options.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel and the location!”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl086_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sofitel for our first trip to New York City, and we loved several things about this hotel! It is close to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, theatres, and Fifth Avenue shopping. We felt like the Sofitel was in a good, central location to a lot of places we wanted to visit. It was also so quiet in our room! You would never known you were in the middle of NYC! We stayed in a basic room, but the bed was super comfortable and the bathroom was very spacious. We had a large walk-in shower with rain head and a large tub. We also loved the small touches like fresh flowers in our bathroom and candles! The only thing frustrating was the terrible cell phone service. We could hardly place calls out or use internet on our phones. I also wish that there had been a coffee maker in our room as I like to have a cup first thing in the morning. Besides these two small things, we enjoyed our stay and would pick the Sofitel again!

Reviews.Title: “NY Trip”
Reviews.Author: fajdari
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Sofitel, NY was better than expected. The hotel was located to many attractions. The service was great and the room was VERY nice. I would stay at Sofitel hotel, NY (or any other location) again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute luxury & elegance!”
Reviews.Author: Sheherazade70
Reviews.Content: Of all the high end NYC properties, this is hands down the best service I've ever received. From the very moment I arrived, front desk staff were helpful and diligent in getting me the best possible room available. Even with checking in a tad early (2pm) they were gracious and accommodating and even gave me an upgrade one tier above the room for which I paid and it was spectacular. The rooms (suites) were extremely clean, well-appointed with elegant furnitture that's in good repair, huge flat-screen tvs, and absolutely spectacular bathrooms with Hermes toiletries. The bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept on and the linenes were wonderful. Room service was prompt and delicious---worth it! The restaurant/bar Gaby's was also a great choice with very reasonably priced, delicious food. I now find it very difficult to stay anywhere other than a Sofitel. Book it--- you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Can't think of a Single Flaw”
Reviews.Author: SweetLife07
Reviews.Content: On our second trip to New York, we decided to book Sofitel from July 4-8th, and boy are we glad we did! Most of my reviews are pretty informational, complete with a list of pro's and con's. But honestly, for this hotel, I can not think of any flaws. Why I LOVED my stay: - We had a suite, so our room was nice and spacious for the two of us - The Fitness center is big and well equipped, one of the best hotel gyms I've encountered - They surprised us with a chocolate cake and chocolate covered strawberries because it was our anniversary - Housekeeping and turn down service very efficient - Excellent location - central to times square, shopping, theatre district, in the heart of it all - The friendliness at this hotel is exemplary of first-class hospitality. The lobby staff makes you feel like you are their only guest. For example, they even went out of their way to press your floor button on the elevator when they saw my hands were full! Randy, the bellman, is so polite and just a sweetheart. I left Sofitel and New York with a heavy-heart. Five whirl-wind days, but many positive memories! I almost think it will be harder for me to stay at other hotels now during our travels since I will always be comparing my experiences to Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “we loved and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: luis_l_vale
Reviews.Content: we stayed at Sofitel New York, for a short break. We had a great experience at all levels. The staf was extremely warm and polited. The rroms were very well appointed and spacious. we will be bak and we know where to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at the Sofitel. I appreciated the staff - very friendly and were as involved or uninvolved as you wanted. I do think the hotel is pricey, although the location, cleanliness, and accessibility were outstanding. Very quiet hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault anything!!”
Reviews.Author: Empauljas
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to NYC and it was fab because we stayed at the sofitel, we had good views the bed was really comfortable and the room was clean, the staff were friendly and there was just nothing that we could fault it was that nice I still keep going on about it and desperate to return again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel, but lack of cell phone coverage was odd and frustrating.”
Reviews.Author: MarkGreaney
Reviews.Content: It's a beautiful place, especially the common areas. Our television did not work so we called maintenance, who just tightened a connection in the back. The next morning, however, the TV stopped working again. It just had a frozen pixilated screen on all channels as if the sattelite feed wasn't coming through. The main problem was that neither myself nor my girlfriend could get ANY ATT coverage on our cell phones- can't speak for other carriers because we both have ATT, but it was as if the hotel was lead encased. I literally had to leave the room, descend to the lobby, and go out in front of the building to make or take a call. It was like I was taking a smoke break. This was incredibly annoying and an absolute deal breaker to me ever coming back here again. We just stayed one night, then went to the Grand Hyatt .4 miles away for the next 4 nights. There we had no issues whatsoever with coverage. Then we went to another hotel in Midtown for the last night, and again, no cell phone problems. I can't recommend the Sofitel for that one reason only, which is too bad, but for 300 bucks a night I don't think I should have to go stand in the street to wait for an important phone call.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel,great location !”
Reviews.Author: SilverDave
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights right at the end of June, great location near to fifth avenue shops, Rockerfeller plaza and Grand Central station, all well worth a visit. Good sized room with nice Bose room filling sound.We were on floor 6. Did not eat in hotel, plenty of choice around along with plenty of coffee shops Would recommend and would certainly consider other Sofitel properties

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Canim1985
Reviews.Content: Great location, room was very comfortable and the staff all friendly. Nothing bad to say about the hotel, nor did it blow my mind. Recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Second time visit and loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Avensis_Spirit
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Sofitel. It was just as good as the first. Excellent location in Manhatten and those beds, how did we ever get out of them in the morning, they are to die for. Staff polite and attentive. Room clean, well maintained and a reasonable size. What more can you ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Party Like a French Diplomat”
Reviews.Author: ponc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in junior suite over the 4th of July holiday weekend in the floor above the one that DSK stayed in during his now infamous stay at the same hotel. This was our second stay here and everything was near-perfect. We booked several months earlier at a reasonable rate for what appears to be one of the slower travel periods for NYC. The suite was large and comfortable and was equipped with the latest amenities. We requested and received a small refrigerator for our stay at no additional charge. The hotel is ideally located on W 44th Street between FIfth and Sixth Avenues, close to the Theater District, Rockefeller Center, and subway stations. We've stayed at other places, including the Casablanca, which is currently tops on the Tripadvisor list, but I don't think that we've liked any hotel in the city more than the Sofitel for its convenient location, expansive, modern rooms, relatively reasonable rates, and its courteous service staff.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, surprisingly quiet, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: DavidAirey
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week here, flying Continental from Belfast. We mentioned at hotel check-in that we were celebrating our honeymoon, and the friendly woman on reception said she was glad we told her, and that we'd receive a special gift in our room at some point. I think because of the honeymoon we were also given a room on a higher-than-usual floor (21st). Smallish room, but very comfortable, clean, and furnished to a high standard. The bed was excellent. Brilliant sleep quality. Black-out curtains always help. Five days into our stay I asked about the gift. A different person on reception said he'd find out about it. Sadly, it never came (I was more disappointed for my wife, not being too fussed myself). Had we never been told about it, I would've given a higher "service" score. I received a feedback-request email upon returning home, and briefly mentioned the gift. The general manager replied offering a free room upgrade on our next stay, which was appreciated. For breakfast most mornings we went out the back exit of the hotel, crossed the road and walked a few metres to the right where there was an excellent deli: fresh food, great coffee, great granola yoghurts. It was probably 5-times cheaper than the hotel breakfast menu, with perhaps double the serving size. Highly recommended. Popular place. There are three computers in the lobby with free internet — good for searching the sights. Location: excellent. Just a 5-10 minute walk to Times Square, yet in a much quieter spot. The staff all seemed very friendly. Ask the concierge team if you're looking for a good local restaurant. I'd certainly stay here if I return to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: stesuec
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a fantastic 7 night stay at the Sofitel. When checking in, I casually mentioned that we were celebrating our silver wedding, the staff at reception congratulated us and we thought no more of it. Upon returning to our room later that night, the hotel had left a lovely chocolate dessert and card, congratulating us, which was a very nice touch. All the members of staff that we had contact with, were helpful, pleasant and polite. The hotel has a fantastic location, located between 5th Avenue and the Avenue of the Americas, about a 5 minute walk to Times Square. We had a room on the 9th floor with views of 45th street. The room was spotless, with lots of storage space, a large flat screen tv, Bose music system, and a very comfortable queen size bed . The bathroom was a nice size, with a separate shower cubicle and bath.There were other nice little touches, such as the sound from the tv or radio could be piped into the bathroom,and the complementary bathrobe and slippers. The only downside was that the room didn't have coffee/tea making facilities. We didn't eat in the hotel but there is a very popular diner 50yrds down the street, which was handy for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel, and would definitely recommend!”
Reviews.Author: baylormorgan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon, and we really appreciated the outstanding service, and beautiful accommodations. The hotel was clean, and the staff was friendly. No bed bugs here! We were upgraded upon arrival to a 23rd story room, overlooking Rockefeller Center. Our room was plenty big, and the bed was very comfortable. The L'Occitane bath products were a pleasant surprise. We loved our housekeeper, as she did complimentary turn-down service every night, with free bottles of water. The concierge was very helpful- finding great restaurants, or even researching a good laundromat. We also thought the staff was excellent at helping us get cabs when needed. Excellent location- close to all the activity but away from the hustle and loudness of Times Square. (about a block and a half away) We didn't eat at the restaurant, which looked great, but seemed expensive. The other negative is the lack of free WiFi, but it was only $40 for the week, which was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in Times Square - no frills, no issues”
Reviews.Author: bostongal19
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Sofitel in New York for two nights during our weekend trip to hang out with friends, watch Broadway & ABT shows, and enjoy some great restaurants. All in all, the trip was enjoyable and relaxing, and our stay at the Sofitel - while not a standout - does not detract from the trip either. We were given a room right by the elevator bank on the 10th floor of the hotel, but we didn't experience any noise issues. The vibe in the hotel is definitely luxury, though not quite like the Pierre or Peninsula hotels. All the hotel attendants and front desk reps we interacted with were helpful, perhaps even eager to help. While I have no specific anecdotes to relay, in my mind and experience, that can be a positive! There are certainly no aspects to our stay that were sub-optimal - I would stay at the Sofitel again, particularly if our plans included more Broadway shows and gallivanting around the city. (The Sofitel is located right off Fifth Avenue, equidistant to the B/D/F/V and 4/5/6, making it easy to traipse around Manhattan.) If you know, however, that your plans don't require you to be near Times Square or Lincoln Center (or the general Midtown area), the Sofitel isn't necessarily the best option. The Bowery and Crosby Hotels downtown are better options for visitors who will be frequenting that area. Sofitel, however, I think is a reliable option for Midtown.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RobynGB
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel in June for about a week. I travel to New York every 6 weeks or so and I must say the Sofiitel Hotel is far better than any I have stayed at in the city! The staff are all friendly and helpful - the rooms are light, large and always so well cleaned, the room service was great! The Sofitel was in an excellent location and was pretty easy to always get a cab. I will definitly be returning to the Sofitel again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Our Search for a Favorite Hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: FLJOntario Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Is it that hard to find a nice hotel in New York? That's the question my husband and I kept asking ourselves. We've been to New York many times but we always stay in different hotels because we have not been happy with previous ones (The Hudson and the Paramount are two that scored badly in my books. The W was mediocre and I would not rush to return.) Are we super picky? I look for good service, cleanliness, a well designed room, adequate lighting -- and a room that doesn't feel like a closet. That should not be out of reach for "quality hotels". Our favorite hotel in any city is the Sofitel in Montreal, surely there must be something comparable in NYC?!! So when a spring sale came up at the Sofitel New York, we arranged our trip to take advantage of the good rates. When we first arrived the room we were given wasn't "great". By comparison the Sofitel in Montreal feels airy and spacious and has huge modern glass windows looking out onto the city. The NY room we were given was spacious (by NYC standards) but it only had a single window with a view of brick walls and rusting water tanks on rooftops. I called the front desk and asked if there were any rooms they could give us in the same price bracket that had a good view. We waited about 20 minutes, and one of the hotel managers called and said she would show us two possible rooms on higher floors. The room we agreed on was similar in layout to the one on the lower floor, but this one had a great view of New York and the Chrysler Building. As I am a photographer having a view is a big plus, so I was pleased with the room change. We stayed at the Sofitel New York for 4 nights. There were a few minor things I asked to be fixed (a broken hairdryer, not enough hangers in the closet, not enough towels, a bedsheet with a mark on it). All requests were taken care of promptly. My summary: The Sofitel New York delivered on all counts: service, comfort, cleanliness, a well designed room, good lighting, good internet, and in a central location that made walking our preferred mode of transportation. Most days we ate at restaurants nearby where the price of breakfast is cheaper than a latte at Starbucks, but on the last day we treated ourselves to breakfast at the hotel restaurant. It was expensive. My husband said, "This hotel is a reminder why we need to earn more money!" I agreed. Sofitel New York is now my favorite hotel in NYC. We'll be on the lookout for their next sale...

Reviews.Title: “Quality, serice and location”
Reviews.Author: MarceloGomes
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property last week to enjoy a week of vacation. I must say that me and my friends ( 7) had a blast!! The hotel is very well located. All employees are very friendly and keep looking for how they can make our stay better. We got lot of good suggestions from concierge team and also all the bell captains and housekeeping were very nice to us. I strongly recommend this hotel. One of the best I know in town. If you are looking for shopping , dinning and Broadway's plays this is the right place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel was amazing and can't wain to return.”
Reviews.Author: Eamonn111222
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic time in the sofitel, In advance I told the hotel of our aniversary and I was upgraded to a fantasic room on the 24th floor with great views as it was available. After our day in New York the staff organised a beautiful dessert in our room. The beds were very soft and comfortable. The staff were very helpful. I could not have asked for any better. The hotel is just off times Sq, and near everything you need to do in Manhattan. The location is perfect. I will be back next year in the Sofitel for sure and I have stayed in a couple of other hotels in Manhattan and this is top of my list (for my budget).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: captain_gwk
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for three nights 24-26 June. Pros: Location - Perfect location. This hotel is close to Time Square and fifth avenue for shopping. Room - We have booked the King room, which was really spacious. The bed was big and really comfy. Welcome - We were offered a champagne as a compensation for the booking that you will read below. Cons: Room - Our room was just behind the elevators and we could hear their noise during the night. I personally did not like the two doors for entering the bathroom. Booking - We have phoned twice for a good view and high floor but we were given a room in 9th floor so the views were not great (we payed $500/night). Breakfast - The breakfast was not a buffet, therefore you did not have much of a choice.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOTEL IN NEW YORK!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: UKLorri
Reviews.Content: What an experience! What a hotel! What service! Despite the size of the hotel, the staff made our stay feel so intimate and personal. The service is impeccable, the staff, from door staff to bar staff, simply couldn't have been any more friendly and warm. We felt like we were guests in a small hotel, rather than just passing bodies in a soul-less building. The lobby is stunning and the change of lighting at night, coupled with the floral arrangements, is breathtaking. Everything about the hotel oozes quality. The suite was beautiful, with fresh flowers in every room, gorgeous fixtures and decor and incredible cleanliness. The Hermes bath products are divine! The phots on the website and those on here really do not caputre the beauty of this hotel and nothing can prepare you for the So-Bed. It's pure luxury. We have already planned our next stay. Top marks Sofitel New York - you have an amazing hotel and amazing staff.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Kat008186356
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Sofitel hotel before on several occasions and have been impressed by the rooms, cleanliness, staff hospitality etc. This time however we were here on our honeymoon and the stay was disappointing, Don't misunderstand me, the hotel was clean and is undoubtedly in a great location but having been made a fuss of as a honeymoon couple in other hotels on our stay for it not even to be acknowledged seemed odd, particularly being repeat customers not only to this particular Sofitel hotel but in other cities as well. We also some how managed to miss the turn down service two nights out of three despite being out of our room between 6pm and 11pm both nights.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull stay, we will be back”
Reviews.Author: alp1961
Reviews.Content: Excelent! It was wonderful to see chrysler and empire at night from our window!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in the heart of times square & theater district”
Reviews.Author: msheri
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. We were on the 14 th floor and heard no street noise whatsoever. Nice sized bathroom and very nice amenities.

Reviews.Title: “An over rated hotel”
Reviews.Author: anjusantosh
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel after reading the reviews on tripadvisor. I think this hotel is overrated. Starting with the good- I think the location is excellent. It is very easy to get to where the action is. The staff were generally very good and helpful I stayed in the junior suite. The room looked worn out, although it was very clean. I found the quality of food terrible. The saving grace is that there are a lot of good restaurants closeby. There seemed a lack of communication among the staff. My laundry was not picked up twice, inspite of calling to remind them. No help was offered to set things right

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Well Maintain Property”
Reviews.Author: Richie248
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the Sofitel New York, Staff was friendly and helpful and check-in was quick and painless. Room was large by New York standards and very well appointed. Had a very restful sleep as the room was quiet and bed was very comfortable. Also great Midtown location and close to Radio City Music Hall. Property also has a great bar (Gaby's).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic beds”
Reviews.Author: BusinessCaspar Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Super central located 5th ave and Time Square. Superb beds. Easy check in and check out. Fax to room done in less than 10min. Rooms are big enough and pretty silent. Air con not noisy. All in all recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “STOP YOUR SEARCH – SOFITEL IS WHERE YOU WANT TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: TMCNEWS
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Sofitel New York numerous times and have never been disappointed. I have also stayed at other hotels in New York but now I can’t see myself switching. Well, maybe if I got a penthouse at the Palace for a good rate. I arrived in NYC (LGA) around 3:30 in the afternoon and then had the longest taxi ride at just over one hour to get to Sofitel. When you arrive at Sofitel you are usually greeted by a Bellman, on this trip I had a couple people ahead of me at the curb and one group had about 13 pieces of luggage. With my two small bags I just headed for the front desk quickly bypassing the people with all the luggage. Front Desk: I have always had good experiences with the Front Desk staff at Sofitel, always professional and helpful. On this trip I ran into the General Manager of the hotel, Mr. Jorge Tito. I had met Mr. Tito last year while checking out of the hotel and had a conversation with him about my stay and some upcoming trips. He then assisted with my check in and I was quickly off to my room. The Room: I was in 1622, a junior suite, this trip. The room faces 44th Street with decent views. I have read some reviews saying the furniture and room is outdated and if that is true it’s not by much. They are scheduled for renovation this year and I am looking forward to seeing the new look. The junior suite living area has a writing desk and chair. Couch with a comfortable chair next to it and an entertainment center. There is one of those mini bar refrigerators with the weight sensitive items inside so be careful you don’t look inside and move anything unless you intent to buy. The bedroom is very big compared to other NYC hotels. The bed is EXTREMELY comfortable. There is plenty of closet space and an area for hanging your clothes in the hallway between the bedroom and bathroom. The bathroom is also huge compared to other NYC hotels. Each bathroom has a separate stand alone shower and bathtub. The water pressure has always been strong and hot. I kept my windows opened during most of my stay only because I like fresh air and enjoy the sounds of the City. During this trip I did get a wakeup call that I wasn’t expecting however. The Puerto Rican Day Parade was on Saturday and they were lining up floats and other entries outside of the hotel on 44th Street. The parade made it hard to get around for a couple hours but by early evening everybody was gone and the City had the streets all cleaned up again. Pros & Cons Pro: Small hotel, about 400 rooms. Quiet hotel. I saw the GM, Mr. Tito assisting guests a couple times during my stay. Once he was helping guests with their bags off the elevator and another assisting at the front doors with guests. You will most likely not find that at your bigger hotels. The hotel is just about 2 blocks off of Times Square and maybe half a mile walk to Benjamin Steakhouse on 41st Street. Housekeeping has always been good and one thing that I have noticed is that I rarely see the carts in the hallways. There are also two Duane Reade Stores (Pharmacy / Grocery) one block away in each direction so if you forgot something you are only steps away. Con: The bed does not have a second sheet. I have read reviews where this really bothers people. For me the only real problem is that the comforter can get too hot so there is no real happy medium. All in all I would and have certainly recommended Sofitel New York to my friends. I will be back in July with friends from Texas and Ohio for a celebration dinner at Benjamin’s Steakhouse and to see the fireworks too.

Reviews.Title: “Location,Location,Location !”
Reviews.Author: djhallett
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 11 nights in mid May and had a great time. The hotel is perfectly located for all your sight seeing in NY. Walking distance to Time SQ,Grand Central station(your gateway to the city),the shops of 5th av. and madison av.All the major sites are close by. Rockerfeller Centre,Broadway are all walking distance The rooms are typical 5 star..well maintained The staff are what you expect from a 5 star hotel...friendly and helpful. ConciergeDesk is really helpful with tips about the city and can organise everything for you. Food.We didn't eat in the hotel as there are so many excellent choices nearby. The Red Flame diner is 50 metres away so it provides a cheaper alternative for breakfast. Gregory's Coffee opposite is a good choice for those who need real coffee...not American coffee. Final comment. Great place to stay in NY if you are on an expense account.Not cheap, but very good!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this elegant oasis in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Cruizergrl
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel is the most elegant and beautiful hotel in New York. From the hushed decor & lighting, to the beautiful furniture & floral arrangements, this hotel spoils you for any other hotel in New York. The rooms are spacious with lovely decor & beds are extremely comfortable. The bathroom is very modern with separate tub & shower & I loved soaking in the large tub by candlelight. Staff has old world European charm & are very gracious & helpful. Fantastic walking location close to theatres, Times Square, 5th & 6th shopping. Thank you for a wonderful stay. I will definitely return & can't recommend more highly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay with a bumpy start”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel at 2:00 pm and was asked to wait in order to have a really nice room with a view. I waited until 4:00 pm and was given a room which had not much of a view and was pretty dark. However, as soon as I complained I was given a similar room on a higher floor and a different angle, much more airy and luminous. From then on, my daughter and I had an excellent stay: the rooms were tasteful and clean, service prompt, extremely professional, friendly attitude on the part of all staff I met, I will come back again to this hotel. However, please drop the Bonjour! It sounds a bit fake, and we are so happy to be in NY, who wants to think about France?

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Antarctic
Reviews.Content: Booked a junior suite at what is certainly one of the better hotels in New York. Bed comfortable and rooms relatively quiet despite being adjacent to the lifts. Bathroom good with upmarket toiletries. Some of the fittings are become tired but generally I liked the hotel. The bedroom was rather dark and lights were needed most of the time to provide reasonable illumination. The bar and restaurant are also rather gloomy and fairly pricey to match. After breakfast on the first morning we decided to eat at the Red Flame emporium just along from the hotel - many other hotel guests also used the Red Flame. The food in the restaurant was very good and the waiters cheerful, but the food was slow in delivery. There are three PCs in the reception area for guest use. The hotel is in a good location. The staff were helpful and accommodating when overcoming an error in the original booking. I would stay at the hotel if I visit New York in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Just the perfect location in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Faxao Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If you need to be in the heart of THE City, steps away from Times Square and Broadway Theatres, this is the right place to go ! Very clean and quiet, never had any problem. I always come back either for business or vacation. Only minor issue: wi-fi should be included in the room rate, considering the price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel near Times Square”
Reviews.Author: oxforduser
Reviews.Content: Despite being part of an international chain, this hotel manages to have some character. It is very well situated in Manhattan - near Times Square - and would equally suit those on business or a city break. Rooms and bathrooms are spacious and modern and staff are helpful and the service excellent. While there is little in the way of public space (a dark lobby sitting area and smallish bar/breakfast/restaurant) the restaurant is surprisingly good and reasonable value for main meals. Breakfasts are ok but with quite limited 'menu' choice rather than buffet and are not particularly good value. (for a great American breakfast, there is a NY Deli just 50 yards away up the street). WiFi is available but expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: kk18Melb
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd time at this fantastic property in New York city and they have not failed to surprise me. From arrival to check in it was a warm, friendly and welcoming atmosphere and it makes me feel the staff cares. The bed is the best I have slept in amongst the hotels I have visited. It is not too hard and neither is it too soft. The bathroom is very clean and well stocked with shampoo, soap, and bath gels daily. The hotel offered a turn down service in the evenings with bottles of water replenished. Daily we were left with delicious Macroons which was welcomed after a long day of shopping and sightseeing. I will most definitely return to the Sofitel if and when I make another trip to New York. The 4 nights spent were well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “excellence”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very nice location, but a bit tired hotel. Anyway I like this place very much despite the fact that they do not want to provide their visitors with yoga mats)) Njoy it my favourite is suite 2222 during the weekend....

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: newyorktraveler04
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Hotel has to be the number one hotel in New York city. From the friendly staff, beautiful rooms and quality amenties, all of your travelling needs will be met. We highly recommend a stay at the Sofitel Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: OttawaMike_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel for 5 nights and it was amazing. It was our first trip to NY and couldn't have asked for a better location. Just a couple of blocks to TImes Square and many other attractions. The hotel was beautiful and very classy. Thanks for a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “THIS HOTEL IS THE NUMBER ONE IN NEW YORK”
Reviews.Author: Nisou
Reviews.Content: We tryed different hotels in New York and since 6 years we have choiced the Sofitel. All the staff is so nice and so helpfull! the rooms are very comfortable and very clean . To stay at the Sofitel is like a vacation. I will definitly recommend this hotel and specially for the french people. In the Sofitel all the staff speaks french.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: rusty49
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is central and is worth every penny. Elegant Lobby and good sized rooms and bathrooms--separate shower stall--, the Bar/Restaurant is very nice as well. Staff is amazing and the Concierge nailed every request. We love to walk and this is so close the great food, shopping and the Theatres. Stayed at the Library last visit and this Hotel was way better but did lack the nice touches at the Library, like the Breakfast room and the Roof Top Bar. If you want elegance and to be pampered... this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but overpriced..”
Reviews.Author: M0_the_Expl0rer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with colleagues for a 3-day business trip in February. Overall it was a positive experience but not sure it would be my top choice as I think there are many other excellent hotels in New York with more character. The decor is art deco which isn't really to my taste, however the room was spacious and the bathroom was nice - great shower. The location was very convenient and easy access to 5th Ave and all the shopping! Breakfast was very good but a little warning- they do 'supersize me' portions so the omelette was fit for three people (I asked for a kid-size omellete on my second day which was what one would expect in Europe!). Dislikes - decor and having to pay for wi-fi!

Reviews.Title: “Very good indeed”
Reviews.Author: UKtraveller143
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at the Sofitel. Very impressed over all. Very friendly staff, big clean room, excellent bed and linen. Only comment would be high cost of breakfast (although quality was very good) and charge for internet usage - all major hotels should provide this free now in my view.

Reviews.Title: “We had a terrific time in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: bethmerc
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel was an excellent location for myself and 14 year old daughter. It's central location was easy to navigate. The hotel was lovely and the staff was fantastic. Albert (concierge) was very helpful and Elvis(not kidding) was great. I would recommend this hotel to people visiting NYC. It's close to Times Square but not too close.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel NY is the greatness one imagines when NYC comes to mind; sophisticated, elegant, cutting edge.”
Reviews.Author: SXR48
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a most enjoyable stay at Sofitel NY. The hotel was subtle, elegant and sophisticated. By the end of the weekend, it had become magnificent. The location was PERFECT for Broadway, dining, shopping and St. Patrick's Cathedral. The staff was remarkable, especially the door staff. Big Derek could be the most enjoyable and pleasant hotel staffer that I have ever met!! See you again soon Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for large family”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Staying in New York with four children aged 6 to 12 years was a pleasure. We had booked a ”Magnifique Family” package, and stayed for four nights in superior rooms at the 16th floor. The staff was very friendly and helpful. One of our daughters has a gluten-allergy, and it was no problem finding the right food for her. The breakfast was great, with american sized portions, delicious croissants, european-style bread, lavazza coffee for the adults and hot chocolate for the children. The beds were very comfortable. The bath tub was a bit on the small side, but he shower was nice. We would like to come back!

Reviews.Title: “View, what view? Of a wall”
Reviews.Author: BobK898
Reviews.Content: Was upgraded to a junior suite, unfortunately not high enough. The room was eternally dark and dreary with a view of another wall and HVAC equipment. Great location. Do not allow them to put you low, felt like we were in someone's basement.

Reviews.Title: “SoBed - so worth it”
Reviews.Author: IcarusFlyer Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The one thing that keeps me coming back to Sofitel hotels is the bed. It's the best night's sleep! I collect A-Club points on business trips in various hotels and always look forward to using them in this and other Sofitel hotels. As a Platinum member, I get a room upgrade and a welcome drink (champagne or cocktails) for both my partner and me.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, clean and close”
Reviews.Author: Pusskka
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the Sofitel NYC. Very large room for NYC, great bathroom with luxurious shower and all the vanity trimmings you could ask for. Close to the touristy stuff, but far away enough for some quiet. Would love to stay again!! Staff were very nice and Lo'Occtaine bathroom products a lovely French touch.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located but not really a 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: AddAdrTA
Reviews.Content: Ideal location. Had quite a large room for the NY standard (same for the bathroom). The staff was ok but nothing more. The furnitures, carpet and curtains were a bit tired and colors were sad. The bar is not the Sofitel's bar and ordinary. I didn't experience the breakfast as it was too expensive. Compared to the nearby Novotel (which has a very nice view on TImes Square for some of the rooms), I'm not conviced it disurves its 4 stars ... There are so many other nice hotels in NYC that I would not recommend this one

Reviews.Title: “Second time round - Even better”
Reviews.Author: Leese25
Reviews.Content: We travelled to New York for the Easter holidays and had booked a Junior suite as we were bringing our teenager with us this time. We were allocated room 2906, which although did not have as good a view as last year in room 2922 - it was far roomier. The lounge area turned into our daughter's bedroom and the once we asked for the bedding on the sofa bed to be changed from sheets and blankets to a duvet, it was as good as the main bedroom. They changed the mattress on the sofa bed to what felt like a Tempur mattress with the duvet and bedding that this hotel is known for. We have never slept in such comfortable beds! The bathroom is huge - you could have a party in there. The hotel left anniversary cake for us, which was a delightful thought. The only difference between last years stay and this year was the complimentary bathroom soaps etc are now Hermes, which is very luxurious. I could not fault this hotel in any way. The staff are polite, professional and attentive. The rooms are spotless, spacious, comfortable and clean. The location for us is perfect. What more could you possibly want? I know there are plenty of hotels in New York, but I will not go to another. Why bother when you have found perfection?!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Beds very comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Edgingin
Reviews.Content: It's definitely on the high end of 4 TripAdvisor circles, overall. The pros: the beds, the location, large-ish bathroom with separate tub/shower, nice gym, basic rooms are ok size for NYC (although the basic room is a queen not a king-sized bed). Everyone was very polite and attentive. The cons: cushy hotel room carpet might be a benefit for some but to me it's just...ick. Also, for my taste, they went a little overboard with the whole "we're a French hotel" thing. All basic greetings are given in French (on the phone, at the desk, in the corridors). Amusingly, when I replied in French with more than a brief response, one particular employee seemed stunned (maybe it was my accent). Overall, the hotel has the potential of being a good value for the right rate and the location really is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “My best stay in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I stayed in. On my next trip to NY, I'll make sure to check at the Sofitel. Breakfasts were more than expected and the pancakes were awesome. Check on the breakfast "a la francaise". Love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Retreat from Times Square!”
Reviews.Author: Laura0576
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel is lovely - it is a really nice and quiet escape from the hustle and bustle down below. The rooms are super quiet and you cannot hear anything outside. The beds are super comfortable (and best pillows EVER) Great gym, room service, Bar etc Only negatives are that the front door service can be hit and miss (sometimes they help, others they dont) - but this is totally minor...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in Central location for Tourists”
Reviews.Author: shortcake42
Reviews.Content: 10 / 10 for a city break hotel. Gorgeous room, huge bathroom and minutes from times square. Couldn't have asked for more. Love this hotel and will return whenever in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location & location”
Reviews.Author: Jill1056
Reviews.Content: Briliant located hotel, less then 5 minutes walk to Times Sqyare and the heart of NY. Unbelievable beds which were a god-send after a full day sight-seeing. Room typical city sized but well laid out and only lacking tea making facilities (which we asked for and were given a kettle). Highly recommend and would stay there on next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven”
Reviews.Author: AprilTraveler_71
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited NY for the first time April 15 - 17th, and the Sofitel Hotel was a beacon of light in our stormy arrival. Our original flight was canceled, then they lost our luggage so it was a pleasure to arrive at a hotel that was not only super chic, but welcoming and clean!. The bed was the softest and most comfortable I've ever slept. I love this hotel and would highly recommend it to anyone visiting NY.

Reviews.Title: “Excelled all expectations!!!!”
Reviews.Author: boblinsydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights at the end of March to celebrate our 30th wedding aniversary.From the moment we arrived we were treated like royalty..It was our first time to New York and staying here helped make it a great stay and a longing to return.The luxury beds were heavenly and I don't think I have ever slept so soundly while on holidays.The staff from housekeeping to the doorman, conceierge and front desk were all vey pleasant and felt they couldn't do enough for us.The room was very spacious,as was the bathroom with Hermes toiletries, bathrobes and slippers.The room was well appointed with flat srceen tv and comfortable loung chair and footstool. Thanks once again to all the Sofitel staff for making our stay very memorable, we will definatley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!!”
Reviews.Author: Kelwood
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel New York is right in the middle of everywhere you would want to be, but tucked away enough to avoid the noise of Time Square. It is 1 block away from Broadway theaters, 5th Avenue shopping and of course Time Square. Once in your room however, you could be anywhere as they are sound proofed very well- no noise to be heard. The service at the Sofitel was great. Housekeeping visited twice a day ensuring everything was neat and tidy. The room service menu had a good variety of options and the restaurant allowed for early pre-theater show dining. Our room was a luxury king room (hoping for a bit more room) and it was large enough for us to enjoy. The bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom doors were a little awkward but that's a very minor point. We enjoyed our stay at the Sofitel and would stay there again on our next visit to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in March 2011”
Reviews.Author: Strohfamily
Reviews.Content: We're a family of 4 (2 adults and 2 kids) and we stayed in New York Sofitel for 3 nights. This is a great hotel, very conveniently situated and we absolutely loved the beds - rooms were spacious and we also had breakfast which was divine!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: gibraltarwgtn
Reviews.Content: Should have done this review earlier but better late than never. We stayed in the New York Sofitel and the one in Washington and couldn't have picked better. It's expensive but not particularly so when considering US prices but worth every penny. The service is impeccable, French style is obvious and the New York one is perfect for doing the tourist thing in Times Square. Just can't say enough about this place, it was a perfect Oasis when the hustle of New York got too much. Beds are some of the best we've slept on and we've been lucky enough to stay in some really nice hotels on our travels. Would go back tomorrow if we could! We have such wonderful memories of New York and the Sofitel was part of that. Excellent gym too!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: JRNA
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very nice and the service is wonderful. It is an international hotel so has a European feel. The staff is friendly and very helpful. Our room was a great size (we were worried about that after hearing how small the rooms are in New York) We had a queen bed, two comfortable chairs a small table and did not feel cramped. The closet had good storage. The hotel furnishings were very nice and the hotel was very clean. We never felt rushed to get out so they could clean the room daily. The lobby and sitting areas were beautiful. The exercise room was well equipped and very nice. The location was great! Could not have been better. You could exit the hotel on either 44th or 45th and Starbucks was right across the street on 45th. I really liked everything about this hotel. I can see where paying for interenet could be an issue but it wasn't for me. There are computers in the lobby to use if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel! Elegant, quiet with top notch service.”
Reviews.Author: Brian D
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about our stay. We were celebrating our anniversary. They upgraded us to a Jr. Suite, delivered a decadent dessert on the first night, and treated us like kings. Service and the whole experience was awesome. Location was great. It is on a quiet block only 2 blocks from Times Square and the theatre district. There is a coffee shop across the street and a nice diner with great food on the block as well. Is also in a good location to walk up to the 5th Avenue shopping district and down to the Empire State building. If you pre-pay you save 10% on the room night cost. Room price was the same or less than the big hotels around Times Square but better by a mile.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location comfortable room and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: raymondwilk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel for 6 nights in from Tuesday 22 March. At check in i was upgraded to a better room than I booked and the room I received on the 18th floor was reasonably spacious and very comfortable. The room was very clean and had a view of 45th street at the back of the hotel, the street was not noisy. The location is wonderful right in the centre of town in the theatre district. I appreciated that there were three computers in a room in the lobby that were free for guest use but the hotel also had a high internet connection in the room for about $39. for a week. (or $10.00 a day). I thought that the concerge whose name was Rene was excellent he has an excellent knowlege of NYC and was able to recommend appriopriate places to eat and explain transport options while being friendly and professional and discuss tourist sites that were worth visiting. Some times it was difficult to get a taxi quickly as the sofitel is further along the one way street street than other hotels and so the other hotels often got free taxis first. However the door men seemed to get a taxi by being persistant and this was a minor irritation.Overall a great central location and i would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience, Cost and Comfort”
Reviews.Author: FLLtourist
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Sofitel several times over the past few years and always have a great experience. The location is wonderfully convenient for both shopping and theater. As usual, the front desk staff, the concierge, and even housekeeping were all cheery and helpful. Remember, this is New York. Don't expect to do the city on a budget. We find the Sofitel is a good deal for what it costs! The room was a decent size, the bed was comfy, and the bathroom was spacious and well appointed (love, love, love the magnifying mirror). This is the only hotel where we've ever managed to sleep in until 11am! I thank the Sofitel for the blackout curtains that really work and the lack of noise from outside, the hallways and the cleaning staff! This trip, we ate at the Gaby for dinner... dinner was decent and incredibly convenient pre-theater (without the frenetic dining at the restaurants in the theater district). In past visits, we found the brunch to be an elegant experience (but if you're on a tight budget, go to the Red Flame down the street). Again, an overwhelmingly positive experience. But if I had to make one suggestion to the hotel, it would be that it's time for them to provide free Wi Fi in the rooms. In any event, we'll be back (with or without free Wi Fi).

Reviews.Title: “Very good quality hotel with a fantastic location in the middle of Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: azalie
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights at Sofitel New York in February 2011. Its an excellent hotel, of a quality on par with its price, and a great deal for location. I'm a native New Yorker (and staying here only because I'm too lazy to deal with weekend train schedules to attend a work conference that started at 7 AM) and can confidently say that its location is fantastic for a tourist. Located within a 10 minute walk to Times Square, Grand Central, Rockefeller Center, and Herald Square, and most of the major subway lines. Its really right in the middle of Manhattan. Doorman at hand, the concierge/bag check right when you enter, followed by small lobby area with comfy leather seating, a small room on the side (entrance visible when you leave, not when you enter) with three computer terminals offering free internet access, and at the end, the main counter to the left. Decor is classy and simple, leathers and warm woods. Service was ubiquitous, friendly, and attentive; some spoke French and/or with a French accent, which was a pleasant touch if not really necessary. Check-in was efficient. Turn-down service in the evening was sweet, with ambient lighting and classical music playing as you enter. I stayed in a 6th floor king bed room, which was large, of similar decor theme as the rest of the hotel, with good quality furniture, fixtures, and linens. The set-up around the bed was beautifully designed, including the lighting, artwork above the bed, and side tables. Bed was firm and very comfortable. The bathroom has a double door entry without locks. There is a separate glass-enclosed shower stall in addition to a tub. Bathroom was roomy and good quality, with an adjustable magnifying mirror and large, frame-lit vanity mirror. L'Occitane bath products were a plus. Mirrored closet space with lights inside, flat screen television, chair with side table, and work desk completed the room. Wi-fi in the rooms is an extra cost per night; the lobby terminals help but that's an outdated method of providing internet access. My room had no view to speak of (the back of buildings) so I just kept the curtain closed, but that didn't matter much to me. There's a fitness center open 24 hours but I didn't make use of it. I enjoyed my stay here and would highly recommend it for out of town guests.

Reviews.Title: “First Time in NYC - Sofitel was excellent.”
Reviews.Author: TrvlDn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, looking forward to our first trip to NYC, booked reservations through Expedia at the Sofitel Hotel on 44th Street in midtown Manhattan. From the beginning, the service was friendly, courteous, and efficient. The room itself was a standard size room (unbeknowst to us we had been upgraded to a higher floor), clean and comfortable. The Sofitel hotels are apparently known for their comfortable beds and this was no exception. The thick comforter was warm and soft - sleep came easily the first night. I should mention that we did not eat in the hotel since there were so many restaurants and coffee shops in the immediate area. Across the street, good coffee can be had at Gregory's Coffee, and good food at a reasonable price can be eaten at the Red Flame a few doors down from the Sofitel. One the word: the area where the Sofitel is located is extremely well situated for almost all of the theaters in midtown; the subway lines are closeby, and it's a short walk to a lot of the major sites (Empire State Bldg, Grand Central Terminal, Chrysler Bldg, Times Square, etc.) It's really crowded and noisy on the streets, but once you were inside the hotel and your room, it was extremely quiet. What a good way to rest up... Needless to say, my wife and I enjoyed our time in NYC and especially at the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Great position, staff impersonal and generally unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: FlyingSomewhere
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff never lifted their head to acknowledge us, bellmen disinterested and chatting to each other. We didn't even bother to interact with staff here as none seemed interested in guests. The hotel is in a fantastic position, and has lovely decor in lounge and restaurant. Our room (upgraded apparently) was ok, but not as soundproof as I would have liked from corridor noise. I had to remind the hotel of my platinum status, even though it was in email to them. Asked for a kettle/jug and cups, got the jug, no cups.. then housekeeping took the cups away and didn't replace them.. just what we had come to expect of the staff training/interest unfortunately. Restaurant was excellent, and very quiet. Recommending the hotel for its fantastic position, rooms are good, relatively quiet..

Reviews.Title: “will come back on my next visit”
Reviews.Author: eldoud11
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to New York with my wife, and we are glad to have chosen SOFITEL We had a very nice room, spacious, clean and the bed was so comfortable . Could not asked for better! Not just the location is so convenient, food was indeed exquisite and service was very attentive. I would definitely recommend SOFITEL to my all of my friends and for sure will come back there on my next visit to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Location and bed the best thing about the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: Ranjini050
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Sofitels in Europe and was disappointed with this one. Sofitel is reknowed for their beds and pillows - and in this Sofitel did not deviate from the high standard. The bathroom was dated and not up to standard, but the maids (always friendly and nice) kept it clean. The imposing dark lobby hid the sometimes unfriendly staff. I ordered in one night - food was overcooked and not edible. When I mentioned this to the staff I was told that it was not appropriate for me to raise this. Location is fantastic and the bed is great however it is neither a five or four star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: queenoftherow
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent, I have stayed here twice now and would 100% reccommend it. The rooms are excellent, the service is excellent and the location is right inbetween Times Square and Fifth Avenue BUT still in a quiet street. The hotel bar is fantastic. I am a really fussy traveller but this hotel is fab.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: emz_M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel New York in October 2010 for 6 nights. Check-in was quick and efficient. The lobby is elegant, containing lots of comfortable couches and 3 computers with internet access. I booked the Superior room, opting to pay a little extra for the privilege of being on a high floor. Having specifically requested a quiet room in advance, I was disappointed that I was placed adjacent to the elevators. This was far from ideal as I could hear people coming and going throughout the night and early hours of the morning. The room, equipped with a soft queen size bed, mini-bar and flat screen TV, was spacious, comfortable and clean. The bathroom is lovely, outfitted with a marble bath, separate walk in shower, hair dryer and L’Occitane products. I ate at the Restaurant once and service was ridiculously slow. I didn’t particularly mind as I had already checked out and was passing some time before my flight. Had the circumstances been different, I would have chosen to eat elsewhere. The hotel is centrally located in midtown on 44th Street between 5th and 6th Avenues. Times Square, Empire State Building, Museum of Modern Art, Rockefeller Centre, Grand Central Terminal and even Central Park are all within walking distance. This was great for me as I attended four Broadway shows during my stay and never had to walk more than 10 minutes when returning to the hotel. Overall, my stay at the Sofitel was very pleasant but a few improvements could have made it exceptional. I wouldn’t rule out staying there again but will try somewhere different next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great in all respects”
Reviews.Author: bostowyo
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel is in a fantastic mid-town location. Steps to Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Empire State Building, etc. The lobby is large and comfortable. The room was good-sized with a large bathroom (especially by NYC standards) with separate shower and tub. I had a great view of the Chrysler building out my window. Large closet space as well. Furnishings and amenities were very nice - flat screen TV, L'Occitaine bath products, Evian water, and a box of four fancy chocolates every night. The Concierge was very helpful. I arrived early (noon-ish) and my room was ready for me. Quibbles: WiFi is $9.95 a day. It should be included. The restaurant is very expensive - $28 for an omelette? But there are lots of good restaurants nearby. There is a pretty nice fitness area and three computers in the lobby. I would definitely stay at the Sofitel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - but a bit more attention needed”
Reviews.Author: MarcoInnsbruck
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sofitel New York for 2 nights in September 2011 together with my spouse. The hotel has a great location - just a view minutes away from Time Square. The rooms are as spacious as you can expect them in a ultra city center location and offer everything you need. I heard about the Sofitel beds in the past from some friends and I have to say that I was not disappointed at all. Sleeping on a cloud cannot be anything better than that. Apart from the room I cannot comment too much on the hotel as we had a room only deal and decided to eat outside even for the breakfast. Only thing that bothered me a little was the attention to details which you could expect from a 5star hotel. At check-in I explained that my airline lost my luggage but no assistance was offered - not even a dental or shaving kit to serve my basic needs after a 14 hours trip. I asked the concierge to call the airport from time to time to check about my luggage - but he just told me that it will arrive, so I don't need to worry. When in the afternoon of my second day in the hotel I still could not find any luggage in my room I went down to the concierge again just to find out that my luggage was already waiting for me there. For how long? I don't know... I did not even get a message into my room to inform me that it had arrived. Back home I realized that I forgot some luggage at the hotel which was quickly sent to my by UPS - it was even freshly washed and ironed! I'd certainly recommend this hotel to all of my friends going to NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: Julien006
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in New York City many times (both for business and pleasure). This is one of the only hotel I will stay at from now on. The staff is professional and attentive. The concierge desk is very helpful. The rooms are just great. I am unsure of the mattress brand but I slept like a baby. This is my go-to hotel in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “3rd time guest”
Reviews.Author: hollywood41194
Reviews.Content: While I have stayed in the majority of hotels in New York, this must be my favourite. Sofitel has proven to be a name I can trust and I will return very soon. A big thank you to the concierge staff for helping to locate my suitcase.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: A.MACCA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Feb 2010 and Mar 2010 and had stayed in various hotels before in NYC the Waldorf etc We decided to try this hotel due to the reviews and the location near to TIMES SQUARE etc The room was excellent and we had asked before hand if we could have a nice view - we got a view of the Chrysler building. The staff were excellent and we both enjoyed the service, the lovely room and reception area. Rooms modern witha French chic about them.... We stayed for my birthday and received a complimentary birthday cake which my partner loved! Would i stay again in a SOFITEL hotel ..yes i would. Thoroughly enjoyed it Would recommend and stay again

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oli_M_1980
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a 4 night stay in the Sofitel New York. Firstly, this hotel is wonderful and I would highly recommend it. LOCATION - Midtown on 44th Street inbetween 5th and 6th Avenue. The location is excellent, and with in walking distances of alot on the main attractions. This part of 44th street is nice and quiet, and perfect for what we wanted. 2 blocked over towards 7th Avenue you will find Times Square (very busy) I am so glad I didnt choose a hotel there right in the middle of all the hustle and bustle. When we first got to the hotel and walked into the lobby / reception area, you could tell straight away that this was going to be a great place to stay (and we were not wrong). It had that classy / luxury feel about it. Check in /check out - perfect, no problems and no waiting around. ROOMS - Rooms were very spacious, clean and comfortable. Bathroom have a bath and large shower. It was a very classy bathroom. Now the bed was AWESOME. Very big and probably the most comfortable that we have stayed in. Even to the point that just before we checked out, my wife decided to take the covers off the pillows and bed to check the labels to see what they were. (sad? Probably!!) We thought we might see if we could find them online, which we did and which we realised they were very expensive, so we wont be purchasing them!! oh well!! The one day it was raining when we went outside. The doorman had a large umbrella which he gave us to use for the day. Little things like that go along way. So overall this hotel is brilliant. It was so nice, especially after and packed and tiring day of sightseeing to come back to such a wonderful hotel to have a chill out before going out for the evening and then getting back to recharge the batteries for the following day. If you are wanting to stay in Midtown - THIS IS THE PLACE TO STAY.

Reviews.Title: “Another great Sofitel!!!”
Reviews.Author: KatD59
Reviews.Content: I've found Sofitel to be reliable worldwide and the NYC Sofitel is no exception. Location is great to 5th avenue and Times Square. Beds are comfortable. Very clean and euro modern. Bar was exceptional. Great Service all around. Nice size rooms. Will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: rcharles13
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights and must say it was a very nice hotel. Rooms were big, spacious and clean. The best part was the Sobed, which was absolutely brilliant and had the best nights sleep ever! If you want to stay in Mid town then this is perfect location, between 5th and 6th avenue, with a short walk to time square, empire state building, grand central We didn't really eat in the restaurant as it was pretty expensive. Red Flame diner about 50 metres away for breakfast was perfect or Gregorys coffee opposite. Pastis in greenwich village is brilliant too. All in all a great hotel to stay in, great location, friendly staff, reasonably priced for how nice the rooms are.

Reviews.Title: “Fab-u-lous”
Reviews.Author: Karen C
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel!! Have stayed in the Alex, Helmsley and Tribeca Grand before and the Sofitel beats them all for location and everything else. We arrived early for check in but had a room arranged immediately and as per my request, a view of the Chrysler Buillding. The rooms were fantastic with the Bose radio, gorgeous beds and bedlinen and Hermes toileteries in the wonderful bathroom (with bath and walk in shower). The staff are very helpful and unobtrusive and attention to detail was excellent. We did not have breakfast (there is an excellent diner at the end of the street) but had an evening meal in the restaurant which was delicious. Would highly recommend this hotel. It is centrally located yet in a quiet and exclusive street (44th between 5th and 6th Avenues). When next back in NYC I will not even consider anywhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “three star service and quality”
Reviews.Author: truecolors05
Reviews.Content: Wanted to try the Sofitel after reading so many amazing reviews of the hotel on Tripadvisor. Arrived on time for 4 pm check-in but the room was still not ready. they offered us two free drinks at the bar while we waited. The two of three wine samples from a tasting menu were very bad as if they had been sitting out too long. They were out of the 3rd one and the replacement one was good. Checked into the room around 4:30pm. The room (one BR king suite) was nice sized but had an aged look to it; a hair was still in the bathtub, multiple stains were seen on the sofa, curtain, and the writing desk chair. Bose wave radio and flat screen TV were nice. The bed was too soft and woke up with a backpain. The down comforter was nice and warm but the pillows were not. They were cheaper polyester of some sort and too high so I slept most of the night without the pillows and woke up with a neck pain. My hubby woke up with a bad backache. There were multiple series of clicking noise from the wall next to the bed all throughout the night which woke me up a few times but strangely stopped in the morning. The shower was small but had a nice rainshower head; water pressure is on the low side. We had views of many rooftops of adjacent buildings and street.
