We checked out earlier than planned because I didn't find the room relaxing. We asked the bellhop to hold our bags until early afternoon; when we returned they had trouble finding our second bag. This is not a luxury or even a 4 star hotel in quality or service but is conveniently located. We will go back to the Trump SoHo, the Pierre, or the Four Seasons for clean luxury and comfort, and better service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: derbycityvisitor
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, good value for NYC, and a terrific location. We stayed over Christmas. The rooms are relatively small but hey its New York. The walls need sound proofing as we could hear the people in the next room talking. The food was only average. The concierge was very helpful. The hotel has a small but satisfactory gym. The lounge is very nice. We don't hang around hotels very much when we visit the City but I would recommend this hotel for its location, cleanliness and value.

Reviews.Title: “ANOTHER AWESOME STAY AT SOFITEL NYC”
Reviews.Author: TMCNEWS
Reviews.Content: SOFITEL is only 2 blocks off of Times Square, close enough to feel like you are right in the center of the action and far enough away to enjoy a quiet night sleeping. The staff is very professional and there to help you without being intrusive. ARRIVAL: You are greeted by a Bellman and taken into the hotel where you can either leave the bag(s) with him or take them yourself to the front desk. My suggestion would be to take a look at how busy they are inside of the lobby before leaving your bags. If they are swamped you might want to take them with you to the front desk. Even if your room is not ready and you want to check your bags the front desk will take care of that for you. On the other hand, if the room is ready you can head right up stairs with your bags. FRONT DESK: The staff at the front desk has always been very professional and helpful. On one visit when my room was not ready the staff member invited me to have a drink on the house at Gaby’s. She then, instead of just pointing me in the direction of, she walked me into the restaurant and then returned shortly to inform me that the room was ready. THE ROOM: I have always stayed in their Junior Suite so I can only speak about that type of room. These rooms are approximately 650 Sq ft with a living room, bedroom and a large bathroom. The rooms are very quiet, unless you open a window to hear some of the noises Manhattan has to offer. I mainly leave a window open myself because I do enjoy hearing the sounds of the City and the flow of fresh air. The living room has a couch and chair along with a work desk with a chair. There are plenty of lights throughout the room if you’re into well lit rooms. The bed is extremely comfortable with plenty of pillows to choose from. I have seen some people comment at the fact that the beds do not offer a bed sheet, it’s only a comforter. I will agree with this concern only because the comforter is very warm and sometimes you could just use a sheet. This issue would not keep me from returning however. There are small reading lights on the headboard if you want to do a little reading before sleeping. Also, when you close the drapes your room is practically blacked out – a nice touch for a good night’s sleep. THE BATHROOM: I cannot speak about the bathroom amenities only because I travel with my own but there are plenty provided on the sink and in the shower. One of the selling points of SOFITEL for me is the fact that they provide a separate tub and stand alone shower. The tub even has a shower wand. I believe this is the case with all types of rooms within SOFITEL. HOUSEKEEPING: Well, here is where SOFITEL excels for sure. I do not have one bad thing to say about this staff. When you return at the end of the day of doing whatever it is you do out in the City the room looks just like it did when you first entered. When you talk with the staff in the hallways they are always very polite and professional. They do not just say hello while running by you. I do not want to ramble on too long about this but I have always commented to the hotel management after my stays and Housekeeping always gets the highest marks. I would suggest to anyone staying there to leave a nice tip on the pillow for these hard working people. PUBLIC AREAS: The hotel lobby and other areas have always been very clean and smell nice. I have noticed while sitting in the lobby that as staff members walk through, from Bellmen to even managers, will go adjust pillows on the couches or clean off a table if needed. The gym, located in the basement is also clean and ready with plenty of towels. CHECKOUT: When checking out the staff member will always ask you how your stay was and if they could have done anything to make it better. One thing I have noticed is when they ask you they are actually paying attention to you – it’s not like they are just reading off of a card. I also had the pleasure of meeting the General Manager of SOFITEL during my most recent checkout. He too asked how my stay was and I believe that he was genuine when he said he wanted to know if they could have done anything to make my stay better. From the GM, to the Bellman, to the Housekeeping staff and everyone else wearing a SOFITEL uniform, the staff is outstanding. I have seen some people comment that SOFITEL is expensive but worth it and although they are I will also add that if you look you can find dates where their prices are very reasonable and within the range or better than other midtown hotels. I cannot suggest you stay at this hotel enough. Give it a try and if you have any questions I would be happy to answer through Email.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay anywhere else in NYC, this hotel is the ultimate in elegance and luxury”
Reviews.Author: JohnDublin_Ireland
Reviews.Content: The hotel was recommended by well-travelled friends who are very particular about where they stay. This hotel defines the term "hidden gem", great location, beautifully finished, attentive staff and atmosphere of tranquillity in the middle of NYC. Dollar for dollar this can't be beaten, all parts of hotel were immaculate. We really couldn't find fault here. My only concern is that it's growing popularity will mean more difficulty in getting a room, it should be a secret!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended if you are French and homesick.”
Reviews.Author: eh_tonnant_voyageur
Reviews.Content: Just coming back from a new stay at Sofitel Manhattan. This time, I had a “superior” room (which is in fact the cheapest, I guess), level 6, and was a bit surprised of some traces of tear & wear, mainly on the doors. And again, I gave up in the queue to access the Concierge. Maybe the management will add some day more people behind this desk, so that I can get a restaurant booked instead of managing on my own. Except for that, compared to a prior experience, I should say that reception improved a lot, and there was no noise in the room, either from the outside or from other rooms, so this confirms that problem I had last time was indeed relating to level 29. What else? Location is perfect, as everybody noticed. And of course the most comfortable beds possible, just a tad of luxury, and a nice bar and restaurant, where, you can find real croissants at breakfast, and all the snobbish Paris crowd who was coming over for Valentine's. Feeling like if I was back home again, really.

Reviews.Title: “Always great”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times and have always had wonderful service . The rooms are always clean and comfortable and a good size. I love the location, easy to walk up to Times Square or along 5th Ave. to the Park.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: EstebanMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sofitel for 4 nights for a long winter weekend getaway. The hotel is very classy, and the rooms are very fresh, clean and nice albeit on the medium/smaller side. I called ahead to ask the concierge to order and deliver fresh flowers to the room for my wife and they did a great job - even when our arrival was delayed by a day - the beautiful flowers were in the room upon arrival. The front desk was great. We had to book an extra night because of the snow storm delaying our arrival. So being last minute the rates were very high. So I booked a queen room instead of the king - but they allowed us to stay in the king we were in - and not move - with no upcharge. That was quite nice. The concierge helped with a few things fine. The only thing was when we asked about a nice jazz club nearby, they sent us to a dumpy place - nothing classy like the hotel or the weekend we had planned. The other thing was when we asked about a nice piano bar, they twice directed us to the same place - but it was a jazz club with a huge cover. no piano. Other than that, the location is great - right off 5th ave. on 44th street - we could walk to Del Frisco's for a steak and to Grand Central and Times Square. Just a very nice weekend. I highly recommend it. Just find your own jazz club or piano bar..........

Reviews.Title: “Superb place to base yourself in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Sofitels all over the world. The chain is great, and this particular Sofitel is, in my opnion, one of the best in the chain. Every detail is attended to, every courtesy extended. Arriving there after a flight across the US, or the Atlantic, feels like coming home. Now, if I could just convince them to put the lovely free coffee out before 7 AM.....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Beds, Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: srcaOntario
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location - a short walk to Times Square but far enough away from the chaos. The beds were so comfortable, had 4 great nights of sleep. The staff were friendly, the rooms were very clean. No complaints at all. Loved it and can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: B4rb
Reviews.Content: Service was second to none. Even before entering the foyer the welcome and attention was unbelievable. We had previously stayed at one of New York City's so called leading established hotels but never again. In future we would only be staying at the Sofitel in this city. Spotlessly clean, quiet and spacious rooms and very comfortable beds. Excellent location being within walking distance of Times Square, theatres, shopping and wonderful restaurants - all recommendations by the hotel concierge couldn't have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: mikow
Reviews.Content: Very Nice hotel with excellent location in the heart of manhattan.. Very good service, very nice team.. And above all, very calm!!

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit to Sofitel New York....and still the best!!!”
Reviews.Author: englishrose1981
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this wonderful hotel in midtown Manhattan. I think it deserves 5 stars, not just 4. Like my previous visit, I stayed in a suite on a high floor which was outstanding, very spacious with wonderful views of the Chrysler Building from the bedroom and the GE building (Rockefeller Center) from the living room.I especially love the bathrooms at this hotel which feature a bath with a separate shower.Food and drink is very overpriced however, therefore we ate our breakfast at one of many diners in the area, Brooklyn Diner on 43rd st at Times Sq and Juniors Restaurant on 45th st also just off Times Sq were particular favourites of ours.The reception staff were exceptional throughout our stay as were the concierge.All round a really fantastic hotel and I cannot wait to return for a 3rd visit!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: boozinhz
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers excellent service, location is exceptional 5th and Madison Avenues to the left and Broadway/Time square to the right. Wonderful cooked breakfast made to order and attentive, willing staff front concierge to restaurant. Free internet access in the Lobby a bonus. I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Good location, efficient staff and reasonable rates.”
Reviews.Author: DiverDanSydney
Reviews.Content: Pretty convenient for midtown...almost halfway between Times square and Grand Central. The rooms are fairly compact (usual in New York) but well appointed. The rooms were very clean and kept that way. The hotel foyer is quite chic and reflect a certain French style. The staff are friendly enough and efficient. I would not describe it as as a home away from home but it is a good and well run hotel. The breakfast is all a la carte, so don't think you can run in and out. If you ask for it you will get good coffee as well. Internet speed in room s good and rates same as other places. All in all a good spot.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Ann C
Reviews.Content: Just a few blocks from Times Square, but very quiet. Very comfortable clean room. Room service was delivered quickly and the food was good. Very friendly staff. We will go back.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: UX-Director
Reviews.Content: You can tell the quality of the hotel (no bedbugs), attitude and service were great. This was our second stay and the mid range (for NYC) cost is well with it. A great location for Times Square, Broardway and Fifth Avenue, but also so close to Bryant Park (Christmas Market), Grand Central Station (Christmas Market). Only down side, but very funny was that the staff seemed not to consider that lots of people speak and understand French, I listened and understood every word of a conversation between two check out staff members, about out stay and check out that's worthy of mention.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: alfa2727
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel, my wife and i have stayed 4 times now and everytime we have tried another hotel we have regretted it. This last trip we had actually booked 6 nighs at hilton west 57 and left after the first night to come here. I couldn't possible have stayed longer there knowing the Sofitel was infinitely better and just down the road. The Sofitel just seems to hit the spot for what we look for for a short city break, we spend all day out shopping and sightseeing and the evenings out for dinner so i have no idea what the restaurants or room service are like, but the rooms are so comfortable, the beds are amazing, i think you would have to spend 2 or 3x more to improve them. It is also perfectly located to explore the city on foot, there are computers in the lobby to use if you need, there are always doormen to find you cabs and welcome you back. I have twice made the mistake of trying other hotels and I won't make the mistake again!! My only suggestion is i wish there was free wifi in the rooms, it always bothers me when yous have to pay an unfairly high fee to access it, but at least there are the free computers in the lobby to check in online etc

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Town! Great Staff and Rooms”
Reviews.Author: AussieMelb2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite for three nights, just after the New Year and it was great. There were only two suites in the area. There was also a door which we could shut if we wanted more privacy. Only guests with keys to the two suites behind the door have access to the area. There was a walk-in robe, a very spacious bedroom with a very comfortable bed, separate bath and shower and a separate lounge room in the suite. Staff at the hotel were also very warm and helpful. Bellboys were keen to assist when we arrived and one staff looked genuinely concerned and offered to assist when he saw the amount of luggage we had. Check-in process was smooth and staff were very welcoming. The hotel had a ‘homely’ feel to it which was great, especially since we’ve been travelling around for about a month before getting to this hotel. Having stayed at many other luxury hotels on our travels this is definitely the best! We’d highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York and we’ll definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “There is no reason to check elsewhere !”
Reviews.Author: CandS2009
Reviews.Content: Just like other die hard Trip Advisor users I scoured the site before making my plans at the Sofitel in NYC. From the staff to the room and everything in between it was exquisite ! I called the hotel direct and spoke to Sandra in reservations. She was very pleasant and accommodating after telling her I was coming to NYC from Florida just for the weekend to propose to my now fiance'. She went out of her way to get my a reasonable room rate on an executive suite and the view of the city I had requested. On top of that I spoke Julia who is the executive assistant to the manager Jorge Tito and she made the stay with them exceptional. She had a bottle of champagne and some chocolates waiting in our room, the lights were on, tv's set to music, and let us check in early. I could not have expected anything more ! We visit NYC at least once every year for leisure and I assure you I will not stay anywhere else now. The location as you have probably already read is central to subways, theater, and all of the other major attractions NYC has to offer. We walked down to the new trendy market Eataly from the hotel and while it was very cold it took us about 15 minutes at the most. Thanks again to Sandra, Julia, and the Jorge Tito for making this special occasion one that we will always remember.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Travelman88
Reviews.Content: I know it's expensive but it's worth it. The rooms are fantastic and the service is out of this world. If you can swing it I highly recommend that you get access to the club lounge.....a wonderful place to unwind other than your room. They have fabulous food and they go all out to make you feel special. I go in January every year....actually headed there Jan 8, 2011. The rooms are great.... I LOVE IT !

Reviews.Title: “Comfort & Luxury”
Reviews.Author: VDtravels
Reviews.Content: Sofitel NY has the most comfortable beds ever! Down feather mattress cover, down pillows and down comforter. Floor to ceiling windows overlooking midtown Manhattan. Amenities in the bathroom are by Hermes (which I've never seen before) The scent caters more to men but that's not bad; as most hotel scents cater to women. Service at the front desk, bell men & guys in front hailing cabs was excellent. Unfortunately, the Concierge had a bit of an attitude. Overall a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Escape in New York”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stay here at least a week every year. This hotel is on a great block with terrific restaurants. The hotel has a private feel. Quiet, good bar and restaurant. Very attentive staff. No long hallways. Every room is relatively close to the elevators (no noise issues) and the elevators always arrive within a few seconds of pressing the button. Rooms are good size with a pleasant, open feel.

Reviews.Title: “A luxurious hotel - a beautiful stay!”
Reviews.Author: mgbecker
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a very nice hotel,really more like a 5 star than a 4 star. The bed and bedding make sleeping a delight, and even little things like the soaps and other products are very high quality. I would love to repeat the holiday - it was very hard to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for New Year in Times Square”
Reviews.Author: WNelson
Reviews.Content: We wanted to spend new year in New York, and having stayed at the hotel before were keen on staying here due to its quality and location. It was superb. Could not fault anything about the hotel - it was clean, classy and perfectly located for all the main attractions in NY. After spending new year in Times Square we were back in the hotel by 12.30. The only thing that would have been the icing on the cake was if there were tea/coffee facilities in the room. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: SteveDV
Reviews.Content: Spent New Years Eve in Times Square and stayed at the Sofitel. Great location to walk to Central Park, Times Square, Macy's, Rockefeller Center. Beautiful room, great service, great bed. Ate at Stage Deli, Capital Grill and Tony's Di Napoli - all worth it! Definitely would stay here again. All Hotels in NYC are expensive but we were pleased with the price and the location of the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: TooNyce4Wrdz
Reviews.Content: First off, I would like to say Sonia in Reservations is a star!!! I was actually booked at the Le Parker Merdien, but after I spoke to the Reservations agent there, I was like ehhhh. He sounded like a total robot, didn't tell me anything about the hotel and not very "welcoming. " I look for these things when I'm calling a hotel; that is your first impression of the hotel, well to me it is. I actually work in the hospitality industry also, so they train us on this :-D Sonia was extremely friendly, engaging and answered all the questions I had. She found out the "purpose of my stay" and accomodated my preferences based on that. She was down to earth but maintained her professionalism at the same time. Because of her welcoming attitude, I cancelled my reservation at the Meridien. Koodos to Sonia!!! Now about my hotel stay... It was good. I had a Luxury King room on the 10th floor. The bed was comfy, the hotel lovely, room service food very good and a great location. However, a few drawbacks. I asked for a microwave twice, but never got any follow-up as to if they had one or not. I had to call a third time the next day to find out they didn't have any available. I didn't mind that they didn't have one, but all I ask for is a simple follow-up. The doormen didn't seem too "interested" either. I saw one texting on his phone! All in all, it was a good stay. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great NYC weekend with my daughter”
Reviews.Author: lcf2001
Reviews.Content: My 9 year old daughter and I stayed at the Sofitel for a long weekend in early October and we had a wonderful time. The room was beautiful and impeccably clean and the hotel is well located for a visit to NYC with a child (Central Park zoo, Broadway, museums and toy stores...). The service was good, but one of the concierge was keen to refer us to a restaurant that had the word tourist trap written all over it. Thankfully, when I inquired to the other concierge later in the day, his recommendation was much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great every time”
Reviews.Author: correspondence_x
Reviews.Content: I love Sofitels, and this one is right up there. Great location, spacious rooms, perfect beds and decor. Can't fault it or them.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: littlejennyren
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel in a central location. My partner took me here to see NYC and it was just perfect. Large rooms, beautiful entrance and right near all the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel - great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Brickers10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights at the beginning of December, as a birthday celebration for my wife. I made the reservation at the start of the year on the basis of recommendations from Tripadvisor, and had told the hotel about the special occasion. The location is fantastic for exploring Manhattan, as it's very close to the main shopping areas, Grand Central Terminal, Bryant Park, Central Park etc.etc. The hotel had placed us in a suite on the top floor, which had a great view across the city. The room was very nice; I can't comment on how the room sizes compared to other hotels across the city, but there was a good sized bedroom and lounge, nice marble bathroom with rainforest type shower and soaking bath, and a small connecting area where there were a couple of wardrobes. The hotel had left a celebration cake for us, which was a nice touch. We never managed to eat a meal there as we were out every night, and we for breakfast we used the Red Flame diner just down the road (which was good value, but be prepared to order immediately and eat even quicker). We drank a couple of cocktails at the bar, and they were nice and not unreasonably priced. The whole hotel has a quite opulent feel, with lots of marble and flowers everywhere. Service was excellent, and the only small negative I would make is that there was only one bath robe in the room, which despite being raised with the concierge, was never rectified. Everyone goes on about the beds; to be honest, because of jet lag and the busy schedule, I would have slept soundly on the floor, but it seemed comfy enough. There were good quality Bose stereos and TV's in both rooms, but again we were too busy to really get the benefit. The rooms were always well cleaned, and very well soundproofed. Overall, we both really enjoyed our stay, and would recommend the hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Hotel, Great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Vanessacmc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here 3 years ago and had such a great stay that we returned on our recent trip. The location is without doubt one of the highlights for this hotel. On 44th St in between 5th and 6th. It really is an ideal location and enabled us to walk to the majority of the attractions we wanted to visit. There are 28 floors in the hotel. If you go for the basic rooms you get placed on floors 1-15 and for the more expensive rooms you are on the higher floors. We were on the 14th floor, which for us was fantastic. There was absolutely no road noise and we had a really good view of the empire state building. The rooms are a very good size and massive double bed, plenty of wardrobe space, ample storage space for luggage and a couple of extra tables and chairs. The bathroom is an excellent size with a separate tub and shower. Plenty of towels and above all some really nice little touches, e.g L'occitane toiletries, cotton wool pads, cotton buds etc. Admittedly its not the cheapest hotel. But for the price you do get friendly staff, very good sized rooms and bathroom and a fab location - I'd happily stay here every time I'm in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could ask for”
Reviews.Author: AnonFromLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my mum for a 4 night shopping trip. This was our fourth trip to New York and this is the best hotel we have stayed at so far. The location could not be better, both for the immediate vicinity and also to travel both up- and down town. We had a twin room on the 23rd floor, the beds and bathroom were great and we requested a coffee machine on arrival which was delivered within minutes. Despite its central location (between 5th and 6th avenues) our room was very quiet. You have to pay for wifi in the rooms (which I find a little annoying in this day and age) but there are 3 computers with free internet access in the lobby. We didn't eat at the hotel but the bar was a nice place to have a drink before or after dinner. All the staff were extremely helpful and friendly and any requests were dealt with promptly. Overall, other than price (but this is New York!!) I can't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Michael813
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sofitel on the 10th of December and the prominent thing that consistent with my stay was the exceptional professionalism and courtesy given by the hotel employees. The main lobby and is beautiful with a lounge to relax in. The rooms were a bit small but everything about the hotel was very clean. The bathrooms were imdeed perfect as well with a separate tub and shower. The location could not have been better as well. It is located about 2 blocks from Grand Central and a quick 10 min walk to Times Square. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-beautiful lobby”
Reviews.Author: TorontoJane
Reviews.Content: We just stayed 3 nights at the Sofitel, guided mainly by trip advisor reviews. The hotel is beautiful, the lobby all decorated and lit up at night with great club chairs to relax in, is stunning. Staff are great, everything is beyond clean and efficient. Our room was underwhelming a bit, mainly because of high expectations. The room a bit small and plain. The bathroom, however, gorgeous and with lots of space and amenities. We paid a high price because of the time of year and based on our stays at other great NYC hotels, I expected a bit more from the room for the price. That said, I would definitely stay again, especially if a better price could be found (which I'm sure it could at different times of the year). The location is excellent with so much within 15-20 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous base for your NYC stay”
Reviews.Author: Coffee4Kate
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were visiting New York for 7 days to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary, experience Thanksgiving Day and to shop, shop shop! I spent considerable time readingTrip Advisor reviews on numerous hotels in NY before booking a Junior Suite at the Sofitel. The suite was great value. We requested a high floor and were given a room on the top floor. The room was generous in proportions (an essential when you are shopping!) and amazingly quiet. The location is less than three blocks south of Rockerfeller Centre and two blocks east of Times Square - making it central to all sights and a quiet haven from the craziness that is NYC. Although minor, the only disappointment was the lack of attention to detail in restocking our mini-bar on a daily basis and replenishing soap in the bathroom. We'll be back at the Sofitel for our next trip to NY.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving haven in NYC”
Reviews.Author: leannegriff
Reviews.Content: Me & my husband booked this hotel based on the fabulous reviews we had seen on Trip Advisor and we were not dissapointed! Everything about this hotel was ideal - perfect location situated between 5th & 6th avenue and only 2 blocks away from Times Square and Central station (perfect for catching the subway). Also a short walk to Broadway perfect to catch a show - we saw Wicked would recomend it at the Gerswin Theatre. The hotel room was very spacious as was the bathroom, the bed was very comfortable too. The conceriege staff where very helpful with directions / queries etc... We didn't eat at the hotel as we were room only - but there are plently of diners and restuarants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Too Much for too less”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Too expensive for this kind of small room it is impossible to stay there more than 2 days we stayed 6 and were very disappointed

Reviews.Title: “False advertising poor customer service.”
Reviews.Author: oggsunset
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms on line for 4 nights. Stayed here before and was happy with hotel. Reservation said high speed Internet access was included but when I went to access it they wanted another 40 bucks. Spoke to desk manager Bassim and he said all I was entitled to was access, if I wanted to use it I had to pay for it. I explained if it was an extra charge the reservation should not list it as an amenity or list it as an extra charge which it did not. No avail. They would rather loose a customer that spends 14 nights a year NYC then provide something that has little to no cost.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL - REALLY GREAT”
Reviews.Author: CRodrigues63
Reviews.Content: Hotel's location is spectacular, very well located. The services of the Hotel very good. The Concierge, receptionists, porters very helpful and friendly. The room with a very good area - and the bed .... very comfortable. My congratulations to the Director General - Jorge Tito and his team! Carla Rodrigues - Portugal

Reviews.Title: “Great location in NYC”
Reviews.Author: lisampls
Reviews.Content: I booked a long weekend (Fri - Mon) over the 4th of July at the Sofitel via Perfect Escapes. We got a deal for $700 for three nights in a luxury king room with extras like early check-in, late check-out, room upgrade, free gift and breakfast each morning. We got in early and they said they could not accomodate us for early check in, so to call back around 3:00...which we did and we were in our room at about 3:30. And for the record, we did not get the room upgrade (they said they were booked) nor did we get a welcome gift....so just realize that when you book a package through Perfect Escapes you may not get all extras - it's completely based on hotel availability (which most likey they will tell you there is no availability.) Know that when you walk in you go all the way through the sitting area and the check-in is to the left. There are a few computers available for use by the sitting area, but when we were there several were not working. I don't remember the situation with wi-fi....I don't believe it's in the room and I believe there is a cost. (Sorry, no help there!) If your room is not ready and you need to use the restroom before you hit the town, they are down one floor...same floor as the fitness center and conference rooms. Anyhoo.....Our room was nice, roomy and clean. King bed, two night stands, a table and two chairs and a desk with a chair (also where the TV sits.) Nice size closet with an iron and board (a plus for me!) and a safe. The bathroom was large with lovely marble...a separate tub and shower and lots of space on the sink area for two people's stuff. The bed was super comfy and the bedding was really nice. Lots of towels in the bath and great L'Occtaine products! Didn't hear outside noise, but it seemed that we could hear everything the people said in the next room. I'm thinking there may have been some alcohol involved there, so perhaps they were just really loud (and not a thin wall problem)....but they were only there one night so after that it was just fine. We were happy to find out that our free breakfast could be in their Gaby restaurant or room service...so we took advantage of the room service each morning. The food always arrived in a reasonable time, was always hot and always very good. We tried several different items and literally, all of them were good....but my favorite - their chocolate croissants! YUMMY! The hotel is in a great location between 5th and 6th. We walked to most places including Times Square, Bryant Park, Rockefellar Center and of course, great shopping! Overall we enjoyed our stay and I would recommend this hotel. The concierge was helpful, the valet guys were really nice and the maids did a great job. I would say the only staffers I didn't get the warm fuzzies from were the folks at check-in / check-out....which is unusual for a Sofitel. I would think they would want to make the best first and final impressions. There are lots of places to stay in NYC, so sometimes the little things (like a smile!) DO make a big difference. Enjoy New York! It's an amazing city!! Happy Travels! Lisampls

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price but service could have been better”
Reviews.Author: kate20091
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Sofitel hotels in several cities now. They always have great locations, great prices when considering the location and are four stars. So is the Sofitel New York. When booking several months ahead you get quite a sizeable room (this beeing NYC) for a great price and the standard is good. We stayed nearly two weeks. The first days we were there the hotel wasn't fully booked. Than we got great service. When the Easter holidays came and the hotel was full, the service slowly got worse. May be they are understaffed? Would we stay here again? Because of the location, standard and price yes. If price wasn't an issue we would try a real five star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sofitel!”
Reviews.Author: FLATraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and would defintely stay here again. Our trip was to see the sights of NYC and the hotel's location is perfect for that. We easily walked to Times Square, Rockefeller Center and even to Central Park once. Subway station easy few blocks away too. We were up on the 25th floor and it was so quite, so we got a great nights sleep each night. Had someone in the room next to us, but never heard them, so no thin walls here. The bathroom is all that the reviews and pictures say it is. So clean and very spacious. Room was good sized, didn't feel it was to small for two adults. Service at the hotel is great. Got a great rate through Expedia. Kept checking on rates and then expedia did a 10% of Expedia rate. Saved us a few bucks. Only used the Gaby restaurant/lounge for drinks one night. Made an excellent chocolate martini. Went to the Red Flame Diner for b-fast one morning just down the street, very good inexpensive option. Tried the Blue Room bar a few hotels down, don't go there, overpriced drinks with no alcohol and irritating bartenders. Would defintely recommend this hotel and hope to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “What a Pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: Southerner057
Reviews.Content: The Sofitelt New York was a truly oasis during a frentic 3 day, New York business trip. From the moment that you arrive, this feeling of home away from home (sorry if it sounds corny), hits you, and I say hits you, because you are just not expecting this sense of welcoming in a Down Town New York Hotel, The "attitude" just stays out of this fine establishment . I just loved to be so close to everything. The superb quality of the Sofitel´s bed was more than a looked forward experience. Great Restaurant, delicious food (Flank steak with caramelized onions!!) try the special of the day, let the maitre d´ decide for you. The bar could have a more efficient service, maybe this was the only negative point of my experience, so stick to the tables by the bar, and not the ones above the bar, maybe what the Sofitel needs is a proper libation site. A great and truly unsuspected detail was to be greeted and escorted by the Hotel's General Manager. I look forward to come back with not hurries.

Reviews.Title: “Restful hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: CliffordM8
Reviews.Content: Booked direct with hotel on internet. Excellent location between 5th and 6th Avenue and 2 blocks from Times Square. Luxury room was spacious, quiet (no outside noise) had a very comfortable bed and a great shower. Recommended if you want a quiet and relaxed stay..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Could not ask for more”
Reviews.Author: StephanieElizabeth
Reviews.Content: Much nicer than the Washinton Sofitel. Great service. Wonderful large and quiet room. Room Service efficent and tasty. Worth every penny. Very quiet. Bed very comfortable. Home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Dog_in_the_fog
Reviews.Content: The only clear advantage this hotel has is the location, in the heart of Manhattan, just a 10 minutes walk from Times Square. The rest I can recall about this hotel was on the bad side. I was expecting something special from the luxury Sofitel chain hotel, however what I got was a rather small room in need of refurbishment. Nothing luxurious at all. We had a room overlooking an ugly backyard. Oh yes, we could see Chrysler building from the window, but that was all about the view. Staff was not friendly, although rather efficient in solving the problems. Overall, I think that it was a waste of money. I also was very disappointed in Sofitel as a trademark for luxury hotels. It is a far better idea to opt for a cheaper Novotel and still to have same level of comfort and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: Graham1961
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sofitel at the end of October and I must say the service was impeccable, the staff were really friendly and could not do enough to help. The bed is so comfortable, had you not been in New York you would not want to get out of it. The location is great, come out of the hotel turn left and you are on 5th Avenue, turn right and you are minutes from Times Square and the Theatre district. At first it may seem pricey, however it is New York and compared to other New York Hotels at around the same price it is miles ahead. We stayed here previously during our honeymoon and Will definately come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. I like this place.”
Reviews.Author: marniemac
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a couple of times and it's a really good option for New York. The location is great - just off 5th Avenue. The Concierge make good restaurant recommendations and staff are helpful by NY standards. Rooms are a good size and very clean. The fitness centre is also pretty good. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great location.”
Reviews.Author: AZtravels_10
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel is in a great location and is nice. I don't think it was worth the money, but you are in NYC where everything is overpriced. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I know it is a French hotel, but I think we were the only Americans in the hotel. A little weird. The rooms were fine, nothing eventful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yidmafioso
Reviews.Content: My wife took me to new york for my 40th birthday . We arrived on 28th october and left on 2nd november . We`ve stayed at this hotel previously in 2008 so knew the layout and the location .My wife had e-mailed the hotel to say it was my birthday and on arrival we were upgraded to a queen superior room . All i can say is the hotel is one of the best i`ve ever stayed in . The rooms are spacious , comfortable , stylishly decorated and immaculately clean , as is the whole hotel . The staff are very helpful and friendly without being over the top and nothing seems like too much trouble .The hotel is superbly situated 5 minutes walk from times square and within easy walking distance of macys , the rockefellar centre , madison square garden and 5th avenue . . Despite being so close to the major tourist traps the hotel is blissfully quiet as it is tucked away near the end of west 44th street .We hope to go back again soon and we will definately be going back to the sofitel

Reviews.Title: “Divine Excellence”
Reviews.Author: davefunseeka
Reviews.Content: Upon walking in to this fabulous hotel everyone goes out of their way to make you feel welcome. Check in process was quick and simple and we didn't have a problem with checking in early. The room was beautiful, clean and cozy. We couldn't hear our neighbors or any going on's in the hallway. The location was ideal for our first trip to NYC. Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Bryant Park, Grand Central Station and Broadway are all within walking distance as well as numerous subway lines. I must say best smelling hotel I've ever been to.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth $650/night, despite the location.”
Reviews.Author: NortheastFamilyMan
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this brief. This hotel is no better than a Hilton or Sheraton. Fine for business travellers, but not at $650/night (inclusive of all taxes). The room is nothing special, not very large. Bed is okay, but pillows were not especially comfortable. Bathroom also not special. Shower was awful - took 10 minutes to get hot, and had lackluster pressure. I stayed here because it was close to a meeting site. I usually stay at the London NYC, which is much, much nicer, and no more expensive. I've come to accept the ridiculous rates that Manhattan commands, but I still felt ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Highland123
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Clean hotel with comfortable beds and a beautiful lobby. The hotel is in a great location - centralized to many of NYC's attractions. The hotel staff was very helpful with any questions we had. Didn't have room service so cannot comment on that. Best hotel I've stayed at while in NYC. I would definitely stay at this hotel again on future trips to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Aussie73_10
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location so easy to get everywhere from here. Room was clean & tidy, beds comfortable, no noise. Staff were very helpful, except for snobby concierge on check out but that was just 1 person. Free internet in the lobby. Would recommend to others and would definitely stay there again. Made our New York stay so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for NY”
Reviews.Author: anjab82
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a very good location. Everything is very close, its really in the center of the city. We did not take the breakfast there as it seems quiet expensive. Would have also appreciate free WLAN access. Beds are very comfortable and also the linen is more than good for US standards. I also loved the bath products from Occitane.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Ballyblog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in March 2010 - we thought it was a lovely hotel - beautifully decorated, the staff were polite and the room was immaculate and clean. The hotel is a good walking distance to all major attractions. I would definitely recommend this hotel to people.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Bed, Staff = SENSATIONAL !”
Reviews.Author: sydney2002
Reviews.Content: Visited the Sofitel NYC in Oct 2010 and had a wonderfull stay for 3 nights. The hotel has a lovely reception area with free wireless and computers to use, real handy for checking the days weather or activities etc etc... all the staff were wonderfull, smiles all around from the door men, the concierge, the reception, the bar, the cleaners, very welcoming and also very informative when asked anything about NYC ! The room was very nice indeed, huge, plenty of storage, fantastic bathroom and the bed, well WOW what a bed, it was a pity I had to leave it to go and see NYC, the bed was simply amazing and by far the most compfy sleep I have had in many a year ! The location is another winner, its in mid town and was easy to walk to places like times square, empire state, chyrsley, rockerfella centre, st patricks cathederal, grand central station, brytant pak, all the theatre's... subway in time square is easy to use, catch the Number 1,2 or 3 downtown, we got the number 2 down to the staten island ferry , only $8 for a full days use. No negatives about the hotel from me, it was a winner and I would stay there again upon returning to NYC. But being british, I am used to having breakfast included in the hotel costs, hence we did not eat breakfast in the hotel as it was a $25 extra charge per person, per night. Aurevoir and merci beaucoup !

Reviews.Title: “Caters to Business Travellers”
Reviews.Author: diamondsnowball
Reviews.Content: I booked a room here because of the great reviews on Tripadvisor. My stay was fine, but not exceptional. The bed was great! One of the best I've had. Otherwise, the room was fairly standard in size and decor, with no view at atll. The lobby was small, but tasteful. The other guests seemed to be business travellers. The vibe was business, a downtown crowd. I think there are better places to stay in NYC, but I would stay at a Sofitel hotel again and I would stay at this Sofitel again, but only if I got a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ladymacb29
Reviews.Content: What is there to say about the hotel? It's wonderful! Location: It's right near Times Square, but on a street that is fairly calm. We walked from Penn Station and it took about 15-20 minutes (depending on how much your feet hurt and how you hit the lights). The hotel is right in the middle of everything - my husband and I didn't need to take a taxi/subway our entire stay. Entrance: Note that the check-in is through the lobby and to the left. All we saw when we first walked in was the concierge desk - we couldn't see the check-in desk. The hotel is very nice looking. We had room 922 - a suite - which was fairly large. The only downsides I noticed about the suite was a grate that seemed to be missing in the closet and I was looking for something like a small fridge. The layout of the suite is perfect - you enter in a little hallway, and then can choose to go left through a LARGE closet to the bathroom or bedroom or straight on to the sitting area. From the sitting area, you can go into the bedroom. Both the bedroom and sitting room had nice TVs and were bigger than some NY apartments. The closet was large and contained a large shelf to place your suitcase on. The bathroom had both a tub and nice shower, plus more than ample room on the counter. The hotel staff were extremely nice. I don't normally like the cleaning staff touching my things, but the one evening when we returned, my toiletries were arranged so perfectly (by size and in a nice triangle!) that even someone who's slightly compulsive like me loved it. The room was very quiet - I never really heard anything from the outside. (Although there was a strange thump that we never quite figured out! It sounded like something hitting our window.) We had free internet - and the desk in the sitting room even contained an ethernet cord in case you forget yours. While we stayed, we received a note saying the hotel was upgrading its wireless, so I'm sure there's that to look forward to as well. While we were there, we also received notices about various parades/street fairs that were going on during our stay. This was very helpful so we knew 5th avenue would be closed one day when a friend would be driving by, so we knew to direct her to drive elsewhere. In short, if you want to truly relax and love the hotel you're staying at, this is the one to go to!

Reviews.Title: “They get it!”
Reviews.Author: jameskdean
Reviews.Content: Service, impeccable but not arrogant. Rooms-older but well maintained and nicely appointed. The featherbed! Great hotel-it's continental, classy and well run. A pleasant experience overall!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: marshall846
Reviews.Content: Took advantage of their stay 4 nights and get one night free program. The staff at the hotel was very helpful and friendly. The location was great for going to plays near Times Square and good shopping on 5th avenue. We didn't try the dining facilities. Very comfortable bed and we didn't hear the typical New York street noises at night or early in the morning--a good plus.

Reviews.Title: “Hot time at the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: lemonzester
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ok. It was just two blocks from Times Square. Our junior suite was nice. The bathrooms was wonderful. The soaking tub was my favorite feature. The only problem we had with the room was that it was warm and humid. The thermostat was turned down as low as possible and the room never really cooled down. It was bearable, but after being outside in the humid heat I wanted to come in to a cool room. I would stay here again, but if I noticed I had a warm room I would ask to be moved right away.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Renouse
Reviews.Content: First trip to NYC, and loved this hotel. Great location, clean, friendly staff, and realy compfortable beds. Would most likely stay here again on our next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “First Time Stay in NYC Hotel”
Reviews.Author: My2Cents15
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 10th anniversary at the Sofitel Hotel in NYC. We are NYC residence and wanted to try something different for our anniversary. I told the Sofitel Hotel that we were celebrating our anniversary. They made our accommodations better then what I could have asked. It started with the hotel manager giving us a chocolate dessert with the words Happy Anniversary spelled out in chocolate. The next morning I called to confirm if they received my breakfast order via e-mail (I wanted to surprise my husband with breakfast in bed. So I e-mailed the restaurant a week before with our order). When I called the restaurant they said they did not receive my e-mail. So I had to reorder the breakfast, which wasn’t an issue for me. But it was an issue for the manager of Sofitel. He send us a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries that evening. He also, provided us with breakfast on our last day at the hotel. I love this hotel. Because we live in NYC and it was a special occasion, so I doubt if we will be staying at this NYC hotel again. However, I will definitely stay in other Sofitel hotels outside of NYC. There was one minor issue I had with the hotel, the fan vent was a bit loud when I was trying to fall to sleep. I can’t entirely blame this on the hotel, I am a very light sleeper. So the next day I brought earplugs and slept like a baby.

Reviews.Title: “Central Hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Jenick44
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our honeymoon in September. Hotel is 2 blocks from Times Square, near Grand Central Station and many restaurants. Rooms are small, even though we were upgraded to a room that costs $1200/night! All in all as great hotel to stay if you can afford it. Comfy beds. nice bathtubs!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A superb hotel with superior service, cleanliness and style”
Reviews.Author: mrikey
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four weeks; a very long time! Within that time, I was never let down by the excellent staff. The room was always cleaned to the highest standard and everyone was happy to assist with extras. The hotel's really well located for 5th avenue and Times Square, but nicely tucked away from the hustle and bustle of the city. I will definitely stay here if I return for business. One of the concierges is a bit grumpy so take him with a pinch of salt but, other than the lack of free wifi, this is an excellent hotel that I have recommended to many colleagues. Also: I still have dreams about the incredible bed - the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in!!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish yes, but luxury?”
Reviews.Author: Matkailija58
Reviews.Content: This is a good 5 star hotel, no question about it, but where can I find luxury? Sleeping quality is luxurious and the rooms are really clean. But there is a couple strange little thing which one could expect of a luxury hotel e.g., air conditioning or ability to listen to the radio in the bathroom. Although the room is modern I can´t understand why the telephone devices are so old fashioned. The bell boy didn`t give a smile at all, front door, concierge and receptionist were attentive. No free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Is In A Great Location, Clean, Friendly Staff..Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: tdwin2000
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Friday morning...they had the room ready before regular check in time and were very friendly. When we got to the room, we were pleasantly surprised to find it very clean...almost looks as though it had been renovated recently. Bed was comfortable, LCD TV of good size worked fine, A/C worded fine. The location is between 5th and 6th avenue on 44th street which is perfect if you are going to Times Square or a Broadway show...walking distance to almost anywhere we wanted to go. I would stay there again and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Class Act”
Reviews.Author: SpivsUKOK
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a number of times in the last couple of years and so I am able to say with some confidence that this is a very impressive hotel. Along with other Sofitels in the that I've stayed at in the US (Chicago & Philadelphia), what you get here is quality: the service is impeccable, the rooms are very well appointed and furnished, the bathrooms are immaculate and the whole experience is simply top drawer. On this occasion, I moved to the Sofitel having been staying for four night at the Millenium Broadway on business. The two hotels are only a very short walking distance apart (I wheeled my bag down the street), but in terms of class they might as well be on different planets. Note: the only reason that I marked down to a "Four" rating is that they charge for WiFi access. This really does seem rather grasping in this day and age.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in mid town”
Reviews.Author: Dublin_Guy_71
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Sofitel a number of times now and it is by far my favourite mid town hotel (stayed at half a dozen of the typical NY business hotels) and at a reasonable price! Location is perfect, rooms are of good size, clean and pretty quiet. On my last stay I had asked for a view of the Chrysler building and they did get me a room with a view which was great. Breakfast is very tasty but expensive (however not any more expensive than any other business hotel in NY). Staff were professional although some of the reception staff could improve on the friendliness. Finally, if you are put off by the crowds in some of the larger NY hotels, this place feels like an oasis of peace and quiet!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Mid-town Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JimParkRidge_IL
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel New York is a wonderful, romantic gem. We stayed in a junior suite (roughly 650 sq ft) and it was luxurious beyond fault. And it was priced around what many other Mid-town hotels charge for a room alone. For me, this is the place to stay in Mid-town.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: msmccorm
Reviews.Content: Great location for a midtown business hotel. Being on 44th allows it to be quiet, but still close to everything. While I was there the hotel was fully booked, but everything ran very smoothly despite the number of people there. The room was very nice, great bath tub, and extremely comfortable. I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel / Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Biscuitsbrown
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to NYC, we decided to have a long weekend there for our wedding anniversary. I used this site before booking as many friends from here (UK) said that they'd found the rooms and service in some hotels to be lacking. This hotel was a little more expensive than a few others we considered but we decided it was worth the extra cash ($120) for the weekend. We were not disappointed, the hotel is in a central location and very handy for Times Square and the subway. The staff were very friendly and our room was spacious and very clean. The bathroom was excellent and spotless. The bed was huge and very nice after being dragged around the shops all day by the Mrs. We didn't eat at the hotel but the bar area was very nice. My only gripe would be that there are only 2 computers with internet within the lobby area. But that's a minor point. All in all a great hotel and we'd use it again. I've recommended it to two friends already. BB

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: girlmiami
Reviews.Content: From the moment I called to make a reservation it was pleasant and professional. To my surprise, the staff upgrade me to the 19 floor since I was staying there for over one week,when I checked in. My room was always clean & second day they gave me extra Shampoos & Soaps. I called for room service and it was quick. I really enjoy myself in the Sofitel New York and plan to stay there again. The most important I felt safe staying there. Thank Sofitel Staff for making my stay a excellent one. No more Royalton

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MrsHaich
Reviews.Content: I stay here often for business trips and I can find no fault with the hotel. The rooms are clean, the staff helpful and the bar serves the best grapefruit cosmopolitan ever. I love the fact that it still has an air of "frenchness" about it, (it is a french hotel chain), from the "bonjours" of the staff, to the complimentary basket of croissants at breakfast. One word of warning however, when ordering breakfast (room service), be careful what you order, as you could end up feeding the 5,000 (literally), even when you say it is for one person - the portions are quite big - that bit is quite American!

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected - but location was great”
Reviews.Author: coecpa
Reviews.Content: Great check in. BUT - When I went to the bathroom on the first day, noticed some very small tightly curled black hairs which were not from our family. Brushed it off. Then when I went to take a shower, noticed the same thing. I called for a manager to report it, the person said I could tell her as she was an asst mgr., then the mgr called who said they would send someone to clean it - too late, I already did. I then started noticing several little things - like no paper on Sunday (told it was because it was Sunday), then no paper on Monday - told it was a holiday. Also, the internet service was strange and did not act as I expected it during stay (and I am a tech person), but I had to put up with it as I needed even a crippled connection (fyi, I was using a wired connection). Another thing I noticed was that the connectors on the CAT5 cable provided in the room were broken on both ends - the tab that keeps the connector secure, which may have caused the connection issues but I'm not sure. We appreciated the fruit basket they left in the room as a result - but it was not necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Such a great find; location, value, cleanliness, service: it has it all”
Reviews.Author: sunknee
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at several of the higher-end hotels in NYC. For the money, this is the best choice. And I am picky. When you walk in, the lobby is large, tranquil, and even smells nice. Check-in went smoothly, and they let us check in early. Our suite was spacious, and the king-sized bed was comfortable. The one bathroom was located a hallway away from the bed, so there is some privacy. The staff is accomodating, the rooms are clean. There is attention to detail in terms of lighting and mirrors (a lighted makeup mirror hangs in the bathroom). The vanity is spacious enough to put out toiletries. The toilet has a softclose lid. The shower is the only minor complaint I have, as the hot water seemed to cycle from hot to luke-warm throughout the duration of the shower. This would normally be a bigger deal, as I hate a cold shower, but knowing the hot would come back helped. Treat yourself to this oasis in the heart of mid-town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Room and Service”
Reviews.Author: travelflash777
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough positive things about our stay at the Sofitel in Midtown Manhattan. The service was outstanding. The room was quiet, very clean and comfortable. We found no bedbugs or any other unpleasant surprises during our stay. We had had a Junior Suite that was very roomy and nicely appointed. Room service breakfast was wonderful and included complementary mini strawberry smoothies along with fresh croissants, pastries and mini french baguettes. We will stay here again and recommend the place to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Where`s the linen???”
Reviews.Author: Liylly
Reviews.Content: I ttravel abroad at least 7 times a year,and I like to pick different hotesl wherever I go.I arrived today from a short trip to New York and I chose Sofitel based on tripadvisor`s review,however I saw things that were never mentioned here.The room is very tiny,the size of the bed is small than the regular queens,but I was chocked not to found sheets under the blanket!!!I figured out that the housekeeping had forgotten to make the bed with them,I called front desk and I was told that there were nevere sheets ,only blankets!!!So I asked somebody to bring them to me and I myself made the bed,though they have night turn service!!! Although it was not a perfect stay,the hotel is clean,excellent location and the staff was very nice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Willem_ter_Haar
Reviews.Content: On 44th street, between 5th and 6th avenue lies Sofitel New York, now locationwise that is about as good as it gets. Times Square only 1,5 blocks to your right, Rockefeller Plaza just a few blocks up, walking distances guaranteed. Furthermore the hotel left a good first impression when you enter the lobby. Concierge staff was very friendly and helpful, and the reception desk was very polite. So up to the 20th floor to our room, and on the 20th the view was excellent. Nevertheless, the room was just so very standard. I had higher expectations of the interior of the rooms, but this hotelroom looked very average. Good, but average and that is not that kind of value for money you'd expect. If I pay over 300 dollars a night, I want more than average. Maybe I am not so used to New York prices yet, since everything was expensive to me in the Big Apple. The queensize bed was definitally too small for the 2 of us. We fitted of course but one move from my wife and I was awake with her. Coming out of the airplane, or after a full day walking all over Manhattan I want a soft bed and many hours of sleep, not waking up because my wife rolls over in the queen sized bed. That was the only downside, next to the average decoration of the room. I can't give it the full 5 stars, but I can surely recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: Norwegian37
Reviews.Content: We had a great 4 nights at the Sofitel in late August. Very professional and friendly service, large room (17th floor), and great location. We don't have much to compare with, since it's only our third visit to New York, but we will definatly stay at the Sofitel when we go the next time. Didn't use room service or the restaurant. Saw recommodations for the Red Flame just around the corner. Had all breakfast there - nice place and great food. Only downside being that I personally much prefer parquet before carpets in hotelroomss (don't know the correct english words but I guess you'll understand). But that's just a personal opinion, and I seem to remember that there were carpets on the other two hotels we've stayed at i New York (The Benjamin and the Radisson). I can highly recommend the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Services”
Reviews.Author: 123bill123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sofitel in July. The experience was wonderful especially the staff in the hotel - they know how to deliver an excellent service the their guests. This hotel will be my #1 choice in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: mbgandco
Reviews.Content: First time I have stayed at the Sofitel in New York having stayed at many other hotels in the city before. Other than the fact that one of our 3 rooms was not ready for check in at 4.30pm I was very impressed and it is one the best 4 star hotels in New York and can give some of the older 5 stars a run for their money. Positives:- Very comfortable beds Clean and modern Free use of computers in the lobby with a printer Complimentary evian in the rooms Nice size rooms Bathrooms with large bath and shower stall (not just a hip bath as in some hotels in NY) Nice gym with free evian sprays, towels etc Allowed to keep one room until 4pm with no extra charge Negatives:- 44th Street is good location for Times Square but otherwise not the most happening of locations Restaurant is expensive for breakfast (as others have said - use Red Flame a couple of doors away) No room in fridge for own drinks and they charge if you remove anything

Reviews.Title: “Best beds in Town. Try SoBed”
Reviews.Author: SwissAirTraveler
Reviews.Content: Great beds which are really comfortable. Friendly and attentive staff, top location in Midtown near 5th Ave and Times Sq. Luxurious and well appointed room with marble bathroom and L'Occitane toiletries. All you need for your next New York stay. Only downside that there's no free wifi in-room and no tea/coffee facilites in room. I'll surely be back there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Stay 3 nights and get a suite deal-deal-deal”
Reviews.Author: Hollywood1973
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay in NYC and took advantage of the stay 3 nights min deal and receive FREE upgrade to a suite. A good deal, the room is very large compared to other hotels in NYC, the amenities were fantastic and a great base to explore NYC. I have a couple of minor complaints and that would be to say that if you are a A-Club member (Gold or above) that does not seem to get you any favours or recognition unlike most other Sofitels in world. The Sofitel in LA treats you like a rock star. I would just say it is a little impersonal in NYC. Secondly, it is not a good look for the doorman to count his tips in front of you whilst waiting for a cab. The room service attendants were fanatstic and housekeeping was also far above standard. Overall, a good base and is generally a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Consistant standard over the years”
Reviews.Author: Sheryll
Reviews.Content: Our second visit to the Sofitel New York, (the last one being in 2008). This time we stayed four nights in a Classic Room Queen size bed and was pleased to find we had been upgraded to a Kingsize room on the 11th floor. Room was a good size for a New York hotel room, separate shower and bath - good space. Housekeeping very good and also appreciated those little macroons you left in our room each day after you had cleaned, also the free water at turndown. We used the same limo driver this time that the hotel recommended last time, just emailed him from Australia and there he was. All staff were friendly and professional and in particular thank you to William the doorman who always had a smile and some great tips for us, especially directing us to the drycleaning/laundry place acropss the road from the hotel, enter at the parking stateion. for $30.00 USD they did 2 bags of laundry for us and some dry cleaning, much cheaper than having the hotel do it for us and also the the wonderful barber that cut my husbands hair. Free internet, although the hotel should monitor the time guests use and should limit the use to adults as we constantly had young children playing games on it or teenage girls on facebook who had no consideration for adult guest swanting to use if for either banking or emails. Shame the Red Diner just down the road was shut for renovations as we had some great breakfasts there in 2008, but they said it would be opening again around the end of July, so do yourself a favour and have breakfast there. Also across the road is a great little bar/restaurant Figaros - good atmosphere. Would we stay here again? Yes great location and consistent service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DaveB58
Reviews.Content: I had never stayed at a Sofitel, nor had anyone I knew, so I chose this hotel from the reviews on here. As we were celebrating a birthday I wanted everything to be just perfect. I neednt have worried! The hotel is ideally situated between 5th & 6th Avenue and just a short walk away from Time Square on 5th. We stayed on the 24th floor and had a great view of the city. The check in (and check out) procedures were very quick allowing us to get unpacked and freshened up and out to explore very quickly. The room was large enough and the bathroom had both bath and walk in shower. We only ate at the hotel once but the food was of good standard and priced similar to other restaurants. Staff were always helpful and courteous and I would recommend this hotel to any traveller, whether on business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and large comfortable suites”
Reviews.Author: Travel4FunVirginia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sofitel for a long weekend in the city to celibrate our 15th wedding anniversary, we were not disappointed. The staff at the Sofitel were very friendly and the concierge desk was helpful. We stayed in a suite and asked for a higher floor, which was provided. The bed was very comfortable and the suite was huge for NYC. We were in NYC to see a few shows and the hotel was a little far from the theaters, but otherwise we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “five star”
Reviews.Author: parkwaydublin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in feb amazing hotel , breakfast was just stunning. expensive hotel but worth it for a special time.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury--class act”
Reviews.Author: JJJ70552
Reviews.Content: Great location. Classy and wonderful service. Staff very well trained and interested in making your stay a great one. This is a very quiet hotel---so street sounds. One disappointment-----------jhad to go down in the a.m. for complimentary coffee.. I know I could have used room service--but would enjoy a coffee maker in my room. Regardless a 5 star!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a peaceful stay”
Reviews.Author: sucker4luxury
Reviews.Content: We booked a package with free breakfast. We arrived very early in the morning and they had a room ready for us. Plus they gave us a complimentary breakfast for that day. It just made us feel so awesome. The doormen are very gracious. The rooms look decent not great if you are used to staying in high-end hotel rooms. However the bed was divine. Really enjoyed sleeping in it. This is a perfect hotel if you want quality service and amenities and the full english breakfast is a must have.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay ever in NYC ! Flawless !”
Reviews.Author: Zarkossil
Reviews.Content: probably the best hotel i stayed in NYC so far (and i tested quite some of them) It definitely is a top hotel to stay in. The decor is a refined mix between modernity and classic neo-thirties/fifties. the staff is very profesional and friendly. the rooms are exceptional : beautiful, very clean and calm, the best comfort bed. i really enjoyed this stay that exceeded all my expectations (and i am picky when it comes to hotels in this category) and all its competitors. Will definitely come back !

Reviews.Title: “Favourite hotel in New york”
Reviews.Author: harrisment
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 10am following cruise and was pleasantly surprised to be allowed to check in straight away, was expecting to have to leave our bags so this was a nice surprise. Great room, very comfortable bed, large bathroom. Good location, very quiet.. Did not eat at the hotel so cannot comment on the food but this is definetly the best hotel I have stayed at in New York. I would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I know in NY”
Reviews.Author: olievans
Reviews.Content: I get sent to NYC for work and I've jumped between various hotels, this is the best hotel I've stayed-in in the city. Great rooms, on a quiet street, good location for work. But all of this comes at a high $ cost...

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in Midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: JeffandElaine
Reviews.Content: We had a truly wonderful stay at Manhattan's Sofitel. Incredibly quiet room, comfortable bed, nice features (like Bose bedside radio and, in addition to all the expected TV channels, French-language TV5 so Jeff could practice his French). We're just nobodies, but the welcome couldn't have been warmer. Location is fantastic: easy walk to Times Square and the Broadway theaters and just as easy to Fifth Avenue shopping. Lovers of cabaret might appreciate that it's literally just steps from the famous Oak Room. Good coffee shop just down the block proved perfect for breakfast. As to cost, well, no, the Sofitel is not inexpensive, not even close. But this is Midtown Manhattan in 2010, and for what was offered, the price seemed neither unreasonable nor unexpected. We're not professional reviewers and haven't made a thorough study, so we can't say it'd be impossible to do as well someplace else for less. Thus the cautionary 4 stars instead of 5 for value. But as far as we're concerned, we've found perfection at Sofitel, and for all our future New York excursions, that's where we plan to stay. JeffandElaine

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Central”
Reviews.Author: TheBearsAway
Reviews.Content: We have been here before and found the hotel to be up to the same high standards that we experienced previously. The rooms were clean and very comfortable and the staff attentive. It is close to Times Square and Fifth Avenue and central for visiting all the sights of Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service and a beautifully maintained hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: WorldExplorer28
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I can say after staying at a hotel that everything was almost perfect. There is nothing that could have been done better to make my stay more comfortable and pleasurable. Our experience at the hotel was great - from the friendly and respectful staff at the fron desk who demonstrated extreme professionalism and understanding to the patient and helpful concierge. Those staff made us decide to stay at the hotel as we were only asking about room availability/rate for that night. Following our check in, we were even more pleasantly surprised by the room atmosphere, decor, comfortable beds/pillows and the luxuriously relaxing bathroom amenities. The hotel is beautifully maintained both in rooms and in the lobby. The only downside was when the hot water was nto available in the morning. However that was due to some maintenance work being done at the time and we understand it was out the hotel staff control. I have to say we called the front desk and as promised they must have followed up as 20 mins later the hot water was again available.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel a great experience”
Reviews.Author: YEP2
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in early July at the Sofitel and it was a beauty. The location is perfect, close to everything but not loud or jam packed atmosphere. Celebrated our 5th wedding anniversary in NYC and the Sofitel had some chocolate covered stawberries waiting for us upon arrival. Webt down to the bar for a couple of drinks our first night there, it wasn't very busy but it was a nice, classy atmosphere. It's a 10 minute walk to Times Square and 5th ave is right there. If you wantto walk arounfd the city and see Rockefeller center, Radio City Music Hall, etc...Sofitel is a great starting point. Room was also large, we were on the 21st floor I believe...Recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Try to get the Extended Deal”
Reviews.Author: MRueda
Reviews.Content: I went on business trip to NY for a week in July 2010. I needed to be close to Grand Central and all the other hotels in the area were booked. Got a regular room for one night and then the Extended Deal which means they upgrade you to a suite, very convenient for long stays. The first room was OK, the suite was great. It was very comfortable, a lot of space for NY standards. To improve: The minibar was just ok but very expensive, the internet connection is not the best (my laptop never connected to wifi and had trouble EVERY day with the cable connection, some days I had to go down to the public PCs in the lobby), the room service is quite expensive. Good things: Nice L'occitane bathroom amenities, staff very friendly and collaborative (once I got the wrong salmon from room service and they sent me chocolates). The best thing: The bed was just AMAZING, with the most comfortable featherbed!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fantastic Service, and Large Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Agent1126
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel is a great hotel which is close to Time Square but not in all the hustle and bustle. The service from walking in to the check-in area is very smooth. The front desk lady which assisted me was Vivian she was great. The room service and house keeping were also great. I consider myself high maintenance and called them about four times in the span of three hours and they came up immediately. The room was large for New York standards. The room is roughly 360 Sq Ft.
