The bathrooms are all marble and done with great taste. The amenities in the bathroom are great there are Q-tips, nail filer, and many other things which women would use. The room has three phones and a 32 inch flat screen TV which is very nice. I would NOT recommend eating at the Sofitel the prices are outrageous even for New York. I mean $25 for cup of fruit? That's a bit crazy. For brunch I would recommend going to Cookshop, 44X Hells Kitchen, Pastis, Cafe Orlin etc. Right outside of the hotel is a place called DB Bistro Moderne. The place is known for $32 burger so if you want to splurge and do something different go there. There is also a 24 hour Duane Reade (Convenience Store / Pharmacy) right around the corner from the hotel which has pretty much everything a person in the hotel would want so you always have that option. The concierge was useless, was not able to make any reservations. They recommend the touristy spots and was not knowledgeable. I had to call AMEX Concierge who got things done. I am from the are so I know the places I like.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, quality sleep,disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: PaulinNotts87
Reviews.Content: Sofitel rates as one of the better hotels in top 10 New York guide and it is ideally centrally located a few mins walk from Times Square(as so many are)and for a leisure break of 4 nights 8-12 July hotel use is minimal. Its positives are location, very quiet rooms(guidebook states soundproofed) and very comfortable beds so we had no difficulties with sleeping(which we normally do in other hotels).Negatives were poor bellboy service, our cases were not delivered to room after 30mins on arrival and we then went out for four hours to find on our return they still werent in room. On complaining we were given free breakfasts for our whole stay which was good(breakfasts very expensive in New York hotels so eat at diners etc) also bellboys ignored workers trolley at entrance which a guest then tripped over!.Breakfast service especially at weekend was haphazard ,tables not laid,wrong orders brought over etc which if I was paying the £18per person I would be unhappy about. Gym was Ok but disappointingly only one bike though 4 treadmills. New York great for sites and easy to walk and use subway trains.Eating is expensive but many clothes, handbags,perfume, jewellery alot cheaper My wife was delighted to find a store near Empire state on5th Ave selling ugg boots at $180 vs £180 in UK with loads of stock(main New york famous named stores have no stock)Empire state on weekdays no queue ,avoid the touts outside selling a film and tour, for statue of liberty need to get to ferry very early otherwise long queues at weekend

Reviews.Title: “Management a let down........”
Reviews.Author: any-holiday
Reviews.Content: Good… until you have a problem - be prepared to be treated as a second class citizen! Went to the Sofitel to celebrate my daughter’s 21st birthday and on first impressions, the hotel does not disappoint - friendly concierge, plush carpets, expensive furnishings and comfortable rooms. One room was not ready by 3pm as advertised but this was not a problem as we could use the other one for the time being. Did not encounter any problems until late on the second night when my daughters were locked out of their room at 12.30am. Reception told them this was due to a declined credit card (the hotel reserves the full amount for your room upon arrival and as both rooms were not available when we arrived, they did not discover this until after we had collected the key for the second room) and as the hotel were unwilling to let them back into their room unless they could take payment there and then (management were not interested that it was late and was 5.30am in the UK) we had to call the credit card company. At no point did the hotel staff contact us during the day to inform us of the problem, even though we had been in our rooms for over 2 hours of the day. Their first response to this issue was to lock the room regardless of the time of night. NB. there was no issue with the card, only with the two large transactions processed in New York in quick succession. There were still problems with the lock on the room after we had resolved the issue and my daughters had to be let in by security. By this time it was after 1.30am. They were again locked out of the room the following day (apparently the key cards play up frequently) and so we asked to speak to management. The manager was obviously well trained on how to deal with complaints and promised free breakfast, late check-out (great if we hadn’t already heard them offer other guests late check-out for no extra charge) and a reduced room rate. When we went to pay for the stay, the room rate was not reduced for the night in question as promised. The manager was unavailable at the time but we were promised a message would be passed on and we would be refunded any difference. We’re still waiting… Good thing: Standard of furnishings and cleanliness Bad thing: Extremely poor customer service and disregard for guests

Reviews.Title: “good location, good views, good room, just good”
Reviews.Author: LarryTheVisitor
Reviews.Content: it was my first stay at nyc, and must recognize i was borried about the location or the quality of the rooms of my hotel, but just was enter and i feel very well, the room was big, with views to times square area and the neons, the hotel stuff was friendly, the elevators were very quick, the hotel has a big lookout where you can drink in the bar and view the lighsts and hear the sounds of manhattan, the metro was 5 minutes walking, and many bars and restaurants, shops, and everything around the corner, cos the hotel is just located in a east-west street but just the corner as all in manhattan of one of the biggest avenues, i remember it was 7th avenue one way and 6th avenue to the other way, and between 50 and 53 street north-south, so just the core of midtown manhattan, so the midtown of the world!

Reviews.Title: “French hotel with American service”
Reviews.Author: kid_at_heart17
Reviews.Content: New York City was my first stop in my vacation to the US this year. I chose Sofitel New York because of previous reviews from other TripAdvisor customers as well as my last stay at the Sofitel Le Fauborg last year in Paris. The latter was magnificent. But that was Paris. The Sofitel in New York had a French flair - from breakfast to dinner - and the room was quaint and had a separate shower. Most of the staff had a French accent to their English language, which gave it a touch of the French boutique. And the bath products were L Occitane, service water was Evian - so how more European could you get? But where the European ambiance ends, the American service begins. Of course, this is the USA - where the front desk people need to entertain every customer like there is no sense of time or space. Every inquiry, even if takes 30 minutes is addressed. Where you need to call the guest services to kindly please add another bottle of lotion because the last one they gave was like 2 days ago and 2 of us were sharing the teenie weenie bottle. Like it takes a lot of effort to put up a smile on their faces, unlike La Fauborg. And unlike La Fauborg, the food was bland and there were very few fruit choices (come to think of it, none at all, unless picking up an apple in the lobby was what you were looking for.) Like the concierge service closes early and was not that useful at all because there was either one or two or no one at the concierge area. Like there was a night that I had to ask them to turn down the beds and bring up some water, but nobody came until we did that ourselves. It was a nice luxury hotel, situated a few blocks from Times Square and a stone's throw away from 5th Avenue. The hotel was nice, but the service was by far below my expectations. Perhaps because the hotel is in New York, there is not much to expect with services.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful experience, great hotel, best location”
Reviews.Author: barbaraGeneva
Reviews.Content: We had a long trip and decided to spend the last night at The Sofitel, for comfort, to spread out and redo luggage before flying overseas, and to be spoiled in the cradle of luxury of Sofitel bedrooms and bathrooms. Huge comfortable room, great bed, even greater bathroom with separate shower and bath and products from L'Occitane. Staff gracious and helpful, room ready before appointed time, late check-out. I could ask for nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE THIS HOTEL- A MIDTOWN GEM!”
Reviews.Author: shiney_traveller
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel enhanced a wonderful trip to NYC, celebrating our 6yr wedding anniversay from July 01- 09, 2010. Every aspect of the hotel- room, food, service, amenities- were outstanding. In fact, we would like to especially thank David and Arian for giving us the perfect morning starts with delicious, and carefully prepared breakfasts. They were (thankfully) included in our stay, but as someone mentioned rather expensive if not. On that note, that is the only wish I have remaining about this hotel in general- that it was less expensive, so we could afford to re-visit... and frequently :) We got amazing value on this trip, and were accomodated so graciously by the hotel reservations dept (shout-out to Dilma!) We loved our King suite, and the view. Oh, the view! Chrysler tower out one window and empire state building out the other. Specific things I loved: L'Occitane toiletries- I didn't bring any of my own, b/c I knew I could trust these. Fresh orchids throughout the well-appointed room Nice linens and towels, the bed was amazingly comfy Two small evian bottles, and classical music at turndown (so soothing to wind down to) Friendly, sincere service from everyone quality food Perfect location, a nice solace in the middle of the Big Apple, close to many of the touristy sites. The metro will easily take you anywhere else you need to go. Aside from subbing to SoHo numerous times throughout the week, we also went to Brooklyn, got some ice cream and walked the bridge back, and even took the sub to Bronx Yankee stadium with ease. We only used a cab when we were dressed somewhat formal, and didn't want to draw attention to ourselves on the Metro. NYC is a world-class city, and a must-see-and-do. If you are going to do it, do it in mid-town, and do it at the Sofitel! Thank you again Sofitel NYC for a fabulous stay- we hope to return again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Very Classy Hotel - Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: JK57
Reviews.Content: Very classy hotel in the middle of Mid-Town. 2 minute walk to 5th ave and 5 minute walk to Time Sq, literally right bang in the middle of all the action. Rooms quite large for New York and well appointed Everywhere has a classy feel but be aware such class doesnt come cheap, food and drink in the hotel are quite expensive ($8 dollars for a beer etc) You get what you pay for however and it really is a very good hotel

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful trip”
Reviews.Author: Aleksevna
Reviews.Content: We visited New York together with my husband at the very beginning of January. Stayed in this hotel in Suite room. Very positivite impression of the room: spacious, clean, perfect view at the Rockefeller Center. Huge bathroom with live flowers, shower AND a bath. Location is very convenient - major tourist destination, nightlife and shopping streets are walking distance. Breakfast was not included and I would advice not to take breakfast at the hotel. We tried once, meal was very good there but too expensive. There is a diner almost next door and there are a lot of cafes around where you can have very good and not expensive breakfast instead. Internet access is rather expensive as well, but for a week it is cheaper then to buy wi-fi card in a shop.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: flanker2000fr
Reviews.Content: We were very satisfied with this hotel. Room was of good size (for NY), clean, well decorated. Location is superb. Highly recommend it if you plan to stay in Midtown.

Reviews.Title: “would defenetly come back”
Reviews.Author: fil73can
Reviews.Content: we go to NY few times a year and always staiyng at diffferent hotels, so far Sofitel was the best out of all of them ( in a 4 star range). Bed was the most comfortable one, we upgraded ourself to a king room and it was very spacious , considering the fact the we had a baby with us and had a crib and 2 strallers in a room and still had a lot of space in a room. Service was very good , room was clean and location is closed to everything. Defenetly would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, friendly, attentive staff, hotel clean and smart”
Reviews.Author: 186460Mike
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel New York for 7 nights at the end of June. We had two rooms, which interconnected by means of a short corridor with it's own external door. The rooms were large enough for us and were well equipped with large flat screen TVs, a Bose radio with a line input for an MP3 player and very comfortable beds. There were three free PCs for internet access in the foyer with a good printer which was great for rinting out boarding cards after we had checked in online for the flights home. We didn't eat in the hotel, but being two blocks away from Time Square meant there were plenty of places for breakfast and dinner within easy walking distance. No faults at all, the only additional thing that would have been nice would have been wireless access, at least in the public areas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: MSJet_Setter1
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay at this hotel. It was quiet, off the beaten path, which I loved also. Room was perfect, bed was great to sleep in, loved the bathroom! Great location to everything...within walking distance to shopping, dining, etc.. Staff extremely helpful and friendly. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: beachbumtim
Reviews.Content: I have nothing bad to say about this hotel and would reccomend it to all. I booked our flight and hotel though Travelocity and wasn't sure if we would just get average service because of that. I confirmed by email our reservations and mentioned that we would be celebrating my girlfriends 30th b-day. When we arrived around 1pm Sunday afternoon we were quickly checked in. While checking in I asked if we could be upgraded to a higher floor, the desk receptioist smiled and said we have you noted that you are celebrasting a birthday and we put you on the 20th floor. I also asked for a late check out since we had a late flight and she gave us till 2pm, Excellent! We proceeeded to our room and found a great clean (and I mean clean!!!!! even the bathroom) room. A little smaller that normal and with a queen bed but typical to NYC. We quicly dropped things off and left to see the town. when we returned later we found a birthday surprise chocolate dessert waiting, BTW My GF had no idea this might be there. and here b-day was the next day. We ate it and cleaned of for our evening. The next day which was here birthday we came back mid afternoon and again found another dessert!!! wow two times!!.. again she was surprised and so was I . Check out a couple days later was great! VERY greart hotel and experience!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: UziTelAviv
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 8 nights in May 2010. Arrived late (after 10 pm), and the desk clerk apologized that they were rather full, so they had to put me on a low floor (4th). This was within my reservation, which said floors 3-14, so I had not even raised the issue, but they still promised to move me up the following morning. They did that, putting me on the 24th floor, with a very nice view, at no extra charge. In general, service was most helpful, rooms spotless and well appointed, and the location cannot be beat. It's rather pricey, but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great service...expensive restaurant”
Reviews.Author: enjoylife
Reviews.Content: At Sofitel for two nights last weekend. This was a mom and daughter(adult) get away. The room was large for NYC, the beds were super comfy and the bathroom nice, clean with all the amenities. They also still have nightly turndowns. All the staff from desk, to doormen, to consierge, hostesses, etc were quite friendly and helpful. We ate an evening light meal and breakfast in the restaurant. The evening's meal was very good, though pricey, but the breakfast was very pricey and since the tip was automatically included, service was slow. All in all I'd definitely stay at this hotel, which is quite near the Theatre District, again. I'd likely eat elsewhere, though.

Reviews.Title: “Right hotel, right place”
Reviews.Author: Travellinghack
Reviews.Content: Stopped off here for 5 nights en route to London. Perfect location for Broadway, the restaurants on 46th and shopping. And thanks to an Aussie in the elevator we found the Post Office on 43rd where we were able to mail books home. And the hotel itself was superb. Discrete, friendly staff, quiet rooms and everything working. My only gripe was the bar staff at 10 p.m. who were disinterested in their guests. But that would not be enough to stop me staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay room but very poor service”
Reviews.Author: LovesToTravel1803
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel during peak season and had to pay over $900 all taxes in for a regular room for one night. The room was okay but it was pouring rain out and all I wanted to do was order room service and crawl into bed and watch TV. I ordered spaghetti, which came within 45 minutes as promised; however, with a knife and fork - no spoon! I stumbled through the spaghetti with my fork and then crawled into bed to watch TV. The remote control's batteries were dead - not weak, but dead! I called downstairs they said they would send someone up with new batteries or a new remote. An hour and 10 minutes later, I called again. Someone else answered the phone sounded surprised and promise to send someone up immediately. Two and a half hours later I went to sleep, no one ever came. Small things in the grander scheme of life, but for a hotel charging these prices, I should be able to change the channel without getting out of bed! Also, if you say you're coming and you're really not, don't make me stay up waiting! Tell me you're not coming. The head of the bed had to be piled with pillows just to even it out because it sank significantly. Lastly, there was a large pill (someone's drug) on the bathroom floor - which meant it hadn't been swept because you couldn't have missed it.

Reviews.Title: “sheer luxury”
Reviews.Author: mrgrumpy
Reviews.Content: Was lucky to stay in this hotel for four nights last November and words cannot describe our most enjoyable stay. Best hotel Ive ever stayed in, got a deal through web site in a superior room after looking at reviews on tripadviser and was not disappointed. If someone is wanting to be spoilt in a five star hotel then look no further and ideally situated in New York.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: INSSH
Reviews.Content: very nice and luxurious hotel - great location near to Times Square, subway is near to the hotel. very friendly staff, reception and concierge !! nice and clean room, wonderful bed also very many TV channels. room was also very quiet. the hotel is absolutely worth its money and we would return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out..don't let them give you a bad room.”
Reviews.Author: lazydays1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Sofitel NY on 4 or 5 trips to NY, usually 2x a year. The location is great and the rooms are always well appointed and comfortable. On my last trip at check in I was informed that they had me booked into a queen room. Now I was pretty sure I had booked a king room and when I inquired to the desk he stated that unless I had my confirmation I was out of luck because that was the room I was assigned. As I looked into my file for the reservation details I began remember this happening to me on my last visit...and the one before. The point beeing I think they activly downgrade you if you don't object or have proof of the room class you booked. I found my reservation (king) and presented it to him. Now he was asking if I minded a queen room because he could not find me a king room because they were full. When I told him this happend last time I stayed here and I wanted to speak to a manager he suddenly was able to find a room (but only one on the 3rd floor). I left feeling like it was a concerted effort to push clients into lower classes of rooms. The next day in talking to the bellman I asked if they were booked full and he said no, somewhere close to 85%.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased With Sofitel New York”
Reviews.Author: Bowdoin1
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at the Sofitel New York in a junior suite on the 26th floor and was very pleased with our stay. From check-in to check-out the service was friendly and excellent. The doormen were quick to help with luggage and secure taxis--even at 4:30 in the morning. Check-in and check-out were effortless. The housekeeping staff were quick and did a great job. The suite was a nice size with a separate foyer, living/work area, bedroom and bathroom. The bed, as everyone has stated before, is excellent and the bathroom is fitted with nice towels and L'Occitane products. The room had two flat screen tvs, a a Bose alarm clock/radio, a stereo in the living room and plently of storage space. The only negatives about the room were the lack of a mirror in the foyer (obviously not a big deal) and a loud vent in the bathroom that was solved simply by keeping the door to the bathroom closed at night. Turndown service was prompt and the bottles of Evian on the nightstand each night was a nice touch. The only negative was the service in the bar in that the waiter made a couple of mistakes on a simple order but it was not a big deal. The location is excellent--on 44th Street between 5th and 6th (Ave. of the Americas). Times Square. the Broadway Theaters, MOMA, Bryant Park, and Rockefeller Center are only 5 minutes away as a ret wo subway stations. Although right in the heart of midtown, the area is quiet and it was easy to get a good nice sleep. The clientele seemed to be split pretty evening between tourists and businesspeople with a number of european language overhead in the lobby. The lobby is quite nice with a gorgeous floral display, several free internet termianals and comfortable leather chairs. We have stayed at Sofitels in London, Chicago, Siem Riep Cambodia and Los Angeles and have always been pleased with my stays and the New York location is no different. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking to stay a (reasonably) affordable, top-notch hotel in mid-town with a little (emphasis on little) European flare.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely sanctuary in mid-town - not disappointed in the least”
Reviews.Author: Maplehawk
Reviews.Content: A very nicely appointed hotel, well located, very clean & quiet. The bed & linens were gorgeous. Generous size (we were in the premier king suite on the 14th floor) room & bathroom (separate shower). Nice toiletries too. A/C fan was somewhat loud & we didn't have a view. Everything in the room is high quality including the BOSE stereo. The hotel staff were very friendly & helpful. The foyer is very grand & elegant. Elevators were fast - never had to wait long at all. The lounge (Gatsby) was wonderful - good food, nice wine list and good service. Our waiter was excellent. Again, a nice quiet sanctuary in the middle of NYC. Easy walking distance to many sites/attractions. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Totally indulgent and luxurious stay!”
Reviews.Author: Leese25
Reviews.Content: Using TripAdvisor as a guide we decided to book with Sofitel as this was our first trip and we wanted a quiet location close to the action - if that existed! When I first emailed the hotel I received a near immediate reply from Sandra, who I now understand is the Reservations Manager. I had contacted a few different hotels but this felt right and I had a good feeling. Boy! Was I right! I explained to Sandra that this was our first trip to NY and we were celebrating our wedding anniversary. I was offered an upgrade with my request of a high floor be noted. They could not promise a really high floor, but they would do their best. After our flight with Virgin Atlantic (first time we have upgraded to Premium Economy and it was worth it. Good entertainment, better food, lots of room, dedicated toilet for just Premium Economy passengers, get on first, get off first and most importantly - your luggage comes off first!). After taking a taxi to the hotel from the airport (don't listen to people who say they were ripped off - if you come out of JFK to the taxi rank, a taxi rolls up and the fare is fixed $50 includes the tolls - the tip is up to you). We arrived at the hotel. The hotel is on a quiet street, just round the corner from Times Square. The main thing is that it is quiet. If like us, this is the first time you have been to NY, the honking of horns is quite a surprise and having a hotel that diminishes the noise, is worth it's weight in gold - this is from a couple from London - so we know noise! The room we were given was a huge suite on the 29th (top) floor! Our mouths dropped open and we just walked around saying Oh My G-d!!! We have been fortunate enough to have stayed in some lovely hotels around the world, but for a city hotel, we simply did not expect such a huge room. There were two thermostats, one in the lounge and one in the bedroom. The bedroom had a table and chairs in and the lounge room (totally separate room) has an armchair, a sofa, huge plasma tv at one end and a writing desk and chair at another. In the hallway and the lounge there were also large pieces of lovely furniture. There was also a dressing area with a large shelf for cases, two wardrobes and plenty of room to move around in between. In one of the wardrobes was an ironing board and iron, a stand for cases and plenty of hangers. Plenty of lights and lamps, so the rooms could be well lit if needed. The bathroom was large and well appointed. A good hairdryer that worked as well as mine at home. The bathrobes were fluffy and felt like new. More towels than we needed. Really nice slippers. The L'Occtaine shower gel, soaps, shampoo and conditioner were replaced each and every day. Two bottles of Evian water were left out each day free of charge, when the turndown service was done. The room was immaculate, with no signs of wear and tear. The bedding is another wonderful story. I have Egyptian cotton sheets and pillow cases at home as I love the feel of them. I buy from John Lewis and they cost a fortune, but they were not as soft as the ones on the hotel bed. The bed had a downy mattress topper which simply melted as you lay upon it. I took great delight each night after a bath or shower just diving under the sheets. The bed was massive. The pillows so soft and fluffy it was like sleeping on a cloud. When we came back to our room after the first afternoon out, we were delighted to see a cake with strawberries left in the room with the compliments of the hotel. A wonderful touch. I do not have anything negative to say about the hotel or their staff. I really cannot understand any negative remarks as the points made were simply not true to our experience. The reception staff fall over themselves to help - as if we were royalty or suchlike. We constantly asked the concierge questions as to the best place to eat and we were recommended some superb restaurants. Each day we said what kind of food we wanted to eat and what level of casual/smart we wanted to be. Each time the concierge would write down recommendations, addresses and made reservation where applicable. We asked reception if we could pay to use a printer for our boarding cards as we were checking out online (I have a Blackberry, so I cannot comment on the hotel's internet connection). I was told to speak to the concierge, who printed out all the information free of charge. We checked out before the 12 noon check out time and our bags were held (free of charge) by the Bell hop staff in a secure room until we were ready to go to the airport. We simply gave them a tip at the end. Tipping: This seems to be a big talking point with UK visitors as most of us do not want to seem flashy (or can afford to be) but we do not want to appear miserly. In a restaurant we tipped between 15% to20% of the total bill cost depending on how wonderful the service was. Taxis had no more than 15% and staff what we felt like. The Dollar rate for us is poor, so we tipped to staff what we would like to receive if the roles were reversed. It is part of the culture and if your service from a waitress for example was bad, don't give a lot as you would be unlikely to go there again anyway! I hope I have conveyed to you how wonderful an experience this hotel made our trip. I would welcome any questions and have no problem recommending this hotel to anyone at any age. The fact that we were charged a room rate of a lowly double and had a suite, well, that was luck and wonderfully received, even at full price, this was amazing value.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with great location with good value”
Reviews.Author: Harrya909
Reviews.Content: It is a perfect hotel for someone visiting NYC for the very first time or for someone who wants to stay in midtown and around all the buzz of the city. Very nice room with a view of Chrysler building. I wanted a higher floor but no rooms were available on the higher floor for king size bed. I emailed the hotel a week ago but I didn't get any response so I finally called the hotel and they gave me the number of service manager who definitely helped and understood our concerns. Room service was bit expensive for a 4 star hotel. I stayed in a better 5 star hotel as I had to extend my trip and it was cheaper and better than here. Would definitely stay here again but will make sure I either order a queen room so I could get higher floor or a suite.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best 4-star hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Blaaberg
Reviews.Content: Great location and amazing service. If you want the highest quality in terms of bed, sofa, carpet, etc, you probably should book a 4.5 - 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, top nyc location”
Reviews.Author: adirondacksailor
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sofitel this past weekend on trip to NYC to attend Glee concert as b'day gift to my teenage grandaughter. This was my first stay at a Sofitel and was thoroughly enjoyable. No complaints to mention as the service, the room, the public spaces were all impeccable. I enjoyed the nice touch of fresh orchids in bathroom and on room service tray. The location is perfect if tourism is your reason for visiting. The hotel is a few minutes walk from the theater district, 5th Ave, Rockefeller Center, etc. Also, the subway lines used the most in a visit are within a couple of blocks. I go to shows every few months in NYC and have stayed at several hotels recently. The Sofitel and the Algonquin next door have been the best, and I recommend the one that offers the best rate as they are now my top choices for NYC visits. Shop around, as this is a city where, for example, the Hampton Inn was charging more than the luxury Sofitel this past weekend on discount sites.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've stayed in in NYC”
Reviews.Author: greeny_4
Reviews.Content: Great location, 1 block from 5th Ave shops, 1 1/2 blocks from Times Square. Friendly staff and nice bar. Room a good size, spotlessly clean. Not cheap, but got quite a good deal through booking.com. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: iceal
Reviews.Content: This is a top hotel. Great service and comfortable surroundings. Great location. Easy to walk to Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “I love Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: keldes
Reviews.Content: I travel to New York for both Business and pleasure about every two weeks. This trip was a combination of both. Usually when I travel I stay at Starwood hotels and have stayed at the Westin and almost every W hotel in New York. I have also stayed in the Mrriot Marquis, the Millineum, the Plaza, the Four Seasons, several modern boutique hotels and some other 4 and 5 star hotels over the years. This trip was during fleet week so the hotel I wanted to stay in was booked. Since I had stayed at my first Sofitel in Philadelphia recently and had a good experience (they gave us a suite for the standard rate because all of their standard rooms were booked) I booked the New York Sofitel through Perfect Escapes. I booked a standard queen room that came with a guaranteed upgrade (upon availability), early check in, late check out, and free breakfast. I arrived at around 1 pm and they checked me right in to a large suite on the 26th floor (not a junior suite) which had a great view of the Chrysler building and where a welcome card awaited me. The room was really nice, had plenty of closet space, and was very quiet. Everything was really clean, no foul smells, and no wear and tear was apparent. I love the Sofitel feather beds and our bed had both down and synthetic pillows already on it. At turn down we were left with a large glass bottle of Evian and two small plastic bottles in addition to a box of chocolates. The towels were replaced, the music was turned on, the drapes were closed in both the living room and the bedroom, and certain lights were turned on. The bathroom had a fresh orchid and candles for around the tub. The water pressure in our room was really good so I cannot explain why others have had problems with it. Room service was fast and efficient and not anymore expensive than I had paid elsewhere. The concierge was polite and helpful and our wake up calls were exactly as requested, I do not care that it was a recording. The gym was small but well equipped. I ALWAYS put my valuables in the safe (which this room was equipped with) and would not leave money unsecured in a hotel room. It doesn't matter the class of the hotel, thefts occur everywhere, so I did not have any issues with items missing from our room. Breakfast was good and at the end of it the waiter discreetly told me that I would not get a check because my breakfast was included in my rate. I inquired about the gratuity and he said that was taken care of. I was left alone all day and never asked when I would be leaving which has happened to me before when I have had late check outs at other hotels. They did not slip a bill under my door which I think is great. At check out I was asked to confirm my charges and then I was given a copy. Overall I found the service to be very good but not great. The bell men do not greet you like they do at other hotels but I received exemplary service everywhere else. The decor is not modern and clean like a W but I found it very attractive. I liked this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous for a romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: fijichick
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long weekend at the Sofitel and had a wonderful stay! The location can't be beat as it's very close to Times Square, and walking distance to many great restaurants, Rockefeller Center, Bryant park, Fifth ave. stores, several subway stations, and much more. The staff was top notch, including the maid service. The toiletries were excellent. The Gaby restaurant serves the most incredible grapefruit martinis and banana creme brulee. The bed and linens are incredible! Also, the price was very reasonable for Midtown. We had a suite and had plenty of space. Beautiful room in a very comfortable hotel. I'd highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Made my 30th birthday Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Monty1980
Reviews.Content: Fab hotel on W44th street, very helpful courteous staff who made the stay a pleasure. My partner had e-mailed ahead of our trip which ws to be my 30th birthday celebration and on arrival we were upgraded from the queen room we'd booked to a superior king on the 18th floor. Room very spacious with lovely bed adn linens. Lovely to have the large bathroom with seperate shower cubicle and deep bath. On the actual day of my birthday, a lovely cake was sent up with the compliments of the hotel. As we did not really eat in the hotel, I cannot pass review on the kitchen but if the evening meals are as good as the breakfast, it must be good. Most mornings we ate at the red flame diner just a few yards along the street. Thank-you all at Sofitel you helped to make a special holiday unforgetable

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Chingle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sofitel for a business trip in April and over the Volcano Ash Cloud disruption period. The hotel staff were very understanding and helpful. They were very flexible where my stay was easily extended and check out time was also very flexible. On arrival at check in, i requested to switched my room from 5th floor to higher floors. The staff reviewed the situation and moved me to 21st floor. Happy :) Room, big enough bed for me, nice spacious bathroom with great designer products. I needed a bath to calm me down over the depressing news of flight cancellation and uncertainty of when i will be able to go home! Internet acess, there are 3 pcs in the lobby but as you can imagine how busy it got where everyone was trying to rebook flights but again, good facility to have. Gym, i used the gym couple of times and it was well equipped. Room services, my dry clean was returned on the same day, great service. I believe the hotel used the dry cleaner across the road but it was slower going direct. Overall the hotel is in great location, 2 blocks from my office or subway station, lots of restaurants to choose from. I would recommend the hotel to other business travellers who is after some european style comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: bladesfan41
Reviews.Content: Loved the city, fantastic experience. As a base this hotel was just what we wanted, excellent location friendly staff and decent rooms. Would love to have statyed longer, but we only had a limited time between seeing family and having to fly home to the UK. If ever passing ths way again will certainly stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Location is perfect”
Reviews.Author: syvergy
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but praise for Sofitel. But I first must gush about the location. The hotel is less than two blocks away from Times Square, in fact, if you have a room on the western side of the building you might even be able to see it. From our window, we could see the Empire State building, which was nothing to sneeze at. But the fact we could walk out the front door and be standing under neon lights in less then 5 minutes was nothing short of fantastic. The Check In was good, but Travelocity screwed up and the booking didn't go through. Thankfully the hotel were able to put us in another room for that night until our room was ready for the next. Both rooms were great, especially the second, which was enormous. Cake and wine was complementary provided as it was our honeymoon - great touch. The bed was absolutely amazing, along with all of the extras. The bathroom was immaculately clean and all marble. Everything in this hotel screams luxury and it's worth every penny. The staff offer 24/7 service and were helpful all of the time. Very thankful. This has to be one of the best hotels in Manhattan, if not the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Staff, Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: chirop99
Reviews.Content: Visited New York last week and had a wonderful stay at this hotel. Was a little leery as I had seen a few negative reviews several months ago but went ahead and booked hoping for the best. The best is what we got. As others have said, you can't beat the central location which is right on the edge of the theater district. Didn't eat in the restaurant or use the bar but had room service most nights and the food was fantastic. Checking in and out, the staff were great. I enquired about a late checkout, as we had a car coming to pick us up at 3 pm, hoping to get a 1pm checkout and they were kind enough to let us have the room till 3pm. I don't think it could have been a better stay and heartily recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: tripkaki
Reviews.Content: We had only 2 nights in New York City and were grateful we picked this hotel because of its wonderful location. The rooms were compact but comfortable and all the staff we encountered were polite and obliging.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, space, peace & quiet, great location, great gym.”
Reviews.Author: carrco
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in April in standard room, it was spacious, quite and comfortable with a very high standard of maintenance and cleanliness. The atmosphere of the Sofitel is pleasant and welcoming and the staff in general are very helpful. Concierge pointed us in the direction of some great local eateries for breakfast/lunch dinner. We used the gym each moring and it is very well equipped and we enjoyed it. Had breakfast in the hotel on one occasion and it was very expensive, there are much better and less expensive places nearby. We felt safe/secure coming and going from the Sofitel and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: Amceja
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Sofitel for 4 nights in March. We found the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful. The concierge desk was particularly helpful, recommending restaurants, booking tickets and giving general advice cheerfully. There was a lot of rain during our stay in New York and our room had some water leaking in under the carpet. Unfortunately the next room we were sent to had the same problem. The staff were very apologetic and moved us into a suite. This was most unexpected and certainly not necessary as we were not really inconvenienced in our other rooms. We left the hotel feeling like special guests and would recommend it to anyone for a hassle free holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: grk58
Reviews.Content: This is hotel owned by a French company and catering to French and European travellers. The rooms were clean and comfortable. We find duvets annoying and our request for a top sheet after our first night was promptly taken care of. The conceierge was very helpful, the fitness facility top notch but the restaurant overpriced. IThe hotel is in the heart of the Broadway district and close to Bryant park. If you confortable with the NYC subway, it's a couple of blocks to Grand Central (Lex Ave lines) and 42nd Street (west side lines). Getting a taxi, despite the best efforts of the doorman, can take several minutes. Ignore other comments on the nearby Red Flame diner..just an ordinary diner, nothing excitiong. But the Taverna Kellinari, a Greek resturant, a couple of doors down was terrific; very good food and very lively and fun atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, loved the rooms, perfect girly break!”
Reviews.Author: NandJ82
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was fab. Location perfect and staff v.attentive and helpful. They checked us in early after a long flight which was very welcome. I explained that my friend had not visited the city before and they gave us a room with great views of the city so she could take it all in. Our room was spotless and replenished daily. The hotel was the perfect base for our girls holiday. I'll definitely take my partner to stay here next time we're in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection !”
Reviews.Author: SolusIreland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in sofitel over Easter and loved it ! From the decor to the accomodation to the staff, it is first class all the way. We usually stay in the fitzpatrick grand central but were so disappointed on our last trip that we decided to try sofitel instead and We were so glad that we did. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel. My only issue (a small one) was with the pillows , which are too hollow/soft and the hotel had no alternatives but I padded them with a couple of towels and they were fine. Already Looking forward to our next trip to New York and we will be staying in this hotel again !

Reviews.Title: “Would not change one thing”
Reviews.Author: Goughie
Reviews.Content: I spent Easter in NYC with a friend and, after reading the fab reviews on tripadvisor, decided to pick the Sofitel Hotel. I booked a package on Expedia website and got a fabulous deal including flights with Continental from Bristol airport. The only criticsm I could have was the check in. Despite us arriving after 3pm, our room was not ready and we had to wait in the bar whilst housekeeping got it ready. Ok, we were given a complimentary drink but after a long flight and wanting to get outside and explore straightaway this was an inconvenience. However, after about 30 minutes our room was ready. As I hadn't paid a great deal for it, I was not expecting it to be as good as it was. The beds were amazing - so comfortable after a very hectic day and the bathroom was fabulous. L'Occitane toiletries added that extra special touch. The location of the hotel is excellent as its between 5th Avenue and Times Square and everything seemed to be in close proximity. We were so lucky with the weather, sunny and warm every day. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone. Well done Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “A Quiet Haven in The Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: SydneyKevin07
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Sofitel beginning with the madness of the St Patricks Day Parade. Very comfortable rooms great staff in elegant surroundings. The bar was great and the staff were always able to engage the guests in stimulating conversation. The location was perfect within walking distance of most of the sites including central park , empire state building and the shops of 5th avenue. The only crticism - free wifi should be offered at all hotels of this class.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Wanderbuster
Reviews.Content: After numerous trips to Manhattan and a different hotel each time, we're here to stay. From check-in to check-out, our experience was great all the way around. The concierge service, room amenities, bar and restaurant, and location stood out, in particular.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay, sounded like french embassy in NYC”
Reviews.Author: MasterBoneco
Reviews.Content: The hotel car picked us up at the airport, so we started well. As I told at the front desk that we were newly weds, they upgraded us to an upper floor, for the 26th, with Chrysler Building view. Room is spacious for NYC standarts, the hotel itself is close to everything, at 44th st, and the concierge service got us reservations on all the fancy restaurants we wanted. Fsoull of french people, even the doormen said Bonjour and so on... and this was nice. The SoBed is excellent, and the room was very clean. After all, a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wow...”
Reviews.Author: NicLiz
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Sofitel from 12th-15th April at the end (or what we thoughts was the end!) of a coast to coast trip... Chose the Sofitel because I'm a A-Club member, but also because of the reviews we'd read on here and I wasn't dissapointed. Originally booked via the Accor iphone app - would not recommend this as it was a really bad experience - and after receiving no help from Accor Customer Service when the booking went wrong, the hotel themselves were ridiculously helpful and sorted all the issues out!! Stayed in a suite on the 28th floor - view of the Empire State Building from the Bedroom and the Rockerfeller Centre from the lounge. Couldn't have asked for more. Room was huge for NY and the SoBed did not dissapoint. Incredibly comfortable nights sleep after a hard days sight seeing. Room service was efficient and friendly. In terms of location, again couldn't ask for more - Times Square, Rockerfeller, Empire State and Central Park all within easy walking distance. Subway stations close by if you fancy going further afield. Check-in staff friendly and efficient. Concierge very helpful, with great tips and advice on things to do. Location could not be beaten.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I stayed in!Fantastic service!Huge rooms and bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: NiceRguy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Sofitel for 5 nights with my wife.It was a fantastic experience,staff was superb and the room and bathroom are huge.The beds,including duvet and pillows where the best I ever had.We received everyday 2 bottles of Evian in the room.I would recomend the hotel to anybody going to NY.

Reviews.Title: “very classy”
Reviews.Author: WJ60
Reviews.Content: the reviews below are right on target. Nice fitness room, welcoming staff. So much nicer than the Algonquin next door at basically the same price. Nice big bathrooms with tubs and showers. Very clean. Only negative was absurb restaurant and room servcie prices. But there's a diner half a block west for breakfast and DB Bistro Moderne a few feet east which has better breakfasts at still high, but better prices. VERY quiet even on fourth floor facing street

Reviews.Title: “Very accomodating”
Reviews.Author: johnbartley75
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my partner and her family. That was with her father and mother, sister and brother who is disabled. First of all I called up in advance as I was planning on asking my partner the big question. They offered me an upgrade, which was great. The room set up for my partner’s family was fantastic. The disabled access was great with two rooms and a lobby area set up specifically for disabled customers. I cannot comment precisely about how good this was not being disabled myself however, I am in construction design and thought it a good set up. The staff were always very helpful and the service polite and resourceful. The location was excellent for the sites, shopping, restaurants and bars. A very good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: UkSeren
Reviews.Content: Sofitel in New York was wonderful. We managed to get a very good rate (one comparable to 2 and 3* hotels) and were more than pleased with what we got. Service was brilliant at all times - the reception desk even arranged for us to have a late check out with no charge when they realised that we had a late flight. The location was also fantastic so we spend most days walking to the places we wanted to see. The bed was amazing - it was a shame to come home and get back into mine! I would definitely look into staying at this hotel again on a return to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but could be better”
Reviews.Author: KristaInLondon
Reviews.Content: I generally like Sofitels. When I travel, it's either a Kimpton property or a Sofitel for me. So I was looking forward to my stay at the Sofitel NY, especially given the raves on Trip Advisor. Let me go through my pros and cons: Pros Location, location, location. If you want central, this is great. Check-in. Fastest check-in ever. I gave them my name and credit card and ID, they gave me my key. Concierge. She was a savant. I approached her around 9:30 a.m. on Thursday morning and asked her a barrage of questions. Each one was answered immediately, along with directions. (I wanted a manicure/pedicure, needed a drug store, and felt like having a burger for dinner) Gym: This is a great gym. I didn't get a chance to count all the equipment, but there were at least two bikes, a few treadmills, and a few ellipticals. Plus a lot of weights. Also, the gym is free. Bath products: L'Occitane. Nice. Bath sheets. I'm a sucker. Cons Room service. On my second night, I wanted a snack and some wine. I ended up paying $57 for a cheeseplate and a carafe. I compare this to the Kimpton hotels, where the drinks are free from 5 to 6 and there's often cheese and crackers and well, Sofitel just doesn't stack up. (Kimpton also has better mini-bar snacks.) Wireless. I couldn't get the T-mobile hotspot to work, and I consider myself a frequent user and fairly technologically savvy. There was an Ethernet cable in the desk drawer, so I used this instead and never contacted them. Ice machine. There were signs for one on the 3rd floor, but it seriously looked like godzilla had ripped it out of the floor. In-room mini-bar: Warm. Enough said. Bed: Definitely could tell that many people had slept there before me. Someone needs to turn these mattresses. Big dip on one side. Price: Ouch. In short, this was a pleasant hotel. Definitely 4 star. But I'm not dying to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great everything!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is not our first (or last) trip to New York. We always stay here and we are always happy with our stay. I can't imagine a better place to stay when visiting. We are very close to Grand Central, Times Square, and the theater district. Do yourself a favor and don't cut costs by staying in a cheap hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel49
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night to a warm friendly welcome. The hotel is in a great position as other reviews have pointed out, i also have to agree with others about the quietness of the hotel as we were on the 15th floor and never heard anything. The bed was so soft and comfortable....lovely to come back to after hours of walking. Every member of staff i came across was polite, helpful and friendly. I will definately be staying here again when i return.

Reviews.Title: “My new favourite hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: Aegisint
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel in New York is my new hotel of choice in New York City. The hotel was everything I had hoped. Its located in the very heart of Mid Town, two blocks from the Theater District and Times Square. But for all that its incredibly quiet. The lobby area is very nice, very European and very comfortable. Check in was quick and friendly, in that French way. The concierge was also quick and efficient with our bags, they were in our room within 5 minutes of getting our keys. Bellman happily helped me get some ice immediately and arranged our heavy cases for us so they were in the right places. And I mean happily. Room service was quick, very tasty and good sized serves. Ok, its expensive, but the quality was certainly there and with the added extras one expects from Sofitel, bread basket, yummy butter and plenty of chilled water. Again all done with a smile. Needed a cup of tea after dinner and a whole day of travel. No kettle or coffee maker in the room. Called down, was told that there were none available until morning but that they would send up hot water and cups immediately, at no cost. Very impressive service for midnight. Had some minor issues with television and internet not working. Maintenance were there in minutes and everything was fixed within 10 minutes. The bed was heavenly. Nothing more needs to be said. The room was extremely quiet, a blessing given the usual New York Symphony of fire trucks, ambulances, police cars and garbage trucks one usually has to put up with. We were on the 20th floor but even so it was so silent we both had our best nights sleep in a long long time. The room was also very clean, as was the bathroom. The bathroom was very well appointed and there was gallons of hot hot water. There are two options here for the internet. The wired internet service is $10 but cuts out at 1200hrs regardless of what time you purchased your 1 x day. The other is a T-Mobile Hotspot, that also works out to about $10 but it does not cut out, gives you a full 24 hours. I found little difference in speed between the two and the T-Mobile one could be used in the lobby, so that was an advantage. We asked for a late check out, which is always tricky in a big city, the hotel accommodated us for a reasonable compromise, gave us an extra couple of hours. Returned later in the day ahead of a midnight flight and relaxed in their very cosy lobby. All in all, one of the most pleasant hotel experiences I have had in New York. I will stay there next time for sure and certainly recommend for others.

Reviews.Title: “We Love New York In The Snow”
Reviews.Author: SYD-LHR
Reviews.Content: Sofitel NYC is in a great location, comfortable and quite stylish. The Sofitel beds are amazing and we always have a good night on them. The only let down to this hotel was the staff. They were either very friendly and helpful or quite surly, especially in the restaurant were a simple breakfast of toast, fruit and coffee caused considerable confusion. All in all though, it's a good hotel in a great spot.

Reviews.Title: “Just superb”
Reviews.Author: Krisq2
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in here with my friend for 4 nights, have to say the welcome we got in hotel is just brilliant. Seriously from guys outside to receptionist and housekeeping staff who seen us on the corridor. If you are thinking French, than yes it is stylish as french are but welcome is for sure American very welcoming. Anyway reception staff was so nice, unfortunately don't remember any of their names(my ignorance) i suppose. We were shown around and off to our room on 21st floor which was really nice with the view of the Empire State Building and Christler Building. Room was actually nice size, i don't need 50x50 sq2 space. Bathroom was lovely with walk in shower and the bath. Hotel was 10min to Time Sq and 5min to3min to 5th Ave. Just the best position. Overall defo will recommend it

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: Ripgroover
Reviews.Content: A very nice, hotel, well maintained in a very good location. Decided to stay here due to the reviews posted and have no complaints. Staff went out of the way to get food that wasn’t on the menu for our young daughter, a late check-out free of charge was given without any hesitation. Didn’t have a very good view from the room but if you aren’t 20 floors up anywhere in Manhattan then it is to be expected, it wasn’t my first time there so it wasn’t a disappointment. If you get the 3 nights for the price of 4 deal then it is good value for money too.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in greatest City !!!”
Reviews.Author: Carpy725
Reviews.Content: The relentless nagging from my wife to visit New York paid off in March when finally I cracked and booked 5 nights at the Sofitel. Upgraded flights with Virgin to premium economy which was a great decision as the extra leg and bum room was great. Meals on plane not so good but then again are they ever that good. Fly out of Heathrow not feeling sorry for anyone that booked with the failing airline that is BA. Arrived in JFK airport and took cab $45 dollar set fee with $5 additional toll charge to hotel. Warmly welcomed and the efficient porters took our luggage straight from the cab. We got a room on the 21st floor - partly due to emailing the hotel requesting a high room as it was our anniversary (nearly). Room was an upgraded superior queen and still quite small compared to others. Large LCD tv - chargable mini bar but no kettle / tea / coffee. Then found out that free coffee available every morning from room near to restaurant. Hotel is in a great position around 4 minute walk from Times Square and therefore central to all the major attractions. Ate out for breakfast lunch and dinner as alot cheaper than hotel prices. Saw all the attractions Central Park with the boating lake was very nice. Empire State Building - no queues and definately one of the best things we did. Shopping a bit over rated - paid to go to Woodbury Common outlet a 40 min bus ride - if you want to save hundreds of pounds but having to pay thousands then maybe the designer outlets are for you. The only bargain I found was Superdry coat for £100 (Uk £150) and Timberland boots £60 (Uk £130) Statue Of Liberty and Ellis island amazing Coyote Ugly bar - pretty wild - barmaids dancing on the bar and owner trying to fight suited americans. Avenue Q show - great entertainment. Bubba Gump food was ok but not a patch on the ribs and chicken at the ESPN Zone both on Times Square. So much to see but I would say you could do most things with a 4 night stay. A truely amazing holiday as Gordon Ramsey would say "New York - DONE" God Bless America

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as expected”
Reviews.Author: THE_ONE_MRBEN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel New York for 6 nights in March 2010 after reading the great reviews on Trip Advisor. This hotel is in a great location - roughly halfway between Grand Central Station and Time Square (but the street itself is quiet). Reviews of this hotel are almost exclusively very good and it's easy to see why. Our room was upgraded upon check in (great way to start a holiday!) and the whole process was very professional. The room itself was fairly large, very clean and very comfortable. We did not eat in the hotel as it seemed expensive and this is New York and there is literally food everywhere. The only thing I can really fault the Sofitel for was the in room WIFI - as mentioned in other reviews it's expensive. Apart from this very small point, staff, location and quality are all fantastic and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury stay with bells on”
Reviews.Author: Y705
Reviews.Content: It was my husband's 50th birthday and I wanted to treat him so I booked a junior suite at this hotel. I must say, it was worth every penny. The rooms were large and very light with a tv in both bedroom and lounge area. The bed was so so soft and comfy and the pillows as well. A nice little welcome touch was a small box of chocolates on the table as we entered. I loved the separate areas including a dressing area. You could shut off all the separate areas as well so if one wanted to retire early you could shut all the areas down so if one of you wanted to stay out/up late, you would not disturb the other when coming into the room. The bathroom was a delight and it was nice to have a separate bath and shower. The in room safe was big enough for a laptop. Fresh bottles of water appeared every day as well which was a godsend. The sofa was comfy too. There was a nice turn down service where the maid put the radio on so there were nice sounds as you entered the room. Had me fooled on the first night, though there was a burglar in the room!! Check in was fast and so was checkout. The conceirge service, depending on who was on, was a little hit and miss. The doormen were delightful and it was a novelty having them open the door for me when I went in and out and a nice touch. My one and only complaint, and this is really pushing it, is that there were no tea and coffee making facilities in the room. Found it irritating that I had to get dressed and go out of the building to get that early morning shot. There was room service, but too overpriced for my liking. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel, too pricey for us, but there was a lovely diner just a hop skip and a jump from the hotel that did a fast and good service for about half the price of the hotel. All the staff were courteous and friendly and when I had a fall the day before we were due to leave the hotel, they allowed us to stay in the suite until it was time to leave for our plane ride home without charge. Bless. the location was excellent too. 5th Avenue at the end of the street and Times Square just a short walk away. We did most of our sightseeing on foot and this is easily done from this hotel and because it is in a quieter street, we were not disturbed by any noise at all. We had a good view of the Crysler Building as well. I would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, delicious breakfasts!”
Reviews.Author: SBJ486
Reviews.Content: We booked through Perfect Escapes website and got a room with breakfast included for four nights, and we definitely got our money's worth! The breakfasts consisted of delicious French pastries and your choice of entre off the menu (at least $75 each time!). Apart from that, the hotel was in a great location. About two blocks from Times Square, we used the subway often, and walked to Rockefeller Center. The hotel was quiet, VERY large rooms, and good service. The only down-side was the view- though we didn't mind because we were not in the room much- and the room would get slightly warmer than we prefer. We would DEFINITELY stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: sunnytxdallas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to New York for a week for our Anniversary. I looked at several hotel reviews and websites and Sofitel's reviews, website and location stood out. Two blocks from time square, 2 block from bryant park, 2 blocks from Central Station and right in between 5 and 6th ave. We booked a luxury room with the Haute Cuisine package which includes a daily breakfast and one dinner. The Gaby restaurant was amazing, the food was great both breakfast and dinner, and the staff was just beyond great, very attentive. One night after walking all day, we arrived at the hotel and my wife wanted some coffe, so we down to the Gaby restaurant and asked for a cup of coffee to go. I was expecting to pay for it but the amazing staff brought 2 to go cups a full pot of coffee and a hor dourves tray and told us it was on the house. On our first night after checking in we went for a small walk to bryant park and came back to our room and found an amazing chocolate dessert that said "Happy Anniversary" and on the 3 night, we had just walked in the room when a nice staff member brought us a bottle of champagne in an ice bucket and two glasses. Let me just say that I never asked for it and was never charged for it, they only knew it was our anniversary because the reception staff asked me if we were there for business or leisure and I responded that we were their for our anniversary. My wife and I had great time in New York and Sofitel made it even more special.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for Midtown NY”
Reviews.Author: fluffyloveheart
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is imaculate. The rooms are very comfy (if slightyl small but in my experience all NY hotel rooms are small) and have a luxurious feel. The service was rather formal but very proffessional and the decor was stylish. I went with my husband to do the usual NY sightseeing/shopping and we found the midtown location perfect for getting around. We didnt eat at the hotel but there is a fab diner right next door. If I am lucky enough to return to New York I defo stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: kclop10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose The Sofitel for our first Valentines Day after reading reviews on TripAdvisor.com. What a great place to stay! Very modern yet cozy and warm rooms and public areas. The staff couldn't be more helpful!! And when I mentioned that we were in town for our first Valentine's Day, we were upgraded to a higher floor which was a nice touch! I have been to NYC before a few times and this is by far my favorite hotel I've stayed at. I will stay here again this fall when I return for meetings!

Reviews.Title: “When will I ever need to go anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: mixip
Reviews.Content: Well, fourth time at the sofitel (I think I've even reviewed it twice) and although I always promise myself that I'll try something different when I visit NY I just can't find a reason not to stay at the Sofitel; every review says it all - lovely rooms, brilliant service, great locaiton, etc. I actually stayed in a standard queen room this time and it was absolutely fine - the bed is heaven and the nightly tray of biscuits awaiting me on returning to the room was a lovely touch. Even the stormy weekend (and non-stop rain) couldn't ruin my trip this time. One small tip (and it is! - I think every other review has mentioned something) - it's much quicker to exit the hotel through Gaby's restuarant exit if you're going anywhere north of 44th St. It cuts a block out and you can cover another block under cover if your visit happens to coincide with the worst storms for years....! lol

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to returning”
Reviews.Author: Faberge
Reviews.Content: This week, my husband and I spent a few days at the Sofitel on our first pleasure trip to New York. We had stayed at their sister property in DC and were expecting the same level of quality. We were not disappointed. The location is excellent. The staff is equally as good. The room was quiet and comfortable with all the amenities one could expect. I do wish they had a top sheet in addition to the comforter as we got a bit hot at night. Excellent hair dryer (minor thing, but important). Upon checkout, the Danielle noticed that we had not recieved the correct credit for our package - without us having to ask, she phoned central reservations and took care of this quickly. The bar staff was also top noch - only wish the bar area was a bit more cozy like the one in DC. We are looking forward to a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but needs a make over”
Reviews.Author: AbinGav
Reviews.Content: No one can argue with the location of this hotel it's great for exploring the city with lots of the sights in walking distance. The rooms are looking a little tired but clean, the best was the hardest bed I've every slept in, thankfully I don't suffer from back problems but am sure that if I did I'd be unable to manage the flight home! I don't think the hotel deserves it 4 stars to me its much more 3 star. All staff where polite and helpful but the next time I go I'll be staying in Soho where we found the shopping much easier and a better choice of restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel quality in New York”
Reviews.Author: silensloic
Reviews.Content: Classically Sofitel! Pros : usual high-level Sofitel quality (service, rooms and bathrooms), good fitness center, fresh fruits always on disposal... Quiet rooms. Cons : not directly located on Times Square ; expensive ; internet is not provided for free ...

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: Lillianne_8
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Sofitel NYC this past weekend to celebrate her 40th birthday. We were greeted in our room with a lovely dessert plate on which was written(in chocolate) Happy Birthday! (The dessert was yummy). We had a few issues that were resolved cheerfully. The breakfast was to die for...I felt I was in Paris with my coffee and hot milk (which I requested). The croissants and other pastries divine. We had one dinner there on Sunday night and it was excellent...especially the olive tapenade served with the mini baguettes. My compliments to the chef. (The sole was the best ever.) Staff was lovely and I never tired of hearing bonjour. I will search out other Sofitels as this was my first experience. Merci beaucoup to all.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Divine”
Reviews.Author: SojournerToo
Reviews.Content: To hear the staff greet me every morning with Bon Jour as I walked out the front door and to return in the evening to a room where classical music played softly from the radio, my bed turned down, ready for me to sleep, was divine. One morning, while waiting for a friend in the lobby, I asked one of the attentive staff for coffee. It was quickly served in one of those french drip pots at no charge. When my friends,who stayed at the Millennium, complained about their hard bed and terrible pillows, I guiltily had to fess up, that our bed was wonderful as were the pillows. A down comforter kept us warm. Our bath was very modern with a separate shower from the tub with a nice long vanity. Providing good lighting for reading in bed, as well, as a comfortable chair, were additional features that kept us very satisfied during our stay. We came in by train to Grand Central and found the walk easy to the hotel. In addition, we were close to Times Square and the subways. The room has a deadbolt, as well as a security bar and a peep hole in the door. In addition to the french soaps and shampoos, there is complimentary Evian water. I loved the Sofitel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location, but a little bare”
Reviews.Author: IslandSnowSeeker
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here for our Honeymoon. Every single staff member was friendly and helpful. The lobby is beautiful and the bar/restaurant was very nice (but quite expensive). The location is ideal for sightseeing (Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Radio City, Empire State Building-all within walking distance). We had a king room and it was big for NY standards. The bathroom was huge and beautiful! A negative-we ended up on the 7th floor (even though I requested a room on a high floor when booking over a month ago) and ended with a view of the side of an office building that was under construction :-( I have a feeling this had to do with booking through Expedia (as the receptionist made a point of mentioning how I booked the room during check in). Aside from the ugly view, the room was still very quiet. Had no problem getting on the computers in the lobby with free internet. Kind of disappointed in only one restaurant choice, no pool, very little common areas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: Charley82
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here at the end of October / beginning of November 2009 and it was wonderful. We didn't want to leave. The location was fabulous, the staff were so friendly and efficient and the room was pretty big and spotlessly clean. The hotel has a sophisticated, yet relaxed atmosphere. It's not cheap, but then New York isn't a cheap destination. Overall, a great experience from start to finish.

Reviews.Title: “One of THE best of NYC”
Reviews.Author: KandDinDC
Reviews.Content: I have just completed a three-night stay at the Sofitel New York. After staying at several other NYC hotels, I can truly give this hotel the award as my favorite NYC hotel. The hotel is very conveniently located and only a few blocks from Times Square. Since I was forced to attend meetings in a Times Square hotel, this property was a perfect blend of 'close enough' but not too close to the tourist masses. The hotel itself is very lovely. All of the common areas look recently updated but keeping the feel of a classic European decor. Check-in was smooth and friendly, and all of the staff members I encountered during my stay were very pleasant. The gym was also well equipped and large enough to be usable with multiple guests using the facilities. My room on the 12th floor was surprisingly large for a NYC hotel. Luxuriously appointed in right browns, golds and reds, all of the now-standard amenities were present (Bose alarm, in room safe, LCD tv, sitting area). The queen bed was very comfortable and only made better by the excellent fabric fittings. In the bath, a glass walk-in shower, large tub, and marble floors and counter made the luxury experience complete. Again, this hotel holds the gold standard for NYC in my book. There may be bigger (hello, Waldorf) and more glamorous (W Hotel, can you hear me?) but the blend of luxury, relaxation and pampering here are unmatched!

Reviews.Title: “Very responsive staff who quickly resolved a major problem, and fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WashingtonJL12
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I traveled to NYC to attend a wedding and chose to stay at the Sofitel in midtown to enjoy the city. I had stayed there twice before on business trips and loved the hotel. The rooms are very clean and comfortable, and I have always felt relaxed and at ease staying there. The rooms are very quiet and have every amenity you could want-- including my favorite: slippers. They are a bit small, but hey, it's NYC. We arrived early on Friday afternoon and our room wasn't ready yet, so we stashed our bags with the concierge and wandered around the neighborhood and grabbed some lunch. The location is perfect-- walking distance to Times Square and Central Park (if you're up for a nice walk), and convenient to the subway. When we returned, our room was ready and they offered to bring our bags to the room. Unfortunately the BCBG bag containing my brand new gown for the black tie affair and shawl was missing. The staff returned to our room 10 minutes later with a BCBG bag, but it wasn't mine. It only took a few minutes for us to realize that another guest must have my bag by mistake. The staff responded immediately, accepted responsibility, was very apologetic and focused on remedying the situation, i.e. find me a dress to wear a few hours later. Brooke from the concierge desk called the room and offered to send someone to the BCBG store to replace my dress. I had to shorten the gown significantly and take-in the top, so I knew there was no way I could purchase the same gown. I asked if I could just go to the store myself and find a new dress. Brooke was amazing-- she called BCBG and arranged to have a sales person greet us and help me find a new dress for the wedding. She also told me that if I couldn't find a dress that fit without alterations at BCBG to go to any store and just find a dress and bring the receipt back to the Sofitel. Brooke also offered to make me appointments for hair and make-up, and offered us a car service for that evening. I was impressed-- they were definitely going above and beyond what needed to be done. All I wanted was a dress to wear, but we were greatly appreciative of how attentive and willing they were to provide us with all of those additional services at no cost to us. In addition to Brooke, the hotel manager Katherine was also incredibly helpful. When we returned to the hotel with a new dress, Katherine met us in the lobby and apologized for the mix-up. She took the receipt and said that she would take it to their accounting department and let us know how we would be reimbursed. We returned at the end of the evening to a voicemail message from her saying that they would FedEx me a check ASAP. We returned last night from NY, so I'm still waiting for the check and can't comment on how quickly it was sent. I was pleasantly surprised and impressed with how quickly Katherine and Brooke apologized and worked to remedy the situation. Nowadays, it's so rare to find such high quality customer service like we experienced. Can you imagine an airline doing any of this for a lost bag? Obviously it would have been nice not to have the stress of a missing dress right before a wedding (yikes!), but it was handled in the best manner possible considering the circumstances, and I have no complaints. The other guest did return my bag the next day and I was able to get my original dress back too! Despite the misplacement of my bag, I would absolutely stay at the Sofitel again and highly recommend it to anyone for both business and personal travel. They showed that they are truly a 5 star hotel in the way they reacted and resolved this problem. The staff, especially Katherine and Brooke, were gracious throughout our stay. And, we had a fun story to share at the wedding!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and close to the sights”
Reviews.Author: ICRC1977
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel, close to time square but and theatres but far away not suffer any noise. The hotel room was clean and comfortable, nice BOSE sound system and flat screen tv. Bathroom very clean with a separate large shower cubicle. Hotel staff very approachable nd concierge excellent.
