Just one warning, DO NOT use hotel room phone for international calls, even if you dial and dont actually connect the hotel charge you $15 dollars per attempt! Otherthan that the is hotel suitable for all types, the hotel appears to do a lot of corporate functions and on occasions the foyer was very busy with business types and a there was a lack of seating, but in the bigger picture thats nothing really. I recommend this hotel for its location and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of quiet in Midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Sven1300
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Sofitel New York. Service and infrastructure were as expected from a 5-star hotel. Staff were very friendly and helpful and the atmosphere in the hotel and between the staff was pleasant. Even though the hotel has 400 rooms, it never felt like an industrial operation; the lobby, restaurant and bar were never crowded and the service of the staff impeccable. Congierge and door staff were helpful and well organized. We enjoyed very much the central location of the hotel that allowed us to visit New York and return for a 'break' without loosing too much time.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Stay Ever!”
Reviews.Author: MichelleH73
Reviews.Content: The room I had was extremely clean! Staff was VERY courteous and very nice! The lobby and all the amenities were AMAZING!! I would recommend this hotel to anyone would wants a REAL NYC experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Great home-base for our first trip to NYC”
Reviews.Author: kennyBNewbrunswick
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel for seven nights last summer and were very pleased with the experience. First of all, the location was excellent. We were a block and a half from Times Square and a block and a half from Grand Central Station. The area was very clean and we always felt safe walking home, even late at night (after 1:00am). The staff was good, the concierge desk (I believe her name was Brooke) provided lots of valuable information and booked an excellent city tour for us. The door men were friendly and quickly got us a cab when we needed one. There was a charge for wifi in the room, but there were three computers in the lobby for guest use (there was usually a bit of a wait for them). Our room was on the twenty-second floor with a view of the GE Building (30 Rock) and I would say the room was pretty big based on what I have heard about NYC hotel rooms. One could likely get a cheaper room in a similar area, but I would defiantly recommend the Sofitel to anyone staying in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a really good location”
Reviews.Author: Enjoyniceholidays
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sofitel in New York for 5 nights Feb/March 2010. It was the hotel that I had wanted to stay in when we decided to goto New York for a city break and it didn't let down. The staff were helpful. The concierge were excellent, booking trips and restaurants for us - giving us info when we required it. We dined in the restaurant which was lovely and also had drinks - the staff were great. The room was very nice, although not huge, was large enough. It was kept to a very high standard and cleaned to an impeccable standard daily. We had room service which was also good and prepared quickly. Location was good for our purposes - a couple of blocks from Times Square and the New York library so access to the subway was relatively easy. It was on a fairly quiet street so we hardly heard any noise whatsoever (we were on the 11th floor). We were given an extended check out time which was also useful on our last day. Only cons were prices were on the high side (for room service/restaurant/minibar) but guess that is more about the pound to the dollar as we found that pretty standard in New York. We were given bottled water every day - left in our room. If we were to go back to New York I would definitely stay at the Sofitel again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: lakegeorgegirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights during the beginning of a very snowy weekend for a birthday celebration. We chose the hotel based on trip advisor recommendations and were not disappointed. We were able to get breakfast at the hotel restaurant included in the rate which was a very good deal. We were also supposed to get a room upgrade but that didn't happen due to availability on the day we checked in. We were in a 19th floor room with a partial view. We were accommodated for an early check in and late check out. The staff were very pleasant and the hotel lobby is stunning. Our only negatives were cold showers on one of the mornings of our stay. Also the concierge didn't have the correct information on the subway to the Am Academy of Natural History. The B line does not run on weekends, so we wasted a half hour waiting for a train that wasn't coming. The location did allow us to walk to many places including restaurants and the theatre. It's one of the few hotels we've stayed in where we didn't hear anyone around us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, just two blocks from Times Square!”
Reviews.Author: Maast
Reviews.Content: Pre-booked at an early bird rate, which was still quite high but still very reasonable for NYC. Upgrade granted thanks to our A-Club status. Average view but corner suite so very pleasant and bright room. As usual, the exceptional Sofitel bed! Personalized welcome upon check-in and friendly staff. Very nice attention (wonderful cake waiting for us in the room) for our anniversary. Overall, excellent if you want to be in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - great location!!”
Reviews.Author: Eln1306
Reviews.Content: Whilst on our honeymoon in August 2009, we stopped off in NYC for one night before returning to the UK and I wish we could have stayed at this hotel longer!! On arrival to the hotel, we had been upgraded to a suite which was fantastic. The suite was on the 29th floor and had it's own living room, bedroom and dressing area. Not only that, the suite had its own private balcony with an amazing view of the Chrysler Building which was magnificent at night. The staff were extremely helpful and recommended a nearby restaurant which was great. All in all - a very memorable stop even if it was for just one night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great staff...Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SpanishLion
Reviews.Content: Located so close to Times Square & 5th Avenue, loved the 5 days I was there. Madison Square garden is not far away where i went to watch a hockey game. Staff were very helpful & polite, the fellas at the door are a great help...Would defo stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: smally1980
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at this hotel we were allocated a smoking room (very smelly), the front desk said this was a mistake and immediately moved us to another room on the 4th floor which was fine but had no views. The following day we were moved to a room on the 20th floor and were very happy with the room. The staff were very nice and helpful. Our room was very nice, the bed was very comfortable, there was enough space and the shower was very good. We were disappointed with housekeeping, they didn't replenish the toiletries and didn't wash my robe when I left it with the dirty towels after spilling wine on it. The location of the hotel is very central but it is astoundingly quiet, the staff are very nice and room service is good.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Close Times Sq, quiet, very good staff and good value”
Reviews.Author: Travelman68Uk
Reviews.Content: Not cheap but nevertheless well worth the money, providing quality, class, excellent safe location, comfort and quiet. You could pay a lot more elswhere and not achieve all of these "tick boxes". Just off 5th Avenue and close to Times square. All Staff very helpful and you can get all the advice you need. Within walking distance of theatres, Madison Square Garden and some great shops and places to eat. Did not eat in the hotel but for breakfast there is a good diner 60 yards down the street which is excellent value, very clean and efficient, which is also open for late night coffee/snacks if required. This hotel is a great base from which to do the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable , quiet and well located”
Reviews.Author: imhonot
Reviews.Content: Great location just off 5 th Avenue and close to Times square. Also next door to a couple of other well known hotels. Didn't eat in the hotel but everybody from check in to concierge very helpful and the hotel itself was warm and comfortable.It was never going to be cheap but it wasn't the price of the very top end New York hotels so a good combination of reasonably expensive and quality... a good base from which to do the city....

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: Antoine_75116
Reviews.Content: I've been upgraded to a Suite on the 26th floor with very nice view. My Bed was just so marvellous... Lobby disappointing as well as housekeeping. Very well located.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel , great location”
Reviews.Author: McCarthy7906
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Sofitel , a great hotel with great location minutes from times square. We booked a suite as it was our honeymoon and though we were congratulated on check , nothing else !! Now I see someone else had a chocolate cake , maybe we'll get the same if we return for our anniversary lol , The room : spacious , clean really comfortable bed and a great selection of movies for those lazy mornings , we had a view of 45th street not the prettiest ! Staff were very helpful , this hotel is expensive as is the in room service $23 for burger plus vat & tip but the food is good and this is a luxury hotel. There is a great "real" american diner two doors down which always had a queue but for something really special head for breakfast at Normas at the parker meridian a real treat at $90 for two but amazing ... We also had dinner at the old homestead one of NY's oldest steakhouses ...amazing..but do make reservations. If you want to see a show probably best to book ahead the concierge said $400 for 2 tickets as it was valentines weekend. Best bar in the area O'Lunneys on 45th , the staff are great fun !

Reviews.Title: “XX anniversary”
Reviews.Author: woccer
Reviews.Content: fabulous stay made all the more so by the attentive and warm staff, particularly Danielle at the front desk. A beautiful chocolate cake awaited us upon our arrival ( for our anniversary) and our room was comfortable and clean w/ a superb view. would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth recommending”
Reviews.Author: FussyTraveller21
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel based upon other travellers reviews and were not disappointed. Service, location and price justify the Sofitel's high ranking. Only downside was a poor meal in Gaby restaurant. Would certainly return and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lucylou1979
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Sofitel for our first trip to NYC. The location is brilliant. The hotel itself is fantastic . The room we stayed in was a good size with a huge bathroom and very clean. The staff were all very polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tmcdonald345
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Sofitel. Everyone was very helpful and the location was perfect for us, not too close, but not too far away. Room was typical NY size, but very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and a good price”
Reviews.Author: BirdsandBay
Reviews.Content: We love this entire hotel company. It's always good quality for a fair price. Excellent rooms and large considering New YOrk City hotel sizes. Marble bathrooms, feather beds, robes. Wonderful flower arrangements in the lobby, a beautiful scent throughout the hotel. Very nice exercise facility and a very good bar and restaurant. We feel so comfortable at this place. Check their website for good deals on stay and try to get breakfast included. The breakfast's are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel NYC - we felt like at home”
Reviews.Author: DurandC
Reviews.Content: Room service in Sofitel NY is too expensive (17% taxes + $3.50 USD). Besides this negative point, everything was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Phantom of the Opera!”
Reviews.Author: LynnD7
Reviews.Content: Celebrated Moms 70th Birthday--went to broadway to see the Phantom--saw wax museum(a must)and took a Horse Drawn Carriage Ride through Central Park--hottests day in history of city.....next door to hotel was a real seinfeld kind of eatery with THE best food...Hotel sent us balloons and a nice bottle of bubbly....saw Donald Trump-he had his private Limo driver take me back to my hotel because I was on crutches......

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: shmoopy
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at Sofitel. The rooms and bathroom were quite large and well-maintained. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have slept in, and came close to derailing our plans as it was hard to get up! Evening turn-down was a nice touch, with macaroons, evian, and a pear left on the table. Nice hallways with nice bright lightning. Didn't need to interact much with the staff, who seemed nice, although the front desk staff were sporting such French heavy accents that they were almost unintelligible; my husband tried to engage one in conversation in French, and it quickly became evident that the accent was a put-on! Funny! But it is NYC! Location is very good in mid-town with good access to grand central station and 5th avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Life is Magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: DramaQueenFlip
Reviews.Content: Even before we arrived in New York, I had already contacted the concierge, Mr. Rene Madrigal, to arrange for our pick-up from JFK and for tickets to Broadway. He responded promptly and throughout our stay, he and the concierge staff were extremely helpful and very friendly. I asked him to have my mom's white coat laundered since no one in Manila would take it because it has leather strips and he sent it out and brought it back the day before we left for Atlanta. When we arrived in Atlanta, we discovered that one of our companions had left her cell phone behind at the computer terminals at the Sofitel. We asked them concierge to have it sent to Atlanta, which they did overnight. The hotel is a couple of blocks away from Times Square and also from Fifth Avenue. The location is quiet, conducive to sleep at night. The rooms were rather small, but it is to be expected in New York. The beds were so comfortable, it was difficult to get out of them.

Reviews.Title: “Central, clean & friendly!”
Reviews.Author: RedMayo
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, very central for Time Square, 5th Avenue and all other major attractions. Room was clean and quiet. Cant think of anything negative what so ever about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Gibby12909
Reviews.Content: Really clean, the bed was the most comfortable bed we've ever slept in!  Location was superb.  A bit pricey for the size of room but its the location that you're paying for I guess.  Couldnt really fault it, would most def go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterLoris
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel mainly due to the reviews on trip advisor and weren't disappointed. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and our request for a quiet room was no problem for them. The location is great for all the major tourist stops, shopping at the subway. The Gaby Bar serves excellent cocktails and The Red Flame down the street was a great place for an all-american breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Check my pics before booking”
Reviews.Author: LondonLondoner
Reviews.Content: As others have said, the location's great (if you want Tourist Central). Staff very friendly. Foyer really smart. But none of that matters because the rooms are way below expectations. Book elsewhere and get better for less. No more to say, just check my pics...

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful, calm oasis in the middle of the manhattan madness!”
Reviews.Author: englishrose1981
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Sofitel New York and I have to say our expectations were exceeded! Having stayed at a couple of other Sofitels before, we knew that this one would be good but to be honest it was outstanding. The reception team were extremely polite and helpful and check in was so quick and easy which was nice after a 7 hour flight. We had a junior suite on the 27th floor with a direct view of the rockefeller center. The bed was enormous and the most comfortable I have ever slept in. There was a small lounge area off the bedroom and the bathroom was a decent size with a separate bath and shower. I have never stayed in such a clean hotel...it was absolutely immaculate. The only (small) issue I have is that breakfast was not included in the rate and the hotel restaurant is so overpriced that we never ate breakfast there. I would recommend the Brooklyn Diner on 43rd street on Times Square instead (about a 5 minute walk). All the major sights are within a short walk: 5th Avenue shops, Times Square and the Rockefeller Center are all within a 10 minute walk! The hotel is 4 star therefore quite pricey, however I would definately stay there again when I return to New York....it's worth evey penny as it's very clean, extremely comfortable and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I hoped for”
Reviews.Author: tessajane
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to New York for a few years now and have always wanted to stay at the Sofitel, but never been able to afford it. Having stayed in the Sofitel in LA (through Hotwire), I decided to splash out and book four nights in (for the price of three) for my daughter and I to celebrate her 20th birthday the weekend before Christmas. Our flight was delayed so we arrived in the middle of the night to be welcomed by charming members of staff. The hotel was warm, stylish and inviting and our (upgraded) room was absolutely lovely - very spacious and well equipped. It's true what they say about the beds - they are so comfortable you don't want to get up. The bathroom was large and it was a treat to have a separate shower cubicle. The orchid and candle set the scene for a truly relaxing, pampered stay. We didn't order any room service (which I thought was rather toooo expensive), nor did we eat in the restaurant. However, a beautiful mousse-like tart was left in our room for my daughter's birthday and when I requested to store it in the mini-bar, a fridge was graciously delivered and installed in our room in a flash! New York was freezing (12" snow fell one night when we were there) but magical in the lead up to Christmas. The hotel was tastefully decorated and comfortingly warm and cosy. It was very quiet with no street noise or sirens. The three free computers in the lobby enabled us to keep in touch with the people we had left at home with no hassle at all and the concierge team were most helpful. So, did it live up to my expectations - you bet it did!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: GammelMont
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel for 3 nights at the beginning of Jan with my niece. The room was big enough and the bed quite comfortable. I had requested a room with a nice view through the website and got it no problem, pleasant touch I though. The breakfast is also pretty good. The staff was nice and helpful. I didn't ask much from them but when I did, I was helped with a smile. Would definitely recommend it and go back.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, upscale, and well-located”
Reviews.Author: JTears
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a very good hotel. By Manhattan standards the rooms were exceptionally large, with comfortable bedding and well sized bathrooms. Also the location cannot be beat, especially if you are there to see some Broadway shows. Service is pleasant and efficient. I just had a couple of quibbles. I requested a twin bedded room, but instead got a king-bedded room with a rollaway. Understandably the rollaway was not particularly comfortable. Secondly the security leaves something to be desired, as neither the doorman nor the elevators require keycards for entry.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet stay near Times Square and Broadway!”
Reviews.Author: austexmike
Reviews.Content: Based on Trip Advisor reviews I booked two night stay beginning on new year’s day. No regrets! I made reservations on the hotel website to take advantage of the pre-paid discounted rate. We arrived at the hotel a little after 1pm after checking out of our previous hotel. With no one at the check-in desk at the time I thought we would need to have the hotel hold our bags until a room was ready, but we were pleasantly surprised to find our room was ready! The check-in was smooth and the lady helping was pleasant. With four elevators available we never experienced a problem waiting. No complaints about room space as we had enough space to place our luggage against the wall and still walk around. The bed was VERY comfortable, bathroom amenities plentiful, water pressure and temperature great, towels soft and plentiful, room spotless, and we never heard housekeeping during our stay. We didn’t need to use the closet space staying only two nights. The television picture reception was a bit fuzzy at times, but we didn't watch much. The Bose sound system is a nice amenity we enjoyed that I find very few hotels offer. Our room view on the 14th floor wasn’t anything spectacular overlooking a quiet street, but I wasn’t specifically looking for a view during this stay. This made for very quiet nights where I don’t recall hearing a sound. The hotel is within 2 blocks (the short ones lol) of subway lines that will get you anywhere and 2 blocks (the big ones!) away from the Imperial Theater where we watched Billy Elliot. Housekeeping turndown service included coming home to our room with classical music playing. A wonderful way to welcome you back to your cozy room after a long day in The City! The Sofitel New York gave us a quiet area within walking distance to Times Square, Broadway shows and subway lines. With a comfortable bed and spotless room added our overall experience was a very solid 4 star hotel stay!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: cdeast
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to celebrate a special ocasion. We were celebrating a birthday and our 40th anniversary and the person (Vivian) at check-in acknowledged both. In addition a cake was left in our room when we went to dinner, which we thought was a very nice gesture. The upgraded suite was very spacious, had two flat screened tvs and a great bathroom - we loved it. The room was clean as was the entire hotel, and the staff was helpfull and friendly. The breakfasts, which were included in our package, were fantastic and the waiter(Ronald)- the best. In summary, we had a great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Really Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Rochey23
Reviews.Content: Myself and my fiancée have just returned from our 4 day stay at the Sofitel. I chose this hotel by sorting the most popular hotels on Trip Advisor and picked the most reasonably priced centrally located one. The Sofitel is a beautifully decorated hotel, the lobby is fantastic, the rooms are spacious by New York standards, we had a superior queen room, on the 22nd floor. It was at the rear of the building so very quiet at night. It was well equipped with a big flat screen tv with 50 odd channels to choose from which was great. The bathroom was elegant, the shower was excellent and the L'Occitane Provence shower gel and shampoo were a nice touch. The reception staff were professional but not overly friendly, just business like, which is fine. The door staff were excellent, very polite always happy to help and even got me a superb SUV, as requested, to bring us to the airport. The only downside and it is a big one in my opinion was the heat in the rooms, the hotel itself is very warm throughout but the heat in rooms made sleeping difficult. The air con was ineffective, it just seemed to make noise and the window didn’t open enough to let the air in, which is a shame as the bed was superb I just couldn't sleep in it. The location is the biggest selling point, a few minutes from Times Square, however this hotel is refined and a joy to stay at. I'd highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECTION”
Reviews.Author: JoJo79
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend stayed here for 2 weeks from 30/12/09. We decided to stay to celebrate the new year and our birthdays. Man what an experience, the staff were fantastic, ok, the check in girl ws a bit miserable, but when I eventually saw the attitude she put up with daily from some of the snotty guests I could forgive her. Location wise, perfect, Times Sq and Broadway to my right, 5th Ave to my left, you couldnt get lost, if you wernt sure, the doormen would certainly help! We had breakfast included, I couldnt keep away from the bacon or salmon eggs benedict or the American, eggs how you like it, with canadian bacon. They would bring a huge basket of pastries, would be greeted with a smile and a how are you, juice, tea or coffee. The staff at Gaby's were great, a special mention to David, Edmound, Goz and Teresa! If you do not want to eat at Gaby's may I recommend Red Flame down the road, just as great, but bigger portions, ha ha ha. or Connoly's on 45W near the Lyceum, or Bar 41 on 41W. As I mentioned me and my friend had birthdays a few days apart, so on our last night, we went to our room after last min shopping/running around like headless chickens to find chocolates, a dreamy mousse cake with happy birthday written in chcocolate and some nice bottled water! We were so touched it was fantastic! There was also a gym on the basement level, but I didnt bring my trainers and couldnt find a pair (can you believe that) that I liked in NYC so I didnt use it. When we left we said goodbye to everyone as it was a pleasure to meet them from the door men, housekeeping, everyone was so naturally nice. I recommend this hotel to everyone and I cannot wait to go back. . . counting down starts now!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: smp13
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel for only one night in January but had a great experience. We arrived on a Sunday evening and were immediately upgraded to a one bedroom suite -- without asking. The room was large and nicely appointed, especially for Manhattan. Only minor thing wrong was two lights were burned out and weren't changed while we were there despite mentioning it to the bell man. There also was no turn down service at night. Again, not a major issue but kind of surprising for a Sofitel. Since we were only there for a night we didn't have time to try out all of the hotel amenities. We did have drinks in the bar which was also serves as the breakfast room in the morning. Drinks were nice and breakfast the next morning (which was included in our room charge) was very good and generous. All in all we had a great experience and will look to stay here again next time we're in the City.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, A comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: SWIFTYS
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this Hotel, We had a great package, inclusive of Breakfast. Our first room, although really nice, was opposite a service lift and door, and was very noisy, so we spoke to the duty Manager and changed to an Executive Corner suite. This was great, nice lounge area, with comfy sofas and great views (this room was on the 28th floor) and a nice bedroom, with the most divine bed! The best hotel bed I have ever slept in. A Really Well appointed bathroom, with separate shower cubicle ( I hate shower curtains over baths!) a deep bath tub, all done in marble. Nice L'Occitaine Bath Products, and a decent haridryer! Air Con/Heating units were noisy though, but I could live with that. Breakfast - This was Included and was of quite good standard. Service was little hit and miss though! Waiter was always unsmiling and not friendly. some mornings you got your complimentary smoothie, some you didnt, some days there was milk and sugar on your table, other days there wasnt! Personally, I wouldnt pay extra to eat breakfast here, but as it was included, it proved to be good value. The blueberry Pancakes were really good! (check your bill carefully, as they charged us for Breakfast and a $9 tip and tax! even though it was included and we never signed for anything) Overall, I would stay here again, as it was in a great location and very comfortable to come back to after a long day shopping. If you stay here, try Keenes Steakhouse for a meal, its only a few blocks away, its excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: YoungTravellerBerks
Reviews.Content: Returned from this hotel today and want to go back! The hotel itself is beautiful - very elegant and stylish and the rooms are clean and homely. The staff cannot do enough to help you. I stayed here for 5 nights and literally never had to open a door myself! My main reason for praising the staff is regarding the help and assistance they provided me with when my flight was cancelled. As my mobile phone would not work, I asked the concierge where there was a phonebox. They told me not to worry and they made all the phonecalls for me and got me onto the right people to re-arrannge an extra nights stay at the hotel and another flight. Baring in mind these calls were international, I was amazed that they did not ask me to use the phone in my room. The location is perfect for anyone who wants to shop and go sightseeing. Macys and the Empire State Building are about 15min walk and Times Square is literally round the corner. This is my first trip to New York, and If i returned I would definately consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: KarenFAberdeen
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. lovely hotel, staff very friendly & welcoming. we were there during the broadway strike at the concierge even took my mobile phone number and phoned me with an update every afternoon to let me know if any shows were on and if he could get tickets - now that's service! room very clean - bathroom lovely and a better location you couldn't find! turn right and you're onto times square , turn left and your on 5th avenue. twas a wee bit more pricier than i would normally pay, but it added to the whole '1st time new york' experience. would definately recommend this hotel and if going back to new york, i'd check availability here first.

Reviews.Title: “A smart hotel in a great central location”
Reviews.Author: T&P&Co
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six nights in this hotel on a holiday to New York. Without doubt it's location is great within midtown; minutes away from both Times Square and Fifth Avenue. And given it's location, it seems reasonably good value for Manhattan. Overall, we felt it was a little business-oriented, and didn't seem particularly personal. We used the hotel as our base to explore the city, for which purpose it was perfectly suitable. Our room was fine. What you would expect from a city-centre hotel. One disappointment was that our room was adjacent to the lift shaft, which meant that there was a whooshing noise whenever a lift went past. We didn't really notice this in the night, but by about 6am, the lifts were in full flow which didn't result in a particularly restful night's sleep. It took as a few days to work out what the noise was, by which time we didn't feel like moving room, but our suggestion would be that, if you are a light sleeper allocated a room next to the lifts, you consider asking to be moved. The bathroom was very nice, with a separate bath and shower, and lovely l'Occitane toiletries. We didn't try the hotel breakfast as there were so many places to go nearby. The Brooklyn Diner (Times Square & 43rd) served up some spectacularly good blueberry pancakes! The concierge staff were very helpful suggesting places to go, including helping us find a local cinema and film showing times. We would definitely consider staying here again, as it does offer decent value given its central location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: galaxychocolate
Reviews.Content: Me & my boyfriend stayed in this hotel for three nights in the beginning of December. As soon as we got there the reception staff were welcoming and polite. Our room was immaculate and clean. The room was much lovelier than other four stars I have stayed in! During our stay the pay phones stopped working but the staff were more than accommodating and without any hesitation let me use their phone upstairs for an international call telling me to take as long as needed! When needing to book our taxi to the airport they asked for the number and booked it all for us. On one day it was raining as we went out and the staff outside passed us an umbrella for our journey. I have never stayed somewhere so lovely, with free, fast internet in the lounge, helpful staff and amazing rooms. Highly recommended for anyone wanting to stay in a great location in New York :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MattFitz78
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to stay somewhere really central, with large rooms by New York Standard, excellent Beds, excellent Showers, turn down service in the evening this place is for you. We got a realy good deal through Last Minute .com which had the tax included in the price. The doormen are really friendly as were the concierge and recomended some real gems for drinks and tapas. Stand out restarants in New York - Budakabar, Pastis, Spotted Pig. Would certainly use this hotel again and really enjoyed our stay there. We have stayed in hotels around the world and this is as good as you are going to get in a city like New York.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet perfection in Midtown”
Reviews.Author: cjauff
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sofitel New York once for business and it's the first place I checked for our vacation. Excellent location on 44th Street between 5th and 6th Avenue. It's as quiet as you can get in the middle of the city, thanks to 44th St. being a one way with minimal traffic compared to 42nd or any of the north/south avenues. We arrived early, and were given our room immediately! Concierge staff were very helpful in recommending restaurants, and directions to Yankee Stadium. The food is a little pricey, so I would recommend the diner just down the street on 44th towards 6th Ave. on the same side of the street as Sofitel. Duane Reade pharmacies are conveniently located at 44th/5th and 44th/6th for snacks, etc, and the subway is very close. You're a short walk from Times Square, Central Park, and all the other destinations in Midtown. The room is a great size (especially for Manhattan), and it's probably the most comfortable bed I've ever slept it. Very large washroom with separate shower and bath tub. I will definitely be back at Sofitel for my next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but reliable and the location is excellent”
Reviews.Author: missnsusan
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent for most major sights and shops . Room rates can be pricey but its a dependable standard of accommodation . Try to secure breakfast inclusive rates as a la carte plates are very dear .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HoppysTrips
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel from 25 Nov 2009 for 5 nights at an average of US$371 per night including tax which was a stretch for my budget but this is New York and I came away thinking it was money well spent. The hotel is on 44th St which is an absolutely perfect spot from which to explore Manhattan. I had a standard room (No. 701) but it was very well appointed with a great bathroom (with separate shower and bath) and it was spotlessly clean. My room was at the back of the hotel so it had no view but it was a great location as I didn't hear any street or traffic noise the whole time I was there which made for a very restful nights sleep. The hotel has a great little gym which I used every day, and it also gets top marks from me for having a little alcove area in the foyer which has 3 computers and a printer for use of guests at no charge. The staff were also very friendly and hotel just had a very nice vibe about it, it wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “European Luxury in Midtown NYC”
Reviews.Author: SwissAirTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights before Christmas Time and 2009 Blizzard in NYC. Choosed the Sofitel based on Tripadvisor's Reviews and its location. We're very impressed and we didn't regret our choice. Very good things are size of the room (we got a Suite as booked, on 26th floor with cityview facing GE Electric building). Room was huge and very comfortable. 2 rooms and a marble bathroom with L'Occitane bath Products, separate Shower and Bath. Also 2 TV's flat screen with HD channel. The SObed is the best you can have in a luxury hotel. Believe me! Had a very good sleep there. Had Breakfast in the restaurant and it was a la carte so we could choose every morning a different dish. Very good place but pricey. Hopefully our breakfast was included in the rate. Location is really good and very near all the NYC's main attractions such as Times Sq, 5th Ave, Central Park, Grand Central Terminal, Broadway... Take a cab if you want to go South as it's quite cheap in NYC. Staff was helpful and most of them spoke to us in French and we replied also in French as we do speak the language. Only complains I can make is no free internet access in room (only 3 computers available in lobby which are always busy) wired or wireless and no coffee or Tea machine in room, which should be a must have in this hotel category. A very good choice for your next luxury stay in the Big Apple. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Even Better Than I Remembered”
Reviews.Author: EastBayTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights (12/15 and 12/16) for business. From the friendly doorman who greeted me to the (different) friendly doorman who helped me get into a car at 5 a.m. when I left, the hotel and its staff were at the top of their game. The lobby was beautifully decorated. Check in was quick and welcoming. Room was spotless, plenty of light, easy power access for laptop, great minibar, and the excellent bathroom and bedding made it a great home base for 2 days. Bar is outstanding, and it was very cool that the bartender remembered my drink . . . from almost a year ago. Breakfast was I'm-glad-I'm-able-to-expense-this expensive, I may have to try the diner a few doors down. Sorry to read of some bad experiences. I've stayed here three times, can be pretty picky myself, and have nothing but good things to say.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel is solid NYC choice”
Reviews.Author: NYCVISIT
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel in New York with my family for two nights over the holidays. Good midtown location, nice hotel, polite and helpful staff (which I have found to be a characteristic of Sofitel's). The rooms, and bathrooms, are relatively large for NYC. I have stayed at the Warwick and the Parker Meriden, which are in the same area, and I think the Sofitel is the best of the three (although I would recommend any of them).

Reviews.Title: “High Ranking Is Not Justified”
Reviews.Author: xiphe
Reviews.Content: Referring to Tripadvisor reviews, I booked 4 nights in December 2009, 16-20. On our arrival, the room we reserved was not ready, and they placed us in a room that was below what we had reserved without telling us, but assured us that the room would be changed to a very nice room for the last 3 nights of the stay. The room we changed to was much nicer, and appeared to be what we had reserved in the first place. Believing that we were overcharged for the first night of the stay, we pursued rectifying the matter with the front desk, but instead the front desk insisted that both rooms were of the same class, but it was very clear to us that they were not. Given the opportunity, they decided to not rectify the situation, which negatively effected my perception of the stay. Pros: Good water pressure and great hot water, very comfortable bed, very clean bathroom, very quiet room, good HVAC, good room service for dinner Negs: Dishonest front desk, dated tacky decor (from the early 90s?), dirty appearance of rug in both rooms Will return to the London NYC next year, methinks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - exactly what you would want in uptown NYC”
Reviews.Author: JWBandJLB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sofitel on 44th Avenue from December 17th to 21st, in room 606. It was a 'basic' room, but we had absolutely no complaints. The room was small - but from what we have read this is quite normal for New York. What we appreciated was that it was spotless, the bathroom was awesome, and the bed was very comfortable. This hotel did not feel 'worn' at all, and the staff were always willing to help with any requests. All in all a top-notch hotel in a very handy location, minutes walk to Times Square and a multitude of other attractions. No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: notonlytraveller
Reviews.Content: We were staying at the Sofitel for 4 nights in Dicember 2009. The hotel is nice, the room is comfortable even though is not big. We've booked a Superior room, so I suppose the Standard room is even smaller. The cleanliness is less than average and the service is almost worse. On the second morning my husband was going to have a shower and noticed that the bath amenities were not replaced since the day before. I've called the housekeeping dept asking them to bring some shower gel in our room. After 10 minutes waiting I've called again and the answer was that we have to wait another 10-15 minutes to have the shower gel. My husband had an appointment that morning so he couldn't understand why he had to wait for half an hour for one small bottle of shower gel. He was very upset and called the Duty Manager, so they finally sent us some amenities but only after 15 minutes. The Duty Manager assured us that he is going to report to the Accommodation Manager about the situation but we never received any apologies from no one and no one contacted us during next days of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fell in love with the City and this hotel made the trip even more memorable!”
Reviews.Author: Calshot1
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. When they say luxury they mean luxury. Extremely clean, comfortable and cosy. The hotel staff could not do enough to help you. It was my first time to New York. I fell in love with the City and this hotel made the trip even more memorable. The location is perfectly situated for Times Square, Broadway, Empire State Building, NY Public Library, Grand Central Station, Central Park. The list goes on. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who seeks just that little extra something for their trip to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy value for considerable money”
Reviews.Author: DencUk
Reviews.Content: On arrival a superior type on the desk advised me that I had been upgraded - though I had not realised I had bought some kind of inferior room on their internet booking system. The room we were given was pleasant but nothing special. It lacked the basic tea and coffee making facilities you find in every b and b and motel - i guess $500 a night is not enough to cover that. The shower was an irritating trickle. The hairdryer blew only cold air. There was no plain water in the mini bar - only Perrier sparkling which i personally cannot abide. True they came round and gave us tiny bottles of Evian on two of the three nights we stayed there - but its not enough. The room key system failed on two days out of three. When i trailed down to the desk the second time I was offered no apology but an imperious clerk demanded that I produce ID. Truly you are there to serve them. The initial supply of shampoo was never replaced and when it ran out on the third night it took three phone calls and an hours wait before they brought some. We had difficulty making the room ac work properly - it was always too hot or too cold and the noise it made switching itself on and off during the night woke us up every time. We both thought the bed was the most uncomfortable we have tried to sleep in in along time. All in all its very expensive and very off hand. Its not the $350 or so they say here - its $500 when you include the tax and so on. For that they cant even give you a coffee maker . When will these hotels realise that privacy is important in the mornings and people generally dont care to wait the half hour we had to to get a coffee [ at about $20 with the price tax service and tip] And no internet - when will these hotels realise that web access is as essential as hot water. Try the Waldorf Astoria instead - cheaper and better in every way.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: yumsweets
Reviews.Content: We were in new york for a week and we stayed at the sofitel...it was at the perfect location..u could just walk to times square and lots of places to eat jus down the road.its a nice cozy boutique hotel and the rooms r pretty spacious for new york standards,our room was lovely..felt like home. the people at the front desk were quite friendly and helpful.It was so much better than the hilton where we stayed last time. Overall we really enjoyed our stay at the sofitel .

Reviews.Title: “$1800 STOLEN FROM MY ROOM BY HOTEL STAFF!!!...”
Reviews.Author: 1worldtraveler3
Reviews.Content: $1800 Stolen from our room at the Sofitel New York Thanksgiving weekend...Both hotel security & NYPD made a report & said "It was most likely an "inside job" & good luck trying to recover the loss"...I've contacted the hotel manager and he said "deal with NYPD and NEVER contact neither him nor the hotel regarding the stolen $ again...They are NOT responsible!"...I would assume a so called 4 star luxury hotel would hire only licensed/bonded professional housecleaning/staff working for them but apparently not!...I am warning everyone NOT to stay at this hotel...It is very overrated...We booked a "luxury king" room and upon arrival were given a small standard room with a queen bed because they claimed to be overbooked...After complaining for 20 minutes, the apathetic staff with faux French accents and major attitude finally agreed to comp us breakfast...Unbelievable!!! This definitely was the WORST hotel stay I've ever encountered in New York. I frequently travel worldwide for both business & pleasure & I have NEVER been robbed in my hotel room & treated so poorly...Stay away from this hotel !!!

Reviews.Title: “Stolen money and horrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: freakyholiday
Reviews.Content: Booked a luxury king room and checked into the hotel and were given our room key. We notice that the room was a queen room and called the front desk to make sure, and they said yes, you are in a queen room but that they were sold out so they would comp us a breakfast the next day and they would also upgrade us to a junior suite king room for our last two nights. We thought this was fair enough and accepted. The next day they had someone move our luggage to our new room and everything was going great. The hotel does seem a little dated, but not in a a run down kind of way. It's a great area if you like being near Times Square. They are pet friendly and we had our dog with us. If this was the end of this story it would be a wonderful one, but it is not. We were gathering our things to check out of the hotel and my partner noticed that our money had been stolen out of his shaving kit. This was about a couple thousand dollars. We immediately called hotel security and we insisted that they call NYPD. There was no indication that the room had been broken into so it was clearly a hotel employee. Also, that was all of the cash we had left for the trip and still had a full day in NY. The manager did nothing but let us keep the room until we had to leave for our flight. To top it off when we were checking out the person behind the front desk tried to charge us for the breakfast that they said they were comping for us. Now, I would think that this supposed luxury hotel would have had a note on our reservation stating what had happened to us and would acknowledge our plight, but alas, no, I had to ask to see the manager and he still didn't acknowledge what happened. When I called the general manager, Florian Shutz, he in essence told me that there was nothing he could or would do to help us and that he took no responsibility for what his employees did or did not do. This guy would be good at testifying before Congress because he was good at not giving a straight answer. Either this hotel has a thief that works for them, or this hotel is being burgled by a guy/girl who can get into your room without a key and busting down the door.

Reviews.Title: “Problem Solved...”
Reviews.Author: tyzak9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel New York from November 25th - 30th just in time for US Thanksgiving. First let me say we have stayed at the Sofitel in Miami and London - both impressed us and the reviews on this website of the Sofitel in New York encouraged us to stay here in New York. I have stayed in New York numerous times and this was by far the best value for your money. We stayed at the W midtown last time and paid almost double for a bathroom that you could not close the door when sitting on the toilet - so we were very happy with the size and quality of this hotel room. Great location and wonderful rooms. Nice restaurant and a GREAT gym. Staff was wonderful with one exception. Here is my story. I had paid for two rooms - a junoir suite and a king room side by side as we were travelling with our 5 yr old, my mom and my sister in law to celebrate my mom's bday. The plan was to put myself and my daughter on the sofa bed in the suite, my mom to have the king bed and my sister in law the other king room. Check in was a breeze and at midnight, I went to pull out the sofa bed for the night only to find that the sofa was in fact not a sofa bed. A call down to front desk and I was told that yes, I was guaranteed a sofa bed, and they would figuure out something for the night and then move us in the morning. It was after 1am when I finally went downstairs to get an answer of how they were going to deal with this problem. The front desk clerk clearly did not know what to do (he discovered they had no more rollaway beds in the entire hotel) but was trying his best. The evening manager sauntered over and told me my mom would have to sleep curled up on the couch with some blankets as they had no alternative - I quickly replied that my mom was 60 years old and would not sleep curled up on a couch - he would find her another room for the night and then sort this out in the morning - he could not have been more displeased with this but DID give us the other room for the night - very sourly and without apology. A TOTAL JERK and not someone who should be dealing with the public. My mom went to bed in her new room and was fine - we felt we would resolve everything in the am. In the morning the AMAZING day manager approached us - very apologetic and clearly very embarassed over what we had dealt with the night before and suggested my mom take the complementary room for the entire length of our stay. We were so surprised and shocked - we thought one of us would be sleeping in a rollaway for the entire 5 nights - he also sent up a cake to my mom wishing her a happy 60th and some chocolates to us for the inconvenience. I have told EVERYONE about this as I feel this is what the hospitality industry is about - making people have an unbelievable experience and remembering them - I will always recommend any Sofitel now because of this young mans actions. It was already a lovely hotel, but he went out of his way to make it an UNBELIEVABLE hotel and a great, great experience for us. I am hoping the General Manager reads these comments and promotes this guy because he understands the business - we are already planning a trip that will involve another Sofitel. This will come back to them 1000 times in more business. Way to go Sofitel for making your guests know they are wanted!!

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel--A Great NYC Family Getaway Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aaafraser
Reviews.Content: Our Thanksgiving family vacation (including 6 adults and 9 children (ages 1 - 11 years) was made even more enjoyable by the very warm welcome we received at the Sofitel. The staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpul. The rooms were good sized, clean, well appointed, and very comfortable. Little touches like the separate shower and bath tub, the small box of chocolates, and the turn down service with lovely classical music over Bose speakers were appreciated by even the youngest members of our family. Kudos for making the Sofitel a lovely, elegant oasis in the midst of hectic mid-town Manhattan. PS---Great location too for many tourist "hot spots!"

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to all expectations”
Reviews.Author: ThunderBayGoofs
Reviews.Content: The Room -Hotwire 4 star rating was well deserved for this Sofitel. -Staff was fast, efficiant and curdious. -decor was on the edge of opulant. -fridge was delivered to the room at no extra charge. -prepriotory bed ensembles where amazing! -As with any high end hotel, you pay to use the phone and internet. -Only 1 VERY MINOR issue we had was finding a working ice machine. -unbelievably quiet, we did not hear 1 siren while in the room. Location -15 minutes walk north to Central park -15 minutes walk south to Penn station/empire state building -2 minute walk to times square/broadway -5 minute walk to Rockefeller centre/Saks on fifthe ave -2 minute walk to nearest subway station -$60 cab from Newark airport or $40 cab from JFK(we took public transit) -close to many well reviewed restaurants such as DB Bistro Moderne, Bubba Gump Shrimp Co.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect and the comfiest bed ever!”
Reviews.Author: Spacecadetgirly
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from a three night stay at the Sofitel and I really cannot fault it. The location is great, a short walk from Times Square and about a ten minute walk from shops on 5th Avenue such as Abercrombie and Fitch, Bloomingdales, Tiffany’s etc etc as well as the lovely Central Park. We had room 2017, which had a view of the Empire State Building and Chrysler Building. The room itself was lovely, the bed was the comfiest I have ever slept in and both the room and bathroom was immaculate. The room was also very quiet. The staff were attentive, friendly and on the ball. Breakfast was not included in the rate but we found the Red Flame Diner a few doors down perfect for a feed before starting the day. I would not hesitate in recommending the hotel and if and when I am back in NYC I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just right.”
Reviews.Author: DebDarren
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights a week ago with partner and friends and we all loved this hotel. We asked for our rooms to be next door to each other and to be on a high floor. Both our requests were met and our room, 2114 was perfect. No noise whatsoever with one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. The bathroom was wonderful with an amazing shower but the best part was the bath. To have a relaxing bath at the end of the day in New York was wonderful. The towels were plentiful and were checked and replaced daily and the housekeeping was perfect. Every evening our bed was turned down and fresh bottled water left by our bed. We had cocktails in the bar every evening before going out and they were superb. Whoever was behind the bar was charming and very helpful as were all the staff we encountered. We didn't eat in the restaurant but it did seem to be busy over the weekend. My husband used the gym twice and was impressed. The hotel has a real 1930's feel to it, very romantic with a great lobby with a fire that seemed to be lit all the time we were there. I would definately go back there again and would recommend it to friends. All the time we were there, I didn't see any children. However, when my kids are old enough to go to New York with us I wouldn't hesitate to stay here with them.

Reviews.Title: “nothing but the best”
Reviews.Author: montmartre2
Reviews.Content: one of the few hotels to confirm a high storey room when u book it. very good and smiling service. location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: Andy-Bag
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a long weekend in NY. This was my first visit to NY and I was really pleased that we stayed at the Sofitel. The location was fantastic, between 5th and 6th Avenue, just a short stroll from Time Square. We were on a girlie shopping break, so booked a twin room. The room was of a reasonable size and the beds were really comfortable. The bathroom was very nice. I have no complaints whatsoever. There is an iron/ironing board in the room and a good hairdryer. No tea/coffee making facilities, but maybe that's a British thing. Anyway, we found a Starbucks nearby on 5th Ave for an early coffee! There is complimentary Evian water in the room. We didn't eat or drink in the hotel, but the restaurant seemed very popular with large groups of people. The staff were very helpful. We left our luggage at the hotel after we checked out and when we returned 6 hours later, we were able to weigh our cases to make sure that we weren't over the 23kg limit! There are 3 computers in a little room off the lobby with free internet and a printer. We never had a problem with availability. There is Wi-Fi in the room, but there is a charge. The hotel isn't cheap. In fact I didn't think we would be able to stay here as twin rooms are more expensive than the basic doubles, but I found a good deal with Expedia which saved about £250 each compared to the price for booking flights and hotel separately. And this was a good time to go - the Thanksgiving sales had just started!! I would recommend this hotel to anyone that wants a bit of luxury in a central, but quiet location.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort in the city”
Reviews.Author: SC/BTravels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sofitel for three nights in November. The Sofitel is a perfect location for a stay in the New York. We had stayed at Sofitel 18 months prior to this visit. The room we were given is showing signs of wear. When I reached down to pick something up off the bathroom floor I noticed areas on the walls and bathroom doors that were not clean and the door worn and chipped at the corners. The same went for the tub. There was a black spot in the tub. I thought it was dirt, but it's chipped, and has not been repaired. We use the shower only, but this might bother someone who likes to soak in the tub. The shower had a small amount of staining in the caulking around the glass that faced the tub. While this may not offend others, we're picky and expected more from the rooms at the Sofitel. The concierge desk was a tremendous help as was the staff outside. We encountered a young man at the front desk who was no help at all when we asked for change. He seemed more interested in his computer screen, as he looked up once. Our request was deferred to another staff member who happily got the change for us. I wouldn't base my judgement on him...the other front desk staff was very helpful. Would we stay here again. Yes, but there would be some phone communication before hand to make sure the room we had was in better shape.

Reviews.Title: “Never disappoints”
Reviews.Author: lawdogs1
Reviews.Content: 3 night stay over Halloween weekend. I have stayed here in the past. The customer cervice remains excellant. The rooms are average to slightly larger for NYC hotels, marble showers with glass doors, quiet and great location in midtown. Much better here than on busy Times Square - but very centrally located. The staff - friendly and accomodating - there is an exercise room free of charge - new bath producxts everyday - I love the Sofitel in New York. Its just big enough to meet your needs, without being too big to be overwhelming - computer services in lobby and great bar and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously overpriced”
Reviews.Author: SefanVT
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located, close to many attractions. The service and the rooms are good, with a few quirks. At check-in you are greeted and addressed in a caricaturesque French. The room was small and the bathroom had a bar-like door, offering little/no privacy. The worst part is that it is seriously overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant place - great location, service and view!”
Reviews.Author: blueiron12
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Oct. We asked for a room on a high floor - and got one with a fabulous view of the Chrysler building on the top floor. Room was large for New York - perfect cleanliness and luxurious standard of furniture and fittings - all very clean. Great service - friendly lobby and concierge - we tried room service and it was very quick - nothing better than having breakfast overlooking an amazing view!. There is a diner down the road for breakfast and it is a great location to get to Times Square, Grand Central station. Its on a quiet street so you feel like you are away from things and very safe. It is worth paying for!. There is internet connection in the lobby where we arranged our yankee tickets!..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service best for Broadway”
Reviews.Author: latebloomerSydney
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent a fabulous 6 nights in NYC. We chose this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews which turned out to be very accurate. Location was ideal as we wanted to be near Times Square and especially Broadway. We saw some terrific shows and were able to walk back to the hotel most of the time. It was also conveniently located between 5th and 6th Avenue from a shopping perspective. We had a suite on the 27th floor which was quite spacious and extremely quiet. The bed was very comfortable. The best thing about the hotel was the service. We found everyone extremely courteous and helpful. A very special mention for Brooke at the concierge desk who was a delight and gave us a number of excellent suggestions for restaurants which really enhanced our experience. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: Take_Me_There_Too
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel is grand. The location is convenient to everything and in a good location. ROOMS -- The rooms were beautiful. Not a single detail was overlooked. There were plush robes, ample closet space, a nice desk, sharp TV, great lighting, and it was beyond immaculate. The feather beds were heavenly! I slept like a baby. Our room had Euro twin beds which are between a twin and a full-sized bed. I am 5'10" and had leg/foot room to spare. The bathroom was huge and had a separate shower and tub. They even provided L'Occitane toiletries. I ordered room service, and it arrived within 15 minutes. They also promptly delivered a tube of toothpaste for me (which I forgot). GYM -- The gym was well-appointed. Luckily, I got there early and was able to get a treadmill without a wait. I believe there were four treadmills, three elliptical-type machines, and some weights/equipment. I would definitely, definitely stay at the Sofitel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Gusfenton
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights at the Sofitel in a luxury king room. Couldn't fault the location, very central for most of the popular attractions. Room very spacious and nicely appointed, gorgeous marble bathroom with seperate shower and bathtub. It had the most comfortable cosy bed which you just sink into and don't want to leave. Ate at the hotel restaurant on the first day for breakfast but after that went to the Red Flame Diner which is only 50 yards from the hotel and was half the price, it was excellent! Very helpful doorman and reception accomodated a late check out with no hassles. Very good choice for a stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Marky1971
Reviews.Content: Greeted by very friendly and professional staff upon arrival,quickest check in ever,hotel is in a great loacation,close to Grand central station,Times Square,Rockefeller,3 block walk to Central Park. The rooms are of nice size and lovely plush clean bathrooms,one of the niceset rooms we have stayed in New York,the view was of office buildings and was the only negative i have of my experience,but we spent all day marching around Manhattan so we were not too disapointed. We only went in the bar to have a drink so i cant review the restaurant,but the whole bar area had a lovely french feel to it and was modern,i did find the prices a bit steep but this is New York. The concierge was very helpfull,waiting at the front desk only too happy to help,we definately recomend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon In NY-The Manhattan Beginning”
Reviews.Author: flyncoastal
Reviews.Content: My bride and I booked a room at the Sofitel through a third party site to start our honeymoon. We had tickets to a Broadway show, so we wanted to stay near Times Square, but not too close...and after reading everyone else's reviews and decided on the the Sofitel. We arrived after midnight because of our late Long Island wedding reception. The check-in was quick and our bags arrived within 15 minutes of us getting into the room. I knew the room was not exactly what we book (low with no view), but was too tired to say anything...so we crashed (well, as much as you crash on your wedding night) and started our first full day as a marrying couple. After a restful night we got up to begin our day in Manhattan. On our way out of the hotel we stopped by the desk and just mentioned how we had booked a high room (and that I called to let them know we would be super late for check-in, they told us we would have a high room with a view because it was our honeymoon) and they not only rectified the problem, but they moved our bags while we were out and upgraded us! Our second night was just a comfortable as the first (yes, even the rooms with no view are super comfortable). The bathroom was nice, the L'Occitane products were great, and the bed...oh the bed...it was so comfortable. The concierge was always busy, but never overlooked any guest. I had a deep desire for some authentic NY bagels for breakfast on the morning of our check-out, so I had to ask. The concierge pointed me in the direction of a bagel shop right around the corner and it was delicious. Overall, the Sofitel NYC was romantic, comfortable, clean, and the service made the whole experience even more memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Believe the reviews”
Reviews.Author: shamac69
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a combination anniversary treat/40th birthday present for myself. It was wonderful. After having been absolutely repelled by a few hotel stays this year, coming to Sofitel was amazing. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was quite lovely, the staff were friendly and sincere and the location was convenient. It was very pricey, not exactly a bargain but worth the money we spent. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Difficult to fault it”
Reviews.Author: nfh
Reviews.Content: I can't fault the Sofitel New York. It was everything I expected of a city centre hotel and it made my stay in New York a real pleasure. Having Platinum status in A-Club, I am entitled to an upgrade, but there was no upgrade availability on my first night. Fortunately, a suite then became available and I moved in on my second night. The basic rooms are much nicer than anywhere else I've stayed in New York, especially the bathrooms which are often badly designed in New York hotels but perfect in the Sofitel. The suites are even more impressive - very spacious and extremely comfortable. I found nearly all the staff to be extremely helpful, especially the check-in staff and the concierge. The general attitude of the staff is one of flexibility and trying to accommodate guests' wishes, and I felt like a valued customer. For example, on my last day, they offered to let me check out of my suite at 5pm instead of the 4pm late checkout I was entitled to. The hotel's location was perfect for me, as I was travelling on business but stayed an extra day for sightseeing and shopping. So many of the places I wanted to visit were within walking distance, and I found the Sofitel to be right in the middle of everything. The thermostats in the rooms work very well and allow you set the desired temperature to anything you want - including in Celsius (probably the French influence). The room warms up very quickly if you're too cold. There's no point in using the wired internet, which costs $10 until noon no matter how soon before noon you start using it. Instead use the T-Mobile wireless internet which works throughout the hotel so you can take your laptop anywhere. You can get a wireless voucher from the front desk for $10 (easier if you're travelling on business) or $8 if you buy it online with a credit card, and it lasts a full 24 hours rather than only until noon. Both the wired and wireless internet are just under 3Mbps downstream and upstream, so it can get a little slow when lots of users are using it at the same time. The safe was just big enough for my 15.4" laptop. My only criticism was the television channels. There are no international news channels (e.g. BBC World, Deutsche Welle etc), so you won't easily be able to keep up with what's going in in the outside world. Even CNN is the domestic US version. However, to be fair to Sofitel this is a general problem in New York hotels, and they do offer TV5 for French speakers. I resorted to streaming BBC news on my laptop, and gave up using the two televisions in my suite, which was a shame given that they were large and modern. I will definitely stay at this hotel on my next business trip to New York and will recommend it to all my colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel......Great Service..........Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 1nedrac2
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed at a Sofitel before this stay.....I now know I have missed some great nights........It is not inexpensive, but it is well worth it. Every employee recognizes you with a pleasant greeting...the bar is fantastic and the breakfast is better (try the crispy toast and Egg). I am already booked to go back!

Reviews.Title: “great location clean comfortable but expensive”
Reviews.Author: loum21
Reviews.Content: i had a great stay could not fault the hotel it was quirt clean loverly room right in the centre of midtown between time square and grand central station. there is a great little dinner a fwe doors up as well i did find it expensive though, but very comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, as expected”
Reviews.Author: USMC-Nav
Reviews.Content: I reviewed the listings of the hotels in NYC and found reviews were good for the Sofitel. Well, they were correct. It is a nice, quite hotel that is close to Broadway and Times Square. The staff are very courteous and eager for you to have an enjoyable stay. My wife left an item in the common area and forgot about it until later. It was actually turned in to the front desk and they held it until we asked if anyone turned it in. Room was great, bed comfortable, and room quiet. Will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A weekend seeing plays”
Reviews.Author: hampdenLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel for my second time. I like trying different hotels but my wife liked it so much we decided to stay there again. We are relatively picky about where we stay and I have to say we were happy once again with our experience. The location is great if you are a theater goer. The broadway theaters are within walking distance. Nice little bar in the hotel. The staff is very friendly and the hotel has a european feel.

Reviews.Title: “Little Paris in centre of New York. Oooh la la”
Reviews.Author: AlexMove
Reviews.Content: Loved it. Great location between 5th and 6th on W44th. Close to 5th Ave and also pretty much all of the theatres for shows. All staff greet you with a Bonjour or Bonsoir. Not sure if the staff know french fluently or just a few words, but no matter, we loved it. Staff very service orientated and seem to really care about customers. Great New York experience and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again, assuming price is kept reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice and value”
Reviews.Author: erin&drew
Reviews.Content: Lots to love about this hotel. They let us check in early and stay late on check-out day. Frette towels, large room and lux bathroom. It's a great location, yet a quiet street. Red Flame restaurant a few doors down was great for breakfast. Felt like we got the best value in town with 3 nights for price of 2 special.

Reviews.Title: “Use the Sofitel every time I'm in New York”
Reviews.Author: surfcowboy
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, quiet rooms which is realy important as I fly in from Europe and I'm in bed by 8PM and awake at 3 AM! Often meet the same people in the gym downstairs and the staff are great. They have a great CRM tool as they always welcome me back and remember my room preferences which makes a change as most hotels are useless at remembering that you stay there 5-6 times a year. Generally pop out and get a bagel and coffee around the corner for breakfast but their breakfast is good (but pricey) Lobby is great place to meet people. Just can get expensive sometimes depending on season.

Reviews.Title: “Just book it!”
Reviews.Author: The_Doctor_MOC
Reviews.Content: I booked the Sofitel largely on the basis of reviews here - I was not disappointed and now very happy to put my £0.02p - I was travelling with my elderly mother for her birthday and the staff were very attentive. The location is superb - turn right and its just a short stroll to Times Square and the Broadway shows, turn left and you are on 5th Avenue and very close to many sights that are sure to be on your itinerary - Room very clean, room service prompt and only complaint was soggy toast! - If you can afford it then you won't be dissapointed

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: MartyMUC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel in late September and it was a good experience. Staff was friendly and helpful, the room clean and spacious. I didn't exactly had a view, but I could see the top of the Chrysler building from my room. Bath was also rather roomy but not 100% clean on the day of arrival, but on the following days. I could hear slight elevator noise in my room but it wasn't a problem as there obviously weren't many night owls among the guests. The midtown location is great, you have good access to public transport and some sights are even walkable. If you arrive at Newark and don't mind taking the bus instead of a taxi, the bus stop is only a few minutes away. I didn't have breakfast in the hotel, you have some options in the vicinity. I liked the Red Flame Diner on the same block. But it can get busy there. There were only minor flaws, e.g. they didn't notice that there was a defect bulb in one of the lamps and the remote control of the Bose sound system didn't work. And I wonder if they don't ask you anymore if you enjoyed your stay when checking out. But all in all a very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Shines”
Reviews.Author: KT861
Reviews.Content: Went to NYC for a business meeting and stayed at the wonderful Sofitel. Centrally located in Manhattan, it's on quiet 44th street between 5th and 6th. The location is wonderful, but the service, cleanliness, and quiet sophistication of the hotel are what really shine. My bathroom had a white orchid and a small tea candle...what a lovely touch! Lobby decor is elegant, upscale and beautiful -- a nice spot to sip coffee or wine with a friend. I felt like I was entering an art museum. My room was sparkling; maybe the cleanest hotel bathroom I'd ever been in. Hotel staff greet you in French, making it feel so ooh-la-la sophisticated. All staff were very friendly, efficient and courteous. Room service breakfast was HUGE! The room was smallish, but impeccably clean, and most importantly: QUIET. Lastly, the pillows were a surprise. I had neck fusion surgery and travel with a foam pillow that I carry in my bag (space saver bags reduce the size). My room had both foam and feather pillows -- two of each -- to satisfy either the feather or the foam crowd. Wow. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: art820
Reviews.Content: We found the Sofitel through a discount hotel website for much less than comparison hotels in the area. We were traveling with a museum group and the rest of the group stayed at a nearby hotel for almost double the price (and wasn't nearly as nice). The Sofitel is very chic and comfortable. The rooms are not extremely large, but plenty big for two people. The beds are very comfortable, with nice linens and pillows. The room was also very quiet, which is very important for a light sleeper. It is conveniently located as well. I also liked that this hotel does not feel extremely large. It has a very "boutique" feel about it. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone making a trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Doogle77
Reviews.Content: This was a very clean hotel in the middle of Manhattan. The staff was very friendly. Within walking distance of practically everything. There was also what seemed like a major subway station a couple blocks away. Will definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and amazing beds!”
Reviews.Author: RhiannonL
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights at the end of Sept 09. We booked via www.perfectescapes.com which included early check in, late checkout, free room upgrade and Breakfast was included. I'd highly recommend this site for a bargain stay and perks at this hotel! Our room was ready when we arrived early, which was a welcome relief so we could freshen up before hitting the city to explore! The location of the hotel is a couple of blocks away from Times Sq, so ideal for exploring. We indulged ourselves twice with a scrummy complementary breakfast (courtesy of Perfect Escapes.com) from the hotel, which otherwise would have been quite pricey ($30pp approx otherwise). Room wise we were based on the 12th floor. There weren't any views to speak of from this floor, but the room was comfortable and spacious. The beds are amazing, having stayed in a Sofitel before in Chicago, this was one of the primary reasons for selecting this hotel in NY! After a long day of sightseeing in NY the bed was welcoming, and cozy. I'm tempted to splash out and buy the SoBed range, it's that good!!

Reviews.Title: “Best deal if you Get a Good Deal $$$”
Reviews.Author: MarcosF123
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with Parents , two rooms , two couples , When you talk about Manhattan , you have to expect to PAY between U$ 300 to US 450 for a Small room with NO Extra service ( no : Breakfast + Internet + Parking , etc... ) BUT the Sofitel , wich is one and a half Block from Time Square , has one of the BEST ROOM in Town , all New , 100% clean and one of the Best and Biggest Bathroom in Town .
