The bed was soooo soft that I woke in the morning with a sore back, but I remedied this by removing the feather-filled topper from the bed for the rest of the stay (its actually a duvet and not a mattress topper proper as far as I could tell). The concierge was fantastic (my bags did not the LA transfer with me and didn't arrive until 6pm the next day, and the Concierge rang to find out where they were for me, when they didn't arrive first thing in the morning as I had been promised at the airport. The location is great (but only a block over from the Library so I didn't see that as a deal breaker). I had room service my first night and it was fantastic although expensive - arrived promptly and was soooo huge (soup, grilled cheese sandwhich, fries and chocolate cake) that I kept half of it and had it when I woke up with jet-lagged promptness at 6am (ie 2am NYC time) hungry. I also had the continental breakfast one morning and that provided enough for lunch as well. My only complaints are that the ceiling of my bathroom was really icky - mouldy and stained. very unattractive. and i was charged for internet use on my first night when I could not have used it because my internet cables and plugs were in my bags somewhere in LA and my laptop battery was dead after the trip. Although I have brought it to the attention of management, no one has bothered to reply and no refund has been forthcoming, which I think is poor service. Next time I will head back to the Library because I like it there, but I would happily stay at the Sofitel again - it was a perfectly decent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel New York a Must”
Reviews.Author: markCheltenham
Reviews.Content: If you happen across my review then I would suggest you trust it. When I booked the Sofitel I read many reviews and trusted them, and I'm glad I did. Without going into too much detail and becoming boring, this was a great hotel. Like most new york hotels there isn't much to see from the outside, but a revolving doorway and a door man or two. First impression when walking in was impressive. Marble, sofa's, plenty of staff, quite luxurious. The room, as previous, comfortable, spacious, large bathroom, huge TV, all you need and more, considering that most of our time was spent doing what we went to NY for, walking and sight seeing, etc. Importantly, as you leave the hotel, take a left and within a minute you are on 5th ave, turn right and within about 2-3 mins you fall over time square. We found we were in the heart of NY, convenient for everything. Walking up 5th, we were only about 15 minutes from central park, and down 5th, about 15 minutes from empire state. About 60 seconds to the right of the front door was the red flame diner. Like something straight off the TV, it was cheap, great food, huge menu, and fast. A must for breakfast. I would recommend the hotel without question. Even when we had to leave at 5am, the doorman hailed a cab for us, something that I had planned to take a lot longer. We ended up arriving at the airport an hour earlier than required. Overall, great hotel, good service, the best location. Go there.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location, Large rooms for New York!”
Reviews.Author: Shell4Andy
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Great location, clean, friendly service - everything you could want from a hotel on a city break! Only two negatives - the complimentary water is infact a small bottle 33cl of evian. I felt a bit cheated by that expecting it to be unlimited and not kiddie sized bottles! Number 2 - The Gaby Bar. Two Cappuchinos for $12... you've got to be kidding me! I know it's a French Hotel but I don;t expect Paris prices in New York, especially with the strength of th £ against the $! All in all the hotel itself was excellent, We had them book us a table one evening at Keens (based on thier recomendation) my suggestion is, do your homework on where to eat - because Keens Steakhouse that we were told about - was disgusting! I would say i'd stay here again, but I wouldn't. New York is too big and has far too many amazing hotels to stay anywhere more than once. Or perhaps I haven't found my favourite yet. If it's your first time in NYC this hotel is for you, the location is the best part about this place, so close to all the tourist areas - Times Square, Fifth Avenue, Top of The Rock..etc Another suggestion, ask for a room on the highest floor, that way you may get a decent view. We requested this and had a room on the 20th floor. 2020 to be exact and had a pretty cool view of the Crysler building!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ABSH4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel NY for five days recently and loved this hotel. We were on 18th floor with excellent views. Staff were pleasant, professional and helpful. The room and bathroom were large and nicely decorated. The location is particulary good - just off 5th Avenue but in a quiet street. Would be happy to recommend to others and will definately stay here again. This hotel is well above average for a four star and worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Will Not Stay Anywhere Else When In NY”
Reviews.Author: RedGiraffe
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the positve comments. This is simply a great hotel. All round service is very special. Rooms are super clean and massive by NY standards. Desk staff and concierge can not do enough for you. Bar and restaurant both excellent. Located right next to Times Square and a short walk away from CS or 5th Ave I'm not really sure what else you could ask for. Even my mother loved it. Stay at this hotel you will not be disappointed. Tips - Get a privilege card (Accor). This got me a free room upgrade for both the rooms I had booked and a late checkout. The higher the floor the better the views. Try to get a room facing The Rockefeller Centre. Eat breakfast at the Red Flame Diner - a few yards down to the right as you exit the main hotel entrance. Corned beef hash and eggs :) concierge can sort a cheap limo service to get around or to/from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: jutmoll
Reviews.Content: Midtown location makes this a perfect choice, especially if you're headed to Broadway. Mostly everything about the place is first class, and definitely worth the price we paid ($250 per room plus tax for Presidents' weekend). My only real complaint was a heating system that occasionally sounded like a jet taking off, but it wasn't so terrible you couldn't sleep or anything. Very clean, nice amenities. I'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: ciarao
Reviews.Content: Just back from a four night stay in sofitel. I booked the hotel because of the great reviews on this website and was not disappointed. It was my fourth time in NY and this was by far the best hotel I have stayed in, in this city. The staff were all so polite, friendly and helpful from start to finish. The room (mine was standard) was large by NY standards and the bathroom was great. Really comfortable room over all and modern in decor. Turn down service was a lovely touch. Bed was really comfy and provided for a great night's sleep. The rooms have sound proof windows so they were so quiet and peaceful. My room was actually by the lifts and I heard very little noise/disturbance throughout my stay. The location is fantastic. Just a couple of blocks from Times Square. Few blocks either way to Macy's and Saks. Ideally located for the tourist. Didnt eat in the hotel so cant comment on food etc. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jellyb1
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Sofitel in December of 2007 for 3 nights. This was our first time to New York and the first time staying in a Sofitel and it was a really great experience. The hotel is in a fantastic location; just a very short walk away from the bright lights, shops and restaurants of Times Square. We also found Macy's and The Rock a very short walk away. 5th Avenue was a little bit more of a hike but we managed it without having to break out into too much of a sweat and sometimes treated ourselves to a very cheap taxi back to the hotel after a day of non-stop shopping! The hotel although right in the middle of everything, was down a very quiet street. We loved coming back to the hotel and being greated by the cheerful and welcoming staff at the front door. We went for one of the cheaper rooms (although still quite expensive). These rooms were only mean't to be on the very low floors of the hotel but we emailed the hotel ahead of our journey and asked if we could have our room as high up as possible for a nice view, and they definately delivered! The room itself was a lovely size with and the bed that was so comfortable we wanted to take home with us. There was also a really huge LCD TV in the room and I found it very difficult to get my partner away from the TV and out onto the streets of NY. The bathrooms were gorgeous as well and the whole room was extremely clean. We had room service on our first night at the hotel and really enjoyed the food - although because of the location of the hotel we found it very easy to venture out for a delicious dinner. All in all we thought the Sofitel was a great hotel and we loved how convenient it was to get to all the location attractions. When we go back to New York we will probably be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Another Good Stay at the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: AnywhereUSA310
Reviews.Content: I discovered the Sofitel a couple of years ago when I fled the Algonquin (which is down the street) after just one night. (Warning - the rooms at the Algonquin bear no relation to the pictures on the Algonquin's website). On this trip I was staying with relatives in New York when I was struck with the flu and decided to decamp to the Sofitel to recuperate. I will often book through Priceline, but with the flu I knew I was going to be confined to my room, so I did not want to take any chances on getting a bad hotel by bidding for an unknown property on Priceline. So I booked the Sofitel on Expedia. Here are the things I like about the Sofitel. Quiet - it is one of the quietest hotels I have stayed at anywhere. That is saying a lot for a city like New York. On both this stay and on my last stay, I felt like I was the only guest in the hotel and did not hear any street noise or any noise from the other rooms. Window Treatments - great window treatments - you can block out all the light at night. Room size - the rooms are very spacious for New York. (One of the reasons I checked out of the horrible Algonquin back when I first discovered the Sofitel a couple years ago is because of the shoebox size rooms there). Bathroom - as many have commented, the Sofitel has very nice bathrooms. There is a lot of counter space to spread out toiletries and every room has both a separate shower and tub (which is becoming very hard to find in New York since the trend is just to have a large shower - not good if you like a bath). Good lighting - there is more than adequate light to read and work. Some complain that the rooms are bland. It is true that unlike some of the "hip" boutique hotels, there is no cutting edge design. But I would rather have comfort over cutting edge design and I find the rooms with the simple white duvets and clean lines to have a Zen-like serenity. (Some complain that you just get a duvet, with no top sheet. But that is exactly how I sleep at home since I find top sheets annoying - so chacun à son goût). If you are looking for a hip, happening hotel, you probably won't like the Sofitel. I find it very sedate. That is a huge plus to me, but could be a minus to you. Anyway back to this stay. Wasn't sure how long I was going to be sick, so booked two nights through Expedia. Got put on the 14th floor (floors 2-14 are the "cheap" floors) right near the elevator. Didn't matter - it was still dead quiet and I felt like the only guest in the hotel. The room was fine - spacious and sunny with a nice little view (helpful when you are spending your time in bed sick looking out the window). One minor quibble with the room - the flat screen tv is on the desk. There is still room to work at the desk, but if you really wanted a desk where you could spread out, you might be unhappy (not an issue for me because I was too sick to work, but just noting it for business travelers. If you have a really work intensive trip - book a suite - see below). When I still had not recovered from the flu after two nights, I booked an additional three nights at the hotel. Expedia showed no availabiliy, but I was able to book directly (albeit at a higher price than through Expedia - I assume the hotel had higher occupancy on those nights and thus the rate was higher). Although there was nothing wrong with my original room, when I decided to stay an additional three nights, I asked if I could be upgraded. They offered to put me on a higher floor - the rooms are the same, you are just higher up. I asked if they had something bigger. They offered a corner suite for $100 more a night. I hesitated, but then agreed and I am glad I did - best $300 I have ever spent. The suite was really lovely - a big window in the bedroom with a view of the Chrysler building - absolutely beautiful at night. A very large sitting room with another big window, a comfy couch and chair, a large desk (no tv on it - unlike in the regular rooms), a very attractive entry way and a walk in closet. Same bathroom as the original room, except in the suites the tubs are bigger. Made me feel a whole lot better about being sick to be in such a nice environment. Room service - as you can imagine, being sick I made quite a bit of use of room service. Thankfully, unlike at some hotels, room service at the Sofitel operates 24 hours a day, although the after hours menu is quite limited. I find it amusing that people on this website complain about the price of room service at the Sofitel. It's like complaining about rain - it is just a fact of life that room service in a big city hotel is expensive. (And room service at the Sofitel is cheaper than at some other New York hotels such as the Grand Hyatt and the Royalton). Anyway, I didn't think the room service menu was very imaginative and the food was okay, but not great. Room service was prompt and everything was nicely plated. If you order tea, be sure to ask them to bring the hot water in a metal pourer rather than in the tea pot as the water will stay hot quite a bit longer even though the pourer is not as pretty as the tea pot. The Sofitel uses a good quality tea bag for their tea service. But It would have been much nicer to have loose leaf tea (which, alas, seems to be asking too much at 99.9% of hotels). (If you want loose leaf tea, however, you can get it next door to the Sofitel at the restaurant in the Iriquois Hotel). One final word - avoid using the Sofitel's dry cleaner. They ruined a favorite knit top I gave them by shrinking it so it no longer fit. The hotel refunded my money for the dry cleaning, but that was small consolation for a ruined favorite article of clothing. And items that I gave to launder while not irrevocably ruined came back faded and stiff. They really need to improve the laundry service - avoid it at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a first visit to NY”
Reviews.Author: rover54
Reviews.Content: We had never stayed in New York before and so have nothing to compare the Sofitel with, and it seems that all well placed hotels are eye-wateringly expensive. The Sofitel is superbly located for tourists, with Times Square/Broadway, the Empire State and Central Park all with 5-15 minutes walk in different directions. Despite its central location, the street the hotel is located on is quite quiet. Our standard room was a good size, spotless, with a very comfortable bed and large bathroom. The restaurant is 'French' but the menu seems to be the same every night. However there are numerous options within a short walk, both 'upmarket' and more basic. Breakfast at the hotel is good, but most days we ate at the Red Flame, a basic diner about two minutes walk away. The food is half the price and you get a taste of more typical New York life. Some reviews mention building noise. There is building work going on nearby and some noise does reverberate up through the hotel, but this is only during the day, when you spend little time in your room. Even walking back to the hotel past midnight we felt very safe - safer than in the average UK city centre after midnight. In summary this is a superbly located hotel, especially for tourists. It is expensive, but so it seems are its competitors. The hotel is of good quality in every way, the only downside for us being a restaurant menu that didn't change. If we go back to New York, we would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Superb in the snow”
Reviews.Author: TheBigFourOh
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay in the strength of previous reviews and the high ranking the hotel has, when compared to all the other hotels available. We are so glad we did. What a find!!. Hotel is oppulently decorated with a flower display in the lobby (at the time of our visit) all red roses amd white flowers to celebrate Valentine's day (ahh!). Our room was on the 19th floor (ask for a high room) and the view from the rooms, whilst in our case was not picture postcard, were fascinating nonetheless for all of the different styles of buildings we could see. And from this floor we could see a lot. In any event as we were out of the Hotel from a.m. 'till dark, the view was inconsequential. The rooms are very comfortable, the beds more so and everything in them you need - the mini bar was used but if the rooms also included tea or coffee making facilities it would have been better. Hotel bar quite pricey, but at a guess i would say no more than other 4 star hotels. Within walking distance of Times Square, Chrysler Building, G C Station, Macy's, Bloomingdales - all the theatres of Broadway.The staff all were affable and friendly; even when it snowed we were asked if we'd like to borrow an umbrella. My tip to pass on would be that when returning to the airport ask the doorman to get you a cab- he'll ask you whether you'd like a yellow cab or a Town car. The Town car costs $10 more than a yellow cab, but is infintley more luxurious and perfectly safe as the drivers and their care are all connected with the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location great for Shopping”
Reviews.Author: MacGreen
Reviews.Content: Sofitel is located in a great location in terms of shopping with 5th Avenue main shops and Macy's only a short walk away (in different directions). The rooms themselves are spacious and airy - with a great bathroom. Travelling on my own, I opted to have room service - and would thoroughly recommend the food - breakfast in the restaurant was also delicious. My only negative point would be to say that my room faced inwards - so there wasn't a great deal of natural light - although it was quiet. Would definately recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Two Thumbs Up!”
Reviews.Author: Laura2812
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel from 28th December - 1st January 2008 and had a wonderful experience with the Sofitel. From the moment we arrived, we were amazed by their attention to detail. We had booked a private transfer (through the hotel) from JFK to the hotel and this was a perfect way to stay our NYC break. Upon arrival, we checked in promptly. Here's a tip that we had before we went, make sure you register for the Sofitel Privilege card (through their website) which has great perks, one of which meant we didn't have to check out until 4pm which is a big plus when you have an evening flight. Another tip is to email the hotel prior to your arrival with a "special request for a higher floor". Obviously this is not a dead cert but it seemed to work for us as we were given a room on the 27th floor with an fab view of the Chrysler Building (I think it helped because it was my birthday on 28th December PLUS we had a bottle of sparkling wine in our room upon arrival - a wonderful touch/attention to detail). The room itself was spacious, clean and, well, what can I say about the beds - bliss! We left a few $s each morning for room service which they appreciated as we got a lovely note from them just before we left. There's a great big flat screen TV in the room which is in keeping with the modern atmosphere/decor. All in all, we were very pleased with our room. We found the internet use in the hotel lobby handy, although it the computers were almost always in use, but hey, who wants to be reminded of home when you're on holiday?! The only time we used the internet was to reserve our seats for our flight home. Each evening, late afternoon, my husband and I would have a drink in the bar before we ventured out for the evening. Pricey in comparison to regular bars, but that's exactly what you expect from a hotel and I haven't been to a hotel anywhere else in the world that is different. All in all, we were very pleased with our stay at the Sofitel and we would definately stay here again. If you have any questions, feel free to email me.

Reviews.Title: “In Love with Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: Swage
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the sofitel new york at the end of January when it was bitterly cold and expected to snow. Prior to arriving I contacted the hotel to let them know it was our anniversary and could I order some champagne for the room, they emailed me back the same day with two lists of champagnes and other things we could have sent to the room. I requested two glasses of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries. After a long flight from london and a bus ride in rush hour traffic we arrived at our hotel a little weary but excited. they welcomed us (a little strangely) with Bonsoir! and then proceeded to book us in; they upgraded our room and said our bags would follow us up shortly. When we got to our room it was lovely and the champagne and strawberries was waiting, much to my boyfriends surprise! there was also a card wishing us a happy anniversary and a full bottle of champagne with their complements. we couldn't have asked for a better greeting. The bathroom is fantastic - huge walk in shower plus separate bath, phone by the toilet! and very clean. the bedroom was beautiful - big squishy bed, massive tv with lots of choice with the channels and the view - we were on the 25th floor with a direct view of the Chrysler Building. We woke early our first day and called down to find out when breakfast started and were pleased to hear 6.15am. My partner had Steak and Eggs and I had Blueberry pancakes - delicious although a little overpriced but the service was impeccable and we didn't need to eat until very late that evening so worth every penny! I cannot find fault with the hotel, the service, twice daily maid service, fabulous staff; all very helpful, free internet in the lobby. we were very impressed with this hotel and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - Already recommended to friends who have booked”
Reviews.Author: Tigger73
Reviews.Content: Believe all the great reviews! You hear the horror stories about NY hotels offering poor service, tiny rooms with lots of traffic noise, shabby rooms etc but this doesn't apply to the Sofitel! The hotel is in a great location in between Time Sq (2 blocks) and Fifth Avenue (1 block) but tucked away from the hustle and bustle. Staff very helpful and polite, rooms lovely and big with beds that you just sink into. We stayed on the 17th floor overlooking 45th and had no trouble sleeping, no traffic noise (apart from the odd siren but it is the city!) and the black out curtains really worked in the morning! Already recommended this hotel to friends who have booked it for April. I don't normally like to re-visit hotels as I think its nice to experience new hotels each time but on my next visit to NY I will be back to the Sofitel. Can't recommend this hotel enough. PS - If its your first visit to NY I can recommend the open top bus tour on your first day, if helps you get your bearings and plan what you want to see and where they are.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value for money”
Reviews.Author: byjove
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sofitel for four nights and it was a good experience overall. Excellent location, clean room, attentive staff, reasonably priced (for New York). The staff is courteous and friendly but has apparently been instructed to market the hotel's Frenchness, and to me at least, the often-heard 'bonsoirs' seem slightly over the top. Some oddities are typically French indeed, such as the main entrance's revolving door which doesn't move until you put your full weight behind it. Our bathroom doors were rather flimsy and couldn't be closed properly, and the ventilator wasn't working well. And now we are nitpicking anyway, the USA Today (free copy) is not up to the hotel's standard – should be the NYT or WSJ. But these are all minor issues of course. WiFi-access is an extra $10 per day or $40 per month (T-Mobile hotspots, US-wide). The bar/restaurant was uncomfortably warm so we decided not to try it. For lunch, try the nearby Indian restaurant (a 2-minute walk, direction Grand Central) which offers an extensive buffet for $16.98 per person.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sofitel !!!!”
Reviews.Author: jmason70
Reviews.Content: Sofitel is a beautiful hotel in a very central location on W. 44th Street. It is walking distance to Times Square (about 3 blocks), to Rockefeller Center,Bryant Park,5th Ave and close to the subway. The staff was excellent, very friendly and always helpful. Our room was beautiful, very quiet and had a nice view on the 17th floor. Ask for the highest floor possible. The lower floors don't have much of a view. The bathroom was very nice, mostly marble and had a separate shower, with a candle and fresh flower. Housekeeping kept everything very clean and they even have turn down service with free bottled Avian water at night. The bed was almost too comfortable. The heavy duvet was too warm at night. The only complaint I have is that there was no top sheet to use in place of the duvet. The concierge knows everything about New York and was eager to help and very friendly. The doormen were always friendly and opening doors when we came and went. Drinks at the hotel restaurant bar were good (but expensive). Order the hummus as an appetizer. It was awesome! We just LOVED the Sofitel and will definitely stay there on our next visit to New York. **Tip- If you want to avoid the expensive breakfasts at the hotel restaurant, there is a diner very close to the hotel called the Red Flame. The food is great, inexpensive, and the service is excellent. We ate breakfast there all 4 days while visiting. As you exit the hotel, take a right and the Red Flame is just a short distance down the street on the right.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a try”
Reviews.Author: Tonyeng
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for two nights just before Christmas. Booked it because of the recommendations on TripAdvisor and it reached all our expectations. Superb location. Rooms a bit small but comfortable and clean. Restaurant in Hotel was OK. Bar in Hotel good and friendly. For breakfast we went to the local diner a couple of buildings away which was good value for money and recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility in the heart of Midtown”
Reviews.Author: PackerCraft
Reviews.Content: Fantastic experience. We booked a two-night getaway to explore the city and we were close to it all. Safe and comfortable, our stay was a high value. With most NYC hotels running $300/night+ this was a fabulous choice -- close to everything but a nice respite once we left the busy sidewalks.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly acceptable”
Reviews.Author: Tremizzle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a weekend while visiting friends. The midtown location is convenient - just outside of Times Square on a quieter side street. There is a parking garage just across from the hotel. Parking runs about $40/day. The staff and front desk were very friendly. Our room was okay -- nothing special, but roomy by NYC standards. The bed was really comfortable with nice linen. The bathroom seemed clean but strands of the previous guest's hair were left on the shower walls - gross. Our room did not have a view. Overall, this hotel was fine and served its purpose. There's nothing really outstanding about it, but nothing really wrong with it either.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: DCDottie63
Reviews.Content: When I placed a bid for a recent trip to New York City, I didn't know what to think when I received a reservation for Sofitel. After reading several reviews on this site, I was really looking forward to this trip. Upon entering the lobby of the hotel, I knew I was in for a wonderful stay. I arrived a bit before check-in time but there was a room available for me. The lobby was sleek and beautifully lit. Definitely a nice place to meet with friends and chat. Both the room and bathroom were spotless and spacious. The hotel staff could not have been friendlier. Shortly after checking in someone from the staff knocked on the door and inquired if everything was ok. I haven't experienced turn down service during my last few trips to NYC and it was a pleasant surprise to see that the curtains were closed and light turned on when I returned later that evening from the theatre. I hope during my next visit to NYC that I'm able to stay at Sofitel again. I've stayed at 7 hotels within the last 12 months, and Sofitel is definitely on the top of my list!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Chicago_Travler1
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel was the great location. Nice clean rooms with lovely bathrooms. Try to ask for the highest floor possible. You might get some kind of a view that way. Concierge was not very helpful, but whatever.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mazza1
Reviews.Content: I went to Sofitel to celebrate my birthday with a friend. The hotel was recommended and met my expectations. Rooms were clean and comfortable, staff were very polite and very helpful. The location of the hotel was superb and very central. The conciege was very helpful and was always cheerful. We drank in the bar every night before retiring and the staff were very chatty and polite. Their knowledge of the city was very good and recommended some good shops and sights. I would highly recommend this hotel and plan to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the sofitel”
Reviews.Author: Boey-7
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in NYC and we loved the Sofitel, the position was terrific just 2 minute walk to times square, the resturant food was very good, we were treated with respect by all staff and even upgraded to the 20th floor due to our honeymoon. Special mention to Renee, the concierge, who did so much for us , he definetly is one of the best in the business. They even organised a limo to pick us up at JFK on arrival which was a great touch. I would not stay anywhere else in NYC, the Sofitel gave us memories for a lifetime. Outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Comfortably Elegant But Not Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: LemonTwist
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a surprise 50th birthday trip to NYC for my husband. The Sofitel was recommended to me by a trusted and well-traveled friend as being conveniently located and comfortably elegant. It was both. The room was really quiet and we found the duvet-covered bed to be perfectly comfortable and cozy. The room was clean, well-kept, nicely organized and tastefully appointed but I wouldn't say it was luxurious---very nice but not luxurious. We arrived to champagne, a personalized birthday cake that was delicious, and a lovely cheese and fruit plate sent by family. I had requested a room with a nice view and we were put in room 2221 facing the Chrysler Building. It was a nice enough view but nothing to write home about. I was a little disappointed to see on the fire evacuation map on the door that our room, though we had booked a deluxe king for a special occasion, appeared to be a smaller version—at least on that floor. Based on the floor plan it appeared that the “21’s” on each floor may be smaller versions of the other comparable rooms if the floor plan is the same---worth checking out when you request your room. Room service offerings were nice enough but at the price, it was well worth the effort to venture out. The bar was nice but the staff seemed very disengaged/indifferent---not a smile to be had. A little warmth makes all the difference. In general the hotel staff was perfectly polite but I wouldn't say they were overly warm. The housekeeping staff did a great job as far as I could tell. The various concierges were always happy to assist but I can’t really say that any of their recommendations hit the mark. I got the feeling that they were recommendations focused on the convenience rather than on the experience which is more what we were looking for—perhaps we didn’t adequately convey that. There were several other items that really weren’t that big of a deal to us but others may feel differently so I thought I would mention them. When we arrived the first evening, it quickly became apparent that the AC was not working. We called engineering and were told that the AC was out due to boiler problems. They said to turn off the air while they were working on it but then they never notified us when the repair was complete and we fell asleep in a hot room on top of the covers. One evening my husband made a run to the ice machine and found it not working. He went to several other floors before finding one that was operating. And lastly, the hotel provides a nice soap, shampoo, conditioner and hair rinse but no bath salts or anything to add to your bath so be sure to bring your own in the event you would like to soak in the tub. All in all, the things I mention as negatives were rather minor in our eyes but had they been tended to, our stay would have been even better. A solidly good hotel in a great location but not extra special.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay..”
Reviews.Author: Azia76
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel in NYC was okay. There wasn't anything wrong with it. It was very pretty, decent sized for NYC, great location...but that's about it. I did love the speakers in the bathroom and the bathroom was really pretty, but nothing I wouldn't expect from Sofitel. Overall, I've seen better, but the location is hard to beat. Really close to everything you could want to see or visit downtown. Staff seemed a bit cold, but that's normal anymore. We stayed here for the last part of our honeymoon (was in Bermuda before) and they gave us free champagne and champ. glasses, along with a letter congratulating us. That was nice of them, but a free night would have been better...haha I know I'm dreaming. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, as good as the reviews say”
Reviews.Author: R_and_C-London
Reviews.Content: I took my GF here for Christmas as a romantic suprise, (and to propose to her - thankfully she said yes :), naturally I wanted a great hotel with a perfect location to set the mood for a magical christmas. we arrived well before booking out (3pm), as as expected our room wast ready. after having lunch and exploring a little, our room wasn't ready an hour and a half later, so they upgraded us to a bigger room, which was greatly appreciated. our room was immaculately clean, and well detailed. we returned to our room ever night to a box of chocolates and 2 bottles of water, which was a nice touch. the bed was in a league of its own - every bit as amazing as people have mentioned! I knew they were reknowned for their comfortable beds, but they were dangerously comfortable - often you'd lie down and find you didn't want to get up again! we abstained from the hotel breakfasts, instead opting for a more American style breakfast at the Red Flame Diner (a few doors down), which turned out to be very affordable, with tasty food and generous portions. We hadn't booked any restaurants, and the concierge were of great help. every question asked and request we made was dealt with efficiently and accurately. Location wise, its between 5th and 6th ave - 2 blocks from Times Square, which is very central indeed. we walked most places, and caught the subway to Macy's and other shopping areas like Prince St and even Century 21. (line R) we caught cabs to various restaurants around Manhattan and on average spent between $10 and $15 each way. Our 5am checkout took all of 2 minutes, so overall a very happy stay at the Sofitel Hotel . We will definitely be back next time we go to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: E_Hemingway
Reviews.Content: Located between Times Square and 5th Avenue and only 15 minute walk to Central Park. Only a couple of blocks from 42nd street and Broadway. This is the place to be. The hotel itself is perfect and deserves its high ranking. Anyone who gives it a poor review has probably simply had bad luck. The rooms are massive - and we only had the Queen room. The TV is the best I have seen in a hotel. and has a massive choice of free TV which is good when waiting for the mrs to get ready. The bathroom is massive and has separate bath and shower. The photos speak for themselves I guess. The mini bar is one of those cheats that charge you if you take anything out which renders the fridge useless. But the prices are reasonable. The bar and restaurant offer very good service with chatty, helpful staff. I wouldn't normally eat in the hotel when on holidays but this was worth it. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Cali10
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay at the Sofitel between Christmas and the New year purely for a short getaway and to make the most of the excellent shopping in Manhattan. Reading the reviews on Trip Advisor was one the main reasons for booking to stay here and we weren't disappointed. The location is superb, almost everywhere of any significance is within walking distance and you can easily pop back with armfuls of bags to drop them off with no inconvenience. The rooms are very comfortable and clean and every effort is made to make sure things are to your liking - the staff will do all they can to make sure that you are happy. Every single member of staff we encountered was happy to go above and beyond to accomadate any requests we had. The staff here were the among the best I have encountered in recent years of travelling. I would never normally return to a hotel as I would want to experience new places etc etc but when we go back to NYC next year we will definately book here again. Dont miss out on the diner just up the street for breakfast to make a great start to any day!

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown location”
Reviews.Author: ANIKE
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel brilliantly situated in downtown and within walking distance of most NY attractions. The standard room (queen bed) was very comfortable, the bed and bedding in particular, but lacked tea/coffee making - typical of USA. Room service was not cheap and had to complain about quality of coffee served in room. However hotel good enough to remove service charge for that order. At the moment there is building work on a neighbouring site with drilling to foundations that can be heard throughout hotel from 7.30am to 6pm week days (can't blame hotel for this). Helped us get out and about earlier so saw more, but check with them first if you want to lay-in during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointment and unfulfilled expectations”
Reviews.Author: BigT71
Reviews.Content: Wow, where to start? I must say that i found this hotel lacking in every aspect except for the concierge who were fantastic. We booked a prepaid room with a supposed special rate for a preferred room, when we checked in we spent 15 minutes listening to the staff discuss all the rooms they couldn't give us for whatever reason. We were eventually given a room and went on up. The carpets were stained, there were crumbs on the bedside table, the window looked out on to a brick wall......this is a preferred room????? I called down and complained and they miraculously found us a room on the 22nd floor, it did seem smaller and more cramped and as it turned out it was. They moved us again the next day to a more comfortable room. What was so bad? The over all housekeeping i found to be poor, the general areas were not well cleaned, dust everywhere, dirty water in the flower pots etc.. the bedroom was very poorly serviced, i noticed before leaving for the day that there was an item on the floor in the bathroom as well as a piece of paper by the bed on the floor (scrap). The room was cleaned and neither item were even moved, quite how they managed to clean the bathroom and make the bed without even disturbing these items i have no idea! We waited 2 hours and had to make 4 calls to get extra pillows. The bell boy told us to call downstairs to get some complimentary drinking water as none was in the room. Next thing, room service arrive with a bottle of water and a $15 check........i sent them away. Next thing someone lets themselve into the room without checking anyone was there and proceeded to check the mini bar, they left 2 complimentary bottles of water on the floor in the hallway. On one of the mornings we decided to go out and grab some breakfast and then come back to the room and prepare for the day ahead thus i put the do not disturb sign on the door as we left. I can only assume housekeeping noticed this as by the time we returned they had made up the room, this was exactly what i wanted to avoid. I confronted the housekeeper and her response was there was no sign on the door as if there was she couldn't go in, she claimed it was in the room on the floor. I am 100% certain this was not the case. The worst thing about all this was that after several complaints from a guest you would think management would talk to you about it and try to rectify things, not a word. Anyway, my only regret was not staying at the Giraffe Hotel which we stayed at earlier and which was wonderful. I wouldn't be misled by the name and expect quality as in the words of the reception, "we are only a 3 star diamond hotel" Perhaps i was just expecting too much

Reviews.Title: “As good as the reveiws suggest”
Reviews.Author: Kevin1958
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to NYC, and we booked the Sofitel based largely on the basis of the reviews we have read on TA. And we were not disappointed. The Hotel is very well positioned and from the moment we arrived we were made to feel welcome by friendly and efficient staff. No delays at reception or indeed at any other time during our 4 night stay. Although this is a large Hotel it doesn't not feel like it. The reception, lobby and bar areas have a comfortable and intimate feel. We would struggle to find anything to criticise. The rooms are large, comfortable and well equipped. The beds were very comfortable with a choice of pillows. Bathroom was spacious and spotlessly clean. Room service was of course pricey but again the service was freindly and efficient. The bar/dining area is a pleasant area to relax in after a hard day's sightseeing, although we did not eat in the Hotel. There is free internet access in the Hotel Lobby, including free printing if you need it. And how about this? On our last day we booked a Town car to take us to the Airport. We would recommned this as the yellow cabs are of variable quality, as are the drivers - just like most other big cities. Our luggage was loaded but the boot (or trunk) would not close properly. The Bell staff and Concierge were immediately on the scene, got us straght into another town car, apologised, and said that would be refunding the cost of the car. We thanked them and said that really wasn't necessary. But they did refund our credit card immediately. Well Done Sofitel - were looking foward to our next visit. Our own recoomdations (and you will never be short of these in New York!): 1. Rainbow Room for dinner (or drinks) in the Rockefeller Centre for the best views in Manhatten. Book early 2. Morton's Steak house for casual dining in the bar (with light bites for Brits/Europeans who aren't used to such large portions) 3. Good light lunches/snacks when shopping in Bloomingdales (ground Floor) 4. Carmines Italian restaurants for the atmosphere, but not for the food. 5. Tavern on the Green in Central Park for somewhere a bit different. Bit of a Toursit trap, but quirky. All in all a great trip based in a very good Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Danzi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sofitel in October as part of our Honeymoon. We had booked it after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor and weren't disappointed. We advised the hotel beforehand that we were visiting on Honeymoon and were surprised when we got there that they had upgraded our room from a standard queen room to a suite on the 28th floor. It was perfect!! They also had left us a bottle of champagne and a letter saying that if we needed anything we only had to ask. The staff were all perfectly helpful and friendly and couldn't do enough for us. The Concierge staff were excellent and helped us get reservations last minute to see the Lion King and also dinner reservations for The View restaurant. The hotel was beautiful and the room that we had was wonderful, with views to the Empire State Building and Chrysler on one side and on the other side of the room there were views of the Rockerfella Centre. The location of this hotel was excellent, only a few minutes walk to Times Square and Broadway and virtually on the doorstep of 5th Av....perfect for shopaholics like me! We had no complaints about noise of any sort from building work or street noise, and we slept perfectly on the most comfortable beds ever! Some people that have written reviews on this hotel obviously are those kind who always have something to complain about instead of enjoying their holiday. All in all our stay at the Sofitel was the best and made our honeymoon memorable and wonderful....I can't say enough and would love to return one day when we visit New York again.

Reviews.Title: “Favourite place in the world”
Reviews.Author: Panda86
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for Valentine's. We both loved our stay - not just because it was where we got engaged! New York is a fantastic city, and somewhere I could visit time and time again. This hotel is in a perfect location, so close to Times Square. We could see the Chrysler building from our room, and had fantastic roof-top views of the City. The desk were very helpful and we made good use of the free internet in the lobby to hunt down restaurants to try and to plan days out. We can recommend Maxies and Dallas BBQ for great value meals (we failed to finish a meal in either of them they were so big!). The TV and movie tour is worth doing but the diner it runs from (Ellen's Stardust) could be given a miss. It was fun to experience the american diner theme and singing staff but it was the most expensive meal we had and the least impressive. We began each day having breakfast in The Red Flame on our way to Times Square for the subway. It's worth going to the ticket stand in Times Square on the day of a show, we went two nights and got them for around 50% off. You'll find it hard to not love this city!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Charlie28
Reviews.Content: Maybe my expectations were too high. But, for me, the most important features of a NYC hotel are location, noise, view, bed, and shower. The Sofitel has a great location and is extremely quiet. But, completely falls down on the other keys. The bed was too soft. Both my wife and I were anxious to leave after four nights of waking up with stiff backs. And the shower --- I'm still rinsing off soap that the shower's trickle failed to remove. And the hotel lost all cold water one night -- none. No water in the sink, shower or toilet. While we didn't book a premium room -- for the price ($619) I expected at least a street view. Other features were as expected, excellent service, staff, cleanliness, decor, and amenities I'd rate the Westin or the London much higher.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: jvtrav
Reviews.Content: As background, we went with our two kids, 9 & 11 years old for a quick family "get away". The good: Every employee was helpful, cordial and treated us in a personalized way (in NYC!!!- weird). The concierges (Vladimir and Rene) and the front desk staff (Vivian and Melissa) went out of their way to make sure that we were well taken care of. The suite (it was an "executive suite") had updated furnishings with flat panel TV's and a very clean, updated bathroom. The location is very central within walking distance of Radio City, 5th avenue shopping, Broadway theatres. The "not so good": The closet space was very limited... although there were plenty of drawers. The room, despite being a suite, seemed cramped- I guess ok size by NYC standards. Maybe fine for two people but it felt a little small for us with our kids. If you are traveling with kids, perhaps better to get connecting rooms. Overall, this hotel is a little gem. Don't tell too many people- I want to go back, get connecting rooms and enjoy "home-style" service in NYC!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sofitel!”
Reviews.Author: jmuemos
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Sofitel for one night the first Sunday in December for a shopping and sightseeing trip. We loved this hotel. The lobby is beautiful and was very nicely decorated for Christmas. Check-in was a breeze and the front desk staff very polite. The room was very nicely appointed - very clean, well decorated, and the softest bed! It was so comfortable to sleep in after walking all over the city. The bathroom was also really nice - marble with a separate, huge shower and tub. Nice amenities and bathrobes too. The best part of the hotel though was it's great location. You are really only steps away from Times Square, shopping on 5th Avenue, and Central Park is just a few minutes away as well. The room was a bit pricey (and we booked the early, non-refundable rate) but it was definitely worth it. I'd stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GabySt_Michaels
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel New York is a lovely hotel. Very clean and comfortable, the hotel is a quiet and refined retreat in the middle of the chaos surrounding it. My stay was just prior to Christmas and the city was packed! We especially enjoyed the sound-proofing and the clean, comfortable beds. Our room was on the 24th floor with a view of the Empire State Building. The room was small but typical of NYC. Service is good but never intrusive. The restaurants recommended by the concierge were the only disappointment . They were very average with less than delicious food. We needed to eat in the area as we were going to the theater throughout our stay.. The concierge service was very good otherwise. Staff was friendly and helpful. I do recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “as good as promised”
Reviews.Author: wahine010London
Reviews.Content: booked the sofitel because of excellent reviews in preference to BA recommendations or 'boutique' options. i was travelling with my 14 year old daughter and wanted to make her 4 days in NY memorable with no nasty surprises. we had a great time - shopped, saw hairspray, shopped, froze, shopped and always looked foward to comming back to the hotel and flopping onto our beds - fantastic! the concierge staff were brilliant - seemed to know everything. Vladimer speaks 4 languages and uses them all! he gave us good recommendations for food and electrical shopping. breakfasts in Gaby's excellent and nice decor. a bonus was the free internet access in the lobby. great for my daughter to facebook friends and for me to check in for homeward flight. overall - fab midtown hotel top tips - ask for a late check out town car to newark organised by bell - great value

Reviews.Title: “superb”
Reviews.Author: kirawira
Reviews.Content: stayed in sofitel for 4 days at start of dec. from the moment we arrived until we left they could not have been more helpful. I was travelling with my elderly mother for a pre christmas trip to new york. and they were so kind and accomodating of her needs they could not have done more. 5 stars !!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Jane024
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor, it is an excellent hotel in every way location is excellent, staff cant help you enough, rooms are beatifull and the beds are soo comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Throughly mediocre”
Reviews.Author: Bluewater81
Reviews.Content: I travel a great deal for my work, and as a consequence have stayed in a large number of hotels worldwide, including the Sofitel in Bangkok, Hanoi ( the Metropole) and Paris (Dokhan's). The Sofitel New York was in every respect a clear underperformer in both absolute and comparative terms, from what is, normally quite a dependable chain. The room was okay (just), but it didn't require close inspection to see that it was grubby (heavily stained curtains for example), an ugly emply raw plug left in the wall, a flat screen TV thoughtlessly dumped on the desk, and little attention to detail or style overall. The corridors were frequently littered with the aftermath of room service dinners and there were disturbing building works going on from early in the morning, (a fact the hotel didn't seem to see the need to trouble me with when making the reservation), and which the front desk seemed to regard as par for the course. All this may just about be okay if if you are paying for a three star, but this holds itself out as a stylish top of the range choice, and it's simply not up to the mark. It has a reasonable bar, and in fairness the bed was comfortable. Its principal redeeming feature, however, is its location in midtown, but the hotel itself is second rate. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: CSSAUS
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel from November 28 through to December 2 and again for one nite on December 4. Thoroughly enjoyed the stay. The room ands service was excellent, quite large by NY standards. Didn't use the restaurant but my wife and I did have an enjoyable cafe latte which was the best coffee we had for our entire stay in the US! The Concierge recommended the Brooklyn Diner on 43rd St between 6th & Broadway for breakfast and we weren't disappointed. One incident I would like to highlight, after we had checked out on December 2 my wife realised she couldn't find a scarf that she had borrowed from a friend. She rang the lost and found at the hotel to report it and they said they would looking into the matter. When we checked back in for our stay on the following Tuesday nite we were told the house maid had found the scarf and it was delivered up to our room. Although pricey for the time of the year we were there I would strongly recommend the hotel. Quite liked the European ambience about the hotel as compared to a lot of the other places we stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Just a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Julian5763
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect. Staff is great, the location is excellent and most of all, you can enjoy the New York’s exciting life and find a peaceful retreat as soon as you enter your hotel. Speaking of quiet environment, one of the ONLY hotels in Manhattan with soundproof rooms!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel sooths”
Reviews.Author: BenW
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during peak Christmas season. There are many good writeups on here about this hotel. I agree with all the ones that define the hotel as an excellent one. Some pointers: Try to get upgraded to a king room. They are on the higher floor. We did so after one night in a standard room and were not disappointed. Had a nice view of the Chrysler building; close enough to see the gargoyles. As mentioned earlier, the higher you are in this hotel, the better. The staff here is very friendly and goes out of their way to make you happy. This statement does not apply to the inept servers at the hotel bar however. Go elsewhere for libations. Regarding the glowing writeups of the 'Red Flame Diner', I just don't get it. The place is o.k. for breakfast and they are certainly fast with delivery, but it is nothing special. A more interesting choice for breakfast and fast is 'Dishes'. Great quality food, even if the atmosphere is 'cafeteria-ish'; two blocks away. Ask the concierge. We ate at DB bistro (two doors down from hotel) and were sorely disappointed, especially after having eaten at the flagship Daniel two nights before. Of course it is much cheaper, but you can do much better for the money. For those from out of town, NYC water is terrific. It comes from upstate New York and does not have to be treated. Drink it from the taps, you are wasting money otherwise. Yes, it was expensive at $500 a night with tax, but my friends stayed at the Roosevelt for $300 and hated it. This hotel is so worth it. Planning to return in early summer; tres bon.

Reviews.Title: “Not as Good as Sofitel London”
Reviews.Author: FatBoySteve
Reviews.Content: I love the Sofitel in London, and so with a vist to New York up and coming, I thought I would try the New York Sofitel. I booked directly with the hotel, telling them that I would be there before there usual 3pm check in - no problem I was told. As you can guess there was, and due to delays arived at 2:30, only to be told I needed to wait. A swift dicussion with the duty manager sorted things out, but not a great way to start the stay. I had also been promised breakfast, but when I came to check out, this has also been forgotten. Not a great customer focused hotel. The rooms are good, we had an exec suite, which is a corner room with windows on two sides, not the same level of comforts as London ie you have to pay for room service tea/coffee. At over $500 per night I expect to be able to make myself a cup of tea rather than pay an additional $20 + tip !! All in all an OK hotel, good location, near Times Square, but not up to the high standards Sofitel usually set.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: holstrav
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on New Years Day 2007, having moved from the Muse hotel after a 3 night stay there. No bad reason for the move, i just couldnt get a 4 night reservation at the muse becasue i left it too late to book. The Sofitel is only a couple of blocks from the muse so i chose to stay here for the last night of my trip. I really did love this hotel. Modern, Sumptuous and excellent staff. the rooms are very spacious and extremely comfortable. Definately worth paying the money for. Beds are so So so so so so so comfortable. I ordered room service on the afternoon i checked in and it was prompt, hot and delicious. Had Breakfast the following morning in the restaurant, also wonderful. Some reviewers comment on not getting views. this is not the fault of the hotel surely, its Manhatten and buildings are next to each other and do obscure views. I had a lovely view of the Crysler building in the distance, if you ignore the roof tops and watertowers in between. If you want unobscured views, book the penthouse suites. otherwise live with it i say. Would definately reccommend this hotel, and indeed the sofitel chain. The Chicago Water Tower is another of my favourites. I work in the hotel industry and in my opinion they certainly know what they are doing

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ptibbs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nicely lcoated for Times Square. It has all the facilities you expect of a medium sized city centre hotel; although I found concierge service to be a little less useful than I had hoped. Bar is nice and intimate, food is good and rooms are very nice. Definitely reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: louScotland
Reviews.Content: We had a great 4 night stay in the Sofitel last week. The location is perfect - about as central as you can be with a 5 minutes walk to Times Square in one direction and the Rockefeller Centre in the other. Would definitely stay here again for the location alone. However there are many more things going for this hotel. We found all the staff polite and friendly, and the concierge was well informed and very helpful. The rooms were reasonably sized and spotlessly clean and the bathroom was BEAUTIFUL! The hotel was also very accommodating with my husbands allergy. Thanks for a great break and we would 100% recommend this for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Mmmn....Very nice but ............is it me ?”
Reviews.Author: DINKYorkshire
Reviews.Content: I love TripAdvisor, I've not been to New York - When I was booking this place was #1 - What could go wrong? Well nothing really...its just a hotel Yes its a good location, yes they speak french - We were probably in the cheap seats ( floor 9) so the room was ...just a room with a bed, which was ok...a bit soft if anything..in short it was all very nice but nothing special - London price hotel room with same size and same remote service - can t complain but cant rave about it either New York is fantastic though so it kind of doesnt matter A few tips if you've not been before...NY that is - Helicopter rides are ok but the view from the skyscrapers are just as impressive - Talking of big buildings - do not underestimate the queue for Empire state building - Huge - 40 mins at least - View is very big and you've go tto go havent you - but wear comfy shoes and go to the Heartleand brewery bar underneath it to chill out afterwards - Bit touristy but nice people and a decent pint - View from the rockefeller center in my opinion was better because you actually see the empire state building so get a a perspective of just how high up you are - fabulous - if you can do one of them at night and one during the day...really good - We went to Carolines comedy store just off Time square - we fell upon a talent contest type thing that was very good - Good night to relax after a day of sight seeing - Broad way show a must - book early or pay concierge prices - guess what we did ??!! however fabulous seats and a great time was had ( hairspray sunday matinee followed by cocktails what better way to spend an afternoon? ) - Buy a Zagats guide for restaurants - Obvious if you know, a real life saver if you dont - As a result of it we ended up in the better class of touristy places reasonably close to the Hotel - Virgils BBQ, and Bardolinas for example both very american and enjoyable - Also went to Les Halles ( Anthony Bourdains spot - Fantastic Friday night ) Red flame diner was ok weak coffee big omelettes and friendly/tip hungry staff, Convenient but nothing special in my opinion - Staten Island ferry is a good thing to do - We did the Gray Line bus tour for 2 days - mixed bag of guides but on the whole a good introduction to manhattan island - Do the Harlem Loop, very interesting . - Wear comfortable shoes, pace yourself on distance but not on the good stuff and please enjoy ...the hotel is just somewhere to sleep

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: traveller59
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel in excellent location within walking distance to most New York major attractions. Good service and facilities. Very well appointed rooms. Will definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Julesee
Reviews.Content: Great room, especially by New York standards. Good gym, great restaurant/cafe. And free internet (top class hotels DO NOT charge for internet in my experience). My only grumble would be there was a bathroom next to my pillow and the neighbour having a bath @ midnight woke me up. Also personally i found the concierge a bit pompous.... but out of the four hotels i stayed in New York this was the best by a long way.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: ShopperUK
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the comments on this website. I wanted somewhere really special as this trip, our 4th to NY, was to celebrate my Mother's birthday, we were not disappointed. A speedy and efficient check in, during which we were shown the restaurant and bar. My Mother was also wished a happy birthday, (I had mentioned the reason for our stay when I made the booking). A bottle of sparkling wine was also waiting in our room. A nice touch. Get a sofitel privilege card via their website, this gets you, amongst other things, a free drink and a late checkout (4pm), great if you have an evening flight. The room was great and the beds were so comfortable. We were on the 22nd floor, no city noise and a great view. Towels and bedding were changed daily. A large bathroom with a separate walk in shower. If I had one criticism, it would be there is no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. The hotel is in a great location, near to the shops and sights. Within walking distance of Macy's, Empire State etc. If you want to go to Abercrombie & Fitch, on 5th, go early unless you want to queue! After seeing the comments about the Red Flame we too went there for breakfast. A great start to the day. For my Mother's birthday we booked an evening dinner cruise on the Bateaux New York. This was a great night. Service and food were excellent and some great photo opportunites. Plenty of time between courses to take photos. A great trip and I would definitely stay here agin.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, VERY comfortable bed!”
Reviews.Author: saralc
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded from the outset as it was my husband's birthday and they had put champagne in the room which was a nice touch. They then offered to upgrade us to a suite on the 26th floor for only 100$ extra (for 2 nights) and this was great. Lovely room, the most amazing, comfortable bed and decent views. We thought the location was great, so close to Times Square and 5th Avenue, yet not too noisy or crowded. Dont order the pizza for room service though....!!

Reviews.Title: “A classy way to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: AleutSvenska
Reviews.Content: I've travelled many a time through NYC, but always on business. I finally got the chance to "vacation" in NYC in 2004 and I couldn't have picked a nicer place to stay :-) The service was excellent and decor smashing! A great central location for my 10-day stay. A very convenient location to great sights and sounds...and food of course! I could easily walk to Broadway and Times Square, or to the Museum Mile and Fifth Avenue shopping. A beautiful hotel with excellent concierge service. I loved th eeinternational flavor there as well.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone was right!”
Reviews.Author: Lilo1929
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sofitel between 15th-18th November and cannot recommend it enough. As everyone else says the location is excellent, the beds are very comfy and the room was spotlessly clean. Particular mention to the staff who were very friendly and extremely helpful. Cannot comment on the food but can recommend the Red Flame Diner a few doors down. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stunned.....not stunning”
Reviews.Author: Ryan.W
Reviews.Content: I remain awestruck that this hotel is rated so high by fellow tripadvisor.com travelers. It is surely enough for me to rethink the usefulness of this website; since I made my decision based on the Sofitel's previous #1 ranking here. From start to finish it was one problem after another. I've been so lucky in my past choices that I guess it's time I had a "bad" experience. Every traveler has his day. Without a doubt the entire visit was marred by the arrival. The doorman stood and talked to a young lady (not a guest) on the street while I unloaded my own luggage, went inside for a bellman's cart and completed the entire process. He was oblivious to my entire existence. When I informed him of my displeasure he then chastised ME. What? Other less than satisfactory areas: room design, room service and restaurant appearence and service. With so many good hotels in New York I would suggest considering other options.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay at the Sofitel!”
Reviews.Author: OCCouple2004
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Sofitel for one week. What a great hotel! The location is perfect. Its about 2 blocks from Times Square and 7 blocks to Central Park. Check in was a breeze, they were able to change our room to a higher floor. The Bed in the room is amazing. There is a restaurant and bar at the hotel, although we didnt vist the restaurant, the bar was great. There was always available seating- and the service was excellent. Another fabulous part of this hotel is the concierge service. Everytime we had a question, if we needed reservations made- they were always there are willing to help. There is a restaurant about 3 doors down; Kellari- highly reccomended!!! Stay at the Sofitel, you wont be disapointed!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel for your visit to New York!!”
Reviews.Author: gerardkelly
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned to the Sofitel for a second time this year and again we were not disappointed. This is a beautiful hotel. The lobby is spacious and very tastefully decorated.The staff are helpful and very friendly. Our room was on the 11th floor and was clean, comfortable and spacious. The marble bathroom is quite large with a walk in shower. The best part however is the bed, it is so comfortable! The hotel is well located on 44th street between 5th and 6th avenues. It's only a 2 min walk to the shops on 5th. (if you're planning to go to Abercrombie and Fitch go early..we had to queue to get in). The hotel is a perfect base for all your shopping/sight seeing needs. You can walk to Times Square, Broadway, Madison Square Garden and Port Authority (to get the bus to Woodbury Common or Jersey Gardens). Make sure to visit the Top of the Rock at the Rockefeller Centre (5 -10 mins walk). The view at night is absolutely spectacular. A visit is a must. We ate breakfast at the hotel on our last morning. It is not cheap but the quality is excellent. Try the blueberry pancakes. For the other mornings we ate at The Red Flame diner on 44th. (Turn right as you leave the hotel, the diner is on the right). Overall this is a top class hotel and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: CheltenhamLady
Reviews.Content: We booked the sofitel after reading all the great reviews on this site. We weren't disappointed. This was my 5th trip to NYC, and this was the best hotel I have stayed in, in the city. Even better than the Plaza. The staff were so friendly, the room was a good size (we had a deluxe king) nice shower and the beds were to die for. It is expensive, but then anywhere you stay in New York is. The location was perfect, we could walk almost anywhere. I can also reccomend the red flame diner, the waffles and coffee there are just what you need for a long day in the city. Also the DB Bistro Moderne which we booked for dinner was excellent. We booked it and then realised that it was only 3 doors down from the hotel. Out of the hotel and turn right. Highly reccomend it. Stay here, you will you have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good service”
Reviews.Author: rakawa
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've stayed at this Sofitel. We love the location, but hate how Sofitels don't provide top sheets on their beds. One can easily walk all over the City from this location. While the hotel has what appears to be an acceptable, but somewhat expensive restaurant, a few doors down there is a diner that is great for breakfast. You can't beat this location. Its central, but not in the center of the crowds and craziness.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Room!”
Reviews.Author: MB600
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 4-day trip to NYC. We chose the Sofitel based on TripAdivsor's customer reviews and my previous experience with Sofitel Hotel in France. This hotel is in a perfect location to walk to Madison Ave and 5th Ave shopping, Times Square, Grand Central, MET, MMA and many excellent restaurants. The room was very big for Manhattan and had a modern European feel. Although the rates were fairly expensive, hey, it's New York! Overall, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you ever wanted in a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sherrill25
Reviews.Content: We came to NYC for a wedding at the Waldorf, and descided to extend our trip by four more days to include our 30th wedding anniversary. We had heard that the Softiel was a beautiful Hotel, but that was a understatement. From the moment you walk into the lobby the air is warm/chic. The rooms are decorated tastefully with all the amenities of a fine hotel and the beds are to die for!! When they heard that it was our anniversary, a bottle of champagne was delivered to our room. Each staff member we encountered was very professional and courteous. The hotel is very centrally located to 5th avenue, Times Square, and the Theatre district. We will definitely return the next time we descide to visit NYC

Reviews.Title: “Sensational Sofitel!”
Reviews.Author: djeanne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went with another couple to NYC this past weekend and stayed at Sofitel. It is an absolutely beautiful hotel from the exterior to the interior lobby, bar, and rooms. As soon as we walked in, we were welcomed very warmly, and the check-in was first rate. I had emailed the hotel to let them know that is would be the other couple's first visit to New York, and our friends received a free upgrade to a suite, and we received a complimentary bottle of champagne. Our room on the 21st floor had views of both the Empire State Building and the Chrysler building. This is a first class hotel all the way. Service is the BEST, and so is the central location. We will definitely stay at the Sofitel on our next visit to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Jenna8109
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Sofitel for a long weekend. It was our first time to New York City and this hotel was very close to alot of things so it was well worth it. We heard the rooms in NYC are very small but the Sofitel's accomodations were very nice. We didn't stay in the hotel much seeing as there were lots of things to see and do in the city. This hotel was very close to central park, shopping, times square, and the empire state building. There are also plenty of restaurants around the hotel. We were able to walk to Broadway where we saw the Lion King and highly recommend it. Also check out NoBu and Mercer Kitchen for dining. They were pricey but excellent. You will need to take a cab to shop in Soho, Tribeca, Meatpacking district ect...but cabs are quick and we felt they were less expensive then getting around Chicago. If you like to go out we thought that Hotel Gansevort, PM and Ten June were great places in the meatpacking district. All in all we thought that the Sofitel was the perfect place and location for our first time in New York. I would definitly recommend this hotel but if we went back again we would probably try one of the many boutique hotels in the city just for a different atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable beds+overpriced”
Reviews.Author: JackMcConnell
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Sofitel in a twin-bedded room for 3 nights. Location is good, but beds way too soft, with no back/lumbar support. Helpful staff are what you would expect in a hotel of this class. Overpriced and resting on its laurels.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant time!”
Reviews.Author: sarnie85
Reviews.Content: Wow! Wow! Wow! This was our first visit to new York and had taken advice from Trip advisor members and thanks to them had a fantastic holiday! The Sofitel was perfect for our trip, excellently placed for getting to everywhere tourists would want to visit.The Sofitel card is a must as even if you only use the late check out it is worth it. We were celebrating our 25th Wedding Anniversary and our room was upgraded and we had Champagne and Chocolates as a suprise! The room was a good size, spotlessly clean, views of the Chrysler building, room turned down each evening with chocolates on the bed. We had not realised it was the New York marathon during our stay which made the hotel very busy, but nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel we liked to go to Grand Central Station to eat with the real New Yorkers which was great fun! The Gaby restaurant is expensive but only relative to prices you would expect to pay in a City restaurant of any callibre. The atmosphere and ambience was really nice. We had a taster menu which was three courses and wine( not house)included with each course at $70 and it was excellent. We would certainly go back !! Hopefully soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great position”
Reviews.Author: mimramtrout
Reviews.Content: Great position.In walking distance of Central Park(15 mins) and Maceys in the other direction(10mins)The hotel is actually in the same street as the Orivis store on 5th avenue.The staff were very courteous and fell over themselves to help with any enquiry.We had a standard room 12th floor.Bathroom was lovely.Room was very clean.TV internet was a waste of time and money.It was so slow it took me back to the early days of "dial-up".Free lobby internet(3 PC's) varied between awful and just about ok in terms of speed.Hotel restaurant did a great breakfast,very good quality.The Bar was well run,the martinis huge!The basement gym was beautiful with plenty of facilities.If you want to stay in this part of town I can't imagine you could do much better.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed the sofitel hotel”
Reviews.Author: BelfastCharlie
Reviews.Content: October 2007 Just returned home from 4 night stay in NY. fantastic hotel great staff clean rooms plus good size. Also just beside the Algoniquine and very central location. Unfortunately nowhere on site does it say they are next to a building site or that building work is on the same block!!!. The work starts at 7.00 or 7.30 in the morning except at the week-end. So be prepared. Of course you don't actually spend much time in your room but just in case. Very comfortable with diner close by. would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: chocnutsundae
Reviews.Content: Arrived in NY on evening of 19th October and stayed for 3 nights. We were on the 6th floor, not a great view but we had peaceful nights of sleep - lovely, comfy beds! The hotel is in a great location to Times Square, Empire State Building, Rockfeller Center, 5th Avenue and Grand Central Station. Took advice from a previous review and applied for a Sofitel privilege card enabling us to check out at 4pm the following day which was great as we got up, had breakfast, did more shopping and came back to room to freshen up before going to airport. Had breakfast at Red Flame diner a couple of doors away as recommended. Very nice breakfast it was too! Would definitely go back and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: KathyOxfordEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel for 6 nights with our three children aged 14, 13 and 4. We had two rooms; a junior suite and a room next door with a shared private hallway.
