We got all this booked easily over the phone, the staff were very helpful in accommodating us. What a surprise we got when we pulled back the curtains - we arrived in the dark and were blown away by the view of the Chrysler Building. The rooms were large, clean, well equipped and luxurious with fresh orchids. The staff were efficient and friendly, the hotel location is excellent. The breakfast was pricey, thats not unusual. We tried it once then hot footed it to the Red Flame which is practically next door. We also tried the Hard Rock's breakfast buffet (not recommended) and Europa Cafe (ok). I cant emphasise enough how great all the staff were, we had an excellent stay. And the beds are WONDERFUL!!!! Had great sleeps, felt like I was floating.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull stay”
Reviews.Author: jessica98
Reviews.Content: Wonderfull stay, excellent service and friendly staff. Very clean and nice rooms. Good restaurant. Will go back again! Also the location of the hotel, just off busy Times Square and close to Central Station, is good.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Tyma
Reviews.Content: Really nice and quiet room and friendly staff, both in reception and the restaurant. However several hassles - for example the time it takes to subscribe to the outside internet service provider and the truly revolting coffee served by room service- makes the high prices seem particularly poor value. I will not stay there again given the other hotels in the immediate vicinity such as The Library and the Royalton which I think give a better experience and more reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Comfort”
Reviews.Author: KerryBethel
Reviews.Content: Our stay for 10 nights was as near to perfect as you will realistically get. We had a suite which was attractively furnished, a bed that was sublime, a decent sized bathroom with separate shower, settee and armchairs designed for comfort not minimalism and soundproofing that most other New York Hotels only dream about but cannot offer. Add to this the friendliest and most helpful staff that we have ever experienced in 45 years of hotel visiting, a superb midtown position, good restaurant and there you have it........ssh but don't tell others as we do not want to find it completely booked for our next visit to NYC in a few months time.

Reviews.Title: “Great 2 days”
Reviews.Author: turleyg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 days on the way back to Ireland from Argentina , and had a throughly great stay. It was our honeymoon and the hotel gave us complimentary champagne which was a lovely touch. One great thing was the helpful people at the Concierge desk who advised us of the nightlife and restaurants of the beaten track. Didnt sample the breakfast. Location is great just off 5th avenue, so can have no complaints!!!

Reviews.Title: “They go the extra mile!”
Reviews.Author: NCMom2Kidz
Reviews.Content: My visit to NY was split between stays at the NY Hilton (Ave of the Americas) and the Sofitel, partly because I attended a conference being held at the Hilton. Let's just say, I was EXTREMELY pleased to move from the Hilton to this wonderful hotel. My room was small, but was clinically clean. After returning home, I realized I left five business suits hanging in the closet in my hotel room. Thanks to Linda in Housekeeping -- my clothes were returned to me the next business day. I was sure the clothes were all but lost, but the awesome staff truly went the extra mile!! Forget the Hilton. On my next stay--conference or not--I'm at the Sofitel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: RHimelfarb
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I took our 2 children (ages 13 and 10) to New York to celebrate our daughter's 13th birthday. We also brought along the grandparents to help celebrate with us. We booked 3 king suites for a 4 night stay (Thursday thru Monday). Our rooms were on the 29th floor which is the top floor of the hotel. There were only 10 suites on the entire floor. Each suite had a slightly different layout. We had a king sized bed in the bedroom with a pull out couch in the living room. There was a tv in the bedroom and the living room. The decor was very fresh and the room was very clean. We had maid service twice daily. There were fresh orchids in the room as well as cold bottled evian water and chocolates left each night. We decided to include the breakfast in our room package. This turned out to be a good choice as the breakfast was delicious. We made an 8:45am reservation at Gaby's for the duration of our stay. We were served freshly squeezed orange or grapefruit juice, coffee/tea and a choice of entree. The food was freshly prepared and always hot. My kids enjoyed the french toast and the nutella pancakes. We required extra bedding for the pullout coaches and it was delivered within 15 minutes. The bathrobes and slippers were a nice touch. The concierge was extremely helpful with suggesting dining options. Rene was more than happy to call any restaurant to make a dining reservation. He suggested a great diner (Brooklyn Diner) which was on 43rd and Broadway. Great family restaurant. Overall, I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. I would absolutely return to Sofitel on my next trip to New York. You can't beat the location. At 44th in between 5th and 6th Ave you are in walking distance to theatre, dining and great shopping! We walked to Canal Street, Central Park, Macy's, Bloomies and Saks 5th Avenue with no problem. Don't forget to grab a green apple on your way out the door!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice indeed!”
Reviews.Author: abruls
Reviews.Content: in September I enjoyed a three night stay with my girlfriend at the Sofitel. Staff are very professional and helpful. The moment we walked in the hotel we felt welcome, the soft carpet and the loungy music in the lobby made us feel relaxed. The room was very clean and was what we expected. The bed was exceptionally good, really soft and comfy. We were very satisfied and we will stay here again on our next trip to the big apple. We had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: tashabrown
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Sofitel on 2 occasions in 2006 and 2007. On the first occasion we arrived at the hotel to be told we had been upgraded to " a fabulous suite" Upon opening the door to our suite on the 24th floor we were amazed! not only was the suite huge but we had an outdoor furnished terrace of around 50 feet by 10 feet overlooking the chrysler building and indeed the new york skyline. Both times we stayed we ate and drank at Gabys which is the hotel restuarant and bar and although more expensive than the surrounding places was excellent - service and food/drinks were worth every cent. Both stays were outstanding and the rooms and service could not be faulted. Also the location is ideal being just off Times Square. We will definately return and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel is a gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: richardBoston
Reviews.Content: What a great experience we had staying for a long weekend 9/27-9/30. Everybody from the doormen to the housekeeping staff made our stay as pleasant as I have experienced in New York City. My wife and I stayed in NYC to celebrate our 27th anniv. I emailed the hotel the morning we were coming, requesting a bottle of wine and some flowers . They had a beautiful arrangement of flowers and wine waitng for us. Bravo to staff of this hotel. If you can't be pleased at this hotel you can't be pleased anywhere. Richard from Boston

Reviews.Title: “You all were right!!”
Reviews.Author: PamelaPAR
Reviews.Content: Everyone was right about the Sofitel in New York. Such service and incredibly wonderful attitudes from the staff. The front desk gentleman actually escorted us to the elevator!! I had received an e-mail from the concierge asking if they could help us with anything, and I decided to take them up on it. She asked me if our trip was a special occasion and I told her it was my birthday. Upon check-in, we were upgraded to a beautiful suite on the top floor. A few hours later, a bottle of champagne was delivered to us! The bartender in their quaint bar made an amazing lemon drop martini and she was cute and sweet. The restaurant reservations they made for us were top drawer. I can't say enough about this hotel. We'll be back.....

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel bliss”
Reviews.Author: salgeo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel for 6 nights commencing 19 September. The room was a superior Twin on the 23rd floor. We had stayed at the Soffitel Bruges a few weeks before in similar room so new what the beds were like.Once in them you do not want to leave The room was very spacious, with two armchairs The bathroom had a bath and separate shower cubicle. Our room looked out on the GE building which made a magnificent backdrop at night We had breakfast on the first morning at the hotel and whilst very nice at $70 thought it a bit pricy.Just down the road towards Times square is the " Red Flame Diner, very good value. I would recommend the romantic river cruise from Chelsea Perth sights are magical. My only gripe is that there was no tea making facility in the room .Missed my early morning brew. We had a great time and will return to the Soffitel

Reviews.Title: “Great Start to the Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: PatioKev
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Sofitel for 3 nights in August as the 'activity' part of our honeymoon, we booked it soley as a result of its (previous) number 1 position on Trip Advisor. The hotel is super, rooms were great, staff were friendly but the location was just fantastic as we managed to walk most places (Times Square, Macy's, Rockerfeller, Empire State) and it was easy to get the Metro from Times Square for other attractions (Staten Island, Brooklyn Bridge). We ate breakfast every morning at the Red Flame Diner just down the road which was fab. The Hotel provided us with a free bottle of sparkling wine on arrival when we mentioned it was our honeymoon which was a nice touch, the staff really were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Super Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: SarahJane67
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel for 4 nights, the room was a non refundable Queen Double on the 9th floor. It was just as the pictures showed, luxurious, immaculately clean and wonderfully quiet. The room was spacious, with a lovely bathroom, bedding and towels replaced daily. (Make sure you take advantage of the turn down service.) The bed was like sleeping on a marshmallow - heaven - just what you need after pounding the streets of Manhattan all day. We would recommend the "Red Flame Diner" - just a few doors down towards Times Square - the food is good and reasonably priced - we ate there every day for breakfast. Overall the stay was fantastic - the staff polite and the location second to none - just 7 blocks from the Rockerfeller Center and 2 blocks from Times Square, close to Fifth Avenue for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “5 star luxury if you are prepared to pay for it”
Reviews.Author: nuttah
Reviews.Content: Booked this 5 star hotel for my husbands 50th birthday. Check in was smooth and professional. Our corner suite was spacious with living room, bedroom, large bathroom with separate walk in shower and a dressing area between the bedroom and bathroom. Everything was very clean and elegant. Nightly turndown service was a nice extra as maid brought clean towels and chocolates and water. We only stayed for a weekend but this is a good hotel for longer stays as the location between 5th Ave and Times Square is perfect. It was fairly quiet on the weekend. As NYC is such a fabulous city we didnt eat in the hotel. We also spurged on dinner at Del Franco's Double Eagle Steakhouse which was superb! But the Red Coffee House just along from the hotel does amazing pancakes for $9. Check out was excellent - we had to leave at 5am as we had a day flight back to London. The guy on reception was very pleasant and even recognised and commented on my perfume. We would go back to this hotel and even choose a standard room as the suite was pretty pricey even for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Engagement Stay”
Reviews.Author: Siesta7
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend (now fiance) and I spent a night at the hotel for a romantic couple of days in New York. What can I say--it was the best hotel experience that either of us has ever had. We entered the lobby which was full of friendly employees and thousands of beautiful, freshly cut flowers. The smell was amazing. Upon check-in, I had requested a high floor, non-smoking. The clerk informed me that for the rate I had requested, he could only give me up to the 10th floor, but he assured me that I would hear no noise. So after our 5 minute check in, we were whisked to the 10th floor where we found our beautiful corner room. The room seemed to be large by New York standards, and had two sitting chairs, a Queen sized bed, a nice wardrobe, all the amenities you would expect from a four star hotel. The bathroom was exquisitie. There was a separate tub and shower, and it was one of the largest I had seen. There was even a freshly cut orchid on the counter. The decorating scheme of the apartment was modern, but warm, and every detail was taken into consideration. Needless to say, my fiance was impressed and we definately hope to revisit the Sofitel New York.

Reviews.Title: “Gret hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: JJ25
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the sofitel for 4 nights in early september as part of a birthday celebration. I'd booked a suite which was fantastic - loads of room, huge bed and masses of storage space. We got a good deal on the room through the hotel site. On our first day we received a bottle of bubbly to say happy b'day from the hotel which was a lovely touch. The hotel restaurant is quite expensive for breakfast, though the blueberry pancakes we had on the 1st day were fantastic!. The service in the hotel was great - check in was very smooth and the room service and help from the concierge was brilliant. We were also allowed a late check out as we weren't leaving for the airport until 4pm. There's a diner (The red flame grill) just down the street and we used that for breakfast most mornings - there's a huge choice on the menu and the service is very efficient. The hotel is between 5th and 6th avenues and you only need to walk 2 blocks to reach times square, which is completely mad, esp. on the weekend. I'd recommend the View restaurant on top of the marriott Marquis hotel in time square - it rotates round and gives some great views of the city plus some lovely food and good service. The hotel arranged a private car to pick us up and take us back to the airport. This is about $50 more expensive than a taxi but well worth the extra money for the comfort and ease of journey. I'd definitly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants somewhere with good service, in a great location with lovely rooms. I was sad to leave on our last day - but will hopefully be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Manhattan location”
Reviews.Author: SharonBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights at the Sofitel and I was very pleased. We usually like to stay at the W Hotels, but they seem to be showing their age so we tried the Sofitel. The rooms at the Sofitel were decent in size, and we were upgraded to a King room (from Queen) upon arrival. The beds were very comfortable and the bathrooms were the nicest we've seen in Manhattan - marble counters/floors, tub and a seperate shower. The staff was accomodating and friendly. Decent French restaurant/lounge in the lobby that is worth trying. The location was great - W44th and 5th Avenue, about seven blocks from Rockefeller Center and only a few from Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Visitor357
Reviews.Content: We paid £200 per night for room + breakfast. Last year we paid £160 per night at the Mansfield over the road. The Mansfield was OK (just), but the Sofitel is out of this world. We had a big room with a big bathroom, all spotlessly clean, elegantly decorated and furnished, with an amazing soft and comfortable bed, and a view of the Empire State Building. After eating the breakfast you don't need to eat again until the evening. The staff are all helpful and friendly. Don't stay anywhere else!!!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Beds!”
Reviews.Author: charlieflower
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our stay in New York, and would like to say that the hotel is lovely, with gorgeous beds. You also have access to the internet and a printer free of charge. The hotel is v close to the shops such as Macy's and even closer to the Rockafellar Centre. The only downside I would stay is making calls from the hotel is extortionate. We are from the UK and even to connect a call they charged $17.65 even if they was no connection. We had had a recent family bereavement and even to try to call cost us in total about £35, with the actual calls which did get through amounting to £62.00 for some clarity we only acutally spoke to our familys 3 times and for less than 5 mins for 2 calls and the 3rd call amounting to less than 10. To say we were surprised was an understatement so basically dont use the phone! To the left of the hotel walking towards 5th Avenue there is a superb Indian restaurant which we would both thoroughly recommend. Best of luck you'll have a great stay if you opt for this hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere better to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Davies91
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have just returned from a 4 night break in New York staying at the Sofitel. The hotel is fabulous, we booked a double room on a high floor and although we didn't have a fantastic view, the room and bathroom where perfect. The room was very spacious, plenty of room to spread out and with a work station and a small seating area. The bed was amazing, the best I have ever slept in! The bathroom was large too with a separate bath & shower. We found all the staff we spoke to courteous and helpful from the reception staff to the concierge and the bartender who mixed a perfect Cosmopolitan! The location is idea between 5th & 6th so it's convenient for both shopping and the attractions of Time Square. I read in another review a recommendation for the Red Flame diner a couple of doors down from the hotel, great place for breakfast, and their pancakes are delicious! The concierge also recommend the Osteria Al Doge restaurant which is on 44th between 6th & Broadway, this is another nice place to eat, food is good and the cost reasonable. Finally, on taking the advice of another reviewer I joined the Sofitel Privilege card program before our trip, great tip, it meant we could get a late check out on our final day, and with a flight at 7pm a 4pm check out was ideal. When we come back to New York, we will definitely be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Happybeing40
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went to NYC for 4 nights to celebrate our 40ths. We were thrilled with the quality of this hotel and its location. The carpets, bedding, size of the room, bathroom, shower, view etc were absolutely first class. I think it is the best hotel I have ever stayed in. We booked it because of the reviews on tripadvisor.com but it even beat our expectations - and I am very fussy. We were on floor 22 and the room was quieter than my house at home! The air con was very effective. There were plenty of places to eat around the hotel at various price ranges. The Red Flame (out of the hotel and turn right) was a family run diner and it was excellent for breakfast. We did all the usual things - bus tour, guggenheim, central park, ground zero, empire state, rockeffella, broadway show. We also did a cruise with 4-course dinner. This was great fun and we met some very fun people there - but the food was disappointing. All in all a wonderful break and definitely want to go back, this time with my husband and kids - need to start saving now. Watch out for camera shops.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel perfect US Open Tennis hotel”
Reviews.Author: 4StarCarolinaTravler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel from Aug 29 - Sept 1 for our trip to the US Open Tennis Championship. I booked a Deluxe Queen Room with breakfast at the Sofitel after reading other reviews and hotel pictures. Upon check-in I was asked if the 4th floor was okay and said 'No'. I asked for a room on a higher floor further from the elevator. Danielle at the front desk then found us a room on the 16th floor. She walked us to the room and it had a horrible view and was a corner room. The corner rooms seem much smaller due to the awkward angle. She said she'd check for higher rooms and in two minutes called us to meet her on the 21st floor. This room 2114 was perfect...a good view, far from the elevator, good size, and high enough away from any street noise. Thanks Danielle! The Room-- The room was spotless just like in the pictures. The Bathroom-- The bathroom was perfect. I picked this hotel over the comparable Times Square hotels because I am a bathroom snob. I need the extra sq feet, vanity space, stand up shower, newer fixtures and mirrors, CLEAN bathtub, and divider between toilet and sink. There was no mold anywhere! The fresh orchid was a nice touch. The Bed -- The bed was very soft. I usually like a firm bed, but we both slept great. Location -- If you're visiting the US Open in Flushing Meadows this is a great location. We had an 7-8 minute walk to Grand Central Station to catch the number 7 train for a 30 minute ride to the Shea Stadium stop. The 7 express ride back is a little faster at 21 minutes. My husband is a runner and ran the few blocks to run through Central Park so that worked out too. Breakfast -- We ate a relaxing breakfast every morning at the Gaby restaurant with complimentary newspapers. Buy the extra breakfast charge when you book the hotel. The french press coffee and juice, croissants, Steak and Egg, Nutella pancakes, or Egg White Omelet entrees were very good and worth the up front charge. The service was excellent. The regular prices ranged from $19 -$26 (Steak, Egg, and Potatoes). Internet -- We used the 3 computer stations in the lobby every day to print the match schedules and print our boarding passes when we had to leave. We also used the wireless connection in the room to do a little work $10/24 hours. Check out -- The check out was fine. My husband moved some of the drinks in the mini-bar to make room for our drinks from Duane Reade (one block away on 5th avenue). Due to the sensors 6 drinks came up on our bill but that was quickly cleared. What can the Sofitel work on? Upgrade the towels to a more luxurious softer brand, make the switch to flat screen tvs, add more padding to the carpet. This is a great pick for those looking for a place to relax and refresh after a busy day in the city who need a spotless large bathroom like me!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jennychan823
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews but I had to after I stayed at the sofitel. My boyfriend and I went for his birthday and the hotel did so much to make us feel welcomed. We were able to check in at 8 am and the hotel sent up a bottle of champange that night because we were celebrating his bithday. The beds were soooooooooo comfortable i never wanted to get up. This was best location you could ask for .

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Was Great”
Reviews.Author: Ross_7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to NYC for our 20th anniversary. We are probably more comfortable with the typical level of service provided by 3-star hotels, but we wanted to be SURE that our accomodations were clean, safe, convenient, and romantic. After reading reviews, we selected the 4-star Sofitel (Trip Advisor top pick in 2006). We were not disappointed. We took the risk of purchasing a special deal on Expedia in which the room was to be selected at check-in. Still it was more money than we have ever paid for a hotel stay. We did request a non-smoking, deluxe room on highest possible floor. Not for one moment did we regret this selection. We were given a queen-deluxe, non-smoking room on the 23rd floor (out of 29). We looked out our window at the Empire State Building. The room was spotless and well-kept during our stay. The hotel staff was helpful and courteous without being in our face. The location of this hotel is great. On this block, 44th Street is quiet but not secluded. At the same time in 5 minutes you can be in the middle of Times Square. We couldn't have asked for more. If you are more frugal on your spending, you will find a satisfying breakfast or lunch nearby at Cafe Metro or Cafe Europa. Little Italy cannot be beat for great food and atmosphere at reasonable price. We ate twice at Lunetta's on Mulberry Street.

Reviews.Title: “An elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: randinc
Reviews.Content: If Priceline had a 5 star in Midtown Manhatten this would be it. Easy check in , a great room on the 16th floor with a city view. The hotel is one of the finest we've ever stayed in. Elegant, friendly, yet comfortable. The room was large by New York standards, great bed, two comfortable chairs, an ottoman, bathroom with separate tub and shower. Service was impecable, staff appeared everywhere with a greeting, to push the elevator button when your hands were full. Complementary USA today every morning as well as coffee set up at the entrance to the restaurant. Concierge helpful. Location about a block and a half from Times Square. Couldn't be more pleased.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: jcoy90
Reviews.Content: Great experience and will definitely go back. I switched to Sofitel from Le Parker Meridien based on comments and photos posted on tripadvisors.com and glad I did. The hotel and staff were great and so is the location. I received a survey request from them the next day. It's nice they ask for input and it's obvious they read it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulBSurrey_UK
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel with good size rooms and the most comfortable bed i have ever slept in. 2 blocks from Time Square, 3 from Grand Central Station. Attentive but not in your face staff. Couldn't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else now!”
Reviews.Author: LondonUKPhil
Reviews.Content: I splashed out on a suite for 7 nights having read the Trip Advisor reviews and was not disappointed. Luxurious bathroom and shower, bed like a giant marshmallow and a good sized lounge with sofa, tv, easy chair and desk, fresh flowers, chocolates every night and bottles of Evian in case we were thirsty during the night. My wife was thrilled to look out of the windows of the bedroom at night and see the Empire State from one and the Chrysler from the other. The desk staff and concierge were all very helpful and polite and always happy to make reservations and give recommendations. Following advice I registered for a Privilege Card and took advantage of a late check out from the hotel and a complimentary glass ot two of champagne. The hotels limo service was more expensive than others but well worth the lack of hassle with a nice clean The location is the best I have ever been in when visiting New York and made for easy sight seeing. The diner a few doors down was great for a cheap hearty breakfast. We never tried the restaurant but it has good reviews. The hotel is within easy reach of a number of good restaurants and there's no shortage of variety. I would recommend it to anyone. If you can splash out for a bigger room then do it.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel- The Place to stay in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: fabulousat40
Reviews.Content: Upon a recommendation, our group of 8 ladies book for 4 nights. The hotel is beautiful and exceptionally clean. We felt like we were leaving family when we were saying good-bye to the door staff and the Concierge. You could not be better located if you plan on doing all the trendy shopping and the touristy stuff. If we called and asked for items such as towels etc they were at our door in moments. We were on the go most of the time and we unfortunately did not take the time to dine at the hotel restaurant, next time! I could not have expected anything better. Other than some minor confusion at the front desk upon check in, I cannot think of anything negative at all. This is my second visit to a Sofitel hotel, I will start to look for the Sofitel hotels as my preference when I travel. I also stayed at the VinPearl in Vietnam another Sofitel managed hotel,5* all the way!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: Sarah048
Reviews.Content: We booked the Sofitel for our first trip to New York City, and were thrilled with our choice. Just a couple of blocks from Times Square and Rockefeller Center, yet the rooms were quiet. The staff members were exceptionally friendly and helpful, and the room was nicely appointed. We would definitely stay there again. The Red Flame Cafe nearby offers quick, affordable food.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous "25th"”
Reviews.Author: jinxie17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Soiftel for one night in celebration of our "25th" wdding anniversary. The hotel is very chic and elegant, the staff most helpful and the rooms are clean and nicely decorated. The bathroom was most accommodating with a tub and walk in glass shower, robes and designer toiletries, very nice! When we arrived back at our room after seeing a show, we were pleasantly surprised to find a bottle of champagne on ice, and a note congratulating us on our "25th".....how thoughtful! We have stayed at many NYC hotels, and found the Sofitel to be the most accomodating to your needs. The Sofitel will be our choice hotel when we return to NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bjschluetter
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on trip advisor for the Sofitel New York, I booked this hotel through Priceline and was not disappointed. Great location, friendly staff and very comfortable, quiet rooms. We checked in late our first night and were put on a floor undergoing renovations. It did not look very pretty nor smell good due to the painting however the room itself was okay. The next morning we spoke with the staff and requested a different floor due to the renovations and they were very happy to help us by placing us on a different floor. Our overall experience of this hotel was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Chris228
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel after reading the reviews on TA as I really wanted it to be a special trip. We were not disappointed - the hotel is in a great central location less than two blocks from Central Park. The room was excellent. I asked for a room on a higher floor for the views and we were on the 15th with a view to the rear of the hotel including the Rockerfeller Centre. The bed was every bit as comfortable as the reviews said, amazingly soft quilt and matress. The bar was OK, we only used it once though. There is so much within easy walking distance that we didn't spend much time at the hotel. We didn't eat at the hotel, but breakfast at the diner a few doors down was excellent with great service. Make sure you get there early though as the queue was stretched out on to the street some mornings and it was VERY cold. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. I would probably stay somewhere cheaper if I visited New York again, but if you want your stay to be luxurious and you want to be in a great location, the Sofitel is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Big apple delight”
Reviews.Author: artfulldodger_7
Reviews.Content: Just got back after 5 days at the Sofitel.. Excellent hotel in superb location for seeing the sights of NY. Staff courteous and friendly. Room spaceous and clean. Compares well with other Sofitels that we have stayed at in Egypt and Portugal. Would recommend the Hotel on location alone. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “From Sweet to Sour”
Reviews.Author: prettybird
Reviews.Content: I must say that I was looking forward to staying at this hotel upon reading the many lovely reviews on TA. I never hesitate to book and spend the extra money involved for a better well appointed hotel. Check in on Friday was smooth and pleasant and the room was very nice with a very comfortable bed and beautiful bathroom with all the nice little extras to go with it. But all went from sweet to sour on my final day in NYC at this hotel. Room service did not rate high with me. My omlette was actually sent up runny and uncooked. Did not call to complain though. Now for the detailed unbelievable experience on my final day... PLEASE READ MY FORUM POSTED ON TA DATED 8/15/2007 TITLED Weekend Trip-Final Day from prettybird

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterMaria
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after reading the reviews others had written and we were not disappointed. We asked for a higher floor and the move was taken care of giving us a lovely view of the Rockefeller building. If you're booking try and get breakfast included. It was just the start we needed to a day of exploring New York city. Use the concierge, they are very helpful and nothing was too much trouble. The beds are VERY comfortable, just what we needed after a day of touring this fantastic city. The rooms are plenty big and the bathroom was lovely. Bottles of water left in room when bed was turned down was a nice touch. Free internet in the lobby proved handy for keeping in touch with friends and family, and finding out news from home. Able to adjust the room temperature using the room thermostat. (Handy in a heatwave!). Excellent location. Quick and easy access to 5th Avenue and Time Square, with Broadway a gentle stroll taking 10 minutes at most. Staff were all helpful, efficient and friendly. We'd definately look to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great- average at an above average price”
Reviews.Author: kickink
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews and seeing it's no 1 status on trip advisor we were delighted to get a week at this hotel. However we were disappointed - it was not great. The room was small dark and a bit worn in places. While the staff were pleasant and the location is really good, considering it's number one status this hotel failed to live up. Its a very standard hotel - nothing specifically terrible but nothing great either. Average at an above average price. Seems to be geared for business customers who stay one or two days. It's not luxurious/ romantic. Would not stay again- there are more interesting , luxurious hotels at a better price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, can't beat it!”
Reviews.Author: jack06
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sofitel for 5 nights. Like others, I don't want to repeat the many great reviews already below, but would like to recommend the hotel. The hotel is in an excellent location, near the Theatre district. Within walking distance of fabulous shopping and many tourist attractions. Time Square is only a 2 minute walk away. The hotel itself is lovely, beautiful rooms, very friendly stuff (particlarly the concierge), who helped us booked a helicopter flight over New York, and had many great restaurant recommendations! The food is great, both the room service and the restaurant. Great if you've had a really long day and just can't be bothered eating out! Definetly recommend joining the Sofitel Privillege Club when you arrive, as this entitles you to a complimentary cocktail during your stay, and a 4pm checkout. Very handy indeed when flying home in the early evening.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: kingsdown
Reviews.Content: An absolutely beautiful hotel in a great location. The friendly and helpful staff made life particularly easy as did the free coffee which accompanied me on early mornings whilst trying to conquer my Jet Lag. The food in the restaurant's French Restaurant was good especially at breakfast where we wished we had stayed longer to sample more of the extensive menu! All in all a luxorious and beautiful hotel within easy walking distance of many major New York attractions which I would love to return to and would recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: betty151
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend stayed at the Sofitel for two nights and had a wonderful stay. Upon check-in we were given a free upgrade to a King room. The room was very clean and the bed was amazingly comfortable (we slept like babies - I would say the bed was on par with, if not better than W hotel beds!) The location was amazing - steps from Times Square in one direction and Grand Central Station in the other. The free internet in the lobby was a great resource. We were sorry to leave and wouldn't hesitate to book a stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “So Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Toysietoad
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my 5 night stay at the Sofitel. The staff were helpful and polite, location is great too. The room and bathroom were large and had everything you could possibly need. Be careful in the shower - the floor gets slippery (I fell on my backside and have a very impressive souvenir bruise - dont worry I wont post the photograph). The resturant where we enjoyed a very late breakfast was perhaps a little on the expensive side, but the food and service were top notch. I would recommend trying a Vanilla Sky from the bar though, very tasty. Oh and set an alarm - you could really sleep the whole day away in one of their beds.

Reviews.Title: “New York, New York”
Reviews.Author: Hopefulglaswegian
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well situated for 5th Avenue and Broadway. We found the staff to be exceptionally helpful. The rooms were very clean and well furnished. Best of all they were free from the noise of the city. The hotel has free internet access in the lobby (3 PCs). Great for teenagers and for electronic check in for flights. There is also a printer for printing out boarding passes. The concierge booked us into a couple of restaurants taking time to find out our preferences and showing us their internet sites. We particularly liked our meal at Bar Americain. Kellari, a Greek restaurant (mainly fish), just along the street (towards 5th Avenue) was also very good. We ate at the hotel's restaurant (called Gaby) one night and that was good too.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: flaura
Reviews.Content: After booking this hotel based on the rave reviews on the TripAdvisor, I have to say I will never do that again. Upon entering this hotel, I was not impressed. Our one bedroom suite was not any better. The carpet was worn and the balcony had leftover cigarette butts on the floor. Yes the decor was nice. And the room was large enough. But there was not never that one moment when you stay at a hotel that is rated number one, should give you. We could have stayed at the Ritz or 4 Seasons for the price. Or a boutique hotel for half the price and had a better experience. One bonus, it's location.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: mediumchips
Reviews.Content: this is a wonderful hotel. wonderful staff. very unique concept and also a fantastic location. if you can get a room here, you should! no cons!

Reviews.Title: “My hotel room was cold as heck!”
Reviews.Author: ebokee
Reviews.Content: This hotel just is not very impressive to me and this is my second time staying here. I will not be staying here again. I had problems checking in because the lady at the front desk claimed my credit card was rejected over $50.00 for incidentals! I had already prepaid my room and my card was fine. I had just used my card at a hotel previous to coming here. I also used it again the next day at another hotel with no problems and my card had waaaay more the 50 bucks available on it. The beds only have a fitted sheet and blanket, they don't have a loose sheet. The carpet was little worn too. There was no view at all and no coffee maker in the room. I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great NYC Experience”
Reviews.Author: DottyUK
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 4 night stay at the Sofitel and were very impressed. It was our first trip to NYC and a birthday celebration. I had emailed the hotel the week before to request a higher level room to get views of the Chrysler Building & a late check-out on our departure day. They replied to say this was possible. Check-in was quick & easy - staff very pleasant. Our room was on the 27th floor and was much larger than expected with great views plus complimentary bubbly & chocolates for my birthday. Great start! The hotel was in a great location just a few blocks away from many of the sights, yet away from the bustle & noise. The beds were really comfortable & we slept really well. During our stay we found all the staff friendly & helpful especially the concierge. The gym was a great extra which we managed to use despite all the walking we'd done!! We didn't eat at the hotel but used the bar which was good but a bit pricey as most city hotel bars tend to be. The only criticism is the lack of tea & coffee-making facilities in the room. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Shirley Z
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a three-day stay at the Sofitel New York. I've tried to stay there several times because it has often ranked Number 1 at TripAdvisor. It was always booked when I tried, and I was therefore thrilled that I was finally getting to stay there. However, now that I have, I wonder why hotel guests rank it as highly as they do. I travel all over the world, stay in 4 and 5 star properties wherever I go, including Sofitels in London and Rome. The Sofitel New York does not live up at all to the standards at these hotels. Let's talk about the service -- or shall I say, the lack of customer service. When my husband and I walked in, I walked over to the front desk, and greeted the guest service agent with a big smile, and said: "Hello, how are you today?" The man didn't lift his eyes to even look at me, and said. "I'm fine, thank you." Never bothered to ask me how I was -- or indeed greet me at all. I had negotiated a rate that included breakfast, but the agent said there was nothing on my file about that. He made no attempt to look into it, and relied entirely on me to find the documentation to prove it. That took some time to resolve, but finally it was and we received the breakfast coupons. The room itself was not at all impressive. We were two people staying in a king room. Most people travelling alone do not need a king bed, so one would think that king rooms would have sufficient drawers and hanging space to allow two people to unpack their suitcases. Not so in this room. The hanging portion of the closest was about a foot wide, with an iron and ironing board crammed in there as well. I had to remove them to make room the clothing we had brought for our 3-day stay, which included evening attire, day clothes, and business suits. The bed had only a comforter, with no single sheet between the duvet and the fitted sheet. That meant that, if we found the comforter too warm, which we did, we had nothing to cover ourselves with. The view we had outside our window was obstructed by buildings, making the room very dark. The floor lamps did not have bright enough bulbs to give ample light for reading. The Panasonic TV was an old model, not one of the flat-screen kinds I've seen in most hotel rooms I've stayed in elsewhere recently. There was only one bathrobe in this king room, which disappeared on two day, never to be seen again. The doors to the bathroom open outward into the closet area, requiring guests to remember to close one set before opening another. Not a well-thought out design. The best part of our stay there were two Albanian servers in the hotel restaurant. They brought a friendliness and eagerness to the hotel that was lacking in all the front desk agents. All in all, this was a disappointing stay. I will not likely return to the Sofitel New York, and would not recommend it, given its high cost and lacklustre service and ordinary accommodations, well below any 5-star hotel I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “5 day trip to New York”
Reviews.Author: benry
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel in New York is by far the best hotel we have ever stayed in!!!!!! We prompted for the hotel after using Trip Advisor! The hotel staff were all extremely friendly and couldn't be more helpful. We got them to recommend restaurants while in new york. To be honest we would never have found them if it wasn't for the concierge staff who booked it. They also sorted out a helicopter ride (not cheap but well worth it). The hotel was extremely clean. In fact it was almost over the top the amount of times the maids changed the towels (probably twice a day!). They made the beds and then if you weren't in the room in the afternoon / early evening then they would come and turn the bed down. The location of the hotel is perfect. It's about 45th st, it's around 200 yards off 5th avenue. It a 10-15 min walk to central park or the same amount of time going south towards empire state etc. Would highly recommend this hotel and the helicopter ride, Top of the Rock (better than the empire state) and Central Park horse & carriage ride. Time square at night is a must, it doesn't look half as good in the day Hope you find this useful!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Fabulous Bed!”
Reviews.Author: Valleygirl
Reviews.Content: I booked the Sofitel for 5 nights in New York, for two reasons. One was the great reviews it had received on TA, the other was the brilliant Sofitel beds which I had experienced previously. I was not disappointed on either score. The hotel was in a great location, half-way between 5th Avenue and Times Square, and only 5 mins walk from Grand Central Station. The staff were friendly and efficient, the room was spotlessly clean, and we had 5 perfect nights' sleep, very important when you have a busy sight-seeing schedule! Although expensive, I felt that the guarantee of quality and comfort were worth the extra money. There was free internet access at computers in the lobby and the lobby itself was very luxuriously appointed and a lovely place to sit. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Completely as expected from previous reviews.”
Reviews.Author: CB57
Reviews.Content: I've just spent 5 nights at the Sofitel, which I booked because of the great reviews read on this site. Our journey from London was terrible as our flight was cancelled, the flight we got on was packed and we arrived (very tired) at the hotel at 1am (4 hours later than planned) only to find that there appeared to be no room reserved for us. The guy on reception (Albert) was charming and quickly placed us in a room overnight on the basis that he would sort it out with our travel agent while we slept. I also got my Mum in London to speak to the Agent and by the time we woke we were told that the Agent had mistakenly booked us in for arrival on the 12th August! The room was nice and clean and the beds were very comfortable....we were only going to sleep there after all! The bathroom was very clean and the housekeeping was excellent. Room Service tea in the morning was a bit expensive (£4 per person) but not of great concern although we did suggest that they provide tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms. The Staff were all friendly and efficient. I've stayed in many hotels throughout the world, mainly 5 star plus, and consider the Sofitel to be a very good 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well I Was Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Symjoh
Reviews.Content: 4 of us stayed for a first--time visit to New York from England. No complaints at all about the hotel - it was top-class from start to finish. Maybe the bar prices were a bit steep but if you choose selectively - you do get bargains (Pouilly-Fuisse to name but one). We're planning to use it again - everyone was helpful & friendly. Like everyone else we used the Red Flame Diner down the street - great way to start the day - can't compare with English cafes - different class . Figaro is a great friendly neighbourhood nearby bar with good Italian food on 44th. On 45th Street, at the back of the hotel, Training Camp has good discount shoes/bags & the Dress Barn on 46th (through the small memorial park) is good for cheap new clothes (women's). Don't use the Indian vegetarian restaurant (Sudokia?) on 45th - the food was inedible - compared to Drummond Street in London it was rubbish. For posing, the restaurant on top at Bryant Square is good fun (don't have the cheese board). New York was better than I could have dreamed and the hotel played no small part.

Reviews.Title: “Great, but not outstanding”
Reviews.Author: redhotrobert1979
Reviews.Content: This is a prefect hotel for a trip to NY. Great location, good rooms, good staff, good value for money and all in all a very good 4 star choice. Only things that stop this being a 5 star rating, conceige who have a scam going with some private hire car firms who ripped us off and being placed in smoking room even when I tripled checked that it was a non smoking room. Otherwise would easily recommend this tip top 4 star NY hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A NYC oasis, great mid-town location, gracious services”
Reviews.Author: scoobie2train
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in NYC thanks in part to the gracious hosts at the Sofitel. Convenient location for a variety of activities. Rooms are not very big, but neat and comfortable lay out, with nice marble bathroom. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: syno
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel, good location near Times Square, Broadway. Room with a view of the Chrysler building. Nice bed and bathroom. Fitness center in the basement, Internet facilities. Concierge very helpfull for organising our stay in NYC. Only surprise for us Europeans the addition of taxes to the bill not explicitely mentionned when booked the Hotel by internet. We absolutely recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every cent”
Reviews.Author: BusinessBrit
Reviews.Content: This Midtown Manhattan hotel on West 44th St between 5th and 6th Avenues gets high marks from other reviewers (which was why we booked it) and they are not wrong. Location: great. Five mins from Times Square and Broadway, ten mins from Macy's and all that wonderful shopping, Empire State Building, and a cheap cab ride from Central Park. For longer expeditions use the ultra-safe subway at just two dollars a trip. Hotel amenities: no excessive frills (eg no pool but a good gym) and an attractive brasserie with terrace that doubles as breakfast/bar/restaurant. Hotel interior very clean and smart with well maintained public areas and plush spotless carpets. Rooms vary in size but all have good bathrooms and extremely comfortable beds - ask for high rooms for the best views (we had views of Empire State and Rockerfeller Centre on 23rd floor - stunning.). Housekeeping first class, with exceptional attention to detail and cleanliness. Breakfasts sumptuous (but make sure you know the deal you are staying on: some deals include breakfast, in which case you are given a voucher to present in the restaurant - this can lead to a muddle if you are a family of four like us two of whom had vouchers and two who did not - this is one area the hotel could do with clarifying for their own waiters' benefit as much as guests'). Desk staff are terrific: friendly, efficient, helpful. We had a welcome complimentary bottle of champagne to mark one of our birthdays, and chocs too - a nice touch. Everyone seems thoroughly trained and the atmosphere is of calm professionalism. Concierge and his team excellent. Most remarkable of all: in your room, high above the horn-honking mayhem of Manhattan, you will hear....nothing. Not the merest whisper of a police siren disturbs your peace. You could be in the middle of the countryside. This is not the cheapest Manhattan hotel but solid value for money, and with the pound going so far in the USA it is even better value. As I said, a hotel does not earn such a consistently high rating without being consistently reliable, so book the Sofitel with confidence.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: BAH3
Reviews.Content: I stayed here July 07 the hotel is nice and clean and comfortable and the location is great for all of the big sites. We stayed room only, the breakfast was quite expensive and the Rad Flame diner is a couple of doors away and good for your morning pancakes etc at a much lower cost. Room service is very expensive - we ordered 2 hot drinks which came to around £15! (before tip) Our flight was delayed getting to New York and the hotel were very nice about this and didn't charge us for the night we missed. The only bad point was the bathroom which needed some TLC, the bathroom door was saloon style and had a big gap in the middle and it was pretty hard getting in and out of the shower as you had to breathe in to close the door once you were in there (and we're not big people). Aside from this I would recommend this hotel to other people.

Reviews.Title: “previous reviews misled me”
Reviews.Author: Ixyz
Reviews.Content: When we we decided to go to NYC, I read Trip Advisor reviews [since I was travelling with someone who wanted to try a different NYC hotel than I usually stay at] and was impressed with the recent reviews of the Sofitel - clean rooms, many guests commented positively about how common it was for guests to be upgraded to great rooms] and so we booked. Our experience was not good and did not reflect what the really rave reviews had said. I can only conclude that the certain guests are ear-marked for extras and asked to please "say how great we are at the NYC Sofitel" Our room had stains [ note plural] on the floor carpet; the shower had what appeared to be black mould in the corner; it was very difficult to to get cab since you are on a side street [ and limos seem to cruise in hopes that you will take up their higher price ride which some guests do after waiting ]. Rates are quite inconsistent - some get breakfast, real deals, other seem not to get such $ deals. While service is in general pleasant the actual hotel property is quite bad relative to what a Sofitel is expected to be based on the very high ratings left by the "happy" earlier guests.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: KarenP
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Sofitel in two years. I cannot think of a better place to stay in New York for the price. The hotel is in a great location, just five minutes from the madness of Times Square but in a quiet street.We had a room on the 19th floor at the back of the hotel, it was quiet, we didn't hear a thing at night either from the street or other guests. I think the highlight of our stay was the bed, the mattress topper, quilt and pillows were all down-filled, it was like sleeping on a giant marshmallow and was heaven to sink into after a long day pounding the hot pavements ( it reached 99 degrees during our stay) The staff were friendly, we used our privilege card and had a welcome champagne in the bar and enjoyed a late check out as a result.The concierge was helpful and had good recommendations for dinner. I have given this review a title 'almost perfect' for two reasons though, firstly our room was showing signs of wear, nothing too bad but there were a few stains on the carpet and some knocks on the wall, it certainly wasn't as pristine as on our last visit. Secondly mini bar and room service prices were ridiculous, I don't think I have stayed anywhere where the prices are so high. These two things wouldn't put me off though and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Return customer to this Excellent Hotel....love it!”
Reviews.Author: pvanant
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a typical wonderfull stay at the Sofitel. The ONLY hotel I will stay at in NYC. Everything the reviews say and more. The concierge staff is first class, best I have ever seen anywhere. Excellent, CLEAN workout room and super quiet rooms. One suggestion in my mind is room televisions need to be updated, but this is nitpicking.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel”
Reviews.Author: pantonm
Reviews.Content: My husband baby and i have just returned from our week trip to New York and would recommend that if you are visiting the states then stay at the Sofitel. We have been to New York 4 times and have stayed at different hotels but none compare to the excellent service we received at the Sofitel. There is not a kettle in the room and i phoned reception to request one so that i could use it for my son's milk and within 10 minutes one appeared in our room. The concierge recommended several excellent restaurants that we would not have visited if not for them. We had breakfast at the hotel on the day we were leaving and it was so good we wished we had gone there before. There were no negatives about this hotel. The business room was enough for the three of us including a cot. All in all we all had a wonderful stay and will be back next year. I must also say that the staff in the bar are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Terribly Unprofessional/Unhospitable staff”
Reviews.Author: CornellHotelSchool
Reviews.Content: I couldn't have had a worse experience staying at the Sofitel. I was unimpressed by the curt and inept hotel employees who made my hotel stay unbearable. I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel, great location, so close to everything but the hotel and rooms are a quiet haven. Breakfast was wonderful and is an a la carte menu instead of the mass produced buffets. We were lucky and choose to have breakfast included ( at a very good rate) as the breakfast options were not cheap and ranged from $19 to $26 for a fantastic steak and egg breakfast..... very impressive and well cooked food! The only down side and in truth i cant really call it that, is that there are no shower facilities available for guests who have a late evening flight and do not have a late checkout. THis would have been a real benefit, not only for us but for many guests who were changing the rest rooms. Overall, a hotel that exceeds expectations and highly recommeded!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Nice”
Reviews.Author: Rappongi27
Reviews.Content: My wife booked this based on reviews from others on this site, and we were not disappointed. We stayed for six nights. It is a very nice hotel, indeed. It is clean and borders on the luxurious with very nice appointments. I certainly agree it is well located. A quick walk to Times Square (but two or three blocks away so it is quiet) and a fast walk to the F subway or Grand Central Station. The conceierge was quite helpful with reservations for dinner. Our room was cleaned at least twice a day that we noticed. The on-site restaurant was very good for breakfast; it wasn't cheap (of course, we didn't much care since we had booked a deal that included whatever we wanted for breakfast) and was willing to make whatever one wanted even if it wasn't on the menu. (We had fantastic lox & eggs & onions, which was not on the menu). We didn't eat there for other meals. It was the kind of place where when you went into the bar and asked for champagne, crackers, mustard and a knife, to go, no one blinks an eye: they just get it for you. Yes, we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: sarspice
Reviews.Content: Cannot fault this hotel. Excellent location, polite and helpful staff and immaculate, comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great New York Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: simoneriggs
Reviews.Content: The sofitel is a great hotel in the heart of New York City. The staff is very friendly and helpful and the rooms are comfortable. The bathroom is beautiful and the bed is wonderful for a great night of sleep. For the money it is the best bet in town!

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: getarounds
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel and again it exceeded all my expectations. I have stayed at many hotels in NYC and by far this is the best. The service is increible from check-in to check-out. The room is a good size though not the largest, but the bathroom makes up for it. Very Spacious! Everything was clean, and if you happen to come back to the room during the day, the cleaning staff once again cleans the room and the bathroom. The bed is incrediblely comfortable. One of the best I have ever slept in, There is not enough I can say about this fantastic hotel. It has won me over and I can't think of any other in NYC I would choose over it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: bao903
Reviews.Content: Loved the Sofitel!!!! It was a wonderful experience. Very convenient, central location to it all. The hotel staff was professional, friendly, and most helpful (they even spoke in French...fun!). The staff accomodated our special request for an early check-in. A room was waiting and available upon arrival. The hotel is immaculate and just as pictured. We could not get over how comfortable the beds were. For being such a central location, there was no street noise. We did a lot of research before booking. This was our first time staying overnight in NYC and we were overwlemed by all of the hotel choices. I have to say we were anything, but disappointed. It was truly wonderful. The only downside...did not care for the Gaby restaurant at all. We wanted to relax and have a drink before ending the evening. The music played at the bar was loud and didn't really match the atmosphere. We went back the next morning because we had breakfast vouchers. We were a party of four with only two vouchers. A scone was $9, pancakes were like $19. We would have been better off grabbing something from Starbucks instead. Even with the two vouchers, the breakfast bill was outrageous for the fare. Next time, we'll skip the Gaby.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, best location”
Reviews.Author: dd220786
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on previous reviews on tripadvisor and it was everything we hoped for. Great hotel, wonderful room, great service, very clean and very friendly staff. The hotel is just a few steps away from 5th Av, Rockefeller Plaza and even Time Square.

Reviews.Title: “Very Chic”
Reviews.Author: Quinonostante
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading these reviews and having had a positive experience of Sofitel Cairo! When we arrived we were disappionted to find that some gifts which had been sent for us prior to our arrival had not managed to reach us...and an urgent email which had been sent was not made avaiable until we enquired after it. We mentioned that we thought this was a little bit poor, and the Sofitel management could not have been more apologetic. We came in one afternnon to find they had placed chocolates and fruit in our room along with a letter of apology! On our last day the Customer Relations Manager made a point of finding us and asking us about our stay! She even offered us a late check out which meant we really enjoyed our last day in New York. The room was spacious and comfortable! The beds were amazing! Air con that works! Great bathrooms. The carpet in the inner lobby feels like sand under your feet at the end of a long day of walking in New York City. Very chic, understated hotel, amazingly central but quiet location! FAB breakfasts I'd recommend a stay! (Would not recommend the mini bar....BIG prices for small items, which are available in shops just around the corner. e.g mini bottle of evian over $4 in the mini bar, only 99c in Duane Reed's)

Reviews.Title: “Anything said thats good about it, is right.”
Reviews.Author: krisSydney_Australia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great spot - 2 minutes from Broadway, 1 minute to 5th Avenue, 5 minutes from Grand Central Station. We came to realise position in a city like New York can make your life much, much easier. It is very clean, spacious and safe. The bed was wonderful, the bathroom was lovely and the room is big enough to open your suitcase on the floor, leave it open and walk around. The staff were more than pleasant and more than helpful. I really can't think of anything negative to say. We would highly recommend this hotel and hope to go back.

Reviews.Title: “The other reviewers are right, as usual”
Reviews.Author: City99
Reviews.Content: For a first time visitor to New York, this hotel is close to the Midtown action (44th St, just west of 5th Ave ) without being so close to Times Square that you can't sleep, and the previous reviewers are spot on with their comments. Choose a high floor by paying slightly more and the view and traffic noise will be fine; we had the Rockerfeller Center view to the north which was spectacular. The front desk was warm and helpful, the concierge knowledgeable although a little brusque. I recommend avoiding the breakfast in the Gabi Restaurant- sure it was OK, but for a fraction of the price you can eat in a NYC diner or deli, with real New York atmosphere and none of the pretension. The Pax cafe (part of chain) on Bryant Park SW corner with 6th Ave serve anything from fresh pancakes to Granola with fruit- we took it out and ate in the park. The hotel was clean, everything worked fine, the decor was plain and tasteful- will need touching up soon though, and the beds were soft but very comfy to sleep in. , Be aware that it does have a French air of insouciance about it, but all things considered it was a comfortable, safe choice and we were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarlasReview
Reviews.Content: We have stayed 8 nights in this hotel and we can say that if we ever decide to go back to NYC we will be staying in this hotel. At the arrival we received a free upgrade due to our 8 night stay. The last day we were happy to receive a complimentary late check-out 3pm, this was perfect since we had to leave at that time for the airport. The concierge arranged a company car for us for the same fare that a taxi would charge us: we got a huge white limousine. Next to the hotel there is a diner where you can enjoy a good breakfast, lunch or dinner. Times Square is just a few minutes by foot. When you go the other way you will find Bryant Park a great place to picknick.

Reviews.Title: “Bon - a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Jesse1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a solid choice for those wanting to stay in midtown Manhattan. The Sofitel is on "hotel row" with other noted properties such as the Algonquin on 44th. The lobby has plenty of comfy seating and has a hushed and yet welcoming feel. There are three computer terminals tucked off into an alcove by the lobby, ideal for printing boarding passes or mapquesting. The chairs, however, do not encourage more than a few minute stay at the terminal. Check-in was prompt and friendly. The room is a good size and very pleasant, although the carpet looked a bit worn and could have used a good steam cleaning. The bathroom is well lit and does have a lot of space and a real (read English soaking) tub. The personal care items are top-notch as well. The bed - ahh - you will sleep and dream well. No street noise, although granted I was on the 22nd floor. Morning USA today is left by the elevator. Get breakfast elsewhere, based solely on the "Paris-like" cost.

Reviews.Title: “Some positives, some negatives”
Reviews.Author: luli38
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend in New York city and stayed at the Sofitel for 3 nights. There are some definite positives about staying at this hotel. Definite positive is the location--which cannot be beat. Great Midtown West location which is convenient to just about everything. No need to take a cab or any other public transportation. We had great weather so had no problems walking to Central Park, Times Square, or Uptown. We did walk all the way to the World Trade Center, but should have probably taken the subway (due the amount of time that it took) which we did on the way back. Walked down 6th Avenue so that we could get a feel for the different areas such as Greenwich, Chinatown, and Soho which I have never had much chance to visit. With regard to the hotel, I don't have much to add that hasn't already been said. The hotel is fine for the most part. Great beds--no yucky bedspread only crisp white sheets and comforter/duvet. The bathroom was clean and nice and the bath products were very good as well. The carpeting was a little stained looking and the room was a little small, but no smaller than most hotel rooms in New York. Didn't eat at the hotel as it seemed rather pricey and I prefer to experience independent establishments. The concierge was very good at providing recommendations and for the most part we enjoyed the recs. Make sure to get the free Sofitel privilege card as it entitles you to free drinks when you arrive. My one complaint was that the hotel was unwilling to adjust my room rate despite the fact that the website was now showing a better rate. I booked about 2 months prior to my trip and got a room rate for about $303 which did not include breakfast and could be cancelled up to 24 hours prior to arrival. The week before my trip I noticed that the Sofitel website indicated a $274 room rate (for the same room that I had booked at $303) or a $309 room rate which included breakfast. I printed out the sheet and when we arrived I assumed that the hotel would be willing to honor the $309 rate and include breakfast. I realize now that I should have cancelled the reservation (since there was no penalty) and then rebooked at the $309 rate as it was only $6 more but would be well worth the increase as both my spouse and I would get breakfast each morning. I assumed that the hotel would be willing to make this change and honor the rate but was fed some line about it being an "internet only rate". It amazes me how customer service is valued differently at various organizations. I really expected more given that I am a Sofitel Privilege member. Anyway, I didn't make a big fuss about it, but will probably be less likely to book a room at the Sofitel for my next New York trip. I might consider the Iroquois which is right next door as I have heard good things about it. Restaurant to consider--Del Friscos -nice steak house with a reasonably priced 3 course meal served prior to 6:30 PM and within walking distance from the hotel in view of Radio City Music Hall.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: PickyHotelGuest
Reviews.Content: Thanks to those who recommended this place! We had a great 7-night stay at this hotel. We had a quiet, comfortable, and clean room. We noticed that housekeeping came around at least twice a day. Sofitel New York has increased our expectations for all future hotel stays. We'll be back. P/S: We enjoyed breakfast everyday at The Red Flame Coffee House (a few steps away from the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: IRISHMEN
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel for six nights for our 25th Wedding Anniversary. From the moment we arrived at reception we were treated with the utmost courtesy. At reception we were congratulated on our anniversary (an e- mail had been sent when booking) and on arrival at our room (25th floor) we discovered a bottle of Champagne had been left for us along with a personal letter from the manager. Our room was actually a suite with its own living area and a wonderful view towards Times Square. Staff were very friendly and the Concierge was wonderful. He recommended excellent restaurants and even booked them for us. The location is excellent on 44th Street as you are between 5th and 6th Avenues so you are only 5 mins walk to Times Square and the same distance to the Rockefeller Centre. Sacks 5th Avenue is about ten minutes and is beside St. Patrick's Cathedral. Beside the hotel is a wonderful Greek restaurant called Kellari (not anywhere like the rubbish you find on Greek Package Holiday) and along the same street is a very good but reasonably priced Italian Restaurant called Osteria al Doge. Breakfast was not included in the room rate so we ate out. There is a diner called the Red Flame which was okay and always busy but try the Brooklyn Diner on 43rd Street. Breakfast may be twice the price but the food was beautiful and decor was very appealing too!On our first night we ate in the hotel's restaurant called Gaby. The food was very good but New York has some excellent restaurants so do try to get about. This was a perfect trip but if the hotel isn't up to scratch then the rest of the holiday is downhill. In this instance The Sofitel excelled themseves and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - would recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: BlueSiFi
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 great days in New York and stayed at Sofitel following the reviews on this site. The hotel was as good as the reviews. We had a room with a view of the Chrysler building. The room was excellent with turn down service. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We were upgraded as it was our aniversary and there was a complementry bottle of champagne. The Hotel is in a great location, just a few minutes away from Time Square. Even with this close proximity of busy area, you do not hear the sound of the traffic in your room. There is an great value diner a few doors away which we used for breakfast (sorry can't remenber the name). I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel and location for our 20th wedding anniversary weekend”
Reviews.Author: gameplanner
Reviews.Content: Many times things don't live up to the hype. The Sofitel did live up to all the great things that we read about it on TripAdvisor. Our great experience started when making our reservations directly with the hotel. Their web site promised to beat anybody's price -- and they did. We booked 3 nights, but only stayed 2. More on this later. Thur. night was a bit pricey at $389. However, Fri was $299, and the rate for Sat. was $251 -- for a 4-star hotel. This was the price for their basic room on a lower floor. But I told the reservation clerk that I would like a higher floor, which she booked for me at no additional charge. What a way to make a positive 1st impression. Besides that, the clerk was extremely courteous. Our cab driver drove us down Broadway to arrive at the hotel. My wife and I were quite pleased that the hotel was just 3 blocks away from all the glitz and glamor of Times Sq. Also the hotel was on the corner of 5th Ave, the door to some of the most luxurious shopping in the world. And we were just a short cab ride from Central Pk. However, we could have walked to it. It's only about a mile away. Back to our room, it was on the 23rd floor facing the Chrysler Build, which was a good reference point if you get turned around. We had a king bed with the most comfortable bedding. The room size was adequate for us but not huge. But the marble bath was huge with a great makeup light which my wife loved. And it had a standalong shower large enough for 2 (smile). Much, much more, but don't want to be too long. Food: we did not eat a single meal at the hotel. The concierge at our request directed us out the back door to the Manhattan Cafe, with an excellent buffet costing less than $20 for 2. A couple of doors down is a dollar store to pick up film, sun block, etc. And out the front down a couple of blocks toward Times Sq is Virgil's BBQ. Chicken, ribs, and pulled pork and sides were quite good (for NY -- we're from TX), costing about $20/person. For sightseeing, recommend that you take the hop on-hop off tour bus which goes to all 5 boroughs. Starts on 7th Avenue, 4 blocks from the Sofitel. Re: shows, altho we paid regular price -- we were fortunate to get orchestra seats for Phantom and Color Purple for about $225 a pair. But, 1/2 price tix are available at the Marriot Hotel near Broadway, about 1/2 mile from the Sofitel. But be prepared to stand in a very long line. One final thing: re being in Midtown. Several reviews commented about the noise. It was not a factor for us. Had no problem sleeping. Final-final point (sorry) -- as mentioned earlier we reserved 3 nights, but decided that we would stay up all night on Sat. So we saved over $300. I checked with the concierge 1st. They locked up our bags for free. They said we could leave them as long as we liked. What a customer-friendly gesture! In closing, the personnel, facilities, and location of the Sofitel Hotel made our 20th anniversary weekend a Godtastic event. No question where we will stay when we return to the Big Apple. "Hotel Sofitel is Swell."

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Marie.Bagnall
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the sofitel and it was even better than we had remembered. The assistance that the hotel gave in preparation for our wedding was second to none, and a big thank you to Daniel - one of the concierge who could not have done more to ensure our day went to plan. We had booked a suite, which was on the 21st floor and had lovely views of the chrysler building. The room was spacious, very clean and had the most comfortable beds. The complimentary champagne was a nice touch. The location is excellent - in between 5th and 6th avenue and just a 5 min walk from broadway. Check in and check out was a smooth process, completed within a few minutes. Staff were polite, friendly and ever helpful. For food, we found a lovely brazillian restaurant by the belvedere hotel. This was a little pricey but such a good experience and the food was excellent. All in all can't recommend this hotel highly enough, and already looking forward to our third visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: KSSydney
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel from 17-22 May with my sister. We booked a twin room. Had a great stay: fairly large room on the 20th floor and as all the other reviewers have said, lovely marble bathrooms and extremely comfortable beds, and so quiet considering the hotel's location (what's with all the horn honking in NYC!!). Room was very clean, and turn down service was great - Evian water a nice touch and we got chocolates on the first night. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great location, great room, a couple of minor quibbles”
Reviews.Author: bristol_traveller_06
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel New York for five nights. This hotel is absolutely fantastic, one of the best I've stayed in. It is very well located, just two blocks from Times Square in one direction and Grand Central Station in the other. We booked via the Hotel website several months in advance and got a great deal on a King Suite. I also asked to be up high and we got the 25th floor which was really nice, though it was on the same level as the ledge for the window cleaning equipment which did slightly detract, but I'm not too fussed as the views of the Rockefeller center were very nice. The suites are very pleasant, lovely lounge area, two televisions (one in the lounge, one in the bedroom), the beds and pillows are fantastic. The bathroom is great as well. The staff always treated us very well, with courtesy and professionalism.
