We never ate at the restaurant but did get Room service, do read the fine print on the room service menu which states all the extras that are added onto the price (tips & taxes are all added on, yet there is a section on the receipt you sign for extra tips, but I can't see this is necessary as it is basically double tipping). I found no pressure to tip anyone, they even asked on arrival if we needed help with our bags & we said no so were able to take them up ourselves, we had heard that at other places they can insist on taking your bags so that you have to tip. Also I let them know it was my Birthday and they very kindly gave me a bottle of very nice sparkling wine beautifully presented in a classy ice bucket with some glasses. The maid service was excellent, we left them a tip each day which they took & would leave a note of thanks. We were never disturbed while our "do not disturb" sign was out. The only quibbles I have, and this is because I am pedantic, are: 1. The lifts can be a bit slow sometimes, and the timing seems to be out, our floor for instance was almost always serviced by the same lift, which could take quite a while to turn up, making me wonder what the others were doing 2. The In-room TV system is very comprehensive, and does have a good billing system to let you know what you've spent, but it can be very slow to load, occasionally will crash and freeze up (even turning off & on the TV doesn't work). Also sometimes it can appear in black&white or have distorted sound. However the movie we purchased through the system played flawlessly which was good 3. The Ice Machine on our level was broken which required us to go to the next level, a minor inconvenience but worth noting. 4. The Iron in the room sparked in the plug socket & tripped the breaker for the entire room one morning. They were quite quick in resetting the breaker and gave us a brand new iron straight away, but it was slightly disconcerting none-the-less. These are minor things though and I would stay at this hotel again without a moments hesitation, It really is an oasis in the madness, but excitement, of Manhattan!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Minu6
Reviews.Content: Returned 10 days ago having thoroughly enjoyed a 5 night stay at the Sofitel. The facts are: the beds are great, the rooms are a good size for New York but best of all the staff and location are simply second to none. If you are in New York to shop, visit the sights or just to be engrossed by the unique atmosphere this is the place to stay. Tips: The Red Flame Diner is a good start to the day, St Andrews Alehouse for a steak, Top of the Rock is unmissable and Central Park worth a long visit. Also do NOT drink the Kronenbourg in the bar it is $14 a pint. Ask for a room high up - we had the 27th floor with a wonderful view of the Chrysler Building. Also we took the advice of fellow trip advisors and registered for a Sofitel loyalty card prior to arrival the complementary drinks and late check out (1600 hours) were much appreciated. Agreed it may not be a 5 star hotel but it is a 5 star experience.

Reviews.Title: “A good city base”
Reviews.Author: Minx77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just got back from a 5 night stay at the Sofitel, and we were very happy with our choice. We booked a standard room but were upgraded to a suite, which was really nice! Therefore I'm not sure what the standard rooms are like. The suite was clean, large and neutral with a really nice bathroom, comfy kingsize bed and lovely views of the Chrysler building. The rate was about $300 a night which is cheap at the moment for us from the UK! The hotel has a fitness suite which looked OK but we didn't use it, and free internet access in the lobby. If you are looking for a hip hotel this isn't for you. Last time we went to NYC we stayed at the Royalton which is much cooler but twice the price! The Sofitel is beige, neutral and corporate. Its not a characterful hotel but if you're looking for somewhere to stay where you'll be guaranteed good standards, a quiet room with great air-con, good housekeeping, in the middle of town, for a fair price then I don't think you can go wrong with the Sofitel. NB One downside is the ridiculous price of room service - I don't think I've ever found one more expensive, and I've stayed in some lovely 5 star hotels throughout the world - don't even think about ordering!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice 4 star hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: vegaslover73
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an excellent 7-night stay at the Sofitel NYC. Highlights – VERY quiet room (windows are triple-paned); extremely professional, courteous staff; the most comfortable bed linens EVER; nice, big bathroom. This is a very nice 4* property in NYC that I would recommend and stay at again. Room service was very good, too.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel New York”
Reviews.Author: DonnaBottell
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Sofitel New York. I found this hotel a bit basic, not at all like other Sofitel's aroun d the world. I did find the staff very helpful and the room was very clean and kept tidy by the maids. However if it is luxury you want then this is not the place. The best high light of this hotel is its location, other then that I feel it is mor of a grade 3 hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, staff, location.”
Reviews.Author: JH46
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first trip to NY and found it a very comfortable room, excellent bed, large bathroom, quiet in room, and super friendly staff. Helpful concierge, reception - no hassle check in / out, doormen found cabs, checked them for left items and secure doors/trunk ! There is a good selection of diners / restaurants nearby which are cheaper than the hotel food. The location is ideal for tourists, walkable to most sights, or the hopper bus, shows, etc. Ditch the car and take a cab or subway, as parking is expensive. Anyway driving is manic and who needs that on holiday? There is a small park opposite the hotel bar, nice to sit in for an evening smoke! For us (a 40 something couple on a 3 day tourist trip) this was absolutely ideal and hassle free choice. Top tips: eat out, ESB early, harbour cruise on hot afternoon, Guggenheim anytime, Macey's do discounts for foreigners ask at any till, and ask, ask, ask, - everyone was really keen that we have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Can these reviews be true?....”
Reviews.Author: ChiswickTurnhamGreen
Reviews.Content: Yes, they can be true - really great place. We stayed in May for 5 nights, (paid for and) got a room on the 27th floor - well worth the extra money. What makes this hotel great? We experienced, first hand, all of the following: - great welcome at check in at midnight, quick and easy - no big forms to fill out (9/10 marks) - staff (almost) always on hand, behind the counter but also - critically - in the lobby area - also very willing to help - this is really different (10/10) - modern, comfortable, well designed, large (for NYC) rooms (8/10) - great room service (9/10) - spotless - little to no noise from street outside or adjacent rooms (9/10) - friendly staff almost always smiling or saying hi (9/10) - free internet in the lobby (3 terminals - could do with 2 more) (7/10) - ok concierge (5/10) - ok bar - (dreadful bar nibbles - -pls change them!) (4/10) Finally, hints: 1. if you don't like your room view ask to change - i changed from view of building site (N view) to perfect view of the Chrysler building (SW view). 2. check out the Blue Bar at the Algonquin next door - fab martinis 3. your hotel is 5 doors from the best breakfast place in the area - check it out - the Red Flame (67 West 44th Street - towards 6th Av) - poached eggs good, waffles better!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in New York”
Reviews.Author: Dave_Webb
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Sofitel hotels in Europe we booked this on personal knowledge along with the reviews on TripAdvisor. We weren't disappointed and spent 4 great nights in New York. The hotel is ideally situated and the rooms are very spacious. The staff were very friendly and extremely professional and we even made use of the room service which I normally avoid. We would certainly stay here again and would recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not exciting”
Reviews.Author: CarnarvonBoy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Sofitel in Munich so had high expectations for this hotel. Unfortunately it was a bit of a let down. From the moment you arrive the feeling of ordinary is about. The entrance is very drab and the lobby although well stocked with chairs had nothing to make us want to sit. Reception is around a corner near the lifts and purely functional. Our previous trip to New York we stayed at the Hudson and these two are chalk and cheese, the Hudson all bling with an amazing lobby but tiny rooms and average staff. This one had a distinct lack of wow but very competent staff, and very resonably sized rooms. The bathroom was also quite large with both a quality shower and bath. We didnt eat but did have a drink in the bar, again it didnt ring our bells. For breakfast we went down the street to the Red Flame dinner every day which made us feel so New York and was very cool. Overall I have given the hotel quite a high rating because the room was large, clean and the view of the Chrysler building from our 25th floor room was cool. Only the lack of wow disappointed us. When we stay 5 star we want to feel like rock stars and at the Sofitel in New York we felt a bit like tired corporate types. Final thing, location is perfect, this part of midtown has a great central location without being too mad like Times Square (only 5 minutes walk away) We did start to feel like we could hang out for a much longer time but this was more to do with a few favourite coffee bars and the familarity than the hotel. We will be back on 44th street again but not at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: cjbailey
Reviews.Content: We booked a room on Priceline and were pleased with the selection of Sofitel. Our room had no view, but was very quiet, great for sleeping and comfortably appointed. Marble bathroom was very upscale. The lounge area was very relaxing and friendly and the hotel staff was attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: Kokes
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel is a fantastic hotel. Believe what you read on trip advisor about the beds - they are so comfortable! Gorgeous fluffy duvets and pillows which make for a great night's sleep - along with the quiet rooms (I couldn't believe we were in Manhattan!) with no street noise and none of the usual banging of doors which you can often get in hotels. Staff were friendly and courteous. Lobby is gorgeous and the rooms are finished to a great standard with beautiful large bathrooms. Only thing missing for me was tea and coffee making facilities in the room. The location is great - 2 seconds from 5th avenue shops and 2 minutes from Times Square. As per the other reviews we visited the red flame diner for breakfast which was OK if you want the whole american diner experience with no frills. For something a bit more refined try the cafe 57 on 6th avenue right near central park - it's lovely and they do a great and very reasonable brunch with everything from fruit and granola to eggs and pancakes. Beautiful atmosphere too. Overall the Sofitel was gorgeous and I'd definitely recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel - Amazing Staff and service - No pool”
Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with our children. The hotel is smart and with probably the best hotel staff in the world. I think the staff makes the hotel. The staff just cannot do enough for you. They remember our names every day of the five days we were there. The hotel manager or whoever trained the staff should be commended. The hotel itself is just okay, clean, smart, you have to pay for the gym, and $35 for parking with no in and out priviledges, so if you park the car now and go out 10 minutes later, its another $35. Yikes. manhattan, all you can see are walls of the next building. We got upgraded to a better room. The rooms are small, and the bed was very small. The staff however gave us another double bed in the room. There is absolutely no view being in MThe hotel doesnt have a pool and apart from using the gym or sit in the lobby, there is nothing else to do in the hotel. Will not stay there again. I like my hotel to have a pool, jacuzzi, steam room and spa.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & value for money”
Reviews.Author: uk~young~traveller
Reviews.Content: We visited New York for the 1st time and wanted to stay somewhere nice! compared to the cost of most hotels in manhatten the sofitel was definetly worth every penney, especially with so many to choose from! the hotel is quite small compared to some hotels, and has an intimate atmoshpere! The staff were very pleasant and friendly. Our room was a good size, bigger than we expected for New York and from our window we could see both the Empire state & Crysler Builing!! The bathroom was very spacious and open, with both a bath & a seperate shower, with marble decoration. The bed is possible the most comfortable i have ever slept in, perfect after a day traipsing round the city! The hotel's location was also ideal, with most things an easy walk away! with such a location we were amazed by the quietness of the room, Being on the 18th floor we couldn't hear a peep! I definietly reccommend this hotel, and would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “The Sofitel is 'Wonderfel'”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterPammy
Reviews.Content: Long live Trip Advisor! I wouldn't travel anywhere without consulting it first and have recommended it to soo many people. I can't really anything more to the rave reviews about this hotel except to say I was delighted that it lived up to and beyond expectations. Do yourself a favour, please, please book a table at The River Cafe in Brooklyn (but do it before you leave home). You can walk across the bridge, as we did, then double back to the water's edge where this 'barge' restaurant is located. The food was wonderful but the view of the Manhattan Skyline was priceless and there's not a bad seat in the house. Oh, and on the day before we came home, a guy got in the elevator with us and was chatting away to my husband because I'd lost the power of speech. After he got out I told my hubby it was Billy Bob Thornton but he did'nt know who he was! (One of the staff confirmed it). So if it's good enough for Billy Bob..............

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Midnightblue
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week to visit new york. The location is excellent 2 minutes from times square. The staff were all very good the conceirge always spot on with his choices of restaurants. Would recommned this hotel. We usually like to heat outside of the hotel as this offers better choice and better quality, however we did eat in the restaurant on one occasion and found the food to be very good.

Reviews.Title: “On the Way Down”
Reviews.Author: Phil12
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times during the past few years and have found it clean, a great location, and very affordable. This four day visit however was very disappointing. The shower was not working correctly and sprayed most of the bathroom. The door did not work at all and a curtain had been supplied. When I arrived the safe was working and after two days it broke, and there was not effort to fix it. At the instruction of the front desk, I delivered my valuables to the clerk in the morning and on my return that evening, the envelope was still on the desk behind the clerks. Also, on my arrival, my television was not working for all the local stations, and this was not repaired until the third day of my visit. All in all, not a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Still our favourite place to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: elegantraveller
Reviews.Content: We love staying at the Sofitel for many of the same reasons as other tripadvisor contributors - namely the location, the terrific beds, nice bathrooms and the proximity to the Red Flame diner (!) This time there was a small niggle though - arriving in room 915, we assumed the previous occupant must have enjoyed some room service meals, for there was a distinct odour of stale cooking. Never mind - we set the airconditioning a little fiercer than usual and thought it improved - except that each time we returned to our room, it was still there. It would appear that this is one of several rooms overlooking an outdoor vent at a slightly lower level - possibly from a kitchen? It wasn't enough to spoil our (short) stay, but each time we returned to our room, I rather wished I had taken action and rejected it when we arrived. I will do so next time!

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel is Great!”
Reviews.Author: strabaneman
Reviews.Content: Sofitel is excellent-if you want a hotel which is perfectly situated,with very comfortable and quiet rooms,then dont look any further.I booked it after reading the reviews on trip advisor and i couldnt have been happier.The moment we arrived we were made very welcome.The room was very clean,the bed was excellent,the bathroom was great and the hotel was comfortable and an oasis in the middle of manhattan.5th avenue is a few steps away and the empire state building,rockafeller centre,macys,central park etc are all easily accessible on foot.Had breakfast each morning in the red flame 4 doors away from the hotel-perfect for a new york experience!I would definitely stay in sofitel new york again.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice for our first visit to New York”
Reviews.Author: tabbykins
Reviews.Content: Difficult to know what to add to the positive reviews already posted. I had mixed feelings coming to New York as I did not think that the city or this hotel would be my thing. How wrong I was!! We had a beautiful, spacious suite on the 25th floor with views toward the Rock. I think the floor was an upgrade as I think you are meant to pay extra for the top floors & we didn't, just requested one if possible. Our stay was for a week. Everything in the hotel done very efficently for you with a minimun of fuss. The hotel is very European in feel, I thought that may be a mistake for us as coming from Europe to NY for the first time perhaps we should have gone for something less European in feel but we loved the Sofitel so 'Je ne regrette rien!' A lot has to do with perspective & expectations. The Sofitel is a great deal, even for a suite upgrade, coming from UK with the present exchange rate. Visitors from inside the USA may feel differently. Also, I have no idea how it compares with other hotels in New York. I did my research on TA & after reading the reviews for this & many other hotels, this seemed like the best bet. It certainly worked for us. I loved New York & the Sofitel added to our enjoyment. Result!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: ravenna
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here five nights and had no issues. The Sofitel has a great location, perfect for knocking around the neighborhood or going uptown or downtown. The room (2104) was well appointed, extremely quiet and had a nice city view. The marble shower had plenty of pressure and hot water. The bed was outrageously comfortable. The staff were courteous and helpful. The bellmen were so efficient that a taxi, even on a rainy evening, was never hard to come by. We found the quality of room service to be very good and enjoyed a nice meal at Restaurant Gaby. That being said, keep in mind that Chef Daniel Boulud has a bistro only a few doors down that serves breakfast, lunch and dinner with excellence. We cannot give a single reason why we would not return to the Sofitel next time we visit NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: caz1979
Reviews.Content: My fiance booked the Sofitel for 4 nights at the end of March/start of April as a birthday pressie combined with getting my engagement ring at Tiffany & Co. As others have done in the past, we subtly mentioned we were here for an occassion but alas no champage. What we did get though was room 2820. 28th floor, only 3 rooms at this particular side of the hotel and boy what a view! The TV was a bit old, not a great deal in the way of storage space but the room was the best I have seen yet even compared to the Fairmont in Toronto. Kudos to whoever makes those beds as they were the best nights sleep I have ever had. The bathroom was to die for and in a moment of nosiness I eventually figured out the knob in the bathroom was great for knowing what the other half was was watching on TV. The location was amazing with Central Park, Empire State, 5th & 6th, Broadway and Times Square all within walking distance although if you do walk to Central Park I'd advise stopping for coffee half way as it is quite far. We received complimentary turn down and 2 bottles of Evian every evening plus the weather forcast for the following day but no chocolates - probably just as well. New York itself wasn't a total let down but I think the weather was very kind to us which helped. Guys, if you're thinking about getting a nice piece of jewellery for your other half (especially the diamond ring variety) definately visit Tiffany on 5th near Central Park. 3 glasses of champagne later and I had the most beautiful engagement ring that would have cost double in the UK. Other things to do/visit - Red Flame (breakfast, lunch, dinner or midnight snack, this place was always welcoming and the selection and prices were great plus it wasn't all tourists there), Apple store on 5th, Grand Central Station (5 minute walk from the hotel). I, like others, found that the hotel staff thought we were made of money when it came to recommending restaurants. I don't think jeans & trainers helped our cause for door opening but when walking that much, I wasn't doing heels! One negative factor about the trip was the red NY sight-seeing buses. They were over priced, over crowded and at times you could have walked faster. Great for learning more about NY but a travellers guide would be cheaper and warmer. A crowd of 50+ (including us) were stranded for over an hour at Battery Park waiting to get home on a day when winter woolies were required but not worn. We were lucky enough to get on the bus home but had to sit upstairs (open-air) in freezing conditions or risk not getting home at all.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful european experience in NYC”
Reviews.Author: guy999
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a amazing vacation over the last weekend in New York City. Part of the vacation was assisted by the fact that this was the best whether that New York is apparently had in the last three months. The best part of the vacation was our hotel, and we had upgraded to a king-sized standard room instead of the suite. This was slightly more expensive at $400 a night but certainly worth it. We have the best bathroom that I have ever seen in New York City at this hotel. We also had a convenient lunch while we were waiting for our room because we arrived a little bit early. They were very helpful and moved us up a couple of floors and also gave us a much better view so that directly out of our window was the Empire State building. However, we went on three tours while we were in New York City and let me tell you that everyone there on each of these tours feels that you really need to look at the Empire State building so I have pretty much seen it in every view the you can possibly see and likely have at least 50 to 60 pictures just because of the number of times that was mentioned and I much like a lemming feel the need to take a picture each and every time. The bedding is sumptuous, the room is very comfortable. the only thing I would have liked is that I would've greatly appreciated having free Internet access in the hotel room. There is no information on the hotel website to indicate whether or not the Internet is free or not however I have discovered that virtually all the hotels that I stay at that are in the $200-$400 price range never include free Internet. Oddly when I stay at hotels in the $50-$75 range they always include free Internet. I would recommend joining the membership club as well because of the expense of the hotel I have quite a substantial amount of points now with the membership club and will recommend everyone to join because it does enable you to have a late checkout and also provides you with two free drinks. Unfortunately by the time that they gave us the to free drinks we are he had a complete meal in a restaurant and we never got around to returning back to the restaurant and having another drink because of our entire vacation we were on the go. This is one of the top hotels I've ever stayed at including throughout Europe. In the room was standard size unlike most of the hotels I stay at in New York which are extremely small and I would highly recommend that you stay here for just about anything.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Scarbs
Reviews.Content: I booked a trip for my girlfriend and i to NYC, and chose the Sofitel based mostly on the reviews i had read on this website. Overall, i was slightly disappointed with what we got. The location was excellent and good for the subway. I found the concierge below par with the staff acting like we had money to burn when it came to booking things. On one occassion a member of the door staff was texting on his mobile instead of opening the door for us. When you are paying top dollar to stay in a top hotel i expect the front door to the hotel to be opened for us. 80% of the time, this was not done. I also felt that because i wasn't swanning around in a suit that i was looked down on by staff, and that my trainers and jeans lowered the tone. Our bath robes mysteriously disappeared on the second day not to be returned and cleaning staff entered our room without knocking on one occassion. The room size was ok, not much of a view and there was some road noise getting through - we were 18th floor. The TV in the room was a good 10 year old set. Bathroom was a good size though and well equipped. The gym was ok (no swimming pool, jacuzzi or sauna though) with up to date machines and a small selection of free weights. My overall experience was that my expectations were not fully met

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Classy Oasis”
Reviews.Author: SE-Explorer
Reviews.Content: Sofitel Hotel Review Sofitel presents as a very classy, sophisticated and elegant hotel. The staff greeted me as if they knew me, and offered a complimentary upgrade. On any other occasion I would have taken it, but I needed two beds for our “Girls in NYC spring break”. They complied with my request for a quiet room by placing me at the end of the hall. Room #1918 had a northerly view over 45th St towards the GE bldg; big plus total blackout curtains keeping out light. The hotel quickly provided the requested additional bathrobes and luggage racks. As if on cue once my friend arrived, the complimentary iced champagne was delivered in a beautiful silver bucket with elegant flutes – real French champagne, after all this is the Sofitel – in honor of my birthday. What a treat! The concierge even provided us with an umbrella for our rainy day. We thought the staff from the doormen, concierge, front desk, house-keeping to restaurant servers were friendly, efficient and helpful. We found the beds, firm but nestled the body with the feather bed topped mattresses, firm feather pillows, silky soft covered feather duvets – the linens were of the highest quality. There were plenty of plush towels, hand towels, wash cloths and great ablutions in the bathroom: lotion, shampoo, lots of conditioner for us girls, body wash, amenity box (swabs, cotton balls, sewing kit), votive candle plus a lovely orchid in silver vase. There is a separate shower & bath (shower is fine, but the Westin’s double shower head has the Sofitel beat). Another nice touch is a clock/alarm with CD player so I could play music – I had compiled a “Girls Just Wanna Have Fun” type CD. Major plus were the environment controls; room could be cooled even though it was only 50 degrees outside. We like a cool room and the heat was on in the hotel, but try getting A/C room in Europe – BIG kudos to the NY Sofitel! I could only find fault with a few things: one red carpet stain outside our bathroom & another stain in the corner near the closet, silicone caulking around the sink had oozed out between the counter and under-sided mounted sink basin – not pretty. Also I would have preferred each bed to have its own reading light rather than one shared between the beds. Did have a relaxing dessert in Gaby, their cozy bistro/bar with coffee late one evening. Coffee was strong & expensive, $6, but I did receive a whole carafe (I only wanted one cup, oh well). The dessert was lovely: raspberry tart topped with a light as air meringue accompanied by raspberry sorbet – just delicious. Overall the Sofitel hits the target on the most important points: Comfy, firm beds, high quality linens & ablutions, QUIET, environmental controls. Sofitel pulls ahead of other hotels by their attentive service, professionalism, going the extra mile by offering umbrellas and free champagne, and no hassle late check out. The Sofitel is one I would recommend to my friends and will chose when I return to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in a Good City”
Reviews.Author: jodean1979
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Sofitel New York from 6 - 11 April 07 was greeted by very friendly staff and very professional staff. Upon arrival I was able to change Travellers Cheques without charges up to $200 but as I wanted more they said that on the 1st exchange only they would do this for $400 (had I known how little we would spend I would not have put the lady at reception out.) We were there for an easter break, both me and my partner really found the hotel to be the best location wise, cleanliness, friendliness and so on I cannot praise Sofitel enough for keeping French Front of House staff to retain that consistently high level of service. If you have booked to stay at the Sofitel New York you will not go away disappointed. New York may not be what you are expecting but the hotel will be! Found New York to be so so. It is not a city we could fall in love with such as Paris but it is okay and enjoyed the stay. Well worth a visit but not much in the way of romantic essence especially not at The Empire State Building as I thought there would be here if no where! The Empire State Building is okay, it is a construction site inside and not only do you queue to get up but you queue to get down too and Top of The Rock at Rockerfeller Centre is far better, much closer to the essence of New York I was expecting and more professionally managed. As other reviewers have said if you are due to stay at the Sofitel anywhere in the world it is well worth getting yourself a Sofitel Privilege Card in advance - takes about 3 weeks to arrive but if you apply online there are no fees and you can ring France obtain your card number and expiry as I did and quote upon arrival or booking in order to gain you can get your free drinks on arrival and 4pm check out without hassle. You need to ring France to get your details if they don't arrive in time number on their website. Didn't spend much as food was relatively inexpensive best meal and most expensive meal we had was at Grand Central Station in the restaurant opposite Jordon Steak House, can't remember the name something like Caprianio. Also The Red Flame Diner a few doors down from the Sofitel is excellent for a cheap and cheerful meal but a bit of a nightmare at breakfast time very busy but that just goes to show how good it is not just tourists either. All in all a very nice experience both of New York and Sofitel. But everyone's tastes are always different but the hotel most certainly will be favoured by the majority but the jury is still out on New York.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Dreams”
Reviews.Author: TravlingBard
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights after 2 nights on the West Side. It was good to be in the midst of the action of Times Square and convenient to Broadway shows. We walked to ours and saw the Drowsy Chaperone which was highly entertaining and funny. The view on the 20th floor was fine, not great, but we did not care to pay a premium for great. The room was well appointed with space to place clothing in drawers, and a decent sized closet. Very nice art and lighting. One neat feature was the speaker in the bathroom that lets you hear what your partner is watching on TV, or turn it off for peaceful bathing. The bed was fantastic, formidable as they say in French. The service was superbe - one actually felt that the staff really cared if you had a wonderful restful visit. I had the feeling they'd be very nice about letting one practice one's French too. Not Parisians evidently. We were obliged with a late checkout on a miserably rainy Sunday - the day set a record for rain in Central Park - so we enjoyed being able to sleep half the day, something that turned out to be particularly beneficial later in the airport when we were delayed from departing until midnight and our flight turned into a redeye. We are both early risers but not at this hotel. The concierge gave very good leads - Rene in particular. The concierge got us GREAT tickets to the B'way show center orchestra 7 rows from the front, which I booked with them by phone a month before after I had booked the room. Outstanding food at Gaby's in the lobby. Also Junior's has opened a location on 45th nearby for what's often referred to as the best cheesecake in NYC not to mention other excellent traditional deli. We caught wonderful jazz by Christian Finger band at Cornelia St. Cafe in Greenwich village, and the food was great there too, with an eye to organic and low-fat. Some of the best entertainment was in the subway, of course. The lobby sports three computers with a super fast connection so no need to bring the laptop. Occasionally they all get busy but one opens up relatively quickly. I've seen more spectacular lobbies but this one is well dressed and very pretty. Kind of strange to say this but this very French hotel offers a quintessential NYC experience, and reminds me of my best times in the French countryside while providing a haven in the City. Very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “fine”
Reviews.Author: lucho74
Reviews.Content: I've been ther with my wife and my little boy (5 years old) for a one night stay in april 2007. It was fine.Very well located, prise as reasonnable as possible in this area, room very clean, and nice, bathroom as nice as the room. Service is fine. The breakfast restaurant is beautiful, but may be the break ast is too expensive, that's my only bad observation. A good address, definitly

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel - Highly recommended for a first trip to NY”
Reviews.Author: cameron28
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 6 night trip to NY. We chose the Sofitel purely on Trip Advisor recommendations and we certainly weren't disappointed. The hotel is in a great location - we could walk to all the main sights - only had to get the metro once to go to Ground Zero/Statue of Liberty. Times Square is only 5 mins walk away and must be seen at night. Loads of great restaurants nearby - can recommend Resette (Italian) and Mr K's (Chinese) and Red Flame for breakfast - all you can eat for about £5 and very, very good - especially the pancakes. Would recommend having a drink in the revolving bar at the top of the Marriott Marquis hotel in Times Square, for panoramic views of the city at night - spectacular. Also tea at the Waldorf and a visit to Carnegie Hall - the famous concert hall. The hotel itself was faultless - staff very friendly and the concierge terrific - they recommended and booked all our restaurants. Also the bed was the most comfy we have ever stayed in and it was exceptionally quiet considering its location. Can't recomend this hotel enough really.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: terps82770
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sofitel for a getaway (from three kids) weekend. It was our first time in New York and, I have to say, our experience could not have been better!! The room was immaculate, the service impeccable (the concierge and the doormen were WONDERFUL). The entire hotel was a class act from arrival to departure. The location could not have been better - 10 minute walk to a Broadway show, Times Square or a number of fabulous restaurants. Tony's di napoli was, by far, the best Italian food we have ever had and had a wonderful atmosphere. I have to mention the beds at the Sofitel. Down pillows, down comforter, down pillow top - need I say more? We actually napped for a few hours after a day of shopping on nearby 5th Avenue just because the beds were so amazing and PLUSH. We are ordering the pillows from the Sofitel shop for our bed at home. The entire hotel was sophisticated and beautiful - we very much enjoyed the art deco decor. I loved the fresh flowers and candlelight. The rooms are not enormous (although the bathrooms have a separate tub and shower along with marbled floors), but WHO CARES when you can sleep in the bed as if you were at home. More than worth it. We will not stay anywhere else for our future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Flowers Waltz”
Reviews.Author: KSergey
Reviews.Content: Sofitel NY is really beautiful. A small island of French spirit in huge cosmopolitan city. “Bonjour!” is the first greeting you hear at the entrance or by phone. An ocean of fresh flowers. Thousands of flowers in big glass vases everywhere. Orchids, carnations, roses, peonies. A kind of a flourish summer garden in cold winter. Such a stylish place! I just couldn’t pass by that miracle and put my curious nose into a pack of white-and-pink peonies - Oh! What an adoring aroma! - And immediately got a condemning look of a lady from reception. Pardon madam, no more boyish behavior. Promise. The reception staff in general is friendly and effective. The check-in took some minutes. I got a room on the 7th floor just in front of an office’s window on the opposite wall at the distance of a few meters. Hope, the guys who daily were working there could hardly see me thanks to the dirtiness of my window. The room was quite spacious and very nicely designed. For instance, I liked the b/w photos on the wall picturing the construction of the Eiffel tower in Paris. Besides, the bouquets of fresh cut orchids in the bedroom and bathroom – nice touch also. The room was very clean and equipped very well – cable TV, air-conditioner, mini-bar, alarm-clock, CD-player, iron and ironing board, electronic safe-box. At daily turndown service, a bottle of Evian still water and a small set of Belgian chocolates are always complimentarily left in room. In marble bathroom, there are a small tug with shower and a separate shower cabin, a hair-dryer, a lot of high quality bathing cosmetics, bathrobes and slippers. Everything is perfect! Dry cleaning and laundry service is absolutely efficient. Every day I sent my shirts to laundry; and my trousers and jackets – for pressing. And I received all my items the same day evening perfectly done. The maid service is very good. In half an hour after my arrival, maids’ supervisor visited my room wondering if everything was all right. Moreover, I was immediately provided with bigger size slippers when I complained that ones already obtained were small for me. And usually, I got my room cleaned already in the morning coming back from breakfast. Breakfast is served at Gaby restaurant as well as lunch and dinner. American breakfast for $20 is great! It traditionally includes eggs, sausages/ham/bacon, pan-fried potato, tomatoes, freshly squeezed orange juice, coffee, croissant, and jam. Besides, fresh berries plate with soar cream is also highly recommended. The restaurant and bar designed like a French café-bistro and stylishly decorated with old French movies’ snapshots with famous actors - Jean Gabin, Gerard Philippe, Jean Marais, et al. It’s a nice place to have a dinner too. The French cuisine is very good. The personnel are extremely pleasant and well skilled. But most of all, I’m pleased by the concierge service. Daniel and Vlad, thank you guys for your great job! I’d like to especially appreciate Vlad’s personal assistance to find out my disappeared prepaid tickets to Metropolitan Opera which hadn’t been delivered by a local ticket agency on time neither to my place in Moscow nor to Sofitel in New York City. Many thanks again, Vlad! All in all, I really liked this hotel very much. It’s a wonderful place for staying there. It’s not cheap at all, but worths every buck spent! And location! Just in the heart of Manhattan! Take a few steps on your left – the 5th Avenue; a few steps on your right – ever shining Times Square, 42nd Street subway station and Broadway theatres; fifteen minutes slow walk straight ahead downtown – the Macy’s shopping kingdom. Where to go? That depends… No doubt, definitely would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SusaB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights over Easter weekend. We "booked" the hotel through Priceline. This is an excellent hotel with a superb location and outstanding service. We arrived before the 3PM check in time and were given a room on the 3rd floor with a queen size bed. The person who checked us in claimed there were no king size beds available and said we could upgrade to a King suite for $100 per night, which we declined. The room overlooked some kind of power unit and I could hear the muffled sound. I went down and asked for another room to no avail. Later I approached another person at the desk who assured us we could get a room with a King size bed the next day. This room was on the 14th floor and much more desirable. Every night they left two bottles of Evian and a small box of chocolates. The bathroom is lovely and there is nothing negative I can say about this hotel. A wonderful property and you can't beat the location. We easily walked to theater district, Fifth Avenue shopping, etc etc.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Jacol
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week long stay at the Sofitel visiting our son. The weather was absolutely freezing but the hotel was wonderful and exactly as described in previous reviews. Having walked every inch of Manhattan, including the Brooklyn Bridge (a must at dusk to see the lights come on in Manhattan), it was a joy to get back and relax in our gorgeous bed! We signed up for a privilege card and were upgraded to a room on the 21st floor with an amazing view of the Chrysler Building and were given vouchers for two free drinks in the bar and late checkout. Can highly recommend doing this. We took breakfast either in our room or in the Gaby Restaurant and the little extras and attention to detail made it well worth the money. Our son works in SoHo and took us to many trendy cafes and restaurants in Greenwich, SoHo, Alphabet City and East Side, which we would have missed on our own. They may look scruffy on the outside but are packed with locals and ooze atmosphere, especially for the younger visitor. I can't remember all the names but we lunched at Chat 'n Chew at 10 East 16th St and had dinner one night at Esperanto Restaurant in Alphabet City, as well as quaint French and Italian restaurants. Be sure to also visit Cafe Lalo at 201 W 83rd St on the Corner of Amsterdam Avenue where 'You Got Mail' was filmed. Our first day we took a 'New York Party Shuttle Bus' tour which I can heartily recommend. The small bus with guide takes you all around Manhattan including the Statten Island Ferry and Ground Zero and the guide gives a personal insight into the whole of Manhattan. Check out their website. On returning to the airport the doormen arranged for us to travel in the black limousine shared with a neighbouring hotel, costing 65 dollars including tolls, and worth the extra for the comfort. From the hotel we could walk to Grand Central, Empire State Building, Rockerfeller Centre (the views from the top are as good if not better than the Empire State, and the queues are a lot less - again dusk is a popular time to see the city in daylight and as the lights come on), Chrysler Building, Times Square, Maceys, etc, making it the perfect location. I'm glad we didn't stay in Times Square as this gets very busy and noisy but a cut price show can be booked at the TKTS booth now by Drowsy Chaperone (didn't see this show but it was recommended to us). New Yorkers are very friendly and helpful and the city felt very safe. Apart from the weather we had an absolutely wonderful stay in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Above average, yes. Best hotel in New York? No.”
Reviews.Author: doremifaso
Reviews.Content: We have not long returned from the Sofitel and found it above average,. but not much more. I am surprised that it ranks so highly, to be honest. It is clean, well situated and the staff were helpful on the whole, but there was little to distinguish it from other hotels of its ilk - the Parker Meridien, for example matches the Sofitel and has a rooftop pool, too! It met our needs and was pretty good value for money, but was resolutely unremarkable overall.

Reviews.Title: “First time in New York - and First Class Hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: WolfCobh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I (both in mid-40s) stayed in the Sofitel for 7 nights. The overall experience was fantastic! The room was spacious (!!), high up, with top view, modern design, a bed that you did not want to get out of (what comfort!!), and was being cleaned and serviced each day par excellence! Free water and (what indulgence) free chocolates every day. The staff was friendly and attentive. And the restaurant offered really excellent food (yes, we had dinner there twice, despite hundreds of other choices)! Few people go for the breakfast, though, as there are lots of places around with good choices. The location is fantastic! 5 minutes to Times Square/Broadway, 10 minutes to the central bus stations and the Port terminal, and 5th Avenue just around the corner. You are right at the edge of all what makes NY so exciting! We will come back to this hotel next time!

Reviews.Title: “little touches everywhere”
Reviews.Author: Jross46
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Sofitel. Both times were delightful. The doorman recognized me after the first time, and was so friendly and polite, "Always a pleasure Madam" and "Welcome back Madam." I love that. Flowers everywhere. Beautifully clean. Lovely bathrooms with marble - separate shower and tub. Bathrobe and slippers. The basic continental room service breakfast was also lovely. I know there are many other raving reviews for this hotel, but I had to add my two cents. Beds are comfortable, sheets nice quality, maid service excellent, complimentary bottled water, all things the other reviews mention. it's worth the exra few bucks. My friend stayed at the Parker Meridien and it wasnt half as nice, but comparable cost.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ZedZedH
Reviews.Content: This is a GREAT four star hotel. I think it's important to clarify that -- it's a FOUR STAR hotel. It's totally not the Four Seasons or anything else that is five star, so I don't understand why people go there expecting it to be at that level. However, if you accept that it's a four star hotel, you'll probably find it's the BEST four star hotel in Manhattan. Stayed there for a week during late March this year, and had an absolutely lovely time. Absolutely no dramas during our stay, and we found everything to be clean, efficient, well managed and friendly. I booked a King Suite via their website on the '3 night getaway' rate, which was tremendously good value. The 7 full nights in this massive 650 square foot suite was just 2942 USD, which is remarkable value for a room this size in New York in my opinion. The suite itself was absolutely lovely. Plenty of room to relax in, which is vitally important if you are in New York for a blazing 7 day tourism extravaganza, and you come home heavily laden with shopping bags every day :) Rooms in NY tend to be a bit smaller than other cities around the world, so this wasn't the largest suite I'd ever been in, but it was an okay size. Of particular note is the bathroom, which had the most wonderful deep soaking bath tub that we made good use of almost every day. Concierge was excellent -- we wandered down to Daniel and said we needed a nice restaurant to have dinner in on Saturday night before our Broadway show, and he very quickly got us into an award winning restaurant nearby. His efficiency and professionalism was quite amazing. Reception was also fantastic, but it depended on who you spoke to. Brook / Brooke was absolutely sensational. She had so much enthusiasm and was so incredibly friendly, that we couldn't help but have a huge smile on our faces as we checked in. Every time I needed to come down to reception, if I saw Brook I would make a bee line for her because she was so lovely. The bed -- oh my goodness. Yes, people rave about the Sofitel bed and I was always like "sure, whatever", but then I got in this one and I totally understand what everyone is on about! They put this very VERY soft featherbed thingy on top of the mattress, and it turns the bed into an absolute slice of heaven. We were often thinking about it while we were out and about :) Great down pillows too. Room service was good, although they did make a mistake once, but quickly rectified it without any hassle. The food was very nice. The downstairs restaurant has been badly slated in past reviews, but we ate dinner there on our first night and found it to be very nice, although the service was a touch slow. We cannot comment on the breakfast because we never ate it there. For breakfast, as has been mentioned in previous reviews, head down the street to the Red Flame Restaurant. This is a kind of 'diner' with lovely big breakfasts, fast service, and a real cool New York street ambience. People come in and queue up at the take-out counter for bagels and coffee, while we sat in one of the numerous booths and just soaked it all up. The waitresses may not be Minnesota nice, but they are super fast and efficient, and ice cold water will be on your table just as you sit, with coffee not far behind it. We had breakfast there every morning, trying different specials and can recommend a stack of things! (great poached eggs, home fries, omelettes) Okay, back to the hotel! Niggles: the cupboard for hanging your clothes in was very small, especially for a suite. However, we managed to get by. We didn't get a fabulous view, even though we were on the top floor. The view was of some unrecognisable buildings, so if you want a view of Chrysler (which you can absolutely get from this hotel) please make sure you request precisely that well in advance. The water pressure in the shower was perhaps below average. On the whole, we had a wonderful stay here and I cannot give this hotel anything less than full marks. I would have paid two to three times the price at the Four Seasons, and I'm sure the experience would not have been that much more comfortable to warrant it. They have great staff at the Sofitel, it's in a fabulously convenient location, and our time there was hassle free and completely pampered. What more can you ask for? Get it on a good rate, and stay there!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bravo Sofitel!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tommer1
Reviews.Content: I opted for this hotel after the mainly positive reviews posted on trip advisor. I am one who can be a harsh critic and when I'm spending my money. I have an attitude that I should get what I paid for and I'm entitled to premium service. We have stayed at numerous hotels around the world some better than others. New York City based on experience is a place that can be dicey when it comes to accommodations. In many cases the room was OK the staff not so hot, location etc....never have we stayed at a place that put it all together. That is until we stayed at the Sofitel, from the minute we arrived to our departure this hotel has found the formula. An excellent attentive staff that genuinely seem to care how not just your stay is but how your overall trip is going. Polite, professional, conscientious, dedicated are only a few of the many QUALITIES I could use to describe their team. If anyone was considering getting into the hotel industry they would be wise to go and stay at Sofitel for a week to get an understanding of how a hotel should be run. The rooms were stylishly furnished, immaculately clean, the bed comfortable with basically no street noise. The location was proximate to everything New York has to offer. There is no doubt when we return to NY where we will be staying. As a matter of fact I was so impressed with this place we would build our vacation time around the hotels availability. Bravo Sofitel!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Chilly Easter but a warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: mostyn7
Reviews.Content: My third visit to New York and the best hotel yet. We were upgraded to a higher floor and had a peaceful 6 night stay in a briiliant hotel. The rooms was the biggest I have stayed in in NY, wonderfully clean and well kept with the most comfortable and cozy bed. This was particularly welcome as NY was having the coldest Easter for several years with an average temp of 2-3oC. We did eat breakfast twice at the hotel in Gaby - it was more expensive than at the Red Flame diner three doors down but certainly a better experience. The Concierge gave some excellent dinner recommendations and we had several memorable meals. We do not normally stay at 'chain' hotels but I would recommend the Sofitel for its extremely high standards and friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, service, location etc”
Reviews.Author: travelllers
Reviews.Content: very fine hotel on a fantastic location. Concierge very helpfull, all other personnell very good to. Extremely clean. no complaints at all. Equal to high end hotels in other major cities as Tokyo or Paris. Would definetely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel was a relaxing”
Reviews.Author: jjuliannaa
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four-night stay at the Sofitel. It was wonderful. I was apprehensive about New York City because all of the hotels seemed to have small rooms. Sofitel was one of the exceptions. We arrived at 2:00 (one hour prior to check-in time), but were promptly given a room. We booked a Premier Queen bedroom with 350 sq ft. It had a wonderful bathroom with a separate tub and shower. Everything was very clean. The first night during turn-down service a vase of fresh orchids was placed on the vanity. Two bottles of complimentary water were also left each night. The employees were all very friendly, but not conspicuous. There was a wonderful doorman who gave us advice on nice places to visit and good restaurants. He also gave us a large umbrella when it was raining. We didn't eat at the restaurant, because we wanted to eat at several local restaurants and just never got around to the one in the hotel. The location is great. It is next door to the New York Yacht Club, which has a beautiful exterior. We could walk to Grand Central Terminal and Times Square. My only complaint is that there was no top sheet on the bed. It had a crisp, clean white-on-white striped bottom sheet, with a matching duvet cover on a down comforter. I got a little warm during the night and would liked to have been able to use just a top sheet. The duvet cover was very clean, and it appeared to be replaced each day. Also, our room didn't have much of a view, since we were on the 4th floor. Our window overlooked 43rd street, where we could see another building next door. It might be worth paying for a room on a higher floor. Overall, the hotel had a very European feel. Many of the other guests were speaking French and Italian. Many of the employees had French accents, probably because Sofitel is based in France.

Reviews.Title: “A near perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: basnight
Reviews.Content: I stayed with the wife for a long weekend and picked the Sofitel based on the reviews from this site and I couldn't have been happier with my choice. 5 years ago I made the mistake of staying at the Waldorf Astoria and vowed never to get ripped off again in NYC. The rate from theSofitel website averaged under three hundred a night which is very competitive. Loved the close proximity to the theatre district and 5th Ave. The staff was friendly and when we thought our first room smelled like smoke the woman who checked us in brought up our new room keys personally and in an instant. The lobby is art-deco beautiful and there is free internet access on 3 hotel computers 24 hours a day. I particularly liked the gym. It was bigger than most hotel gyms, had TV's with all cardio equipment, free headphones, and the gym was complementary ( unlike a lot of NY hotels which charge extra or make you walk to an adjoining health club ). The only negatives were that the hotel TV did not get ESPN ( it was NCAA tourney weekend ) and the comfy bed does not have a sheet but a duvet only ). Other than those tidbits, I couldn't have been more pleased with my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Sofitel!”
Reviews.Author: pixiecat
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in early March 07 - was in NYC for business. My bed was wonderful! Loved the extra-fluffy duvets and soft sheets. The bath was well-equiped & the shower had wonderful water pressure. Someone else mentioned that the staff's french accents were a bit pretentious - every time I talked to them I had to stiffle a giggle! It did seem a bit much... then again, everyone was very nice and helpful (not that I am a high-needs guest). Would have loved to have stayed longer - especially since work was paying! Lovely hotel, hope I get to return.

Reviews.Title: “One Word - Magnifique!!!!!!!!!!! 5 Star Experience”
Reviews.Author: AnointedTraveler
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I just spent her Spring Break week at the Sofitel. From the moment the car stopped in front of the hotel we were treated like royalty. Every guest is greeted as a welcomed loved one returning "home" from a journey. The greetings, smiles, and genuine attention to every service need or request underscores the superelative service of this hotel. I work in the travel service industry and travel to NY often and have stayed in many lovely hotels in and around Manhattan. With all of the state of the art bedding that is touted by other hotel chains, Sofitel's is far and away the most comfortable. I have chronic lower back pain and can only sleep on any mattress 5 hrs at a time. Well, I slept a full 8 hours on their wonderful bed w/o any kinks, crimps, or negative physical impacts. I fully intend to try and buy one of these beds for myself. My finicky and highly pampered teen ADORED the hotel. The internet access, the friendliness of the staff, and the superb room service - the food is fabulous- had her raving from the moment we entered the room. The delectable Lenotre chocolates each guest receives each evening helped to seal the deal that this is now the ONLY place my daughter wants to stay when we visit NY. Daniel -the best doorman on the planet, Ronald- The most informative and debonaire reservationist ever, Nick -the spot on bellman, and the the classy and helptul Concierge all underscore the serious commitment that the Sofitel makes to serving their customers. The lovely location, critic's choice cuisine, blissful bedding, and stupendous staff all underscore the Sofitel's universal appeal. Make the Sofitel your home base in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “I Should Have Danced All Night - because I couldn't sleep!!”
Reviews.Author: bellskee
Reviews.Content: THE BED WAS AWFUL! I think we were sleeping on the box spring and an old one at that. It was so hard we called for extra duvets (feather filled, quite nice) hoping they would help soften the bed but it didn't work. The support of the mattress (box spring) was so broken down you rolled right off the side edges. I'm sure many of you know what I mean. The bathrooms were spectacular as was our view. Very nice lobby. But if you don't get any sleep the nice things are meaningless. For everyone else's sake, I hope we just got the BAD room in the hotel, Room 2008.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and very clean”
Reviews.Author: needaroom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sofitel for 5 nights end of March. It was our first time to New York and we picked this Hotel from the great reviews we read on Trip Advisor. We certainly were not disappointed. Had Deluxe room on 20th floor. Room was so quiet and beds were so comfy!!!! Room was very clean and spacious. Found staff at reception and conceirge pleasant and helpful. Had breakfast at Gabys one morning but it was expensive. Also had breakfast at Red Flame Diner a few doors down but didn,t think it was anything to write home about. Found a great cafe at 43rd and Madisson for breakfast called Central Cafe. It is not like ReD Flame , in that it is food to go although there are a few tables and chairs where you can sit and eat. Great selection of fruits, juices etc. Would recomend Sofital and would certainly stay there again. Close to fifth avenue, Times Square etc. Had considered staying at Times Square but were very glad we didn,t. Sofital offers peaceful haven only 5 minute wail from all the action.

Reviews.Title: “a flagship for Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: gettingaround
Reviews.Content: this is an excellent hotel by the standards of both Sofitel and midtown New York: clean and quiet. Quite varied clientele.

Reviews.Title: “One of The Best”
Reviews.Author: Kendo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights, on our 3rd trip to NY. This is by far the best NY hotel we have stayed in, and one of best hotels overall. Very comfortable rooms, spotless, all mod cons, lovely bathrooms and very attentive staff. Nice view of the Chrysle building and a "typical NY skyline". Great midtown location, minutes from 5th Ave & Times Sq (but far enough off the Sq to be not so tacky area!)Nice bar area and the breakfast was superb. Would definately reccomend this hotel and would defo stay here again

Reviews.Title: “A couple oddities, but overall great!”
Reviews.Author: damonandtina
Reviews.Content: Although the Sofitel near Times Square has a couple odd quirks that keep it from gaining a 5-star rating, my daughter and I thoroughly enjoyed it on a recent visit and would gladly stay there again. Among the MANY positives of this hotel: -Wonderfully comfortable beds -Plush bath robes and great, thick towels -Very quiet atmosphere -Complimentary computers in the lobby to check e-mail -WONDERFUL bathroom with separate tub and shower -Great amenties and complimentary Evian water -Great location about 4 blocks from Times Square and 5 blocks from Rockefeller Plaza -In-room safes that are easy to operate -Great air conditioners that truly cool the room (a rarity in NYC, where most don't cool properly) -Friendly staff and housekeeping With all these positives, you might think this the perfect NYC hotel, but then a few little missteps make you scratch your head and wonder what they were thinking: -NO COFFEE OR COFFEEMAKERS IN ROOMS!! An astoundingly strange oversight. -Evening turndown service, but no chocolates or mints on the beds. Picky, but for $350 a night,....? -Bathroom doors DO NOT have locks! This invites the uncomfortable possibilities of a couple "oops" moments on your vacation. -$350 a night seems about $50-$75 a night to steep for this quality of a hotel. -They took a $900 deposit on my credit card for incidentals, even though I had a PRE-PAID room!!!! Did they think I was going to eat the entire mini-bar,....twice?!?! This is a great hotel and worthy of staying at on your next trip. However, they've certainly left some t's not crossed and i's not dotted in their lack of attention to detail. With that said, however, very clean, very quiet and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience!”
Reviews.Author: rasowe
Reviews.Content: This is a fanastic hotel in a central location. So many New York hotels are overpriced with small rooms and unfriendly staff. This is not the case with the Sofitel. The rooms are spacious and clean with large comfortable beds and the staff are helpful and extremely personable. Although a bit more expensive than some hotels I would have no hesitation in recommending the Sofitel to anyone wishing to stay in New York. There is a diner a minute away called the Red Flame, (turn right out of the hotel), this is a fantastic place for a reasonably priced breakfast. Please try the Sofitel you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lee4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sofitel NYC for 3 nights and really enjoyed our stay. I must say that the bed is the most comfortable one I've ever slept in--I wanted to pack it up and take it home! The room itself was large (even by NYC standards) with a king bed, 2 chairs w/ ottoman, 2 nightstands, and a dresser/desk type table that held the TV and also had a mini-bar hidden inside. The bathroom was large with a shower and separate tub. The space around the sink was plentiful, with an extra shelf to store things on. The room also had a small closet, hair dryer, iron, ironing board, safe, robe, and slippers. The room was clean and we would happily stay there again. The hotel's location is excellent and it was easy to walk to many places in the mid-town area and to Times Square/Broadway. We saw Spamalot, which was on the same street, just 3 blocks or so away. Bryant Park is very close by and there are several subway stops nearby as well. Grand Central Station was also a quick walk away. Just a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Memorable”
Reviews.Author: Niklb
Reviews.Content: Fantastic, superb. I wont bother repeating all of the comments of others but, in brief, we stayed here on Honeymoon, had a free room upgrade (fantastic view), free champagne, and experienced superb staff service. If you are going to NYC on a short break, stay here. No arguments. PS I wouldnt go overboard on the Red Flame Diner though. If you fancy a walk, you must visit the Viand Coffee Shop at 673 Madison Avenue (between 61st St & 62nd St) for a true New York experience. And dont be afraid to use the subway, its cheap, easy to use and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: yaltachick
Reviews.Content: Room was lovely, had a view of the Empire State Building on the 20th floor. (Room number 2015). Chocolates every night and turn-down service was quite nice. Apparently there was an understaffing issue when it came to the room service staff, so I had quite a few delegates (we were there for a meeting) who hadn't had their linens changed, and weren't brought fresh towels. BIG mistake! Overall I'd say this hotel is lovely. If you're looking for a place that caters to a different kind of traveler (IE the CEO of your firm), this is the place. It's a bit pricey for tourists, but then again, what can you expect of a hotel two blocks away from Times Square?

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff....... Great City!!!”
Reviews.Author: Djsban
Reviews.Content: Booked a 6 night break at the Sofitel through their website after receiving my Sofitel privilege card, we chose this hotel mainly because of the great reviews on this site and we were not disappointed. Right from the start all of the staff were very friendly and could not do enough to help you, especially Randy the Doorman, who would go out of his way to help you whenever he could. The room we had was a premier queen and whilst it wasn’t the largest room in New York it was big enough, very well equipped and very well decorated. Also has a medium sized bathroom, which had a large shower, but a small and shallow bathtub. The hotel is ideally located for exploring the city whether you want shopping on 5th Avenue, Times Square or access to the subway system. I would highly recommend this hotel. If you are planning on staying here I suggest applying for a privilege card first as this gives you complimentary late check out and also 1 free drink per person from the bar.... Not to be sniffed at, at hotel bar prices!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: boboblonkey
Reviews.Content: Top notch. The girl who checked me in remembered my name days later. The room was super clean as was the bathroom. Being in Midtown it was a short walk to many, many things. The only thing it lacked was "Old NY charm," as it's a contemporary French style.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: floridagirl50
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 3 nights at the Sofitel New York. We loved it. The 44th Street location is wonderfull, walk one way to Times Square and the other to 5th Avenue. We had a king size bed on the 23rd floor. There was no street noise at all, a very quiet room. The view was not that exciting but we spent very little time in the room looking out. The bathroom, which is one of my pet peeves, was lovely. I liked the marble and the layout was spacious enough that both my husband and I could be in there at the same time when necessary. The closet was very small and we had a lot of stuff with us as we were attending a wedding in the city. Housekeeping arranged for us to have a mobile clothes rack to accomodate us and the room was plently big to have the rack in the room. The bed was very comfortable. The elevator was fast . I called housekeeping a number of times with special requests and all were handled quickly. We had a drink in the bar but didn't try the room service or the restaurant. Overall the Sofitel was excellent. We would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rugbybeer&women
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply superb! We emailed before hand to ask the hotel to book a SUV from Newark which although not the cheapest option was certainly hassle free. Upon arrival at the hotel check in was efficient and professional even though one of the rooms wasn’t ready. The rooms are stunning, small but adequate and one of the best bathrooms I have ever seen. As for cleanliness, second to none. Throughout our stay everyone was friendly without being pompous and couldn’t do enough for us. Use the services of the concierges and doormen as they know their stuff. Great location just a few minutes walk to Times Square. Use the Red Flame, be prepared to wait for a table but it is worth it! Only down side was the bar, average service, average value for money and a little aloof. But spend the little extra for a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Staff and service were Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: SarahDelaney
Reviews.Content: Wow! My husband and I after much consideration settled on the Sofitel NYC for our 1 year anniversary (March 10). We read through all the reviews of hundreds of hotels on this site and had a hard time choosing since it seems that no matter what hotel you choose someone has quams about it. I went to book the hotel online the night before we were scheduled to arrive and found that the prices had gone up so we called the hotel directly and they offered us a fantastic rate (no cancellation policy). We were trying to be economical so booked only a queen between the 3rd and 14th floor. We had taken the train into the city form a friends house in Nj and arrived earlier than check in which is at 3pm, the front desk staff checked us in 3 hours early without one word about check in being at 3. Also, the front desk staff ( who were very very lovely) upgraded us to a King on the 21st floor, not only did they upgrade us but we went out for dinner and came back to find a congratulatory note and a complimentary bottle of champagne and chocolates as an anniversary pressie. The room was extremely clean and the bed was soooooo comfy, I said to my husband that I think we might have had a brand new comfortor and new sheets because everything was so clean and pristene, it was like we were the first ones to ever sleep in the bed. The bathroom was equally pleasing with marbleverywhere and a seperate shower and tub. There were also fresh orchids in the bathroom which was was a very nice touch. Everytime we went in and out of the hotel the staff greeted us and were very friendly, the concierge was great and very helpful. Another plus we found was that the hotel stored our luggage for the whole day on our day of departure so we were able to walk around the city without be lagged down. Over we had an amazing anniversary and loved every aspect of this hotel and plan on returning next chance we get!

Reviews.Title: “Well up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: VP1
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to New York and I booked the hotel purely from the comments on this website - and the hotel more than lived up to our expectations. As mentioned in so many other reviews here, it is the staff who really make the hotel. When we checked in the Receptionist who served us was so friendly and helpful - it made such a pleasant change from hotels in the UK and Europe where staff really feel they are doing you a favour by letting you stay there. I got a Sofitel loyalty card before we arrived (again, as suggested by the reviewers on this website) so we got a free glass of champagne in the bar on our first night, which was a real treat. We didn't use the bar much after that as it was beyond our budget but would certainly have done so had we been a little wealthier!! The room was lovely and the bathroom superb. The area is fantastic - everything is very accessible from there and lots of nice restaurants and bars nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jamie&Hannah
Reviews.Content: My finacee and I stayed in the hotel for 4 nights in mid February. The staff at the hotel were incredibly friendly, especially the concierge, Daniel, who recommended and booked some fantastic restaurants for us at very short notice. If you want the best steak you've ever had, then go to Morton's on 5th, but for breakfast, then the Red Flame diner has to be done (it's right next to the hotel). For burgers, go to Connelly's and don't forget to go to the Stage deli on Broadway for the biggest sandwiches! Anyway, the hotel room was cleaned daily with fresh towels and has massive floor to ceiling windows with great views of the city. The beds really are a comfy as the reviews say - getting up in the morning was quite difficult! The bathroom is modern, with a walk in shower and separate bath. There is a free Internet connection within the reception area, which is very useful. The doormen are happy to answer any questions you might have about where to go, and they'll get you a cab while you relax in the foyer. The hotels location couldn't be better for both shopping and sightseeing - most sights are within walking distance. Overall, it was a fantastic break - we can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Will definately return”
Reviews.Author: IvanL
Reviews.Content: Following the great reviews this hotel received from Tripadvisor, I decided to try it myself and stayed there from March 10th to March 17th. From the minute we entered the hotel, we knew it was going to be good. The lobby is warm and welcoming and the staff at the door are extremely friendly. Randy, the doorman, is a true gentleman and was extremely helpful the whole week we were there. We booked a suite and we were not disappointed. It was on the 27th floor and had good views. The bedroom was very nicely decorated and the lounge was also of a very good size with a TV, minibar and writing desk. The bathroom was also of a good standard with a deep bath and a seperate shower. Following a previous stay in New York at another hotel, this was a real factor in our choosing of a hotel. From the bar, to the lobby, the rooms and the staff, this place should not dissapoint. They have thought of every detail, including chocolates when they turn down the bed to a weather forecast placed on the bedside locker every night. The bar serves a wide range of beers and always provides olives and cheese bites with your drinks. The location is just off fifth avenue and minutes from SAKS and Times Square is only two blocks away. We could see the lights from our bedroom window. To conclude, this place definately deserves its high ratings on trip advisor. It is a bit costly at $3700 for a week but if you are looking for something a bit special, then it is worth it. Also, use the concierge service for restaurant reservations. I did a few times and they got it right every time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for New York, Great Rooms & Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Swanky01
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Sofitel twice in the last 2 years and am going again this May. It's a great hotel, central, quiet, lovely rooms and really nice big bathrooms. I would recommend it to anyone. It may be a little pricey but you get what you pay for. The Red Flame Diner is the best place for breakfast that we have come across. Even dinner was nice there. Big portions so take your appetite with you.

Reviews.Title: “More than expected”
Reviews.Author: provenceman
Reviews.Content: Pour un premier séjour à NYC, le Sofitel est parfaitement situé, tres tres bonne localisation. Le seul soucis etait le tarif en vigueur mais en plein Fashion Week, je me suis estimé heureux de pouvoir booker non pas une chambre (No Vacancy) mais une suite : Atmosphere Art Déco, moelleux du lit extraordinaire, Staff tres serviable et efficace, surtout la reception. Au fait pour information à transmettre au Concierge, Tie & Jacket au 21 Club sont obligatoires ! Une tres bonne adresse (les deux ;-) ) à recommander sans hesitation. Enjoy your Stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FJNM
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to NYC and I booked this hotel due its location...and for this reason I wasn't disappointed. It's in fab location, between 5th and 6th and ideal for a first time visitor to the big apple. The room was nothing special, clean etc. but somewhat characterless. The bar was really cool but the fresh flowers throughout the lobby/reception area were truly amazing...especially the peony roses, Wow! I got a good deal on the hotel website so I was happy that I got value for money as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Delite7
Reviews.Content: We have been to NY several times, but this was our first time at the Sofitel. It certainly won't be the last! We flew in to see a few plays and for that, the location is excellent-- about a 10 minute walk to Broadway. The staff were very pleasant and accomodating. We had a room on the 18th floor with a great view. The room was good sized, with a comfy bed. The bathroom was also nice, with a big shower, separate tub, marble floor, etc. I honestly have no complaints about this hotel at all. We also enjoyed the restaurant, Gaby, for their delicious breakfasts and nice atmosphere for after dinner drinks. The wait staff are very friendly-- one waiter even gave us a couple of drinks on the house! If you want to save $$ on breakfast, The Red Flame is just down the street where you can get good food at a good price. All in all, our stay here was excellent and we'll stay here again on our next trip to NY!!
