Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Staff Ever”
Reviews.Author: gardenercc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel for 2 nights, upon arrival, we were instantly greeted by the bellman, directed to check in and able to check in at 8 in the morning. the staff is the friendliest staff I have come across, not only in New York, but anywhere!!! The room was very nice, large bathroom, clean tub, shower, magnifying mirror, tv speaker and phone in bathroom, marble. the room was very comfortable, ironing board and iron, safe, mini bar, etc. Quick elevators, nice comfortable lobby with internet access. We had absolutely no problems. We were even able to extend our check out time!! The Sofitel is in a great location on 44th St. 2 blocks from the hubbub of Times Square, but the street is very quiet. The thing I was most impressed with was the feeling you received from the front desk staff, they seemed genuinely happy you were there and genuinely happy to be working. What a nice suprise!!!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best!!”
Reviews.Author: GewJayne
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel to celebrate my wife's 40th birthday, based solely on the trip advisor reviews and was not disappointed. We stayed for four nights. (2nd-6th March 2007) Staff were extremely friendly and helpful; we had a King Size suite on the 29th floor with a terrific view of the Chrysler Building. The room was clean, spacious and the bed was the most comfortable ever! Bathroom was lovely with a deep bath plus shower and daily change of towels. I had told the hotel prior to arrival that it was my wife's birthday and as a result, a complementary bottle of 'sparkly' was sent to our room together with a letter from the manager. Nice touch I thought! I had arranged for a Sofitel Privilege Card to be sent to me prior to departure which entitled us to a 4pm check out and a free drink at the bar. (Costs nothing to apply on line) Gaby's Restaurant was 'nice' but expensive. We had one breakfast there which was fine but then tried the Red Flame Diner (which is about a thirty second walk from hotel towards Times Square) and the breakfast was more than adequate with excellent coffee. Good value too. All in all I would say that it was the best stay I've had in any hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a welcome!”
Reviews.Author: BrettLondonUK
Reviews.Content: Returned from a long weekend in NY to celebrate our silver wedding . After reading several reviews we plumbed for the Sofitel . Excellent choice , the staff were very welcoming we were given a top floor room looking towards the Chrysler building . The beds really are so comfortable .The hotel also sent up a bottle of champagne and a letter of congratulations . We followed other review advice and applied for a sofitel privilege card on line prior to our trip ( allow a good 4 weeks for delivery ) its free and gives two complimentary drinks at the bar . You are also able to take advantage of their late checkout 16.00 as opposed to 12.00 . great when you have an evening flight like us as you get an extra day. The Red Flame Diner is 4 doors down and serves up an adequate breakfast for a fraction of the hotel prices. You are a five minute walk from times square or grand central station and have no shortage of restaurants for dinner. Use the Macy's 11% discount card when shopping there you get it from thier vistor center in the store and look for their sales as the 11% is added on. Did I mention the beds , they really are comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value $269 Weekend Internet Rate”
Reviews.Author: STC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel Saturday and Sunday, March 3rd and 4th. I checked on-line at the Sofitel website and booked us an “Internet Special” rate of $269/night. Rates at many other 4-star + hotels were $400 - $600, so things were looking pretty good. The purpose of the trip was to spend some quality time together and have some fun, so I didn’t want to start our weekend with a dirty, stinky cab ride to the hotel. I “googled” airport transfer services and settled on Jet Black Limousine Service, based on the quality of their website, www.jetblackonline.net , their pricing and their fleet of Mercedes and BMW’s. Tony met us in baggage claim and drove us from LGA to the Sofitel in a beautiful sparkling Mercedes S Class, black & black car. Bottled water or other beverages are also included and pre-requested on the website. Pricing was $65, plus a bunch of NYC fees/taxes and a 20% driver gratuity, ending up at $98.96 total. A taxi is approximately $35, so the Mercedes transfer was a special treat. Now, about the Sofitel: 1. We received a complimentary upgrade from our Internet special $269 rate for a queen bed room to a king bed room, upper floor, #2203. 2. Next to us, rooms 2201 & 2202 are at the end of the hallway, with a door that closes off the end of the hallway. So by closing the hallway door; you would have a small private locking foyer between the two adjoining, across the hall rooms. This would be perfect for a family who didn’t need connecting rooms, but adjoining rooms (across the hall) with a private foyer. So, if that’s the case for you, with older teenagers, or elderly parents, inquire about rooms ending in 01 and 02. 3. The guest room was beautiful, as mentioned by many previous reviews. The only amenity that I would like to see in the future would be a plasma/LCD with high-definition signal feed. 4. We enjoyed two breakfasts at Gaby’s, the hotel’s only restaurant & bar. The food and service was excellent. Continental breakfast was $18, and the full American breakfast was $21. Classic Eggs Benedict was also $21. Juice and coffee are included in that price, and the coffee is served tableside in a “French Press”, and was very robust, which we, and I’m sure the French guests, appreciate. 5. The Lobby isn’t large, but sufficient, with about 5 or 6 gathering areas for small groups to congregate before heading out. There is also a small room off the lobby with a couple of computers for you to check your emails or flight status. 6. From the hotel, it’s just a couple of blocks to Times Square, the Broadway theatres and Fifth Avenue shopping. It’s a $10 cab ride to the Metropolitan Museum of Art. 7. We had dinner at the Russian Tea Room and Trattoria Depo Teatra, and I posted reviews for those two restaurants. For the price, $269/night, for a weekend stay, The Sofitel is an excellent choice for a New York City weekend getaway. I hope that this review and the pictures have been helpful.

Reviews.Title: “5* reviews here are no exaggeration”
Reviews.Author: SteveLondon1960
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose the Sofitel as the hotel for our first visit to New York on the basis of the reports here on TripAdvisor, and we were not disappointed. The hotel is quite simply superb. We booked a superior with a Queen sized bed on the 23rd floor overlooking the Chrysler Building and the room was incredibly comfortable. Everything you’ve read about the beds here is true. I reckon this was the most comfortable bed I’ve slept in anywhere in the world, and I’m pretty well travelled! The bathroom was elegant, and spacious, although the bath itself was too small, but the shower cubicle was more than fine. Being so high up there was zero noise from the street. It was our wedding anniversary and we had champagne on ice delivered to our room gratis, not one evening but twice! Evening room service included two small bottles of Evian and a small box of chocolates. Room service was excellent but expensive, as was the bar and restaurant downstairs. As everyone on here has mentioned, the Red Flame diner a few feet down on the left is an absolute gem. A real taste of New York, with lightning fast service, huge menu, open 6am til midnight, and cheap as chips. The Sofitel position is perfect, five minutes from Times Square, Grand Central Station, etc. Chat up the concierges and doormen as they are a mine of information. Also, free internet and printer in the lobby. Basically, you can’t go wrong here, I’ll certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: bradgirl
Reviews.Content: Booked the Sofitel as part of a package on Expedia, so can't comment too much on the price, apart from to say that it seemed very reasonable. Overall this hotel was the best my partner and I have ever stayed in. It was fantastic - felt very posh, but didn't make you feel inferior when you were wearing your trainers and ear muffs on your way out! The location is awesome, a 5 minute (maybe less) walk to Times Square and lots of other New York attractions. Getting a taxi was so easy, especially because of the great guys outside the hotel who would go into the street to stop you getting snowed on or blown over in the wind. Didn't try the food in the hotel, because there's a lovely diner just down the street which serves brilliant breakfasts, and who wants to eat in a hotel at night, when you can hit the New York streets! The room was lovely, very clean and very spacious. The bed was the most comfortable bed ever, we called it our marshmallow because it was so warm and squishy. Housekeeping came in twice a day to sort the covers out, "turndown service" I think its called, she also brought Evian water which was a nice touch. Bathroom was perfect, bath and seperate double shower with pedestal sink and mirror with lights around (felt like a movie star!). Very quiet at night, had no trouble going to sleep, even though the street was a busy one. And no noise from other guests coming back to their rooms either. All in all, the hotel was fantastic, and if you can get a good deal, I would recommend it to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “OK not brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Mondler11
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the reviews on tripadvisor as everyone seems to think it is the best hotel in NY. Don't get me wrong it wasn't bad but it wasn't anything special. We arrived to a friendly bellman and concierge who took our suitcases promptly. we checked in and were given a room on the 15th floor. I paid for a room between floor 15-30, queen bed and city view - i got the first two but not the last. The room was small and overlooked some sort of enormous air vent. The room itself was nice enough - lots of nice goodies in the bathroom with a big marble bath and an excellent shower. The bed was very comfortable and we were only there for one night so did not see the need to ask to be moved. There is free internet downstairs which was useful for checking in to our flight the day before we left. The location is good if you're a first time New Yorker (we were not!) it is a couple of blocks from Times Square, Empire State, Grand Central etc. However, as we know NY very well now we know better places to stay and at an affordable rate. There are no little extras here and it feels like a big chain hotel with no character or anything to remember it by. Overall it was an average hotel however, as a whole although the room was very comfortable and it is in a good location for those visiting for the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings, My expectations where too high.”
Reviews.Author: mrolfes
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at other Sofitels before, and the Chicago Sofitel many times. My expectations were very high because T.A. ranked the New York Sofitel best luxury hotel in America and #12 in the world, which it definetly is not. I think that is why I was disappointed. The New York Sofitel was nice, but not as nice as other Sofitels. No comparison to the Chicago Sofitel. We booked through expedia and did get a very good rate, so maybe they gave us one of their worst rooms. Our very old T.V didn't work very well, but they came up quickly to try and fix it. They offered to move us to another room, but the TV wasn't that important to us. We were told they will be updating the rooms soon, which needs to be done. On the plus side, I would stay at the NY Sofitel again and recommend it, but only if the price was right. The beds were very comfortable just like all Sofitel beds. Very clean rooms. The service was very good and quick. The staff was above average for Sofitel. This is just by comparison. In my experience some of the Sofitels front desk staff, (usually the staff from France) can be abrupt, but that is part of the French feel right. Well not in New York. Everyone was very nice, friendly and helpful. Another big plus was having The Red Flame restaurant so close. We were able to get coffee and breakfast to go to bring back to the hotel for the slowpokes. Saved us lots of time and $$$.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a bed.”
Reviews.Author: Jooles,uk
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I booked the Sofitel for our anniversary of meeting. We signed up for the hotels privlege card prior to booking which was free and enabled us to get a great deal on a suite and also late check out. All the staff were very friendly especially the turn down service, a chinese lady who was always happy and full of beans! The bed was the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in!!!!! It was -15 when we were in New York so we didn't venture out to much in the evening so room service was order of the day, it was excellent! lots of choice, always prompt and very tasty. I think the only thing I would complain about would be there were no tea & coffee facilities in the room which meant ringing room service every morning and at $18 for a pot of tea and coffee was an unexpected expense. If you're anything like me I need a coffee to go downstairs to get a coffee!! Apart from that a great place to stay. The Red Flame dinner four doors down from the hotel is also better value than the hotel breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Five very cold nights in NYC, Feb 07.”
Reviews.Author: gjamesrock
Reviews.Content: Five very cold nights in NYC, Feb 07. The Sofitel was everything we wanted and delivered everything it said it would. The room was very big and all modern, clean and in good condition. The bathroom was great and again modern and clean. The beds have been well documented by other reveiwers and I agree with them, great sleep. The location, it's right there in the middle of everything but down a street that is quiet. There is a breakfast place on the same block that is very NYC and a fraction of the hotel breakfast cost. Concierge were great, they booked a few restaurants for us and didnt have be asked twice for anything. The other staff were all very friendly. The bar was very smart and the staff on the ball, we didn't eat at the restaurant. I will be staying again Gareth, Kent. UK

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: gingersmommy
Reviews.Content: Following the tripadvisor band wagon, we decided to give the Sofitel a try. We booked an Executive suite on the 24th floor. It had a HUGE outdoor terrace with some patio furniture. (Yes, there was snow and it served as an excellent refrigerator!) The room was big,beautiful and the bed was divine! The bathroom and shower were quite nice, complete with first rate toietries. Only downfall was the smallish closets. The service was friendly and great. Most of the concierge team seemed a little too serious but were helpful. (Erick was great and nice) We never ate at the hotel, however, we did go visit the Red Flame diner and thought it was good for the price. We did stumble upon a Scottish restaurant named St. Andrews right down the street. What a find! Some of the best food we ever had. (and we dine pretty frequently!) By all means, try this place out. (no, I don't own, or work at the restaurant!) Overall, I think what we appreciated the most was the beautiful rooms and the subtleness of the hotel and it's elegance.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ahcLondon
Reviews.Content: Great location and lovely rooms. A wonderful three night stay with my Husband and Daughter. I e-mailed requesting a quiet room and we were allocated a wonderfully spacious room on the 25th floor with an amazing view of the Chrysler! Concierge were also fantastic recommending and booking some excellent restaurants. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Five Stars for the Four Star”
Reviews.Author: mhbtr
Reviews.Content: My husband & I recently stayed at the Sofitel NY based upon the reviews from tripadvisor. Needless to say, we were not disappointed. I must preface these comments by stating that I am a hotel snob, & mind you, the Sofitel is not a five-star hotel, but it does not claim to be. (Although some of the service we received was better than some we have experienced at certain 5-stars.) Location: The Sofitel is situated 44th & 5th, making it just about the perfect location for walking to just about anything (Times Square, Broadway, 5th Avenue, Empire State Building, Rockefeller, MOMA, etc.). Though it is a fair (but entirely manageable) walking distance to Central Park. Service: The service we received was prompt & unobtrusive. Our rooms were cleaned meticulously morning & evening; I requested once for extra towels & note was made for the remainder of our stay (unlike some other five star we've stayed). (We also appreciated the bottles of Evian & box of chocolates each evening.) The concierge was helpful at recommending restaurants & obtaining reservations. Ammenities: The fitness center was sufficiently equipped with treadmills, weights, etc. Our room was a suite on the top floor with a view of the Empire State Building from the bedroom & Rockefeller Center from the sitting room. The rooms themselves are not especially large, but more than sufficient (though more storage space would have been nice). The beds were quite comfortable. The bathroom was spacious enough (not huge) & extremely well lit. The least appealing aspect of the hotel is Gaby's where we found the food to be mediocre at best. Not bad, but not worth eating there twice. Would I recommend Sofitel to friends? ABSOLUTELY. For the great rates you can get on the rooms, I don't think you could do any better.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: Highlandscots
Reviews.Content: After doing much research on Trip Advisor we decided to follow everybody else and book directly and managed to get the hotel within our budget. The hotel is just perfect - we arrived and were told we had been given a upgrade on our room to a higher floor which we were delighted about. The room itself was lovely and the bathroom was to die for! The bed, as everybody else has said, was fantastic - just wish we could have fitted it in the suitcase! The hotel's location is also excellent - when you come out of the door you turn right and you are a 5 minutes walk from Times Square, on the way passing The Red Flame which is also as good as all the other reviews say, and by turning left at the hotel and after 5 minutes you are at Grand Central Station. We would recommend the Circle Line boat trip, and Empire State Building as good points to view New York. As far as steaks go, we met up with a family member who works in Manhattan and he treated us to a meal at the Capital Grille. We had the most amazing food at this restaurant starting off with French Onion Soup which was layered with Gruyere cheese. The steaks are just to die for, washed down with excellent wine and just for more badness we finished off with cheesecake .... you have to be bad sometimes! We did use a cab twice but this was only on our first evening - after finding our bearings we walked everywhere apart from going to ground zero when we took the subway. Our top tip if you are going to Macys - go to the visitor centre and collect your 11% discount card. The prices are cheap compared to what we pay at home anyway, but this makes it evey better. We absolutely loved the Sofitel and would not hesitate to go back there, or to recommend it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Leyton
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Sofitel over the New Year. The hotel is great. We chose it because it was rated number one on tripadvisor and it didn't disappoint. The room was extremely clean, a good size and the bed is like sleeping on a cloud. As others have mentioned, if you are in New York for a special occasion let the front desk know in advance. We were there for my girlfriend's birthday and after mentioning this we were given a room on a higher floor and champagne (sparkling wine). The hotel is in a great location and is within walking distance of most of the big tourist sites (Times Square, Fifth Avenue, Empire State Building etc.) My top tip - register for the Sofitel privelege card. It's free and you gets you guaranteed late check in, free drinks on arrival and late check out (4pm) which was great as we had a night flight back to the UK. Next time I'm in New York I know where I'll be staying...

Reviews.Title: “Its all true... the negative comments are fools!”
Reviews.Author: AlysonP
Reviews.Content: Every word of the positive reviews on Tripadvisor are true, we picked this hotel, after lots of homework, for our 5 day honeymoon over Valentines weekend. We took the advice and joined the hotels priviledge club and was upgraded to a higher floor room with a king bed and a view of the Chrysler Building. We got 2 free drinks at the bar (champagne) chocolates and a bedding turn down every night not to mention the free bottle of champagne sent up to help us get our honeymoon off to an amazing start! EVERY member of staff work terrifically hard to give you a great feeling about this hotel and it became 'home' for us on our trip. In New York the people are not always too friendly so it was refreshing to get back to the luxury and oasis of service that is the Sofitel Instead of boring you by repeating what has already been said about this amazing hotel. I will give you our tips for a great trip to NY, and also things to avoid We didnt try the breakfast at the hotel and followed others advice and went to the red flame diner a couple of doors down from the hotel. A bit rough and ready, but good food and service make it all good and great value. If you want to really splash out and have a world class breakfast, take a cab to Le Parker Meridian up near Central Park, and BOOK into Norma's inside Le Meridian, all they do is breakfast and boy do they do it well, outstanding and a bit pricy but you will NEVER have a better breakfast, make sure you book, while we were there people were being quoted 1.5 hours for a table and still staying!! At the same venue is a Burger Joint that you wouldnt find in a month of Sundays, tiny place hidden behind a curtain at Le Meridian, signed only by a small neon burger sign, keep an eye out for it, its easy to miss! World Class burgers and fries, and thats all they do but wow its done well. Avoid Rainbow Room Grill like the plague, it was a fab view no doubt there but the food was appalling and they 'recommend' a 20% tip on a $300 bill, and that was with no dessert or coffee, massive rip off and not to be repeated. Book in at Metrazur in Grand Central Terminal - sounds mad to eat in a station, but what a station, the ambiance is amazing and ask when you book for a balcony table, you wont speak much but you will marvel at the view! After Metrazur cross the main floor up the stairs, come out of the main doors and turn left and head into Campbells Apartment, a hidden gem of a cocktail bar, small and atmospheric...the mojitos and prohibition punch were the best we have ever tasted! Gotham Bar and Grill was divine, words cant measure it, service and food to die for, every bit was amazing. Go to Woodbury Outlet about an hour out of the city for discount designer shopping heaven!! We went by bus so got to asee a bit of the countryside Forget about Empire State building, the place is a dump, queues were 3.5 hours and once I got up there I couldnt wait to come down as I was so naffed off from queuing and pushing, it was rubbish...head for Top of the Rock at the Rockerfeller centre, no queue, up and down in 30 mins, and much nicer, glass panels so you can see more, a bit smaller than Empire State but the same experience, but no queuing and messing about. TRUST ME ON THIS ONE All our meals were reseached on Zagat...highly recommended .. and booked through OpenTable.. again really recommended. Thats it, amazing trip, if you go to any of these places you WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED

Reviews.Title: “A few concerns”
Reviews.Author: ninewinx
Reviews.Content: I haven't read all the reviews but I have found this website to be on target most of the time. We liked the Sofitel and it was a good value with a few caveats... 1. The security is very lax. There are two entrances- one through the front lobby and another from the restaurant. There is open access to all floors with no limitation provided by insertion of the hotel keycard. Anyone could be followed to their room. 2. The bed is comfortable but there was no sheet - just a duvet cover. 3. The heating system hums. 4. I was told the windows were triple paned and that the rooms were quiet. Unfortunately, we heard the garbage pick-up at 4 am every night- even on the 11th floor. 5. Breakfast was $30 per person in the restaurant. Go out the restaurant door & across the street for your Starbucks and into the little grocery store for a very complete and inexpensive alternative. 6. There are other boutique hotels with better locations for the theater district.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Aims to Please”
Reviews.Author: atateka
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our fifth stay at Sofitel. It's tempting to explore other properties, but it's a gamble as well. At Sofitel we know we will be greeted warmly, the concierges and doormen will be tremendously helpful, the elevators fast, and the room clean and quiet. We love the excitment of the city, but really appreciate the calm and quiet of this hotel. We went to the Marriot Marquis to enjoy a drink from the 48th floor. While that was nice, we could not imagine staying at that hotel. It was loud, crowded, huge, and too busy for our tastes. Many reviewers mention the Red Flame, and that is a good choice. We also like Cafe Manhattan which is on 45th. If you exit the hotel from Gaby's restaurant you will see it's red awning across the street. They have a nice selection of fresh fruits, vegetables, breakfast and lunch choices. While there is no wait staff, there are tables for patrons. It's clean, bright, and quiet by NYC standards. I find it remarkable that many of the same staff remain at Sofitel year after year. The staff is knowledgeable, warm and friendly. Guests are often greeted by name and always politely. I would encourage anyone to stay here. Sofitel has excellent standards of customer service and hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Shower, Best Concierges!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_Dublin
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the Sofitel from the 14th-18th of February, we selected this hotel based on recommendations from this site and we were not disappointed. The positive things: The hotel is on 44th Street between 5th and 6th Street, a fantastic location, everything is within walking distance such as Times Square, the Rockerfeller Centre, Madison Ave, 5th Ave… just to name a few places. I would like to pay special homage to the concierges, particularly Erick & Vladimir. There helpfulness and knowledge is next to none and I would like to remind people to tip these guys!! The negative things: The weather was extremely cold at this time of the year and at some points unbearable with temperatures way below freezing and it was hard to get the room warm. The bathroom, although it was generous in size, the shower took some maneuvering. The door opens into shower and doesn’t fold, so if you are in any way slightly above average you may get stuck!! I am not saying that I did, but had I have eaten anymore glazed donuts in the Red Flame Diner I may have had a little trouble. (The diner is on 44th Street, take a right when you come out of hotel, the menu is huge and service is fast and efficient). We had a fantastic time and New York is an amazing city, but it is certainly an expensive and hectic holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Tripper43
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on this site, I was determined to stay at this hotel for a two-night break. I called Sofitel and tried to book, we were told there was no availability so we went through Amex and got the room. Paid $500 per night so fairly hefty in my view, although I'm sure not off the scale for NYC. It;s certainly a great hotel, but I was a little underwhelmed given the hype of some reviews - there's nothing wrong, but there's no wow factor either. A good business hotel. Positives location is great staff largely friendly room was big enough spotless quiet the beds are heavenly nice welcome choccies Negatives Public areas dark and lack ambience I found the concierges a little precious, particularly Rene Limited snacks on room service Short bath! (and I'm only 5'8") none of the taxi drivers knew it, but then I started to realise that you could ask for Carnegie hall and most NY cabbies would insist on a full address So altogether - very good standard business hotel but pricey

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel ,great location”
Reviews.Author: mspiddles
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is really a great place to stay. It was very clean . It is located close to the shopping .The room service was excellent and the staff are ver;y helpful. I used the gym and it was unbelievable. New updated equipment. Over all, I had a great trip. The pillows on the bed are down, And the hotel brought me extra pillows and a humidifer. I was very comfortable. The hotel is a little stuffy . Not young atmosphere in the lobby and the dinner in the resturant was very rich, But yet an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel shower ever”
Reviews.Author: jockbrown
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews, and its location; we were not disappointed. French-owned, it has a European luxury flair. Our suite was perfect for us, and at $400 per day, through the hotle wesite, not bad for MidTown Manhattan for 650 sq ft.. The bathroom was smaller than soome I've stayed in, but it was great. The shower was the best I have ever experienced in a hotel, and I am very particular. (In fact I occasionally travel with my own showerhead and a pair of pliers when staying at cheap acommodations. Crazy, aren't I?) Great pressure and great heat. My wife used the short but deep tub and said it was the best bath she ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Absoutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: mharv
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from 31st Jan til 5th Feb. I am a very fussy person and even I cannot think of one negative thing about this hotel, it was very clean, modern, and has everything you need in the room, an iron, ironing board, mini fridge, fresh flowers, mirrored wardrobes etc. The staff were very helpful also On arrival we asked for a room on a high floor and we got a room on the 21st floor which was great, we had great views of the sky scrapers out the back of the hotel The hotel is in an excellent location, we walked to Grand Central Station, Empire State, Rockerfeller Centre and Times Square was only a couple of blocks away We didn't eat in the hotel but chose to eat at different restaurants each night, I can recommend the Hard Rock cafe and 7Square restaurant although this was a little pricey at $110 for 2 people main course only but it was worth it, it was very nice. Do NOT go to Planet Hollywood, it was dirty, tacky and I didn't eat any of my food it was disgusting I recommed a boat tour around Manhattan, this costs about $20 for 2 hours and you get a live guide of what you are looking at and you can take great photo's of the Manhattan skyline and Statue of Liberty etc, so there is no need to go to Staten Island I would not go again at this time of year though, it was way too cold, I think it was around minus 10 with windchill !!!

Reviews.Title: “Tasteful”
Reviews.Author: JLTP
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a lovely stay at the Sofitel. While there are certainly glitzier, more opulent hotels in midtown Manhattan, the Sofitel did all the little things right. They have friendly, attentive desk staff; a quiet lobby; valet parking (not very common in NYC); and clean, reasonably spacious rooms done in tasteful decor. Plus the location is great--right near Times Square and the theatre district. While not inexpensive, it was a relatively good value. All in all, this is a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good - excellent service & location”
Reviews.Author: TKJA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel from Feb 1 to Feb 5 2007 and have previously stayed at several other similarly rated hotels in Manhattan. My overall impression is favourable but, given the stunning reviews this hotel receives on Trip Advisor, I have to admit that I was a little disappointed overall. Positives: Location very good - quiet and less than 5 mins walk from Times Square. Staff are friendly and helpful. Rooms are sizeable and clean (booked Queen 350 sqft). Bathrooms are clean, spacious and well appointed. Slight negatives: My room a little tired - Decor a bit 80s and old (not particularly well functioning) CRT TVs and hairdryer. Hotel bar and restaurant are lacking in atmosphere. Overall, if you get a good rate (at or below the average advertised hotel rate on Trip Advisor) then I would recommend the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and romantic!”
Reviews.Author: swmarrs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend in January, and we really enjoyed the central location to 5th Avenue, the theater district, and all the subway lines. The hotel was busy - but so quiet that we overslept both mornings. I very much preferred this experience to the ones I've had at the Algonquin and the Royalton (both on the same block). The bathroom was gorgeous and the mattress wonderful. I also appreciated the mirrored closets and abundant storage. The staff were extremely courteous and friendly even though we were bundled up like snowmen.

Reviews.Title: “Your best bet in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: lgcoto
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat this price, the location and the room in NYC. We have stayed at the very best in New York and this is just a great hotel.As is their hotel in Chicago, which I find amazing for chain hotels. The rooms are not large, but most NYC hotel rooms aren't. Very comfortable beds, bathroom was very nice and actually large in comparison to the room. The bar downstairs was quite nice, the front desk was quick and effcient and room service was a no problem. I will stay there again and again.There is a reason why this is #1 in New York. You cannot beat the price and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “As good as the reviews say”
Reviews.Author: RB-Sydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week at the end of January, booking on the strength of Tripadvisor reviewers. We weren't disappointed. The hotel is fabulous. The staff, from concierge to front desk, table staff to housekeeping, were all friendly and helpful. The rooms are generous in size, neatly decorated, with good bathrooms. Computer access is provided in the foyer. The location is perfect, with a subway stop 8 minutes walk away, and so central that taxi rides are quick and reasonable. On arrival, free sparkling water and truffles were left in our room. The breakfast at the hotel restaurant is excellent, with bottomless cups of coffee and juice, complimentary newspapers, and large portions - for $20 you have a hearty start to the day - contrary to other reviewers, I would not recommend the "Flame" diner - this is truly second rate. On 45th St, bw 5th and Madison, there's "Dishes" where a tolerable espresso can be had, along with quick, healthy and tasty lunches, plus Valrhona chocolate donuts! The concierges are all knowledgable, and will happily use their connections to snare a table at one of their recommended eateries - for instance, Osteria Al Doge, down the road, a bustling Italian restaurant, with great food. If you want any criticisms, I suppose the bathtub could have been deeper, and the air conditioning system was somewhat noisy (it can be turned off, with little or no effect on the room temperature); the wifi room internet costs $10 per day. The hotel runs some special rates, so it's possible to get a room for around $250/night plus taxes. We had a fantastic time - a great city and a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: fmcd
Reviews.Content: Booked the Sofitel from 1/27 - 1/31 after recommendations from this site and also friends planning to go. What a great hotel! We got superb treatment at the check-in and felt special. We got a complementary room upgrade and when we mentioned it was our 25th wedding anniversary, a bottle of champagne on ice was delivered that night. The room and bathroom were spacious and very well appointed. Also little things like the turn-down service at night was a nice touch. The view from the room was of the Rockefeller center which was lovely at night. The concierge was also very efficient and we booked a limousine for the trip back to JFK to finish off a really lovely stay. The price from the hotel web site was excellent value for money for a nyc hotel. If you're thinking of staying at the Sofitel, please go ahead and book it. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Hotel - 5 Stars”
Reviews.Author: gerardkelly
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited the Sofitel in NY for four nights in Jan '07. We booked this hotel based on the reviews on Tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. This is a magnificent hotel. When you walk through the front doors you are immediately taken aback by the beautiful and spacious lobby. The staff at the front desk were very friendly and efficient. Our room was on the 18th floor and was superb. It is definitely worth paying a little extra for a deluxe room. The room was very tastefully decorated and very comfortable. The marble bathroom was spacious with an excellent large walk in shower. The bed was comfortable and warm (for the NY January weather). The concierge was very helpful with directions and restaurant recommendations etc. The doormen were very attentive and helpful. Overall the staff were extremely friendly and always on hand to help. Not only is this an excellent hotel but it's location is superb. The hotel is on 44th street between 5th and 6th avenue. It is about a 2 min walk to 5th avenue shops. The hotel is an excellent base from which to get around. Madison Square Garden, Broadway, Empire State Building and Port Authority Bus Station are all within walking distance. Rather than have breakfast at the hotel, we had breakfast at the Red Flame Diner on 44th. (Just take a right on leaving the hotel, the diner is on your right). It can be very busy but the service is great and the breakfast menu is vast. Overall this is a true gem of hotel and deserves to be the No.1 New York hotel on Tripadvisor. We would both recommend this hotel to anyone planning a break in the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: pemtca
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the strength of it's TripAdvisor ranking and I wasn't disappointed. It's so central, staff are amazing and the room was fabulous. This was the most comfortable bed I've ever slept on. Bathroom wasn't huge, but was more than adequate, and the room was big by Manhattan standards. No problem getting a late checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: PeterMunro
Reviews.Content: We were impressed by the cleanliness, the comfort and most of all by the friendliness of the staff. We enjoyed a delicious breakfast every day which was well served by the friendly waiters. The room was spacious and the bed extremely comfortable. Our 14th floor room was quiet and not affected by the traffic noise The hotel is centrally situated near to Times Square and is within easy walking distance of two subway stations which give quick access to the main New York attractions. It is 5 minutes walk to the theatre district and we took advantage of the close proximity by seeing three shows in our 5 night stay. We would certainly select the Sofitel again next time we are in New York

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: thesnops
Reviews.Content: Great location for exploring. Really helpful Concierge - had some great advice on restaurants for dinner. Didnt eat breakfast at the hotel as we chose to each at the Red Flame diner just down from the hotel which was fine. Lunch & dinner in the hotel was great - service without fault. Great bar area. Room was a little on the small size but that's the only complaint - bathrooms large and immaculate. Staff were fantastic and couldnt do enough for you - our bags were lost by the airline and checking in at the hotel the member of staff said she would send up toothbrushes and paste straight away - during the rest of our stay the staff were equally helpful. It's the little things that matter. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A New Year to remember! So loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: harleigh
Reviews.Content: We arrived in New York the day before New Years Eve, jumped in a yellow cab and we were off for a weeks stay in the big apple! We arrived to be met by a very friendly porter waiting outside the hotel, who swiftly took our bags and showed us to the reception. The staff were very friendly on reception, and luckily our room was ready early. We were on the 17th floor and although the room was nice the view was a little poor. Think this is the case in many hotels in New York though as the buildings are quite close together! We asked to be moved to a higher floor, they did their very best and managed to find a room on the 20th. Perfect! The beds and pillows are like marshmellow!! Really great room with fab bathroom and a rain shower! The conceirge 'Renee' was fantastic in finding us a restaurant for New Year {left it a little late to book!}, and helped us to arrange all our trips that we wanted to do aswell. The Sofitel is a fantastic hotel for location, friendliness, cleanliness and their restaurant is also very good! We ate there 3 times! Could not fault this hotel in any way. Would have no hesitation in booking The Sofitel again!! Manchester, England. UK

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: GlynUK
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the Sofitel in Jan 2007, and were cvertainly recommend it to anyone. We arrived at about midday and was immediately given acesss to our room on the 24th floor. The room was bright, airy and very clean and the bed complete with light fluffy duvet was the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in. Included in the room was a safe and a mini bar (we didn't use it as I suspect the prices were very high) and on our floor was an ice making machine. Bottels of water were regularly provided. We had an evening flight out of NY and were allowed to delay checking out until 2pm. The staff were almost apolgetic that they couldn't extend checkout later than that but explained that they were pretty full the following night. We didn't make use of the restaurant but just a few steps along from the hotel was an excellent little diner (The Red Flame) that provided excellent breakfasts for about $12 that would keep you going until lunch and beyond. Drinks at the bar were a little expensive, but they always came with a wonderful bowl of olives and a bowl of nibbles that were regularly topped up. There is a gym in the hotel, just in case you didn't get enough exercise walking Manhattan. Unfortunately there was no sauna that would have been very welcome to sooth sore feet. An excellent location (44th Street between 5th and 6th Avenue) a few minutes walk from Times Square where you can get the subway to travel further afield. I would look no further for a hotel if I was to return to NY

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: billymac2ny
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our 30th wedding anniversary with a trip to New York city. We decided to stay at Sofitel after reading reviews on this website. We were not disappointed. The staff is very friendly and will go out of their way to help you. The hotel is located in a great location Times Square was a couple blocks away and Grand Central Station was a few blocks in the other direction. We really enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: lucaerrante
Reviews.Content: Excellent in every way: location, service and decor. Rooms are a bit small, though, and on the pricey side, but it's ok for the overall quality. Ask for a room on the higher floors: lower floors can be noisy.

Reviews.Title: “not so good”
Reviews.Author: Petre
Reviews.Content: I choose Sofitel NYC, cause of the Trip Advisor reviews. But, I dont think the hotel is so good as the other customer sayed. The staff is correct but not friendly. The room is average(I stayed at a Executive suite). They have that devil machine(a refrigerator you cant use - every time you move a botle they charge), that they never refiled. The two TV sets are antiques and the remote control didn't work well. The housekeping only make turn down service one time(Stayed 4nights). So, for the money($ 600), it's only average. I will not stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Tres Bien”
Reviews.Author: mini_minx33
Reviews.Content: My husband, parents and I stayed at this fabulous hotel over the new year period. Before we went I was in communication with a concierge regarding New Year's Eve arrangements and he was incredibly helpful and friendly. The hotel is in an excellent location very close to Times Square and near a great cafe for breakfast, lunch or tea. It is one of the most friendly hotels I have stayed at with most staff smiling and welcoming (a couple of the concierge team appeared to be a little stuffy). Our room, which had been upgraded, was a good size with an amazingly comfortable bed. All the hotel is spotlessly clean and our room was kept the same. The bathroom was good with a walk-in shower, bath, sink area and toilet. The toiletries were good quality. The tv was a little low to be seen comfortably when lying in bed and the channels are all American, so mainly adverts. Having said that, you don't go to NY to watch tv! Our stay was comfortable and enjoyable. We made the most of the complimentary coffee in the morning and totted up quite an impressive bar bill in the evening. We didn't eat there so can't comment I'm afraid. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Très bon hötel”
Reviews.Author: ADDLille-France
Reviews.Content: Nous avons séjourné 5 jours pour le nouvel an au Sofitel de NYC. Sa situation est idéale au coeur de Manhattan et de Midtown north; à proximité immédiate de Broadway, de la 5ème avenue, de Central Park, ... C'est un très bon hôtel, propre, bien entretenu, spacieux. Décoration assez luxueuse mais sobre et de bon goût. Nous avions retenu 3 chambres De Luxe avec une vue sympathique sur le Rockfeller Center, pour nos enfants et nous-même. Les chambres sont d'assez petite taille mais propres, la literie est parfaite ainsi que la salle de bain. L'accueil est au standard de la chaine Sofitel c'est à dire excellent. Un seul petit reproche: le service du petit déjeuner est un peu compliqué et lent. Globalement à recommander de toute évidence.

Reviews.Title: “Good location if it's your 1st time in NY”
Reviews.Author: DB01
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel for 5 nights in January. Check-in was smooth & we were upgraded to a room on the 28th floor with a view of the Chrysler. Room was disappointing for the price we paid a little too bland for my taste, although the bathroom was in good order. Only 2 blocks from Times Square & with Fifth Ave at the end of the street, this hotel is in a great location if it's your 1st time in NY & your main aim is to see the sights. If you prefer something with more modern decor then this may not be for you. Personally I prefer to be in a less touristy location, but that said I think the staff are what really makes the Sofitel stand apart from other chain hotels, from housekeeping to the front desk. they are efficient & friendly. Can't comment on Gaby, but the attached bar area is a relaxing environment for a pre-dinner drink..

Reviews.Title: “we love sofitel”
Reviews.Author: bisonDublin
Reviews.Content: Fantastic. We are used to things being a little grim for the money in New York but this place was fantastic. Its only 6 years old and they are very nice here. The room we had was a superior Queen on the 10th floor (of 29). Only complaint was slightly noisy air-conditioning. But everything was fantastic. Umbrella`s at the door when it rained. Superb concierge with great restaurant recommendations. Beautiful breakfast. Nobody bugging me for tips all the time. All good. Warning: If you`re not used to taxes that don`t appear until you get the bill - beware. Our room was $254 per night but there was $35 in taxes on top of that that I knew nothing about until the bill appeared. If you don`t mind the price, this place is great. Superb lolcation also. Within 10 minute walk of all the shopping you could ever want. Within 10 minutes of broadway & time square.

Reviews.Title: “Good solid NYC hotel”
Reviews.Author: Matt321
Reviews.Content: I'm from New York and usually stay in the Marriott when in town, but wanted something different for visiting my family for Thanksgiving - found this on expedia and took a shot (reading some reviews here) This was a very nice solid hotel. Rooms were nice and everything was as expected. The front desk folks were very helpful and friendly I think I found a new NYC hotel when I'm on business trips as well. Much less crowded and better feel than the Marriott Marquis.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice.”
Reviews.Author: SnakeStyle
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean, modern, and nicely decorated, but were a bit small. Our view was not so great, and the room could be a bit noisy, but overall I would recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Highly Recommended, Would stay here again and again”
Reviews.Author: catcook80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel New York hotel in early December for 4 nights, this was our first visit to New York and we wanted to book a special hotel that was in the right location for ease of getting around. The Sofitel seemed to fit the bill. We really couldn't have chosen a better hotel, the Sofitel New York is amazing, what an entrance. We can see why it is rated No.1 on TripAdvisor! We'd recommend that you pay that bit extra for one of the Deluxe rooms which are located on Floors 15-29. Our room was on the 21st floor, the view was good view and it was very quiet. It was a good size room, the marble bathroom with it's seperate shower was lovely. In all a spacious room. The beds are so comfortable, you'll get the best sleep ever! The hotel is in the ideal location for getting around easily, you are never far from shops, restaurants etc. The hotel staff are all very helpful, the bar is a cosy place to enjoy a drink or two. We really couldn't find any faults with the Sofitel New York. The complimentary web access and printer located in the main lobby are a great touch, as we found it very useful on our last night, as it meant we could check-in online for our flights back home and print out our boarding passes. Saving us time in the queues at JFK. Concierge at the hotel is excellent, we asked for recommendations on nearby restaurants, we were given a list but one of those was "Keen's Steakhouse" on West 36th Street, what a meal we had, the service was the best we've received anywhere and the food was amazing. If you appreaciate good food and wine, you really should go to Keen's. The Doormen are friendly & attentive. On our last day, we were offered a private hire car back to JFK for $60. Compared with $45(ish) for a Yellow cab, we decided to go for it. What a good choice! It was a great way to end our trip. We travelled in a luxury black people carrier, a Chrysler we think. The driver was friendly, gave us free bottled water and it was a very comfortable and stress free drive to the airport. Rather than have breakfast at the hotel, we had breakfast at the Diner along the road, turn right at the front entrance to the hotel, heading towards 6th avenue. It's a great wee place, busy but great service, and the breakfast menu is vast. We tried various items each day and we never left disappointed or hungry. Overall a wonderful hotel, we have recommended it to friends & family, and we will personally be staying at this hotel when we return to New York.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best if not THE best hotel in New York city”
Reviews.Author: jdf3361
Reviews.Content: I visit New York City three times each year. This was my second stay at this Sofitel and I do not intend to seek different lodging on any trip to NYC. The hotel is in a convenient location for the business functions that I attend, a few blocks from Times Square and Grand Central, tons of great restaurants within a few blocks as well as good shopping - so location wise, for me, it is superb. The front desk is extremely well staffed with from four to six desk agents throughout the day and evening. They are each extremely pleasant, well informed, meticulously attired, and peform the check in and check out process with precision. The lobby area has several seating areas conducive to simply relax, meet with friends, have an impromptu business chat or check e-mail on one of four computers in a private area off of the lobby. The lobby is always staffed by a uniformed employee keeping an eye on things and there to handle simple directions. The rooms are average to mid-size, especially for a major city. The rooms that I, and colleagues, have had are exceptionally well maintained, have all amenities that you could possibly need and have nice small touches such as fresh flowers in the bathroom and a bed that is luxurious. Room service is prompt, very good quality and as pricey as you would expect. The cafe/bar is a great place to relax with a cocktail and is very well staffed and reasonably priced. It is rare to find a hotel where everything is as you wish, but this is one of those rare finds - quality lodging, efficient service and good location. At almost $600/night it is pricey - perhaps the only thing that I could fault.

Reviews.Title: “Great Christmas Vacation”
Reviews.Author: dallasprincess
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel was the best hotel decision we've ever made. I've always found this website helpful and have used the reviews for hotel decisions and have never gone wrong. I thought I would contribute this time. The hotel is stunningly beautiful and right in the midst of midtown. It's located on 44th street between 5th and 6th avenues, so it's basically in walking distance of all the great shopping on 5th. My husband and I enjoyed the Christmas lights, music and shopping along Rockefeller Center and were most impressed by the lights and music on the Saks Fifth Avenue building. If you like the hustle and bustle of Times Square, you are only about two blocks away from the hotel but at least you are not actually on Times Square which was a bit noisy and not really our taste. The rooms are beautiful and beds are super comfortable. Staff is friendly and helpful and the concierge helped us by phone while we were out and about. The Sofitel is also in very close proximity to Grand Central Station so we were able to get all around NYC by subway without much trouble. We loved this hotel and would come back again. The pictures don't even do the hotel justice. Thanks to all the other travellers who have helped us make our decision by writing such helpful reviews!

Reviews.Title: “Very good. Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Weegie1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in November as a stopover from flying home from visting relatives from Houston. Having stayed in NY several times in the last few years this was the first time in the Sofitel and was booked purely on the strength of reviews from Trip advisor.Previously we had stayed at the Plaza as a 30th birthday pressie to my wife in a great room (sad to see its being turned into apartments) and before that I had stayed at other hotels around Central Park area. This was the first time we had stayed more centrally and to be fair I had some concerns that noise would be an issue. However, this was not the case. The room was good without being great, but being a light sleeper this was more than made up for by the fact it was quiet. And in a busy, hustling city like NY, this is a blessing. The location could not be better. Basically two blocks to Times Square and almost everything in close reach. Having stayed near Central Park previously the one criticism of that area is that it is a fair old walk down to the Theatre District and Macy's etc etc. From the Sofitel its fantastic. Everything is within walking distance altho I would still recommend the bus tour 2 day pass as a means to getting around New York cheaply. And you learn things on the way round also! The Hotel foyer and lobby is beautiful and spotlessly clean. The service is great and mostly the concierge is very helpful. The guys at the door are even more helpful and a good means of information. A couple of helpful hints. Use the Hotel's town car service for pick up and drop off's at the airport. It's only marginally dearer than a standard cab, and an aawful lot more comfortable. When you add toll fees etc to a standard cab its practically the same. The hotel arrange this without hassle. The guys at the door can also aid you with this on the way back. Avoid the Hotel bar...its pretentious beyond belief and the service here (unlike the rest of the Hotel) was very very poor. They were more interested in preening themselves and looking cool for the business people populating the bar than actually serving anyone. Besides NY is full of good bars and restaurants (by the way the Indian restaurant 200yds to the left down the street of the Sofitel is very very good). Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great starting base in NY. Its clean, comfortable and stylish. Even better, if you get a deal I cant think of better value in NY, as its location is perfect. We'll be back here...we'll just avoid the bar!

Reviews.Title: “Out of their way outstanding”
Reviews.Author: vendorcloud
Reviews.Content: We did our annual shopping trip in New York and stayed at the Sofitel. I had holds on places like the W, The Palace and The Westin Times Square but none of those compare. Sofitel brings the sophistication of Europe to 5th Ave in a way many others cannot. I am a longtime guest of the Essex House but since their change of ownership didn't have a favorite. I do now. Check in was immediate, friendly and accurate. This was a busy weekend in New York and it could have been problematic. I like their bellman bells that they play for "front" service. The room was as planned and clean as you see in other reviews. Of course I found a few black spots in the shower but nothing like some of the photos you see herein of the W etc. This place visits your room twice daily to attend to things. Extra towels and room service were 20 minutes or less. They could use an update to electronics with flatscreens and free WiFi but that's minor. I am sure they will figure it out. The towels had a "holiday inn" feel to them also, but again, they will figure it out if enough of us complain. I couldnt find my ipod charger and their faulous head of security John Sheehan not only found one left by another guest but charged my ipod while i was out shopping. Front door staff and such were efficient too. The only downside (and why i gave only 4 dots instead of 5) is that their bar and restaurant are lacking any type of ambiance and panache that most New York 5th avenue area hotels have. At the holiday time, there are great fireplaces crackling, nice cocktails moving about and cheer. Not here. The bartender was majorly UNDER and he was complaining to his boss. The boss, in turn, was complaining about him to another worker. It was very unprofessional. They are also not wheelchair proficient (I am not a user but...) so that our stroller had to go down a bunch of stairs to get to the bar/restaurant. The breakfast was average and very expensive. Try Norma's at the Le Meridien for breakfast. That place rocks. All in all I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a great location and attention to minor details.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff at the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: dueykairyup
Reviews.Content: Not that I have a ton of experience staying in big city hotels, but I have enough to know that the staff makes or breaks an experience. And I must say that the staff at the Hotel Sofitel NYC was over-the-top. There were eleven of us (ranging in age between 6 and 75) plus luggage plus a wheelchair traveling in a very large stretch hummer. Upon our arrival the doormen and bellhops were incredibly personable, professional, and efficient unloading our luggage and whisking it away and then gracefully ushering us into the grand hotel. We arrived well before check-in time, yet four of our five rooms were already prepared. The staff at the reception desk was very friendly and handled the confusion of our particular check-in quite quickly (five rooms reserved under different names but paid for by me). Although we were on a smoking floor (as requested), the smell was very negligible. That's remarkable. Our rooms were impeccably clean, and throughout our stay the 24-hour housekeeping staff on our floor (the 8th floor) was very attentive. I will say, however, that although we all received turn-down service (which included complimentary bottles of Evian water), only some of us got all of the little touches such as the box of chocolates while some of us didn't -- that would be my only comment. Room service was quick and efficient and, I feel, well-priced. A plate of delicious cheeses and fruit for two was $12.00 and arrived within 15 minutes. The concierge desk provided asked-for information with professionalism. The doormen were so observant and anticipated our approach every time—not once did any of us have to open a door ourselves. Although we never needed a taxi, I did observe how quickly and efficiently one was hailed for others many times. Check-out was also handled quite quickly, and I was very impressed with the doorman who cleared the much-congested roadway outside for our hummer to pull up to the door. I must mention Catherine (not certain of the spelling of her name), the front desk manager who administered our reservation and who was on duty during our weekend stay. I cannot say enough about her. She handled the arrangement of our five rooms with aplomb so that all of us could be accommodated comfortably and together. During our stay she was indescribably attentive, especially honoring my daughter with some special birthday gifts (which was the reason for the trip -- my daughter's 18th birthday). Catherine made us feel as if we were the most important guests in the hotel -- she remembered what our planned activities were and every time we entered the lobby she came out from behind the reception desk to ask how we enjoyed such-n-such. She is an incredible asset to the Hotel Sofitel NYC. I cannot thank her and the staff enough for such a memorable stay. As for the accommodations themselves, the rooms were small BUT much larger than expected. We have experienced that rooms in NYC hotels tend to be small, but at the Sofitel we did not feel cramped thanks to the mirrored closet doors on one side and the huge window on the other. A plus is that the window can be opened for fresh air. The room had just about everything one could need – except a coffee maker (presumably 24-hour room service can handle that request). The honors bar was well-stocked with snacks and drinks (alcoholic and nonalcoholic). The price list was in the closet (along with the safe and a basket of other necessities) which was a little bit too much out of the way to find before indulging, and we discovered, after the fact, that prices were very expensive ($4.50 for a small can of Pringles, for example, but I’m not experienced enough to know if this is “normal”.) With a variety of pillows and a pillow-top mattress, the beds were very comfortable except that, although wonderfully fluffy, the duvet was the sole covering and it was a little too heavy and too warm. Adding a sheet as an alternative would have been ideal (and I’m sure a call to housekeeping could have solved that.) Among our five rooms we had 2 kings, 2 queens, and a room with 2 twins. The king was large enough to accommodate two adults and a 6-year-old. There would have been space in any of our five rooms for a rollaway although it would have been tight. The bathroom was huge and had a tub with hand-held shower and a separate shower stall. The countertop was expansive and held a variety of luxuries including fresh flowers and a candle, as well as many nicely-appointed necessities. The mirror was large and well-lit and somehow did not fog up during a hot shower. There was also a swing-away magnifying mirror. Excellent water pressure made for a superior shower. The towels were over-sized and absorbent, and the complimentary bathrobe was a great plus. Use of the bathmat was mandatory since the beautiful marble floor was very slippery when wet. Privacy was compromised a little bit due to the crack between the double doors of the bathroom; however, the doors were not facing into the room itself, so it wasn’t a huge issue. Two fun touches were the commode seat that closed automatically and the hidden speaker which piped in the sound from the TV. The room was well lit with a number of lamps. As for electronics and technology, high speed internet access was available for an extra fee, and there was a keyboard of some type for wireless access to something on the TV. None of us had time to try out either of these. The alarm clock was too much of a high-tech gizmo for any of us to figure out. One in our party gave up and called the front desk for a wake-up call (which they received exactly on time in the morning.) We didn’t eat at the Gaby restaurant on-site in the hotel, but we did stop in at the bar just before last call (midnight). It wasn’t crowded at this time and there was only one server. He made up for the unfortunate slow service by offering us another round even though it was past last call—a nice touch. I don't believe there is a health club on-site, and I'm not certain if Sofitel has a partnership with a private club -- we didn't have time to pursue that amenity. The public areas of the hotel included a lovely gift shop and a large lobby full of very comfortable chairs and couches and tables. There was a fireplace full of lit candles, and being the holiday season, the Christmas decorations were beautiful and elegant. French influence was found everywhere from the accents of the staff and their welcoming “bonjours” to the magazines and newspapers found in the lobby and the gift shop. For some, the price may be deemed expensive, but I feel that $500 per night for accommodations of this caliber in NYC during the Christmas season was a good value. The hotel’s location was perfect: ½ block east was Fifth Avenue and two blocks west was Times Square. Although 44th Street was sometimes congested, it was incredibly quiet and calming inside the hotel. Without a doubt we will stay at the Hotel Sofitel NYC again. As well, if ever in a city that has a Sofitel, we will purposely seek it out. It is my belief that a fantastic staff is not unique in the NYC location but that top-notch service is a philosophy of Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: VaTraveler12
Reviews.Content: I'm not a luxury traveler, but I will spend the money if necessary to ensure a great trip. After reading many travel horror stories about hotels (fleas, shared baths) in new york city, I decided to opt for high-priced to avoid any disasters. The Sofitel turned out to be well worth the money. Great location. Attentive staff. And not too busy. You never felt rushed and there were never any lines, not even for taxis or the concierge. We arrived around 8AM at the hotel and we were just planning on leaving our luggage, but they had a room available so they let us check in. That was a pleasant surprise. Everything is expensive in new york in December, but short of the Plaza or Le Meridien, Sofitel was a perfect match of price and comfort. I look forward to staying there again in the future, sometime other than Christmas when it is a little less expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: City-Sights10
Reviews.Content: This hotel certainly lives up to all the excellent reviews on Tripadvisor. I booked it on the recommendations on this site and wasn't disappointed. We arrived at 1pm and the receptionist went personally to check if our room was ready, after he confirmed that it was he showed us to it and we were very pleased with it. We were on the 20th floor with a lovely view of The Chrysler Building. The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. There was a complimentary bottle of bubbly on ice,(for my wife's birthday). The location of the hotel is excellent, with most of the main tourist attractions within walking distance. (Empire State 10 blocks, Central Park 15 Blocks, Time Square 2 Blocks, Central Station 2 Blocks) We didnt need to use taxis or the tube, instead we bought "hop on Hop off" bus tickets which not only get you to all of the tourist sites but the commentaries are very entertaining. We didnt eat at the hotel so cant comment on the food, but there are plenty of good food restaurants within a couple of blocks. I would certainly recommend this Hotel and we will definately stay there again, couldn't fault them on anything.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Devon_girls
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in. The rooms were beautiful and very comfortable. The location is perfect just tucked away in a quiet road near Times Square. It was my friends 30th birthday and the hotel upgraded our room and gave us a free bottle of champagne which was really good of them. We were on 22nd floor and the view from our window was breathtaking. The staff could not have been nicer. Reception staff very friendly and helpful, the maids and bell boys were really good and the concierge was very helpful - he booked us in to some fabulous restaurants. I will never stay at another hotel in New York again - this place is fabulous. Can't wait to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chickendale
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Sofitel after reading comments on Trip Advisor about how nasty some of the other places were. We do not have nasty carpets or mice in our home, so why would we pay to stay in a place that did have those terrible things? The Sofitel lived up to the reviews that were posted. The beds are wonderful, clean carpets, huge bathroom (for a hotel), nightly turndowns, French chocolates, & 2 blocks east of Time Square. All of the staff were very helpful and friendly. We will be staying there again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AMC_Micheldever
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 nights with my wife at the Sofitel NY. The hotel even was better than I expected, I could not fault the it. Good size room, the bed was the best I have ever found in a hotel. The staff were very helpful & professional. The location is perfect. I thought the breakfast was excellent & worth the cost, despite what other may say. Tips : No room kettle, so take your own. Book well in advance, my last night cost me $479 booked in May, or $950 on the night

Reviews.Title: “Eight Days...of Excellence”
Reviews.Author: JDSeattle
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week at this hotel last year, and returned for the same week again this year and stayed eight days (Thanksgiving week). We had a room facing the Chrysler building on the 20th (22nd?) floor and for NY...was large enough for our needs. Mirrored closet, immaculate bathroom, the bed extremely comfortable. Utilized the services of the concierge - no issues there. Had drinks in the bar (Gaby's)...perfect martinis. Used the 4pm late check out without a hitch (some issues last year) and all staff we interacted with were professionals. I will definitely stay at this hotel again next year. The only issue - we were a bit close to the elevator and I could hear the noise in the morning. I'll remember to request a room further away from the elevator next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous - the softest bed ever in a great location”
Reviews.Author: NikkiT75
Reviews.Content: I booked the sofitel at the last minute after getting a bit of a discount after doing a little bit of searching & joining the hotel's privilege club. The reception area is very nice with friendly receptionists. It is a french hotel chain, you are always welcomed with Bonjour or bonsoir, which personally annoyed me, but others may find this sophisticated! We had upgraded to a room with a king size bed, which on the web was only up to the 14th floor but as I had previously joined the privilege club online (do this at least 2 months before as it takes ages for the card to come through) we were upgraded to the 20th floor and had a view of the Chrysler building which is nice BUT I would say this is also at the back of the hotel - but who cares you are not in your room all day, so looking out of the window and seeing the lit up chrysler definitely made me realised I was in NYC. The bed though was the most fantastic thing in the room (which was normal New York size - small, the benjamin is a lot bigger) it was so soft it was heaven after a heavy day walking around the city. In the room every night was a box of 4 chocolates & 2 small bottles of water which were free and appreciated. I had also happened to mention that it was our anniversary and like others who had stayed at the hotel before us who were also celebrating we had a bottle of champagne on ice waiting for us when we got there. The Gaby bar - was very nice which also served a small selection of bar food/sandwiches but it is expensive $11+tip for a beer and a juice. The location of the hotel is very handy just 2 streets over from times square so close enough to walk to with no effort at all and also far enough away so you do not hear the Times Sq bustle. For breakfast I had read that others had eaten at the Red Flame diner just past the hotel and I would agree that this was very nice, quick service and very good food at a decent price. One thing I must say is the taxes are not included normally in the prices on the hotels website which were a little bit more than I expected but still ok in the scheme of things. Overall we will definitely be staying at this hotel again without any hesitation at all just for the nights sleep alone - in fact now looking into changing my own bedding at home to match it!

Reviews.Title: “Totally Impressed with Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: TheStewarts
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reviews before booking this hotel, we were not disappointed and it exceeded all our expectations. Without a doubt, Sofitel is the best hotel we have ever stayed in. Knowing how New York hotel rooms are often described as small, these hotel bedrooms are big even by UK standards. Great location, great hotel, helpful and friendly staff - can't wait to go back. If you get the opportunity and are visiting November or December, the Radio City Christmas Spectacular is not to be missed. An outstanding show, unique to New York. If you want to really splash out, a visit to Tavern On The Green in Central Park is a real experience. Quite pricey but an exceptional restaurant, especially at Christmas time when the decorations are unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel lived up to the reviews”
Reviews.Author: jojomillar
Reviews.Content: Just back from NYC.We booked the hotel and flight through expedia room only. Had never heard of the hotel before but read reviews, so we expected a lot. We weren't disappointed, our room was on the 12th floor superior queen. Bed was fab and bathroom lovely.Nice touches like the Evian water each night. We didn't eat in Gaby's but had a few cocktails !! The hotel was very central so we walked most places.Close to the subway and Grand Central Station( very impressed with Grand Central lovely restaurants and beautiful ceiling, go and see !! ) There are lots places to eat, try the Red Flame for breakie and snacks very reasonable. Went to Little Italy for a meal really nice ! The Concierge was very helpful for info for shows & shopping. Only issue we had was changing money, they seemed to have to different rules depending who you got and some times they had to go searching for money, which seemed strange for an advertised hotel service. Be warned about JFK, give yourself plenty of time to get there and to queue and boy did we queue !!! Overall fab hotel.....would stay there again !!

Reviews.Title: “Such an oasis”
Reviews.Author: B_G_C_M_P
Reviews.Content: This is jewel of peace and quiet in midtown Manhattan. The staff was attentive, knowledgeable, warm and provided privacy as needed. The beds were like floating on a cloud, the food superb, and there was no noise! I cant imagine anything overlooked in the room as there was a safe, robes and slippers, internet, etc. Truly European hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paul&Anne
Reviews.Content: Excellent location - 3 minutes from Times Square and the subway, Excellent staff - always friendly and very helpful Excellent decor in the rooms and the Lounge. We'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “True to all the positive reviews about this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tinka14
Reviews.Content: My husband was lucky enough to be awarded a trip to New York for his efforts at work so we had a choice of 4 star hotels for a 4 night stay and based on the reviews on tripadvisor.com, we decided to stay at the Sofitel...plus the fact that the hotel is excellently located for Times Sq, Broadway, 5th and 6th Avenues and Central Park, plus the Rockefeller Centre, Grand Central station and more! We did a lot of walking! I managed to get a Sofitel Privilege card in advance and emailed the hotel a few days before our arrival asking for a room with a view of the Chrysler Building which upon on arrival we were duly upgraded to, room 2200...lovely spacious room, great view....our only niggles were the air con was a bit noisy but we didn't need it so switched it off and you could hear the lift shaft noises but we usually fell asleep very quickly on those great big comfy beds and the lifts never woke us up. We ate once in the hotel and although the breakfast and service was very good, the price was horrendous...$50!!!! So we tended to eat our breakfast at the Red Flame Diner a few doors down which was usually near full with tourists and with locals, always a good sign. The food there was always promptly served up and the service was good...I wouldn't say the food was outstanding but was nice and a lot cheaper! The hotel was very clean and the staff were there but unobtrusive which suited us, we only used the concierge once and just asked a question about a taxi to get us to the heliport (as we had a helicopter trip included - fantastic - do it!)...the free internet service in the lobby is a great touch and enabled us to do a bit more research about our trip and send emails back home!
