We only seemed to get the Evian water at night (no chocs!) but it was a nice touch. We would say that the Sofitel deserves it's 4 star rating and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great but very, very posh”
Reviews.Author: OAFCBoy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a five night stay at The Sofitel. Going for a 21st celebration the hotel noted this and left a complimentary bottle as seems to be the norm now. Rooms were very well looked after. At times felt a little under dressed though as many seemed to be their on business and we were there for pleasure. Did receive some funny looks in the lobby but hey who treks round on holiday in a suit, I do that at work back here! One or two slight problems. We were told by the doorman that as it was Parade on Thursday we should leave at 12pm for a 6pm flight as traffic would be heavy and we could be in traffic for sometime. It wasn't and we arrived at 12.30pm. So 5 and half hours of waiting for us. Secondly a charge for the inhouse restaurant was placed on my bill - despite me never visiting it. Thankfully this was soon cleared up. Visited the Red Flame once and found it to be fine for a quick grab and go. Overall I'd say 4/5, it's a really nice hotel, maybe aimed at the better dressed traveller on business in my opinion than twenty somethings on a few nights break.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: gill63
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel in an excellent location on west 44th street. Ideal for sight seeing. Beautiful art deco lobby. Very good and helpful staff. Comfortable rooms. We had one of the cheaper rooms which didn't have a view but did have opening windows and one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in! Breakfast was super but expensive. There is a great little diner about 100yards from the hotel which was a fraction of the price for breakfast. Excellent location for sight seeing. A short walk from Times Square and the subway. I am delighted to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and experience”
Reviews.Author: mom_and_traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights at the Sofitel and were very pleased. We loved the central location. We were able to walk to Times Square, St. Patrick's, Rockefeller Center, Grand Central and MoMA. There are many subway stops within a few blocks. Even with the central location, the room (No. 1423) was perfectly quiet. The amenities were comforting -- a dreamy bed (though it is much shorter than our queen-sized bed at home), thick robes and a pair of women's slippers, quality bathroom products, a beautiful, roomy and clean bathroom, champagne upon arrival (for my husband's birthday). As other reviews have mentioned, we did miss access to a coffee maker in the room or complimentary coffee in the lobby, but that is a minor complaint. Room service arrived in about 10 minutes. The apple caramel crepes and French toast with fresh fruit were delicious. The service was excellent, especially from Brooke at the front desk. Dinner at the Gaby was good -- not as excellent as other options, but safe and reliable. (We especially loved lunch at the Bar Room at MoMA and dinner at Blue Hill, near NYU.) When we return to New York, we'd love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: JHoney
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a room here, and at the last minute asked for an adjoining room with twin beds for our son and his friend, who decided to join us. The rooms were at the end of the hall, across from each other, with a door that could close off our two rooms from the rest of the floor. We just kept our room doors open so we could keep an eye on the teenagers. The rooms were spotless, and the complimentary nightly bottles of Evian water were a nice touch. The beds and pillows were comfortable, and maid service was twice a day. The doorman was always able to get us a cab, and we were always greeted warmly by the staff. The hotel rooms ARE expensive, however. I think that with a little advance planning we would have been able to get a better deal. A warning -- don't pay $10 for a bowl of room service cereal. Walk down the street to one of the many restaurants around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mafi
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel from November 3rd to 5th. Great location. The hotel was spotless, the staff courteous and accomodating and the room nicely appointed. We will be using this hotel again for our New York weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: CAROLE3
Reviews.Content: By New York standards the rooms were quite spacious , clean and nicely furnished. We had to complain twice about a poorly flushing loo before we were offered another room. Dinner in Gaby's was very acceptable. Location is central for Times Square and 5th Ave but it was very expensive. At this price we would expected complimentary coffee in the foyer and there were no coffee making facilities in the room. It was either room service or a walk round the block to Starbucks. Check in staff were very friendly and efficient. Beds extremely comfortable. The 'Red Flame'diner often recommended on these pages was cheap. nasty and the food was abysmal.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly!!!”
Reviews.Author: Picky67
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for 2 nights and it was heavenly!!! Great Lobby, great front desk staff; upgraded our room from 7th to 24th and it gave us access to a balcony/terrace! The room was huge with a sitting room and a large size bedroom with a fabulous bathroom. My husband and I are very picky travellers and we pay attention to the details. Two complimentary drinks tickets, and Champagne delivered for our Anniversary, with a special letter! Very fine touches, of fresh flowers, water and chocolates for an evening turn down. Really nice decor and quality of room furniture. WE LOVED the bed, and the bathroom the most! We would definitely stay here again! Great location, great bellman, and even gave guests access to 3 computers in a private area off the lobby! Extremely attentive to the guests needs! Love it!!!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jo&Ste
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay in the Sofitel. Overall we liked the location - only 2 blocks from Grand Central, easily walkable even with suitcases and 2 blocks from Times Square for tourist buses. Near the theatre (we saw the Producers at St James' theatre which was fantastic) but although Fifth and Sixth Avenues were close, it didn't feel like a busy street. Diner on the same street - but very busy at breakfast time. We were moved up from the 7th to the 26th floor on request (reception staff were extremely friendly and 'can do', but be warned, the view came with the compromise of having to hear the rattle of the elevator machinery at the top of the building! Room was big but not a huge amount of storage aspace. Getting little bottles of water and chocolates in the room was nice. The bed was very comfy and surprisingly not too hot. Bathroom to die for - gorgeous shower and lovely decor - huge, too. Didn't have time for a soak in the separate tub though unfortunately! The only thing we didn't like was the concierge staff, who were stuck behind a tiny desk at the front of the hotel and didn't seem over-friendly. We were recommended a good Mexican restaurant by Daniel, but we didn't like it and did not ask their advice again. Don't waste your money in the hotle restaurant - go to Candle 79 on 79th St instead it was the best meal I have ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: CE1927
Reviews.Content: Just came back from 4 nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the sofitel. All the staff were excellant and the hotel was very comfortable. For a 1st time in New York this was the hotel to stay!! 2 min walk from times square and broadway one way and about 10 min walk to rockafeller centre and further 5mins to central park the other way. Rooms were very nice and spacious, every ammenity you require and the bed was the best we've ever slept in!!! Definately woth a stay while in New York!!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: tripadvjunkie
Reviews.Content: We were really looking forward to our stay at this hotel for our 20th anniversary based on other reviews. Stayed at this property October 27 - 31,2006. We booked directly through the hotel's website and paid full price. One good thing is that the hotel rooms are exceptionally quiet and you do not hear any street noise. Also, because it was our anniversary, a bottle of champagne was sent to our room. Nice touch. However, we were not exceptionally pleased by either the hotel or its staff. The room was clean and of adequate size. However, the shower backed up in the first few seconds that the water was turned on, and you were left standing in ankle-deep water throughout your shower which eventually ran out onto the bathroom floor. We twice requested maintenance to fix it, but they never did. We were left with the impression that the staff just didn't think this was any big deal. The second time we requested maintenance, we were asked if we wanted a different room. However, no offer to actually move our unpacked clothing was ever mentioned. Obviously, they staff was not exceptionally helpful or this problem would have been fixed the first time we asked about it. Because of this, I doubt very much that we will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: MarkBarrow
Reviews.Content: Booked the Sofitel based on other reviews on this site and on arrival in West 44th Street was underwhelmed by entrance. However once we walked into the lobby we were amazed at the quality of the hotel and its excellent staff. The rooms are large for New York and on the higher floors very quiet. The bathroom in our suite was large with seperate bath and shower. Would not hesitate to stay here again as it is in an excellent location between Times Square and Grand Central. The hotel facilities are good as well with a good restaurant and pleasant Bar. The only slight problem was a lack of Coffee/Tea making facilities in room.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location, Everything you expect from a 5 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tracee3d
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot and have stayed at many 5 star hotels, but with the high prices in NYC, we had to opt for something more reasonable. Sofitel NY could easily qualify for a 5 star in our opinion. It was in the middle of NYC, a few blocks to the Time Square, Radio City Music Hall, Museum of Modern Art, Central Park, all the shopping on the 5th Avenue, and had a great view of the Chrysler Building. We even walked to the Metropolitan Museum of Art, Museum of Natural History, the Empire State Building, Union Square, and Soho. Perfect location for tourists. Service was excellent, too. Very clean and neat. It also had free internet access with a printer by the lobby 24 hours, which was very convenient. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: AnnieTO
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sofitel from October 19 - 24, 2006. We booked based on all the amazing reviews here on Tripadvisor. Although the hotel itself was in a great location and the rooms spacious and comfortable I can't say that it was the best experience we have ever had. For one, I have an allergy to goose down and when I requested a duvet or bed spread not filled with it, they only thing they had was a ratty blanket that didn't have a cover that fit. They really should have alternatives for clients with allergies. The second thing that really bothered us was interuptions by housekeeping. On our last day there we had the late 4pm check out and were both fighting colds, so we were resting before our flight. Housekeeping must have knocked on the door 3 or 4 times between 3 and 4pm to see if we had left yet. 4pm means 4pm to us and if we need you before then, we'll call. One time I was just coming out of the bathroom and she practically already had the door open. Very disturbing. Make sure you have the do not disturb sign on your door or they will keep coming back. We thought that one warning that we were still there was enough, apparently not. We used the conceirge to make a late dinner suggestion for us and he made the reservation under the wrong name. There was no harm done, but for someone expecting a tip it was a little unprofessional. Front desk suggested we tip $10 for this! What the....for a dinner place suggestion? We didn't even ask him to make a reservation, he just did. The hotel was clean, excellent location if you want to stay midtown, the room clean, the bathroom nice, the room spacious, the staff polite etc. Sofitel just seemed to lack character. Eat breakfast at the Red Flame just down the street towards 6th Ave - it was fast and cheap. Definitely the way to go for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!!”
Reviews.Author: halfp
Reviews.Content: A worthy #1 We wanted a good hotel in New York and noted that Sofitel was #1 and after reading the reviews decided to book. We were not disappointed. A fabulous location; Time Squre, Grand Central Station, 5th Avenue, Broadway and more all within a short distance. We were upgraded to a king size room and had a bottle of champagne and some chocolates with a very nice letter when we retuerned to the room on the first night, as I had e-mailed the hotel to tell them that it was our 40th anniversary. The bathroom was enormous and the bed - well - almost too comfortable to get up!!! The bed was turned down every night and two bottles of Evian and the next days weather forecast were left on the bedside table. Little touches that make a big difference. We will certainly stay here again and have recommended the hotel to our friends. Thanks to all the reviewers and Trip Advisor. Sue and Tom Halfpenny - Sheffield

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Great Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: 24shoregirl
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel!! I was in Manhatten recently for three days of theater and museums. I booked the Sofitel because of the great reviews and because I wanted to be close to the theaters. I had a wonderful experience. My credentials: When my husband and I travel, we always stay at five star hotels and the Four Seasons are our favorite. So, I know what I'm talking about. I was travelling alone this time and safety and security were very important to me. The Sofitel in New York exceeded my expectations! The staff could not have been any nicer and the service was great. I was in the cheapest, single, queen sized room and was treated like a guest staying in a suite for a month. By the second day, the doorman knew my name. The room was very nice. Not much of a view, but I had good light. Everything was spotless. The bathroom was very clean and adequate (great shower, not much of a bathtub). The bed was fantastic!! Very cozy and extremely comfortable. I had a lot of room service and the food was delicious. There is not much of a lobby shop, but Duanne Reed (mega - drugstore) is right around the corner. This is an excellent hotel and I would stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Diffiuclt to find fault but....”
Reviews.Author: DavidCon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel a couple of days ago based purely on the other trip advisor reviews (it's rated no.1) as we wanted a change from the 'trendy' hotel scene (the Ws, the tribeca grand etc). It's a great location (few blocks from time Square) but not noisy or that busy which makes a change. We arrived in town about 7.30 on Saturday evening and booking in was very easy as our rooms were pre-booked through Expedia and there was no line up. The rooms were reasonably spacious (by NY standards) and did not look at all tired/dated and the bed was very comfortable. The bathrooms were also a decent size and were very clean. The rooms have internet connection (at $10 for 24 hours) but you can use the net for free in the lobby as there were 3 computers. The food in the hotel was also very good (which makes a change) but like most other hotels a little expensive. We were also given an extended checkout (2pm, which they let us extend to 5pm at no extra cost). There was however one slight niggle- the air conditioning in one of the rooms did not work very well. Unfortunately they didn't seem to be able to fix it properly which was slightly annoying. Overall an excellent hotel- We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: CrisGodoy
Reviews.Content: The best word to describe this hotel is "amazing"! Everything works well: the hotel is beautiful, the staff is very kind, the location is perfect. We stayed there for a week (Oct.16 to 23) and had a very good time. The room is absolutely quiet, comfortable and clean. The queen size bed (as we have requested, due to price considerations - this is not a cheap hotel) was amazingly good. The sheets were changed every day, and the bed was made again around 7 PM. The bathroom is wonderful: separate shower, everything in marble, towels changed twice a day. Even the soap/shampoo are of excellent quality (Roger & Gallet). The restaurant is very good, although the prices on the wine list were a bit high. I strongly recommend the breakfast (delicious croissants). Service very kind. The staff is remarkable, specially the concierge service. I would like to mention the concierge Daniel, who was very helpful in finding us some delicious restaurants. I will return to this hotel, and highly recommend it for anyone travelling to NY.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Beds, Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: MrsSher
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading all the great reviews, and as many have said before, we were not disappointed. This trip was for my husband's 40th birthday. I also emailed the hotel beforehand and signed up for the Sofitel Privilege card. When we checked in we were offered a King size room on a higher floor which was great. The rooms are a great size and the beds are sooooo comfortable, you do not want to get up in the morning! On the first evening a bottle of champagne arrived with a letter of congratulations for the 40th Birthday. A nice and very welcome touch! The staff were all very helpful and were not at all stuffy. We ate fantastic breakfasts in the hotel restaurant 'Gaby', about $50 for two of us. The Classic eggs benedict were wonderful and the yoghurt granola with fresh berries equally as good. The location is superb. Times Square, Fifth Avenue. Grand Central Station to name a few all within a moments walk or so. Had a fabulous meal in 'The Palm' restaurent on 2nd Avenue. A great experience. We would definitely recommend this hotel and look forward to staying again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Genuinly world class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jack's-dinner
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel for the last night of our honeymoon and I can honestly say it was one of the three or four best Hotel experiences I have had. I was a little wary at first since I tend to stay away from large chain hotels as they generally lack personality or charm, but Sofitel had both in spades. The room – VERY large for NY – separate bath and walk-in shower in the marble bathroom, four large towels, and all extremely clean. We were on the 22nd floor, great view, no noise from other rooms or lift, air-conditioner purred rather than roared. Reception – doorman was efficient and very helpful, concierge could not do enough for us, even going so far as organising theatre tickets for that night. All done with a genuine smile and desire to please. When we checked in we mentioned to the front desk that it was the last night of our honeymoon. Two hours later as we were getting ready to go out, there was a knock on the door and a waiter appeared with a bottle of Crystal champagne courtesy of the Hotel. It was extremely impressive. When I went down to the bar, they had a number of beers I had not heard of before. As I couldn’t decide, the barman without prompting poured a half-glass of each for me to try. I tried all four and settled on a glass of wine instead. He did not of course charge me for the beer. Our flight the next day was not until 6.30pm. The Hotel offered us a free late-check out on the room until 2.30 pm and stored our bags with the concierge until we left. From beginning to end the staff went out of their way to make our stay as pleasant as possible. The price is steep, but unusually in New York, here you really are getting what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: UK_Basball_Fans
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed here for 8 nights at the beginning of October to celebrate my 40th birthday. We had a room on the 18th floor with view of the Chrysler building. The room was lovely, the bathroom well equipped with toiletries etc. Even provided a bottle of Champagne on ice because we'd told them it was my 40th birthday treat. Every night the turn down service included 2 bottles of water, which we used to take out with us during the day time. Hotel is situation just 5 minutes walk from Times Square and about 15 mins from Empire State Building. Hotel staff very courteous at all times. Yes, the Gaby restaurant is pricey, we had breakfast there on my birthday and it was 3 times what we'd been paying at the Red Flame (highly recommend their pancakes and french toast!) a few doors down on the same street - but special birthdays require special treatment. Recommend joining the Sofitel priviledge card scheme, but do so in advance because our card didn't arrive in time for the trip so we missed out on the free drink at the bar mentioned in other reviews, however, we did get late checkout (4pm) which was great for us as we had late night flight. Would definitely stay there again and pay a little extra for a higher floor room having seen photos of other rooms. Agree with other reviewers about Grayline sightseeing bus, Empire State Building and Rockefeller Centre (top of the rock) if only for the elevator experience!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bergkamp9999
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel is excellent in all aspects; service, rooms, food etc. Considering it's location (1 & 1/2 blocks from Times square) and the generally very noisy streets, my room (17th floor) was very quiet and spotlessly clean. The bathroom is a generous size with first rate bathroom products. The bed was so comfortable, with a very soft feather duvet - just the thing after a transatlantic flight. Gabys restaurant serves good food and the prices reflect the high quality ingredients. The checkin process was fast, friendly and responsive. Overall, I would certainly return here for my next trip but I recommend booking well in advance. I had booked a couple of weeks ahead but if you leave it till the last minute, you can get charged over $700 for weeknights.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and tranquility”
Reviews.Author: GerbilOReilly
Reviews.Content: Peace and quiet in the middle of New York. Rooms pretty spacious for a city centre. Staff attentive. Couldn't be bettered.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago guests thinks Sofitel NY is one of the best!!”
Reviews.Author: TLorine
Reviews.Content: I am just returning from my first trip to NY this past weekend, which was a surprise for my fiance's birthday, and was thoroughly impressed with the Sofitel. Before arriving I emailed the hotel to let them know of the birthday plan, and they immediately upgraded our room to a King size bed and a higher floor to stay on. As soon as my fiance' walked in he said WOW!! :-) We were so impressed with the service, and hospitality of the staff. Nick, (the greeter, or bellhop that stands in the front) was really nice and helpful, and upon check in we thought our key would not work, and when we came down to let the staff know, the agent at the desk immediately went upstairs with us to show us to how to use their key. Very attentive and courteous staff, and overall a wonderful experience. I would definitely book with the Sofitel again in other locations, strictly because of the service that we received at this location. AND!!!!! They brought up a bottle of champagne and letter wishing my fiance' a happy birthday!! WONDERFUL Experience!

Reviews.Title: “Superb stay - read on...”
Reviews.Author: TedStriker
Reviews.Content: In summary - wonderful staff, great location, clean attractive hotel with sumptuous rooms at a very good price. Couldn't have hoped for more. My girlfriend and I stayed at the Sofitel for a long weekend at the end of March. We are both professionals in our late twenties if that helps. The trip was a surprise for her, and I wanted to pick a hotel with exceptional and friendly service, and a good quality room at an acceptable price. I chose the Sofitel purely based on the reviews here on tripadvisor. Of course I considered all sorts of other hotels (Mandarin Oriental, Michelangelo, Ritz-Carlton, Four Seasons....). I am sure all of these are splendid hotels, but either the reviews here didn't match their 5-star status or the price was just too high. Prior to my arrival I requested the best suite available, preferably with a good view of the city. Upon arrival, the staff were fantastic - they had pre-booked a fabulous room with a huge balcony overlooking the east-side of Manhattan which was a great surprise to both of us. We had superb views of the Empire State Building, the Chrysler building and many others. We were also treated to a complimentary bottle of Champagne, kindly delivered at a suitable moment chosen by me. The photos do not do the view justice. I appreciate the best views of the city come from place such as the Mandarin Oriental and Ritz-Carlton, but you'll expect that when you see the price! Our room was spacious enough for two, and well decorated. The bathroom was excellent - (I probably wouldn't have noticed, but my girlfriend tells me it was first-rate, and she's very particular about that sort of thing). Throughout the weekend the staff were friendly, helpful, courteous and professional. I am extremely grateful to them for making our weekend so special. Whilst this is not a five-star hotel, the overall attention to detail and quality of service is first-class. Certainly I found this to be the best priced hotel of this class, particularly by booking in advance. Finally, the hotel is superbly located for visitors and sightseers alike, situated just a couple of blocks from Times Square and only a few minutes from Fifth Avenue and Grand Central Station. I would certainly stay here again, and can thoroughly recommend it to others whatever the occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: greyman26
Reviews.Content: I made our reservation on-line using Sofitel site which was easy. The rates quoted on the site do not include taxes although this was not as clear as I thought it should be. I also signed up for Privilege card which provides a nice benefit of a 4 PM checkout if needed. Our room was $375/night before taxes for a Fri/Sat nights. The location on 44th St between 5th and 6th (closer to 6th) was good since we planned to visit a number of areas and could walk 3 blocks to Grand Central Station (or 3 -4 blocks to Times Square subways if you don't mind crowds). Taxi's are readily available out front of course. This is a nice block of small hotels and restaurants. The hotel is also next to private clubs - the New York Yacht and Harvard clubs. The taxi ride was a $7 metered fare although the driver didn't seem to know this newer hotel (the Algonquin a few doors away may be better known today to cabbies). The bellmen were cordial and a bit busy when we arrived. They did not try to force us to use them when they saw we each had only a roll-aboard bag. Check-in was quick with no waiting in line and the receptionist was extremely friendly and professional. She had a lovely French accent and pleasantly answered a few questions we had. We also rec'd 2 complimentary drink tickets - this may have been because we were first time guests. Our room was on the 14th floor and faced on 45th street . The view was basicall buildings across 45th Street and a small park. During our stay, we did see the view from the elevator lobby on the 29th floor which was also primarily a view of nearby buildings. I believe you may get a decent view in some but not all of the rooms on the highest (20-29) floors. Our room (incl. bathroom) was exceptionally clean and in perfect shape. The room was average size with king bed & side tables, small table and sitting chair, and low desk/bureau with TV, desk & chair & minibar. There was also a good sized closet and drawer storage area and large dressing mirrors. The good sized bathroom was mostly marble and glass with both a tub and walk in shower. Housekeeping each day was flawless. We had dinner one evening in the hotel restaurant, Gaby's. The food was excellent and we used our free drink cards with dinner for 2 glasses of champagne. There are also banquet tables near the bar if you want to get a drink (and possibly a light bite to eat?). NYC has many great hotels in many different parts of the city. This is one we would certainly use again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special!”
Reviews.Author: junkemail669
Reviews.Content: I searched TripAdvisor to get some ideas about where to stay when I visited New York and Sofitel was at the top of the list, so, I booked a three night stay. I was less than impressed. Nothing special... For the price, there are many more attractive options... So, if you stay at the NY Sofitel, do no expect any thing special.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend”
Reviews.Author: HazelBagel
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Sofitel hotels before and on the strength of our positive experiences in the past, decided to try the New York sofitel. We were not in the least disappointed. We booked a package through Expedia, which included a standard double room (queen sized bed) and direct Delta flights from Manchester to JFK. We also pre-paid for transfers with a shuttle company, but would advise people to either treat themselves to a taxi journey (around $50 one way) or to get the AirTrain from JFK to Jamaica Avenue and then get the overground train to Penn Station and finally a taxi to the Sofitel - grand total of $30 for the two of us. When we got to the hotel we decided to upgrade to a room with a King sized bed, this was an extra $80 a day, but worth every cent. The room was roomy, confortable, spotlessly clean and the only critisism was that if you like to soak in a bath, you will be disappiinted as the bath is very shallow and rather short.. Other than that we could not fault the accomodation. The staff at the hotel were all very friendly - and not in a false 'I am doing my job' way. The concierge service was very good and they gave good tips for where to eat etc. If you stay at the Sofitel, go the the Red Flame diner for breakfast, it is extremely good value and the food is excellent. All in all, we will certainly go back to the Sofitel when we return to New York, hopefully not in the too distant future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Fabulous, Amazing, Best Hotel in the World !”
Reviews.Author: anni555
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel for 3 Nights 18/19/20th April 2006 we came over from Ireland to get married on 19th and we had the best time ever ! This hotel is PERFECT ! cant believe it is not a 5*. We chose the hotel because of the amazing reviews and it definitely lives up to them tenfold ! The staff are absolutely amazing ! so nice and friendly and would go totally out of their way to help you (The lady on the reception desk was absolutely brilliant) Rooms are gorgeous and bed is Fabulous ! We checked in and were trying to organise somewhere for our 26 Wedding guests from Ireland to meet on the morning of our Wedding (for which the lobby was perfect, lots of lovely seating area) and when they heard we were getting married they gave us an upgrade from a Queen room to a King, the lady said they would have given us a suite but they had none available that day, but if we left all our luggage ready the next day they would move us when we were at our Wedding ! we couldn’t believe it ! When we returned back that Night after our Wedding they had moved rooms for us and the Room was completely and utterly UNBELIEVABLE ! firstly there was a bottle of champagne and a card from the staff and strawberries dipped in chocolate waiting for us which was beautiful ! such a lovely touch ! the Room was massive with TWO bathrooms, a sofa area a big bedroom and best of all a HUGE SUN TERRACE outside the patio doors with table and chairs and two sunbeds !!!!! we were totally blown away ! I had never seen anything like it and never even thought it could exist in the City ! we were sitting out on terrace looking right at the Chrysler Building easily the most beautiful building in the city, it was fabulous, and all our guests came over the next day and we sat in the sun and drank champagne all day ! (no one could believe the room) then ordered room service that evening which was very nice too. I can easily say the Sofitel made our Wedding Day truly MAGICAL ! It is also situated brilliantly, just short walks to the main attractions and on a side street so no street noise whatsoever. Red Flame Diner is ace for breakfast! The Top of the Rock is good, but it is $18 each to go up to the outside viewing area, which we did a few days before our Wedding, but on our Wedding day we went up to the Rainbow Room for cocktails which is also in the Rockefeller Building and only 2 floors down from the top of the rock and we paid about the same and had a cocktail and were not outside in the wind ! (and we had cosmopolitans which were supposedly invented in the Rainbow Room !) the views from it were amazing no different than the TOTR, the cocktails were expensive but definitely worth going up for one ! but we were lucky as the lady waitress bought us a free cocktail as we had just got married ! I would also recommend a trip to China Town (Canal Street) especially for girlies who love handbags ! bargains galore ! Overall, the Sofitel is FABULOUS and we will definitely, 100 % be back as soon as we possibly can !

Reviews.Title: “Large and Comfortable Room”
Reviews.Author: worthington
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay at the Sofitel. The rooms are very large for NY and very well appointed and comfortable. The ambiance is French, which also adds to the charm. Had an excellent dinner two doors down at DB Bistro Moderne. Also recommend that you stop by the Royalton across the street to visit its wonderful bar.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, clean, lovely”
Reviews.Author: mommamiya
Reviews.Content: Great location, very good room service, wonderful bed and lux bath. I loved this place and want to go back now!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: RUGRAD
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Sofitel, came into NY for an anniversary weekend, prepaid room for lower rate. Stayed on upper floor with view of the Empire State Building. Staff were very good, the right mix of engaging without being intruding and very professional, from the doorman to check in/check out everyone was friendly and quick. Room was nice, great bed, clean, electronic minibar, good closet/drawer space, bathroom was new separate shower and tub... We used concierge to recommend restaurants for dinner and breakfast and the recommendations were good. On this trip we did not eat at Gaby's or stop by the bar there but I have in the past had very good breakfast(s) there.... I used the gym in the morning, it is in the basement and has plenty of treadmills etc and new weights, medicine balls etc. The location of the hotel is great for midtown, you are 6 blocks from Radio City, 2 blocks east of Times Square, right around the corner from St. Patrick's and 5th avenue shops etc...the hotel is on the same street as the Algonquin hotel which has nightly entertainment and the NY Yacht Club, City Hotel, and a few other hotels....about 15 blocks from Central Park, I ran to the park, took about 5-6 minutes...probably a 10-15 minute walk. If you are not going to eat at Gaby's there is a diner on the same street (44th) and a Starbucks on 45th and 6th (around corner) so you can pick up Sunday paper and your Grande half caf mocha no whip latte.... We had a great time, I would definately go back and would recommend to others....

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed by Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: SCART
Reviews.Content: Pros: Nice midtown location, new and sleek design, clean rooms and comfortable beds. Cons: Would not honor Sofitel Privilege Card (despite paying $300/ night ) because I booked through Priceline. Was given a room with two oversize twins despite calling ahead to tell them that this was an anniversary trip. Our room # was the same number you call to get guest services if you forget to dial the 9 first, so we received calls all hours of the day and night from other guests. (Do not stay in 1212) And received little apology for this. The shower door opened the wrong way making it almost impossible, actually humorous, to get in and out. Not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ltyka
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our anniversary over Labor Day weekend at the Sofitel. After all day in the hustle and bustle of the City, particularly near Times Square, it was like Shangra La to walk into the calm, quiet lobby of the Sofitel. It is a great location, nice sized rooms, wonderful bathrooms, very comfortable beds, and quiet rooms. The service is anything but snooty. The hotel restaurant is a bit pricy, but there is a diner about 1/2 block away. Join the rewards program and get free drinks and late check out. Also, they left a card, a bottle of champagne, and a box of chocolates in our room! We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Don't go anywhere else in New York”
Reviews.Author: Saraboo
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to the 29th floor. The trip was for our 15th wedding anniversary. The conceirge and the entire staff are great. The property was extremely clean and bright. We will definitely be back to the Sofitel again. In fact we are looking at booking the one in Rome based on our experience. A can't miss hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PamplesPals
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from the Sofitel in New York and were expecting great things after reading the other reviews on here, we were not disappointed. On arrival we were greeted at the door and excorted to reception, whilst our bags were taken to our room. Check in only took about 5 minutes which was great after a 7 and a half hour flight. All the staff were very polite although I did find their accents quite hard to understand and I think they thought the same of me. We were escorted to the escalators and once we got to our room (which was on the 23rd floor) we found an amazing room with a bottle of champagne and a welcome card from all the staff. The bed was gorgeous, and just as comfortable as it looked. The bathroom was huge and it had a shower big enough for 2 (ooh errr!) and a separate bath, also loads of free goodies and fresh flowers. The bed is incredibly comfortable and is hard to get out of in the morning but the promise of the wonderful shower helps. The TV has 40 channels and their was always something on, its particularly good for weather and Times Square info as their seemed to be different celebrities their on a daily basis. There are also pay per view channels for the latest films if you have the time. The room was cleaned once a day immaculately, and a turndown service is offered between 6 and 9 which can be a little bit annoying as that was the time we usually were having a snooze before going out in the evening as all the walking does tire you out. However, this is when fresh water is given to you though and it is appreciated in the humid conditions of New York. We only visited the bar once, it was very pleasant but not very lively and the drinks were on the expensive side, 2 vodka and cokes were $24 dollars so make sure you have plenty of cash, they do have very tasty complimentary bar snacks. Overall our stay was wonderful, the view from our room was very good too and the hotel is in a brilliant location for shopping and sightseeing. All the staff went out of their way to help you especially the concierge who gave us free passes to two top nightclubs. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Superb, fantastic, Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Dolly1964
Reviews.Content: My partner John and I stayed here for 6 nights at the beginning of September. From check-in to check-out everything was just great. Room on the 21st Floor, huge, spotless, modern and those beds, so comfortable!! The hotel is in the heart of 5th Avenue but so quiet and safe. The Red Flame Diner a good start to the day but also try the Au Bain pon Delis great place to pick up a tasty breakfast or snack and a third of the price. Once you get in the swing of what to do (self service) you are well away! For a gem of a reastaurant try the "Hour Glass" based on 46th Street and 8th Avenue (known as Restaurant Row). For 76$ you get 4 courses two bottles of wine, tea or coffee. Ambience best I have ever come across in New York. Service second to none. Table turnaround is roughly 1.5hrs but if eating earlier in the day sit outside, drink relax and watch the world go by and take longer! We eat here 3 times and with such a varied menu could be there all month! Go there you will not be disppointed just don't tell everyone about this hidden secret! If you are from the visiting from the UK mention to Maria, & Megan that Jeanette & John from Essex say hi and we are coming back! Enjoy just stay at the Sofitel! Pictures will follow!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! HUGE rooms!”
Reviews.Author: HTM276
Reviews.Content: Good location if you want to be in midtown near Times Square. Rooms are HUGE, great service and staff. Would recommend and go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “C'est Magnifique”
Reviews.Author: BRC333
Reviews.Content: Hard not to repeat what many other tripadvisor.com users have already said. Sofitel's #1 ranking is well deserved. It has a great location on 44th - close to Times Square but not too close. It is well built - we never heard a peep at night. Room was great - we were upgraded to one of the higher floors. Exercise room was 24/7 and fully equipped. Concierge was well-connected - we were able to acquire house seats to Wicked on short notice. We had a wonderful time using it as our base and look forward to trying other Sofitels. BTW, for a good dinner pre-theatre that is located just down the street, try Osteria al Doge.

Reviews.Title: “Beds are soooo comfy!”
Reviews.Author: foxyUK
Reviews.Content: The location of the Sofitel is great, 44th St just between 5th and 6th. Within walking distance of everything. The staff are very welcoming at all times. The rooms are a perfect size, with beds so comfy that as soon as I lay down I never wanted to get up! The daily supply of Evian is a nice touch. It was my partners birthday the second day of our stay and the hotel sent up a bottle of Champagne on ice with a welcome message, lovely. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: heybud2
Reviews.Content: What a great experience! Very friendly staff. Stayed for 7 nights and was upgraded upon arrival. Received a higher floor with a great view of the Empire State Building. Also received a free bottle of champagne for our Anniversary! Rooms were very large and decorated nicely. The bed was so confortable you didn't want to leave it! Bathrooms had beautiful marble floors and we never ran out of hot water! I can't say enough good things about this hotel! Also perfect location, between 5th avenue and Times Square! Rockefellar Plaza just 3 short blocks away and Subway stations just 2 blocks. We will definately stay at this Hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Oustanding Service”
Reviews.Author: 1498slm
Reviews.Content: We have just returned to the UK from a six day trip to New York. We stayed in a 26th floor suite (great views!). The room was fabulous, large bathroom, walk in double shower, separate lounge area etc. We arrived early but were given a great welcome and as I had told the hotel in advance the trip was for my husband's 40th birthday, the hotel manager came out to greet us, discreetly accompanied us to the lift and very genuinely pointed out that should we need anything during our stay to let her know. This was followed later that evening with a complimentary bottle of champagne and chocolates delivered to the room. We only had one problem during the stay (safe not working) which was fixed within five minutes(genuinely less than 5 minutes!!). The location of the hotel is outstanding - Times Square, Grand Central, Central Park all only a short walk away. Fifth Ave partically on the doorstep. A hotel of this quality with staff who are so helpful and friendly is great anywhere in the world but in a busy city like New York is a real find! Couple of tips - Red Flame Diner on 44th or Cafe Europa on 5th or 6th are great for breakfast. Enrol for a Sofitel Privelege card before you go and get late check out plus other benefits.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TouristFromSeattle
Reviews.Content: Check In / Check Out ----------------------------- Our check in was fast and easy. A porter took our bags from the curb up to our room while we got the keys. The whole process took about 3 minutes. We got exactly what we asked for - a room on an upper floor with a view of the ESB. We also got mineral water instead of champagne as I requested via email a few days before we arrived - perfect. Check out was even faster than check in. There was never a wait at the front desk for us. Room ----------------------------- The best feature was a very comfortable bed - maybe the best I've ever had in a hotel. The bathroom was all marble and came with decent amenities. The walls were pretty quiet - heard some hall noise but nothing from outside. The curtains blocked out all light in the morning. Guests ----------------------------- The guests were a mix of Europeans and Americans. Some couples. Some families. Some students. Some dressed up. Some casual. Mostly tourists. Overall a sharp middle-class group. In comparison, we stopped by the Super 8 a couple of blocks away to visit some friends one morning and the crowd there was quite different - hanging around the lobby in their pajamas for example. Location ----------------------------- Pretty good. It's about halfway between the Times Square / Broadway area the St. Patrick’s / Rockefeller Center area (but so are about 100 other hotels). 44th between 5th and 6th has some good restaurant choices - decent breakfast joint, an Indian lunch buffet, a classy Greek restaurant, a slick bistro / bar. The Algonquin is also on this block. You have a lot of good après-New York choices right next to (and in) your hotel. Other Compliments ----------------------------- Despite the polished appearance of the lobby they play jazzy techno on the sound system - which I thought was a very cool touch. The halls on our floor had red marble, red carpets, and cinnamon potpourri scent filling the air. The room safe was convenient. The turn-down service / towel change / free Evian was very nice - we essentially got room service twice a day. Complaints ----------------------------- 1. The ice machine on our floor wasn't working. 2. The TV remote control didn't work. 3. The hallway on our floor was too warm. 4. A cabinet door in our room was broken off one of its hinges. 5. We could not get anywhere near the computers in the lobby. Even at 11 PM all 3 were overtaken by kids writing email - when all we wanted was 5 minutes to check out a bar review or the Troussard's hours of operation. Pretty annoying. 6. Too many people using the concierge for recommendations instead of just getting info. Having a conversation about what attractions to see in Manhattan is not appropriate when others are waiting behind you to get the Met's hours or a bus route number.

Reviews.Title: “Everything it was cracked up to be”
Reviews.Author: RoseCambridge
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of what we had read on Trip Advisor. We had booked the basic room and on checking in at 1.00 p.m. asked if we had a good view. We were told we could have a good view if we came back at 3.00 p.m. the normal check in time when one would be available. We returned at the said time and the guy on reception personally went up to our room to check the view and on return said it was good. It was as well, 22nd floor and a good view of the Chrysler building. The beds were everything they were reputed to be and so were the pillows. One criticism may be that there are no tea or coffee making facilities in the room. Despite what others say, I don't think the bar prices were that expensive when you compare with UK hotels of a similar standard. Cleanliness was excellent and the hotel so quiet. You couldn't hear the people upstairs or next door. Good idea to get a Sofitel loyalty card before you go as you can get to keep your room until 4.00 p.m. on check out day and a free welcome drink. The location of the hotel was excellent and the staff very friendly and helpful. There is nowhere else to stay in New York as far as I am concerned.

Reviews.Title: “It lived up to all our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Across_the_globe
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel after reading all the positive reviews and was very pleased at how accurate they are! Everything about this establishment was top-notch from the service to quality of rooms and cleanliness. The location is also very convenient for sightseeing, dining and, most importantly, shopping on 5th Avenue! It was a pleasant surprise to also find that it's only several doors away from the famous Algonquin Hotel. We tried breakfast at the Red Flame Diner upon other reviewer's recommendations and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. It was our first visit to NYC and we had a great time. New Yorkers are a lot friendlier than we'd expected. If we return to NYC we will definitely stay at this hotel again as it probably ranks amongst the top 5 of the best we've ever stayed in around the world and we have stayed at some pretty good hotels! I simply cannot recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Top Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cass73
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with the other rave reviews on this hotel, well worthy of the praise that's been lavished upon it. We stayed at this hotel over the Valentines weekend this year and even the heaviest snow storms for many years didn't spoil our enjoyment of the hotel and NY as a whole. Service was excellent, the staff are extremely helpful, with one concierge happy to forego the opportunity of making some commission on the sale of theatre tickets by advising me to buy direct from the theatre at half the price! I would recommend this hotel as a great stay for couples for a long weekend or for business.

Reviews.Title: “You have to stay at Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: Arttraveller
Reviews.Content: Sofitel in New York is a truly amazing hotel...nicely located midtown (44 between 5th and 6th) so it's easy to walk to museums, theatres, shopping, restaurants, Times Square etc. I arrived on a Saturday in July and was quite early (noon) but was immediately offered a choice of rooms on low or higher floors (chose the 26th for a great view) The early checkin is always nice so you don't waste your day. The room door would not open (my error) but security showed up in under a minute and was more than helpful. Staff are courteous and helpful, and speak with charming french accents--they also speak perfect English of course. The room blew me away...I am very particular about cleanliness and comfort, so was pleased to see a spotless room,. very chic and elegantly furnished, cooled with central air and a gorgeous marble bathroom with deep tub and glassedin shower stall as well. The bed was heavenly, a featherbed and a soft duvet as well as high thread count sheets made for deep sleeping after wandering all over Manhatten. There is a gift shop, bar and restaurant, and fitness area. On the final day of my stay I was able to check out a 5 pm, and once again staff were very gracious about this. Then the doorman found me a limousine to the airport for $35.00 US (normally a limo is over $100.) Not all cabs have air conditioning that works and many smell, so a clean cool limo ride out of the city to La Guardia is always welcomed. I checked comparable rates on various hotel search sites on the Internet and then found a weekend special on their own hotel site that was very reasonable. They did email me a confirmation at a higher rate, but this was immediately corrected when I noted the discrepancy between rates quoted on the phone and those advertised on their site. If you become a Sofitel priviledge card member (apply immediately online) you can get things like room upgrades, late checkouts, points etc. I was alone for this trip, as I left my husband and children home so I could shop and immerse myself in museums but I felt safe and pampered at Sofitel. Now I'd like to return in the fall with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: KL_Sue
Reviews.Content: Location could not be better, you can walk to Times Square, Rockfeller Centre, Empire State. Rooms are large and quiet (views aren't great, but who cares) and in great condition. Don't hesitate to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Arrogant Staff”
Reviews.Author: CA_bchboy
Reviews.Content: Arrogant staff, limited help with problem, followed "comany line", absolutely no effort beyond the company line to assist you. Rooms are comfortable as are the beds, good location too. Good luck. If everything perfect you will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Quietest hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: themomtravels
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a lot of Manhattan hotels. Never before tried the Sofitel. I was a little nervous when I was assigned a room on the fourth floor. Worried about the constant street noise which is usually an issue. Not to worry, being in that room was like being sealed in a cacoon. I never heard one thing from the street. The beds are incredible, complimentary water is nice, bathrooms are very luxurious. My only complaint is Gaby's - limited bar menu for food, extremely overpriced even for NYC standards (one burger, one club sandwich and two beers was over $60). I would stay hear again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: vae
Reviews.Content: We just spent the weekend at the Sofitel in New York and it was wonderful! I had never heard of the hotel, but read the reviews and those did not even explain how wonderful the room was. The bed was by far the most comfortable that I have ever seen in a hotel. right next to Times Square, very helpful employees, and just wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KEA322
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sofitel New York August 4th-6th. After much research and reading of reviews on this site, I chose this hotel. It was our first trip to NYC and this was the ideal location, centrally located to tour the city. We walked just about everywhere. It was also very nicely tucked on a side street so it was always very quiet. The hotel is very clean, beautiful and offers friendly service. The bed was so comfortable; I could not wait to come back to our room every night just for that!!! I followed the advice that many people wrote and signed up for a free Sofitel Privileges card and also emailed the hotel to let them know we were there to celebrate our anniversary. We were upgraded from a queen to king room with a view! We also received champagne and chocolates our first night. With the Sofitel card we also had a 4 PM checkout which was great. This is definitely my most favorite of all hotels I have stayed in and would absolutely stay here again and any other Sofitel. I highly recommend this hotel especially for couples. It's fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous stay at the sofitel!!”
Reviews.Author: reginafalange
Reviews.Content: my husband & i just returned from a FANTASTIC stay at the sofitel. we were celebrating our 5th wedding anniversary & i happened to include that while making our reservation online. vladimer, the conceirge, recommended a great romantic restraunt with exactly the type of cuisine we were wanting. not only did he call us in our room & let us know the time of our reservation, but later that day room service delivers a bottle of champagne with a letter from the hotel manager wishing us a happy anniversary. so nice! i immediately called down to order a wonderful cheese plate to enjoy with the bubbly! everything about our stay at the sofitel was wonderful. the king suite we had was huge with a seperate living area that had a tv, mini bar & a nice size desk. our bedroom had a tv also and both rooms had windows that opened. SUPER comfortable bed with very high thread count sheets. everytime we walked through the lobby we were greeted by at least 2 hotel staff members. the elevators were very fast. the bell staff was excellent in giving directions and getting taxi's. on our way out to jfk the bell suggested a car to the airport rather then a taxi. it's a flat rate to the airport and the taxi is meter, so if there is traffic- well. my husband & i did think it a little weird that our minibar was never restalked . especially since we drank both coke's & bud's on the first day. there was a little trouble printing our boarding passes before we left in that the printer wasn't working, but the conceirge printed them for us. no big deal at all, but i would definately check if the printer is working before checking in online because i had to call the airline and have a manager uncheck us in. it was kind of a pain but certainly not the sofitel's fault. just an fyi. we will definatley stay at the sofitel the next trip to nyc!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: comeaujo
Reviews.Content: I must admit I had very high expectations for this hotel after reading all the positive reviews but after staying there for 3 nights I have to say it is almost perfect. IMHO the location is ideal - so close to Broadway/Times Square, 5th Avenue, Grand Central Station, Rockerfeller Centre, 2 major subway lines, etc. You can even walk to Central Park easily. The rooms are a very good size by NY standards and the beds and bathrooms are basically what you dream of having in your own home. I'm not one to regularly use the services of a Concierge but there were always a couple on hand and they looked very friendly and helpful. They also have free internet in the lobby (3 computers and a printer). We didn't have a great view from our room on the 9th floor but who cares you don't go to NYC to stay in your room anyway (try Top Of The Rock for an amazing view of the city). There is a diner (The Red Flame) just a few doors down towards 6th Ave where you can get a fast and excellent breakfast. If you fly into Newark buy a round-trip bus ticket on the Newark Liberty Express ($23) and get dropped off at Bryant Park. You'll only have to walk a couple of blocks to the hotel on 44th street. PS. If you plan on buying an All-Loops bus tour buy it at the airport WITH your bus ticket b/c they do not honour the discount at the Greyline Visitors Centre on 8th Avenue. What else? Fresh fruit in the lobby every day, ice-cold A/C, did I mention the beds? I will stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “A complete bargain for NYC!!”
Reviews.Author: lovemypup
Reviews.Content: I am a self-professed hotel snob, and am still mourning the closing of the Plaza. I have since stayed at the St Regis, Trump International, Waldorf Towers, and Four Seasons. They are all "nice," and expensive. That's fine. . .you get what you pay for. I saw the rates of the Sofitel (booked on their website for around $250/nt) for three nights in late July. I didn't have the highest of expectations given the price for a hotel in NYC, but boy what a pleasant surprise. I was able to check in almost 2 hours early, and took advantage of their late check-out, and I greatly enjoyed the location in midtown. The twice daily maid service was wonderful, including morning service on the day I checked out! I echo everyone else's comments on the beds, the great Roger & Gallet amenities, the huge bathroom, and I greatly appreciated the peace and quiet (and I was in a room right by the elevator) and rarely heard anyone outside in the hallway. Finally, my room on the 14th floor didn't have much of a view, but it was nice and quiet and comfortable. I believe I may have finally found a new home base in NYC!! Merci Sofitel!!

Reviews.Title: “MAGIC!”
Reviews.Author: OohAhhCantona
Reviews.Content: Went here to celebrate my girlfriends 30th birthday and cant say enough about this hotel. Staff were very friendly and as we were celabrating they upgraded our room with a great view of the chrysler building.And the next day we were greeted with a bottle of champagne and a lovely birthday cake complete with candle left in our room.Really nice touch. Rooms are great and the beds are comfy as hell! Great location too. SUPERB

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: snirtanion
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed at the Sofitel July 22nd-24th. Bottom line, a very nice hotel that I would stay at again. You can expect very comfortable beds, decently sized rooms, and upscale amenities typical of a hotel of this class. Sofitel is in a spectacular location for sightseeing and tourism, safe and convenient to most of NYC's major attractions. I echo the other posters in highly recommending the free Sofitel card, which allows for a room upgrade, complimentary drink and late check-out. It's free, so why not?

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: sansim
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 8 nights in July, after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, and were not disappointed. This hotel was absolutely perfect for our first trip to New York City. I booked with the hotel direct as I wanted to make sure we had connecting rooms for my family. We stayed in two deluxe rooms, we just closed off the end of the corridor with an additional door to make them connecting. We were on the 21st floor and rooms were so quiet and comfortable - the beds are wonderful. The hotel itself is in a wonderful location, just a short walk to Times Square or 5th Avenue. All the staff were incredibily helpful and friendly, especially the doorman. The lobby/lounge area was beautiful, and my sons took full advantage of the free internet access from the pcs which were provided for guest use. Our only small complaint would be the cost of breakfast in Gabys restaurant, quite high for a family of four. This did not prove to be a problem, we had the Red Flame Diner on 44th Street or Starbucks, or Manhattan Cafe on 45th Street. New York City was just fantastic, even during the heatwave! Would recommend visiting "Top of the Rock", much better than Empire State which was very commercial and crowded. fWe also took advantage of the 4 oclock check out for Sofitel Privelige Card Holders. I cannot speak too highly of this hotel and can not wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Mitsumi
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a great spot in town and was a unique sleeping experience (heavenly bed). However, they should work on making their staff more friendly. I arrived early in the morning in the hotel (from an international red eye flight) and they couldn't even offer me to store my luggage and give me a confortable place to rest (while the room was not available). I almost had to beg for a room and still got as an answer: "go out for a walk and return around 12:00 - 1:00pm". Have I mentioned it was freezing outside (in January 2006)?

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: PEME
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel, ideally located in downtown NY with friendly and efficient staff. We spent three nights in NY (July 13 through July 16) and this was a great base for our visit. The room (Queen Deluxe) was pleasant and the bed was a dream. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel to friends who are visiting NY, in particular first time visitors where the location near Times Square and Broadway is ideal. There is also a great diner down the street to kick off your day which is a perfect way to see how New Yorkers live on weekdays in particular, a really great place to eat and watch the world go by !

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Symbill
Reviews.Content: I booked a suite. Excellent value for New York. $440 per night, large bathroom, excellent accomodations and view directly to the Empre State building. Perfect! Would recommend and personally repeat anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect honeymoon at the Sofitel NY”
Reviews.Author: Antwerpenaar
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sofitel NY for a week in july as a part of our honeymoon. They had reserved a deluxe suite for us on the top level, with a magnificent view on Rockefeller Center. Everything was great at the room and its amenities, there was a XL bathroom for NY standards ! The personnel was really helpfull, and the cleanliness was impeccable ! Above all this, the Sofitel has a great location, with a lot of tourist attractions at walking distance e.g. just 2 blocks away from Times Sq and 1 block from 5 th Av. I would recommend it to all leisure travelers, and especially to honeymooners because they go all the way to make your stay special !

Reviews.Title: “The Sofitel Hotel was wonderful and so was the staff!”
Reviews.Author: Southern Cal Traveler
Reviews.Content: We just returned from four nghts at the Sofitel and truly enjoyed the both hotel and the staff. The hotel has a great location and is as beautiful as others have commented, but it was the staff that made the difference. Always a smile and a greeting, always helpful, and very professional. Although I made a reservation on-line, I ended up working with Sandra in reservations after she emailed me to let me know there might be a problem with my reservation. She was great to deal with and worked out my reservation needs and upon our arrival everything was in order. During the rest of the trip, staff was always available, helpful and smiling. Customer service is clearly a priority at the Sofitel. Our room was very, very comfortable (Frette linens and towels) and we had a perfect view of the Empire State Building. The bar was lovely and the food we ordered from the restaurant was delicious. I will definately return to the hotel and will recommend it to others. I will also consdier Sofitel hotels in other cities I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Terrifique!”
Reviews.Author: psycherie
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the Sofitel in Chicago and hoped to have the same great experience in New York. From the extremely helpful bellman to the gracious reception to the chic and cozy room, all of our expectations and hopes were met. Our concierge recommended a wonderful restaurant to us we never would have found on our own, and we found everything about the experience to be top-notch. I would consider staying here again a privilege!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HUTCH1113
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took our annual trip to NYC on July 13th and returned on July 17th, so we got to spend 3 fabulous nights at the Sofitel. Once I laid on the bed for the first time, I wished I was staying there for a month. The room itself is a perfect size with plenty of storage for clothes and anything else you may want to store. We were also extremely happy with the bathroom and the oversized towels that were provided. The bathroom was tastefully decorated, had great lighting and there was tons of room for a NYC bathroom. We stayed in room 1720 and had a nice view of the Chrysler building at night. During the day, you were looking down into an alley and on rooftops. Not very appealing, but the night time made up for it. The location can not be beat, as it is right on 44th street between 5th and 6th avenue. Extremely close to all the great midtown attractions, yet in its own little quiet world. In fact, you would never know that you are only a block and a half from the ever bustling Times Square. We ate at the Red Flame diner next door one evening and had a very nice meal for a reasonable price. We sat by the window, so we got to watch NY walk by as we ate. Also.....I wanted to extend thanks to the Sofitel for the following reason. The day before we were set to leave, my wife got food poisoning from the Rock Center Cafe in Rockefeller Center. She was sick all day and night to the point she couldnt even stand up. Our flight did not leave until 8:30pm on that day, so we had originally planned to store our luggage and do some more sightseeing. Well, that obviously wasnt going to happen. I asked the front desk if we could have late check out (only expecting a couple hours at most). She gave us until 8pm for no extra charge because of the circumstances. Normally, they would charge half the daily rate which would have been an extra $175. Needless to say, we were very grateful for their cooperation. Also, in past cases where we have been granted late checkout, the housekeepers bother you every 15 minutes until you leave. We stayed until 6pm without a peep out of anyone. That was very appreciated since my wife was asleep. I thoroughly enjoyed this hotel. I didnt have one complaint.

Reviews.Title: “What a way to spend your 40th”
Reviews.Author: KatrinaM
Reviews.Content: We had a 4 night stay at this wonderful hotel. It was first class and in the most central location, yet quiet and away from the buzz of NY. This was a surprise trip for my husbands 40th and it must be the best trip we have ever had in our life. With direct flights now from Edinburgh to Newark with Continental Airlines, it made the whole holiday so much easier. Visited everything we could from Central Park, 5th Avenue, Times Square, Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, Empire State Building etc etc. And to top it all on the birthday we took a helicopter trip over the city. Spectacular....... This was a beautiful hotel, good service, large rooms, luxury bathrooms and try the room service (great after a late night on Broadway). We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Four Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vml5
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying at the Hotel Sofitel for the weekend. After taking a red eye flight, we arrived at the hotel around 7am on Sat. The front desk graciously checked us in immediately, and upgraded our room to the extent possible. They had no problem with our early arrival. Doormen, concierge, bellhop and front desk were all very friendly and polite. We stayed in a regular (petite) queen room...the deluxe was not yet available. By NY standards, the room size was average (on the smaller side...two people could not walk together in the hallway/path leading to the room's door). Small amenities like down comforters and pillows and complimentary evian water and fresh orchids in the bathroom were nice touches. The bathroom was average with a separate tub and shower, one sink with an over sized vanity. Everything done in marble, glass and chrome finishes. Soft padded carpeting, terry robes, and digital thermostat control gave the room a comfortable feel. The rooms were clean and so was the bedding and carpet. We had drinks and dessert at the Gaby restaurant downstairs. Prices were normal for NY, leaning on the high side. The raspberry tart was about $17 and very mediocre. The hotel is close to the theater district/Times Square so if you want to be in that area, this is the perfect hotel for you. Overall, this is a solid four star hotel which earns all four stars. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “"Best choice ever ! ..deserves being No.1 !!!”
Reviews.Author: Puedder
Reviews.Content: We stayed for at the Sofitel for three nights in the beginning of July. Booked the best availaible rate on the sofitel homepage. Since I planned my engagement I wrote an e-mail to the hotel and asked for a nice room on the upper floors w/ a nice view. As we got there Mrs Bittner welcomed us personally and told us, that we got a free upgrade to one of the suites on the 21st floor w/ an amazing view towards the Chrysler Buildung. The suite was just amazing...big luxury bath, very nice living room and bedroom w/ one of the best beds I have ever slept in .... WOW !!! I can only say that this hotel is more than worth the money ... staff is always very friendly and helpful and the atmosphere in the hotel is one of a kind for a luxury city hotel !!! This hotel definitely deserves being the No. 1 in New York. Special thanks especially to Mrs Bittner for this memorable stay at the Sofitel - we definitely come back to one of our wedding anniversarys.

Reviews.Title: “A class above”
Reviews.Author: Postcorner
Reviews.Content: We too stayed here based on tripadvisor and all I can say is thank you, thank you, thank you tripadvisor and of course, Sofitel. Not to brag, but we have been lucky enough to stay in hotels all over the world and this is quite possibly the very best. We read the reviews and, knowing New York, were trying not to build our hopes up. Well we shouldn't have worried. It was my partners 30th birthday and, following a tip on here, I emailed the hotel. On arrival we had been upgraded to a high floor room and on our first night had a complimentary (full size) bottle of champagne. The staff at reception were wonderfully polite and pleasant as were the bar staff, concierge and cleaning staff. The attention to detail in the room was amazing, plentiful soaps and accessories, even candles. After one night the staff had learned where we liked things and left the room as we liked it rather than rearrange things every day (I find that so annoying in most hotels). There is even a turndown service with complimentary water (necessary in the heat), fresh towels, etc. The staff were always very friendly and courteous and we didn't feel disturbed in anyway. They respected us as customers and you didn't feel like you were disrupting their schedule, as you often do elsewhere. The standard of cleanliness is impecable and the size of the room very generous for New York. The bed, well, just amazingly comfortable, even little details like the bottom pillow being slightly bigger had been thought of. Can't say enough, complimentary internet, very nice evening bar area and it goes on. I have never stayed in a Sofitel before and will certainly be using them again. I would not stay anywhere else in New York, that's for sure. The hotel is quite obviously managed extremely well and hopefully the standards won't slip as it becomes more and more popular thanks to tripadvisor. Oh and location, 200 yards from 5th avenue, 3 blocks from times square and the deli just on the right as you head to sixth, The Red Flame, serves a hearty breakfast. In short, (at last!) everything about Sofitel New York was just perfect and made our trip quite possibly the most pleasant vacation we've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our 1st visit to NYC.The Sofitel was perfect in every way, all staff were helpful, decor was styish and intimate, beds and pillows were heaven to sleep in, rooms were so quiet considering this is center of city. Location was great, loved the bar and wonderful food at Gaby's hotel restaurant.The Red Flame diner a few doors away is fine for quick breakfast and Daniel Bisto is next door, also amazing food. I would stay in this hotel next visit and recommend others to do so. This is also 1st time I have used Trip Advisor but it will not be the last. Christine N.Z.

Reviews.Title: “A very well managed property....”
Reviews.Author: sarman
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two night "escape" to Manhattan. The Sofitel is a very fine hotel. We booked an internet special for a suite, requesting a higher floor - we were given 2508.... very clean, spacious, comfortable and quiet. We even tried the on-site restaurant, Gaby's, and enjoyed our selections - sea scallops for me, tuna for the wife -......( note to kitchen.....the rice cake underneath the tuna needs some fine tuning). We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice”
Reviews.Author: Tripper200607
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel is well located for mid-town Manhattan, the level of fit, finish and maintenance is well up to par for the standard of hotel, and the staff provided good service. Unless you get a deal on the price, however, this can be a little steep, and that's the one thing that predicates against an Excellent ranking.

Reviews.Title: “Without Peer”
Reviews.Author: Hank298
Reviews.Content: I had a dual purpose stay in NYC, July 7-9, celebrating my anniversary and meeting with a significant client. I made reservations at the Sofitel Hotel because of the high recommendations made here. I was not disappointed. From the time of our arrival we were treated as honored guests. In looking for a location in the hotel to meet with my client I was introduced to the business sales director, Ms Francoise Christine, and she personally took us to several rooms to find the perfect setting for my meeting. The first evening, just prior to our "night on the town" to celebrate our anniversary, my wife and I were treated to a wonderful bottle of French champagne, compliments of the hotel. The beds were totally "as advertised" and our suite on the 25th floor had a great view and was a bargain by New York standards. You really can't find a better location for a pleasure visit. It's central to everything..... 5th Avenue shopping, Times Square, and the theater district. Everything was within easy walking distance. Away from the hotel, which is hard to leave because of the pleasantries of the entire staff, we saw Mamma Mia, which was great, light-hearted fun. We dined the first evening at the Divine Bar known for its wine and tapa selections. While nice, it didn't meet the standards of the recommendations I had read. Nevertheless, it was very convenient to Broadway and our show that evening. Our second night we dined with my clients at Michael's Restaurant, W. 55th St., on the recommedation of my next door neighbor and we arrived on "celebrity night"! We dined early and the restaurant was almost empty on our arrival at 6:15pm and the group following us in included Mary Tyler Moore and Bernadette Peters. Shortly afterward, Frank Gifford took the table next to ours (sans Kathy Lee) with another couple. The food was quite good (I'm a tough food critic) but the ambience and wine selection were wonderful. We completed the evening with a visit to the Gotham City Comedy Club headling Tony Rock, Chris Rock's younger brother. Anyone going to NYC should strongly consider a visit to the Sofitel Hotel. It's a great value and they out-Ritz the Ritz!

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel is So fit for a queen!”
Reviews.Author: linzi10
Reviews.Content: I booked the Sofitel for my mom's trip to NYC. I got a great internet rate for a queen room but was upgraded to a larger room upon arrival and presentation of my Sofitel privilege card. Service was fabulous, we forgot a few things, and they were brought right up. I was given a key to the room at 1pm so that I could take up a gift for my mom.
