The beds are absolutely fabulous -- the only downside is that you won't want to get up! But you must get up and travel to the neighboring Bryant Park for some excellent people watching and/or drinks at the Bryant Park Grill. Just as my stay at the Sofitel DC, I was more than pleased with the Sofitel here in NYC. And after staying at several NYC high end hotels -- the Sofitel is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Simply The Best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from six nights at the New York Sofitel. Whilst this is our first Tripadvisor report - our opinion of the Sofitel is based on comparison with a variety of Hotels across four continents. Our 'Best' Hotels to date have been the Shangri La Singapore and the Bangkok Marriott Resort & Spa. Until now we had not stayed at a Sofitel Hotel. So why has staying at the Sofitel caused us to go into print? Because the Hotel made a great visit to New York even better. We were on the 23rd floor with a great view of the Chrysler Building. The room was a good size with ample space around the bed and a separate seating area. The bathroom had both bath and separate walk-in shower which we consider essential. The non-smoking room was well presented, clean with good quality furniture, towels etc. The bed was simply the best Hotel bed we have experienced - just so comfortable. The room was serviced twice a day which meant when you dropped back to the Hotel (great location – central but quiet) to have a midday shower (its hot and humid in July) you knew that the clean room and towels you were using would be replaced for the evening. Best of all - all the staff are so friendly, informative and helpful. Meals were expensive compared to local eateries. We choose to to eat out for three quarters of the time on the basis of cost and also to experience New Yorkers food – but when we did eat in the Hotel we found the food and service excellent. Why was the Sofitel New York so different and so good? It is very difficult to put into words - we have stayed in many Hotels which provide equally as good rooms, clean beds and showers, a pleasant ambiance, friendly staff and are situated in good locations. But being at the Sofitel just made us ‘feel’ good. The overall experience was greater than the sum of the parts. You will just have to try it for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “1st Rate Accomodations & Extra Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: 57sport
Reviews.Content: Returned late Mon night after spending 3.5 days @ this beautiful hotel. The positive reviews posted on this forum were right on target. Visited NYC w/ Mom, 2 sisters, cousin and her friend, June 30 - July 3. I was the only one in our party that had never visited the city before and each encounter with anyone was friendly (almost as good as the south). If you've never been to the Sofitel, please go, if only for 1 night. The room was very spacious and we were on the 21st floor. I speak a little French and was amazed that each french-speaking employee took the time to slowly ask questions and respond to mine to make sure I understood. Formidable! I travel quite a bit for pleasure and the ammenities were top notch. Ditto to each post regarding the room & the hotel. We were 2 to a room and the european twin beds (longer and wider than standard twin in the states, although not as wide as a full bed) were parallel to the Wynn beds in Las Vegas. Registration as well as check-out was a breeze; concierge (Vladimir) has lots of patience with guests on the phone or in line at his desk. The bellman could answer our questions specific to any subject and made sure we understood his directions. Due to time restraints we were able to cram lots of attractions, however, will return to complete the sights. Bring very comfortable shoes, lots of water and a camera, as this is a walking city, sort of like San Francisco, without the hills. Once you've had a taste of the luxurious atmosphere at the Sofitel, you won't want to stay anywhere else. I absolutely, positively, give the Sofitel 5 stars in all catergories and can't wait to return! Au Revoir et Bon Soir mes amies...

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: You cannot find a better hotel with such a wonderful location, beautiful rooms and impeccable service. We recently had a four night stay and everything was exceptional! The Concierge was very helpful! The room we stayed in (King Suite) was huge....beautiful...comfortable bed....and QUIET! The location is wonderful and within walking distance of everthing. I would 100% reccomend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't deserve no. 1 rating”
Reviews.Author: muzzmashe
Reviews.Content: Five night stay - June 21-26 -my son's wedding - had booked months in advance - "Superior Room" for me and wife - $379 a night - plus taxes - THE ROOM WAS SO SMALL we couldn't both walk around up at the same time. This was clearly a single room - one bathrobe in the rroom - at night when they gave you the little water bottle (big deal) 1 was left - the towels were sparse - I complained and i must say they responded to my complaint promptly - a Ms. Aline Bitkind was sympathetic and offered us another room - the next day - the room was more to what we had expected - nice size - except the smell of cigarette smoke permeated the room even though it was supposed to be a non smoker -but by this time i didn't feel like complianiung again . Even with this room I don't see the no. 1 rarting - sure it's a good location - it's quiet - friendly helpful staff - but they charge $10 a day for wireless service three computers in the lobby are always beeing used) It's a very nice hotel - clean and good service but really - at those prices - nothing that special. reading some of the reviews i am certain that they are not -- at least some of them - by unaffiliated people - I have nt prroof - just the way they're worded -

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience - ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel thanks to Trip Advisor, and we're so glad we did. All the other reviews are spot on; it's difficult to praise the Sofitel NYC too much. The comfy bed, sumptuous bathroom and quality decor are all as previously described. We thought we'd mention a few special touches that really impressed us. In the bathroom we had both a generous shower cubicle and a full-sized bath. Far too many clean towels appeared every day and the toilet roll was regularly folded into a neat pointy shape at the end when the cleaning staff had visited. They also left us complimentary bottles of Evian and a handy card telling us what the weather would be like the following day. The staff were friendly and helpful the whole time. We even spotted the doorman handing out an umbrella to a random passer-by as she was getting so soaked (it rained a lot while we were there). We loved the xylophone chime the staff used to summon the porters (obviously we weren't allowed to carry our own cases). The only thing to avoid would be using room service - which is very expensive. And don't believe what you see in the main mirror either - we've never looked so tall and thin! We got a very good deal on a Premier Queen room, so much so that we were convinced there must have been some mistake! We'll definitely be going back, but now we've seen pictures of the King rooms...

Reviews.Title: “wow, wow, wow”
Reviews.Author: lilirishstar
Reviews.Content: Travel advisor members are right again. We stayed at the Sofitel this past weekend. It exceded all our expectations. It was our first visit to New York and it was close to everything. The hotel (starting with the wonderful lobby) was beautiful. The spacious (by NY standards) room had a nice view, cool artwork, and a very, very plush bed. The extra large closets include robes and slippers. Inside the swinging doors to the bathroom we found a marble shower next to the tub, fresh flowers and candle with matches. Little extras like many light switches and plugs almost went unnoticed. Wow! As an extra bonus, Chris Rock was shooting a movie scene right across the street on our last day there. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel (just one "but"...)”
Reviews.Author: golffanatic
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Sofitel at the end of April and were delighted with the hotel, in common with most other reviewers - room and bathroom very clean, very comfortable beds and friendly staff. Despite all the good mentions of the diner just outside the hotel, we decided to be lazy and had room service breakfast every day, which was brought up by a delightful lady. However, on the last night, when we came to settle the bill, we noticed that there was a charge of approximately $50 for Gaby's Restaurant food, and we had only been to Gaby's for one drink on one occasion. On further enquiry, this turned out to be a breakfast of French Toast. When I asked to see the signed bill, someone had written my surname (but spelt it wrongly) and my room number. As we had obviously not been there, due to the room service breakfast, the item was deducted from my account. In view of this, I feel there should be some form of checking when signing in the hotel, and the fact that my name was on it, was quite worrying. As I was checking out of the hotel, I asked for the manager's email address. I was given a business card, which I later noticed was an Assistant Front Office Manager's card. I emailed her when I returned, but six weeks later, have had no response. As I said at the beginning of this review, overall we were delighted with the hotel and would certainly return, but I am disappointed that no-one saw fit to reply to my email.

Reviews.Title: “The only problem was I didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: An exceptionally great hotel, very clean (I'm very fussy about that kind of thing!) and the location couldn't have been better for a base to explore NYC. When we checked in the lady at reception said as we were staying for a full week that they would upgrade us to a King room which had a view of the Empire State Building! I know everyone reviewing the hotel has mentioned the beds, but they are most definitely worth mentioning again! it was like sleeping on a big fluffy white cloud! exactly what is needed after full days and nights of shopping, sightseeing and enjoying NYC nightlife. I think that although the hotel is a bit expensive it is worth it as NYC can get a bit hectic and I personally found the Sofitel to be a comfortable and relaxing haven to recharge! The buses were a great way to get around and see more sights, we paid 24 dollars to get a weeks pass which is unlimited travel on the buses and also the subway (which is about a million times better than the London underground) otherwise each trip is 2 dollars regardless of destination. I personally found New Yorkers to be incredibly friendly and very helpful. I hope anyone choosing the Sofitel will have a great stay as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were spending only one night in New York, so I did a lot of online research to pick one that sounded nice, comfortable, was convenient to the theater district but not right in it, and which fit our budget of $300 or less. Based on the reviews here, I chose Sofitel and booked the cheapest room at $259. What a great deal -- you get so much for what you pay, particularly in New York. As recommended, I mentioned it was our anniversary online, not thinking anything would come of it, but when we arrived, the extremely friendly and helpful Gabrielle told us we had been given a deluxe room on the 27th floor. We had a view of Chrysler Building (and the Puerto Rican Day Parade preparations the next morning) and there was sparking wine waiting for us with a thoughtful note. The bed indeed was the most comfortable I've ever slept in. The room was big by any standards, and the bathroom was enormous by any standards. Both a shower and a tub (with a detachable showerhead), large sink with a large lit mirror, mood lighting, a candle, and fresh flowers. Lots of closet space with all different kinds of hooks. The blackout curtains were great, as we were up late the night before. The room was totally dark. Best of all was the soundproofing. Not only could we not hear any street noise, particularly the preparation for the Puerto Rican Day Parade, replete with bands and DJs blaring full blast as we discovered when we went outside, but, most incredible of all, when I opened the door, I discovered someone vacuuming right outside our door. I couldn't even hear the vacuum when I was on the other side of the door! Left our bags with the concierge as we explored the city on Sunday. No charge to leave the bags. Also, when we checked in the night before, Gabrielle asked if we wanted late checkout. Staff was extremely helpful. We were sad to go and wished we could have stayed longer. Only criticisms: bathrobes were a bit scratchy (big deal) and the air conditioning was finicky. Either too cold or too warm, even if you only adjusted it one notch.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel NYC = Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: herbocka
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a quick 2 night get away to NYC with my girlfriend. We had been to NYC once before but stayed in a different hotel. I did a lot of research this time around and all the reviews on this website about the Sofitel are bang on. We had a great room with one of the best beds in the world! I think it was better than my bed at home. Anyways, hotel staff was great and very friendly. The hotel was pretty quite for NYC and overall a great atmosphere. As for location you are about 1 minute to all the shopping on 5th and 6th Avenue, 5 mins to Times Square, 15 minutes to Central Park. One suggestion is to join their rewards program on-line (it is free) you get a late check-out (if you ask 4pm) which is perfect for a late flight, 2 free drinks at the bar and points towards a free stay. Next time we go to NYC we will be staying at the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Super Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: marvthemarv
Reviews.Content: I booked accommodation for a six day stay in May direct with the hotel early in February and asked that if possible my wife and I could be upgraded. The total cost with taxes was not cheap at $2,259 but I was encouraged by the reviews on this site. Sure enough upon arrival we were given an upgrade to a large well furnished room on the 18th floor. King size bed, air/con that worked perfectly and big fluffy towels in a large marble bathroom were very satisfactory. After two days however we were apologetically asked to vacate our room as work had to be done to an adjoining room and access was needed. We were given a 25th floor suite as compensation.....large well furnished sitting room and adjoining bedroom each with independent air/con and of course that marble bathroom; a couple of happy campers.The entrance hall was delightfully understated with marble floor and leather seating. Highly scented pot purri and fresh fruit in bowls were changed frequently. Being in such a great situation we didn`t eat in the hotel except for a well served and large pot of tea one evening. The restaurant 50 yards from the hotel served marvellous New York food at any time. The highest breakfast bill we had was $16.00 for two full breakfasts including tip. The nearby Indian restaurant was also of good standard and about the same cost as London. Taxis were always available within seconds and the staff at all levels were an example to other supposedly 4* or 5* establishments. There is no doubt we will return here for future visits to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at a well-run hotel”
Reviews.Author: labyrinthhuntrr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sofitel this past weekend. The hotel is beautiful, with fresh flowers and a deep, thick carpet in the lobby. Even the lobby music was hip and subtle, but not pretentious. We didn't go to any Broadway shows this trip, but it would have been a convenient location if we had decided to do so. We locked ourselves out of our room, and the front desk staff was polite and quickly gave us new room keys. Storing luggage and having taxis called was also done politely and efficiently. Our room had a view of the city. The art hung in the room was tasteful and romantic. The bed and bedding were very clean and comfortable. The bathroom included a marble shower and a standard tub. The room service menu was extensive and delivered quickly, if somewhat pricey. If I had to nitpick, I would note that only one washcloth and one bathrobe was in the room (although I'm sure if we had requested more, they would have been provided). One of the closets did not close properly without some finagling. The bathroom had double doors, which left a small gap between them. However, these were definitely minor issues and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay, and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Ruined our Vacation”
Reviews.Author: kmturk
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at sofitel not knowing that it will be a disaster in waiting. For a hefty amount we booked a room for 5 nights. When we go there on 5/27 1:30 am the manager Melisa got rude with us when we asked for the King room. She said we will only get the Queen room. She forced us to contact price line if we wanted king room. Priceline was closed at that time so we disappointingly settled for Queen room. She was also not willing to give us any room above 15th floor. Next day we talked with Priceline to ask for King room and they said it was upto Hotel management. I was on phone for almost one hour with Priceline and Sofitel managment tossing me to each other. This was our first trip to New York which had already started on a bad note. Eventually Sofitel management asked us to pay $100 extra per night if we wanted the King size room. Interestingly another staff person at the desk had asked for $80 earlier and yet another one for $50. Me and my wife were so frustrated and disappointed with Sofitel that we settled with our Queen room and focused on the NY City and tried to forget the worst experince that we had with Sofitel and Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic in NY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the Sofitel due to the reviews i read on this site and i wasn't dissapointed. Iit has a great location, one block from Time Square and one block from fifth avenue, and like everybody else the beds are the most comfortable ones i have ever slept in, the rooms are huge for NY and are very well presented, i would recommend this hotel to anyone and i will stay there again next time.

Reviews.Title: “What could we have done to make your stay more enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Travellersfromswitzerland
Reviews.Content: "What could we have done to make your stay more enjoyable" - this was the key question of the Sofitel N.A. survey we found in our inbox returning home from a 6-nights stay at Sofitel N.Y. And indeed we had to leave the answer blank as nothing came to our mind. Thanks to all Sofitel employees that contributed to make our N.Y.C. experience enjoyable ! We have chosen Sofitel based on the positive reviews on Tripadvisor - thanks to all that have taken their time to report on Tripadvisor allowing others to take advantage of their experience and putting pressure on service providers to all travellers benefit ! Previous reports have given detailed descriptions - we wish to add some elements we found important with regard to our stay: 1. We have done the booking at the lowest available internet rate with full advance payment and no cancellation option. As we were sure about our dates with international flights confirmed and with a private trip insurance in case of Force Majeure, we found this option attractive and it worked out well. 2. We have acquired a Sofitel Priviledge card through the Sofitel website giving points towards a free stay and enjoyed a free drink of our choice during our stay and late check-out until 4 PM which was just perfect in light of the early evening flights to Europe. 3. The first few mornings, we followed earlier advice to get breakfast in neighboring coffee shops as to give support to the common travellers' claim for more reasonable breakfast charge-out. Indeed the in-house American breakfast sums up with gratuity and tax to $26. Nonetheless, the various coffee shops we tried out charged between $15 and $19 with incomparable quality and service. The last two mornings, we had in-house American breakfast including espresso, which for Europeans unused to American breakfast and especially what is commonly called "coffee", appears still to be the lesser of two evils. 4. As first-timers to N.Y. we found a room with a view essential. Either thanks to the Sofitel Priviledge card or to my wife's smile, but this is how our room's view looked like... Good night and good luck!

Reviews.Title: “The Wonderful Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights in the The Sofitel New York and that is where I'll stay when I return to NYC. This hotel is a dream. My room was on the 20th floor, and I had a spectaular view of the Chrysler Building. My room's queen-sized bed was like heaven, covered by a very soft down comforter. The bathroom had both a large soaking tub and a large shower. The room was very clean and everything was in fine working order. I ordered room service several times and found the food delicious. The service in this hotel is just fantastic - friendly and prompt. Local friends told me that the room was large and luxurious compared to what one would find at most hotels in NYC for the price, which averaged 439 per night ( I made the reservations at the last minute on Expedia). The Sofitel is centrally located in Midtown Manhattan, in the theater district, which means you are in the center or the center of the cultural universe. I walked everywhere I wanted to go - MOMA, Central Park, the Manhattan School of Music, to Carnegie Hall, the Trattoria Dell'Arte (great Italian restaurant), the NYC Public Library, and Times Square, and the Sofitel is just a short cab ride to Greenwich Village and all of the jazz clubs (check out the Zinc Bar). Fifth Avenue shopping is just around the corner and Little Brazil a few blocks away. I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ardenp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel for a quick anniversary getaway in Manhattan - I picked it based on its excellent reviews on this site, and couldn't have been more pleased. The service was amazing - we checked in early, got upgraded to a suite when they didn't have a room on the upper floors (which I had reserved online) and received a complimentary bottle of champagne with a handwritten note congratulating us on our anniversary! (I recommend mentioning this in the comments section when making the reservation). The bed was very comfortable with luxurious linens (very similar to the Westin Heavenly Bed), and the bathroom was beautiful as well. The suite was spacious (we did see the standard sized room as well and it was reasonably sized). The room was well soundproofed. I had looked at many of the other luxury hotels in Manhattan - I can't imagine how they could have been any nicer than the Sofitel, which was priced more reasonably. I would definitely stay there again, and would consider staying at its other resort locations in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Join the Club!”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravelers4106
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel while we were visiting New York for a wedding. We joined the Sofitel privilege card club on the internet just a few hours before we checked in. We requested via-e-mail our card number so we could add it to our reservation. We called ahead and gave the number, which meant we got an upgraded room, late check out, free use of the gym and a two free drinks at the bar. It's absolutely worth taking a few minutes to sign up. Definitely try the French Martini's at the bar! The rooms at this hotel were very clean and pretty spacious. I was surprised they did not have a coffee pot which would have been nice and a friend ordered a pot of coffee for an nearly morning wake up only to find they brought her decaff. But the location of this hotel is perfect if you want to be in the heart of things and if you are seeing any Broadway shows. Almost everything is within walking distance or a quick cab ride. The staff was helfpul if not overly friendly. We would definitley recommend this hotel for nice getaway in the City.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel New York - ASK for extras!”
Reviews.Author: KeysOceanDrive
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel for 3 nights (May 20-23, '06). We paid $302.35 each night including taxes thru Expedia when booked with our airfare. I have seen better and I have seeen worse rates.... Another guest did the following which I think are excellent ideas- I didn't read thoroughly enough though to do this for our visit- I hope you do....: -emailed the hotel prior to arrival to confirm booking and request a room with a good view - also mentioned that it as a special trip for both -On arrival they were given -a free upgrade to a deluxe Queen room on the top floor (29th) with an amazing view of the Chrysler Building - a complimentary bottle of Champagne on ice with 2 small boxes of chocolates and bottled water - It's in a great location, with plenty going on in the surrounding area - between 5th & 6th Aves. at 44th& 45th Sts. Theatre district to the west and shopping to the north. -Our room was #1414, no view but still nice. Very neutral decor and everything is newer and updated throughout. - The room was a nice size with a desk, chair, 2 side chairs and table, mini bar ($5.50 for 1 can of Diet Coke), 2 nightstands, safe large enough for laptop, built in lighted closet and shelves for clothing. -The bed was very comfortable., it felt like you were sandwiched between two duvet covers, ask for a top sheet though! - Nice marble seperate shower, sink and porc. bathtub , makeup mirror, towels were large but not thick and fluffy- given 3 for 2 peoplle, ask for more if needed! - That diner is really good and convenient, Starbucks out the back door thru the restaurant. -Restaurant/bar nice for after dinner drink, decorated in leopard prints. -We would definitely stay there again! And do take the Top of the Rock tour at Rockefeller! Also, the Boathouse restaurant in Central Park was beautiful on the pond on a beautiful sunny May day! Also the discount tickets box office has been moved off of Times Square (think west) near the Marriott Marquis Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “SOFITEL HOTEL NYC - Really good hotel - highly recommend ! ! !”
Reviews.Author: Reader
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel Hotel in NYC for two nights in May. It's a really good hotel. The room was extremely comfortable, clean and modern - great beds! The bathroom was excellent - a wonderful shower!! The bar and restaurant were lovely but really pricey! The Red Flame Diner a few doors down is perfect for breakfast. The location was great - midtown near Times Square. We walked everywhere. Central Park was good fun and the new Apple Store opposite the Plaza Hotel is worth checking out. The staff at the Sofitel were very helpful but they were also a bit frosty... The man at Conceirge wasn't really that helpful - a forced politeness. However, I would definitely stay at this hotel again. A perfect Hotel to stay in especially if this is your first trip to NYC. It was worth paying a little extra for the Sofitel because it was so comfortable - it's also a safe hotel and in a good neighbourhood. Not five star - but a very good 4 star!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute World Class”
Reviews.Author: wacka
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 6 times in the last year. The location is perfect. Vlad, the conceirge, is only out ranked by his assistant, the most beautiful female concierge in New York! The room is spacious and extremely tasteful. The service from the bellmen to the front desk is efficient, friendly, and extremely professional. I would rank this as one of my favorite hotels in the world. Period.

Reviews.Title: “An unusually quiet NYC hotel”
Reviews.Author: Westonian
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a basic double room facing 45th Street on the 16th floor for the Internet rate of $399 + $56.89 taxes = 455.89. The check-in was fast at a well-staffed front desk. The room, while not large, was well furnished and well-equipped with the exception of coffee/tea-making equipment, which is not even available from housekeeping on demand. The bathroom had a separate, glassed-in shower stall. Everything in both the bedroom and the bathroom was like new. The biggest plus was the excellent soundproofing, which yielded total silence throughout the night -- no trace of any traffic noise -- something not provided by many much more expensive NYC hotels. Another unusual plus in New York City was the very smart, polite, efficient and apparently bilingual staff in both the hotel and the restaurant. The biggest minus was the lack of coffee/tea making equipment. The minimal continental breakfast from Room Service costs just under $25 per person when the taxes and mandatory tip are factored in. Check-out was fast and accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and warm”
Reviews.Author: Thebrowndog
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 2 night stay at Sofitel.It was great.Very centrally located.A short walk to times square or fifth ave. Everyone was very french..but very friendly.Room service was quick, front desk was quick. The rooms are spotlessly clean.Housekeepers were lovely.But, the bed is beyond good it is heavenly!They just engulf you in feathers from the featherbed to the comforter and pillows.It is like sleeping on a cloud. Fresh flowers in the bathroom which is all marble. I don't have a bad word to say about Sofitel I would recommend it and will stay there in our future trips to the city

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel for 3 nights between 20th April to 23rd April 2006 which was purely based on the recommendations on Trip Advisor and I am pleased to say I was not disappointed. I booked it online direct with the Sofitel as I found this was cheaper. The trip was a surprise for my husbands 40th birthday and after requesting a high floor we got a free upgrade on arrival to floor 26. (We didnt get the champagne that others have mentioned but didnt let this spoil it). The reception staff and Concierge were always helpful and we were allowed to check out 1 hour later and left our luggage at the front desk until we had to catch our flight. Great view from our wiindow of the Chrysler Building and round the corner from Empire State Building. The room size was ample for the two of us and yes the beds are the best we have ever slept in. We have never walked as much as we did in New York and we felt the comfort of the beds more than met our standards. (I agree you do need comfortable shoes). Bathroom was quite large and the room had lovely finishing touches and we were told the weather forecast and given free water every night by the maid service. Did not eat at the Sofitel mainly due to being expensive but there are so many great places to eat that this was not a problem. Turn right when you come out of the hotel and there is a great diner called Red Flame which serves great breakfasts which were great value. Also try Planet Hollywood they do BOGOF drinks between 4 and 6 pm. Other good places were TGI Fridays which had several locations throughout NY. There are a couple of good Irish pubs on 45th Street, one of which is called Connollys which do nice food and it has a good atmosphere. On a Sunday there is a big street market going down this street which was quite good. The hotel is located within 5mins walk from Times Square and close to Grand Central Station, Chrysler building, ESB, Bryant Park and Rockefellar centre. It took us about 15-20mins to walk to Central Park. We used the subway to get down to Ground Zero and the Statue of Liberty which was hassle free. One experience worth doing is the Helicopter Tour called the Big Apple which takes you over the Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island and down the Hudson river with Liberty Helicopters. Try to catch a show on Broadway, we went to see Chicago at the Ambassador Theatre which was excellent. Shopping in New York is excellent we found Maceys as one of the best stores (dont forget to get your discount card from the customer service desk in Maceys). We flew into Newark and got taxis to and from the Sofitel which cost about £35 including tip one way. Whilst in NY we had two extreme sides of the weather - first 2 days were scorching hot and the last 2 days were downpours but the hotel very kindly borrowed us a large umbrella so we were still able to walk about and not get wet. We flew with Continental airlines which were also excellent and by being able to check in online at the hotel we found this saved us queuing up at Newark. All we had to do was drop off our suitcases at a desk. New York is a great city where we felt safe walking around and we would definitely stay at the Sofitel again, its a bit pricey as you don't spend much time in your bedroom while visiting NY but well worth it for a once in a lifetime visit.

Reviews.Title: “ok, but not number 1”
Reviews.Author: kate227patt
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights early May in a suite as a special trip. Suite was spacious and decor was lovely, however there were large tears in the sofa which I was a little surprised at. Bathroom was great, again very spacious and very clean. Bed was very comfortable as other reviewers have stated. I signed up for the privilege card which meant we were given free drinks tokens at check in, for cocktails/champagne, this was a nice touch. The card also entitled us to a late check out of 4pm. Good in theory but in reality we had to pack/finish getting washed, dressed etc with the maid in the room as she told us she had to have the room cleaned and ready for 4pm. Note that we checked out at 3.30 so she was in our room with us from about 3pm. Not so good for privacy. Overall a good hotel but I wasn't too impressed with the service for the price I paid for a suite.

Reviews.Title: “mad about this place”
Reviews.Author: emma2007Dublin
Reviews.Content: i am just back from 5 nights in new york and reason i stayed here was trip advisor.. and the reviews didnt let me down, cos we are irish we normally stay in fitpatricks never again! wouldnt stay anywhere else in new york then the sofitel.. from the moment we pulle dup outside the hotel the experience was brilliant! the beds were the best beds i have ever stayed in the staff were out of this world.. my mum was very ill when we arrived they nearly carried her up the the bed! the bathrooms were fab so clean and the extras like the candle and all that was brilliant we walked down to the show in times square (7 mins) we walked to macys( 14 mins) its just brilliant we had rooms service... we had club sambo pizza burger and salad it was all just lovely breakfast of pankcakes and porridge was yummie to delivered to the room and so fresh and tasty i cant say enough i just loved it we were 4 out to shop for the 4 days and it was prefect two twin rooms right beside each other on the 21st floor... u couldnt hear a car or anything two words sofitel hotel - perfect for shopping id say a romatic weekend or bussines i will defo be going back and cant wait

Reviews.Title: “Well deserved award”
Reviews.Author: peronei
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in New York for 5 nights at the Sofitel. The welcoming staff was not overly friendly but that was okay. We loved the entrance hall and the whole appearence of the hotel. The room was very nice and clean not very spacious but absolutely spotless ( I was looking for the spots but could not find any). Try to get a high floor as the views are fantastic day and night. For some odd reason we had a crib in our room which we never requested. After several apologies the staff removed the crib. One bulb in the bathroom had to be replaced I think they did it within a few minutes after we reported it. Very fast and efficient service. The location is also absolutely fantastic you can walk everywhere and you are there in the middle of time square within 3 minutes walk. The good thing is although the hotel is so central it is still very quite and peaceful. For breakfast we recommend the red flame dinner as it has the best breakfast ever. I generally do not like hotels but this one is very superb and I would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfu Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from April 26-30 after reading all the positive reviews on Trip Advisor. We were in NYC for our 10th Anniversary. Upon checking in we found out that they upgraded us to a suite on the 29th floor with a beautiful view of the Chrysler Building. The staff was very nice and made us feel right at home. This hotel is perfectly located in downtown Manhattan.. easy to walk to most things you would want to go to. Perfect for shopping on 5th Ave and not a far walk to Lord and Taylor and Macys. We ate breakfast at the Red Flame every morning since the hotel restaurant seemed quite pricey. We had originally booked a room at the Westin on Times Square.. VERY glad we didn't stay there.. was very noisy around that hotel. The Sofitel is very quiet and peaceful. Saw Monty Python's Spamalot.. totally hilarious!!! Would recommend this musical to anyone. Would definitely stay at the Sofitel again!!!

Reviews.Title: “PURE LUXURY”
Reviews.Author: KC305
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at the Sofitel New York, and strongly encourage anyone looking for a hotel in NY to choose this one. The rooms are very spacious and spotlessly clean, with extremely comfortable beds, large windows with nice views (we looked out at the Rockefeller Center, our parents looked out at the Chrysler building). There is a great gym, an excellent restaurant and free internet in the lobby. The location is great, between 5th and 6th Ave, a short walk to just about everything in midtown. What really sets this hotel apart from others and gives it the #1 spot that it so rightly deserves are the people who work there. Every single person was extremely friendly, well mannered and helpful. From the second our taxi pulled up outside, we were greeted with big smiles and service beyond what we would ever have expected. We had two standard rooms reserved and upon checkin, one was kindly upgraded to a suite. Furthermore, the hotel manager came out to personally introduce himself to us and to ensure that everything was ok. My parents were there to celebrate a very special anniversary and the hotel could not have done more to make this a trip to remember. From the champagne, to the specially made cake and the beautiful suite, we were all in awe of just how much this hotel and its team members really care about their guests. In the 4 days that we were there, it was actually impossible to get past the front desk without being warmly acknowledged by whoever was on duty. Housekeeping was outstanding - they kept the rooms looking like we were the first people ever to stay in them, I have never seen a bathroom sparkle so brightly before, and the turndown service was a nice treat to come back to after dinner. We all agreed we would never stay anywhere in New York again other than the Sofitel. All the people we met during our stay, from the manager to the concierge, front desk, housekeeping and restaurant staff, we now think of as our friends. Whoever reads this review, I hope you get to experience the satisfaction of staying with them also. We can't wait to get back there again one day soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: edpovall
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights at the Sofitel at the end of April and had a great time. I've given it 4 out of 5 only because I think 5 should be reserved for outstanding hotels and I think the Sofitel fell just short. We arrived at about 1pm and they had a room ready on the 12th floor. I asked if they had anything higher up and they said they would have a room on the 18th floor that would be ready at 3. So we plumped for that one and went for a wander around. When we came back later the 18th floor room wasn't ready so they put us on the 20th floor. Good points: - Good size rooms - Lovely bathroom - Rooms were quiet - VERY comfy bed - Excellent maid service - the rooms were done twice a day - Good central location There are no major negative points but if I'm being REALLY picky: - The shower lacked power - Towels were not particulalry luxurious - Service was a little cold - A TFT television would have been nice instead of the CRT - The air con was a bit on the loud side - The reception desk was in an odd location around the back of the lobby Overall a really good hotel that made for an excellent first time in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ZoJo
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Sofitel mid afternoon on a Saturday. Our room wasn't ready, we asked for a room on one of the upper floors and were asked to return in an hour. When we did that they said there was still nothing available so as we were tired we took the room we were offered on the 4th floor. The person we spoke to on both occasions was most unhelpful and dismissive. The next day we got someone far more helpful and he promised us a room mid afternoon. When we went back we were given something on the 19th floor. Other than that, this hotel is very good, very quiet and the staff other than the person we got when we arrived very helpful. The Concierge gave us some really good recommendations for restaurants and also helped us with the subway routes. The Red Flame a couple of doors down is great for breakfast. The shops, TOTR, ESB, Central Park and Times Square are all within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Matched up to the excellent reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 4 night stay over Easter with my boyfriend. Was not disappointed by this hotel and it lived up to the great reviews I read. Location is excellent and my top tip is there is a great diner to have breakfast just down the same street. The room and particularly the bathroom was fantastic and couldn't fault the service either. Would definitely recommend. Anna from London

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: Zayn1981
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a week long business trip to NY. I had a choice of the Affinia Dumont but chose the sofitel because of its location to my work place and the reviews at tripadvisor. Let me begin with saying the reviews are spot-on. I arrived on a thursday night and was greeted by the friendly reception staff who were very pleasant. I had phoned the previous night and asked for a quiet room if possible. They had remembered this and gave me a room on the 26th floor, which was great as it was really quiet. The room itself was a generious size very similar to that of the Barclay intercontinental where i stayed previously. A clean room with all the necessary requirements that a business traveller would need. Part of my package included breakfast at the hotel. The breakfast was excellent prompt service and a very good menu. Overall i am very pleased with my stay at the sofitel and can see why it is number one on this list

Reviews.Title: “Solid - but #1 ?”
Reviews.Author: aspenannie
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights at the Sofitel in NYC and had a very enjoyable time. It is a great location and an oasis of calm in the midst of the bustling city. My only compalint....sorry...is that the beds here were not quite up to par with the Sofitel in SFO where I stay a couple weeks per year. I'm a comfortable bed fanatic and these mattresses have seen better days. The linens are great. I loved the bathrooms. Huge for NY. Everything else was fantastic. Is this the #1 hotel in NYC ? Guess it depends on your budget. We had one meal in the restaurant and were not impressed. The SFO Bay Sofitel has a little restaurant where you can buy the BEST pastries made in America. We wished that the NY location would have this, too.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the strength of previous positive postings and I was not disappointed. You felt like an important guest from the moment of your arrival. The doormen (Special mention to Randy and William) who were very helpful. Check-in was quick and painless and you didn't have to wait an age for the lift to arrive! Usually rooms in NYC are relatively small (ie not much room to swing a cat) but its fair to say that my jaw dropped when I entered our room. It was huge!! And the bathroom was a decent size with both a shower cubicle and a bath (being 5 foot one I fitted in it perfectly!) The curtains were heavy and thick so it was easy to fall asleep at night. A fresh bottle of evian with a note on the following days weather forecast was also left every night. I would disagree with previous comments about not going up the Empire State if you've never done it before. All I would say is go first thing in the morning or late at night to avoid the queues - the view is incredible. Other suggestions would be:- Take the free Staten Island Ferry - the views of the Statue of Liberty and Manhattan are amazing on a clear day. The crossing takes roughly half an hour. Take the subway to Bowling Green then its just across the road. Head to Strawberry Fields in Central Park - there's usually a good crowd with musicians so you can have a sing song. I would also recommend the Monkey Bar which is on East 54th Street between Madison and Park Avenue. For all you Sex and the City fans - this is where Carrie and Big decide to be friends after their affair. It's very chic and moody and the Cosmopolitans are to die for!

Reviews.Title: “Faultless....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It hardly needs saying again considering all the great reviews on this web site but I don't think I would ever stay anywhere else in New York having been to the Sofitel. It is a lovely hotel, in a perfect location, with great staff and worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “my favorite NYC hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I rarely write any reviews, but let me simply say that this hotel was incredible. very large room by NYC standard, wonderfully polite staff, great location.... If you can get a good rate on this hotel, look no further. Really pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “A New York with bigger the a phone booth rooms”
Reviews.Author: vveerrgg e
Reviews.Content: Came down with my girlfriend for the Easter Weekend. WITHOUT A DOUBT THE BIGGEST HOTEL ROOMS FOR THE PRICE! Mid town manhattan has lots of small hotels with tiny rooms. This place had a fullsize bath and shower in the bathroom and a bedroom with more then just walking room to the bed. The french flair was romantic, and the rooms are checked twice a day. They actually turn down the bedding for you in the evening. Close enough to be a 10$ cab ride to anywhere... I will be staying in this hotel next time I'm in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “It's all true!”
Reviews.Author: Markmywords
Reviews.Content: I won't repeat all that has already been said about the excellent Sofitel New York, just to say that my wife and I had a wonderful experience staying for four days in April. The hotel is excellent with exceedingly friendly and helpful staff and can not be faulted. A few ideas 1. Don't bother with the Empire States Building, the queues are very long (allow at least an hour) and the whole experience is tacky and tired. 2. Go to Top of the Rock which is excellent, the queues are short, the experience is better and there is much more room to look around and admire the views. 3. Try Rosen’s Deli, 23 East 51 Street, good deli in art deco surroundings. 4. Depending on your point of view either take your partner or avoid Diamond Street (47th Street). There are some amazing bargains in comparison to the inflated jewellery prices in the UK. 5. Finally, the pretzels are heavy going and one between two is sufficient!!

Reviews.Title: “It's the human touch that makes the difference”
Reviews.Author: eurolondoner
Reviews.Content: I concur with most of your other reviewers: this is a truly wonderful hotel. To me, however, it is the people who mostly make the different. I stayed at the hotel during the February snow blizzard, and my plane was cancelled. The hotel concierge, Dimitri, spent hours on the phone to try and sort out the problem with the airline. The rest of the staff were ever so flexible about telling me I could tell them at the last minute if I needed to extend my stay and pledging to offer the same (highly discounted) rate I had paid for my one night stay. Rooms are beautiful and pleasant, room service breakfast was lovely, and once again, the staff are some of the best I have met.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel for a long weekend trip to the Big Apple and absolutely loved it. Absolutely no complaints. The hotel has a beautiful lobby with lots of comfortable seating, the staff throughout the hotel was courteous and helpful, and our room was gorgeous. Not the biggest room in the world - but as I've heard, much bigger than most rooms in New York. The bed was fantastic, the room was very, very clean, and I LOVED the bathroom. Particularly, the feature of a separate bath and shower is really nice. In general, the hotel was perfectly lovely, and within close walking distance to SO much. Grand Central Station, the NYC Public Library, Times Square, broadway, and many, many excellent restaurants are all easily within walking distance. I would definitely stay here again. Also, there are two great breakfast places - one just on 44th, a few doors away, is a little diner - pretty cheap and hot food, and another is around the corner on 5th avenue - the Cafe Europa. We didn't eat at the hotel at all because we heard the prices were pretty extreme. The Algonquin, a hotel next door, is great fun at night for enjoying cocktails. On Sunday night singers from broadway shows came out and sang and played piano in the lobby. It's a delightful place.

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere better, no questions!”
Reviews.Author: Youngtravellers
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Sofitel over Easter Weekend and had the best time in New York. The hotel is positioned between 5th and 6th Ave. on 44th Street so puts it within 10 minutes walk of everything worth looking at. The place is simply splendid, fresh flowers every-other-day and everyone (barr some but i'll explain later) is so helpful. We were recommended to get a high room, we were on the 15th floor and could see nothing but when you realise that New York is only huge due to everything being so high you'll understand! The lack of view didn't spoil a thing, the hotel was just the perfect place to relax after a hard day of walking and shopping. We didn't eat in the hotel cos they tend to be more expensive and we'd had some other recommendations. The only thing that let the Sofitel down was the fact that my girlfriend and i are quite young so the doormen didn't -ever- open the door for us on the way in. The concierge seemed reluctant too, but yet overly helpful to the older guests! Ah well. If you stay here go to breakfast at The Manhattan Cafe across the road, round the back. It's fantastic! And for dinner Michael Jordans The Steak House, at Grand Central Station is great but dress smart, it's a bit glam! Buffalo steak is superb, but the garlic bread for starters is divine! The other place we tried was Del Friscos on roughly 49th and 6th, the McGraw-Hill Building. It's a bit expensive but we were sat next to Colin Farrell so who can complain!!! If you need any info then please email me, i loved it! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and even better city!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mont990
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel about 2 months ago after cancelling another booking at an alternative hotel. This decision was due to the first class reviews the Sofitel receives on Tripadvisor and we could not have made a better choice!! Upon arrival at the hotel we had a couple of teething problems in the room but these were dealt with immediately. We were celebrating our wedding anniversary during the stay and on our 2nd night the hotel had a complimentary bottle of champagne delivered to the room - a much appreciated gesture!! In our opinion the hotel itself charges a little too much for the breakfast. However, you can't go wrong with the Red Flame Diner a few doors away - be sure to get there before 9 a.m. to avoid the queues. Too much to say about the city itself other than it feels like you are walking around in a movie set!! If you are planning to go up the Empire State Building you can purchase your tickets in advance on the internet (---) for an extra $2 and beat the queues - well worth the extra $2. If you are planning to see a broadway show we can highly recommend "Jersey Boys". This is a city we will definitely be returning too at some point! Overall an excellent break in a great hotel and a fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing - Like a Palace!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent luxurious hotel, friendly and helpful staff. Great location just off Times Sqaure/Broadway one side and fifth avenue the other side. Our rooms overlooked Crysler Building and Empire State Building 23 floors up! Weather was good, snow on arrival then warm and sunny the rest of the week. Beds were as comfortable as reviews had said. Included a well stocked mini bar, complementary newspapers, bottles of evian every night with a weather report for the next day. Planning a return trip for next year!

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, fab location, fab city!!”
Reviews.Author: MaldivesForever23
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel New York from 7-10 April, and booked it based on the reviews we read on Tripadvisor. It lived up to expectations in every way. Minutes from both 5th & 6th Ave on 44th St, the location was fantastic. We were on the 10th floor and our room was so quiet, we did not hear any traffic, sirens or noise the whole three nights. Bed was the most comfortable we have ever slept in. Spacious, clean room, and excellent marble bathroom with large shower cubicle and separate bath. Staff were extremely friendly and made us feel very welcome. Hotel has a nice bar and thought drink prices were reasonable. Only minor criticism would be the lobby which is quite dark, but apart from that, we loved it and would go back. Travel tips: For a cheap breakfast go to the Red Flame diner, turn right out of hotel, 1 min away. Always busy, great bacon and eggs! Dinner - we tried Tavern on the Green. Firm believer people should make their own minds up about restaurants, as everyone likes different things, but we were very disappointed, overpriced & boring food which lacked flavour, no atmosphere....but good location though and pretty park views. Top viewing spot - "Top of the Rock" observation centre at Rockefeller centre. 67 floors up, stunning views, cost $17 per person. Well worth it. Nice walk - we did a great 3 hour walk from Pier 17, through financial district, then up West Broadway through Tribeca, lunch in Soho cafe and Greenwich, then back up 5th Ave to hotel. Saw so much, brilliant weekend.

Reviews.Title: “The waldorf astoria has nothing on this place”
Reviews.Author: essejack
Reviews.Content: If you book this place 12 months in advance you get a fantastic rate (we paid £150.00 a night) The staff were very professional, friendly and helpful. The hotel allowed us a late checkout. Accommodation on the small side but the room was great with a picture postcard view of the chrysler building. Staff turned a blind eye on the deli meals we ate in the hotel. Bathroom immaculate and had a large kingsize bed (as standard). I have stayed in the Waldorf and it has nothing on this place. In a fantastic location. When we left (very tearful) we asked to hail a cab but for an extra $15 we were chauffer driven to the airport!!!!!!!!! Outstanding!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous in every way”
Reviews.Author: AmerInEuroJen
Reviews.Content: This hotel definitely deserved it previous reviews. My husband and I stayed 2 nights booked thru Sofitel online (Accor is the parent company). I told them it was for my birthday and we were treated to a free room upgrade (to a deluxe queen) and (since I'm pregnant) fruit and artesian water. We paid their special rate of $287/night plus about $35/night in taxes. For NYC it is the perfect location and it was easy to catch a cab whenever we wanted one. The beds really were soft and they use the Euro-style duvets but I'm sure if you wanted a top sheet you can ask. It was very quiet and the staff was very polite and helpful. The tub and separate shower were lovely and the sitting area by the window comfortable as well. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, fantastic hotel. Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: junglejules
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our trip to New York based largely on reviews on TripAdvisor. We were not disappointed. The hotel is in a great central location and within easy walking distance of Empite State, Grand Central, Rockerfeller Centre, Time Square, Intrepid Air and Sea Museum and even the helipad for the helicopter tours. Hotel itself was in execellent order. We stayed in a deluxe room and we were very pleased. The view out the window was not the best but then it is not a tall building (by NY standards) so you can't have everything. All in all a great base for a NY holiday. We loved the hotel and NY. We'll be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the sofitel hotel for five nights from the 23rd to the 28th of march 2006 and it was excellent. After viewing hotels on trip advisor we decided to opt for this one due to the good reviews. The room was spacious and very clean, the view was amazing and staff were very friendly and helpful(Randy the doorman has some very good tips). The Manhattan Cafe (through the back entrance of the hotel and accross the road) is a great place for breakfast with plenty of choice at reasonable prices. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Smashy
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I chose to book at the Sofitel because of reviews we had read on Tripadvisor and we weren't let down! We stayed for three nights between 27th - 30th March. The location of the hotel is fantastic, service was always helpful and we would definitely stay there again. We paid slightly more money to get a room with a city view, which was brilliant (the views at night were amazing). We were getting married whilst in New York and the hotel had given us a lovely suite, with an incredibly comfortable bed, gorgeous bathroom and a lounge area too and the size of the suite was really impressive. My brother and sister had a twin room on the same floor (22nd), which was also great. I can't comment on the food since we ate most often at the Red Flame Diner (which I would also highly recommend) but the hotel bar was very nice indeed. We would certainly book at the Sofitel again.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms (for NY), great location, overall good value!!”
Reviews.Author: Austin2NY
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Sofitel New York the last week of March 2006 (27th - 31st). We chose the Sofitel due to the overwhelming positive reviews on this board and it did not dissappoint one bit! When we first arrived, we were greeted at the front desk by an extremely friendly individual. She upgraded our floor level and room size from a Queen premiere to King Deluxe after hearing it was my wife's birthday present. We also received our 2 free complimentary drinks at the bar (sign up for a free Sofitel card on their website to receive them), and we were off to our room. Although we didn't spend alot of time in our rooms each day (we came to NY to sightsee/have fun), it was always nice to be able to walk to our hotel regardless of where we had just been (did I mention how convenient the location is?) and rest up in that ultra-comfortable bed! The afternoon/evening turn down service + complimentary water each day was also appreciated. Our first night there, we also had dinner in the hotel restaraunt (Gabby's). While I'm not one to generally eat in hotels (they are often over priced and average quality), Gabby's quality was really good (I highly recommend the lamb chops!). If (OK when) we travel back to NY, I'd stay at the Sofitel again as long as we can book a room for under 300 a night. (we paid $269 a night)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - reviews definately deserved”
Reviews.Author: Claire_murray
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at the Sofitel New York last month. Staff were friendly and helpul. The hotel is very understated from the outside (in fact its almost invisable - assuming you don't fall over the door man!) but inside the marble foyer and excellent service make it worth another visit. The location couldn't be better - easy walking distance to all mid-town sight seeing and shopping areas. Rooms are large by New York standards - also modern, clean and comfortable. The maid delivered bottled water with the turn down service and an incredibly accurate weather forecast - correct on all the days we stayed. This hotel definately deserves its No 1 rating!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, but not ultra luxe”
Reviews.Author: nakedmaestro
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Sofitel NY for 2 nights on a Friday & Saturday evening in early March. It's my favorite chain and it's too bad Sofitel doesn't have more properties in the U.S. As was the case when I stayed at the Sofitel Chicago, & Philadelphia, the Sofitel NY didn't disappoint. Everything was as good as it could possibly have been from check in to check out. I requested a view room on a high floor and got it. Bed was very comfortable and bathroom very spacious & clean and the toiletries were fantastic. Room service was good and arrived promptly. For those that are not familar with Sofitel, it's a French chain that is very popular in Europe, the middle east, and Africa, but only has like 12 properties in the U.S. I'd compare it to a Westin, Le Meridien, or W. Sofitel is certainly as good as any of those chains and I'd argue that they're actually better due to the room amenities they provide that American chains lack. Those little extras make all the difference. Although it's ranked #1 in New York by this website, it's certainly not the best hotel in NY by ultra luxury standards. For value, convenience, and service, the Sofitel NY is absolutely deserving of its Trip Advisor ranking. That said, wealthy travelers expecting the Sofitel to deliver Four Seasons, Ritz Carlton, Penninsula, or Mandarin Oriental style decadence will inevitably be disappointed. It's a fantasic hotel for vast majority of people, just don't be confused by the #1 ranking and expect it to be the most luxurious place in New York. It isn't, nor does it claim to be, but it is a fantastic hotel nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a girl's weekend with my sister. Having been to NYC four times previously and having stayed at the Michelangelo twice this past summer, I have to say that the Hotel Sofitel on W 44th was definitely a great value for my dollar. The staff was extremely courteous. Our check in was smooth and we were even offered an upgrade at no additional cost. We had prepaid for our room and were to share a queen bed. The front desk staff offered us an open room with two oversized twin beds (which was a higher cost when I booked our reservations) and suggested that we would enjoy our stay much better as we could both stretch out and sleep in our own beds. She was definitely right! We loved the room. The decor was exactly as described and pictured. The room was pristinely clean and the fresh orchid in the bathroom was a lovely touch. The bathroom is what really made the room enjoyable. There was both a separate glass shower and a porcelain tub. The walls and floor of the bath were all marble. There was ample room for toiletries, a magnifying mirror, adequate electrical plug ins, and good lighting. The only drawback I could see to the bathroom was the lack of a ventilation fan. Evenso, I would definitely highly recommend this hotel. The maid service was equally efficient and thorough. We never saw any carts or heard the service staff at all. Our room was meticulously clean each time we returned. I had no qualms about soaking in the tub after a long day out walking. We paid $319/Thurs and $229/Fri & Sat evening. If being close to Time Square & the theaters is essential to your trip, I would most definitely choose to stay here. The next time I come to New York I would love to stay at the Hotel Sofitel again. The concierge even gave us the name of a car company that took us to the airport in a town car for the same price as a taxi. A top notch hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Almost excellent!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very good! Great location, facilities and staff. View from bedroom window could have been better e.g. Times Square, which you can see from Novotel (Accor sister hotel on 52nd & Broadway). Not quite as good as Sofitel Chicago which we stayed at on route to New York for the St Patrick's Day celebrations. Oh yeh, and what a celebration!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a first trip to the States”
Reviews.Author: mawillow
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from New York. The Hotel and room was wonderful, staff were very friendly and helpful. We were celebrating our 25th Wedding anniversary and received within moments of entering our hotel room a knock on the door with a member of staff, holding a bottle of champagne and a lovely card, what a surprise! Location perfect for shopping, eating and sight seeing. Once again I would like to thank the staff for making our first trip to New York very special. Will certainly be returning to this hotel in the very near future

Reviews.Title: “Another Excellent Stay at the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: Jude8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel for our honeymoon and really enjoyed the stay. The service was excellent and they even brought us a complimentary bottle of Champagne and dessert with a nice note congratulating us. We loved staying at the Sofitel because it is a block and a half from the subway, a few blocks from Times Square and a few blocks from shopping on Madison Avenue. Yet, it is also tucked away from all the craziness that allows you to escape to your room and relax. Turndown service is a nice touch evian water provided and the forecast for the next day. My only tiny complaint is that if you touch anything in the minibar you are going to have to pay for it. We are used to this though so we are just careful when grabbing items. Another nice amenity is the free internet in the lobby area. We used this to make reservations, get directions, etc. We would definitly recommend this hotel for both business and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel delivers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just back from 5 days in NY. Chose Sofitel based on previous reviews and not disappointed. Location is great, close to the action but street was quiet, at least at night! Room was a good size and Bathroom excellent, small problem on 4th day fixed immediately. Bed extremely comfortable meaning a good nights sleep, essential for all the walking. Staff were friendly and courteous, unlike NY Taxi drivers! Doorman Randy was always able to help. Didn't try the food based on prices and eating out is part of the experience, Red Flame Diner down the road fine for Breakfast before hitting the sights. We paid $240 per night through Airline Network and thought it was good value for NY, certainly a safe bet if nervous about where you are going to stay and think you just can't beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: exeter
Reviews.Content: My daughter, age 15, and I had a WONDERFUL time in New York over March break. Even the weather was warm and sunny. We stayed at the Sofitel, a beautiful, clean and quiet hotel just two minutes from the bustle of Times Square and close to the best shopping in the world. The hotel staff are very friendly and service is European, meaning polished. Many of the staff speak French. The room was as requested with two double beds, the linens superior, and the bathrooms incredible. The toiletries were wonderful, and after long days shopping and sightseeing I appreciated the luxuries. The big hotels at Times square always had lineups at the front desk and for elevators: never at the Sofitel . And the doormen got to know us and were very helpful. My daughter loved having a personal shopper at Bloomingdale's and got some great things... We reserved through NYCVP, which saved us over the hotel rates offered by the usual discount providers. The packet of vouchers was waiting for us at the hotel and they gave us a room on a higher floor as requested. It couldn't have been better. NYCVP also arranged for theatre tickets to sold out shows, and got excellent seats , both on shows that were otherwise unavailable. The Red Flame diner next door was a cheaper alternative to breakfastat the hotel. We also went to the Rockefeller centre for their breakfast by the skating rink...memorable. We did the Top of the Rock by day... better views of the park... and the empire State building at night... great city lights views. And all the usual bus and boat and museum tours. New york is much friendlier than pre 9-11 and is worth revisiting if you have not been back since then.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not terrific”
Reviews.Author: jah123
Reviews.Content: I often stay at Sofitel in DC and Chicago and found this hotel not quite up to Sofitel standards. The bed was very comfortable as always. However, the room had only a single window which badly needed a wash. I felt that I was in a tenament on the lower east side. The restaurant was decidedly mediocre. However, on the same block on 44th there are two extremely good restaurants. While the French are not big on exercise in hotels, the exercise room was not very good with few machines to exercise with. The staff was helpful but more attention to details would improve this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: LtDan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sofitel for two nights and were very happy there. The staff was very professional and courteous, accomodating each request we had: a high floor, a late checkout, a specific newspaper each morning, a yellow pages...all handled quickly and with a smile. Our room was larger than the typical New York hotel, even though it was among the least expensive of the 3.5/4 star hotels we looked at. The bathroom was great: very new, very clean. The bed was a queen, but felt bigger somehow. The location was very convenient. We could easily walk to restaurants, theatres, subway stations, and attractions in minutes. You could get to either 5th or 6th in less than a minute. There's a diner-type place called the Red Flame just down 44th toward 6th that does a decent breakfast; for dinner one night we ate at Triomphe (right next door in the Iroquois Hotel) and it was fantastic. All in all, a great hotel in a great spot. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Mid-Town Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jackosan
Reviews.Content: I write only to echo the praises of other reviewers. I could not have been more pleased with this hotel. From experience, I can state that this is one of the finer 4-star hotels in Manhattan. Prompt, attentive service, clean, smartly appointed rooms, bathrobes, slippers and other amenities galore, high-end beds and bedding, large bathrooms with separate bathtub and shower. The exercise room had a nice mix of cardio equipment and enough weights for adequate resistance training. Had drinks in the restaurant/bar, but no meal. Seems like a very nice place, but pricey. If you are looking for some excellent food at comparatively bargain prices, Little Brazil is just a block away. Super location between 5th Ave. and Avenue of the Americas (6th Ave.) and 44th and 45th streets puts you right by the theatre district and Times Square. Plenty to see, do and eat. A short walk or cab ride from anywhere in mid-town. Minor gripe: Charging for internet access is so 20th Century. Still, I will gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Aly22
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in February for his 30th birthday. The staff were very friendly and we were made to feel extremely welcome. We stayed on the 27th floor and had a magnificent view. The location is fantastic only two blocks from Time Square and 5th Avenue and the doorman was always ready to grab us a cab when we needed to go further. We treated ourselves on our first night to room service and although the food isn't cheap it was delicious, but if you like steak though you have to try Ben Benson's Steak House. My boyfriend is a chef and therefore not easy to please, but he couldn't rave about his food more. We were even given a tour of the kitchen!! But be prepared, it's pricey but worth every penny. We both thoroughly enjoyed our time in New York, and would happily recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel is nestled perfectly between 5th and 6th avenue. Times Square is within walking distance as are many of the museums and other attractions of the city. The Hotel itself is great, the rooms are spacious, immaculately presented and very comfortable. The shower was fantastic! The staff are very friendly and always happy to help. I would whole-heartedly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value.”
Reviews.Author: Stevebeckhead
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights early March. Paid $359 per night for room on 22nd floor with a city view!, so not cheap and a city view is relative - remember New York city views are limited. Thought the room and facilities were excellent, comfortable large bed, decent sized room, good well stocked bathroom and to me most important peace and quiet. Both my wife and I had 6 nights of excellent sleep only waking when my body clock thought it was time to get up - usually 4 in the morning. Maid service was spot on with bathrobes changed without asking and a plentiful supply of toiletries. Turn down service was always done when we out so no problems. Didn't use the restaurant facilities as I thought they were very expensive and with 13,000 restauarants to choose from I like to venture out. Reception and door staff spot on and as a Sofitel "Privilege" card holder was able to use our room through to 4 pm which fitted perfectly with our 6pm flight back to UK. Any body can have one of these! Would almost certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: amp94596
Reviews.Content: I travel to NYC about 7-8 times a year. This is my first visit to the Sofitel. I got an average rate of $240 a night over four nights for a King bed on a lower floor. The overall experience was very good, very comfortable and hospitable. The bed was excellent. I will come back to the Sofitel again soon. NY City hotels have really gone up in price over the last year and I can't find anything in the $250-325 range as good as the Sofitel anywhere in the city. The room was large by NY standards. I can't remember the last time I had a shower and seperate bath in a NYC hotel. The location is great. Although this hotel isn't a "scene", it is relaxing and hospitable. What would I change? The menu is expensive. (Food is good) The workout room needs towels and tuned up machines. The carpeting in my room was starting to show it's age and the room had a strong lingering air freshener smell.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly Disappointed with Hotel, New York is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: jezza
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel for 4 nights at the end of February 2006. My partner booked the hotel as part of a trip to New York to celebrate my 40th. We selected the hotel based on trip advisor reviews and booked through expedia. After requesting a high room (as per previous trip advisor recommendations) and notifying the hotel that I was celebrating a special occasion, we were dissapointed to be located on the 7th floor. Apparently this was due to the hotel being full. We were however, promised a high floor for the next 3 nights and this resulted in a relocation to the 21st floor and a view of the Empire state. Hotel: staff were generally very friendly, accommodating and attentive. Ambience: the hotel in my opinion lacked any real atmosphere, there was no buzz in the lobby (probably due to the general layout). Prices: as a tourist you don't visit New York to stay in your hotel room, therefore, we didn't use any of the facilities, although did notice that the food prices were very expensive. $18 dollars for a waffle plus tax and service charge and probably a tip! Rooms: as many have mentioned the beds were very very comfortable. The bathroom although luxurious was very cold, please add heating!! Maid service: again the rooms were cleaned to a high standard, however, we only once had the room turned down as we were generally getting ready to go out when the maid knocked at 19:00. (call me a cynic, the only time my 40th celebrations were mentioned was on our last morning when the maid knocked on the door and wished me happy birthday!!) Concierge: again very informative and friendly and a fountain of knowledge. Location: excellent, only two blocks from times square or fifth avenue. Tips: there is an excellent breakfast diner called the red flame on the same street, turn right outside the hotel. Get to the empire state early to avoid the crowds. Try a restaurant called Tao its fantastic! Ice Skate in Central Park! Avoid the cafe part of the Boathouse restaurant in Central Park. Get to the Central Line queues early to ensure you are able to get inside the statue of liberty. Otherwise you have to be satisfied with a walk around (which is fantastic anyway). Visit Macy's on a monday morning, it is fairly quiet. Enjoy the big apple!

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Juliann1024
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night and it was a very nice hotel. The beds where amazingly comfortable and I loved that I wasnt afraid of the linens. They smelled clean and where very crisp. Bathrooms where very spacious and well light, and it is rare to have a stall shower and seperate tub and I loved that too. It was a very warmly decorated room and I know why it gets reviewed so well. Got a great bargain and wouldnt hesitate to stay their again

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in February 2006. We took advantage of a 30% discount deal from Expedia and stayed in a Deluxe King Suite on the 26th floor.
