We looked out on to the Rockefeller Centre and at an angle could see down to Times Sq and the Hudson beyond. A problem with staying in this part of New York (mid-town) is that all the buildings are tall so good views are few and far between in any hotel. The hotel is in an excellent location and staff we came across very helpful and friendly. Lovely clean, quiet and spacious room with seperate sitting room. Very comfortable bed. Also had a wonderful bathroom with candles and mineral water. The mini-bar (working on sensors/weights so don't touch anything!) prices were ludicrous however but free ice down the hall kept shop bought drinks cool! Don't go for convenient therefore expensive hotel breakfasts (looked as though a standard breakfast for two in the Sofitel is in the region of $70) but find a nearby diner/restaurant. The best breakfast we have ever had in NY is at the 'Pershing Sq cafe' - on 42nd St opposite Grand Central Station (under the bridge).

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay!”
Reviews.Author: RileysMom08
Reviews.Content: We just spent the weekend in NYC and what a fabulous hotel stay! The lobby was gorgeous and the staff were friendly but discreet. The room was clean, well maintained and very quiet. We were on the 7th floor and couldn't hear a thing from the busy street below. The bed was so comfortable that we just wanted to lounge around all day! Plus the bathroom was incredible with marble galore and a tub and separate shower. The hotel location is perfect...just a couple of blocks from Grand Central and Times Square Subway stops. We would definitely recommend this hotel to all our friends and plan to stay here our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Have to say disappointing”
Reviews.Author: BogartG
Reviews.Content: Having chosen this hotel by the tripadvisor rating I have to say I was somewhat disappointed. (might I add that this is my first disappointment with tripadvisor which I consult every time I travel). Booked this trip as a surprise for my husbands birthday. I contacted Guest Services to request an upgrade to a suite and champagne to be in the suite when we arrived. This was confirmed on request. On arrival we were told there were no suites available and allocated a small room on the 11th floor. When I opened the curtains to see the fantastic view I was greeted with a man in an office block across the street. My husband sensing my disappointment requested a move to a higher floor and a larger room. Although we were moved to a slightly larger room on the 27th floor it was definitely not what I had expected. (the champagne eventually arrived after the relocation) The view was better but the room was quite tired with black marks on the carpet and curtains that required a good washing. I was awake most nights with the noise of the lift beside us. I, at this point did not wish to complain and be moved again as I didn't want to spoil my husbands trip. The front desk were ok with a hint of super almost icy efficiency. The concierge was more than helpful and friendly and the door man was just great. (couldn't help enough!) My gut instinct tells me there are definitely better hotels in New York that wouldn't be nearly as overpriced. Wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a family trip for our daughter's senior year of high school and had always wanted to visit New York. Couldn't have asked for a better hotel than the Sofitel. Room, comfort, service, and anything we may asked for was great. The doormen are always pleasant and greet you going and coming (great source for info). Would recommend this for anybody and hope to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Blizzard'06 in Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews on Sofitel, it seemed the be the best value/cost hotel, thus I got a deal through the internet somewhere in September. As I would love to have a room on one of the higher floors, I gave them a ring just to check where my online deal would bring me. Inhouse reception confirmed my order and informed that I am either going to be on the 3rd or the 4th floor... which did not make me very happy. And indeed on arrival we got assigned a room on the 3rd floor, but I had to simply express my preference once, and we got an excellent room on the 18th!!!! Room was very tastefully decorated, the bed just excellent, bathroom very spacious and clean. We found that the hotel is very well situated, did not have any problems getting around in NY. This was true also during the snow storms!I found staff very helpful, they gave updates on what we could do and what to better avoid. It seemed to me they had extra shifts on, as they had to deal with many people (specially whose whose flights got cancelled). Fortunately we rather enjoyed the snow, and had a lovely time in the Central Park. One thing though, on the first morning we went to have breakfast in the Gaby restaurant and ordered breakfast. It was my negligence not to check the menu, but ended up with a $50 bill for eggs, bacon and croissant(which were all very tasty). This made sure we never stepped foot back again the restaurant. It was a very nice stay and would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for exploring NYC!”
Reviews.Author: Bestbunnygirl
Reviews.Content: My husband suprised me with a trip to New York for my birthday and booked the Sofitel as it was No.1 on Trip Advisor! We had a suite on the 28th Floor which had amazing views of the Crysler building and the Empire State building. When we arrived the receptionist was extremely friendly. As we had arrived before normal check in time the only suite they had available for us was a smoking one (and we are both non-smokers) she said to us that this would have the best views, and if it smelt at all of smoke to come back and she would sort it out straight away. For a smokingfloor we couldn't smell a thing! The room was amzing, with the best bed in the world, although if you've just got of a 7hour flight don't sit down on the bed as soon as you get to your room otherwise you won't want to get up!! When checking in we had mentioned to the receptionist that we were here for my birthday, and when we returned from our first day sight-seeing we were created with a chilled bottle of Champagne - a lovely touch! All the staff went out of there way to help you and were always on hand if you needed anything - everyday when we left the hotel we were wished a good morning and wished a good day! The location is great, it is a couple of blocks walk away from Times Square and in NYC its really not difficult to get anywhere! A brilliant hotel for a first time trip to New York!

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to high tripadvisor rating”
Reviews.Author: kristie
Reviews.Content: This hotel lives up to its high tripadvisor rating. The rooms are contemporary yet so comfortable. I loved the bed - I am pregnant with twins and it's hard to get comfy at night, but I slept like a baby on this bed! We enjoyed the restaurant, and the service from everyone was impeccable. Everyone treated us very nicely. The hotel is well located - within blocks of Times Square and the theaters.

Reviews.Title: “Just Great!!!”
Reviews.Author: jpuso2001
Reviews.Content: Everything about it was just right. Perfect combo of value and luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend retreat!”
Reviews.Author: JanetRob
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sofitel in January. First visit to New York so wanted to stay somewhere really special so booked a Kingsize suite. Our room was on the 20th floor (the lift actually made my ears pop every time I used it). The view from the room was magnificent facing Chrysler Tower. This was by far the most comfortable room I have ever stayed in. The bed was out of this world and the bathroom luxurious. We had two tv's, one by the bed and another in the lounge area separated by sliding doors. A few nice touches, candles and matches in the bathroom and bottled water by bed every night. Great location, only a few minutes walk to Times Square and all major attractions. Didn't eat in the hotel, but turn right on leaving and 100 yrds down great place for breakfast. Would definately stay here again and recommend to friends, can't wait for a return trip!

Reviews.Title: “SWEET!”
Reviews.Author: jefruss
Reviews.Content: Perfect location on West 44th between 5th Avenue and Avenue of the Americas (6th). Exemplary service, especially housekeeping. Doorman arranged Town Car transportation to La Guardia at a rate comparable to a taxi fare. Lots of smiles from the staff. Free use of computer terminals located in an alcove off of the lobby. Our room on the 26th floor had a wonderful view. Bathroom was spacious with perfect lighting. The closet did not have quite enough space for hanging clothes, otherwise it was well arranged. Forget Gaby's, the hotel restaurant. Sub par eats. We did, however, have a sensational meal at db Bistro Moderne which is only a few doors away. Gaby's is the only reason not to give Sofitel an "excellent" rating. Also, the addition of in-room coffee and flat screen tv would place this property in rarified air. Bottom line - we will book this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Best combination of quality and value in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Still call Australia Home
Reviews.Content: I booked the Sofitel on the strength of the Tripadvisor reviews. I have worked in and visited Manhattan as a tourist for 20 years and this is the best stay I have in terms of value for the standard of accomodation, service and quality of the experience. I stayed for 3 days and two nights, used the restaurant and the fitness centre and again both were well above the average. The broadband Internet service was fast and inexpensive. My first choice in New York from now on. Im so pleased with the Tripadvisor recommendation that I have signed up.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - couldn't fault it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel with my husband and friends. We all thought the hotel was great. Check-in was effortless, speedy and friendly. Rooms were spacious, not overly so but better than others I've stayed at in NY. The bed was extremely comfortable, so pleasurable that you almost didn't want to get out each morning! Nice room touches, fresh flowers in the bathroom, great illuminated mirror, water left when the beds were turned down at night, ironing board and iron, slippers, bathrobes... Bar was a bit dull but it's a hotel and why drink there when there's the whole of NYC on your doorstep? Hotel is in a great location, easy walking distance to 5th Avenue, Times Square. We were also lucky enough to have a view of the Empire State and Chrysler buildings from our bedroom window (even if we had to crane our necks a bit!). Believe what everyone on Trip Advisor says (I took their advice) and book this hotel it's very good. I've attached a photo which should help you decide for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Best anniversary experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: Pattikmo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just celebrated our 28th wedding anniversary in NYC and the Sofitel was definitely one of the highlights. Our room was SPLENDID! Spacious, elegant, and comfortable, with a magnificent bathroom. We felt like we were on our honeymoon all over again. And the staff has great attention to detail. We had mentioned that it was our anniversary and were surprised by a lovely bottle of champagne delivered to our door. We would not only highly recommend this hotel to our friends. (we already have!) but look forward to returning there for our 29th anniversary as well!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: Concord Pit
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at the Sofitel. On a quiet street, 4 minutes away from Times Square, the views from the windows on the upper floors are FANTASTIC. Very well appointed rooms, excellent bathrooms, and very discrete staff. Although this is a small hotel, you dont feel as though you are cramped, the attention to style and comfort is very evident in the richly opulent ground floor. We didn't eat at the hotel, because the restaurant experience in New York is so varied.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: sungal
Reviews.Content: For our weekend getaway to New York, we were looking for a nice hotel in the theatre district. We are, I guess you can say, hotel snobs- we enjoy a beautiful property & room and excellent service. Well...the Sofitel exceeded our expectations! Fantastic service, beautiful room, unbelievable bed, and great location. We would not think twice about booking another Sofitel property our next getaway! Very impressive!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful experience New York was. I went for 4 nights for my 40th birthday, it was a surprise booked by my husband. The Sofitel lived up to its reputation, lovely room, well stocked bathroom, with a great view of the Empire State Building and the Crysler Building from our room on the 23rd floor. Great service from all the staff. The location couldn't be better, centrally located with many of the sights and attractions within 5 minutes walking. Despite this We didn't hear one noise during the night. The breakfast in Gaby's was excellent, (Gaby's Granola, my favourite). We did try the red flame, just down the road, and although this was good, the hotel breakfast was simply much better for not a great deal more money, probably around £4 per head more with unlimited juice, coffee, toast etc. We organsied a tour prior to leaving for New York with New York Party Shuffle, which I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless Hotel! Can't beat the Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A friend and I booked the room at the Sofitel NYC on Priceline(-). We had never heard of the chain but were delighted to find it the number one choice on tripadvisor.com. We were not disappointed! The location is excellent, approximately three blocks from Times Square, four blocks from Rockefeller Center and a 15-minute walk to Central Park. The room had two double beds (very comfy), was quiet and clean. The staff was very helpful and made wonderful restaurant suggestions. They also got us tickets to a Broadway show and were happy to accommodate us with all of our requests. I would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it!! Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent 4 Star Option”
Reviews.Author: torontotravellers5
Reviews.Content: I chose a King Suite at the Sofitel for my special proposal weekend after hearing the strong reviews- I most certainly believe that the hotel met those standards. The locations is ideal- just close enough to Times Square without being in the middle of it. The rooms are a good size and have a very nice contemporary/European feel to them. The bathrooms are particularly beautiful. The King Suites really do add a nice touch to the experience, if you are willing to pay the extra. (personally, I'd rather have a King Suite at the Sofitel than pay even more for a small room at one of the 4.5/5 Star spots) My only caveat is that you should be aware of the fact that the Sofitel does not have that grande feeling upon entering the lobby. It is very classy, but lacks that awe that 5 Star hotels usually bring to the table. If that is not a key factor for you, its hard to go wrong with the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Towers above the rest”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel! The room was beautiful, as was the bathroom. The bed was simply divine, we didn't want to leave! The room was on a high floor and thus we had a great view (and the room was quiet). The restaurant and bar were both very good, and not too pretentious. The room-service delivered breakfast was great. There is free internet provided. It is slightly let down by its lack of a pool or other leisure amenities. The staff were generally courteous and helpful. The barman mixed a mean cocktail. This is the best hotel we have ever stayed in. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “They did it again!”
Reviews.Author: ccoqui
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel Hotel, New York from 01/20/2006 to 01/22/2006. It is my second time staying at this locality. Excellent! Before my departure I was thinking of their bed, soft but at the same time firm, their comfortable bathroom with the signature orchid, and all the amenities you can think of. The Service was excellent. The Front Desk , the Concierge, everybody had a big smile on them and a Bon Jour! I recommend this hotel to anyone going to New York. Conveniently located and right in the middle of the action. Located a few blocks from Grand Central Station. On the expensive side (they always have a good offer through the internet) but worth paying.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel offered everything you would expect after reading the reviews. Its location is great for sight seeing and shopping! The rooms are large and beds are like marshmallows! The bathroom was large and clean. If you need recommendations as to where to eat ask the doormen - they were so helpful and recommended some great local places. Overall you couldn't fault the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “sofitel just wonderful”
Reviews.Author: anne2264
Reviews.Content: My daughter and myself stayed at the Sofitel hotel New York for 4 days from 18th Jan to 22nd 2006.The hotel staff were very helpful,the room was wonderful with a marble bathroom and a Queen size bed,we were allowed a late check out and they confirmed our pick up time for us. Just down the street was the Red Flame diner which we used for breakfast,once again the service here was fast and food was excellent. This hotel although not one of the cheapest was ideally situated for all sightseeing trips.I would not stay anywhere else in New York but here. A.Jones Wales

Reviews.Title: “Good position but....”
Reviews.Author: Woodward1
Reviews.Content: We had booked a suite with city view on a high floor but when we arrived it was not ready as the previous guest had arranged a late check-out and we did not get our room until 7.45pm. This was not a good start to our 5 night celebration trip to NYC. If a hotel offers late check-outs then they are duty-bound to ensure that this is not abused by guests staying until early evening thereby obviously inconveniencing arriving guests. 3pm - 4pm would be bearable but after 7pm is not acceptable, especially when the hotel is full. Luckily we persuaded them to allow us the use of a standard room to change and store our bags etc. but I would be reluctant to stay in a Sofitel again unless they change this practice. I know that I am not the first guest to highlight this. The suite was good with a very comfortable bed and great city views. Service good, food OK but front desk staff not always as helpful as they could be.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: phorid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel in the fall when multiple events were making rooms impossible to find. We ended up paying a lot for the room (even by NY standards) and even using Priceline (around $400). That said, I still highly recommend this hotel! This is a hotel that just feels different than other hotels. When you stay here, you know that you are not in an ordinary hotel. For one, the lobby is beautiful, but in a subtle, non-ornate way. For another, the service was wonderful. Help was always there but in a discreet manner. In addition, we loved the free use of a computer hidden away in one part of the lobby, complete with internet access and printer. Like many, we needed to print our boarding passes for our flight, and it was a breeze here. The room itself was just wonderful. Not huge, but it is in NY. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in, and the linens were fabulous. The room was extremely quiet, and we heard NO noise whatsoever. Very unusual in NY. The bathroom was in a league by itself. It was huge and had lots of marble, mirrors, and special toiletries. It also had a glass-enclosed shower, and a separate huge tub! The towels were big and thick. Lastly, the location is near Times Square, a positive for some and a negative for others. The positive is that it is close to the theaters and many restaurants. The negative is that it tends to be more touristy than other parts of the city and so there are less non-tourist places to eat and shop. For a different feel than your usual big city chains, I highly recommend the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for exploring central New York”
Reviews.Author: sweetmarie
Reviews.Content: We had a family reunion at New York and therefore booked two rooms and a suite. The suite was georgous and a very good value. The rooms were very nice too. But the room for our sons did not get ready until 6 p.m. and one day they did not clean the room at all. After leaving we realized that they have charged us too much. In the end we got the money back without delay but you have to watch. We did not like the restaurant because it is rather noisy. There is no breakfast buffet and the menue is really pricy. But all those disadvantages are worth the really good rooms. The hotel is also situated very near the fifth ave and it is not far to the broadway.

Reviews.Title: “Too much fresh air!”
Reviews.Author: mhedleyrob
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was all you would expect from a 4 star. Service was good, staff friendly, rooms comfortable. The room was a suite costing about $450 per night. My only major gripe was the Air Conditioning/Fresh air system - with the air conditioning turned off, air was still forced through the system making it impossible to sleep. Had to call the maintenance man out 5 times! Once at 2 am Sunday morning and 7.30 am Sunday morning. During the week I was told that the air coming on in the morning was fine as most other guests had woken up - call me old fashioned but I like a lie-in on my holiday break!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: rdanna
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just came back from a weekend in NYC. I had selected the Sofitel based on reviews from this site and the ability to get a slightly discounted room. The location was also great because we were spending time uptown and downtown. It was nice to have a centrally located home base. The whole experience was great from start to finish. We were greeted promptly by the doorman who took our bags immediately. We were escorted by another gentleman to the reception desk. We were checked in less than 5 minutes and our bags were brought to our room right away. Every staff member we encountered was very friendly and eager to help. The room was great. Everything looked new and it was decorated very nicely. We loved the bathroom with the separate glass shower and tub. Basically it had everything you could need. Linens and toiletries were replaced nightly. I've read about the beds and I have to say that it's all true. The beds were so damn comfortable it made it tough to get up in the morning. Man, I'm glad my bed at home isn't that good cause all I'd ever do is sleep. The only time I called room service was for an ice bucket for champagne and it literally arrived about 1 minute after I hung up the phone. I highly recommend staying there if you're up in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Overall positive experience”
Reviews.Author: tryemdad
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night, Saturday, two rooms. My wife and 4 kids ranging from 1-14 in age. Quick, efficient check-in process. Decent (average to slightly above)size rooms. Bathroom is much larger than what you'd usually find at this price-point. Quiet. Comfy beds as advertised. $331 per room (each w/ two double beds)with all fees, taxes, etc. We did not eat in the hotel. The Red Flame Diner is o.k. - but it is JUST a diner, so beware of all the overwhelmingly positive reviews, especially if you're from NY or an area where they're are lot's of diners. Good location - close enough to Times Square - yet far enough away, if you know what I mean. We usually stay at the Excelsior on the UWS. I'd rate this experience as equal to it in overall quality. Sofitel has a much more modern and slightly more impersonal feel than the Excelsior, but it's newer and in better shape. We'd go back again, eventually. But first, I'd probably try the Iriquois and/or Algonquin, both on the same block. They appear to have a bit more character. Only negative aspect of our stay was getting our car back from valet on Sunday morning. It took >30 minutes as we were quoted at the time. There were lots of complaints from the crowd waiting ahead of us. Not sure if this was a one-time or chronic issue.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel!”
Reviews.Author: liquidice
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel for 3 nights at the first beginning of January. After our stay I easily see why this hotel is rank number 1 on [------------] As our taxi pulled up, almost immediately the doorman came opened the door and took our bags. The lobby is impressive, dark and sheek- instantly we knew we made the right choice! A friendly receptionist had us checked in and within minutes we were escorted to the lift and wished a good stay. The room was great, bathroom modern, and like many others have said,the bed was extremely comfortable! We didn't eat at the hotel so cannot comment. A wonderful time all for $177 a night. (Yes we searched around for the best price)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Sofitel, New York The bedroom was excellent ! In terms of food it is great french cuisine ! (yes u can find it NY) for breakfast excellent fresh bakery such as croissants, baguette, pain au chocolat. Dinner at Gabys was absolutely what u expect for an upscale french Hotel. In addition to that we finally found an Hotel that had 3 complimentary Internet stations down at the main hall just perfect. The location is central, maybe a bit off from TIMES SQUARE but still OK. We absolutely recommend this hotel for your next stay ! check it out

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay while in NY”
Reviews.Author: VeeBee
Reviews.Content: We are a young couple(30yrs old), and decided to treat ourselves to a nice getaway. The Sofitel comes highly recommended, but the price suggest absolute luxury. It is in a great location, a block away from 5th ave, and surrounded by other great attractions, 10 blocks from broadway and 10 from Penn Station, about a 10 minute walk in either direction. The location was fabulous. Check in: we were greeted at the door by a doorman and concierge in French, and were allowed to check in early for no extra fee. We stayed on the 22nd floor. The view was of another building which was rather disappointing. They also let us check out late for no extra fee. Be sure to sign up for a free loyalty card, that comes with extra upgrades and little perks. Our room: was nice, with contemporary decor, but very small. Not a lot of room to move around. It was clean, linen fresh daily. A thin robe and slippers were provided. TV was a 27 inch. Again, nothing you wouldnt expect at a 3 star hotel. Turn down service every nite with Evian water and weather outlook for the next day. the BED: okay, so I was really curious to see if this bed lived up to its reputation (the pessimist in me) but it does. It was absolutely heavenly. Down sheets and comforter, and pillows. I slept in one position, never moved. The room was nice and dark at night, and truthfully, as a mother of two, this was the best sleep I have had in a very long time. We slept until 10 every morning. Food: We chose to eat outside the restaurant. The Red Flame is a little diner 2 doors down and was great. Good food, fast service, and the usual New York treatment from the staff. The wait was never more than 10 minutes. I did not like the fact that after 11pm, no one was in the lobby. Anyone could have walked in the hotel, so that was kinda odd. There is only 3 computers in the lobby that are always occupied. But overall, it was nice, I will stay again, but for a better deal. For 350.00 a nite, I expect to be treated like I paid 350.00 a nite. :) Hope you enjoy it, its nice, but its gonna cost you. Again, the bed. It might just be worth it for that darn bed!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TxtoFrance
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel January 1-4th. Room was very nice, bathroom was nice with the separate shower/tub, complete with surround sound in the bathroom! I was disappointed that I wasn't comfortable in the bed everyone talks about. But my husband wants us to get a comforter like the one on the bed. We never ate in the hotel. Diner down the street or cafes did the trick for breakfasts and lunches. Within walking distance to Times Square, 5th Avenue, Grand Central Station, ESB. We will recommend this hotel to others looking for convenient hotel in NYC. When you have to walk to most destinations, location is everything.

Reviews.Title: “Good but Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in Mid-November 2005. We were slightly early for check-in and as we had two rooms reserved one was ready and made available to us straight away. This was fine and I must say that the gentleman dealing with us on reception was first class, outlining the hotel location, facilities and so on. He made us feel really welcome. Like many we booked this hotel because of the recommendations on Tripadvisor. The Hotel itself was comfortable, rooms and common areas were nicely decorated and it was very clean. Only observation was that it didn't feel particularly special, as a destination there was no 'wow' factor. On that basis when settling up the bill on leaving it did feel somewhat overpriced. For sight-seeing the location is excellent. Generally it was fine, but for the price it just didn't feel like a special destination.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel - bed was exceptionally comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here New Years's Eve (12/31/05- 01/-1/06). By far this is the best hotel I have stayed at in New York City! The service was great! Very Friendly staff from the doorman to the recption Desk to the security staff! We were even able to check in early! (around 12:30 pm!)Granted it was just a one night stay - but the room was fabulous! Very clean! Nice size. We were on the 9th floor and had an end unit. Unit had a minibar, high speed internet conection, and ironing board and iron. The bathroom was very nice - with a separate shower and bath. The split doors to the bathroom saved on space I am sure, but it also made the whole room more inviting. The bed was the most comfortable bed ever! I really enjoyed the European style with the comforter. They also had a very soft but warm blanket if you wanted it. I had no problem with the positioning of the TV as apparently another reviewer had. This is more of a business hotel than a "party" hotel. Which was just fine with us - nice to get some quite after a hective day in "the City". Relatively good price (about $600)especially considering it was New year's Eve in NY City!. The location was great - only a few blocks from Time Square, the Theatres, Rockefeller Center and Grand Central Terminal! I will definitley stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Sofitel New York”
Reviews.Author: JoanneW
Reviews.Content: Have recently returned from a five night break at The Sofitel. It was a treat for my husbands impending 40th birthday...and what a treat it was. We had a large room on floor 28 with a fabulous view of the Chrysler Building. The staff were very attentive without beig OTT and although part of a large chain we found the public areas to be more in keeping with those of an independent hotel. The restaurant served wonderful food (we tried breakfast and dinner, both of which were excellent) The concierge was very helpful with directions and local attractions and also booked a helicopter flight for us (at very short notice)The location was superb for restaurants, shopping and theatres so we were able to walk everywhere. Great choice for a special occasion...we will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel but”
Reviews.Author: Oudec
Reviews.Content: Totally agree with the last review from Trip Advisor members from London. We booked this hotel because of the excellent reviews on Trip Advisor and whilst we were not disappointed, we wouldnt rave about it. All that has been said is true, very quiet, fabulously comfy beds, nice rooms, etc etc. We believe that you are actually paying for the location of the hotel, two minutes walk from 5th Avenue. We were told we had a suite but it wasnt a suite it was just a normal hotel room but it was big for New York. You HAVE to eat at the Red Flame Diner. We loved it, food was good and reasonable but the best part was hearing the orders being passed to the kitchen, eggs over easy, all the way, etc!! Loved it. Dont be put off by this review, we would definitely stay at the Sofitel again but only if we got a good deal because it is very expensive in every way, rooms, drinks, meals.

Reviews.Title: “Cant understand these great reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Coltbridge
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel purely on the basis of Tripadvisor reviews for a three night stay in New York with our children. We have a suite and an executive room. The experience did not get off to a great start, arriving at 1500 we were told by an unsmiling receptionist that our rooms were still occupied. Her solution was for us to wait in reception for 90 minutes while they were emptied and prepared. Then, as if this made it better, she said that the squatters had actually paid for a late checkout! So this wasnt even an accident. After an hour of faffing we got into our rooms. Mostly as advertised, but in our suite the bahtub was only 36 inches long at the bottom, and 45 inches at the top. ie you cant stretch your legs out in it. In the bedroom of our suite the TV was set off to one side by about 60 degrees, so we couldnt lie in bed vegging at the tv without getting a severe cricked neck. And the window of our suite, 240 feet above street level, has a three foot crack in both the inside and outside panes - slightly alarming. To console ourselves we tried to make a cup of tea. No kettle. We rang housekeeping to be told that they dont provide kettles, but "we will see what can be done". An hour later nothing had been done, so we rang the manager, and 20 minutes later a kettle arrived, but in this heart of the world's greatest economy the kettle has no automatic off switch. Not impressed, at $1000 a night, and puzzled by all these great reviews - suggests that the rest of NY's hotels must be pants!

Reviews.Title: “Talk about Heavenly Beds...”
Reviews.Author: Mickie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel NY for one night in early November. The service was amazing from the bellman to the front desk, etc. but the most remarkable feature was the incredibly comfortable bed. I don't sleep well on the road but thanks to the luxurious sheets and cozy duvet, I slept like a log. It's pricey but I'll pay a bundle for a good sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value but Don't expect Wow Factor”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For the price, the room was pretty good (we had a king suite). Beds very comfortable pillow top with thick comfy quilt. Bathrooms definitely large and above average with separate glassed shower stall and deep bath tub. Very clean hotel. Location is excellent - able to walk to times square, broadway, restaurants, subway etc.....Just do not expect the "character" you will find in some other new york hotels. It reminded me of staying at the Westin Hotel or the Sheraton in any other big city (except the bed and bathroom are better quality). Overall I recommend it but am curious as to what other hotels of similar price range offer as the price is still not at all cheap.............

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: sftraveler04
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Dec 18-20, 2005 based on the reviews on Tripadvisor. You absolutely cannot beat the location of the hotel, which is great because we didn't spend much time in the room. The room and hotel itself is average. For the price you could probably get a better room elsewhere, but you probably couldn't get the great location. For our next trip I would probably want to stay elsewhere in the same price range $400 - $500 a night to compare before giving the Sofitel the highest rating.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: monbri
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel Hotel from December 16 through December 18th, 2005 (right before the subway strike). I picked the Sofitel based on the reviews from this site. I am glad I did. We usually stay at Ritz Carlton's but this time I opted to stay at the Sofitel. The staff was not only attentive but went out of their way to book dinner reservations and ensure that we were having a great time in the city. We stayed in room 2522 which has an awesome view. The room itself is nothing short of spectacular. You cannot ask for anything more. It has a separate bedroom, living room and the bathroom is the biggest I have seen in New York. The hotel is located just blocks from the heart and soul of New York. We were able to walk to anywhere we wanted to go. Now for the bottom line. If in New York stay at the Sofitel. You can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in an executive suite for $369 plus taxes per night booked online direct with accor hotels. Bedroom was very spacious with huge balcony (pity it had 2 inches of snow on it which never melted due to the freezing weather last week!), very spacious separate lounge also. Bathrooms are lovely, particularly liked the little touches like fresh flowers and candles. Forgot to take conditioner and shower gel but no probs as toiletries were replenished daily. Found all the staff very polite and helpful and all the expected staff were present whenever we entered or left the building. Had dinner on our first night - fillet mignon for me and lobster ravioli for my husband- and thoroughly enjoyed it. Also had breakfast twice and was impressed by choice available and service of staff. The location of the hotel couldn't be better and yet once inside you would never know that you were in the heart of midtown. In short, we have been to New York a few times and this was by far the best hotel we've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: lesleyjane
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in December 2005 after reading all the great reviews on this site. I must say that we were not at all disappointed. The hotel itself is situated close to Times Square, inbetween 5th and 6th Avenues. The staff were polite, friendly and helpful on all occasions. Nothing was too much trouble. The concierge was knowledgeable and helped us on numerous occasions by booking restaurants for us and drawing maps to help us find places we wanted to visit. Randy the doorman was a real gentleman too! Our room was large by New York standards and spotlessly clean. The beds were ultra comfortable too. The bathroom was huge with a big walk-in shower and separate bath. The communal areas were plush and kept very clean. All in all I would recommend this hotel highly to anyone who values cleanliness, old fashioned manners and friendly and informed staff. A1!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: msboodle
Reviews.Content: Hotel was beautiful and the staff was very helpful. The bed was extrememly comfortable. The only thing that I didn't enjoy about my stay was the fact that there was not a coffee pot in the room. I really enjoy my coffee!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable 4 star hotel (with some problems) suited to the average tourist”
Reviews.Author: Thomson_aus
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations of this hotel and booked 6 nights at the Sofitel based on it being rated the No. 1 hotel in New York by tripadvisor.com. I was disappointed with this hotel. Sofitel New York is a comfortable 4 star hotel for the average tourist. You should not expect high standards of service or luxury staying here. Sofitel is a 4 star, not a 5 star hotel. People travelling to this hotel should expect comfort, but not luxury. It is not a luxury hotel with consistent excellent service in the same league as The Ritz Carlton, The St. Regis Hotel, or Four Seasons Hotel in New York. Having checked out these five star properties while in New York, for my next stay in New York I would probably choose the St. Regis. The room rates at Sofitel New York are very high. I was paying $US500 a night for a queen bed room with no view. Good points: -Modern marble bathroom with separate bath and shower -Comfortable queen sized bed -Midtown location near Broadway and Times Square Bad points: -Room service ordered on my first night arrived almost cold. I ordered a Vegetable Lasagne and it was luke warm. Also, the night menu seems to suit the hotel rather than containing appealing options. - I returned to the hotel around midnight a couple of nights to find absolutely no staff on the property at all (no doormen, and concierge and front desks were both empty). For a 4 star hotel I think this is not satisfactory. Also, when I returned late on a Saturday night (Sunday morning), there was one staff member in the lobby who was sitting on a chair in a deep sleep. My walking past didn't even wake him! -Doormen do not open doors for guests consistently. For a 4 star hotel charging $500 a night, I tend to expect this. -Internet access terminals in the lobby are always down. I complained a couple of times and they were fixed, only to be down again. One of the terminals was taken away and not returned for 3 days. There seemed to be no rush to ensure it was fixed. -Concierges are not available all the time. There were times when a concierge was not on the property. One night I wanted a restaurant recommendation at 7pm and went to the concierge desk only to be told that there is no concierge on the property at the moment. -Maids are stingy with replacing toiletries. I had used all the shampoo and on one day when my room was serviced and the toiletries were replaced, my empty shampoo was replaced with a half-empty bottle. I asked the maid whether it had been used by another guest and she said "I don't know" and brought a new one. Equally, with the turndown service, they are supposed to provide bottles of Evian for both guests. We had 2 guests, and for most of the nights only 1 bottle of Evian was provided. I wouldn't rush back to the Sofitel at $500 a night, but if you can get a room for under $300 a night it would represent good value. And remember, it is not a luxury hotel, it is a standard 4 star tourist hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I treated ourselves to 5 nights in New York at the Sofitel and what a superb hotel. The room was modern yet tastefully furnished, designed with French flair. The room had extra touches, for example when you opened the wardrobe door a light would come on. The bathroom was very tasteful with a large walk in shower as well as a bath. The only disappointing thing was that we had to go back to our own bathroom when we came back!! The location was excellent too, right by Time Square but with the advantage of excellent soundproofing in the hotel. We didn't eat in the hotel choosing to eat out for breakfast, lunch and dinner. However, we did go to the bar for a drink one evening and what a beautifully designed place it was. In summary one of the best hotels we have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend in New York”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely wonderful....safe, quiet location only minutes from Times Square and Fifth Avenue, beautiful lobby, courteous and helpful staff, quick elevator service, spacious rooms by NY standards, views of Chrysler and/or Empire State Building, extremely comfortable beds, beautiful marble baths with soaking tub and glass shower, special touches such as candles, fresh flowers, terry-cloth robe/slippers, complimentary water bottles, cd players, and late checkouts. We came to NYC for a weekend visit with another couple and enjoyed our stay immensely! My husband and I stayed on the 17th floor where it was extremely quiet. The couple we traveled with were upgraded to a larger room on the 19th floor and surprised with champagne and chocolates after I emailed the hotel a few days prior to arrival that they were celebrating their anniversary. Be sure to register in advance for a Sofitel Loyalty card and bring a printout of your registration so you can request a late checkout. Also, don't touch anything in the room refrigerator unless you want it...There is a sensor inside, and you will be charged for any items moved. As for activities in NYC, I would recommend dinner at Tony's Italian Restaurant and Gallagher's Steak House, breakfast at the Red Flame Diner, cheesecake at Lindy's, early lunch at Carnegie Deli, purchasing tickets in advance on the hotel computers for Top of the Rock so you do not have to wait in line, and of course any show on Broadway...We saw Producers and Chicago this time, but also enjoyed Rent and Phantom on previous visits. Book well in advance if you want to see Wicked, Spamalot, or Odd Couple. We all had a wonderful weekend and will not hesitate to make reservations at the Sofitel on our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: Bermudasusan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sofitel NY for 1 night Nov 25th. The city was mobbed with holiday shoppers but the Sofitel was calm and lovely! We stayed in suite 2922 and had a nice view of Chrysler building. The bed is super comfy, the bathroom was divine, all marble and a deep tub which was great after a hectic day shopping! Perfect location for all the best NY has to offer. Room service was prompt and accurate. The girl in the gift shop remained kind and smiley even after I repeatedly knocked over a handbag display. The check-in guy had to play the xylophone to summons a bellboy who appeared quickly out of no where. I said "They make you play the xylophone???" He smiled and said Yes! ...in fact i think he liked having to play it. I would stay here again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Bas1976
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sofitel in mid October 2005 for 3 nights and thought it was wonderful. The location was brilliant, just 5 minutes from Time Square and all the hussle and bustle of the Big Apple. But....even though it was so close to everything it was incredibly, a small haven of tranquility. We booked a suite (which was huge by NYC standards) so we were on a high floor. It was utterly silent up there and I slept brilliantly on the beautifully comfortable bed. The bathroon was lovely with a huge walk in shower but the 'large' bath we were promised when we booked failed to materialise!! The lifts were very speedy and we never had to wait for them unlike in other hotels (Parker Meridien). Free internet in the lobby topped it off. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: MOF_CPH
Reviews.Content: Nice atmosphere and great staff. Size of room exellent and very bright.

Reviews.Title: “Classy non-flashy luxury”
Reviews.Author: BobHarvey
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Sofitel. The staff were courteous, the room moderate size but elegant, lovely bathroom, tasteful toiletries, the most comfortable bed you'll ever sleep in. The lobby's a tad gloomy though elegant, and the only thing I'd really knock is the price of breakfast. Go down the block to the diner instead.

Reviews.Title: “Really Great!!”
Reviews.Author: kr203040
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Sofitel 28th Oct-1st Nov - looks exactly like the pictures on the website and has a lovely plush lobby! The rooms are lovely - very clean, nicely decorated and extremely quiet. We were on the 16th floor and didn't hear a sound from outside. When we first got there the bins in the room hadn't been emptied and there were no fresh towels in the bathroom, we rang reception and the head of housekeeping was at our door within literally one minute, she was exteremly apologetic and offered us another room but we were happy to stay where we were and a maid fixed the room immediatley - for the rest of our stay everything was perfect. The Evian water and weather forecast of a night were a lovely touch and all of the staff we encountered were friendly and courteous. I have previously stayed at the Alex and the Westin Times Square and would say the Sofitel definately has the edge over the the Alex and is equal to the Westin - if you want ultra modern go for Westin - ultra comfortable - go Sofitel!!! Don't hesitate to book and enjoy the great location!

Reviews.Title: “Just what we hoped for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms at the Sofitel for 4 nights in Nov 05. It was our first visit to New York and we weren't really sure what to expect. We needn't have worried. The hotel was great. Staff at check in were extremely friendly & the rooms were excellent & well equipped. Although ours overlooked the street we weren't bothered by noise & the beds were very comfortable. Bathrooms were modern & spotlessly clean. Concierge & doorman were extremely helpful when we asked for directions or wanted a taxi. Similarly bar staff when we went in for a late night drink. Hotel is in a great location near to Time Square, Grand Central Station, Empire State Building & numerous other sights. I would heartily recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Queensnative
Reviews.Content: I recently booked a suite here as part of a celebration for my husband's 40th birthday. We were both extremely pleased. Service was prompt and very friendly, the hotel itself is very striking and our suite was just like the photographs - beautiful. It was also very quiet, which I appreciate. Had drinks at the bar one night, and a fantastic fresh breakfast the next morning. I would recommend this without any qualms to everyone, and will definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not wow”
Reviews.Author: ltngold
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews here I was expecting to be thrilled with our choice of staying at Sofitel. It is very nice and the bathrooms are extraordinary. But the best hotel in NYC - I don't think so.

Reviews.Title: “A wee gem.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband Tom and myself stayed at the Sofitel for eight nights during Oct 2005. We loved the hotel. The attenion to detail was excellent, service first class and the staff where extremly helpful and friendly [when we reported a blocked toilet, the problem was dealt with quickly and efficiently], in particular the concierge staff. When we had to rearrange our wedding plans the Head Concierge rearranged it effortlessly and continued to support us up to and during the big day, making sure it was a special day for us. The hotel is in a good central location. The Red Flame Dinner, a few doors down was good for breakfast. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Every bit as good as you read!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm normally not one to write online reviews, but this place certainly merits it for all the right reasons. We booked the hotel for 3 night shopping break based on other reviews and great price obtained through a third party internet site. Check in was simple - no queues and no problem for an early check in just before midday (3PM is preferred time). We were on the 11th floor so our view was restricted by neighbouring buildings, though in all honesty, you are not in NYC to stare out your hotel window as you will see plenty of sites when out and about. Ask at check-in if you want to be higher up. The rooms are a good size and extrememly comfortable. The bed and bathroom are every bit as good as other reviewers have described. The rooms were very quiet too - both in terms of city noise and nighbouring guests/corridor noise. It felt like we were the only ones on the floor. The hotel has an excellent location in midtown Manhattan, convinient for shopping/shows etc. We didn't have much interaction with the staff, but when we did, they were curtious and helpful. The doormen were great too. Didn't eat in the restaurant but opted instead for the diner a few doors down for breakfast which provided a hearty meal for a day on your feet. The small internet access area(3 PCs and printer) in the lobby was excellent for checking on your business email while you are away. All in all, an excellent place to stay, and I have been in my fare share of 5 star luxury hotels that don't come up to the same standard. Won't hesitate to book again.

Reviews.Title: “Super stay in Sofitel, nearly perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Irish_Dude111
Reviews.Content: I normally stay in 3 star hotels but wanted to stay in somewhere special for our visit to New York and we werent disappointed with our 4 night stay at the Soiftel. Arrived in yellow taxi from Newark ($65 i think), and were immediately met and helped out with our luggage. We were able to walk right in and check in without having to haul bags. Arrived at about 1.30pm and got checked in straight away (no problem swaping to a smoking room). We were given a room on floor 29 and when we pulled back the curtains the view was breathtaking. Superb view out to the Chrysler Building and if you strained your neck you could also make out the Empire State Building too. The room was clean and spacious (Not sure where other complaints about the room being too small, maybe we arent used to larger tooms). Plenty of coat hangers and a wonderful bathroom with bath and a very spacious shower (water pressure could have been better though). Bed was wonderfully comfortable. Wasnt expecting to need air conditioning in November but it was great (21deg outside). After changing and heading out we arrived back exhausted later that evening and went straight to bed. It was after i switched off the airconditioning that i noticed an irratting noise from the bathroom area. It seemed to be the extractor fan which was not switching off and unfortunately the noise was such that i spent a very sleepless night! Not a good start to holiday. In the morning i reported to receiption and they said they would check it out. We arrived back later that evening and the noise was still there. Went to reception and they said they would send an engineer round. He arrived about 5 mins later and said he thought he knew what the problem was. We were leaving to go to a show and had to leave him to it. When we arrived back it was late and we were exhausted, the noise was still there and there was a phone message left for me. Basically said that it was a pump above the room which controlled the water and could not be switched off however they would be more than happy to move us to another room. It was too late so i thought i would give it another go. Slept a little better but the noise was still very annoying. I should have moved the next night but again we arrived back late and i didnt want the hassle. Slept with the window open and slept like a log!. The noise in the room seems to switch on and off whereas the background noise from outside was constant and helped to smooth out the sound!. Would reccomend getting the sofitel privelege card for the late check out, and free drinks in the hotel bar. We didnt receive our complimentary chocolates though we did get the evian water delivered every night. On the morning we were checking out i looked up the bill on the tv an noticed that we were being charged the full rate. I had actually been allowed a lower rate on the "Price Match less 10%" deal on the Sofitel Website. Luckily I had all the paperwork and copies of emails with me. Took a bit of explanation as it seems that the Hotel did not receive notification that I had been given the lower rate ($500 less) and this created some confusion. Eventually Albert was able to sort out the matter and my bill was duly reduced. Watch out for the minibar-I had lifted out 2 bottles to look at the alcohol content and these showed up on the bill. These were immediately removed when I mentioned it. There is a sensor in the minbar which shows up when anything is removed. Checked out a 4pm and the doorman offered us a yellow taxi for $51+Tip+Tolls or a Limo for $60+Tip+Tolls. We took the limo and had a very comfortable trip to airport. The location of the hotel is superb, just off 5th Avenue, easy walking distance to subway, Broadway, Empire State, Macys, Central Park etc. All in all I would give the Sofitel 5 stars. They made us feel welcome and despite the problem with the noise in the room it was I that chose to stay on when they had offered the change. I would reccomend anyone who avails of the "price match deal" to confirm the rate directly with the hotel to prevent any confusion. We ended up paying $1350 for our 4 nights and i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Still great but they need to watch the details”
Reviews.Author: mrwatson
Reviews.Content: I am a HUGE fan of this hotel. I've been staying here since they opened and don't stay anywhere else in NYC unless forced. In general, the location is great, the service is friendly and helpful, the room service quick, the rooms clean and big for NYC standards. Since I'm such a huge fan, I figure I'm allowed to be picky. I think they need to get on top of the details - or make sure the staff is really trained to be looking for these things: Examples: bathrobe not in room (fine, got it but had to call) Pen missing from paper/pen pad on desk chair missing from room (that's even more bizarre - how do you miss a chair) Bath mat not replaced one morning Gym had broken TV on one machine and missing foot pedals on one of the stationary bikes all in all still good, but I would hate to see it go down hill.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel 29/10/05 - 2/11/05. Very pleasant stay with no real faults to report but no 'wow' factor either. Not a place you would regret staying at but surprised it gets quite such enthusiastic reviews on this site. We stayed in a King Suite on the 28th floor and the room was very quiet and comfortable. Not sure if the hotel gets its #1 rating because it doesn't do much wrong rather than anything spectacularly right. On the occasions we needed assistance the staff were very polite and helpful. Nice lobby, decent communal areas and an easy place to relax - it depends what you are looking for, and I would recommend the Sofitel as a good, safe bet. Having stayed at the Four Seasons in Dublin a week or so earlier my girlfriend and I are still commenting to friends on the standard or service etc we received - with the Sofitel our only real comment was that it was 'nice'. Minor complaint was the standard of room cleaning - e.g. marks on the bedside tables caused by water glasses were not wiped away in the 4 days we were there and apart from the bed having been made it was difficult to tell if the room had been serviced. We didn't complain, however, so gave them no chance to rectify it. Location very good particularly for a first time visit to NY. If you want good, well located accommodation the Sofitel won't let you down, if you want something truly memorable it may be worth looking further afield (maybe a room at the Four Seasons for the same price as suite at the Sofitel - probably my choice next time).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For A Long Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel partially based on reviews from this web site. It did not disappoint. We were pleased to find the staff friendly and helpful, without the snobbishness that comes with some of these higher priced hotels. We were delighted to receive the bottle of champagne the staff sent up for our anniversary. The Sofitel is a nice sized hotel, but not overly huge. The lobby is comfortable and inviting. Our rooms were a good size and fairly quiet, given the location. Very comfortable bed as well. We had good breakfasts at the diner down the street, and other meals while we were out. On our last night there, we were exhausted from all the walking and wanted to eat someplace good and nearby. The concierge recommended Osteria al Doge down the street, and we enjoyed an excellent meal in a relaxed setting to celebrate our 10th anniversary. Sofitel would be my first choice in hotels the next time we travel to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel. I'm glad I took the advice of the trip advisor reviewers! Location couldn't have been better. Elegant lobby and very helpful concierge and reception staff. The room was lovely and of a good size. The bed the most comfortable I have ever slept in (you can now buy them if you visit their website) and the bathroom very stylish although I was a little disappointed at the size of the bath-too short and shallow. I would definitely recommend applying on the website to become a privilege card holder as you get a free drink in the bar on arrival and more importantly a late checkout of 1600 on your final day-perfect for our evening flight. I would definitely stay in a Sofitel hotel again wherever it may be.

Reviews.Title: “It's no wonder this hotel is #1!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: baharyt
Reviews.Content: Here is the lowdown. A stay at this hotel will ruin you for other hotels! From the moment that you enter the sumptuous lobby and are greeted with a smile by the staff and concierge, you know that you have stepped into a place with class. First: We requested a large corner room on a high floor when we made the reservation. (We learned this trip trick from reading other trip advisor reviews) The room itself (2221) was large and impeccably well designed and very comfortable. The bathroom was beautiful!!! Very large with a separate shower and tub. The bed was the most comfortable that we have slept in in all the years we have traveled. Second: LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION!!! Perfectly situated 2 blocks from Times Square and subways and 2 blocks from 5th Avenue and shopping!!! Who could ask for a better location?!! Even though we were right in the middle of all the action,..... the room was so quiet!! Didn't hear a thing all night long. In closing: This hotel is not number one without good reason. Our best wishes to the Sofitel's continuing success. Thank you for making our stay one we will never forget!! And THANK YOU TO TRIP ADVISOR for once again coming through with another winner! Thanks again, Michael and David San Diego, California

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: george1
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from our 1st vist to New York (it will not be our last) on the tripadvisor recomendation we stayed at the Sofitel. What a hotel no faults at all. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have been in. The room was very clean. Bathroom excellent. Very good location central to all attractions, we walked everywhere. Staff could not do enough for you. When we visit New York again we will be staying at this hotel. Few yard down the red flame diner for breakfast, one block over Sammy's bar. Excellent trip all round.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I started going to the Sofitel a couple years ago when the President was speaking out against the French (2003)- we got such a wonderful deal on the room ($100 per night) that we tried it and even got an upgrade. There were coupons given for free drinks in the wonderful bar there and all the amenities of a luxury hotel- view of Empire State Building, the robes, the mitted washclothes, fresh orchids, candles in the bathroom with music/tv piped into the very large bathrooms with separate marble showers with large shower heads. Although it is close to the "action", it is quiet inside and the lobby is serene and welcoming unlike the Times Square touristy hotels where you have to show your key to get inside and there are mobs of people hanging out. Here the staff are attentive, helpful and quietly efficient. The rooms are quiet and you don't hear other people in the hallways or in the next room when you are in your room. Unfortunately, the opinion of hte French must have changed because the prices have gone up but the quality of these large sized rooms and the ambience has not changed from excellent! We love it!

Reviews.Title: “good and not more”
Reviews.Author: Charlot21
Reviews.Content: Nice bathroom (with battub PLUS shower, PLUS marble), nice bathroom...what else ? Small bedroom ; we could not get to the armchair without pushing the bed ; could not leave the bathroom door open AND go thru the small corridor to the room main door.... Maybe all the fuss I read here is because people at the SOfitel say "bonjour" and not "good morning". It is a good hotel, certainly not a 5 star ; so if you want to feel you are in the US and npt pay extra money to get french soap, go to the Hilton. If you want luxury, then head for the New York Palace for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay.... Great Location....best Stay In New York !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Commish123
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend the Hotel Sofitel...great location between 5th and Times Square, easy walking everywhere. Excellent rooms, well equiped, clean (spotless), comfy beds, and just the right amount of french touch on everthing. Great Bar.......Excellent Resturant. This will be our New York headquarters from this day forward. PS; There is Great Tracatoria just steps out the door to the right heading towards Times Square and a nice little diner less steps, yet.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel is SUPER!!!”
Reviews.Author: taglady
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed three nights at the Sofitel New York .Lobby was very pretty with nice sitting area and the fresh cut flowers were beautiful. Our 14th floor room was great. Nice room decor, marbled bathroom was nice with separate shower and tub and the candle in the bathroom added an extra nice touch.Cannot say enough about how comfortable the beds were..soooo comfy. Hotel staff were very nice..Rene' (sp?) at concierge was very helpful.Doormen were always there to help and getting a cab when we checked out was no problem. Computer room complete with printer was real nice. We were able to check in and print boarding passes for our flight back home. Hotel is within walking distance for most everything..Times Square..Radio City..Rockefeller Center. Saint Patricks Cathedral. Fifth Avenue shopping.Grand Central.. We took subway to Chinatown. We saw Phantom of the Opera at the Majestic theatre and it was a couple of blocks away. We also went for taping of David Letterman show which was also within walking distance. Red Flame Diner just a few doors down was a great place for breakfast. We will most definitely stay at the Sofitel on our next trip to New York!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for NYC”
Reviews.Author: BigMac58
Reviews.Content: We took two rooms - one for my wife and me, the other for our two girls. We had premier queens on the 14th or 15th floor. The receptionist sweetly gave us rooms opposite each other at the end of a corridor - as there was a door just up the corridor for which only we had the key we could form a suite arrangement between the two rooms and have total privacy as a family, which was a nice touch. Clean, affordable (by NYC standards), brilliantly located and attentive staff. Above all else however is that I am a terrible sleeper but the bed was so comfortable that I had the best sleep for years. As they now market as their own brand (as featured in the Sunday Times)I am putting one at the top of my list for Santa this year. Brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Loved IT”
Reviews.Author: stephanierafail
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here for business several times. The room is heaven (great bathroom, very modern, DVD players with DVDs you can get from the front desk, comfortable bed, plenty of room.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights during a visit to New York City, and had a very enjoyable stay. Our room was (for NYC) very spacious and quite comfortable -- and also very upscale with the modern-looking blond wood finishing and furniture. The bathroom was great, with marble and a very nice separate glass shower (and a tub as well!). The midtown location is also great, especially if you plan on seeing any shows. Times Square is only a block or so away. We would definitely stay at the Sofitel NYC again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Price Guarantee Not Honored”
Reviews.Author: BurnedbyHotelHana
Reviews.Content: Beware of using the Softel web site for booking hotels. They do not honor their "Best Rate Guaranteed" Policy. I booked the Sofitel for 10-21 thru 10-24 at $1397 on their site. Sidestep found a lower rate and I forwarded this on to Sofitel. Sofitel refuses to match the price because the online reservation had a cancellation charge and Sofitel's did not. To my knowledge, almost every online web site has a cancellation charge or is nonrefundable (Expedia charges $25). This is a "gotcha" buried in their fine print. This is apparently a common problem too because the person answering the 800 call from their web site explained that it would likely not be honored for this reason as soon as I called. Apparently this is a common answer. In their defense, I will say that the hotel itself was much more cooperative when I called them direct to cancel my reservation. However, at that point I had already made other arrangements. They also pointed out that Sofitel offers a "best rate" and "hot deals". The "best rate" is cancellable; the "hot deals" are not. At the time I booked (10-11), the best rate (cancellable) was $100 LESS than the hot deals. As explained to me then, I would have to book the hot deal at the more expensive rate to get a price match. Too much hassle. Too much fine print. Too Mickey Mouse for a reputable company. Bottom line. A company that advertises a best rate guarante on its site that apparently routinely refuses to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: SterlingRose1212
Reviews.Content: My friends and I (3 gals from Houston) recently went to this hotel after bidding on it from Priceline. Worth every penny for the location alone! We flew into Newark and it was a breeze via taxi ($45 plus tolls and tip) This hotel is within walking distance to most of the NY hot spots-theater district, shops on 5th Avenue, St Pats, Central Park (OK-a little far but everyone walks in NY) Macy's etc. The staff is lovely and the only complaint I had was we couldn't find the doorman a few times to help with cabs and had to flag down our own. There are several hotels on the block and it was raining most of the Columbus Day weekend so cabs were at a premium. We did not eat at the hotel but found tons of inexpensive places for breakfast and lunch. Bar area is nice but drinks are pricey. We were on the 22nd floor and it was so incredibly quiet we over slept every day. The view was so-so but the peaceful sleep was worth it. The beds are fabulous and the rooms are a good size. Bathrooms were big, too. Highly recommend if you can get it for under 300 per night!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The best I have ever stayed at in NYC. The rooms are spotless, well appointed and quite large after NYC standards. The staff is very friendly, and the locations is great. Will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Beautiful Hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend trip to NYC. The Sofitel is in a great location, midtown manhattan. This is easy walking distance to Grand Central Terminal, the NYC public library, Times Square, Fifth Ave. Shopping , the Empire State Building and Rockefeller Plaza. We also walked back to the Sofitel from Madison Square Garden. The Hotel is french. The lobby is large and beautiful with fresh flowers. It has intimate conversation areas set up with leather chairs and beautiful damask couches. The doormen were attentive and friendly. All the staff we encountered were polite, friendly, relaxed and attentive, not at all stuffy. Our room was lovely with neutral modern art deco furnishings. The bed was great! It was a king with fine linens including a featherbed and down comforter. The bathroom was nicely appointed with marble flooring and counters. Everything was very clean and french soaps and toiletries were provided. There was an easy to use room safe which we made use of. Even robes and slippers were provided. There was a nightly turn down service where the maid came in and prepared your bed. She also left bottled water, a card with the next days weather forcast and a breakfast order menu. We did not try any of the room service but the items on the menu sounded delicious. There really is nothing they could improve on. It was all great. The only thing I missed was a chocolate on my pillow. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel. I booked way in advance through travelocity and I think I paid $269 a night. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best customer service ever”
Reviews.Author: BlackPearlCasino.net
Reviews.Content: All I can say it awesom!!!! I wouldnt stay anywhere else

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and the best beds ever! Loved the Sofitel it was a fab sanctuary at the end of a tiring sight seeing/shopping day. The shower was lovely and the service also. The hotels location meant that it was possible to walk to nearly all popular attractions and the room service in a morning was always exactly on time! Never saw any of the maids but our room was kept spotless. Will definately stay here again when in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel !!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location, between Times Square and 5th Avenue. I booked a luxury room at $610/night for 7 nights directly with my credit card, but I had also a sofitel favourite guest card ($300) that offers 50% discount Fri-Sun and 25% Mon-Thur. There was a problem at check-in with my favourite guest card, and they solved it immediately presenting their excuses by offering me 50% discount for the entire stay. They really have an aggressive commercial attitude, prefering to lose some money than have unsatisfied customers. The hotel is excellent, the location is excellent, inside and outside noises are non-existent (excellent noise isolation, each floor only has 6-7 rooms), the staff is helpful, the room is clean (they clean it twice a day), marble bathroom, free evian water every night... This list could be endless, so I really recommend this hotel if you really want your stay in NYC to be excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sofitel for four nights based on reccomendations on this web site. Reviews were exactly as described; I was not disappointed. Location is superb; just off Times square and Broadway, and close enough to shopping district on Fifth Avenue. Reception staff were always helpful and curteous. The room was well presented, with the best bed you are ever likely to sleep in, (much appreciated after each day's lengthy walking), along with iron and board, safe, TV and mirrored wardrobe. The impressively spacious bathroom with seperate bath and powerful shower also had some great toilettries as well as fresh flowers, candles and a hairdryer. Free internet access in hotel's lobby was also very handy. As with previous reviewers, I can heartily reccomend the breakfasts at 'The Red Flame Diner' five doors down from the hotel. I enjoyed New York immensely, I will certainly be returning and definately staying at The Sofitel again. P.S. Do take your most comfortable shoes as you will do plenty of walking!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but a little overrated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Definitely a solid hotel, but based on the glowing reviews I saw here, I thought I was in for the hotel stay of my lifetime. The queen deluxe room was a good size, not huge, like at the Affinia Dumont (my favorite NY hotel, but a little pricey these days), but nice enough. The bathroom was wonderful, large with a bath AND shower. Overall, the staff was helpful, my room was ready by 10am, but I did have to call down three times for some extra toothpaste. Be warned that your Sofitel privilege card will not be honored if you book your room online at a discounted rate. Nice place, above average but not excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at an excellent price”
Reviews.Author: MJDunne
Reviews.Content: Booked the Sofitel for a bargain price of £364 on airline-network. We were given a lovely king room, gorgeous bed, decor and bathroom. The room was just lovely after a long flight from Heathrow. The reception staff always said hello or mostly "bonjour!" The location was perfect, close enough to Times Square and 6th Avenue for some fun but quiet enough for some peace! There was also a great restaurant almost next door which did some great breakfasts! We drank at the bar both nights and had some great fun. Could not fault this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “The most comfortable bed in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Vendredimanche
Reviews.Content: Only stayed in New York for 3 nights this time around so sleep and comfort were a priority and we were not disappointed at the Sofitel. Our queen room was large for NY standards (much larger than I expected!), very nicely furnished (with big cupboards/ iron/ safe / full-length mirror / fluffy bathrobes), and delightfully quiet. The bathroom had both a bath and a shower and lots of lovely products + candles & fresh flower (and the towels are from Frette...). The bed is just amazingly comfortable with fresh crisp linen - we're thinking of writing to Sofitel to ask where they got their beds from and buy the same one for our home! Service was faultless, and both checking in and out was extremely quick. And of course the location is brilliant - minutes off Times Square and 5th avenue. Price-wise, it is expensive but then again everything is expensive in NYC. We paid the same price for the Hudson hotel last year and had a very disappointing stay there. You can get the best rates on the internet, especially if you book the non-refundable option. Only drawback of the whole stay: the price of the breakfast which we did not know about until we signed the check (and it was too late!) - USD45 for 1 continental breakfast + 1 coffee... extortionate! Once bitten, twice shy - we went to a nearby diner for the rest of our stay. But we'll definitely be back at the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay at Sofitel thanks to its #1 ranking here on TripAdvisor and was extremely pleased. Very courteous service at check-in impressed us, and set the tone for our stay there.
