The room was average size, though supposedly good for New York City, and was equipped with a couple extra amenities you don’t usually get such as a complimentary room safe. Thanks to its location a block-and-a-half East of Times Square, street noise wasn’t a factor. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: LittleJan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visit New York several times a year to visit our daughter. We stay in different hotels every time we go. This time we stayed at the Sofitel and although it was over and above what we would normally pay, it was worth every single cent. The staff are among the best we have encountered anywhere. Just walking through the lobby you know you are in for something very special. We had booked a "Superior" room, which is the cheapest, but there was nothing cheap about this room. The bed was the most comfortable we have slept in. The decor was understated elegance. The bathroom was amazing, not only a bath with shower, but an extremely large walk-in shower, enough for at least four people to shower at the same time! Only ever staying in 31/2 or 4 star hotels it is very unusual for "room only" hotels to have a turn down service at night. Not only were the beds turned down, but all the towels changed as well. They also supply big fluffy robes and slippers.....what more can you ask for. They also leave a note of what the weather will be like the next day....wow. Money permitting, we will definitely stay at the Sofitel again. All this and a five minute walk to Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “If you love NYC, the theatre but not the noise...”
Reviews.Author: jjg54
Reviews.Content: Your within a stroll from all what you love about NYC if that is theatre, shopping and people when you stay at The Sofitel. Central Park, the Empire State Building, the Library, 5thAvenue, MOMA although that was a contemporary disappointment. The hotel rooms were wonderfully quiet from the horn-blowing conversations of NYC. Timing and lineups of TKTS made a drop in to Spamelot theatre necessary and rewarding. Orchestra seats Thurs pm. Monty Python takes a shot at all. Hilarious. No tax on clothes, Macy discounts for out of town plus credit card app, Labour Day sales, the place was jammed. Chez Josephine great piano, good bistro food. Le Train Blue at Bloomies a Restaurant Week treat. You won't have issues with the Sofitel if you do it could only be that everyone wants to stay there. We found it a great way to start and end your New York day and BUZZ!!!

Reviews.Title: “Really great hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Guillermo21Belgium
Reviews.Content: I had been reading all reviews before booking a Deluxe Queen Room at the Sofitel. I was not disappointed at all ! Before checking in, I had sent an e-mail to the hotel requesting for a high floor room and a late check-out. Indeed, the (free) Sofitel Privilège Card offers this late check-out as part of the package. In addition, I had mentionned my birthday at that time. What we got in return: - an upgrade to a suite (!) - a birthday card from the Mgt - a birthday chocolate cake and drinks Moreover, the location is great: between 5th & 6th Avenue, close to Rockefeller Center. Overall, an excellent hotel, with great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: lovewestcoast
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel New York from 9/2 - 9/5/2005. We have stayed at many fine hotels and this one did not disappoint. It was a great home for us during our visit to NYC. The hotel is nicely tucked away from the crowds but still very close to Times Square, Rocefeller Plaza, Grand Central Station, subway access, etc. The lobby is elegant in an understated way - feels comfortable and approachable. There is a small computer room off the lobby with four computers and a printer with free internet access - this was a big plus! The front desk staff is friendly and efficient - very service oriented - they worked with us to find a room we liked - our first room had a very small window and felt claustrophobic. When we called down to complain the front desk clerk offered to come up and show us another room to see if we liked it better - very accommodating. The front desk is located near the elevators - we were greeted consistently when coming and going. The carpet in the elevators and the guest room corridors were the only things in the hotel that did not feel spotless - they always seemed like they needed to be vacuumed. The room we ended up in was a Deluxe Queen on the 21st floor which had a nice city view. Initially we were not sure about having a queen bed versus a king but it turned out to be a very comfortable room. The bed was fabulous just as others have mentioned in their reviews - felt like a layer of down under the sheet - there were feather pillows - two king size, two standard size - the down comforter and duvay were very cozy - although it was weird that there was no top sheet provided on the bed - we had to request a top sheet every day. All the bedding was very crisp, clean, fresh, high quality. The carpet in the room was soft and comfortable and also felt very clean. The art work was attractive. The bathroom was FABULOUS!! - felt very clean, fresh, updated, luxurious - attractive marble, shiny metal fixtures, separate shower, Frette bath linens, upscale French bath amenities. As others have mentioned the room was VERY QUIET - we did not hear any sirens, city traffic noise, etc while in our room which was very nice! The air conditioning in the room was also very quiet. Also a nice touch to have a Sony CD player/alarm clock - we brought some of our favorite CD's and enjoyed the music while in our room. The housekeepers kept the room clean and fresh twice a day and we never really noticed them - very discreet. Gaby's Restaurant was nice for breakfast - food quality was high, portions were nice - not too much or too little - coffee and orange juice were included in price of breakfast - $21 for American breakfast including 2 eggs, breakfast potatoes, wonderful fresh croissant, breakfast meat, coffee or tee, and juice. They automatically add 15% gratuity to all breakfast checks - that was strange. Anyway, it was a nice experience and worth the $50 for a special breakfast for two (although on day two the hotel was power washing the sidewalk right outside the windows of the restaurant - the noise was disturbing - not sure why they would choose to do that during the morning hours at breakfast time). The french press coffee was a nice touch but they leave the pot on the table and it gets cold too fast. We did enroll in the Sofitel Privilege Program before arriving and were offered a free drink when we checked in (although it was only ONE drink - strange since there were two of us). The concierge was dissapointing when compared with the rest of the experience. We dealt with three different concierge agents during our stay and found all three to be aloof. They did not seem very interested in helping, not very enthusiastic, not service oriented - a bit snobby. The bellmen and door staff also seemed aloof. Overall the hotel was impressive. The facility is modern and clean. The service at the front desk/ restaurant/ housekeeping is very good - the concierge/ bellmen/ door staff need work. We will definitely stay at Sofitel New York next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location; great rooms and fabulous service. We loved the hotel. Albert at the front desk was extremely knowledgable and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “High class hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All reviews true. Really lovely quality hotel, charming and efficient service (I stayed in three different hotels in New York for one trip and this was the only one I didn't have to queue to check in/ out). Hotel also let me have a free late check out. Room was lovely, even had a great view. So it's not cheap, but where in New York is?

Reviews.Title: “It is true! ”
Reviews.Author: Where to go nextt
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at the Sofitel New York , 27 August 2005 onward . Chose the hotel based on the reviews on this website and we were not wrong to do so . The service was first class in terms of concierge , front desk , room service & chamber maids . We did not use the Gaby restaurant electing to take breakfast at the Red Flame £25 for 4 including tip & eating out in the evening. The location is superb with Times Square, Central Station , 5th Avenue all within a 10 minute walk , truly remarkable . The rooms were of a good size by New York standards , very clean , the bathroom was luxurious and the beds were very comfortable ( perhaps a little too soft for some ).The gym was adequate. A noisy/leaking air conditioning unit in my daughters` room was fixed promptly. I certainly felt confident that any issue would have been dealt with efficiently and willingly - this had not been my previous experience at the Radisson Lexington though you do perhaps get what you pay for . five nights in a standard room was mine for £700. I would not hesitate to stay here again .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Location and The BEDS, OH THE BEDS”
Reviews.Author: eprintmp
Reviews.Content: I am always skeptical about reviews on these sites as i always think they are written by the staff, especially when they rave about a hotel. I needed to go to NY for a wedding so I wanted to be centrally located within a good area so I opted for the SOFITEL. There was a bit of a mix up on the booking as they deducted 4 payments within 1 day, however this was rectified immediately. When we arrived they checked us in swiftly then sent us to our room. The hotel is very clean, very art deco with a modern feel. The rooms are a little on the small side, however I now know what they mean about all good things come in small packages. The bathroom is superb (the shower is heaven) the marble surround is very plush. My biggest criticism is always the Iron never works properly and the bed is uncomfortable. Well this was certainly not the case. The bed was out of this world the most comfortable I have ever slept in. The iron actually ironed a cotton shirt to perfection. The room service was prompt and the staff was very helpful to say the least. I could not really fault anything about the hotel except there was no laundry service on a Sunday, hence ironing my own shirt. Thanks Sofitel it was a great experience

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: RST1974
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, friendly staff and good facilities. Don't expect big rooms (this is NYC after all) but they are very well decorated and very clean, the bathrooms are a decent spec too. I have stayed in much worse 5 star hotels. Only minor gripe was the service at breakfast was v slow. Outstanding value for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! Extremely quite room, awesome bed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Highly recommned. Staff was attentive and friendly. Lobby greets you with the smell of fresh cut flowers. No street noise. Room is spacious and extremely quite (my husband travels all the time, said this was the quietest room he's ever been in, no a/c noise). We were upgraded to a room w/ a view, which I was glad. When I made reservations, we went w/ the less expensive room, which is on lower levels (no view). Can't complain!

Reviews.Title: “4th visit & still perfect!”
Reviews.Author: CSIMelissa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel 8/17-8/21 with my mother. This was our fourth stay at the hotel in the past two years and like the others, it was perfect. We didn’t have any major complaints. We will definitely return. Our room was nice and our beds were super comfy. The hotel is soooo quiet! Even at night. They have changed their bedding somewhat so it was a bit odd because instead of having a top sheet on your bed you just had a thick, down comforter. As luxurious as it was it was WAY to warm of something to sleep with in August so we requested “regular” sheets and housekeeping complied. Also, housekeeping kept shorting us on towels and wash cloths but they gladly brought extras up when I called. I’ve never mentioned it before, but the lobby has a very nice seating area . It’s a great place to wait after you’ve checked out and you still have time before heading to the airport. There’s free internet access off that part of the lobby too. Also, I would recommend the Red Flame Diner just down the sidewalk for breakfast, lunch or dinner. We headed there every morning and got excellent food and service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and stayed in early November, it was wonderful. The staff was very attentive, the rooms were nicely appointed, and my wife especially loved the shower and bathroom. I had never been to New York, and was worried about the size of the rooms, but the standard room we had was perfect. We can't wait to go back. If possible, I recommend early November, we got the room for $179/night for four nights. Gig em Aggies.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First time poster, long time reader. Wanted to take my wife somewhere special for a little getaway. Everyone's helpful and informative posts through Trip Advisor led me to the Sofitel in NYC. A superb hotel that I wouldn't hesitate to visit again. As soon as you walk through the doors, you are greeted with the aroma of fresh cut flowers. The staff is all smiles, willing to do whatever it takes to make sure you are comfortable. The location is perfect. Times Square, Central Park, shopping, and fine dining are all so close that a Taxi isn't even a consideration. The room (King Bed Suite) was spacious, comfortable, and well appointed. The bathroom was enormous. And the bed...Ahhh yes, the bed. Let's just say that the "Heavenly Beds" that Westin hotels brag about, pale in comparison to the beds here. I don't think I moved from the position I started in all night. The only thing that I was disappointed with was the view from our room. When you book a king bed suite, the description on the web site boasts a "Superb City View." Our view was far from superb on floor 5. The hotel did offer to inform us if anything came available, but we never received a call (not that we stayed in our room to wait for one). From other reviews that I've read, it sounds like the majority of the rooms have great views. Just make sure you emphasize that when you check in. I'll do that the next time I visit NYC, because I certainly plan on staying at the Sofitel again.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: aglazer
Reviews.Content: All I can do is say what everyone else has said on here. This is a beautiful hotel, in a great location, with a fantastic desk staff. It'll be my first choice of places to stay in NYC from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First time in New York City. Hotel is elegant, staff is very pleasant [New Yorkers seem to be rude else where we went], and the room was great! The room was beautiful, but it does seem smaller than normal hotel rooms. I did sign up for the privilege card. I got the late check out at 4pm without a problem with the card. I did not get chocolates like everyone else says, and I only recieved 1 complientary drink, and it was two of us in the room. No big deal. I was there for my birthday and I did mention it at check-in, along that I needed a high floor room. I was given a high floor room with a wonderful view of the Chrysler Building, but nothing else for the special occasion, no big deal, I ordered a bottle of wine from room service to celebrate and payed the hefty price. Overall it has been the best hotel I have stayed at and I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “A great experience!”
Reviews.Author: travelHI
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 8 nights at the end of July and early August. I based my decision to stay at this hotel by the reviews on this website. I was not disappointed. The staff, including the concierge, were professional, friendly, personable, and very helpful. I received a room upgrade (I was celebrating a marker birthday and this was acknowledged). Before I arrived, I talked with the hotel several times before booking to confirm details. I was pleasantly and efficiently serviced. I also called the concierge a few times asking for advice on what to see and for arranging theatre tickets. The service was personal and efficient. The rooms I had (I moved once from a lower level floor to a higher level floor) were large, clean, and nicely decorated. The marble bathroom, including the large acrylic shower stall, was modern and spacious. The make-up lights on the mirror were fantastic - the best I've ever experienced. The location was superb - just blocks to Times Square, the NY Public Library (try the free tour and use the wonderful reading rooms), Bryant Park (next to the library), the theatre district (what a joy to be able to walk to and from and not have to try and find an after-theatre cab), Central Park.... a great and safe location... By the way, I booked through expedia and got a great rate!

Reviews.Title: “Suite at Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: fly121
Reviews.Content: The suite we checked into had a balcony and looked out at GE Building and Rockefeller Center. Check and see if you can the Playbill rate. Regular rooms do seem a bit smaller but the suite is worth the price. You know you are in hotel that caters to the French. Excellent location if coming into Grand Central Station, you can walk to Times Square and Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best”
Reviews.Author: BroadwayMaven
Reviews.Content: First time stay at Sofitel. Our eight night stay more than met our expectations. Reviews on this site have cemented the superiority of the Sofitel and I am confirming the comments. From the moment you walk through the door until you leave the Sofitel is an oasis of calm and beauty. Our room was wonderfully appointed, and quiet. A/C works great and the beds are perfect for a great night's sleep. A wait of no longer than 5 seconds for an elevator (particularly important after many years at the Marriott Marquis whose nightmare elevators ended our stays there). The staff at Sofitel is helpful and tends to your every need. Concierge made several phone calls for us about restaurants in the Village and obtained hours of operation, location, etc. The privilege card is an added bonus and we each enjoyed a complimentary drink in the lovely Gaby lounge. Had lunch and dinner in Gaby restaurant, patio area is fabulous and you feel as if you are dining in a private garden. Service is impeccable at the Sofitel on all counts. The Sofitel is now our "Signature Hotel" for our trips to NYC. We have already booked two more stays this year. BTW, the Red Flame is definitely a must for a very good breakfast. Location of Sofitel is excellent, you can walk to all local sites and avoid the clamor of Times Square area. A truly joyful experience to stay of the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “tops in new york”
Reviews.Author: jandlo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights and absolutely loved this hotel. have been to nyc a few times before and stayed at other upscale properties. They don't compare to the Sofitel. Great rooms and amenities. Very peaceful, not the typical busy noisy tourist hotel. Great staff, formal but not too stuffy, very willing to please. Concierge was very helpful. I really loved the quiet elegance of this hotel after a long busy day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience, even with some glitches”
Reviews.Author: TakeATrip2Anywhere68
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from 4 nights at the Sofitel. We based our decision on the reviews from the TA website, and wanted to be close to Times Square. Our flight was delayed 2 hours, and because of Deltas "Frequent Snorer" program, sleep was not a possibility on our red-eye. We arrived at JFK at 6:30am, and by the time our cab made it through rush hour, we showed up at the front desk at about 8:00am. My wife (6 months pregnant) was spent. I asked if I could pay a day rate to check in early, and they said the hotel was full that evening. The manager overheard, took one look at my wife, and came over to assist. She found us a room, with a beautiful view of the Chrysler bldg, and offered it at no charge! +1 Sofitel! The room was fine. Very typical size, but very nicely appointed. +2 Sofitel! Delightful bed (we sleep on a tempur-pedic at home) +3, stunning bath room+4. The shower was so good we are now contacting the manf. of the showerhead to have one shipped and retrofitted to ours. +5!!! Location was amazing. So close to TS, but just as easy to the Today show, and then another block or two to 5th Ave shopping. +6 Staff was great from them moment we checked in. Very accomidating, and very personal. Always a smile to greet you even when you are walking by. +7. The lobby is stunning, and in general the decor was A++++, +8 Our flight was late afternoon, and a late checkout was no problem. +8.5 Sofitel !!!! Now the glitches... Yes, we got our bottled water about half the time, and if we were in our room during turndown time, the housekeeper never came back, the doorman was a tad preoccupied, and Gaby's was overpriced. Our stay included free breakfast and we only ate there 2 of our 4 days, even though it was free. The juice is $5/glass, and frankly, for $10, the Red Flame breakfast was better, in our opinion. And true, for some reason, the hallway to our room was toasty, yet our room could feel like the southpole if we had the thermostat set below 70. We kept it on automatic 72 and it was pleasant the whole trip. If you think the hallway is hot, try the ice room by the stairs.. wow! I got a kick out of the room service menu, mostly because a Red Bull is $18. I love NYC for stuff like that! All in all... with all the glitches... -1 Sofitel. No big deal! Everything that mattered was perfect. The things that we didn't expect made up for everything else. The hotel, staff and location are incredible, and when we return, we'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Karen055
Reviews.Content: My teenage son and I stayed at the Sofitel for 7 nights in July 2005. The day after having made and paid for my reservations, I was alarmed to read a couple of negative/so-so reviews of the Sofitel. I had chosen this hotel based on previous reviews, and then these appeared. I am delighted to report that our experience was nothing but positive. Our room was large (for New York), clean and comfortable. The beds and pillows were perfect, and the linens clean and fresh. I usually travel with my pillow because I have such difficulty sleeping with hotel pillows, but had forgotten it this time, so the pillow review is especially meaningful. As mentioned in many other reviews, the bathroom was wonderful. In fact, my son liked it so much I had to remind him at one point that we hadn't come to NY to spend a week in the bathroom taking showers. The service from staff was prompt and courteous. When I mentioned to a front desk clerk that my son had loved the chocolates (sign up for the Sofitel privilege card beforehand!) and was disappointed that they weren't going to be delivered nightly, he saw to it that more were sent up that night (at no charge). On our first night there I heard a high-pitched sound coming from the A/C vent, and knowing I wouldn't be able to sleep with that going, I called the front desk to complain. Within 5 minutes a custodian came to the room and quickly fixed it. So much for my hopes of being upgraded to a suite! We did not use the conceriege service, so I cannot comment on that, but whatever service we did need was provided with a smile. The location of the hotel is excellent for access to everything, either by walking, subway, bus, or taxi. For breakfast we liked the nearby Cafe Europa (5th Ave.) and Cafe Manhattan (W. 45th St.). Yes, the hallway outside the elevators on the floor (17th) was not air conditioned, but on the other hand, we never had to wait more than 30 seconds for an elevator. All in all, I think the hotel is a superior choice. It is a 4-star, so those expecting 5-star ameneties may be disappointed, but we definitely were not. And, by the way, I do not work for Sofitel and am in no way connected with the chain.

Reviews.Title: “Best Beds”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sofitel July 29-31 with my wife. The best beds we have ever slept in. Never woke up in the night and always slept right through to the wake up call. Hotel is very clean. Wonderful bathrooms where you can listen to the TV through bathroom speakers. Turndown service is nice...they leave you two complimentary Evian bottles each night. We had queen size bed and it was fine. Other couple we were with was upgraded for free to King Size bed and a bit bigger room. We would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay and must come back”
Reviews.Author: tnghi121
Reviews.Content: I. LOCATION: 1/2 block from 5th Ave, 2 1/2 blocks from Grand Central Station, 2 blocks from Broadway. Located in a much more quiet and less traffic street (W. 44th). This is more of a boutique hotel where you can find a quiet, cozy, warm lobby in contrast with the big American hotels. II. CLEANLINESS: Very clean. Nicely, tastefully and artistically decorated from the lobby to the rooms. They change your sheets and comforter so everything is fresh and clean. III. COMFORT: The bed is superb. Nice room size for a NewYork Hotel. The tub and bathroom are surprisingly large. Very impressive furnitures. The amenities in the room are outstanding: you can find q-tips, listerine mint, umbrella, robes, slipper, safety pin, needle and threads, magnified mirror, candles (where applicable)and a scale. My room even had some fresh orchid in a stainless steel vase. The only missing one is a Bible and NO CABLE TV. They even have internet access in the room for $9.99/day but why pay if you can use one of the 3 super fast computers in their business center that includes a printer? IV. SERVICE: This is the best part of the hotel. Customer service was outstanding from replying to your email to checking in/out. My room was upgraded to a suite (without any request) because they know that we were the for a very special occasion. They even delivered a bottle of champagne to our room within 30 minutes of checking in. Housekeeping service is excellent. All requests were handled in a timely and professional manner. I'm a clean freak, so I normally request disinfectant and clean the room, especially bathroom and commode whenever I check in to a hotel. After that, I normally put a "do not disturb" sign outside so no one would come in and "clean" the room again with the same "wiper" they have used in other rooms. I only call for extra towels and shampoo...if needed. This time wasn't an exception. The bad news is, SECURITY knocked on my door after coming back from a long and tired trip and loudly stated that:"it is the New York Policy that we have to check on you randomly, especially if you have the "do not disturb" sign out for too long. It is also hygiene that we are concerned of. We need to come in to clean your room unless you refuse the service. Do you refuse the service?" V. COST: Reasonably priced comparing to other 4 stars hotels VI. TIPS: 1. FOR THE FOOD: The food at the hotel is expensive but good. The pizza place across the street has great service and very good food (try the linguini with chopped clams in marinara sauce or white sauce for less than $9) The red flames cafe down the street toward 6th Ave doesn't have good service and the food quality is below average to me but at average price. My best choice for something fast, inexpensive, good and healthy is Cafe Europa (walk 1/2 block toward 5th Ave then make a right). Must make a reservation to Club 21 in the evening. Try the better Prefixe (choice of Apetizer, entre and desert) for $68 or spend a little more for the "Taster" which includes different wines and foods. Check out (---) for more. Must experience the Bateaux New York Cruise and dinner at night along Hudson River. Want something more romantic on this cruise? Upgrade the package to "Romance on the river" and you will be treated like a VIP, the lady will get 1/2 dozen of roses. For more, check (---) 2. FOR THE SHOWS: Don't need to spend big bucks on expedia or online to get "good seats". Most of these theaters give you extremely good view of the stage. In fact, I think you will get better view seating upstair. You can save 50% by standing in line at the ticket booths on Broadway (cash only). 3. FOR TRANSPORTATION: a. From and to airport to hotel: If you want to save money then subway is best. If you have at least 2 people in your party then go with the taxi and save you from traveling all over town in a super shuttle. It is only 8-10 dollars more if you have at least 2 people. b. Around town: Best to walk even if it is 15 blocks away. Too much to see and too many people walking, we walked 15 blocks before realizing it. From Sofitel to most destinations would cost you $5.50-12.00 for 2 (Taxi charge: $2.50 starting + 40 cents for each 1/5 mile + 40 cents for each stop that is longer than 2 minutes + $1 for extra person during a certain period of time. Going to Financial District or China Town, the least expensive way is subway ($2-4) 4. FOR THE SHOES: Bring your most comfortable walking shoes or slippers (best with open toes to prevent friction) and some bandages. You are guaranteed to have blisters even with the most comfortable shoes. 5. SOFITEL HOTEL CHOICE: Don't stay at Sofitel if you have kids who need more attraction and kid's amenites. This hotel is a perfect choice for adults and business travelers. OVERALL: A wonderful hotel. A must stay and must come back.

Reviews.Title: “Best on Street”
Reviews.Author: RJS&Gale
Reviews.Content: One block from Broadway on 44th street, next to Iroquois and Algonquin where we stayed on previous trips. Rooms are nicely decorated, good sized with a large bathroom, and generally lower prices than the others. Three couples traveled together and paid three different prices ($229, $259 and $279) for the same room. Great lobby to wait for that one couple who is always late. Staff nice and very helpful. If you get the lower price, it is a "best buy" for the area, but better rooms regardless.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: enn25
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Sofitel for our 10th anniversary and we were extremely satisfied with the hotel. After reading some of the not-so-hot recent reviews, we were worried. Not to worry...everything was perfect with Sofitel. Before we arrived, we asked for early check-in and a high-floor room. When we arrived at noon, a room on the 22nd floor was waiting for us. However, because there were no Executive King Suites at the time we booked directly with the hotel, we asked if they had any cancellations since our booking and if so, could we upgrade to one from our Premier Queen room. They found a King on the 20th floor that we had to wait for but we didn't mind since it would be free of charge. We later found out that they had moved us without a fuss, even though they had already set up champagne and chocolate-covered strawberries in the first room. The champagne was a nice touch from the hotel and the strawberries were sent from a friend. When we got into our room, we had a nice view to the side of the Chrysler Building and could see part of the top of the Empire State Builidng. The room was nicely decorated, not too modern and none of the furniture was shabby (as one past reviewer mentioned). The room was fairly big for a hotel room in a big city and the carpet looked and felt clean even walking on it barefooted. Strangely though, the room was not a suite even though the bed was a king bed. We had assumed that it would be a suite with it's own sitting room since a past reviewer had mentioned that the only way to get a king bed was to book a suite. I don't think that's the case now. The bed was absolutely comfortable!!! I like firm beds and my husband likes softer beds. For some reason, we BOTH had no problems sleeping in comfort on this bed. The spacious bathroom was extremely clean, with the marble floor so clean that I didn't feel like I had to lay down towels or use slippers while standing bare footed. There is a separate bathtub and a separate shower which is nice since you don't have to step over the side of a tub to get into the shower. The water pressure was adequate and the toiletries they had were nice enough. I would recommend you bring your own hair conditioner if you use it regularly to get out tangles. The hair conditioner they provided never did the trick. The lighting was great in the bathroom, especially with the lights surrounding the entire mirror...great for when you were putting on your make-up or shaving. Unlike a previous reviewer, our air conditioning for the room worked extremely well and was a blessing when we would come back after a day of sightseeing in the heat and humidity. Oddly though, we noticed that the hotel cools the lobby areas nicely but only cooled the hallway of our floor at a minimum. The lobby area was so nicely cooled that you could sit there for hours. Plus, Sofitel provides guests with access to three computers and a printer 24 hours a day in their lobby. This was wonderful for getting Broadway tickets at the last minute (sign up for free membership to Playbill and you'll get discounts or check Craigslist for last minute tickets) and for checking in and printing out your airline boarding pass the night before you depart. For the $289 a night we paid, we were extremely happy with Sofitel. We've stayed in much worse for the price. The hotel is in great shape and it truly is within walking distance to everything...2 blocks to Time Square and the theaters and 3 blocks the opposite direction to Grand Central Station where you can take the subway to all tourist areas. It's even easier to hail a cab from Sofitel than say if you stayed at a busier hotel in or closer to Time Square where you have to compete with others for a taxi at busy commute times. P.S. Try to get Broadway tickets to Spamalot...it was costly but SOOO worth it. Also, do NOT buy the "New York City Pass" which offers admission for several museums and attractions for one price for a set number of days. We barely recovered the money we spent for the passes because you just couldn't do too much with the lines and the crowds. The pass claims that you get to bypass the ticket lines at some of the attractions. True, you don't have to wait in the TICKET lines at some places but you will have to wait in the line for those people like you who purchased the pass. These lines were almost as long as the ticket lines! For example, we could have used the computer kiosks (no lines) for purchasing admission tickets at the Museum of Natural History but since it was covered in our pass, we waited in a long line. And at the Empire State Building, we had to wait in line with everyone who was buying tickets. If we didn't have the pass, we could have spent a little more money and purchased "Express" tickets that allowed you to bypass all the lines or move to the front of the lines (i.e., security check).

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DonnaMark
Reviews.Content: First time visitors to NYC for a romantic fling, my wife and I booked the Sofitel based on reviews from this site. Not disappointed at all. Great location in the center of everything, especially busy Times Square. But once inside the front door, quiet beauty surrounds you. All staff seemed friendly (but we had no issues or special requests). Room was smallish. Bathroom was best ever - esp. the shower and the surrounding marble. Red Flame, a few doors toward TS + the only real option for breakfast, was delicious, fast, and coffee cups constantly filled. Helpful to us could have been info re: best was to get Broadway tix, tours, recommended deli's, nearby sites (Bryant Park is a jewel and only two blocks away), etc. Would we stay at Sofitel again? Yes!

Reviews.Title: “Great, Service, Great Room, Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: Jugdish
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definetly worthy of the rave reviews. The location is fantastic, easy to get everywhere, but not in the middle of chaos. The rooms are nicely decorated, not gaudy and not overly modern. The bathroom is above what I expected with a separate marble shower and tub and a marble top sink. However, I will say this is what I expect in a hotel in this price range ($250+/night). Front desk was extremely accomodating in giving us a room with a view of the chrysler building when asked. Worth noting, however, is not all rooms are outfitted with feather beds and down comforters as noted in other reviews. All suites and King rooms have them, but only scattered queen rooms do. Our first room had a normal hotel polyester bed setup, not what I would expect for this price, so I called the front desk and they came and changed our linens, no questions asked. Overall a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel was a good choice !”
Reviews.Author: Finicky_one
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel for one night 7/16. I think we made the right choice.This is one of those places that will not wow you with any one thing but it's a very subtle, understated, sleek, classy non-toursity hotel. We had a Delux queen room. The room was very clean - loved the bathroom - all granite and shower is great. You can even listen to the tv while you are in the bathroom - they have speakers - nice touch. The bed was comfortable too. The staff is very polite and helpful. This was our first time at this hotel. We requested an early check-in and late check-out. When we got there at 12 noon, the room was ready but since we requested higher floor, we said we would wait. 2 pm check out was arranged - no questions asked. The concierge (both) were very helpful in recommending restaurants, making and even canceling the reservations. The location is very good - easy access to all the restaurants, shopping etc - walking distance - just take comfortable shoes - my girlfriend didnt and she had blisters on her feet. Good overall experience - decent value for money - we pd $259 for our room - not bad since its NYC theater district ! I guess I am rating it as 4 stars coz we were on the other side so we didn't have a view of the Chrysler building - GE bldg is not bad to look at but still, it ain't no Chrysler ! :) Jay H Richmond, VA

Reviews.Title: “Nice Bathrooms, Everything Else was Just Average”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in the middle of June for 2 nights. When we checked in the staff was very nice and reminded us to use the priviledge card because we definitley forgot. When we got to our room it was very impressive.........lacked a little character but it was very clean. The bed was sooooooo low and small I didn't notice this until I got up close. Be sure to put the extra lock on your door because house keeping just tried to walk in on us the first morning there (without knocking) she apologized and we said "no problem". The second day it happened twice (this time with just 1 knock!)......the apologies started getting old by then. We had priviledge card so check out was supposed to be at 4pm but someone from the front desk showed up at our door questioning us about it and when we told him we had the card he said that we were supposed to notify the front desk ( remind you the front desk reminded us to use our card and we DID). I explained to him that we showed our card at front desk and he said "okay"...........no apologies for the inconvenience. I would not stay here again. Sooooo not worth the $350.00 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: boo2ting
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel for two nights and experienced incredible service. Having booked a premier Queen room, we were upgraded to a deluxe King room. I had emailed ahead of time to let them know that it was a special occasion (husband's first art opening in NYC), and that we would be arriving at 8am on a redeye. In my email I asked to store our luggage upon arrival, and if possible (it was a longshot) to check in early. To our surprise, when we arrived at the hotel at 8am as planned, they had the upgraded room ready for us! And they didn't charge us for an extra night, as is usually the case when you check in that early. We took a nice luxurious nap in the extremely comfy King size bed before heading out into the city later that day. Our entire stay was wonderful, the food at Gaby's is very good (if pricey) and the location is right in the heart of Times Square. We have stayed at four-star hotels in NYC several times, and have never received such warm and generous service. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “lovely NYC stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Sofitel New York with my husband and 4 year old daughter in a suite and had a very enjoyable visit. The room had a seperate sitting room and tv's in both areas which could be closed off from one another. We had a king size bed which was very comfortable and the bathroom was marble with upscale tioletries, robes, candles and flowers. Our room also had a lovely view of the Chrysler Building which was quite beautiful at night. The location is central and easy walking distance to Times Square, Central Park, Grand Central Station etc.... even for our 4 year old daughter. The staff were especially polite and room service (at least for breakfast) was excellent with large portions. We registered for a Sofitel privelege card prior to our stay which offered perks such as late check-out and free drinks on arrival. We will definitely stay in this hotel again on our next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had read all the good reviews on this site which is why we booked the Sofitel - these people obviously did not stay in the same hotel as we did. Only consistency is that I noted that other people had talked about blocked toliets and airconditioning going out which both happened to us. The rooms were so very boring and our non-smoking room had old tobacco smells in it, all in all a very unimpressive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Their rating is suspect. Hotel Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: snowmassbadger
Reviews.Content: On June 6-7 the power and water went out for 24 hours they did nothing to help except give us one 11 oz. bottle of water. Since they were the only building effected they could have done something. All they did was what other reviews say they have done in the past. Say "we'll get back to you" and then never do it. I have a letter from Sofitel admitting to their problem so if it is proof that is needed I'll be glad to furnish it. I saw a June 7 th post saying all was great, what gives?

Reviews.Title: “acceptable but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in June 2005 and whilst the hotel was OK, I cannot work out why it is hyped up by so many people on this website. The rooms are a reasonable size with nice bathrooms. The staff are friendly, though the dinner recommendation from the concierge the first night was so poor I can only assume she was on commission. We had no major complaints and felt the hotel was quite adequate, but far from memorable and lacking in any character. We will not bother returning.

Reviews.Title: “Best I've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: RandywakemanIII
Reviews.Content: The Staff, the location, the rooms, the ambience and just the alround quality left me thinking that although this is a 4 star and I have stopped at a few 5's this tops the lot. I would recommend like others did on this site that you pay your money and get booked in, it'll make your New York trip even better. Grand Central is walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!!!! Will Return!”
Reviews.Author: enmsmommy
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews about the Sofitel we decided to stay there and I am glad we did. We stayed at the Sofitel the first week on June on the 25th floor. We originally were on the 14th floor but asked to get a higher floor and did! I stayed here with my husband, 3 year old son and baby daughter. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. 1. The location is great. Close to Times Square and you can walk to Central park in 20 minutes. 2. The rooms are great. They were roomy. We had four people in ours! The linens are nice and the robes and slippers add a nice touch. The bathroom is wonderful. I loved all the Roger & Gallet soaps and the orchid and candle was a nice touch. We had a wonderful view of the Crysler building. 3. The staff is wonderful. We were greated with smiles and courtesy. Everytime I saw a staff member, they were always smiling. They were very friendly and helpful. My son had an accident in the bathroom, he slipped in the shower and cut his head. They called an ambulance and made every effort to make sure that my son was okay. (He is fine) The manager and concierge bought him a little monkey. 4. Room Service was very good. We had breakfast. Yes it was pricey, but we enjoyed ourselves. 5. The hotel itself was very well kept. The lobby was quiet and the fixtures & furniture had a relaxing feel to them. Next time I am in New York I will be staying here. Look no further for a hotel in NYC. This is IT!

Reviews.Title: “Awsome”
Reviews.Author: tahitato
Reviews.Content: This is a truly awsome hotel, we satyed for 4 nights on the 12th floor. We did although get charged for items which we had not recived or used so be careful with the minibar. We also had to ask for more gowns and slippers as there was only one set for a two bed room. very clean and the turndown service with bottles of water is great. check for the folded toilet roll too it always briongs a chuckle. English beware this is a french hotel and although new york is american there is a language thing which can sometimes get frustrating. espically when tryinmg to book broadway shows. There is also a good diner down 44th called the red flame best place for breakfasts. A great hotel with good views in a great location to 5th avenue and time square. highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and lovely European style hotel”
Reviews.Author: wise2374
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just celebrated our fifth wedding anniversary at the Sofitel. Unlike a previous reviewer, we did receive acknowledgement and some special treatment, with an upgrade to a suite on a high floor. We were staying on a Saturday night, however, and it's likely there was plenty of availability. The hotel has elegant and sleek public spaces, with a very nice lobby and front desk area. It certainly has a European/French feel to it, with French TV channels and everything written in both English and French. Our suite was well-apportioned, with terrific fixtures, including an incredibly cozy and handsome bed, and gorgeous bathroom and shower area. Otherwise, I'd call the rest of the room understatedly elegant and modern, with handsome fixtures all around. I like the location in that it isn't in the heart of Times Square, but was an easy walk to it, and is also convenient to the Theater District. Because the hotel is further east of both of those areas, it's got a touch less hustle and bustle, and just feels like a less touristed area. Don't get me wrong - it's still midtown New York City, but being a few blocks east of those other areas make it a more relaxed setting. Plus, catching a taxi down Fifth is an easy shot to Greenwich Village which, given the NYC traffic patterns, is nice. Because I live in NYC, I don't stay in New York hotels much, it's hard to compare the Sofitel to the nicer hotels here. But relative to the upscale business hotels I normally stay in in other cities, this is really a lovely hotel, and I do recommend it. You just can't go wrong with a place this nice.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: fotocoquine
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just celebrated our 20th anniversary at the Sofitel. The rooms were immaculate and comfortable with an elegant bathroom stocked with great products. Towels were changed twice daily. The room was quiet from street noise and we did not hear noise from neighboring rooms, but we were awakened by loud people in the hallway at 2am. Though not the hotel's fault, consideration would have been nice. I asked if there were any rooms with views, but we were given a room on the 21st floor overlooking 44st Street (no real view). I don't know if they had control over that, but I didn't feel that they put in any special effort, given the fact that we told them months in advance when we reserved that it was an anniversary. Maybe it is too large a hotel for that kind of attention to detail, as I've seen in smaller hotels. The concierge was very helpful, as was the doorman who hailed a cab for us in the rain. After our dinner, we walked back to the hotel from the Village, which was fun. Sunday morning, the Puerto Rican parade originated in front of the hotel. It was interesting to see the floats up close, and we didn't have trouble leaving the city that afternoon (as I expected when I saw the crowds!) The Red Flame diner was a quick and inexpensive breakfast. We had an easy walk up to MoMA. We signed up for the privilege card and took advantage of the late check out which was very convenient. That alone makes it worthwhile. No one mentioned a free drink at the bar, so we didn't take advantage of that. I had obtained a good rate through a Playbill offer, but when I went to check out, I was charged the wrong rate. After some time they corrected it, but did not apologize. I would stay here again, because it was very convenient and well-maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We chose our hotel in N.Y. according to the reviews at Tripadvisor,and we weren't disappointed. The hotel couldn't be in a better location,and the staff couldn't be nicer. The room was lovely and I would highly recommend it to anyone. I plan to return in October. Thankyou to all those who take the time to post a review and make the chore of chosing a hotel a little easier!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kanu
Reviews.Content: Just returned from five nights in the Sofitel. Our suite was excellent, everything in a room you could wish for. The staff were very helpful and courtious, very professional. The hotel bar was very stylish and quiet, only disappointment was, that the toilets were on the ground floor. The bar men were very helpful and informative. We did have room service, and I have to say the food and service was fantastic. We did try the Red Flame Diner on our first morning, it was ok, I preferred the choice at the Europa Cafe for breakfast, which was on 5th Ave to your right. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mattt9999
Reviews.Content: From the moment we got to the Hotel til we left we loved this Hotel! This was a surprise trip for my wife to celebrate our 4th wedding anniversary and our first visit to the USA so I wanted it to be good. We arrived early but reception was very helpful sent us to the bar for drinks and 2 glasses of champagne arrived quickly (worth getting the card for this). The room we had on the 17th floor was very nice and big and we had a great view of the ESB from it. The room was very quiet and had we think the best bed we have slept in.The bathroom was great plenty of room with a nice big shower and bath. The location for was excellent just a few minutes walk to Broadway and Times square. Nice little place for breakfast just a few doors down called the red Flame. When we booked in we requested a late check out which as with everything was not a problem. Overall we would recommend this hotel and can not wait to get back.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 3 nights after a 5 night stay in las vegas. I would have to say that this hotel was excellent. The service for me couldnt be faulted the doorman, concierage, reception staff and bar staff were all friendly and very helpful. the red flame diner is great for breakfast and there is also a good french restaurant further down the street for a late dinner (recommended by doorman). I thought the hotel bar was also great from my perspective, its a very art deco, relaxing bar with great cocktails, its not a party bar but for me and my wife it was perfect for quiet conversations at the start or end of an evening. Definately a hotel i would go back to

Reviews.Title: “Overated but you get a good nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the end of April in this hotel. The hotel is situated in a good location, especially for Broadway and Times Square. The hotel has an impressive exterior and a beautiful eleganty designed entrance hall. The reception staff were very helpful and courteous during our stay. Our room was fairly high up with an unpleasant view of an avenue, but in New York you're only in your room to sleep and we got our best sleep ever staying here. The room was on the small side for New York but the bed was one of the best we have tried , and we have tried alot of beds! The bathroom was lovely and the shower was great for shower voyeurs. It was sort of fixed to the end of the bath, so that if you had a bath you could watch your partner shower. Those that have been will know what I mean. Hotel facilities are what you would expect for a New York Hotel of this standard but the toiletries were nothing special. We went to the Red Diner next door and found it filled a hole, however we found nicer places than this for our Breakfast. New York is excellent and we will definitely go again. We highly recommend the Comedy Cellar for a great night out, Central Park - the squirrels are so tame, Brooklyn Bridge and Brooklyn for the sunset view of Manhatten. We enjoyed our stay at the Sofitel and anyone who stays there will have a pleasant time, but we find it hard to believe that it is No 1 in New York.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: PEDIATRIX
Reviews.Content: my wife and I just stayed here onw week ago and we had a suite which was beautiful and very quiet.we will certainly return. I felt the staff was great as was the food both in the room and in the restaurant. also we had fun in the bar. it would appear that it is a great choice for the value

Reviews.Title: “Warning”
Reviews.Author: ckerr
Reviews.Content: This is a warning to travellers like me who have read the effusive reviews of SofitelNYC on Tripadvisor.com, this hotel is nothing special and there many other hotels in this city that offer better value, like W Tuscany who have similar rates. The service is undeniably friendly yet barely competent, the property is reasonalby well maintained though lacks any flair. In short staying at Sofitel has not been a disater but has no wow factor

Reviews.Title: “Excellent...”
Reviews.Author: Carriuni
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel for 4 nights, and were very impressed by all aspects of this hotel. We were given a decent sized room with a seperate shower and bath and a full view of the Chrysler building whilst still paying a reasonable rate. The location was ideal for sightseeing and the staff were very friendly - breakfast, although more pricey than other places, was incredible! I recommend the pancakes with chocolate sauce - if you can face it that early (my boyfriend couldn't!!) One thing to note is that this is a business hotel, and whilst there are tourists, and ordinary folk milling around, you will see predominately suits. Not a problem for us, as they certainly weren't snooty, but just a point!! x

Reviews.Title: “clean, nice, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Never2Full4Dessert
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose Sofitel for a weekend getaway, based on reviews from this site. We were not disappointed. Rooms are very clean and comfortable. We used to live in NYC so we weren't looking for a lobby "scene" or a big fancy hotel, nor did we take advantage of the concierge. However, we did want something upscale, comfortable, clean and convenient. Sofitel was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for only one night, but it was excellent. The hotel room is quite big and the bathroom great: a great separate shower cabin and bathtub. The bed is soft and luscious, the only downside being that it is also somewhat springy - i.e., if you move a lot during your sleep, your bedpartner will bounce along with you. Location is great, walking distance from Grand Central station, right between 6th and 5th on W 44th st. Helpful and courteous staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: WI-Couple
Reviews.Content: Just got back yesterday from a stay at the Sofitel. It's in a great location, about 2-3 blocks off Times Square. It was my first time in NYC so I wanted to be close to a recognizable place. The staff was very welcoming. We showed up at 9am and they already had our room ready, also helped us find our way to the subway and called a cab when we needed it. Fresh flower bud in our bathroom and towels delivered twice daily with nightly turndown. View could have been a bit better but I had asked for a regular room, the higher priced probably have better views. Only thing missing was a pool, but this is primarily a business hotel so not altogether surprising. All in all just a great hotel, nothing exemplary happened, but sometimes it's having exactly what you expect that's most comforting. I was also attending a seminar for work and found that most people had stayed elsewhere, with less luck than myself. We also stayed one night at the Skyline before coming here, which I'll review shortly.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel visit met expectations”
Reviews.Author: efmCalgary_Alberta
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked Sofitel through Expedia and enjoyed our 3-d stay. Impeccably clean, deco-type rooms with nice illumination around the bathroom mirror, and a great shaviing mirror. The size was certainly adequate for a hotel room in NYC (we have stayed in rooms at other hotels that more approximated closets). Having booked through Expedia, we were not eligible for the continental breakfast , and, warned ahead of time, we avoided the restaurant, which was pricey, and made good use of the Red Lion Cafe mid-way down the street. The small knob on the bathroom door fell off but was replaced. We stored a small container of milk in the Frigo-Bar (as they are called in Gemany), and just displacing an item caused it to be billed; on complaint, the charge was removed and a refrigerator was then brought in for our needs during the stay. This was all gratis, as were the little slippers supplied. The only thing we missed was a Bible in the room, which, we were told by a clerk at check-out, is offensive to some people (of course its absence could equally be offensive), but we were assured that they were available for anyone requesting them. A small complaint is that I could succeed, even with help from the hotel operator, in placing a local call (no problem for long distance!). The hotel, is, as far as we could see, in almost every way, first class. The wonderfully quiet room, convenient location, and excellent service make it well-worth its cost.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepy but Happy at Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel for four nights in early March while doing the NYC "tourist" thing. The location is great - within walking distance of lots of the museums and attractions. We walked everywhere. The exterior of the hotel isn't too impressive, but the lobby and check in area are polished and chic. Marble floors, plush chairs, fireplaces... you get the picture. The staff was polite, friendly and professional. We had a very early flight into NYC and the front desk allowed us to check in early, making two tired travellers very happy. Our room was clean, clean, clean, which I loved. It did smell a little detergent-y when we arrived. It got better with time - or maybe I got used to the sanitized scent. The beds are not big (queen-size), but the bathroom was amazing - all marble, great lighting (I swear, I've never looked that good!), a big glass shower and a nice-sized bathtub. Our room was a bit small yet comfortable. The decor was subdued - very modern and sleek. The only item I missed was a plush comforter. The bed had only a thick bedspread that was a little too unwieldy for sleeping. We stayed on the 27th floor and I would suggest requesting a higher floor. There was very little street noise and the walls were thick enough we never once heard our neighbors. All in all, we liked the Sofitel - a lot. We'd happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Rated highly for a reason”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Based on other reviews on the TripAdvisor site, I booked a stay at the NYC Sofitel for March 2005. Just 3 blocks from Times Square and the heart of the Theatre District, the hotel is in a wonderful location. Also on the block are the Red Flame Diner, a quintessential New York diner with comfort food at good prices, and the Times Deli, a great stop for a take-back-to-the-room sandwich or a muffin for breakfast. (The lemon cake is superb!) But I digress - back to the hotel. The room was a bit larger than most NYC hotels that I have stayed at, and was clean and nicely appointed. The bathroom was enormous, with a wonderful walk-in shower and separate tub. Very nice. The hotel seemed quiet, with no room-to-room noise. I also appreciated the ice machine on every floor. The staff was attentive but unobtrusive, and I would stay here again with pleasure, if I could again find a rate more reasonable than the "rack rate" quoted on their website.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alvarki
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in April 2005. It was very nice and comfortable. In the past I have stayed at the Waldorf, the Plaza and the NY Palace. I did not care for the decor (or how OLD everything was) at the Waldof or the Plaza and I would say this is very comparable to the NY Palace - which I love. It is not the same high standard of quality and elegance as the Four Seasons or the Peninsula - but then again - the price isn't as high either! It is a very nice hotel - at an average NY price. As in previous posts - I enjoyed the little things (candle, real flowers in the room, complimentary Evian, turn-down service, slippers, and the quality bath products) and the room size was average.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: daphnescombine63
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from an excellent trip to New York, where on the recommendation of other trip-advisor travellers, I chose a suite at the Sofitel. I was not disappointed by the 28th floor views of both the Empire State and Chrysler Buildings, nor in the room which was big enough for the two of us (I took a friend for his first trip to New York). The only slight disappointment was that the rooms were a little too typical; I had expected a little more individualism, but that said, they were very comfortable and immaculately presented. The bathroom was great with a large shower cubicle and seperate bath. The bed was huge and very comfortable indeed. The staff were polite and very helpful - the concierge in particular could always sort things out as needed, be it reservations or advice. The location is great too and it's very easy to get around the city from here on foot, subway or taxi. I highly recommend the hotel and suggest you search for deals through this site as I got a great price that way.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Goagirl
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a three night stay at this hotel with my husband and we loved it. The hotel is in a great location within a couple of minutes walking distance from 5th Ave and Times Square although on a quiet street. We arrived early at midday and were given a room straight away. It didn't have a view, but we didn't mind as it was so quiet. At night, the heavy curtains cut out the light and there was no street noise whatoever. It was a large room with quality furnishings and linens, and the bathroom was a delight with lots of marble and top quality toiletries which were replenished daily.The turn-down sevice was treat, and towels were changed twice daily. We had signed up for the Sofitel priviledge card before we left and so we were given a complimentray glass of champagne in the hotel bar and had a late check out of 4pm. The staff went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. I would definitley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - Average Beds”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel is a wonderful place to stay unless a really comfortable bed is important to you. Their beds are just average, their pillows below average. The sheets are 100% cotton, but the blankets are velux (yuk) and the duvet is polyester. PLUSES: -Wonderful location - close to Fifth Avenue and the Theatre District. -Fantastic bathroom, marble, glass, soaking tub, separate shower, large luxurious towels and robes. Bath products are Roger & Gallet, slippers are provided. -Service is fast, very friendly and gracious. We were shown three different suites until we found the one we liked. -Tall windows that open at the bottom. Great views available on the higher floors. MINUSES: -Beds are not that comfortable. Too bad because everything else at the hotel is very high quality. -In order to get a king bed you have to get a suite. -No drawers for clothing. You have to use shelves and a very small closet. One tip - go to the Sofitel website and get a free Accor Privilege Card. This entitles you to a free drink per person, chocolate, Evian and 4:00 pm checkout.

Reviews.Title: “superb sofitel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here over Easter weekend.I booked it having read the great reviews and the fact that it was trip advisors No.1. Everything was excellent- Staff,bedrooms,quality of linens,little extras and particularly the view of the Empire State Building from our room on the 21st floor.! We did not eat there (felt $25 for breakfast was not worth it),and the recommended Red Flame Diner along the street was excellent,even if the plastic red chairs initially put me off. The position of the hotel for sight seeing could not be beaten. We would recommend it whole heartedly and would definatley stay again in future.

Reviews.Title: “Highway robbery”
Reviews.Author: avrooster
Reviews.Content: I chose the Sofitel for my recent stay in New York, based on its Trip Advisor popularity. The hotel is new and the accomodations are pretty good. The staff was always pleasant, but not THAT efficient. But several things were not as good as I would have expected. Even though the bathroom was beautiful, the sink was cracked and THE SHOWER DID NOT DRAIN PROPERLY. Their TV e-mail was slow and not user-friendly. But the really unforgivable part was their phone system. They charged me $15,46 for a one minute call to Argentina (probably several hundred times their cost) and they also tried to charge me for several calls that had not been completed. To make things worse, their phone system is set up so that I was unable to use a toll-free phone card I had. I got a busy signal every time I tried and wasted a lot of time trying. I stepped outside to a pay phone and got through immediately. That is why my review is titled "Highway robbery". If I go to New York again, I will try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Every bit as good as we were led to believe!”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Pie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for four nights and it was excellent in every way. Our bedroom was lovely, the bathroom perfect and everywhere spotless. The staff were also extremely attentive and nothing was too much trouble. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel for a trip to New York. The location is great and perfect for shops and sights yet it is situated on a quiet street. I booked this hotel because of recommendations on this site and it has not let me down!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Could not fault the hotel at all. Perfect position, two blocks or so from Time Square, lovely rooms. Had a blocked loo on the first day and it was sorted straight away. Staff all really friendly and helpful. Had a meal in the Restaurant one night and although expensive it was of a very high standard. Definately worth applying for the Sofitel card on their website as it gives you 4pm check out on your last day. Would not hesitate to stay again when next in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Another perfect stay at the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: MorganB
Reviews.Content: We just completed another stay at the Sofitel. We moved from there to the Millenium Hilton because i had some HHonors points to use. Despite the Millenium Hilton being a nice hotel the Sofitel excels in many ways. As we are staying back to back in the two I thought I would offer a comparison. Bathrooms are much better at the Sofitel. They are truly beatiful, with a seperate glassed in shower, marble floors and granite counter tops. Hiltons bath is very average with a shower curtain over the tub (ick!). Hiltons shower control had 2 inch in red and blue that say HOT COLD. Its very tacky/ institutional. Towels in the Sofitel are thick and absorbant. You can also lounge around in the provided robe and slippers. Towels are nice at the hiton but not as thick, no robe, no slippers. Bath Products in the Sofitel are Roger et Gallet. I love them and stock up on them at every stay. I also find the sewing kit handy. Hilton offers Neutrogena which is okay but I am not compelled to keep them, no sewing kit in sight. AC unit in the sofitel well conceled in the ceiling and cools the rooms swiftly. The Hilton has a large metal unit under the window. The AC happens to be out in the entire hotel today. Despite the two hotels being about the same price I find the Sofitel much more luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “great stay at the sofitel”
Reviews.Author: ltj-1964
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed at the hotel for three nights between 31st march and 3rd april.i had booked this hotel way back in october 2004.i also had a sofitel privilege card which was free and well worth having.you get complimentary free drinks and late check out which we used.my wife was forty whilst we were at the hotel and i had emailed the hotel in advance to tell them and ask for an upgrade.the upgrade was not available but they left a bottle of champagne in our room in a bucket of ice.the room was lovely with a great bathroom.the queen deluxe was a lovely room and more than adequate.very polite and professional staff.the only thing that lets this hotel down is the entrance which is dull and lacking in colour.that was my only gripe.drinks were reasonably priced in the bar as well.excellent hotel and i would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, as expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 nights at the Soffitel seeing all the positive reviews. And we were not disappointed!!! We arrived at 11am in the morning hoping to be able to put our bags with the Concierge. Instead they offered us a room!!! That was very nice considering that the check-in time is at 3pm. We really appreciated this. (We did have the Soffitel Privilege Card) Everything in the room was very well organized. The room was very clean and had all the amenities. The only thing we could have used was a coffee maker. But not critical at all. We were also given 2 free drinks and chocolates the first night. The bathroom was big, spacious and had all the little knick-knacks one needs. Cosmetics were all french, a bonus for those who prefer french toiletries. The service at every level was impeccable and helped to make the stay very very pleasureable. Although room service was expensive, there were a number of very good restaurants within walking distance to the hotel. As a tourist, the subway was very close, shopping at 5th avenue was 2 mins away, and the museums were either within walking distance or a short subway ride away. The location was excellent. And yes, I would recommend this hotel to all my friends. And we would stay there agian when we went to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel an easy sell !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an excellent break at the Sofitel New York, my husband and I booked a suite which was on the 26th floor directly with the Hotel. We stayed from Friday 1 April to Monday 4 April 2005. We also completed the privilege card which allowed for a late check out (4pm) & complimentary drinks. The service was fast and friendly from beginning to end, and the hotel well located for shops, museums etc. The decor was great as was the view! The suite was a good size,equipped with iron and board ! Breakfast in the Gaby Restaurant was also good, but there are sooo many places to eat that you cant go wrong! If you are going before June 2005, spend an evening at the Belesco Theatre, 3 minute walk, where Julius Caesar is running, starring Denzel Washington and British Actor Eamon Walker. The whole cast was excellent! Shopping in New York is good, we walked everywhere and did not feel intimidated in any way. I will be returning later this year and the Sofitel will be my first choice , thank you to previous write ups for assisting us in making such a good choice which is why I am doing one in return !

Reviews.Title: “What else can I say????”
Reviews.Author: RON1970
Reviews.Content: EXCELLENT! MARVELLOUS!! Very clean, excellent staff, high quality room...... I could go on but I guess you get it! WAY better than The Time hotel we had the misfortune to book into last Easter!!! Got that one?....... The Time, 49th Ave :o(

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel - Pricey but extremely comfortable and well-located”
Reviews.Author: travelproPasadena_CA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel on the basis of TripAdvisor recommendations. I want to add my recommendation - it was outstanding. Very pricey, even with substantial internet savings. Our room didn't have a view, but the bed and bathroom were as luxurious as described elsewhere and unbelievably quiet. Very relaxing after a day of walking. Location was fabulous - easy and safe walk from Broadway late at night and just steps away from 5th Avenue. Red Flame cafe was great for breakfast and nearly next door. Concierge and bellman very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Yet another top marks”
Reviews.Author: Fife_traveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned after 5 nights in New Yawk(sic). Again, like so many, we went on the advice of Tripadvisor users and can only say it was fantastic. A truly fantastic experience, lots of friendly, knowledgable staff with good restaurant advice; spotless room - yes, we liked the turn down service too! Location is spot on - we are keen walkers and we could head uptown or down towards Battery Park from here, and there was so much nearby as well. We are already planning our next visit and will be absolutely gutted if we can't return to this hotel... A special mention should also go to the Red Flame diner in West 44th St. - we used this every day for breakfast - great value and a true American style diner - loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend (4/1/05) at the Sofitel which we chose because of TripAdvisor, and like every other review we were not disappointed. The hotel was beautiful and the staff was friendly. Our room was very nice, clean, comfortable bed, not too small, nice view, clean bathroom with marble vanity. The location of the hotel was excellent. Parking across the street was $ 28.00 - we saw the Producer's which was on the same street so we just walked there and to Carmine's for dinner. Breakfast a few doors down at the Red Flame like the reviews recommended. We signed up for the Sofitel Priileged Guest Card and got 4:00 pm checkout which was helpful. It was a great weekend thanks to Tripadvisor!

Reviews.Title: “Truly Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: PeterK939
Reviews.Content: I booked the Sofitel based (after exhaustive research) on the reviews here, and it really does deserve the reputation it's earned here. This review applies to a suite - I splashed out this one time as it was a special occasion. Good accomodation is something I place great importance on - it's great to just crash out sometimes and watch a movie for a few hours - the Sofitel surpassed this expectation in every measurable sense. Rooms are absolutely luxurious - they look identical to the pictures on their site (something that's very rare these days). Attention to detail is extraordinary; mini Hi-fi, CD clock radio, travel adapter in room, bathrobes, slippers, candle in bathroom (along a little box with a nail file, shower cap and some mints), separate shower, silk coat hangers; there was even an umbrella provided in the closet. Location is perfect - 5th Ave (including Met Life building) on one side; Times Square is a few blocks away on the other, but it's still in a very quiet spot. The room was totally soundproof; I never heard any street noise, and couldn't even tell if there was anyone in the room next to me - it's the first hotel I've stayed in for a long time where I've had a proper nights sleep. Staff go out of their way to help their guests - nothing is too much trouble. Just to give an idea of the high quality service - on the first night, there was some ambient noise from the air conditioning in the room. When I asked to change rooms the following morning, the receptionist brought to a suite that had an even better view of the Empire State building. When transferring the bags to the new room, he not only insisted on carrying both (heavy) bags, but would not accept a tip for the trouble - that truly is first class service. The only problem after that was that I didn't want to leave the room ! All in all, fabulous; if like myself, good accomodation is of great importance, don't hesitate to book the Sofitel - I know I won't next time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect-believe the hype”
Reviews.Author: deedle
Reviews.Content: Cannot stress enough how great this hotel is. We only booked it due to the reviews on this website and all the good stuff is true. Great location (it was our first time in NYC and we found all the sites really easy) Staff very efficient. Definately sign up for their privelidge card. The 4pm check out is a godsend if you have a night flight. Nice to have a separate shower cubicle too. Great little touches like fresh flowers and candle in bathroom. Like loads of others have said before me - stay here- you wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: “The most perfect hotel in NYC - location,charm,amenities”
Reviews.Author: Dave0365
