Reviews.Content: I can simply say that anytime we return to NYC, this is where we will stay. I cannot imagine a better hotel for: location (peacefully quiet and only a 2 block walk down 44th and you are in Times Sq), ammenities (imagine a large king bedroom with perfect A/C, a good sized bathroom with seperate bath and shower and great toiletries and this in NYC?), staff (always friendly and polite with a ready smile), facilities (4 elevators and our maximum wait was about 15 seconds!!!, quiet bar/lounge, plenty of quality umbrellas for use). We arrived on the red-eye from San Francisco at 6:00 am on Sunday morning and were at the hotel by 7:00 am. Although room checkin is usually 3:00 pm and the hotel was FULL the previous night, they were able to get us a room by midday. I recommend breakfast each day 3 doors down at The Red Flame diner - cheap but nice and not rushed. We didn't use the hotel restaurant for eating, though we had a couple of night cap cocktails that were nice and not overly expensive (I do recommend the 8th floor lounge at the Marriott on Times Sq for cocktails and Tapas). Cabs are convenient because they are EVERYWHERE however a cheaper alternative is the subway. The nearest subway entry is 42nd and 5th - 3 streets down - a great/safe way to explore the city for $7 a day jumping on and off as often as you like. Greyline bus tours is located on 46th and 8th - again a short walk. I could go on and on about the benefits of this hotel, but that would only duplicate other reviews. Go on, just do it!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It's our 2nd time in this hotel. We stayed here April of last year and was surprised that one of their staff member still recognized us and greeted us by our last name. His name is Edward. He's the same bellman who helped us with our luggages before. What a professional and knowledgable person he is. He made us so feel welcome. Excellent service he gave us.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Excellent Midtown Location, French Themed”
Reviews.Author: Sparkly*Euro*Peep
Reviews.Content: Exellent hotel - perfect location, excellent luxurious large rooms with lurvely duvets, huge marble bathrooms, lovely brasserie downstairs, courteuos staff. Stayed here for a month in August 2003 when it first opened - what a wonderful experience. Times square and Lexington are just a stonesthrow away.

Reviews.Title: “C'est tres tres bon!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: myrtlemee
Reviews.Content: we stayed for five nights in early March 2005 and absolutely loved the hotel. It is just in such a fantastic position, the view from our 23rd floor window was the Empire State Building straight ahead and the Chrysler Building to the left. Such a lovely bed and bathroom with all those gorgeous little touches making it special. Great toiletries,robes,flowers,ironing board,powerful hairdryer etc,etc. The bar prices were the same as everywhere else...EXPENSIVE. so worth stopping there for the one for the road!!!!! We didn't eat in the Gaby but it looked inviting.Breakfast in 'red' diner few doors down on the right was fine. New York is exciting,interesting and exhausting and it was always a pleasure to retreat to the Sofitel. Thanks trip advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Best by far!!!”
Reviews.Author: silverstar007
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I got engaged in New York last September and stayed at a different hotel over in Murray Hill which was great if a little old. However, we were coming back to the city (to buy wedding rings this time!) and we wanted to stay somewhere different, so I checked out the Sofitel, was very impressed with the reviews on this site and booked it. We stayed there from 5-8th March and it was simply the best hotel that either myself or my fiance had ever stayed in (and we've stayed in A LOT of hotels!). There is no way that this is a 4 star hotel - its 5 star all the way, from the impressive lobby, to the courteous staff, to the fantastic bedrooms. I was totally thrilled from the minute we walked in, we requested a room with a view and were given a room on 21st floor - no problem, the bathroom was absolutely fabulous, the room spacious and spotless. We even had the maid come in again at night to turn down our bed, and leave a bottle of mineral water with the weather forecast for the next day! I can't rate this hotel enough, its in a great location between 5th and 6th Avenues, 2 blocks from Times Square and close to many great attractions and stores. Definitely sign up for the Sofitel Privelege card, worth it for the late check out alone. Also the restaurant in the hotel (Gaby's) is top class and well worth a visit. We would not stay anyway else in New York now!

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous, Marvellous, Marvellous !!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from March 7th '05 to March 11th and like a lot of other reviewers I decided on the Sofitel based on reviews left by others on sites like Tripadvisor and based on the detail available on the hotels website. I really can only support what other have said .. the hotel is in an excellent location, the 25th floor suite was in perfect condition and the staff were extremely helpful. This was my first trip to New York and as I planned to pop a certain question to my girlfiend, everything needed to be perfect. As requested, the roses, rose petals, champagne and gooey chocolate dessert arranged via the Concierge were setup perfectly. The blanket of snow outside and the twinkling city lights (not in the hotels control I know) made the night a very, very special one. This really is a first class hotel and we will definately book future New York trips with the Sofitel. In fact we'll check if there's a Sofitel hotel in other locations for all of our future trips in Europe, the U.S. and beyond. Oh, she said 'Yes' by the way. Hooray !!

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Hotel”
Reviews.Author: S.Marissa
Reviews.Content: During my first visit to New York (Feb. 2005), I had the pleasure of staying at the Sofitel Hotel and I loved it. The staff were very friendly and knowledgeable. The hotel is located on 44th between 5th and 6th (2 blocks from Time Square and 3 blocks from Grand Central Station); therefore, it was very easy to maneuver around the area by walking and subway (which I loved). My only disappointment was the hotel's restaurant, Gaby's, the creme brulee was served cold. I am accustomed to having hot creme brulee. Other than the creme brulee, I was well pleased with the hotel and am planning to bring my husband there on his first visit to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Fab!! Fab!! Fab!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel on Sunday 6th March for one night as a treat to end our stay in New York. I had only heard about it through Tripadvisor and gave the hotel reservations team a call to check availability and rates - the lady I spoke to (I think her name was Wanda) was really friendly and professional and swung my decision to stay there. On arrival at the hotel we were greeted bya genuinely pleasant porter and reception staff and were advised that even though we were a couple of hours early our room was ready for us. Oh my God and what a room it was - we had booked an Executive King Suite and upon entering was really impressed with the luxurious standards. However, our biggest suprise was yet to come as when we drew back the curtains to check out our view not only did we have magnificent views of BOTH the Crysler Building and the Empire State Building but had the biggest balcony/terrace to admire them from!! It truly was a fabulous place to watch the city lights turn on at dusk and a breathtaking place to eat breakfast in the morning - we really felt like movie stars!! Everything about the Sofitel is wonderful I really can't recommend it enough - thank you for making a trip to my most favourite city a really special one!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed and up-market hotel”
Reviews.Author: sc_UK
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a couple of nights in the Sofitel, New York. I'd done my research when looking around for a hotel and the good reviews on Tripadvisor and the reasonable price were the deciding factors in booking a room here. I should explain that I'm the type of traveller who is rarely happy with the first (or sometimes second) room allocated by the check in staff: I'm a bit picky. From the moment we stepped into the lobby at the Sofitel I could tell that this place was going to be nice. The porters delivered our bags to the room almost immediately: tipping them wasn't the usual embarrassing experience those of us from the UK have to endure in US hotels. Reception staff were very pleasant - a welcome and unusual attribute in this city. Check-in took seconds. The bedroom was on the 23rd floor. It was impeccably clean and a reasonable size, with a great heating / airconditioning system and a very quiet location. The room smelt clean as soon as we opened the door (unlike the room we stayed at a week earlier in the New York Hilton which smelt musty and smoky). The bathroom was spacious and well laid out (separate shower and bath), with nice touches like a freshly cut flower and a candle (with a handy pack of matches too). Although two of us were in the room, the hotel only provided one bath robe and one bottle of water - although they had both of our names and gave us two keys. The bed was a bit on the small side, and I suspect that they assumed only one person was staying in the room. The overall feeling and ambience in this hotel is relaxed and friendly, but professional and up-market, and I would not have any hesitation in recommending it. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay at the Sofitel, booked on advice of Trip Advisor reviews, we were not disappointed. Found all staff to be very friendly and helpful. Rooms were lovely- only complaint would be no tea and coffee maker in room. Thanks to a previous Trip Advisor for the advice on the Sofitel Privilege card, we were able to keep our room until four pm on the day we left at no extra charge. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - a bit pricey!”
Reviews.Author: leannemc
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the lobby, but found reception hard to find as it was tucked away past the lobby and around the corner. The staff were pleasant. As my husband and I arrived separately, he had arranged for an upgrade to a suite which he was told would be an extra $100. Upon check out they informed us this was 'per night' which was not clear at the time. They agreed to meet us half way in the end. The suite was lovely and a good size for New York standards. Cable tv and all the usual amenities. Really nice big bath room with candles and toiletries. Sound system throughout all rooms with telephone in the bathroom. Nice comfy bed. Location was great - we walked everywhere, Times Square, 42nd street, Grand Central Station, Central Park (bit of a hike) and Soho by taxi. Overall a nice place and I would go back and stay again. Concierge provided big umberellas and were very helpful. Arranged for a private car to the airport as well.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel-Thumbs Up”
Reviews.Author: lemondrop
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a w/e in May 2004. Booked thru Priceline so had no idea what we were in for. Friendly service checking in; room was small, but clean and bathroom for excellent. Loved the long shelf above the sink for all our toiletries. Hotel was very quiet. Great location for walking to places of interest. Reasonable breakfast a few doors down at Red Flame. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: RhosdduRed
Reviews.Content: We just spent 5 nights at the Sofitel and were very happy with what we found. Unfortunately, our request for a high room via the web agent didn't get to the hotel and we ended up with a room on the 11th floor which didn't offer the best view in the world. However, this wasn't the hotel's fault. The hotel has 29 floors so there may have been other rooms which afforded a better view. The room was very well equipped and modern with plenty of room. It was also immaculately clean which is always a bonus. The tv offered direct internet access, cd request facility as well as the usual pay per view for all the latest movies. The bathroom had a bath as well as a separate shower and was quite spacious. No coffee making available though. We never used the turn-down service although it was available. All staff were very helpful especially the front of house staff. When our shuttle transfer to the airport was late, the concierge was ready to spring into action to get us a taxi but thankfully, the shuttle eventually turned up. The location was just right with Times Square, the Empire State Building and the Grand Central Station all within a 10 min walk. Times Sq was very busy especially on the Friday and Saturday and the hotel was a quiet retreat away from the crowds. The hotel bar was one of the nicest we have been in although it was slightly more expensive than the numerous bars and restaurants which were nearly. We are visiting NY again in November and will definitely be staying at the Sofitel again.

Reviews.Title: “Almost lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: Steve6696
Reviews.Content: On arrival, I asked for an upgrade as it was my wifes 40th birthday. He asked his boss who said that would be no problem, then gave us the keys to the smallest room on a low floor. Small room, no view, and a bathrobe that had seen better days. I asked what the room had been upgraded from and was told their was nothing better available. ie It wasnt really an upgrade at all. Next day i got a much more accomodating member of staff who immediately gave me a choice of 2 large rooms on high floors with king size beds. We took one, and from that point on the hotel was great! Had a peek in a suite (room number 2922) which was lovely with great views of Chrysler building etc. Maybe next year....

Reviews.Title: “Soiftel - C'est Bon!”
Reviews.Author: TMM
Reviews.Content: We loved our room at the Sofitel. We had an Executive suite on the 25th floor and our room faced the GE building - A really nice view at night. There was plenty of space for our 22 month old to run around. What surprised me was how quiet it was. The bathrooms are gorgeous and the staff was very helpful, but not in your face. Twice we had a problem with the toilet, but each time we reported the problem it was addressed quickly. There are lots of nice amenities such as the robe, slippers and even a lint brush which was handy as I forgot mine. The location is fantastic and we walked to most places of interest. We also received complimentary drinks of our choice at the bar and late check-out as we signed up for the Sofitel Privilege card. We never dined in-house, but we loved the Red Flame diner a few doors away. It was one of the few places that had high chairs and a good food selection for our son. The breakfast was delicious and the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: HelenUnitedKingdom
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay at the Sofitel, NYC and was very impressed. Check-in staff were lovely, rooms spacious and the most comfortable beds ever. Fabulous big bathrooms with a great separate shower. The room was immaculate every day and the turn-down service superb. The weather forecast and bottles of evian very nice touches. Check-out was quick and efficient and the doorman kindy arranged a fabulous car to the airport for us. Can't imagine staying anywhere else if returning to New York - if you have a stay at the Sofitel booked be very excited and if not, do not be afraid to book this exellently located hotel. It was certainly worth every penny we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Tripadvisor saves the day again!”
Reviews.Author: Eric001
Reviews.Content: We had just 2 days and 1 night in NYC so wanted to stay somewhere special that wouldn't bankrupt us. Used Tripadvisor last year for accom in Key West and found a great place. Used them again this time for NYC - checked for the No.1 rated hotel in NYC. Sofitel it was. We arrived by taxi and our suitcases were taken by doorman who gave us tags which we handed to reception when we checked in. I asked for an upgrade and we were upgraded from queen to king room. 2 mins after getting into room our cases arrived. The porter showed us all the features of the room and asked if there was anything we needed. The room, and bathroom, were spotless and well equipped. Most comfortable hotel bed ever! All contact with hotel staff (room service, reception, wake-up call etc) was friendly and efficient and they always used our name. Check out was just as smooth and efficient as the other aspects. We are normally wary of the big hotel chains (we wouldn't have thought of staying here without Tripadvisor reviews) but Sofitel 'broke the mould'. The whole stay was very pleasurable and effortless. It is the first time I have ever wished I was staying longer at a hotel. If you're thinking of staying here - GO FOR IT!

Reviews.Title: “tres tres magnifique !!.”
Reviews.Author: donshe62
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for six nights last week of january into February.From the word go I knew I had made the right hotel choice.The absolutely beautiful foyer and desk area were a welcome sight after a long haul flight.The receptionist was a delight,she greeted and made us feel like we were the only guests staying here.I had asked for a twin room on a high floor via e-mail prior to arriving and was assured this was no problem at all.The room allocated was on the 23rd floor right in a very quiet corner,and it was beautiful.Much bigger than in the photos the site prints.Two double beds with luxurious bedding.Floor to ceiling mirrors,lots of closet space.and what felt like brand new carpets.The bathroom was very large and very modern.A huge walk-in shower and lovely fluffy towels and lots of French toiletries.The towels were changed twice a day and flowers and scented candled are positioned there also.Turn down service also great.with complimentary evian water every night. The gym is small but has all up to date excersise machines.The bar looked lovely too,although we did not eat or drink there.There is a restaraunt just a few doors down called the red flame which is perfect for breakfast etc...and very cheap!. All in all I was delighted with this hotel.After a day of exploring and sight seeing I could think of no better place to rest my weary head. If you are going to new york don't stay anywhere else.Pay a little extra and stay at the 'Sofitel'. You will not be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Sara Jo and Rosy say ...Magnifique!!”
Reviews.Author: OLOL
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week. Didnt want to leave..Bathroom fantastic Room great loved the view. We felt so New York!! Location just perfect.. Only one small criticism was that the room service coffee was too strong..and yes we are coffee drinkers!! All in all you just couldnt fault the Sofitel and we have tried loads of hotels.. The gaby restaurant was very good the bar has atmosphere.. A must (except we dont want everyone to go there in case we cant get in next time we book!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Five-star quality at three-star prices”
Reviews.Author: dougie-w
Reviews.Content: We were drawn to the Sofitel because of its top ranking here at TripAdvisor, then the low rate we found at Hotels ($161/night) clinched it. And we were not disappointed. The room wasn't large, but it did seem luxurious, with lots of nice extras: bathrobe, slippers, CD player, large framed photographs from New York and Paris on the wall. The bathroom was exceptional with its marble sink, glass shower plus separate bathtub. The TV speaker in the bathroom was a little odd, but what the heck. Bed wasn't the most comfortable, but there were plenty of pillows. As others have mentioned, we did receive a tiny complimentary bottle of Evian water each night with the bed turn-down service, but not the fresh bud that I had read about in a previous posting. Location was great, just a couple of blocks from Times Square. Check-in was very quick, friendly and easy. We will definitely be returning to the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: being close to 5th Avenue, Times Square and walking dsiatnce from Central Park, this hotel is well located to enjoy midtown and the locality. Service was consistently excellent, even before arrival - the concierge arranged for a limo to meet and collect us from JFK and delivery us in comfort to the lobby (a real plus after the transatlantic haul from London). we had a 5-day weekend away from the kids and indulged in the generous breakfast-in-bed menu on at least three occasions. what can we say that hasnt been said across so many positive reviews *smile* we'll be back !

Reviews.Title: “Well done Tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the sofitel from the 21st to the 26th January. On the advice of tripadvisor we booked a standard room with a hotel search engine - much cheaper than rates offered direct by sofitel.com. The hotel is very nicely situated between 5th and 6th avenues and 2 blocks from Times sq. The empire state is an easy walk and central park is 15 / 20 mins walk away. The hotel is very pleasant, clean and friendly. The rooms are of good size and very comfrotable, the bathrooms are marble and large. We didnt try the resataurant / bar as it seemed dark and uninviting with loads of staff ready to pounce. On a very minor negative point, all extras in the hotel are quite expensive - minibar, telephones, room service etc - but all these are optional. We will not stay anywhere else in New York again. We would recommend Del Friscos restaurant for beautiful steaks etc (49th and 6th) and for fantastic family meals of really stupid USA quantities try Carmines (44th and 7th). Also when you go up the empire state, do the skyride and sit up at the front.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sofitel hotel”
Reviews.Author: DrExplorer
Reviews.Content: I chose the Sofitel from Tripadvisors recommendations and was not disappointed. Fabulous location, lovely 5 star bathroom nice room

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: dangell
Reviews.Content: I travelled to New York for the second Christmas in a row and stayed here again! I was a bit concerned that it would live up to my memory of last year as this time I'd brought my mum and sister. I had no need to worry as they both loved it. Again we found it well worth the cost. I would highly recommend you stay here. The food, service and rooms are all excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry, another brilliant review!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Felt I had to post a review after my stay at this hotel as I enjoyed it so much. (Jan 14-18 2005) As it states in all the other reviews, the staff are brilliant. From the point of arriving to leaving they went the extra mile and were always helpfull, especially the concierge who booked us tables for dinner and advised us on almost everything about New York. The room was very nice and was cleaned twice a day, which meant if you had an afternoon nap, the bed was remade when you got back at night! As promised there were bottles of water and flowers beside the bed each night. It may not sound like much, but it stops you breaking into the min-bar to have a drink, and saves you a few bucks! The bathroom was very large with a bath and very big shower. There were speakers in the bathoom, behind the mirror, so you could listen to the music/tv that was on, and a fluffy dressing gown to name but a few niceties... Our room was on the 19th floor, and the view was of W44th street. Not a great view, however I was realistic to expect that when you stay in the city you may see buildings out of your window. They were not however slap bang outside, and therefore allowed normal light etc into the room. It was no different to staying at many of the hotels I have stayed in in London, Paris etc (I stayed at the Millenium broadway last year, which is the hotel down the road, and although the view was of broadway and was much nicer, the room and staff do not compare.) We ordered room service on two nights, and both times the food was of a high quality and delivered quickly. The person taking the order was also very helpful and friendly, (As opposed to Millenium Broadway, where I felt I was taking a liberty ordering room service!) I can't stress enough how much the staff made the stay a pleasure, combined with the excellent facilities and decor of the hotel. I read a few of the reviews on this site, where people scored it lower as it is not as good as a 5 star hotel. Well all I would say is that this is the best 4 star hotel I have ever stayed in. Its a general rule that you get what you pay for, so if you pay more, then a 5 star will give you more. However I can't think of what else they could do, expept move the building onto broadway. This hotel is exceptional value for money, and we will be staying there again. (P.S. Red flame diner is the most friendliest and best in the locality. We strayed to another because the queue was so big one morning. Big mistake. The menu was a 1/4 of the choice, we waited ages to be served and it was over double the price.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: freqtraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 night over the January 14th weekend. Fast checkin. Was slated for a queen bed on the 9th floor. I asked for a higher floor. This was my 3rd trip to NYC and from experience the higher the better to get away from the road noise. The checking agent offered to see if she could get me a king bed while she was at it. I ended up with a king bed on the 18th floor. The room is pretty much how it is pictured on Expedia, bed, two chairs and desk. The bathroom was realy nice, it had a walk in shower and a seperate bath tub. The turn down service is neat if your into that kinda thing. The turn down service came at about 5:30 - 6PM my first night. I was in the room and turned her down. I was offerred a small bottle of Evian thought. Second night I was out of the room and they left the bottle of Evian. I valued the water more than them fussing around the room. Overall, it's a great hotel, friendly staff, clean rooms. I would stay here on my next trip, however, given the hotels popularity on this board it may get pretty worn out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights at the start of January 2005 and had been swayed to book this hotel based on the excellent reviews on this website, which proved to be extremely accurate. The hotel is well decorated and we found the reception staff very efficient and co-operative. On arrival we were allocated a room on the 12th floor but made enquiries as to whether we could be moved to a room with a better view. We were offered a room on the 23rd floor and it had a view of the Empire State and Chrysler Buildings for no extra cost, so it's definitely worth asking! We also took up the offer on the hotel's website of ordering a Sofitel Privilege Card prior to travel and made use of the 4pm checkout time - also at no extra cost. Our room was clean and spacious and had a lovely bathroom with a separate large walk-in shower. The nightly turndown service includedh a small bottle of water and a weather forecast for the following day, which were nice touches. Due to the excellent location of the hotel, we found we were able to walk to most of the attractions in midtown Manhattan - only 10 mins from Times Square and 15-20 mins from the Empire State Building. Central Park was about 30-40 mins walk away. Although very pleased with the hotel itself, there were a couple of things that let us down personally. The first was some information requested from our concierge. We had asked him to confirm our return flight details on the day of departure and were wrongly advised as to which terminal we needed to get to and the second was that despite informing reception at check-in that we wished to make use of the 4pm check-out, we received 2 visits from staff while we were packing asking us when we were due to leave the room as they had no record of our request. Also, one word of advice on taxis - there is currently a flat-rate fee of $45 + toll ($4) and tip from JFK to midtown Mahattan but this does not apply to the return trip! Our return taxi fare cost $60, exclusive of toll and tip so make sure you have some extra dollars if you're down to your last few!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the sofitel in June 2004 for 9 nights. It was fantastic in everyway. The location was brilliant, the room was luxurious and large, and the staff were very helpful. I would recommed anyone going to NY to stay at this gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Outstanding Reservation System”
Reviews.Author: larover
Reviews.Content: I went to book a room at this hotel because of all the great reviews. Their web site showed no Executive Suites available although Expedia did. So I called them and they said they were not sure why their web site was not showing available Executive Suites. They would however match Expedia's rate which just about every hotel will. However they would not guarantee me a high floor. They said I could call the day of to see if I got a high floor but since they gave me the cheap Expedia rate they would not guarantee me a high floor unless they had a room on a high floor the day I was to check in. Yes they gave me the Expedia rate but they didn't have to give Expedia a cut since I was booking through Sofitel and not Expedia and they didn't even show anything available on their site. In any event they were pleasant just seemed unorganized, not helpful and did not behave like an outstanding hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked the Sofitel on the recommendation of all the people who had added reviews on Trip Advisor and were not disappointed. The hotel was in the middle of everything and we walked almost everywhere! All the staff were friendly and more than helpful, all of the tips and advice they gave us was spot on and we would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone. We will defiantly be staying there when we return on future trips to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sofitel for one night during the Christmas season and chose it mainly because we got a good rate through the internet. The hotel was in a perfect location for us - in between the theatre district and Madison Ave shopping. The staff was friendly and helpful, rooms nice, bathrooms even nicer. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: Shaun_Curnow_2004
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended the Sofitel and I was not disappointed. A lovely establishment with excellent staff. I signed up for the Sofitel loyalty card before going and this entitled us to extended use of the room as well as complimentary drink (this may be given without the card but what the heck). The bar is great, art deco and again friendly staff. We arrived late at night but the short walk to Times Square quickly invigorated us. As for New York, WOW! We decided to focus on sight seeing as opposed to shopping. After all there are shops in the UK but not the same sights. I used Tel Aviv Cabs to and from the airport. Reliable and reasonably priced. Finally, my thanks to all that helped me when researching, NY WHiz et al, and asking dumb questions like "would I need a taxi from the Sofitel to Belasco Theatre?".

Reviews.Title: “Nice to be back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hadn’t been to New York for about 10 years so being nervous about returning to the city after all that time, I decided to stick with a chain I knew, have stayed at the chain in Cannes France on many occasions, which is very impressive. Forgotten how expensive hotels in NYC could be, 479 without tax for a queen room. On arrival very impressed, Large lobby, plenty of places to sit & unwind but was disappointed with the first room given, no 316. Air conditioning was outside window so couldn’t sleep & I just didn’t feel that the room was worth the money. Asked to be moved, no problem, upgraded to a king bed, I think but more on that later, & the room was simply in a different class. Beautiful bed and bathroom. No view was an initial disappointment but after along day it was nice to be able to shut the world out as the room was just so quite it was difficult to remember you were in NYC. I would have given the hotel 3 stars for the original room at the rate paid, a beautiful hotel lobby cannot compensate for an average room causing lack of sleep but after the upgrade I think 5 stars is appropriate. Overall very clean, hotel about 4 years old, excellent location & would highly recommended. Emailed them 2x about the type of room given in anticipation for a future stay but after 2 weeks still no response.

Reviews.Title: “A Paradise Compared to Other New York Hotels”
Reviews.Author: AnywhereUSA310
Reviews.Content: After two horrible nights at the Algonquin, I got smart and moved down the street to the Sofitel. For exactly $10 more a night than I was paying at the Algonquin, I got a room that was four times the size of my dingy miserable room at the Algonquin. At the Algonquin, I looked out at a airshaft. At the Sofitel, I was on the 24th floor, with a nice view of the skyline. At the Algonquin, there was a miniscule bathroom with a combination tub, shower. At the Sofitel, I had a huge, beautiful bathroom with separate shower and tub, lots of counter space, nice French toiletries and a makeup mirror. At the Alongquin, there were two tiny elevators that you had to wait forever for. At the Sofitel, there were four huge elevators that came immediately. The Sofitel room was nicely layed out, with two chairs to sit in by the window, a nice desk to work at and ample closet space. Someone else at this site complained about the turndown service. I thought it was great. I didn't even know they had turndown service (they certainly didn't at the Alongquin) and I left clothes strewn on my bed - when I came back at night, the clothes were all neatly folded, my bed turned down, the curtains closed, a bottle of Evian on the nightstand, together with the next day's weather forecast. Lovely! The staff also couldn't have been nicer or more helpful, with no attitude (unlike at some of the more trendy hotels in NYC). Perhaps the thing I liked the best at the Sofitel was that it was dead quiet. I heard no street noise whatsoever, nor any noise from any of the other rooms. I also loved the fact that the curtains completely blocked out the light at night (at the Algonquin, they had these strange blinds that did not completely darken the room). Someone else on this site complained that at the Sofitel your morning wake-up call is not from a live person (it's just a ring on the phone). As for me, I don't care about chatting with a live operator for my morning wake-up call - what I value is quiet and a spacious, attractively furnished room and I got that at the Sofitel for a very reasonable price. I'll be back. P.S. My only quibble with the Sofitel was the bar (I didn't try the restaurant). For a French hotel, they didn't have a very good selection of French wines by the glass and the white wine was served over-chilled. But those are really very minor quibbles - there are a million other places to go for a drink in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Quietly elegant!”
Reviews.Author: LMS39
Reviews.Content: I brought my mother-in-law to NYC for the first time on Columbus Day and wanted our room to be perfect. We were not disappointed with the Sofitel. Although the city was exceptionally crowded and noisey due to the holiday parades, we found luxurious tranquility from the moment we entered the front door. Every staff person we encountered was friendly, helpful and respectful. They performed their duties impecably without being obtrusive or pushy. The room was very clean with single beds more like doubles. The bedding was immaculate with the look and feel of being brand new. The bathroom was gorgeous with a shower stall the size of many NY bathrooms. The fresh orchid and candle in the bathroom and the thick terry cloth robes and slippers were the extra little touches that made us feel as if we were staying at a European Spa. If you are looking for hi-tech flash and urban splash, the Sofitel is not for you, but if you can appreciate understated elegance and Old World sensibilities, you will not be disappointed with the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “What you expect from a top hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrpapa93
Reviews.Content: After spending a few nights at the Hudson Hotel, the Sofitel was a godsend! Simple, clean, elegant and large rooms. The service was good from the front desk, the concierge and the doormen. The next time I am in New York the Sofitel will be getting my business.

Reviews.Title: “"Bonjour" does not make a luxury experience!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ownershiprep
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in November and was quite frankly very disappointed with it. The hotel would rank at the level of any other typical chain hotel and definitely not a luxury hotel as it relates to services, although the design is acceptable and not outstanding. I had a need to print a document and neither the concierge nor the front desk could help me. They kept passing me to one another and finally upon my persistance they sent me to their so called business center in the corner of the lobby to print my document on my own and without any assistance. Turn down service was nothing but to flip my bedspread over on a bed that was used by me during the day to lie on and had been terrbly wrinkled. No ice, no replacement of the used towels, nothing special at all and the wake up call was done with a machine instead of a human being. No doorman or bellman ever greeted or opened the doors when coming to or leaving the hotel. The icing on the cake was when I called to inquire about my trimmer that I possitively left in the bathroom, a machine took a message and after four days someone called and left a message that they did not have it. No offer of apology or replacement whatsoever. For $280 a night, I expect much better services than was given in this hotel. I would rather have had a first class service commitment from a hotel than a "bonjour" machine wake up call!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sofitel NY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved the Sofitel NY! We just got back from a 4 day trip to NYC and loved it. Christmas time is the best time to experience NYC. Everyone was very nice and the city looked even more beautiful with x-mas lights. We were a bit scared booking online and paying over $1100.00 for the rooms but we couldn't have been more satisfied! As soon as we walked into the marbled floor lobby I knew we had made the right choice. The staff was very friendly and with the loyalty card, sign up online at the sofitel website for free, we received a welcome cocktail. Our room was on the 27th floor with a spectacular view, like requested. The room was sooo clean and the bathrooms were wonderful. We each got a bathrobe and slippers and every night our bed was turned down and we were left one bottle of water, chocolates, flowers, and the next day's weather forecast. The location made the hotel even better. We were walking distance from everything like Times Square, 5th Ave., Park Ave., and the Today show. If it is your first time in NYC I suggest you stay at Sofitel and take the Sightseeing Tour, they are wonderful and very informative. The best restaurant would be Del Frisco, pricey but great!

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights during the week of Thanksgiving at the Sofitel. I booked the room based on location, and Trip Advisor reviews. We spent $299/night, and had a room on the 23rd floor. Our first impression was not favorable...there were no bellman at the entrance, and we lugged our bags to check-in. The room was standard...the carpeting was absolutely filthy. We would of asked to move, if we weren't so tired, and had already been informed at check-in that no upgrades were available. We were left 1 bottle of water nightly, with a sprig of orchids in the bathroom...not my idea of luxury. Most guests were European. The concierge was helpful in getting us a driver to the airport. We also ate breakfast at the Red Flame Diner several days, which was convienent and cheap. The best attribute is location. This hotel certainly does not rate close to the Ritz as trip advisor reviews suggest.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Travelbugtoo
Reviews.Content: Our booking was messed up (NOT the fault of the hotel!)and we had to go to the Novitel for two nights until it was sorted out. We were upgraded to a suite on our return to the sofitel, which was fantastic, for the next five nights !!!!! Our friends were in a normal room and it was not nearly as good as ours! The staff were great without being intrusive. The bar is wonderful and it is definitely worth aquiring a Sofitel Privilege card!

Reviews.Title: “Flawless”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I got a great rate ($189/night) via Playbill and impeccable, hassle-free service. This is a great location with very quiet rooms, perfect for seeing Broadway shows and Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: LLRS1
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at the Sofitel. I have stayed at many NYC hotels, and I think that this is my favorite overall. I have stayed in rooms that cost twice as much that were not as beautiful, clean, and quiet as this one. Our twin room was fairly large and very clean. The bathroom was beautiful, well laid-out, and spotless. I was surprised at how quiet the hotel was. We slept very well and did not hear a sound all night long - not from other guest rooms nor from the street. I will definitely try to stay here on my next visit to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value but not cheap”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The French staff must have been in good form as we had fine service, including the front desk and bar. While checking in, our room was switched as I remembered to confirm our request for a quiet, non-smoking room (the original choice had been near the elevator). I took a bath in candlelight (nice touch) and found both the bathroom and bedroom clean & comfortable. Light turns on when you open the closet, nicely arranged, with lots of thought in design and extras. Only wish the room had a coffee machine. We go to NYC fairly often and this was our first stay here; normally we splurge once a year on a W hotel. Beds at W are better, but otherwise Sofitel may have the edge. Not as trendy.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge couldn't be more helpful”
Reviews.Author: LPW
Reviews.Content: The concierges Vladimir and Rene were very helpful: Vlad confirmed our helicopter trip, Rene chose and booked us a table at the Gotham Bar & Grill. Hotel is very smart and excellent location between 5th and 6th on 44th St. Twin deluxe room on 21st floor with view of the GE building - though Travelocity website had said there were views of Chrysler/Empire. Top tip: Go to the Sofitel website and order a privilege card (which is free): This will enable you to check out as late as 4pm (usually 12 noon) and a welcome cocktail from the Gaby bar - these would have been $11 each so well worth filling out your details online! Only criticism was the car that the porter organised for the trip back to JFK - when the driver received a more 'lucrative' phonecall/booking, we were passed over to a yellow cab driver who only received $40 of the $55 we had given the first driver to give to the taximan. Seems there are some thieves wherever you go. On the whole, I would recommend this hotel for its location, big rooms, lovely bathroom and the concierge service.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the basis of the reviews I read on Trip Advsier, and was not disappointed. I took my Mum to NY for 4 days, and wanted to make it special - and it was. Good value for its great location... we walked everywhere. And the conceirge was lovely - v helpful. I would return without hesitation. I went in August 2004 but forgot to put this review up at the time - sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for $299”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good location. Close to everything yet still has quiet atmosphere. You must be willing to tolorate the French, staff and guests alike. Famously indifferent and cold. One of the best bathrooms I've ever see. Very Clean. Did have to switch rooms upon arrival as our first room had a broken bed and stains all over the carpet. The quickly responded and we were satisfied. The bed is of Holiday Inn quality, nothing more. The Concierge was not staffed with dedicated personal and hardly usefull or inviting. I rate this "Above Average" only because we paid $299. per night. Other rates in the 400+ range would bring this down to an "Average Hotel."

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel is Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I got a last minute deal on this hotel and didn't know what to expect. I was completing thrilled, however. The room was luxurious and extremely comfortable. Everything was clean and well-maintained. Service was fantastic. And talk about a great location. Just blocks from Grand Central, Times Square--I felt like I was right in the middle of everything. I will definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 5 nights at the Sofitel and had booked based entirely on the positive reviews from Tripadvisor. Weren't disappointed at all - spacious room, courteous staff, decent sized bathroom with separate shower, central location. The only minor drawbacks were a couple of slightly worrying stains on the carpet & curtains (axe murderer as previous guest ?), a highly complicated TV (we gave up!) and the fact that they the bellboys "lost" our stored luggage on the last day and took a hell of long time to find it ! These were only minor things and certainly woudn't stop me from staying there again or recommending it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in the Sofitel in May 04. Booked a suite, got the best deal from their website. Staff, room and view were excellent. I simply can't complain and would certainly choose the Sofitel again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrriffic!!!”
Reviews.Author: mrbear
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at many New York hotels over the past 25 years, I expected the Sofitel to be the same old, same old. What a surprise. Not only is it in a terrific location, but is truly a terrific value. The staff is exceptionally professional and service-oriented, from those at Reception to those who did a splendid job on the room. Nice touches...turned down bed, small box of chocolates to the French shampoo in the bathroom. The room was comfortable and quiet. Highly recommended...one of the best hotel experiences I have had in my favourite city.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice....wouldn't give me a bandaid when I cut myself on door.”
Reviews.Author: Kennio
Reviews.Content: Nice friendly staff. I did catch my finger in the door and cut it pretty badly and the front desk would not give me a band-aid which was not cool at all. For the most part it was great location and nice and clean. The concierge asked me what I was doing that evening and then gave me two $100 tickets to a show. So taking the good with the bad....I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel for 7 nights from 2 October 2004. The moment we walked into the hotel I knew I had made the right choice. I had based my decision solely on the reviews here on Trip Advisor. All the staff were very polite & helpful. There were plenty of staff at reception so you never had to wait more than a few seconds to be attended to. The standard double room was very spacious, with an attractive bathroom that comprised bath & separate shower cubicle. We asked the concierge to recommend a fairly relaxed, reasonably priced Italian restaurant in the area and the one she recommended, the Resette, was perfect. Being a business hotel the breakfast can be a bit pricey but the Red Flame Diner, about 5 doors down from the hotel, is a traditional American diner that provides a fantastic breakfast for great value. The queues tell all but don't be put off - the queue moves fast. The location of the hotel is also ideal. 15 minutes leisurely walk to the Empire State Building in one direction & less than 10 minutes walk to Times Square in another direction. The hotel is located right between 5th & 6th Avenues so you really are right in the centre of Manhattan but it's on a relatively quiet street. We saw a Broadway show one night & returned to the hotel on foot at 1am. The walk back to the hotel took approx 10 mins via main streets and is well lit. We felt perfectly safe. We definitely want to return to New York & we would definitely return to the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!!!”
Reviews.Author: pinsey
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel. The most unique and eclectic hotel i've ever stayed in. I am usually a priceline shopper - not sold on a particular hotel, but this is the exception. It is worth seeking out this hotel and staying there. $200.00 mid week rate on their web site.

Reviews.Title: “First rate”
Reviews.Author: canuck50
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 nights at the Sofitel. After hours of dizzying research on line, settled on this hotel...not sorry. For a one-nighter we might have gone for something less, but we were so happy to have this pleasant retreat to return to after a day of sightseeing. The bed was wonderful, bath was spotless, maid service was attentive (towels changed 2xday)....all in all a first rate experience in our opinion. Location served us well....prices are what prices are in NYC...after a while you just go with it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in mid-August. Excellent hotel, super clean, quiet, nice views, and great air conditioning on hot August days. Really, not a single complaint. For those going online, free WIFI in lobby (which is a great spot for a small business meeting) or $9.95 per day high-speed Internet access in room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: familytraveller083
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel from 23-28th August. We got married in the Empire State Building during our stay so it was important to us that the hotel was just what we wanted and after a lot of research (and going on previous reviews here) we picked the Sofitel and it was the perfect choice. We had an Executive King Suite with a great view including the Chrysler building. It was very roomy (lounge/bedroom/hall/dressing area etc), was spotlessly clean and totally soundproofed - we didn't hear a thing from either inside or outside the hotel the whole time we were in the room! The bathroom was gorgeous and throughout the suite and in all the public rooms the decor is lovely - modern but not too modern and it all looks brand new. The bed was very comfortable and the room so calming - a great place to relax and chill out after a day in the city. The location is very central & every member of staff we came accross was polite and friendly. On one occasion we couldn't lock our door and it was put right the instant we reported it - I've never had such quick service! When we left to get married we intended to take a cab and the doorman (William I think) instead of calling a cab summoned us a merecdes seemingly out of nowhere. The hotel also put champagne and chocolates in our room with a note of congratulations. Others in our party stayed at a variety of 4&5* hotels in the city while we were there and we all agreed that the Sofitel was the best. I am fussy about hotels but honestly can't think of any negative points about our stay here. We will definately be returning to New York - its an amazing city - and without any doubt will be staying at the Sofitel on our future trips. Apart from the hotel the Red Flame diner is a great breakfast experience (is a few doors down from the hotel), the Algonquin (next door) perfect for romantic cocktails and the River Cafe under the Brooklyn Bridge is awesome in every way and a 'must-do' for any special occassions!

Reviews.Title: “All is well at the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Everything was outstanding during our stay on Labor Day weekend. Having the opportunity to return the next weekend for a business meeting at the Waldorf and compare the two, the Sofitel blew it away. It is all about the little things, and they understand that here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: summerbeachmom
Reviews.Content: I am very picky about hotels, and was very satisfied with my stay here. I selected this hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, and was not disappointed. The room was VERY clean, the bathroom was great, and the hotel was in a great location. The price was very reasonable too. I would definitely stay here again for future trips to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended but not bad!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sofitel New York at the end of August for 4 nights. After the searches among the other hotels according to the reviews and the photos of the hotels we decided to choose this one. The hotel was not very quality as we thought, the front desk staff was rude, they do not know smiling. Room was very small, the decoration was ok. Amenities are ok also not a big deal. The location was very good for us very close to Times Square and Broadway. You should not expect any view, we were on 23rd floor and after we requested a room with view and we changed our room for this reason, I do not call it as view, it was just another building instead of a wall. But the thing that I cannot forget is the bed was the most comfortable one that I have ever slept, it was incredible. Overall the hotel does not reflect Sofitel quality and service as known.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Choice”
Reviews.Author: Joncro
Reviews.Content: First rate hotel. It's not as impressive as the best in NYC but for the money it deserves an excellent rating. Super clean, modern but not too modern, rooms a bit snug, excellent service, unbeatable location just west of 5th Ave on 44th St. We've always stayed at the NY Palace but would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Wonderful Wonderful!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I spent 5 nights in August at the Sofitel New York. It was our 1st trip to NYC and I can’t imagine it being any better at any other hotel. We hope to return next year and I will stay at the Sofitel New York again. I can’t say enough about the staff, the location and the city. I want to go back ASAP.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel, NYC over Labor Day weekend and it was very nice, great staff, and quiet. We were given a 23rd-floor room with a sweet view of the GE building. The hotel was very quiet with new furnishings and decor. Had breakfast at the Red Flame down the street 2 mornings and at Fitzpatrick's near Grand Central Station (a bargain for Irish breakfast). The location can't be beat. Only drawback was that the bed was a bit hard. Bathroom was great, though.

Reviews.Title: “a quiet haven in the heart of New York”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel because of the good reviews it received on trip advisor. We were not disappointed!! It is a sophisticated hotel, with stylish rooms and comfortable beds. We had a great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel - Cannot recommend highly enough”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: They say it pays to book the best hotel you can in New York and this hotel proves it. Right from the welcome from the door/concierge staff (who were very friendly and useful throughout the stay) to the reception staff, the turndown service staff, the bar staff and the housekeeping this hotel is well managed and provides the ideal base for a visit to New York. One and half blocks from Times Square, yet in a relatively quiet area, and handy for Grand Central Station, this hotel could not be better placed for a visit to NY. Our visit was well managed with room requests quickly sorted. We had two rooms on the 23rd floor which we could close off to make a virtual suite. The views were tremendous. The standard of the rooms was very high and the facilities second to none. The provided toiletries were better than at any other hotel I have stayed at but beware the mini bar prices! This hotel is highly recommended. I have visited NY several times over the years and I will be recommending this hotel and returning myself. French flair in New York.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely and welcoming oasis in the city”
Reviews.Author: PleaseDont
Reviews.Content: Just got back from three nights at the Sofitel. A friend and I (both female) stayed in a twin room that we reserved on their website for $199 for the first two nights and $239 for the third (the Saturday before the RNC convention). We were delighted with the hotel. We arrived at nearly 2 am and were greeted warmly. They were giving us a room on the 17th floor when I mentioned something about liking a view, and they changed us to the 22nd floor. The view was very enjoyable (not spectacular, but there are a lot of tall buildings in the area, as someone else mentioned). The beds were VERY comfortable (they seemed wider than normal twins). Nice robes, nice towels, beautiful big bath with nice furnishings and products. The air conditioning was very good, and the sound-proofing excellent (we opened the lower window in the morning and were surprised at the noise). We ordered room-service coffee each morning, which arrived hot and fresh in short order. I will look for Chris at the concierge desk next time, based on reviews here--I had called ahead to try to get tickets for a particular show and spoke to a different concierge, who was basically no help. My only suggestion to the hotel would be more drawer space--there is only one small drawer in the desk/console, which is already filled with stationery, etc., and two square drawers in the beside table, one of which is already filled with phone books. We never tried the lobby bar as the light was always off--maybe next time. We appreciated the bottles of Evian (one hot and humid morning we noticed a stack of bottles and a stack of towels next to the front door--nice touch!). The location is terrific. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel nice. Do not use valet parking. Beware!!”
Reviews.Author: Hab
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed at Sofitel New York to celebrate our anniversary weekend. Room was very nice. We've stayed in other Times Square area hotels with substandard rooms. Lobby was welcoming and very relaxing. Candles, tables, nice furniture etc. Nice to relax, read, rest your feet. Although this may seem small it's a great asset in the middle of New York City. Most hotels do NOT offer such a nice, peaceful lobby environment. Actual was very clean. Important!!! Bathroom was clean. Important!!! View was great! Important! Room had small table and chairs. Nice! Front desk staff very nice. Doorman and concierge staff very nice and helpful. Okay....the bad news. We parked our Toyota Landcruiser using hotel valet service. I was a little leary because someone drives your car to a parking garage at another location. My husband said let's go ahead and do it. I preferred to park across the street (diagonal) from the hotel for twelve dollars cheaper (not much but.....). We used valet service. Next day upon checking out our truck was brought by valet service. My husband checked the driver side of the vehicle and asked me to check to the passenger side. I found a nice sized scratch on the rear quarter panel. Mind you...we detail our truck every week so....we know what scratches were there. Once wd notified the hotel doorman, he called the head of security who was STANDOFFISH! He was obviously not thrilled that he had to deal with our problem but neither were we! After all we paid $40.00 for parking and a SCRATCH! It took us over an hour for pictures to be taken, report written etc. To date (over two weeks ago) we still have not heard from the representative from the parking garage. My husband has left several messages. The person in charge is never available....hmmmm????? I would recommend the hotel (maybe) but not the valet parking. If you value your car and do not want any extra dents or scratches....do NOT use VALET. Once I hear from parking staff (if ever)....I'll post a follow up.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying at the Sofitel as part of our honeymoon (11-13 August) which we booked on expedia. We found the Hotel to be very modern and sophisticated, a vast improvement on other hotels we have stayed in in New York on previous trips. The location is superb, convenient for Times Square but also conveniently located away from the hustle and bustle of the same. Door staff and reception staff were extremely polite and friendly. The Concierge staff were excellent and we were very pleased with their recommendations for places to eat and drink. The Concierge was good at translating our wishes into good suggestions. Having had the benefit of an upgrade on account of our honeymoon our King room was extremely well presented and spacious particularly for a hotel in NYC. We have stayed in 5 star hotels with much less to offer. Our only gripe, and it is not a major one, relates to the hotel bar. Having arrived back to the hotel from a night at the theatre ( we saw "Sly Fox" which was very funny!) we were disappointed at the manner in which we were rushed to finish our drinks because of general activity from staff in the bar and restaurant that indicated that the bar was closing and maybe we were keeping people from going home. However, we would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel, Spacious Suites Near Theatre District”
Reviews.Author: YoMan
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 3 nights in August, 2004. This hotel has a central location for most mid-town activities. 44th street is somewhat busy and not particularly attractive, but the hotel itself is very nice and is tastefully decorated. We stayed in a suite, which had a nice living area and good bathroom with separate tub and shower. While large for NYC, the suites here are not as big as Chicago Water Tower. Gaby's restaurant was excellent. Room service was very fast (20 min on average). Room service food was good, but somewhat limited menu. I would stay here again. However just to counter earlier reviewers that stated this is better than 4 seasons NYC. I definitely disagree. Stayed at the 4 seasons as well on this trip, see separate review. The 4 Seasons is a cut above, both in room quality and service. Of course it is twice the price as well. For Value and a high quality room, Sofitel is the winner. For that extra luxury and pampering, and upscale location in shopping area, choose the 4 seasons.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: milhouse
Reviews.Content: With the sole exception of the location, everything, I mean everything, about the hotel is merely average for an "upper" scale hotel - which means that it's pretty nice (nothing more). And while it might be nice, it certainly falls a long long long long way from the likes of the Waldorf Towers, The Plaza, etc... I understand liking this hotel because of its central location and decent (stress decent) accomodations, but all of these glowing reviews have me wondering why everyone believes this hotel to be so much more than it really is. Folks, it is a far cry from one of the top hotels in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel (with a minor exception)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked the Sofitel online for $160 per night (awesome deal!) and were very impressed with the hotel. It is centrally located (not too far north or south), and maintains a boutique feel. The staff was excellent and helpful. They even told me where to get cheaper tickets to Phantom when I inquired with the Concierge. We were always greated with "Bonjour." Regarding the room, it was larger than what you would expect in NYC - incredible bathroom with marbled floors and walls, a full bath and separate shower stall. My only comment was about their internet. For some reason, it didn't work in our room and when we called the front desk, they said they'd send someone up - 15 minutes later, someone came up and gave us new cables, still didn't work. Then I called the 3-rd party 800 number associated with the service and fiddled with it for another 1/2 hour. When that didn't work, they said they'd contact the hotel directly and work it out with them. Well, they never called and when I called the front desk, they apologized profusely and said someone would be up. Someone did come up - and handed us a new set of cables - urgh. In the end, it just wasn't worth the hassle. At least they tried, though. Outside of that, everything was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Most enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having made a reservation at the hotel in late July of this year based on the recommendations of this site, I have to admit to being very impressed. The staff were very courteous and extremely helpful, the room was very spacious and furnished to a high standard with excellent facilities. The central location of the hotel and access to the local transportation make it an ideal place for site seeing. The room rate is very competitive for the standard offered and compares exceptionally well against other hotels of a similar, and higher, rating. Having been fortunate to stay in a number of the finest hotels in NYC this has been one of the best experiences to date - it is not quite the Plaza, but is significantly better than the Waldorf. I would have no hessitation in recommending this hotel and if I were to offer any criticism it would be the same one levelled at most hotels i.e. overpriced mini-bar.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: CLascelles
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at this hotel earlier in the year, and had a truly marvellous time. The staff were helpful and polite (saying, "Bonjour" and "Bonsoir" to us every time we walked past them), and the room was gorgeous with a nice, big, comfortable bed, and quite a nice view of the city. Also, the bathroom was extremely clean and well-presented, and the toiletries smelt absolutely delicious! It's definitely worth getting a Sofitel card, as we had one, and got a free drink in the bar and a late check-out with it. It's also worth shopping around for the best price; we used Airline Network's website and only paid around $180 a night for the room, which is brilliant considering the hotel's central location. All in all, we had a wonderful trip to the States (our first time there), and will definitely stay at the Sofitel when we're next in New York.

Reviews.Title: “I want to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wonderfull!!! I went for my 16 th birthday and absoultly loved it. Only five mintues from times square and with really helpfull staff ( who can always manage to get you a yellow cab since their so hard to get!) and with a wonderfull bathroom with a power shower! Make sure you go to the ticket booth in the center of times square as you can get half price tickets and make sure you go on a carraige ride in central park. Its your own personal guide, who'll tell you everything and even all the triva bits like what movies were in the park and what not. Only bit of advice, leave lots of time for the empire state building, Its worth the vist but you have to queue for ages inside, so make sure you do it in the day although its pictureresque at night. The hotels excellent though! makes you feel like a movie star!

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time at the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: AZheat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sofitel July 9 & 10th. The hotel is everything we expected and then some. We were on the 10th floor exec. suite. The room was wonderful, clean, and very large. The special touches of candels and flowers in the bathroom were perfect, everything about the room was to our satisfaction. The location was great for us, near Time Square, Empire State Bldg, Grand Central St., Central Park was a 20 minute brisk walk, we loved it. If your in new york during good weather walk over to Bryant Park around happy hour time, it's just a few blocks away , the desk will give you directions , its a beautiful park with outdoor bars and restaurants with a great crowd to mix with or just people watch. Dining note: the best pizza I have ever had (and I'm italian) is a place in the village called Lombardi's, brick oven cooked it's worth the wait and subway trip over, plus the village is a fun place to see. Our trip was perfect and the Sofitel is not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Unremarkable”
Reviews.Author: guye
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in July essentially on the strength of previous reports here on Tripadvisor. This was our first trip to New York, and we were particularly pleased with the location of this hotel; it was very close (10mins walk max) to Times Square, Fifth Avenue, Central Park, and the Empire State building. Apart from the location we found little else exceptional about this hotel. We had a reasonably pleasant two-bed room on the sixth floor where the decor was a little tired, the view was of the building across the road, and the bathroom was small but functional. The public areas were well furnished and we found the staff fairly pleasant. The rate we paid ($300 / night in July) was not excessive, and perhaps our expectations had been raised by all the great reviews here, but I sincerely hope this isn't the best hotel in New York. We'll be trying somewhere else when we return in December.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in NY!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel in NY, my wife and I live in CT and stay here every 3 months or so to get away. They have the nicest rooms and the best service. I stayed in a suite last time on the top floor..best view in NY one window had the empire state another had the crysler, and the next was the GE building. Bathrooms have speakers in the from the TV, shower and bath..Just a great hotel...Much better than the marriott or sharaton's....same $$ too...

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnnieB
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything! The rooms are well-appointed with beautiful modern marble baths. The hotel is close to everything from Times Square to Central Park, NBC studios, Grand Central Station and great shopping on 5th Avenue. You couldn't ask for a more gracious and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be returning to the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to New York each year and have stayed at some of the best hotels in town. After our first stay at the Sofitel, we have proclaimed it to be our new hotel of choice. The accomodations (we had an executive suite), service, price (summer rates), and location were great and I look forward to our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service, great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked a trip to celebrate my daughter's graduation and used the reviews on tripadvisor.com to help me make a decision. We were not disappointed. From the moment we got out of our cab, we were treated like royalty. I always judge a place by the way the staff makes me feel. And they were wonderful. I also can't say enough about the rooms. The marble bathrooms are luxurious, with a full tub and separate shower. Of course, the location is superb. We would definitely stay here again. If you take this advice, also head to db bistro moderne for dinner, which is two doors down from Sofitel. We had one of the best restaurant experiences ever.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at the Sofitel in mid June of this year and everything was fantastic! Our suite was spacious, comfortable, and beautifully decorated. Room service for both breakfast and dinner was fabulous. Location was great - peaceful yet close enough to all the action. Each and every staff member was incredibly helpful and friendly. Would highly recommend staying here on your next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “"Arrive with a smile, leave with a smile"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my husband and my first trip to New York. We figured, what better way to spend the 4th of July, than in New York, under the Macy's fireworks display, and how AWESOME they were! We spent many hours reading reviews of various hotels, service and accomodations, before picking the Sofitel. The minute we arrived we knew we had picked the right hotel. The doorman met us cheerfully, removed and brought in our bags and answered any and all questions we had. Our room was not ready (we arrived at 11:00 and check in is at 3:00) so the concierge stored our bags and we left to explore grand central station. Upon returning to the hotel we were given our room, on the 24th floor!! Well worth waiting for. We had a beautiful view of the Chrysler building. It is so beautiful both day and night. The Sofitels location was wonderful. We walked almost everywhere, and if something was a little too far for walking we jumped on the subway at grand central (2&1/2 blocks away) using our metro card. There are restaurants and food venders everywhere so there is no shortage of choices. We ate breakfast quite often at the Red Flame Diner (5 or 6 doors down from the Sofitel) that offers a wide selection of hearty breakfasts for a very good price. The Sofitel is in walking distance to the broadway shows, shopping, central park, and the many museums. Location is key!! We even saw a T.V. personality check in at the Sofitel. I can't say enough about the Sofitel, the staff was very courteous and professional, rooms were extremely clean, lobby was classy and inviting. The Sofitel will again be our choice in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel New York was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: ToKatya
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel New York Hotel for a weekend in July 2004. The hotel's location was perfect - in the heart of Manhattan, only a few blocks from the theatre where we had booked a Broadway show, and close to great New York shopping. We loved the staff of the hotel - always helpful and courteous. We also loved the design of the hotel and rooms. Housekeeping was meticulous and honestly, we couldn't have asked for more. When coming to New York again, I will choose this hotel again without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “So-fi-fi-fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: kitty33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel over the July 4th weekend after reading the reviews on this site. We received a very good rate on a king bed suite located on the 26th floor. WOW! Beautiful, comfortable, luxurious room with every amenity and detail you can imagine. The public areas of the hotel are beautiful and sophisticated. The staff are friendly and are willing to give you as much or as little attention as you desire. The rooms are simply to die for. Large marble bath with deep tub, separate shower, fluffy towels, wonderful and plentiful toiletries, great lighting etc. The room itself was plush and the furnishing were chic and comfortable. Many, many details! The closets are lighted and contained great robes, slippers, iron and board, tie and belt hooks, numerous wood and padded hangers, safe and other amenities. The lighting in the room and bath is extremely well done. I particularly the artwork and picture lights which gave the room a very sophisticated flair. Great view, 2 tv's with speaker in bath, sliding pocket doors between bedroom and sitting room, good, quiet AC with two separate thermostats in bedroom and sitting room. Many, many good pay-per-view movies and other online services. Housekeeping is flawless. Twice daily service with Evian water and next day's weather report supplied at turn down. Room service was good but VERY expensive, my only complaint. Fresh flowers in bath and on room service trays. Basically, they thought of every detail and did everything right! We liked the hotel so much that after we got there, we booked a room for my mother-in-law last minute as a special birthday treat. She had a regular queen room which was smaller, but spacious and had the same level of detail and luxury as our suite. I have stayed in over 20 NYC hotels over the years including the Plaza, Peninsula, Carlyle, Four Seasons etc. and have to say that this was by far my favorite NYC hotel experience. I was VERY impressed and will not hesitate to stay at a Sofitel anywhere in the world from now on. For value and luxury, simply the best!

Reviews.Title: “Was there during the blackout”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed with how the staff handled the blackout last summer. They had a generator that kept the elevators working until after 8 pm, so that we could get to our rooms. We had no idea that so many people were turned out of their rooms at other hotels just around the corner in Times Square. We slept peacefully in air-conditioned comfort that night. Some of the staff even stayed 24 hours, slept an hour or two up on the hotel roof and were there to serve breakfast the next morning. The whole thing was handled calmly and with abundant professionalism. Kudos to the very capable staff!

Reviews.Title: “what more could you ask for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we spent the weekend at the Sofitel. We were impressed from the minute we walked through the doors. The staff were more helpful than we could have ever asked for. The rooms were fabulous and the location was central to everything that we wanted to see. All our requests were met and it made the difference between a good weekend away and a fabulous weekend away. A weekend spent just in the hotel would have been worth it. As has been said previously the flame grill just up the road is excellent for breakfast. enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for a New York weekend”
Reviews.Author: doug036
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel June 24-28 and loved it.
