Wonderful bathroom including first class amenities, bathroom candle, towel service twice daily, etc. All the staff encounters we had were great. Several of the front desk personnel are French. We were on the 20th floor and had a nice view of Rockefeller Center. Had dinner in the hotel dining room one evening as it was raining hard outside. Very good meal and top service although Gaby is not inexpensive. Two cups of decaf after dinner set us back $12. Starbucks, just out the hotel's back door, seems to get a great deal of hotel guest traffic. Had breakfast at the Red Flame two mornings. One was excellent and the other not very good but the place is worth a try. Of course, the Sofitel location is wonderful with easy access to everything either on foot or subway. Very convenient. Never waited for elevators which is so common in large hotels. Would certainly try to stay here again. Good choice for our long weekend in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel 6/19-24. Usually stay in Times Square area, but wanted to try a new area of NYC. The Sofitel was wonderful. The doormen were attentive; the front desk courteous, and the maid service was excellent. Fresh towels provided twice a day and when we asked for more, they were at our room within minutes with a stack of towels. There was turn down service, fresh flowers in bathroom, fluffy bathrobe to wear, and bottles of Evian water left nightly. Our room was on the 7th floor; view was nothing special from our room, but this hotel was so quiet, we slept like babies. The beds are very comfortable. Red Flame Grill next door is very good and reasonable. The bathrooms are spacious, separate shower, French toiletries provided. Only down side is no coffeemaker or fridge. That would have been nice. Prices in mini-bar were typically outrageous. Nice location, easy walk to theatres and Fifth Avenue, subway is two blocks away at 42/Bryant Park. Room was not that spacious and was expensive $274, but it was clean, safe, and a nice place to stay. Would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for Mother's Day weekend, May 7-9, 2004. It was our first time in NYC and we had a perfect weekend. The Sofitel was just like everyone had described in the reader reviews I had read before making reservations; i.e. large rooms, elegant bathrooms, convenient location, friendly staff, etc. We walked everywhere from here to all of the major tourist locations. We had breakfast at the Red Flame Diner which I highly recommend. Would stay there again on our next visit to NYC. My only complaint was that the one time I really needed help from the concierge, she wasn't helpful at all. She didn't even try to solve my problem. Maybe she was having a bad day!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: CyclingFan
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel met or exceeded all of our expectations on our recent trip (June 3 - 6). The staff were helpful when we needed them, and otherwise were completely unobtrusive. The rooms are spacious by NYC standards, and as has been said, the bathrooms are lovely. The lighting is phenomenal. Great location, steps from 5th avenue. Didn't eat at the restaurant, but we did stop in at the bar for a few cocktails after dining elsewhere. Lovely atmosphere and attentive staff. We'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel New York from May 20th to May 24th. It is a beautiful new hotel in a perfect location. The hotel is spotless and the room, which looked exactly as it does on the Sofitel web site pictures, included; a safe, iron/ironing board; bar fridge; terry robes, slippers, gorgeous marble bathroom with all the trimmings and twice a day towel service. The hotel is located 1/2 block from 5th Avenue and is about a 5 minute walk to Times Square. All staff were very courteous. The hotel has a luggage room in case you are early or are staying on after check-out, but in my case I was able to check in before 11 and check-out at 2pm - staff were very accommodating. I would defintely recommend this hotel and plan on staying there again. It is a great value for the amenities, location and style.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great service....friendly people, nice workout room....nice bar...nice restaurant...beautiful bathroom w/ shower AND tub. One complaint: Shower was underpowered. Dave

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean, fun”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just came back from staying at the Sofitel for 4 nights and was very pleased. Great location, very courteous staff, and - if you're lucky (I was!) - you can even get a view of the Chrysler building from your room. Don't expect anything extraordinary from the rooms, which are standard for a hotel of this grade (which is fine), although they are generously-sized for Manhattan. The restaurant is a bonus too: very good food and excellent staff. The Sofitel is a good safe bet: you won't be let down.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting”
Reviews.Author: eandjracquet
Reviews.Content: We are originally New Yorkers who now live in a northern suburb. I was going to my 25th High School Reunion in Manhattan on 11/11/00-we had to take my small, Pekingese dog with us. Sofitel accomodated the dog-the room and bathroom was beautiful-but a little small if one was staying more than 2-3 nights. Fitness room was awesome-each cardio piece had it's own TV. Service was okay-it took us 25 minutes to get our luggage-and the dog was among the checked pieces-also, the valet car parking was a little slow. Still, a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “First time stay but am going back - Deliciously satisfied customer.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First time stay but am going back - Deliciously satisfied......Looked at various hotels, canceled reservations several times for my May 20th - 23rd, 2004 NYC stay. Worth every dollar of each nite's stay! The Executive Suite on the 26th floor, Room 2614 awesome view, state of the art bathroom which house's a separate shower, semi garden style tub, marble counters & floors, toiletries are French perfumed. Hotel provided two small four piece chocolate boxes, a large bottle of Evian water at no addl. charge. The suite is approx. 600 sq ft. My rate per nite; $400.00. The location is about the only flaw for me (probably for no one else though, am too picky). I would have preferred the Sofitel at the Marriot Marquis location! That would have been the ultimate Plaza Hotel for me!!

Reviews.Title: “A very ggod deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 nights-stay in NYC over this may 20-23 week-end. As a Gold VIP at Hilton I had firs booked teh Waldorf-Adtoria, but after readin some reviews on this site, I preffered to cancel, and try Sofitel. We're French, but that did not specifically made us go for it. Now, the location is perfect, the staff is courteous and helpful (helped us in locating some stores in the Village, some information about our flight supposed to leave shortly after the Paris airport accident was proptly given to us). The rooms are clean, bathrooms are very nice. I would recommend to try to check an upper floor room to get some view (we were on the 23rd, barely decent in terms of view but still enjoyable). Also, we required a late check out before getting the shuttle pick-up for our flight. They made no problem about it (another advantage of the Sofitel card: it DOES give something to the customer, while Hilton is just flattering egos by giving Gold or Diamond cards, which give nothing to their customers). The only downside is that I would recommend to carefully heck your bill: we had an Internet Special rate, which was not considered at first, and they charged us a much higher price. After discussion with the front desk, this was fixed (and I remember reading other reviews about the same kind of problem). For breakfast, as many people here said before, get out of teh hotel, make a right a get to the Red Flame. They're NOT nice people and they don't really care for their customers. But it's a good value for a breakfast in NYC. All in all, we'll definitely stay again at the Sofitel Hotel NY during our next escape over there.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We used Trip Advisor for our honeymoon to NYC. After much research we went with Sofitel. Hands down we were very impressed. I have stayed in nice hotels but once you get to the room it just feels like any other hotel. Sofitel was different. Great lighting, great bathroom. Overall a lovely experience.

Reviews.Title: “Above average hotel in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: retep68
Reviews.Content: Booked my stay at the Sofitel largely due to the reviews on here (was going to stay at the Tribeca Grand, but that had terrible reviews back then). Can't say that I agree with the rave reviews the hotel gets on this site. The staff were OK, but certainly didn't go out of their way to help. When I asked for a late check out I was told I couldn't have one, even though I had emailed a request for one weeks earlier (I received a reply confirming the late check out). The receptionist, for some reason, seemed quite pleased to be able to deny me this. However, I then produced my sofitel priviledged guest card and the receptionist had to agree to the late check out. The room was excellent, large with a good view (22nd floor - requested high floor with booking and also backed this up by email a few weeks before travelling). Bathroom was good, but again not as good as the reviews here indicate. No tea / coffee making facilities in the room (is this a US thing?) and a tea and coffee brought up to the room cost circa $20!!!! (coffee was excellent though!). Mid-town location is probably the best thing about the hotel. 5th Ave about 40 yards away. 5 mins to either Times Sq or Grand Central to get the subway, so a piece of piss to get just about anywhere in Manhattan. Personally will try the Tribeca Grand next time, partly because I tend to spend more time downtown, but mainly because the Sofitel just didn't live up to my expectations. A good 4* hotel, but that's it, nothing exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Guests Of Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel was part of an excellent weekend in New York for my wife and me. I called the reservations desk a few weeks before we arrived to inquire about rooms and when asked if our stay was for business or pleasure I replied the latter and added that this was my wife's first visit to NYC. The clerk said "Oh, I'm going to make sure you have a great room!" When we arrived our room was on the 25th floor facing the Chrysler Building and my wife (and I) was very impressed. The hotel is very clean, quiet, and calm and the staff is courteous, friendly, and helpful. Location is just right, near many sights but not in the middle of them. The Red Flame down the street is a great place for breakfast. We are totally happy with our stay at the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend spent with my mother at this hotel. It is a very nice hotel. We stayed in a Queen. Although, the rooms are not huge, there was enough room for the two of us. It was clean, and quiet. I particularly liked the separate shower and bath, plus the fact that I could listen to the tv while in the bathroom was cool. :) We did order breakfast one morning which was just okay. Like the other reviews said, the diner a few doors down is just as good and much cheaper. The hotel is located within walking distance of times square and fifth avenue, also there are some very nice restaurants located along the same street as the hotel. I recommend it and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not All What We Expected”
Reviews.Author: vixs
Reviews.Content: After doing a great deal of research on New York hotels I decided on the Sofitel due to the exceptional reviews on this site, however my stay was most disappointing and I feel I have to leave my view here. On arriving I asked pleasantly if they had any rooms on a high floor only to be told none were available and was given a key to a room on the 6th floor. I was very excited to see the room as I had read many good things, however I found the room was pleasant and comfortable but not the luxurious elegant room I was expecting and the view was non-existent! In fact parts of the room looked a little worn. After exploring further we found the toilet was blocked so went down to reception to complain, they immediately sent for the maintenance guy but after 15 minutes he was still struggling and we asked for another room, this time we were offered a room on a higher floor (surprisingly they miraculously found a higher room even though my previous request was denied). Our stay for the next 6 days was pleasant enough, I must say the one good thing going for this hotel is the location as it seemed to be within walking distance of most attractions, the staff also were pleasant and polite but not in the friendly sense. Towards the end of our stay while brushing my teeth what should happen but the u-bend fell off the sink spilling water everywhere, again they sent the maintenance guy to fix it and we were offered a complementary breakfast (on leaving they attempted to charge me for this breakfast!) I will never be staying at the Sofitel New York again; my advice for others would be to give this place a miss and check into the friendly Algonquin a few doors down, which has a genuinely friendly atmosphere, which the Sofitel lacked.

Reviews.Title: “Probably New Yorks finest 4 star hotel ?”
Reviews.Author: billymax
Reviews.Content: Just returned....wedding anniversary. Like most others we booked this hotel after reading web comments. If you want a 5 star hotel and want to pay 5 star prices go elsewhere. If however you want an excellent 4star in a superb position and want to pay a reasonable price then this is it. We had an executive king room (read "suite"), large and beautifully furnished throughout , great marble bathroom, dressing area, separate sitting room and 2 tv's, stereo, really comfy bedroom, nice toiletries, candles,towels changed twice a day and bed linen every 2 days, quiet and airy. evening turn down service flowers and Evian mini bar. View from our room (14th floor) wasn't very interesting and although the hotel offered a change on night 3 out of 7 in the end we couldn't be bothered to move. Room decor beige and white and more light fittings than I've ever seen in a room. Very restful. It's a great base to return to after the most exhausting but enjoyable 7 night (8 day) first time trip to New York. Concierge was helpful and the doorman fantastic at getting cabs. All staff were courteous and friendly. Room was ready when we arrived at 2-30pm and we had a late 4-00pm (no extra charge) checkout. Didn't eat or drink in the hotel, pre booked great restaurants from London. ( Red Flame for breakfast or the food court at Grand Central Terminal (we can't take the big cooked breakfast every day)), River Cafe, Boathouse, Gramercy Tavern, Balthazar. Saw Don Giovani at the beautiful Met Opera House (nice Italian restaurant opposite...can't remember name) and don't miss the Carnegie Deli. Woody Allen plays Dixieland Jazz at the Cafe Carlyle on a Monday (extortionate but a fantasic evening). Did all the main sights and areas.......hardly stopped to catch breath. The Frick Collection is stupendous. There is so much to see and do and we only scratched the surface. New York is probably the most friendly and exciting city in the world and this hotel contibuted in no small part to a wonderful experience. If you want to do museums galleries and shops , walk the town from end to end and sample the nighlife you can't do so unless you have a good comfortable base to return to. This is in our opinion is it. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “After reviewing several on this site Sofitel deservedly came out top”
Reviews.Author: scottish_scrooge
Reviews.Content: After reviewing numerous hotels on tripadvisor my girlfriend and I decided that Sofitel sounded the best in that price range, it came down to this or Paramount in the end. All reviews were accurate and the hotel was certainly above average with helpful staff and modern, clean and roomy surroundings. The location of the hotel was perfect - 2min to the left Times Square and 2min to the right 5th Ave. The room was a decent size with large bathroom but had no view other than fire escapes. Negatives were that we could hear whenever the room next door was running water and there were a lot of door slams. There is a great cafe type place the Red (lobster or flame?) almost next door which is excellent value for breakfasts. Directly adjacent is where the 'worlds most expensive hamburger' is served. One other point is there is a good bar on the same street - St Andrews, if you need to take a break from it. One word of warning is that if you book online directly with the hotel it is does not include tax which will add a significant amount to your bill. Overall a good Marriot type hotel, nothing hugely special but almost nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband spent 5 nights here over Easter. We agree with the majority of reviews. Good location, quiet, nice comfortable room, big bathroom, very friendly staff, nice restaurant if expensive (to be expected), Evian and chocolate Easter bunny were nice touches. No complaints at all! Ate breakfast/lunch in The Red Flame as advised - good grub! Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What All the Fuss About”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I don't understand what all the fuss is about - it's a good solid "B" hotel. Nothing special at all about it. While it certainly was a decent enough hotel, I can't fathom who the people are who believe this hotel to be a 5 star hotel. Hey, just cuz it aint a Motel 6 don't make it the Four Seasons or Waldorf Towers either.

Reviews.Title: “Superb experience at Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: momofaws
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 day trip to New York with my 13 year old daughter. The Sofitel was in a great location--very close to the theater district and Times Square, but quiet, elegant and relaxed. Two full beds --very comfortable-- a beautiful bathroom, delicious continental breakfast, and here's the mark of really superb service--my daughter left her backpack in the lobby and we didn't realize it until we were at the airport in Newark. The concierge (both of the ones we met were very friendly and extremely helpful) sent a driver with the backpack, and got it to us before we took off. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. The room was very clean and the bathroom was absolutely beautiful with its marble countertop, fresh flowers, candles, and sunken bathtub. The location is one of the best in New York. Very close to Times Square, the subway, Central Park, 5th Ave shops, Rockefeller Plaza, etc.. But, the best part was the incredibly friendly and helpful staff. The concierge, Rajae, was so sweet and nice. She spent a good portion of her time finding places for us to go to enjoy the New York nightlife. The Bellboys, Nick, Randy, and Manny, went out of there way to make sure we knew where we were going and getting us transportation. I will without a doubt stay in this perfect hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A 4 star treat of a hotel in the heart of theatreland”
Reviews.Author: Poppy_9
Reviews.Content: Like many others on this site, we booked the Sofitel based upon it's rave reviews on this website...we were not disappointed. From the hustle and bustle of 44th street (the hotel is perfectly placed between Times Square and Fifth Ave) you enter the peaceful haven of french style and comfort which is the Sofitels lobby. The staff were all courteous, from the welcoming receptionists to the discreet maid service and friendly doormen. The location is perfect for exploring the immediate area and is just 5 mins from the subway to get you out to the rest of the city. The rooms are average size and perfectly adequate for two people. Original artwork adorn the walls and the atmosphere created by the furnishings is warm and cosy. The bathrooms offer a greater degree of style with vases of orchids and candles adding the extra touches which make all the difference. As an added bonus the Red Flame diner is just a few doors away is a great place to start the day with a hearty breakfast. We stayed for one week and enjoyed every second, we will definitely stay at the Sofitel again and I can't recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “perect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: fabulous location, so convenient, staff always able to get us a cab, HUGE gorgeous bathroom, spacious room for NYC, very, very nice. Concierge hooked us up w/reservations once we got there for dinner - tried to do it before online, language was a bit of a barrier. Red Flame Diner down the street is a gem for breakfast - can't say enough good things about this hotel. Try expedia, best rate I found. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Sensational Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for six nights in a premier twin room on 20th floor, and we had a great time. Spacious rooms and bathrooms, nice touches such as Evian water every night, very clean. Good location, close to sights and easy reach of subway stations and bus stops. Impressive lobby with helpful staff. Would definitely stay here again. Cinema Cafe across from Fifth Avenue has an excellent breakfast, Red Flame also good apart from grumpy waitress! A excellent hotel for couples or friends.

Reviews.Title: “What is all the fuss about? I thought it was just okay.”
Reviews.Author: htpartyshack
Reviews.Content: Yes, the bathroom was nice and the room was clean, but I don't understand all the rave reviews. I thougt it was just okay. There are much more interesting places to stay in NYC for the same price. Last time I stayed at Le Parker Meridien, and thought it had just the right mix - cool without being impractical, views of Central Park, and great amenities including one of the best gyms in the city, free high speed internet, and a flat screen 32-inch tv and dvd player. But this time I wanted a location a bit further south. I was supposed to have a view of the Chrysler or Empire State buildings, and was told by the desk clerk that the view of the Chrysler is particularly beautiful at night. Well, they must have moved it - our room looked out to a non-descript dreary office building across the street, even though we were on the 18th floor. I could of complained I guess, but I don't go on vacation to argue with desk clerks. The room decor was not in the least interesting, my wife said "glorified Holiday Inn" upon walking in. It was pretty bland. The staff was friendly and professional, and the soundproofing was great - very quiet for NYC. Sorry to dampen the enthusiasm for this otherwise well-reviewed property.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, friendly and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel March 5 & 6, 2004 and were delighted with the comfortable room and the beautiful bathroom. Beautifully decorated lobby, very modern with several cozy conversational areas. We had a delicious lunch at the Gaby restaurant, which is in the hotel. We were having a get-together with 4 long lost cousins and the restaurant staff accomodated us by giving us a table in a quiet corner of the elegant dining room. Stayed as long as we liked; they didn't push us to leave. After a while we decided to retire to the lobby where we could continue our dicussions in privacy. My only suggestion is that it would be nice if they would offer wine, tea, etc. late in the afternoon, early evening in the lobby. Hotel and restaurant staff very nice.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: michelescully
Reviews.Content: we arrived late on friday 13th (a party of three including my nine year old son) for a three night stayi was worried before we arrived as i had been told my son had share our bed as rooms available were only queen size (one per room)however this was our only problemthe room was small but beautifully decorated with a sumptious bathroom with lovely toiletriesour view was no-view (only floor four) and faced in to the hotel - however this made it very quiet - no night-time sirens or traffic - a real new york view would have been nice for my son for his first trip to nylocation - perfect - it was so cold that weekend - but it only took five minutes or so to walk to times square etcthe downside - breakfast - no buffet - so we walked to times square and ate in a hotel thereroom service - quite expensive - but very goodmy son loved the hotel - and so did wea beautiful aroma in the lobby and so romantic with the candles, etci would recommend this hotel and plan to stay here again when we visit new york next february

Reviews.Title: “Warm,Friendly,Elegant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The moment you enter this hotel it's obvious you're in for a treat. The character, design and decor of the lobby and rooms is European elegant, warm and friendly; as well as ALL the staff which is outstanding and very accomodating. You just cannot beat the location (right next to the oldtime favorite Algonqin Hotel) in the heart of the city. It is now at the top of my list of places to stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Superb!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel on Feb 13th for a 3 night stay over Valentines Day weekend. Even though check-in was not until the afternoon, when we arrived at 10am we were delighted to find that out that our room was ready and could check in early. First off, let me tell you that this hotel was flat out GEORGOUS. From the sophisticated lobby with marble floor and leather chairs to the glowing candles on every table and the soothing potpurri aroma, we fell in love with the ambiance of this place. Our room was on the 19th floor, and my lord, what a fantastic view of rockafeller center (GE Building). Even though the room was a little smaller than previous hotels i had stayed at in NYC, the overall quality of the room and the view MORE than made up for the size. Everything in the room looked brand new. Even the marble bathroom was in pristine condition. The beds were comfy, slippers and shower robe were provided. Extra pillows and blanket were also already provided in the closet. Location, Location, Location. I dont think this hotel could be in any more of a perfect location (especially when its 15 degrees out). We were literally 1.5 blocks east of Times Square, 0.5 blocks west of 5th Avenue, 5 blocks south of Rockefeller center. EVERYTHING was literally within a 5 minute walk. We couldnt have asked for a better location. To sum it up, this is by far one of the greatest hotels we have ever stayed in. We couldnt have had a more perfect valentines day and a more fantastic trip to NYC. After hours of research on this site and many others, i dont think we could have made a better choice. Last year when i was in the city i stayed at the Rhiga Royal, and while the rooms were huge, i was unimpressed with the lobby, the location, and the view from the room. The sofitel on the other hand was much more agreeable and to my liking. I will be staying at this hotel everytime we go back to the city, it was just amazing. PROS: + Beautiful Lobby + Beautiful Rooms + Extremely Friendly Staff (most seemed to be from France) + Location was superb + Clean Rooms/Bathroom/Lobby + View was fantastic (we were in room 1904 if anyone was curious) CONS: - To be honest, there is none i can think of. It really was THAT good.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel SoRight!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent AGES reading tripadvisor looking for the right hotel and picked the right one! Spent Valentines weekend there and it was everything the reviews promised - effecient and friendly staff, and with little touches that make the difference; bottled evian every evening with the turndown service, the candle and orchids in the bathroom, the ice machines on every floor - all the small things that make the big difference. The real selling point is the closeness to everything - Times Square one way in less than 5 mins, 5th Avenue 2 mins, Empire State less than 10 mins walk, Central Park in 10 mins.Only thing that made me laugh was the New York born and bred doormen with their daily "Bonjour" (think Del boy and u get the picture!!) - but then the chain is French.Ate in Gabys once (the in hotel restaurant) which was good but you need to like French cuisine and if you don't, well, alternative venues aren't far!Was able to check in at 11am AND check out at 4pm with no charge (but do ask early)Bad points? Only the mini-bar I guess - $5 for a can of coke is pretty extortionate, but it's a pretty minor complaint when there are so many places to get snacks around. Got a great deal on Expedia so shop around for a good price once u decide to go there.

Reviews.Title: “New Favorite NYC Hotel”
Reviews.Author: adamunc
Reviews.Content: After a trip to the Sofitel New York Feb 6-8, 2004, I will never stay anywhere else in New York. I arrived at 10am and was able to check in immediately. The lobby is elegant and soothing, the staff is concerned and efficient, and the rooms are beautiful and comfortable. The amenities are outstanding, with bathrobes, WEBTV, CD player all standard. The bathroom was good-sized and featured silver-plated fixtures, with even a candle and orchid provided! There is also a speaker in the bathroom that pipes in the sound from the TV. Housekeeping was impeccable.
